Reviews.Author: Nina Y.
Reviews.Content: Maine Lobster roll!Some of my Yelp friends had come here for lobster rolls and suggested that there might be long lines so I just decided to come a bit later - around 2 I think.  I still had to wait for about 30 mins, but since I was by myself, there was a seat at the bar so I took it!I got the warm lobster roll with some french fries. French fries were average - not bad, but the lobster roll. Omg. it was filled to the brim and there was actually so much lobster, it was hard to eat! I had to cut it in half to eat it appropriately. Nice and buttery too! I really wish I had more room, but there looked like there was some other amazing things on the menu. Definitely the lobster roll was a great choice.

Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: I was craving a lobster roll while visiting New England and was reccommended this by a friend. Much like the rest of the resturants in the North End, this place had a wait, and you will, most likely, share a table with others. However the food makes it worth it, I had the Hot (with butter) Lobster Roll and a bowl of their "Famous" Clam Chowder. While the Chowder was good it isn't why this place receives a 5 star rating. Personally I've never been a fan of Lobster, but I thought I should give it a try while in Boston. The roll was spot on, not too much butter, but enough to notice. The Lobster was cooked to perfection.

Reviews.Author: Reject S.
Reviews.Content: Overpriced and over-hyped lobster roll. Though generously sized, the roll wasn't at all impressive, despite the reputation that proceeded it. Bland lobster, though it had a decent texture. Midway through eating the hot buttered lobster roll, I noticed a flavor not unlike an uncleaned shrimp...there was definitely the bitter taste of crustacean fecal matter I wasn't used to when eating lobster. Towards the end of the roll, I was hit with a strong blast of black pepper. Looks like it wasn't evenly seasoned, since I hadn't tasted a hint of that pepper through 3/4 of the thing. I recommend you ask for a wedge of lemon if you decide to actually try this entreé for yourself. My friend who had the roll with mayo remarked that the mayo flavor was barely noticable. The fries that came with the dish were forgettable.In the end, it came down to $50 for 3 oyster shooters and roll, plus tip. ($27 for the roll, and $2.60-3.10 for the shooters). The Winter was my favorite, not being too fishy, with a meaty texture. The Kumamoto tasted like eating a honeydew melon by the sea...it had a strong ocean flavor, with a hint of melon. It had me waxing nostalgic, since this particular oyster originated from the very city I had lived for years in Japan.As for the service...it was decent, though a bit bursque and a bit bizarre, the staff talking amongst each other about the customers as though we weren't right there.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie Y.
Reviews.Content: Get your name on that list! It's totally worth it! In Houston, there's really no such thing as waiting 2+ hours for dinner let alone a box of pastries... in fact I don't even think I'd wait more than one hour for food at a restaurant (I get hangry); however, at Neptune, more often than not, you will have to give your name and phone number to the host/hostess if you want to have dinner at this restaurant. I'd recommend putting your name on the list around 5pm if you're planning to eat dinner around 7 or 8pm. My boyfriend and I put our name on the list at 5pm on a Saturday night and we were told that it would be a 3 hour wait. Being tourists, we were perfectly fine with dinner around 8pm. In fact, we took this extra time to explore and had dessert before dinner at one of the local pastry shops nearby. Around 7pm I decided to look at my phone to see what time it was. That's when I realized that I had two missed calls from Neptune (apparently, my phone was on silent). Luckily, while I was staring at my phone, the host from Neptune called for a 3rd attempt (3rd time's a charm) and I picked up right away. Lesson to be learned: After you put you name on the list at Neptune, make sure the ringer volume on your phone is turned on! After hearing that we didn't have to wait an extra hour to be seated, my boyfriend and I walked to Neptune and we were seated at the bar within 10 minutes. For starters, we ordered a few different kinds of raw oysters from their terrific selection. I wish we could have tried every single type but we might have spoiled our appetite just a tad by eating dessert before dinner... oops. We ordered 2 Wellfleet, 2 Pleasant Bay, 2 Summerside, 2 Beausoleil, 4 Kumamoto, and 2 Jonah Crab Claws. The crab claws weren't anything special, just regular stone crab claws, I probably wouldn't order them again. My favorite oysters were the Wellfleet and the Kumamoto. The Wellfleet were salty and buttery (YUM) and the Kumamoto really did taste like cold, creamy, honeydew! I thought that Neptune's description of the Kumamoto was weird but after eating these oysters, I could definitely taste the sweet honeydew flavor. Highly recommend the Kumamoto oysters.The Johnny Cakes were our next appetizer and I would also recommend ordering this. It's the perfect combination of sweet and salty. The salty portion consisted of smoked trout, American black caviar, and creme fraiche in a "tower" on top of a large sweet, corn "pancake." Spread the smoked fish, caviar and creme fraiche over the entire Johnny cake, cut off a little piece and eat it altogether in one bite. It's divine. I wouldn't recommend eating these elements separately as the smoked fish would probably be extremely salty by itself. It's perfect when paired with the sweet johnny cake. Our last dish was an entree of seared scallops and duck confit on a bed of microgreens and roasted brussel sprouts, I LOVED the duck confit and the seared scallops. The scallops were seared on the outside and nice and tender on the inside; however, I did notice that a couple of the scallops were completely white on the inside while the others were underdone (still opaque) in the center. I'm not sure if Neptune was aiming for more of a "seared tuna" type of scallop (cooked on the outside, raw on the inside) or if they just took the scallops off the pan a little early. I didn't mind either way as the flavor was still spot-on (plus, I like raw scallops), but I can see how someone who enjoys fully cooked sea diver scallops may be a little concerned. The duck confit was tender and savory and the roasted brussel sprouts were perfect for balancing out all of the different flavors in the dish. Overall, my boyfriend and I had a wonderful experience at Neptune and I wish we had room for one more entree... say.. the raved about lobster roll. Until next time...

Reviews.Author: Chelle B.
Reviews.Content: I read all the rave reviews so I decided to check out Neptunes. Maybe it was because my expectations were so high, but I found it overpriced and overrated. I didn't mind the 1 hour wait, I was expecting about that. I was however annoyed that I was a single diner and for the last 20 minutes of my wait I stared through the window at a single bar spot I assumed wasn't being given to me for a reason only to have it become mine. I was also vicariously annoyed for the couple still standing outside when I was seated because the couple next to me had been waiting for change for about 15 minutes and actually WANTED to leave. The food really didn't live up the hype. I had half a dozen raw oysters and they were as good as any other raw oyster in the city. I also had the Neptune on piggy back app and was not impressed. The greens were drowning in lemon, the pork was under seasoned, and the server had told me there were four oysters on the plate and I was only served three. This is an easy mistake to make, but $16 for 3 oysters isn't  something I would have paid if I had known. At the end of the night, half a dozen oysters, an app, and a glass of wine came to $50 for one person. I feel like it was a night wasted.

Reviews.Author: Jason A.
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston from Chicago to see the Cubs at Fenway and decided to visit this place to eat a Lobster roll.  I ordered the hot lobster roll and upon the first bite, I was in heaven.  So much lobster meat in warm butter and absolutely delightful.  For an appetizer, we had an order of mussels.  The sauce that accompanies this appetizer was so flavorful.  The server brought us a few pieces of bread as he stated that the sauce was just amazing.  He was so right.The wait was a little long, but it was totally worth it.  Neptune runs a good system in taking down your name & phone number and calling you when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Lesley H.
Reviews.Content: I read all these reviews about the wait here, so when my boyfriend and I walked in and there was one person in line waiting I thought we were extremely lucky.... nope that was just the line to get on the list. Once we got on the list it was a 2 hr wait which honestly wasn't too bad since they take down your phone number and you can wander around until you get that call. To start off our meal, obviously I got half a dozen of fresh oysters. I had the bartender help me choose which ones to try, and then the guy sitting next to us at the bar chimed in with his favorite too. I love oysters, but am definitely not an oyster connoisseur and wondered if I would be able to taste the difference between the different kinds. To my surprise, I definitely could. I liked the sweeter/fruitier oysters. My two favorites were the Wellfleet and Island Creek. My boyfriend got the crab bisque bc he doesn't like raw oysters... crazy i know. I didn't try any of it, but he loved it.For our meal, obviosly we got the famous lobster rolls. My boyfriend got it cold (with mayo), and I got it hot (with melted butter). Both were delicious. I thought I would have possibly liked the cold better bc all the lobster rolls I've had before were served this way, but I actually ended up liking the hot version better. Now I will say this is not the best lobster roll I've had, but it is pretty dang good. It definitely is the largest one I've had. At the other places I've gone that I would have ranked higher than Neptune were a lot smaller. They definietely don't cheat you on the size of the lobster roll here.

Reviews.Author: Joanna N.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster was the highlight of the road trip that my roommate and I took to Boston. After almost 5 hours of zigzag driving (we're awful drivers with no sense of direction), we made it to Neptune around 3pm -- our first destination. We made our way through the mass of people standing outside only to wait inside for about 20 minutes before the hostess acknowledged us. She was doubling as waitress so whatever. We were quoted a 2.5 hour wait which I had anticipated, based on the reviews that I had read. Soo, we went on a little lobster roll sampling run in the area (Pauly's, North End Fish Market, Boston Chowda Co) to wait it out. The host called us exactly 2.5 hours later!Even after devouring 3 lobster rolls, we were determined to sample a good portion of the menu. We ended up splitting some oysters, a lobster roll, and their scallops entree.The oysters were AMAZING. You're given a little paper oyster menu and pencil to check off the ones that you want. We decided on the Beausoleil (hints of champagne), Kumamoto (hints of honeydew melon), and Kusshi(sweet, cucumber finish) based on the interesting descriptions. I'm not sure why I was so surprised when they all tasted exactly as they were described hahahha but that was indeed the case. So fresh. Soo good. My favorite was the Kumamoto!Since all the lobster rolls we sampled before Neptune were cold, we decided to get the warm lobster roll with fries. Honestly, I was a bit underwhelmed. It wasn't even that we were lobstered out or maybe we were? There was definitely a lot of huge, fresh lobster chunks but not any more so than on the ones we had tried at the other spots. Meanwhile, this roll was practically double the price! I also think the lobster could have used a pinch of salt. The roll was also a tad soggy. The fries were solid, though!The scallops that we ordered here are THE BEST THAT I'VE EVER HAD. These babies were monstrous -- plump, seared and seasoned to perfection. This dish  comes with d'anjou pear butter, duck confit, brussel sprouts and Maytag blue. Seemingly an odd combination of rather complex ingredients but everything worked perfectly! It was the ultimate flavor explosion. The brussel sprouts were roasted perfectly. The pear butter was very mild but welcome -- I soaked the brussel sprouts and scallops in it. The duck confit was salty, rich and flavorful. We didn't get the blue cheese on our dish that it was supposed to come with, but it was fine nonetheless. I actually think the flavor of it would have been too sharp if there was more than a sprinkling. The meal was definitely not cheap but I can't get over the amazing oysters and scallops. I most definitely will be back to Neptune the next time that I am back in Boston -- probably go on an oyster run while waiting it out!

Reviews.Author: Peter I.
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it pays to be a business traveler. Tonight I wandered over to the Neptune and was told by folks waiting it was 3 hours for a table!!!! What? 3 hours???Well, being a one they squeezed me into the bar (quite comfy actually) and my server Ann took great care of me. A little chowder. A nice glass of chianti and I was happy.I had fried clams and watched the oysters and lobsters go by and it was a parade of goodness!!! The clams were some of the freshest and best I've had!!! Ever! Next time I'll call and get a table. All good here!

Reviews.Author: Michele W.
Reviews.Content: Lobster, butter, bread, fries...what's not to loveDefinitely go for a hot lobster roll, so much meaty lobster dripping with hot melted butter, line up early. Tourists kill this place

Reviews.Author: Mimi C.
Reviews.Content: *OVERRATED* *CLAP CLAP CLAP CLAP CLAP* *OVERRATED* MAINE LOBSTER ROLL  - ** signature dish that everyone comes for ** ... SKIP!!!expensive at $27 (unfortunately the going price around the block, we checked!)While large, chunky, and generous in portion, the lobsters didn't taste fresh and lacked that "just outta the ocean" bright flavor and they were tough to the texture. Now, you'll say, you can't have everything fresh but with Maine being only a few hours away... We had the hot (topped w/ hot butter) and the cold (with dill & mayo) and both were disappointing. The fries looked like they've been sitting out too long. My friend and I eventually gave up finishing. CIOPPINIO: Good broth, not too salty. Hubby had this dish and said that the shrimp just wasn't very fresh tasting. For $27, I thought it was not worth the value. We kept comparing to cioppinios we' had back in SF and this just doesn't compare.Another friend of ours had the scallops + duck confit and seemed happy with it. They also ordered oysters which I assumed were pretty good but at close to $4.00 a pop (SERIOUSLY!?! and no happy hour to speak of), I rather buy my own oysys and shuck 'em myself *super easy thing to do*Service was ok. Our waitress seemed to be having a bad day and spilled over her grumpiness into 'her service * ugh *. --- PS- ok so how to actually get in.. and while I warn you this is a skip place... you're looking at 1+hr wait (no reservations). It's a small space, but they do take your number down and call you when they're ready for you.

Reviews.Author: Paul F.
Reviews.Content: Fabulous.  Best oysters in Boston and the lobster roll is enormous and outstanding.  My kids had the yellowtail sushi and it was also great.  Small place, no reservations, always a line, but they will take your number and call you when you have a table so it works out OK.

Reviews.Author: Mahsa T.
Reviews.Content: Tiny, but very popular spot! Neptune Oyster has been written up everywhere as one of the best seafood places in Boston and that is why you'll find a line and a wait to get in there even in the middle of the day during the week. I got lucky with bar seating and since it was lunch time, I wanted to get something on the smaller side, so I opted for the lobster roll (especially when I read on the menu that you get your choice of served hot with butter or cold with mayo). I chose hot with butter and boy did it hit the spot, along with my cold Harpoon beer.One of the best lobster rolls I've had. Only con was that the fries had a bit of a burnt bitter flavor to them, but I didn't come here for the fries. Cute "Neptune-God of the Sea" theme and decor. Service was friendly. I definitely recommend this place, the rave reviews are justified, and it's worth the wait. You can put your name down, go walk around the neighborhood and they will call or text you on your phone when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Enzo M.
Reviews.Content: I was excited about going to this place from the moment someone mentioned I needed to try their lobster roll (I love lobster rolls). All i can say is when i definitely made it here 2 weeks ago it unfortunately wasn't the best lobster roll i had. Don't get me wrong it was great. I had the warm one, my friend the cold one and it was great, just not impressed based on these reviews. Oysters were solid but more expensive than the same oysters at island creek. What got to me the most however was their beer selection. It was horrendous. Just a bunch of half decent craft brews-where island creek and B&G oyster really shine in respect. Service was also bleh, it was crowded though and always is. I wouldn't say skip this place and if your wait time is like an hour then go, but if its like 2-3 hours just leave. Not worth it.

Reviews.Author: Travis W.
Reviews.Content: Pretty sure this is the best seafood dinner I've ever had.  I didn't go all out fancy but opted for the oysters and the lobster roll instead.OMG, insane is my best description.  I literally think I set a land speed record devouring it.  The appeal of this place is not only the food but also how small and intimate the setting is.  You better put your name in by 5pm if you want to eat before 10pm.  And that's on a weekday, I can't imagine a weekend night.This is a MUST if you're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Ron Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is small, but well worth the wait.  When I got in, the waitress told me that there would be an hour wait and she took down my name and phone number.  In 45 minutes, she called me back.  I had told them that I was on my way back from moving my car and it took an additional 15 minutes.  They didn't have an issue and still reserved my seat.  Only drawback was the slow service but it seemed like there were only a couple servers.  I had ordered the lobster roll with hot butter, a clam chowder, and a johnnycake.  The lobster roll was awesome and delicious.  I loved every bite of it with fresh lobster chunks.  The fries that came with the dish was well seasoned and delicious.  The clam chowder was delicious.  The chowder was creamy and had fresh clams.  The potatoes were fresh out of the pot and didn't seem very mushy.  The johnnycake was served hot with the smoked trout and caviar on top.  The flavors worked well except the smokiness of the trout was strong, but still worked.  I left this place full and the pricing was what I had expected considering the restaurant being a seafood bar style restaurant.I would definitely come back here if I visit Boston again.  I would suggest you park in the structure across from the Haymarket subway entrance.  There is a convenient store on the next block where you can get validation if you buy something at the store.Have a great time here and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Gigi L.
Reviews.Content: Definitely make this spot your cheat day destination... worth every calorie! Got the hot lobster roll and it was magnificent... huge pieces of crustacean with just the right amount of butter... the fries were eh... i'd go with the salad next time. Also ordered the johnnycake... that was delicious. i recommend splitting it since its pretty rich. The oysters were legit as well... got a island creek and well fleet... both shucked well and yummy. a must for all lobster lovers... just remember.. no ressies here, so be prepared to wait 1-2 hours!

Reviews.Author: H C.
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about coming here, but was disappointed both by the food and the service.  My companion and I waited for over 3 hours and ordered the crab bisque and triton plateau--neither of us felt like a lobster roll.  The crab bisque was delicious, creamy but light.  The triton plateau was beautiful and came with a mignonette and cocktail sauce.Unfortunately, the mignonette tasted like alcohol and oil and was very bitter; there was no hint of acid in it.  It tasted so bad that we thought there had been a mistake.  I timidly inquired about it of our waitress, who responded, "It's champagne."  In my experience, even a champagne mignonette has some acid, whether champagne vinegar or otherwise.  I explained that our mignonette tasted only of alcohol and asked if there was anything with vinegar.  Our waitress stated that she thought there was vinegar in the kitchen.  For some reason, she then dropped off a cup of syrupy balsamic vinegar (never eaten with raw oysters) and studiously ignored us the rest of the night.Chastened, we picked at our food and left soon thereafter.  The oysters were fine and the shrimp was good.  But the clams tasted like they had gone bad, some of the mussels had not opened up, and there was only so much that we could eat with the cocktail sauce.  I had oysters a couple nights before this at Island Creek and the experience there was so much better--the seafood was fresh, they brought out a caddy filled with fun condiments, and they really cared about my experience.  If you are looking to eat raw seafood, please go there.

Reviews.Author: Sheri C.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster, how I love thee!   During our honeymoon we found this precious pearl via Yelp. It kept coming up #1 no matter what we typed in: Segway tours, pubs, museums. We had to try the place.  It became a defining moment in our dining experience as a newlywed couple.  We ate there twice in 4 days and I had 2 meals to myself during a recent overnight layover in Boston.  I had a choice between an overnight layover in NYC or Boston and I chose the latter for Neptune Oyster alone. Totally worth it!The shellfish is deliciously fresh and clean, briny and buttery, and oh-so-delectable.  Thinking about their freshly shucked oysters and mussels makes my mouth water!  The hot buttered Lobster Roll is THE Best, Top Notch, and Unrivaled.  Order it, you won't be disappointed.  Finally, I had to try their North End Ciopinno during my most recent visit.  The spicy broth had layers of rich flavor and succulent shellfish.  Gotta love when they keep the heads on the shrimp, too!Bonus tips: The locals on either side of me highly recommended Monday's dinner special, a Lobster spaghettini dish.  Even over the lobster roll!  Also, they don't take reservations but they will call you when they've got your table ready. Grab a beer or two at Goody Glover's on the corner while you wait, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Kay C.
Reviews.Content: Life-changing lobster rolls.  One of my goals when I came to visit and this place did not disappoint.  We got there around 2:45pm hoping the later time would mean not as long of a wait but unfortunately they still quoted us an hour.  We went to Paul Revere's house and 40 minutes later they called us so it wasn't quite as long as they said thankfully.  I had purposely not eaten much for breakfast so I was starving.Went all out, got a couple of glasses of bubbly (big glasses here), fresh MA oysters (very briney, large and juicy but a bit saltier than what I'm used to from the PNW), and 2 lobster rolls - 1 cold and 1 hot.  $27 each - so quite spendy - but man you get sooo much lobster.  You'll definitely be full.  I personally think I actually preferred the cold - the hot had a little too much butter - I should have asked for a little less butter.  Overall, great lobster meat though and I was fully satisfied!

Reviews.Author: JiaJia T.
Reviews.Content: I tried 5 different lobster rolls in Boston and this one beats the others.  By. Far.The last time we attempted to eat here the wait was 2+ hours so this time we went on a weekday around 5:30pm.  There was no wait and we were seated right away.  Inside was small and we were practically having dinner with the friendly couple next to us.  The service was fast and friendly.  We ordered Neptune on Piggyback, one hot lobster roll, on cold lobster roll, and north end Cioppino.The Neptune on Piggyback had plump oysters fried perfectly but still retained the freshness.  The golden raisins, greens, and aioli were refreshing flavors in the dish.  Then came our lobster rolls.  Huge chunks of glorious lobster meat spilling out of the lightly toasted rolls.  Stunning first look.  First bite confirmed the first look.  The flavor of the lobster meat was enhanced by the mayo/butter.  No fillers just fresh lobster meat with the perfect amount of butter/mayo.  The hot butter lobsters and cold mayo lobsters were different but equally delicious.  Don't forget the rolls.  They wouldn't be perfect lobster rolls without the rolls.  The rolls weren't limp or too small or too big.  They were just right.  These are the lobster role (pun intended) models  that all others should strive to be.Sure the lobsters rolls were fantastic but the Cioppino was a serious contender.  Fresh, jumbo shrimp, scallops, clams, mussels, fish, and rice all swimming in the saffron infused briny broth.  It was simple and complex, and rich and light all at the same time.  I think I forgot my manners and licked the last drop of the broth.  Some bread would've prevented that.Hands down, this place deserves its numerous praises, and more.

Reviews.Author: Shelly Z.
Reviews.Content: Amazing, amazing little gem of a restaurant. Completely worth the wait. I enjoyed a lobster roll, warm with butter. One of the best things I've ever ate. Service was great. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Author: Tom G.
Reviews.Content: Perfect! You'll have to wait, but your patience will be rewarded with the freshest oysters, impeccably shucked.

Reviews.Author: Kat A.
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were visiting Boston just for fun. All our friends told us we had to go to this restaurant. Luckily we were still there on a Monday and weren't hungry for lunch til 3PM. We got seated in less than 10 minutes. They don't take reservations, so trying to get a seat in this tiny place can take at least an hour. I think you can leave your name and then they'd call you when a table was ready. It's a super cramped place. We were seated at a table with another couple who didn't seem too keen on having to share there table with anyone else. We both ordered a few different oysters to try, a lobster roll and clam chowder. The oysters were so fresh. The lobster roll is the best I've ever had! We had it hot with butter (the other option is cold with mayonnaise). The clam chowder wasn't that great. The broth was pretty thin, but maybe all my life I've been eating fake clam chowder and this is the real way it should be made. It wasn't as flavorful as I expected.This is probably the only restaurant I'd come back to if I visited Boston again.

Reviews.Author: Renuka V.
Reviews.Content: 2 of us got in from NYC at 3:30am, slept, woke up and got to Neptune at 12:15pm Monday and  put our name on the list for a 12:45pm seating. Walked around the shops in the area and found a v.cool boutique carrying cool designers, incl AmandaUparichard. Also discovered Polcari'sCoffee where we got some spices. When we got back to Neptune, there was a line just to get their name on the list(!). Ordered 1/2 dozen of 3 types of oysters, which were ok but not as tasty as the ones we had at LenoxHotel. Also shared the ButtermilkJohnnyCake which was buttermilk pancakes topped w smoked trout tartare and garnished w sturgeon caviar. Very good and a must order!! And of course, shared the lobster roll as well which was as all other yelpers here will attest, was the best ever!! Total bill was $80 incl tip.

Reviews.Author: Taj K.
Reviews.Content: We knew going into this that we would have a long wait. For a table of 4, we showed up at 5pm. We got the call our table was ready at about 8pm.Though they don't take reservations, you won't have to wait in a long line like giacomos. So we walked around the north end and Faneuil hall, got drinks and enjoyed the beautiful day.The restaurant is small like most restaurants in the north end. You can smell the butter in the air.A few of us got oysters, and they were amazing. Fresh, refreshing and delicious. "This is the best oyster I have ever had and I don't like oysters!" according to one of my friends. I tried the beausoleil, and tasted the hint of champagne.We shared the fried oyster appetizer, which ended being plenty for the 4 girls to share. We also shared the warm lobster roll as pairs. With a glass of wine, our bill split 4 ways only came to about $40 each.I am by no means an expert on lobster but this lobster roll is one of the most amazing things I've ever put in my mouth. My girlfriend who drove up to the north shore last week for a lobster roll wishes she had stayed in Boston. The appetizer of fried oysters was great but in retrospect I would have preferred more raw oysters. Btw raw oysters are about $3 each.I highly recommend Neptune oysters. Wait will be shorter for smaller parties, and very quick if you go alone. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Sang P.
Reviews.Content: Went around 11:15 to wait in line. They opened almost exactly at 11:30 and we were seated immediately. Didn't have to wait at all! And it was so worth it.Do you like lobster? (who doesn't?) Order the lobster rolls. You will not regret it. VERY GENEROUS portions of lobster and delicious bread...One of my favorite stores in Little Italy and definitely the best lobster rolls in Boston.Great service + great atmosphere. Highly recommended. If you're in Boston, you must go here!

Reviews.Author: R S.
Reviews.Content: At first, I though the food was great... and service was decent.  However, I was unlucky and must have got one bad raw oyster which beyond a doubt caused me to be violently ill.  (I have never been that sick from food before)While it could have been unsanitary food preparation, I completely acknowledge this could have been simply a bad batch of oysters.  However, when I called the restaurant so they could look into if a batch of oysters could be bad to save other patrons from the same fate, they did not care in the least bit.  The person on the phone was very short, abrupt, and rude and referenced their raw seafood disclaimer and was not interested in hearing which oysters we had or anything else.This is not unacceptable and disappointing from a restaurant with a decent reputation.  Obviously many people have had great food here, but from my personal experience with them, I will never recommend or go to it again.  Hopefully none of you suffer my same fate, but why risk it? There are plenty of other great seafood places around town...

Reviews.Author: CARLA S.
Reviews.Content: I had the lobster bisque which was amazing. My dad had the chowder and both didn't like it because it was very thin like a broth. We loved and I encourage you to get it - buttermilk Johnnycake was amazing!!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is good, but very simple. The main thing going for it is that the seafood is ridiculously fresh. I guess for a place with such high ratings my expectations were a little high. We started with a dozen oysters from around the Massachusetts and Canada ways, which were good and fresh. The oysters were followed by an anchovy dish and a hamachi crudo dish - both were delicious. The crab bisque was very flavorful, but I would have liked a lot more crab - it felt like there may have been the equivalent of only one crab leg. The lobster roll in butter was packed with lobster, but seemed plain. I know most lobster rolls are plain, but I would have liked a fun seasoning or some sort of twist to be added. The food was good - I would give the anchovies and the hamachi 4 stars, but the other dishes 3.5 stars. I probably wouldn't wait for hours, but would definitely head in if I happened to walk past it at an off (empty) time.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly N.
Reviews.Content: This place was yummy. Highlight were the fresh oysters and very good service. I talked all weekend about the oysters. Just wonderful. Now, the less memorable, but still good...Neptune on piggyback: this was decadent but light. It could have used more of a dressing, but the micro greens provided some moisture.Lobster roll (hot with butter): probably not what you want to read, but mine was definitely overcooked. Or I just happened to have a really old big-ass lobster that didn't have much flavor. There was no inherent sweetness to the meat. The roll was delicious, but the overcooked lobster made it less eventful than I had anticipated. Tried to make it better with salt and pepper, but it was too late. Fries were OK.I recommend the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic warm lobster roll, though it's expected for $27 when other rolls of comparable quality are in the low $20s.I have to say though, the service is awful. I don't understand how they feel comfortable pricing themselves at ~$30 entrees when their servers never smile, barely speak to us, and make numerous excuses for honest mistakes like forgetting my order instead of simply apologizing. The pricing is fair for the quality of the food, but doesn't make sense considering the poor service.

Reviews.Author: Mary M.
Reviews.Content: It's true. This place lives up to the hype. We had a great experience. Super friendly servers and a 45 min wait. We walked around the north end and they called to tell us to start making our way back. We had 3 different types of oysters, shrimp cocktail and split the hot lobster roll and fries. Delicious. All of it. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Zach T.
Reviews.Content: Great place for all kinds of seafood. As someone who loves Oysters, this is my favorite place to go. Hands down. They break the oysters down by region and give you a description of what flavor qualities you can expect from each. (Its a good place to get started if you don't know a tremendous amount about oysters). The environment is a nice laid back upscale combo. A little loud inside (which I don't mind) as almost half of the place is a bar. There is seating for up to 24 at the tables, so the max you'll ever see is 40-50 people in the establishment at any given time. I don't know if they take reservations. I just put my name on a list w my cell number and get called when my table was ready. Plenty to walk around and see and you more than likely will end up waiting for a table at this local favorite. Good service.  The best food. Great atmosphere. The table may take a while to get. Its definitely worth waiting for.

Reviews.Author: Deborah F.
Reviews.Content: Never again...first and last time. The wait was long and the male server was rude and his attitude never changed throughout the night. The place was crowded and very uncomfortable. The food was not worth the cost. The best part of a very long and uncomfortable evening was getting home.

Reviews.Author: Jesse D.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant delivers the goods when it comes to a top-notch great seafood.  Intimate quarters and a great oyster list.  Very busy whenever I've been so plan ahead.

Reviews.Author: Liz L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down best place for oysters and lobster roll on the east coast!  My husband and I took a trip to the New England states for one week.  We traveled from Boston to Maine by car.  We tried oysters and lobster roll in every state, at famous eateries showcased on TV.  However, our favorite place was a recommendation by my husband's coworkers, Neptune Oyster.  Not only do they have an impressive selection of delicious oysters from both coasts, the lobster roll beat out everything we tried in Maine.  What made this place better than the rest was temperature.  The lobster roll was actually warm - both the buttered lobster meat and the bun!  I like raw seafood cold but I HATE cooked seafood served tepid or worse, cold (e.g. shrimp cocktail).  So if you're in the mood for great seafood, skip Maine and go straight to Boston!  Warning: there will be a long wait (like 1.5 to 2 hours) but they give you a pager so you can leave and go do other things (like nap, grab drinks elsewhere or take a pre-dinner stroll).

Reviews.Author: Joyce L.
Reviews.Content: When have I ever waited 2 hours to be seated? never, but I trusted my fellow yelpers when they said that this place was worth the wait, so I explored the area for 2 hours, ate a HUGE cannoli from mike's pastry (amazing btw), and relaxed by the fountain area/park/whatever that thing is.  I ordered the hot lobster roll, of course, and we also got a couple oysters.  When comparing the freshness of the oysters, I enjoyed the oysters at Neptune more than Island Creek Oyster Bar.  I'm not sure if the oyster selection changes at Neptune according to what is available each week, but I would recommend the Island Creek Oysters from Duxbury, MA (ahhh the irony haha)!  The Katama Bay oysters were a bit salty, so I would pass on this one if you're sensitive to salt like me.  As for the lobster roll, it definitely lived up to the hype.  Lots and lots of meat on a hot, buttery roll.  I had trouble finishing my lobster roll... probably because I ate all the fries before I started on the roll haha problems of a french fry addict.  If anyone is particularly picky about their fries, the fries here were just as good as the lobster roll - hot, crispy, the "just out of the fryer" kind of good.I have nothing much to add about this place.  The food was great and the service was great, as well.  Like everyone else said, it's a tiny space and the wait is ridiculous.  I'm glad I was able to try out the "oh-so-famous neptune oyster", but I don't know if I would come back again and wait another 2 hours.  So for now, farewell neptune oyster and I shall see you later... probably on a cold winter day when I'm craving clam chowder soup and less people are willing to wait in the freezing cold.

Reviews.Author: Juan C.
Reviews.Content: The food is amazing, but the service is mediocre. Sever didn't know the dishes well and I had to ask for water. It wasn't busy and out waiter disappeared.

Reviews.Author: Kiki P.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster has the freshest and tastiest oysters in town. I have been trying to go here for years and since the wait is ALWAYS so long I usually just end up eating somewhere else. This time, I waited the full three hours and boy was it worth it. They had a dozen different types of oysters on the menu so I tried one of each. This included the Wellfleet, Island Creek, Katama Bay, Ripitide, East Beach Blonde, Onset, Pemaquid, Winter Point, Beausoleil, Tamagouche, Kumamoto, and Kusshi. Of these my top 4 favorite were the Wellfleet, Island Creek, Winter Point, and Kusshi. I highly recommend trying these if not all.After the oysters I had the PEI mussels which were served with toasted cashews, red curry, cilantro, lime, scallions and garlic...yummy! The mussels were good but not as amazing as the oysters. I have definitely had better mussels in Boston. The broth was tasty but the mussels did not really take the flavor of the broth. I also tried the clam chowder which was delicious. The consistency was a bit thinner than you would imagine which made the chowder taste light but the pieces of clams balanced the thinness out. After trying every single oyster on the menu, I was actually pretty full. I am mad that I did not have the opportunity to try the lobster roll but all the more reason to come back. I really wish they took reservations. Hopefully I have the energy to return here soon!If you have not been to Neptune yet, stop reading this review and get yourself over there right now!

Reviews.Author: Lauren W.
Reviews.Content: INCONSIDERATE BASTURDS.  called ahead to get instructions for best chances of seating a large party b/c they don't take reservations.  check our plans w them again by phone before heading out--because it's hard for our disabled friend to walk thru the N. End.  arrive 15 min later to be informed by officious hostess that they won't even take our names for the waiting list b/c it is 3 hrs long.  and when I say the person answering the phone ought to give more accurate info, she makes it clear she couldn't care less.  all I can conclude is that they're willing willing to waste customers' time, gasoline and parking fees--not to mention physical efforts--to assure their chances of a sellout.

Reviews.Author: Ellen P.
Reviews.Content: Went around 5:00pm on a Wednesday. The waiter told us it would be 45-60 min. We were called back and seated within 45 min maybe even a bit sooner. The oysters were fresh, each of us ate 4. Everyone in the group got the lobster roll - 2 hot, 1 cold. Both were delicious and I really enjoyed the fries. After reading other reviews complain about the fries I think it is personal preference. The fries are not crisp, rather bendy with some crisp ones. They are well seasoned and both individuals at my table couldn't stop eating them - they give you are large size portion. One person opted for the arugula salad instead of the fries. It had a phenomenal tasting dressing on it but almost too much. Next time I would ask for the dressing on the side. Worth the less than 45 min wait. Great atmosphere and Great food.

Reviews.Author: Barb S.
Reviews.Content: Came here again, as we enjoyed their food so much on our last trip to Boston.  The oysters were amazing, skip the blue crab cocktail (too much dijon--masks the taste of the very expensive crab), yummy warm lobster roll with butter and our neighbors said we HAD to get the johnny cake, so we did.  The johnny cake is such an interesting dish, a mix of sweet and salty.  They make a pancake and drizzle it with lots of butter and something sweet--I'm guessing honey, maybe.  Then they put a little tower of smoked trout in the middle with a dab of creme fraiche and caviar on top.  My only complaint is the size of the place and the fact that you share a table with people you don't know and it's hard to hear your companion across the table from you.

Reviews.Author: Cindy T.
Reviews.Content: My first time in Boston and first meal in Boston was at Neptune Oyster last month. We started off with a dozen of four different oysters and each one was so different in flavor and all were so fresh. I've never had oysters like this before. Twas amazing.Then i had the hot lobster roll. Wow, I've never had a hot lobster roll and this was soooooo good! It was warm and not overly buttery. Just awesome and nothing like I've ever had.I heard this place can get super packed, but luckily we came here around 3pm and there was zero wait.

Reviews.Author: Che B.
Reviews.Content: Quality. I came here when my parents were in town. My mom wanted to go to a place with good food, so I turned to yelp, and it didn't disappoint. When my parents and I got to the restaurant we noticed the line. Always was there people in line waiting to get in. After 30minutes of waiting, it was my family's turn. There's a pleasant ambiance of the restaurant (though I can't put my mind on how to describe it). The tables are pretty close to each other, so if you're all about personal space, this might be a concern.Food:I ordered the Thursday special- Shrimp and Grits. Best shrimp and grits I've ever eaten (before here, only had such southern cuisine in the south). And they weren't chincy on the amount of shrimp- 12pieces (not bad). The sauce around the shrimp and grits was  a red mildly spicy sauce. It was one of the most flavorful dishes I have eaten in a while. I could tell many spices I have never heard of went into that sauce. My mom got the hot lobster roll, which didn't disappoint. And dad got some scallops- also very good. The raw oysters were delicious too. I never tried oysters before (always hesitant). But the one I tried was incredible. Everything that was ordered was food at it's highest quality. Service is great for such crowdedness and food arrived relatively quickly.  So all in wonderful experience. If looking for the finest seafood in town- here's the place.

Reviews.Author: Adam W.
Reviews.Content: We typically only come in here with out of town guests, but always love it when we do. Usually we stick to the obligatory New England dishes, like the fried clams, oysters, and lobster rolls. For the 14 years I've lived here the quality of the food is way better than any clam shack we've had. Of course the upcharge is reflected as well.

Reviews.Author: Keon D.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll sandwich is outrageously expensive.. but at least it's also outrageously good.For 20 something bucks 25? or 27? i forgot. You get a lobster roll sandwich that is overflowing with juicy delicious lobster. Unless you are a competitive eater I would not recommend trying to get anything else or soup in addition to this sandwich. With all the fries and the lobster you'll be VERY very full. It costs a lot but the main difference is that instead of little chipped up pieces of lobster, you only got nice large chunks. There was also a TON of lobster. I chose the hot buttered lobster roll, you can also get it cold with mayo. Only thing is the sandwich bread quickly became kinda useless as a sandwich that you could pick up and I had to eat most of it with fork and knife. (The bread kinda squished)

Reviews.Author: David Y.
Reviews.Content: So I ventured up here on my own and I'm so happy I did. I was in for the week visiting friends and family and needed to get a seafood fix. I took the T up here and ordered the calm chowder and the lobster roll with butter. The chowder was a bit thin for how I like chowder, but it's made to order. That's about the most negative thing I can say. The chowder itself was delicious. Then came the lobster roll. It was massive and there were huge chunks of lobster. Not the typical minced lobster meat. Not only was the thing massive, but the lobster was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. It was definitely the best lobster roll I've ever had. A piece of advice, there is almost always a wait for groups of 2+.  As I was by myself, I got seated immediately in a single seat at the bar. The smaller the party, the quicker you eat. Even if you do have to wait for over an hour, it is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Spike T.
Reviews.Content: If you don't go super early or on an off off hour be prepared to wait.  The place is small: just a few tables and a row of stools at the oyster bar.  Nice historic old Boston style atmosphere without any grandmotherly mustiness...To start, get some oysters.  You'll get a paper menu listing the day's offerings with the oyster's origin, the price per oyster, and a short description of how each oyster should taste.  For example... get the Island Creeks/from Duxbury/2.70per/Description: Med, high salt, juicy, fruity finish.  Choose from half a dozen varieties from MA, and another half dozen varieties from outside of MA (Maine, Rhode Island, Washington State, British Columbia).  Also listed are Clams, Shrimp/Crab/or Octopus cocktails and Crab Claws.  Check off the amount of what you want on the paper menu, hand it to the server.After that... it's hard to order anything else but......The Lobster Roll.  Get it.  One of the best you'll ever have.  You can choose between the cold lobster roll with mayo (which technically is a Maine style lobster roll) or the hot lobster roll with warm butter (which technically is a Connecticut style lobster roll)... however, the choice for me is obvious... go for the hot roll with warm butter.  You will get a huge amount of Lobster piled into a split roll.  You will get an obscene amount of french fries.  You will get butter all over your hands.  Eventually, the butter will break down the roll into a sopping beautiful delicious lobstahfying mess.  When you finish you will be in a Lobstah coma.  Eventually, after you come out of it, You will look down at your shirt making sure you didn't get any butter or lobster on yourself.  But who cares anyway, you just sucked down one of the best lobster rolls the city of Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Author: Bahareh Z.
Reviews.Content: Best oyster house! We tried 8 different oysters and they were supper fresh and delicious. Also tried the buttermilk Johnny cake and the smoked trout and caviar was fabulous.Once you get past the long line up you'd the wait is worthwhile.

Reviews.Author: Tina D.
Reviews.Content: Great place for fresh seafood!  If you're into oysters my recommendation is still Marliave at happy hour.   But it's the variety and the lobster roll that's puts this place over the top!  If you like fresh seafood,  just shell out the cash and get the triton plateau, it's worth it

Reviews.Author: Kswagg X.
Reviews.Content: 4 stars because there were several pieces of shell in my lobster roll. Johnnycake was delicious. Highly recommended. Oysters are fresh and delicious. Prepare for a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Margaret N.
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the hype! Not much seating inside so make sure you go early to get a table. Went around 11 a.m. to put my name down, and they called me two hours later for my table.Tried the fried clams- very yummy! Perfectly fried and plump and juicy, and they give you a pretty good portion. You definitely get your money's worth. The fresh made dipping sauce it comes with is amazing too!! Had the infamous lobster roll, buttered bun. They give you a generous amount of lobster meat!! Wish it had more flavor though and really wish they removed the poop from the lobster. The bun is perfectly buttered and toasted though! And fries were on point! Definitely a great spot for anyone visiting from out of town!

Reviews.Author: Sarah T.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait. Everything was incredible. Get there early to put your name in and go have drinks it's like hour and a half wait. Lobster roll scallops and all oysters were amazing!

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: Great service and a really good lobster roll. Still can't decide if I like the hot or cold better but I'm probably leaning towards the cold. If the wait seems to long go next door to Ernesto's for a quick slice.

Reviews.Author: Brad P.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best lobster roll I EVER HADThe wait was 1 hour but who cares!!! There's a reason people line up for this. And you should too.They give you two choices of lobster roll - warm with butter or cold with mayo. GO WARM WITH BUTTER. You can thank me later. The fries that comes with it was fantastic as well. Also had the oysters, and I love the variety they had. A little slow for the oysters to come out but apparently it's because they crack open fresh oysters when you order them. It was delicious.Other menu items looked fantastic. If I ever visit Boston again, this will most definitely be my first stop.

Reviews.Author: Kailene K.
Reviews.Content: I brought my friend from out of town to try her first New England Sea Food dish! I don't think we could have scarfed down the lobster roll any faster.  The fries that came with it were just mediocre though.  We also had the Johnny Cake - ohhh man was that soo good.I'd without doubt recommend this place to everyone.  I'd also recommend getting there 3 hours before you actually want to eat.  We went on a Wednesday at 2 and still waited 2.5 hours.

Reviews.Author: Roma o.
Reviews.Content: I going to have update my review.  I visited that place during busy weekend and 3 hour wait time is ridiculous,  but let me explain why.  We have a restaurant in Brooklyn,  New York where wait on average was 40 minutes. Since then they have expended into 3 new locations not too far apart and wait time was cut by half.  So I think Neptune Oyster could afford to open another tini-tiny place somewhere close by. And I know that most people are not enjoying seating almost face to face to strangers and listening their conversations. Food no longer tasted the best and I'm basing it on traveling and eating around MA,  NH,  ME,  CT and Long Island NY seafood restaurants. I've already tried better food for much cheaper. So if you are traveling by car,  save your time, do a little yelp homework and you can find same if not better food for much less. Face it,  it's not romantic, not trendy, not kids friendly,  not big groups friendly,  not occasion group friendly (such as birthday),  and with wait time of travel from NYC to Boston.

Reviews.Author: William E.
Reviews.Content: Idk .... My  'check-in' "WAS" sweet! I soon realized the waitress/barmaid was as faux as her complexion as was the TAXED menu! While the menu was fresh, the prices were as well! And that was the limit of this joint! Wait a minute! This place and most reviews are the epitome of an OXY-MORON! ( located in Charlestown with the "Oxymorons")

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: My quest to find the best hot lobster roll started and ended at Neptune Oyster.This place is bursting with New England charm with marble top tables and a very inviting dark stained wood bar to post up at.  Seating is extremely limited, but I assure you it's worth any wait.  Not only is the seafood spectacular, but the experience can be memorable!Being from Seattle, I'm no stranger to seafood.  Oysters are abundant and fish is plentiful.  What are us Seattleites missing? LOBSTER.  I heard about Neptune Oyster and made the trek to the North End to see what this hot lobster roll was all about.  I came alone and was lucky enough to find the last remaining spot at the bar.  The bartender quickly brought me a menu and an oyster ordering sheet.  After seeing the woman shucking oysters through the window from the street, I knew these things were going to be good.  There's no question what your getting with each oyster type as the ordering sheet gives an excellent description of each flavor profile.  Their mignonette was an excellent accompaniment to wash them down.If there was one food experience you shouldn't miss in Boston it's this hot lobster roll.  This thing deserves 6 stars, maybe even 7!  The roll is generously buttered and tossed on the grill to get those nice grill marks and then overloaded with a heaping pile of sweet, buttery local lobster.  I'm sure the seafood pastas they serve are delicious, but I'm not interested.  At a pricey $27, you might scoff and say it's just a sandwich.  After you eat it you'll be willing to pay more.I will certainly be back!

Reviews.Author: Rob B.
Reviews.Content: Adequate. Drafty. Overrated.If all you're after is a "Boston lobster roll" go to James Hook & Co. Just as good, much less pricey and you won't have to wait three hours for it. Neptune's mains are very good, but not good enough to wait for.

Reviews.Author: I G.
Reviews.Content: What's the big deal about this place? What is worth the 2 hour wait for a table on a Sunday evening? The lobster roll was good, but I've had better. Prices are on the expensive side, and the space is pretty tight. The neighborhood is pretty busy and hip though, and there's definitely things to do and places to see afterwards.

Reviews.Author: Olivia P.
Reviews.Content: On my next visit to Boston, I knew I had to come back to Neptune Oyster. Even though I came on a Monday afternoon (~3pm) like I did previously, this time, I had to queue for 45 min! It was packed!Again, Neptune Oyster did not disappoint. Oysters were amazingly fresh. No fishy lingering tastes but a taste of the ocean instead. I also had a chance to try the giant shrimp cocktail (3.50 each) which was ok. I would rather spend on another oyster next time. Most importantly, this time round, I tried the lobster roll, and it was simply delicious. You can choose to have it prepared warm (with melted butter) or cold (with mayo). I chose the former and each bite was a bite of heavenly goodness. The price tag of 27 may seem daunting at first but once you see the amount of lobster that's served, you'll agree it's worth every penny. The lobster roll is served with a bed of piping hot fries which were good too. Neptune Oyster is a must go and don't be put off by the 3 or 4 dollar signs. For a fresh seafood place, this place isn't overpriced at all. Prices are reasonable and quality is exceedingly good.

Reviews.Author: Michele H.
Reviews.Content: I could spend a paycheck here on oysters.You will not find fresher seafood in Boston.  I came on a cold day, lucky enough to steal a stool at the bar.  The oysters tasted as clean as the new snow falling outside.  It tasted the like a mermaid breathing the ocean. I left $60 poorer, but then again, here I am five years later still thinking about the moment that made me fall in love with oysters.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer T.
Reviews.Content: *Wellfleet oysters (smooth, not too salty, little sweet); Katama Bay oyster (sooo salty!! This was the bartender's favorite and I don't get it haha. All I could taste was how salty it was, definitely my least favorite); Pleasant bay oyster; Westport oyster; Kumomoto oyster (omg yes!!!!!!!! cute little oyster that packs a lot of flavor. it honestly does have a slight honeydew aftertaste which is so pleasant. I could definitely eat a lot of these if I wanted to; my favorite oyster I tried!)*cold lobster roll (the lobster chunks were huge and cooked nicely; there was an abundance of meat and too much for me. I got a little nauseous eating it. The bread was grilled and was great. The fries were a little too overdone and salty. I think it was a decent sandwich but not worth $27.)This establishment is cute. We sat at the bar and with my people watching, it seems to be a bunch of locals eating there consistently. Staff is friendly but our waiter/bartender seemed flighty and missed an order of oysters for us. The food was ok. I think it's overrated. It's a tiny spot with good oysters and that's about it. Don't think I would ever go back

Reviews.Author: Helen D.
Reviews.Content: They weren't lying - the BEST lobster rolls are found here. I went to Maine last year and I probably went to the wrong place but I wasn't impressed with the lobster rolls there. This, on the other hand, absolutely delicious!! They get 5 stars for the food but be warned, there are huge lines. The whole place only fits about 30 people. We left our name within 30 minutes of the restaurant opening, and there was a 2 hour wait! Now that I've had the lobster, I can say it is definitely worth it. The awesome part is that you can leave your phone number and they will actually call you when it's your turn, and they hold your spot! (Bf and I were hungry monsters eyeing 4 empty seats at the bar when we first put our names down). That means you are free to walk around and explore instead of standing by the door glaring at the happy patrons taking their time eating. I wish the ramen shops in NYC would do this too.We are both oyster noobs and I generally avoid them because I don't want any oyster-borne diseases. But we figured now's the time. There wasn't an extensive list but each oyster had a description of the salt content, size and taste. We each tried one and liked it. I think this experience opened the door for me to try other oysters, thanks Neptune!Now for the lobster rolls... We each got a hot buttered one and it was so. perfect. The rolls are overflowing with HUGE chunks of juicy lobster. This is what dreams are made of! It comes with a ton of perfect fries but I was too full to finish them. I can't wait to stop by the next time I'm in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Lulu W.
Reviews.Content: This one is the best seafood restaurant in Boston! The lobster roll is great! I like the hot lobster meat with warm butter inside. I feel satisfied with each bite. The fresh olyster bar is amazing! There are many choices in their olyster bar Manu, I tried some, and they all taste great! Very fresh! The waiter told me Some are shipped from MA, some from  connecticut. I like them all. A highly recommended place. One tip, avoid the rush hour, they never accept reservation, have to wait for nearly two hrs to get in for dinner. But worth the time!

Reviews.Author: Mital P.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Long waits, but amazing food. My first couple times here had a wait of 1-2 hours since I came on a weekend around lunch time, but there was no wait at 3pm on a Tuesday (go figure...). If there's a wait, put your name down and grab a drink at a nearby bar. If you're doing the freedom trail, put your name on the list BEFORE you get the Paul Revere's house and then finish the trail.The lobster roll, hot with butter, is a given. I'm not a huge fan of the bun, which is a bit too fluffy and lacking in flavor for my liking, but let's be honest... The roll is all about the lobster... Which is divine. I always get an assortment of oysters from the raw bar. They never disappoint.I'm 3 for 3 on visiting this place when I come to Boston. That track record is not going to change.

Reviews.Author: Fred M.
Reviews.Content: Long wait, tiny space, close quarters, almost communal tables, yet still it's almost a four star. Excellent fresh seafood a bit different from the norm separates it. Reminds me of Swan Oyster Depot in San Francisco.You come to the restaurant, give them your telephone number and they tell you how long you'll need to wait. We came at 3:00 on a weekday afternoon, thinking we'd get right in and were told it would be a 2 1/2 hour wait. There's no place to park, the closest place to have a drink while waiting is 3-4 blocks away but walking around the North End is a lot of fun. They called in just 2 hours.We started with wonderful blood orange bellinis. We then chose four each of 6 of the 12 kinds of oysters they offered. They were served with a light red sauce and a briny clear sauce plus fresh lemon, just enough to compliment but not overwhelm the fresh oysters. We had an amazing bowl of steamed mussels in a curry cashew wine reduction. Make sure you ask for bread to enjoy every drop of the sublime liquid.Their fried clams were without doubt the best I've ever had, hands down.We wanted their clam chowder but forgot to order it.We shared our entrees of fresh halibut, warm lobster roll with fantastic fresh cut fries, seared scallops and cold lobster roll. Every bite was terrific.The food was a 5, the convenience and atmosphere a 2, the wait and parking a 1. I was undecided between 3 stars because I am used to valet parking, reservations, warm comfortable atmosphere and the trappings that we expect at these prices. I also was tempted to give it 5 because the food was fantastic, fresh and not overly fussy. Decide for yourself, it's worth doing once...... Or maybe more than once. I really should try the clam chowder to be thorough.

Reviews.Author: Erik O.
Reviews.Content: Great food and the wait isn't bad if you come in a small group at the right time. My wife and I showed up and put our name on the list at 4:45 and got the call at about 5:40. I had some oysters, a shrimp (they are sold individually), the yellowfin tuna, the hamachi ceviche, and the Neptune Burger. It's a lot, I know, but I got the impression that the raw fish wasn't going to do the trick. I was wrong. The oysters were good and the descriptions were right on the mark. The shrimp was nothing special, and the price was high, so... The tuna was amazing. It's a tuna tartare and the seasoning is beautiful. The hamachi also had great flavor and was a larger portion than I expected. Between the fish and the stuff on top, you get a really good mix of flavors. The Neptune Burger was amazing. Easily one of the best burgers I've ever had. The flavor was so rich and you got a great amount of flavor from the beef itself. I was blown away from the first bite. I should have stopped halfway through, but it was so good I couldn't stop. The reason they lost a star is because of the clam chowder that my wife had. They warn that it's brother than most New England clam chowders, and the thickness of the soup supported that, but the problem was a lack of flavor. It was just bland. They don't put salt and pepper out, so there's no way to remedy the problem. Based on this, I cannot recommend the clam chowder. Other than that, the waitstaff was friendly, the bartender gave a good beer recommendation, and the food arrived in a timely manner, so all else was in order. All in all, an amazing dinner with one blemish, although it was on a dish that is iconic to this town.

Reviews.Author: Ran H.
Reviews.Content: I had my first lobster roll here and I really doubt there's any better!!! This is one of the few places that make warm lobster rolls (don't really like cold lobster..). We came in and put our names down and phone number. You can explore the north end while you wait for their call. Our wait was about 2 hours. The oysters were good too! Definitely give the warm lobster roll a try. The place is tight so large groups will probably have to wait quite a bit longer but there's lots to explore in the area!

Reviews.Author: Evelina P.
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews indicate, be prepared to wait for a while. Arrived to Neptune expecting this however what I thought would be 1-2 hours turned out to be close to 3 hours. We put our names down on the list and walked around the city waiting for the call. Lots to see in the area so the wait doesn't seems so bad unless your already starving like my party was. The front end seemed disorganized but I disregarded this as the employee was new- we've all been there at one point in time. We got seated at the bar towards the back of the restaurant which was nice away from the bustle of the front restaurant. Seating is for about 40-45 diners which explains the long waits!The food was divine- the best seafood I've ever tried!! Our table started with oysters. We were given a card with the oyster offerings for the day describing the flavours and origin- helpful for those who are not well versed with oysters. While waiting, the oysters were shucked in front of us. Next, was the Clam Chowder. I am surprised more people haven't reviewed it/order it. Creamy and velvety with generous chunks of clams. Last but not least, a Lobster Roll had to be ordered. Buttery goodness dripping out of a sweet soft bun served warm with a side of fries. The fries were good but nothing to rave about. All in all our table agreed that the oysters and clam chowder were the meal highlights.Service was great. Seated at the bar, the owner was serving us for the night. Friendly, he explained the process of catching the seafood for the day and recommended some amazing local beers to try. The food was also paced well. As soon as one dish was finished the other was brought out.Beer and wine are the only offerings for alcohol.When recommending this place to friends and family with fair warning of the wait time, I am always greeted with shock that i would wait that long for a table. Would I visit again? YES!

Reviews.Author: Sophie H.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait.  Best lobster rolls and clam chowder in Boston. They tie with B&G for oysters.  Service is great and it is always a good experience.

Reviews.Author: Mo F.
Reviews.Content: The warm lobster roll was perfection.  Enormous chunks of lobster, light bread that soaked up just the right amount of butter, the whole thing glistening like some culinary jewel.  As much as I respect anyone who orders a salad instead of fries to accompany this sandwich, it would be a huge mistake to replace Neptune's perfectly crisp and salty mound of fries with roughage.  Just go whole-hog and get the fries.  You will not regret it.Also, the Johnnycake was one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten.  A perfect combination of crisp and goey, salty and sweet, fishy and ...corny.  Make sure you eat it.Add to that a few oysters and a glass of Reisling, and it was totally worth the two-hour wait from 1:30 to 3:30.

Reviews.Author: Christina X.
Reviews.Content: Oysters, good! Clams, good! Lobster roll, good! Clam chowder, good! And we got lucky and only waited 10 minutes :) But if I had to wait, it's definitely worth it!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: The line here before it opens is insane.  We got there about 15-20 minutes before the lunchtime open and we BARELY made it in the first round.  That is my one piece of advice to you, go and stand in line before it opens or you will be standing in line waiting for people to finish their delicious meals while your grumble with hunger.The seating area of the restaurant is small, but they make the most of it, seating multiple parties at table if needed, and it is always needed.  The feel is perfect for Boston: fresh and cool but suble and homey.I got the clam chowder and the lobster roll.YUM.As all the other reviews said, I concur with it all.A MUST TRY in boston!

Reviews.Author: Scooter L.
Reviews.Content: We arrived in town around 3:30pm and immediately started asking everyone where they would go for a Lobster Roll.  Consensus pick by everyone was Neptune Oyster.  Can this be true?  The name is not Neptune Lobster but Neptune Oyster as the place specializes in oysters!  An oyster place for lobster?So after checking into the hotel, where the front desk clerk also recommended Neptune Oyster, we headed to the restaurant.  We walk in at 5pm and the small place is packed.  The Waiter/Maitre'd tells us that the wait is 30 minutes and to give him a  phone number to call.  So we head back out and tour Little Italy where we identify culinary targets for the rest of the week.  We identify Bova, a no frills bakery with all types of desserts that is open 24/7.  Wow...people need sweets around the clock???  Well, gotta try this place after dinner.  A half our later around 5:30pm...our table is ready.A dozen oysters for starters (large list with detailed description as to size, brininess, origin, nationality, mother place of birth, father place of birth....JK...but they do have a descriptive list).  This place is definitely Neptune Oyster - the name fits!  We move on to Octopus Salad (get this too), Ahi Tuna Carpaccio (get this too), and the Lobster Roll in a buttered roll (lots of Lobster - falling out of the buttered bun - get this too!).We were definitely happy with the recommendations from all.  The place should be called "Neptune Seafood" as they do everything well!  Service was also attentive as the entire staff rotated through the restaurant - doing everything - taking orders, serving plates, clearing tables, and setting up for the next "to-be" happy customer.A definite foodie destination....

Reviews.Author: Amanda L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best lobster roll in the country. Hot lobster with drawn butter on a toasted roll that soaks in all of the butter. Yum! The lobster meat is so tender and for $27 you get a lot - they sure don't skimp out on the portion sizes. I got mine with the side salad: bib lettuce with almonds, oil, and some salty, amazing seasoning. This meal never disappoints. My boyfriend and I shared oysters to start and they were all so good, briny and fresh. Sit at the bar and you can watch them shuck the oysters in front of you - fun! The only thing that stinks about this place is that it is so small so there is always a long wait. Get there early and put your name in. We went around 6 on a Friday and were told it would be a 2 hour wait. Luckily, there's plenty to do nearby in the historic North End, but this place is definitely worth the wait. The food is amazing, it's a quaint scene and service is impeccable - ask Ann at the bar for wine recommendations - she really hit the nail on the head for my boyfriend and me.Great food! Great service! I'll be back again and again and again!

Reviews.Author: Scott P.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  This place is an experience!You might be put off by the very cramped interior or the wait that most likely 'awaits' you.  I suggest you plan your evening here either really early, or really late, or with the in mind that it's a small, tightly packed place that you are probably going to have to wait 30 minutes for otherwise.Is it worth the wait?  YES.  I've been to Boston 4-5 times and usually visit a seafood place at least a couple times on each visit, and I have to say this ranks as the highest.  If you want to skip the fluff and go right for the throat of this place, you have to do the cioppino.  Full of seafood, seafood, and more seafood, all the size of your head, in a slightly spice broth with rice in the bottom.... and this wasn't even my dish.  But I got to try it, and if I ever go back, that will be mine.  I had the scallops, all seared perfectly, on a bed of brussel sprouts - I don't even much like sprouts but there wasn't a lick of food left on my plate when done.  We also ordered oysters, several varieties, shrimp, and - pardon me for not remembering the name of this, but it was a shredded crab meat salad dish - was just a-mazing.  I'd like to also, on a personal note, mention that someone that was there on the same night 20 minutes prior to sitting down, posted a one star, about the service.  The night that we were there (4/6)they were down a server and very busy, but our waitstaff was fantastic - nice, funny, and outside of being a little late with our drinks I didn't find a reason not to rate it 4 stars at least.  We met the manager who was also pleasant.  I would take a trip back to Boston just so I might be fortunate to visit this place again.  The evening goes up there, for me personally, and everyone that was at our table, in the out of this world experience col

Reviews.Author: Cici A.
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best lobster roll i've ever had. I opted for the warm lobster roll with butter rather than the cold one with mayo. We came on a rainy Tuesday afternoon at 2:30 pm and were seated right away.

Reviews.Author: Barry W.
Reviews.Content: It's been four or so years since I last posted about Neptune.  And, Neptune itself will be ten years old later this year.The most amazing thing I can say is not too say more about the food, the friendly, knowledgable service and the simple sophistication of the menu than I did previously.So why this update?  Because nothing has changed.One of the very toughest things to do in the restaurant business is achieve consistency and staying power.  Staff turnover.  Fickle or unreliable suppliers.  Some bad press. Difficult landlords. The list goes on.  We all know that most restaurants fail within a couple of years.Neptune won't just cross the ten year mark this November; they'll blow right through it, as strong and as deservedly popular as ever.The lines are still ridiculously long.  On a sunny, spring, non-holiday weekday, the party of two at the back of the line when they open at 11:30 has a 90-minute to two hour wait. And they're not fools.  It's worth it.Neptune is a real rarity.  The best oyster/seafood bar in a city known for (but not really deserving of) recognition of its seafood.  In the North End, Neptune is still surrounded by Italian seafood joints that rate between awful and mediocre and cater to tourists.I hope the Globe or Boston Magazine do a story on Neptune for the 10th.  Not with the zillionth description of the fabulous oysters, delicious cioppino, awesome fried clams or truly best lobster roll.  No, a story about the history and the people who've made Neptune what it has always been, all decade long. A friendly, welcoming place with such class, sophistication, quality and humility. The most amazing thing now, ten years later, is that no restaurant owner elsewhere in the North End seems to have been inspired by the unending lines to learn from what these guys are doing.Bravo, Neptune! May you thrive for another ten, or fifty, years.

Reviews.Author: Joyce A.
Reviews.Content: It took me two years of trips to Boston to finally make it inside, on a freezing cold day.A phone call to the place tells you they do NOT take reservations, so coming here you must either be prepared to wait or give up altogether. We lucked out, walked in & got a place at the bar. I noticed, however that just minutes after our party of 3  were seated, a group of 6 diners came in and THEY had a table reserved! So what gives, Neptune?But I digress from the most important part/s: the food! the oysters! The service!Service: Glad I got one of the gentlemen (Mako) behind the counter. His female counterpart seemed just too exasperated to repeat the menu offering (NOT described on the printed menu other than Triton Plateau or Neptune Plateau). Yes, I was happy to leave him a substantial tip too!Favorites:Lobster cocktail : your are served the meat of an entire lobster, at the very least, dressed lightly with olive oi, spare seasoning and pinch of some parsley - absolutely satisfying, tender and briny, fresh. No Mayonnaise or cocktail sauce at all - PERFECT!Crudo of tilefish : served in a ring, chopped pieces of white fleshed fish, reminiscent of Hawaiian Poke but without any added seaweed or chilies - fresh, clean, buttery, RAW!Lobster roll, in butter, served on very yummy bread and french fries on the side. Oysters! Oysters! Oysters!there were so many varieties offered, mostly from Massachusetts, Rhode Island, some from Washington state and even Vancouver BC. Had a sample from a dozen different varieties: best for me  Island Creek and Basket Island.Had them raw, sprinkled with a little bit of lemon and horseradish (served on the side). Also available is a vinegar/diced shallot dip (Mignonette) . Splurge: got a bottle of Prosecco to go with it!Shout out to the lady behind the counter who actually shucks ALL the oyster orders: She did such an excellent job, not a single bad oyster, or piece of shell in any that I ate. Hope I get as lucky next time I'm in Bostonia!

Reviews.Author: Genny S.
Reviews.Content: For food, this place gets a 5.. As for service.. Bad. Really bad. The service staff is great! However, the owner was horrible. As a chef, I could tell he was the owner.. You just can sense it by their attitude/way they carry themselves. So I thought, great! Well... This is where I was wrong!! He was the worst.. I had to beg for water 2x, he let our oysters sit on the counter.. 2 feet from us.. Read the ticket.. And left them there. The waitress came by 5 min later.. Read the ticket and handed it to us. We were siting at the bar.. And if you've been here.. It's not that big!! And he was right in front of us!We ordered dinner, he took my order, but we had to flag him down to take my co-workers order.. Mind you.. We were both there.. Waiting with menus. When it came time to pay the bill.. What a nightmare.. He took forever. My co-worker said, "well.. I guess that's why he's the bartender." And I replied, "no, because it didn't look like he cared about tips like most bar staff do.. This guy.. Is the owner." Sure enough.. I was correct.. And he was a major di*khole.Food was great, some of the most tender octopus I've ever eaten, and I've been to 30% of the world in traveling, cooking, and eating. If you wanted people to know you're the owner, wear a shirt or tag.. Don't treat your patrons poorly

Reviews.Author: Elica Y.
