Reviews.Content: AMAZING oysters and FANTASTIC lobster rolls. Every time someone visits me in Boston, I can never forget to take them to Neptune's Oyster and no one has ever had a bad experience yet. This is a SMALL restaurant located in the North End and unfortunately does not take any reservations. I highly recommend coming with a small party or else you will be waiting for a while to get seated. Food wise you can't go wrong. Everything here is great. 1. I have gotten the seafood tower, which is literally a tower of seafood. A seafood lover's heaven. 2. Oysters are extremely fresh. Order a dozen and try all the different kinds of oysters. 3. The lobster roll - an all time favorite. I always order this lobster roll hot with lots of melted butter. YUM! For only $25, they hook the lobster up! My boyfriend and I were astounded by the amount of lobster they give you. Nevertheless, we both devoured it up because it was so damn good.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie F.
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place for seafood. Yes, there will be an expected wait if you want to dine here (as they do not take reservations). You will have to show up and place your name on a waiting list and wait to be called when your table is ready.If you haven't had a lobster roll, this is a good place to get either hot or cold options. However, other dishes worth noting are their daily specials, whole bronzino, seared yellow fin tuna, and scallops Also, try their neptunes on piggyback and johnnycake for appetizers. These have consistently remained on their periodically changing menu.

Reviews.Author: Azizi k.
Reviews.Content: * Tourist Trap Not as great as the hype (sorry Neptune oyster) *  Hot lobster was just ok * Fried Clams were good * wine suggestions were not great * Waiters are too busy for quality service * overpriced, I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Author: Elisa C.
Reviews.Content: Rule 1: Don't underestimate a restaurant on Yelp with 4.5 stars and almost 2,000 reviews.Rule 2: Be prepared to wait (aka a line down the block one hour before they open on a chilly Saturday morning).Rule 3: Don't bring a big group. Favorites only. (This place barely fits 35-40 uncomfortably.)Rule 4: Don't try to budget this meal.Rule 5: Come HUNGRY. It's worth the investment.--Though the oysters didn't wow me - the oysters at the farmer's market down the street were much fresher - the food here is phenomenal. The ciopinno, the lobster roll, the clam chowder, your everyday seafood favorites prepared for all my noble epicureans out there. Come hungry. Leave happy. No regrets.

Reviews.Author: Jayne C.
Reviews.Content: Went here with a coworker and we had to wait 2+ hours for a table. Apparently, that's not as long as the wait gets! When we were being seated, we overheard the hostess tell another party the current line was 3+ hours! Now, let's get down to business and talk about the food.To me, lobster roll is overhyped. Guys, it's lobster in a roll... So what? It's good but it's not worth a 2+ hour wait! Fortunately, what is worth it is everything else.Raw oysters. Raw clams. Salty, mineraly, briny deliciousness. Each with their own unique flavor and texture. It's a huge mistake to overlook these little babies! The Cioppino. Mouth watering. The seafood is perfection... not rubbery and over cooked. The broth.. oh my god, the broth. I can still remember it. *sigh*The Buttermilk Johnny Pancake... words cannot describe how good this dish is. You're an idiot, if you don't order it. It's sweet, salty, creamy, crisp. It's a beautiful orchestra of textures and tastes in a deceptively plain, pancake. Normally, I don't wait long at restaurants. I'm not a snob. I just don't have the patience! If I'm hungry, I'm hungry! That being said, I will wait at Neptune just for their Johnny Pancake. It's that good.

Reviews.Author: Robert M.
Reviews.Content: My quest for the best Lobster Roll is over. Excellent but pricey and worth every cent. Your choice of mayo or butter, (go with the butter), and served with very tasty fries. Roll is toasted perfectly and tried some raw clams and oysters as well that were tasty and fresh.Tiny with limited seating but the staff were great.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W.
Reviews.Content: I died and went to lobster roll heaven. Neptune Oyster House's lobster roll consistently shows up on best-of lists and for good reason, it's beyond belief. Order the hot and buttered roll and submit to the wonder that is responsible for 3+ hour waits at times.The restaurant itself is tiny and gets crowded early. Be prepared to wait, and it can be quite a long wait at that. Your whole party must be there to be seated, and they don't take reservations. I arrived a little before 6 on a Wednesday evening before the height of tourist season really kicked in and was luckily able to snag what I believe we're the 3 last open seats. You will be sitting close and cozy with your neighbors, it is that sort of establishment.As aforementioned, you can't go wrong with the lobster roll, hot with butter. Large chunks of lobster spilling out of the roll, no skimping here! Served with perfectly seasoned fries that seem to magically disappear even if you tell yourself you're only going to have a couple. Oysters are fresh and excellent, they have a selection of about half a dozen types it seems. Great wine list, we ordered a bottle of Pinot noir. Prices are up there, but it's what is to be expected for high quality seafood in high demand, they charge it and people will pay.  Allow yourself the splurge and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: A friend of a friend wanted to come here for a late lunch one day, and so we all stopped by here. The first thing I noticed was that it was absolutely bustling! That was a good sign, though I must note that this restaurant is like every other restaurant in the North End: small. We ended up kind of sharing a table at the booth in the back, but it wasn't a huge deal.Most of us ended getting the lobster roll. While it's definitely a little pricey, you get probably a good pound of lobster meat. I think they put an entire lobster into each roll. And! It is delicious! I could probably have saved half of or for lunch the next day, but I just couldn't resist finishing the whole thing. It was so good, I demolished the lobster roll in record time! One of my friends also got two oysters, and she thought they were really good. They offer oysters from all around, and you could eat an oyster from Rhode Island, or Massachusetts, and I think they even had one from California!The service was really good! They were super attentive, great about refilling our water and clearing off the tables. The service, combined with the food gives makes this a 5 star place. Yes, it's a little crowded. Yes, it can get a little boisterous. However, I consider these traits part of the charm of eating in the North End. And who knows...maybe at the end of your meal, you'll have made friends with the people sitting next to you.All in all, this was a great experience. The food was great and the service was great. It is a little pricey, but I would still say that it's worth it. At the very least, it's worth trying once.

Reviews.Author: Maximillian M.
Reviews.Content: Flying solo means you get seated right away at the counter. Had a snack of a half dozen local oysters and a Harpoon seasonal beer. Very nice. Will come back someday to try an entree.

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: It seems like most of the reviews start like this so I'll do the same - our wait time was 3 hours on a Friday night (starting around 6PM). Yikes!  Come early and put your name down and at least they're kind enough to call you when a spot opens up.  We went to a different bar for a bit and came back hungry.  The end result was quite solid (although I'm unsure how my patience would fare in future visits).  When you come into Neptune Oyster, you'll discover why the wait time is so long.  The restaurant is pretty tight and small so make sure you're ready to rub shoulders with your friends and neighbors.  One of the great things about Neptune is that they have a great wine list and a tasty one at that.  We had the Vera bottle for about $30 which wasn't too shabby.  As their name also suggests, they also have a good amount of raw seafood.  We had three of the oysters (really can't name them - they all were quite good though) as a checklist is given to you to (prices ranged from $2-$8).  Service was good too and attentive.  Then came the main target - the lobster roll.  I got the buttery iteration.  Let me tell you - it was BUTTERY - not the point of disgust but to the point where I was delighted and fearful for how unhealthy/tasty it was.  The lobster was also quite delicious and fresh and the bread was pretty good (although you can literally taste how soggy it was due to the butter).  It rivals the Barking Crab as one of my favorite lobster rolls in town.  Cost-wise, you'll be set back about $25.  Come early and you'll hopefully leave home happy is my concise review of Neptune Oyster.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey B.
Reviews.Content: I try to be stingy with my five-star ratings, but having lived in Cambridge for two years, Neptune Oyster is hands-down one of the two best restaurants in Boston (Giacomo's being the other).  You might raise your eyebrows at a $27 lobster roll, but if I told you you'd be paying for the best lobster roll you'll ever have in your life, would you feel differently?  As is typical with many popular North End establishments, the restaurant is tiny, and you should be prepared to put your name down and come back in a few hours to be seated.  The hostess will give you a call when your table is ready, so you can walk around town or grab a drink elsewhere while you wait.Start with a round of oysters -- the selection is excellent and spans both coasts.  But if you try one thing at Neptune, it better be the lobster roll.  Both the warm (with butter) and cold (with mayo) versions are fantastic, but my personal preference is the latter.  I'm a big fan of lobster rolls, so take it from me when I say that Neptune's version has no equal, either in Boston or elsewhere.If I had one disappointment with this place, it would be the clam chowder, which was only so-so and more watery than creamy.  Nevertheless, Neptune Oyster gets five stars without hesitation in my book!

Reviews.Author: Brian J.
Reviews.Content: Small hole in the way but the reputation is definetly here.  Lobster roll and oysters really satisfied me.  I felt like I ate a whole lobster.  This is a must stop if you're in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Rowena M.
Reviews.Content: Imagine my excitement when I didn't see a line outside this restaurant on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.  We get in and was told that the wait would be an hour and 45 minutes?  Huh?!  But there are tables available right now?  Didn't matter, you had to put your name on the list and you get called back when your table is ready.  So we walked around and returned after an hour and 45 minutes (yes, it actually took that long for our table to be ready) and we ordered several types of oysters, clams, and the giant shrimp cocktail.  With oysters as  part of the restaurant's name, I would have expected this to be their specialty.  Yes, they had a good variety and yes they were fresh, but it's just hard to enjoy oysters when they're not cleaned well and when there's still a lot of grit that gets between my slurping action and the oyster itself.  We found the clam chowder to be tasteful but was a tad too soupy with the potatoes on the under-done side.  Then came the lobster rolls which I anticipated with the same gusto as my first born.  Let's just say that I was underwhelmed.  While there were lots of succulent lobster meat, one would think the bread should be of higher quality so it doesn't completely fall apart when you pick up the sandwich.  The saving grace of this place is its service.  We sat behind the counter and was pleasantly served by people who had a palpable sense of camaraderie.  I wonder if we would have been more forgiving of the less than stellar choices we made if the wait hadn't been so long.  Hard to know because I can't imagine this would be on my list on my next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Jerry C.
Reviews.Content: Ok ok, u are all aware of my willingness to bash bad places... But this one was very very good. could not sample everything of course but my lobster roll was good and a generous amount of lobster meat.  This place is not cheap by the way:). Waitress and hostess were great and know how to treat customers.  however,,,,,, while a fine restaurant indeed, there are plenty of other similar places nearby that assuredly serve good oysters and such as we'll.  Unless u are right at the beginning of the Neptune line, your wait will be around an hour.  the wife had a tasty Caesar salad with anchovies (it was essentially a big piece of lettuce cut in half lengthwise).  I commented to the gal next to me "I came all the way from Calif. and the wife orders a head of lettuce for $16:).  But it was indeed tasty/)

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: Boston No. 1 oysters bar! The sea food they use seems just being caught by a few minutes, it is the most fresh sea food I ever had in restaurants. The Service and environment are perfect, the waiters can give you useful advices for your order, like which kinds of oysters are good in current season, and what wine and oyster combination is worth to try. This is an amazing experience for a gourmet.

Reviews.Author: Jax V.
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere: Ya better love your neighbor, side by side close knit, which isn't a bad thing.Food: I loved the oysters!!! A fresh, wet, mouthful!!!Companion said the Lobster Roll didn't meet his expectations.Entrees were ok.It was a great night out, but the company made it perfect!more later...

Reviews.Author: Sean B.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic oysters and an AMAZING hot lobster roll! Must go to place in Boston, despite the wait and cramped quarters. Go...now! Thank me later. Enough said!

Reviews.Author: Amir N.
Reviews.Content: Never have I waited 2.5 hours for food but I did this time because of the outrageous reviews!!Small place serving fresh seafood. Beer and wine only.Great service, had great oysters, some of the best tuna I've ever had and the hot lobster roll!!

Reviews.Author: Nazreena J.
Reviews.Content: 1800+ reviews and 4.5 stars, says it all.  If you're looking for a delicious lobster roll, stop searching because it is here at Neptune Oyster.  During my two year stint in Boston as a grad student, I took EVERY SINGLE visitor I had to dinner here.  After moving back to Southern California, I realize how amazing those lobster rolls are and how hard they will be to duplicate.  I've tried a couple in LA, but nothing comes close.Man, I miss this place...can't wait to visit beantown, just to make a stop at Neptune Oyster!

Reviews.Author: Jazzy T.
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was ok. Why too over hyped. This was my first time trying a lobster roll and it was just ok. I'd much rather have a whole lobster but they only have tht on Saturdays which sucks. I came on a Tuesdays and the wait was an hour! It wasn't horrible though bc I went to the sweets shop next door and hangout there and tried some delicious treats (the brownie n dark almond bark). Good thing was we got seated early cause I guess a lot of people had gone to eat elsewhere. Don't go here unless ur ok with people being in ur personal space. I could barely move without running over somebody

Reviews.Author: Andrea B.
Reviews.Content: I kissed a lobster roll and I liked it.Yes I'm serious.No I'm not crazy. Go to Neptune Oyster and try one and you'll do the same thing!Not to be redundant, since I know that 1700+ reviews have already said this, but if you're in Boston and want really, REALLY fresh lobster, this is the place to go. Get it cold with mayo, or hot with butter, you can't go wrong. You know how sometimes you order a lobster roll, and you get microscopic pieces of lobster and a whole lot of mayo to attempt to make up for it? Well, put your microscope away, because you won't need it here! My roll had tons and tons of huge, succulent pieces of lobster. So good! Too good. You won't shed a single tear about the $27 price tag, because it's worth every single penny.A few words to the wise: They don't take reservations. The restaurant is teeny tiny. Get here early, and on a weekday if you can, in order to avoid massive wait times (read: hours!). I came by at noon on a Tuesday, and there was no wait whatsoever for two seats at the bar!I'll most definitely be back, because a little bird (hi Mike G!) told me they have fantastic fish tacos... and if they're anywhere near as good as that ol' lobster roll, I'll probably kiss them too.

Reviews.Author: Sarah G.
Reviews.Content: Getting here at 5:30pm on a Tuesday and we barely got our party of 5 a table! The wait here is notorious, because this seafood haven is pretty small inside, and you will pay a pretty penny to eat here as well, but hands down that scallop dish with duck confit and blue cheese and mini brussel sprouts and those johnny cakes with caviar and smoke trout made it worth the $84 price tag per person with wine. So really not too bad of a price when you consider you are eating high class seafood!So those were my two fav dishes, we also got the fried ipswich clams with their house made tarter sauce which had a nice layer of fry on them but weren't overly battered and heavy, the sardines special which came with a pesto and fried egg and this dish was probably not my fav and not sure you can call that pesto when i tasted nothing like pesto, the lobster roll was packed with lobster and it had just a light amount of mayo and it was more peppery than lobster rolls I've had before but that was great and the grilled bread was great too, and the cioppino which I also thought was just so so to be honest even with the saffron rice. Good thing those scallops hurt me to share with the table because they simply were that amazing, and those johnny cakes just wow. I need to clearly buy caviar and smoked trout and try and replicate that ASAP! Oh and get some oysters too. They have so many kinds!!! And you know they will do them right here :-)

Reviews.Author: Cindy X.
Reviews.Content: Make sure to order lobster roll! So satisfying... The sweetness of the lobster and the roll are the perfect combination. I can still feel it in my mouth.I substitute my side fries with salad. The lettuce came as a whole which was really hard to eat.This restaurant is small and very busy through out tbe day so the service can be kinda slow.

Reviews.Author: Sherri C.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster was the best restaurant on my most recent trip to Boston. It definitely made a lasting impression!The wait is quite long, so make sure to put your name down early, and then leave to walk around the area (Mike's Pastry and Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall are close by). For our party of 7 it was about a 4 hour wait.The best thing at Neptune Oyster was their lobster roll. They packed the roll with so much lobster that it was overflowing. It was so warm and buttery! (We ordered a second round!) The fried clams were also a favorite of the group. I'm a huge fan of clam chowder, but their clam chowder was a bit too watery for my liking. Not creamy and chunky enough. :(But I'm pretty sure that the lobster roll was and still is the best lobster roll the 7 of us has ever had. We were all still talking about it weeks later. One of my friends is still chasing her Neptune Oyster lobster roll high... Haha!

Reviews.Author: Ruby C.
Reviews.Content: Showed up on a Thursday night around 5:15pm & there was no wait. Glanced at the menu but I already knew what I was going to get; the lobster roll in hot butter. The lobster roll was absolutely delicious; chunks of lobster in hot butter served on warm bread w/ a side of fries. Makes sense why this place won Boston's best lobster roll in 2013. At $27 the price is a bit steep. Pauli's a few doors down serves a lobster roll at $15 but it is served cold w/ mayo & simply doesn't compare to Neptune's. I had a few oysters; very fresh.The dinner wait progressively got longer.. By 5:45pm the wait for a group of 4 was more than 1hr. They do take your name & number down so you can get a drink nearby.Parking is limited - free 2hr street parking on Salem Street until 6pm; afterwards, it's permit parking. Strict parking rules; there were many parking tickets issued. If you plan on exploring North End, it's easier to park on one of the nearby parking structures; weekdays after 5pm & anytime weekend is a flat rate of $11.Definitely a place I'll need to come back to when I'm in Boston. So save up & come early to get your lobster roll!

Reviews.Author: Ron S.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were here for a late lunch. The hostess that sat us at the bar was very hospitable. The bar tender (female)- Shiner was NOT!Shiner was arrogant, less than helpful and did not convey a good impression for Neptune.We were sitting next to a "regular" who was clearly treated different the we "tourists".I had the clam strips which were over-priced. the home-made tartar sauce left much to be desired.My wife ordered some $3.00/each oysters. No cocktail sauce was offered and Neptune did not have saltine crackers to serve with them- bummer for such a small request.Bottom line- we will not return.We are tourists, with children in college in the state of Massachusetts.We travel here several times a year and will spend our dollars elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Deniz H.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  Very casual, cute atmosphere. Great sea food! worth the wait if you have to.The appetizers were great.  I remember eating a pancake topped with seafood, not exactly sure what it was called, and it does sound weird, but it was delicious!

Reviews.Author: Joanna W.
Reviews.Content: Ok everyone knows that their lobster rolls are good. But their oysters are like heaven in your mouth! It's smooth, juicy, fresh, the best ive ever had!

Reviews.Author: Lils Y.
Reviews.Content: Saturday lunch, waited about 25 minutes to be seated (waitress takes your #, calls you when there is an available table... meanwhile you get to stroll around a bit). LOBSTA Roll came with fries and a ton of lobster, so I understand why it is $27 for the meal. You can order this hot/buttery or cold. I wish the bread was toasted - b/c parts of it did get soggy from the lobster + butter. Definitely think this was good, but pairing the roll with a healthier alternative like salad would be a better choice (esp. b/c the roll is so filling itself).OYSTERS - about $2.70 to ~$3+ a pop, was very fresh. Waitstaff is very friendly too, but since the aisle is so tight, they may bump into your chair often. Good thing you'll be distracted by the lobsta goodness.

Reviews.Author: Julia M.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite seafood places in Boston. I highly recommend the Maine lobster roll served hot with butter. It will set you back $27, but it is one of the best (if not the best) lobster rolls that you will ever have. Plus, they aren't skimpy with the lobster, so you'll leave feeling full.As with many of the North End restaurants, Neptune Oyster is rather small & does not take reservations, so either arrive early or be ready to wait in line for over an hour.

Reviews.Author: Eva Y.
Reviews.Content: It's really small inside and there's always a wait here. Make sure you come in by 730pm if you want to be guaranteed a table. I came in here around 730/8pm on a Friday one time and the waitlist was so long that they couldn't add any more people to the list. Came here earlier the next time around and although they didn't kick us out this time, we still had to wait for an hour before we got seated. We ordered their clam chowder, oysters, lobster rolll, and their north end cioppino and they were delicious. The oysters were really fresh and i really liked their lobster roll. My boyfriend however thought it was too plain and buttery. My only complaint was that their fries that came with the lobster were way too salty.Will come back here soon!

Reviews.Author: Allison S.
Reviews.Content: We had the best oysters here!! So fresh and so delicious. They do a great job describing the subtle differences, which was super helpful for a novice like me. The lobster roll was fantastic too. Buttery chunks of yummy goodness. Only negative was the fries. I wish I listened to another review and substituted for the salad. They were soggy and not very good. Only drawbacks are the price (a little overpriced in my opinion) and the wait. We waited an hour 15 minutes on a Sunday afternoon around 1:45!! Yikes!!

Reviews.Author: Brett M.
Reviews.Content: My lady and I went here for a quick lunch the minute we arrived in Boston. Since we were saying at the Hilton in the financial district, we planned on spending the majority of our time in the North End. Neptune was calling our names. We ordered the crab bisque, clam chowder, and 6 oysters. Also, they have Guinness on draft and pour it well. The soup(s) were superb, a word that I refuse to ever use unless it's really damn good. Well, it was superb. As were the oysters and Guinness. Thank you Neptune and thank you girlfriend for paying for lunch. Service was A+ to boot. Why am I talking like this?

Reviews.Author: Courtney L.
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Loved.Before coming to Boston, I stumbled upon this place on Yelp and knew it was my must-eat in Boston. We came for Marathon weekend, so I knew the entire city would be slammed, but I was prepared for a wait. We arrived around noon on Saturday and completely lucked out! An hour wait! :) I gave the hostess my number and we got the chance to peruse Mike's Pastry and grab a couple brews at Goody Glover's before we got the call. When we returned, we got a seat right by the door. This place is tiny, but so full of Boston charm! We did get a kick out of people coming in, seeing no line, and then thinking there was no wait only to get totally blindsided when they find out the wait was now up to 3 hours :) Ha! So happy that we planned ahead! I knew before we sat down that I wanted that lobster roll. Hot and buttered. We decided to share it along with some a la carte shrimp cocktail, crab claw, wine and the New England Clam Chowder. The shrimp was very good. So fresh tasting! The crab claw I was less enthused over. It was kinda hard to eat, but I still really enjoyed the flavor. The clam chowder was VERY good. The broth was thin, which was surprisingly because I love thick, chunky chowder, but it was SO flavorful. The clams were huge and plentiful... we basically licked the bowl. Our first NE chowder experience was a special one ;) However, it was quickly forgotten once that lobster roll came out. Paired with fries, the sandwich looked small, but looks are so deceiving. The bun it was served on was mostly gutted so it was PACKED with lobster instead. And not just any lobster... this was warm and fresh... it was buttered, oh it was buttered, but not in a 'dunked' or 'globbed' way.. it certainly wasn't too much or too greasy. Even though we shared the sandwich, it was still a good portion.. the best being the middle bites where the bread was soggiest... YUM. I told the husband not to resuscitate me if I choked on the lobster roll. Gone too soon, maybe, but doing what I love: eating Neptune Oyster lobster roll. I will come back here each time I am in Boston. Fantastic food! Pricey, but not unreasonable. Great service and the North End is such a fantastic area to explore!

Reviews.Author: Candy F.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll and jonnycake all the best!!Good place to go!!

Reviews.Author: Dessi V.
Reviews.Content: There are so many reviews written about this restaurant already and I'm wondering what else can I say that is not mentioned by the yelpers. Well, the beauty of Yelp is there are always recent reviews we can use as a reference that a place is still as good as originally rated. This is definitely the case for Neptune Oyster, I can affirm the food is absolutely delicious. I have to start with the oysters, first of all I enjoyed the little paper provided by our hostess that had a list of all the oysters available from the raw bar with description of their specific tastes, where you can mark how many you want of each. Second they really know how to shuck oysters in this restaurant and third the quality of the oysters is amazing. Then comes the lobster roll, OMG, ordered the hot version with butter.  As lobster roll is served with fries I usually ignore the bun. Didn't work this way, the butter from the lobster soaked in the bread and we ended up eating the bun after everything else in the dish was cleaned up, simply because it was yum. The Neptune Caesar salad was tasty, the salad freak in me disapproved the whole lettuce leafs, I prefer them cut, but still this is a delicious bunny dish (if bunnies eat anchovies). Wine list is strong, there was no chardonnay by the glass, but we were served some regardless. Wait time time was 20 minutes on Friday, 5pm, but people coming after us were told they can be seated after one hour.  Neptune Oyster is a pricy dinner option, but is all worth it. I'm coming back next time I travel to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Kim Y.
Reviews.Content: Pretty much a general consensus that the food here is amazing and well worth the wait! The oysters are so fresh, it's almost as if they just caught them out of the ocean themselves! Lobster rolls, the mussels, the Johnny cake, all delish!Only reason I couldn't give 5 stars is the fact they don't take RSVPs! That I don't understand. It would be more convenient then having to try and kill 2+ hours in the north end or worrying if somebody cut you in line or if they're going to call you if a table is ready! They need a better system

Reviews.Author: Michele P.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters I've ever had!  We got there 30 min before opening, so we were seated right away!  We had oysters, lobster roll (warm), and crab bisque.  All were excellent!  Well worth the wait, and every bit as good as people say!!

Reviews.Author: Amanda S.
Reviews.Content: The Lobster Roll is heavenly! The dressing on the greens salad is so good too. My guy had the hamachi ceviche and loved it. Very very good. I will revisit again!

Reviews.Author: Jisu P.
Reviews.Content: The only place I don't mind waiting in a line for the BEST LOBSTER ROLL EVER.

Reviews.Author: Juan F.
Reviews.Content: Been wanting to come here as soon as I moved to Boston almost 2 years ago. I finally got the chance to check this place out!! The restaurant is tiny... so if you come here during prime time lunch or dinner hours expect to wait at least an hour! Luckily, when we got here we just avoided the line. There was one open table to seat us and after that I kept hearing the waiter say "45min-1hr wait" for the people who came right after us.So we ordered a bunch of different types of oysters and clams as well as the Hot Lobster Roll. Surprisingly, our raw stuff took so long to come out.... It took about 30 minutes for the oysters and clams to get to our table. Raw food shouldn't take this long to be served!!! Our waiter probably saw our frustrated and hungry faces and noticed that our raw bar food had yet to be served. He quickly gave us a free appetizer. It was Hamachi Sashimi served with avocado spread. It was delicious and made me hungrier!The raw items were FINALLY served to us and were quickly devoured. Clams were meaty, juicy, and sweet and oysters were sweet and creamy. They were super fresh! Definitely worth trying even though they are super expensive.The hot lobster rolls were amazing. I did NOT expect SO MUCH LOBSTER. Usually, places skim on the lobster when making a roll by mixing it with a bunch of mayo and completely chopping the lobsters until you cannot tell whether or not its lobster that you're eating. Not this place! There was big ass lobster chunks perfectly placed in between a slightly grilled bun. All of that is coated with melted butter and served with some amazing fries. $25 well spent!.

Reviews.Author: Michelle A.
Reviews.Content: Clearly, you already know there is a long wait.  For us, it was two and a half hours that we spent exploring the neighborhood and eating appetizer/dessert from Mike's Pastry around the corner.Once we got our phone call (great system!), we shuffled back and snagged our seats at the counter.  We each got a lobster roll (hot) with salad substituted for fries at no additional charge.  There must have been a pound of fresh lobster gobbed up on that roll with sweet, warm butter oozed on top.  My first lobster roll--it was an investment meal, but it was well worth both the money and the wait!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay Q.
Reviews.Content: Ya there's a line, ya it's gonna be a while. It's WORTH it. Put your name on the list and walk around little Italy for an hour or two. The hot lobster roll was amazing, clam chowder was great and the oysters were fresh and delicious. Service was good and they even made my sister in law a vegan dish.

Reviews.Author: K M.
Reviews.Content: Get the WARM lobster roll - wowsahs! I only eat lobster rolls here after trying many other places. Decided to save my pennies and wait for the best one in town.

Reviews.Author: Tanya Y.
Reviews.Content: When a restaurant has over 1700+ Yelp reviews, there most definitely has to be a reason.  With that on the back burner, Neptune has been on the top of the list of must-try places for a long time.  I was happy to finally get that opportunity last month.While everyone raves about their lobster roll, (we ordered it hot, accompanied with fries) which is decent and of course overflowing from the bun with chunks of lobster meat, I don't think it was the best thing on the menu like everyone else says it is.  It is, however, definitely one of the cheaper priced "entrée" items at $27.  Instead, while you're at Neptune, and if you're here for the first time, please do yourself a favor and please get some oysters!!!  Neptune has a person at the window front, shucking various amounts of shell fish (oysters, clams, crab claws, prepping shrimp for shrimp cocktail, etc), which definitely entices people walking along on the street.  The oysters come at roughly ~$3 a pop, but are all definitely worth it.   You are given a paper sheet with about 15 different varieties of oysters.  Each oyster comes with a description stating the size, where it comes from, and the flavor/finish it relates to.  Champagne? Honey Dew? Popcorn finish?  Hells friggen yes!Afterwards, make sure to order the Seared Georges Bank Scallops ($33 - d'anjou pear butter, Long Island duck confit, Brussels sprouts, Maytag blue).  The scallops had a great sear.  The combination of the saltiness from the duck confit and the bomb-dot-com Brussels sprouts were to die for - I never thought in a million years that Brussels sprouts could taste this darn good.Neptune is packed at all hours of the day, and they do not take call ahead reservations. However, a good tip?  Go in, leave your name, party size, and cell phone number.  They'll call you whenever they have a table (or bar space) available, allowing you to roam around and explore the entire North End.  Expect to pay a pretty penny (they accept cash and credit) and don't expect to have much room between you and the person sitting next to you; they make sure to use up every seat.  This establishment is definitely a gem and is a place I look forward to visiting again when another celebration is in order.

Reviews.Author: Christina M.
Reviews.Content: This place is, hands-down, my favorite restaurant in Boston.  Be prepared to wait for 2-3 hours if you show up at peak hours on a weekend night (and trust me, there will be a wait no matter when you go).  This is one of the few places that I will happily wait as long as they tell me to (and grabbing a few drinks at Vito's across the street will make the time fly).Expect to be seated very close to your neighbors, as this place is tiny.Admittedly I haven't tried much off of this menu--but that is because what I always order is just too good.  I have never had a bad oyster here, and I love being able to try so many different varieties.  They give you helpful descriptions of the oysters as well, so you're never overwhelmed.  Their other raw bar selections are always delicious as well, including the blue crab cocktail.  I usually fill up on the raw bar and then order a lobster roll (hot with butter, obv) to split with whoever I'm there with.They also have a really great wine list.  I've discovered a few very cool white wines here.

Reviews.Author: Alan T.
Reviews.Content: Wanting to experience another good oyster place, we came prepared after reading about the lengthy wait times (2 hrs??) others experienced in getting seated. We had a little snack before heading over. It was a Tuesday night and we were seated in 20 minutes instead of the 45 to an hour we were advised on so that was a welcome surprise. Our seats were at the bar so we could observe as the oysters were shucked. Looking over the selection of oysters, we liked how each selection not only listed their origin, but a description of their size, degree of saltiness, and finish. There was a lot to choose from! We went with Island Creek, Katama Bay, Pemaquid, Winter Point, Kumamoto, and Kushi so we could try both Atlantic and Pacific oysters. We also decided to try a hot buttered lobster roll. Did I mention we were hungry? To our surprise, the lobster roll was served up first (aren't oysters usually served first?) but we didn't fuss and just went with it. True to other reviewers descriptions, this roll had a very generous portion of lobster meat piled on the hot, buttered roll with a side of crispy french fries. It was delicious! Our oysters came up just as we finished the lobster roll so we decided to set aside the fries and start working on the oysters. The oysters were sequenced in the same order of our selections starting clockwise on the outer circle and then counterclockwise on the inner circle. Between the two of us, we had eleven oysters each and we were not disappointed! As we consumed each variety, we tried to see if our palates were in line with each oyster's finish, (i.e., fruity, brown butter, citrus, sweet, honeydew, cucumber). That was fun. The cucumber finish of the Kushi was dead on while others we had to think over. Saving the fries for last turned out to be a good move - a rich, salty counterpoint to the oysters we just finished.Neptune struck us as more of a locals hangout. Very cozy (read: small) like a lot of spaces in the North End but manageable. The noise level is a little high but we were fine with it. Some might balk at a $27 lobster roll plate but for the price, you're getting a very generous portion of lobster with that so I wouldn't expect a McD's price. And of course, the oysters were superb! I'd come here again to try some of their other menu items. I now have another choice for oysters when in Boston - Neptune!

Reviews.Author: Pack C.
Reviews.Content: It was our best meal in Boston. The place doesn't take reservation. We were there sat dinner 3-4 hrs wait, even for seats at the bar! We decided to come back on monad at early dinner time ~4-5 pm. It still required 1 hour wait. The place definitely worths the wait. Our favorites were lobster spaghetti and seared scallops with Brussels sprouted. We also ordered the seafood tower thing. It was good but we like their hot entree dishes better. The meal costed us about ~$50 per person including tips

Reviews.Author: Yasmin C.
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhhh the anticipation!!! I'm such a sucker for food-related hype, so hearing about  a 1.5-hour wait only makes me more stubborn about trying out a new restaurant.  Hence why I was able to convince my older brother to A) endure said wait time, and B) pay $27 for a sandwich. We hopped into line about 15 minutes before the place opened at 11:30 and, of course, didn't get in with the first group. We left my cell number and then grabbed coffee and went for a walk around the harbor.  Not a bad deal! The host called me a bit before our projected hour and a half, and so we hightailed it back over to the restaurant, where we were seated at the bar.We picked out a set of oysters to try...I really appreciated the descriptions of the different types (i.e. salty, nutty, etc). They were all DELICIOUS and went down easily. We decided not to order more since we had lobster rolls on the way, which proved to be a smart move. Those lobster rolls + French fries were huuuuuge. We ordered one hot and one cold and split each. Both were amazing, though I preferred the hot one, which was so delicious and buttery and amazing. I liked that the cold one wasn't drenched in mayo, and both sandwiches were absolutely filled with lobster meat. I was stuffed after the oysters and lobster rolls; couldn't make much of a dent in the massive pile of fries served alongside each sandwich.With tip, the whole thing came to about $90 I believe...a bit pricey for a couple of sandwiches and a few oysters, but not bad for fantastic amount of food including a hefty amount of lobster! I give Neptune 4.5 stars...I would love to return at some point when I'm back in Boston, though I won't be in a huge hurry to wait in line again. For now...craving fulfilled and curiosity satisfied!

Reviews.Author: Ivan M.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is one of the best seafood places in the world.  Order a round of oysters, then the lobster roll (brioche, warm bread, butter instead of mayo, and generous load of lobster).  Wines are interesting, too.Now, it's a small place, wait is often bad (but we came 11:30 on a Friday, there was no line), there is a bit of draft from the door, but it's still a fabulous experience - must be tried.  Reason enough to move to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Blake H.
Reviews.Content: I have not found a lobster roll to date that is better than the one at Neptune Oyster. I always get hot with butter. The oysters were also delicious and there are several good ones to choose from. WarningThe place is small and you can get yourself in trouble if you show up during peak dinner times. Try to be there before opening so you can be the first in the door. The prices are expensive...but hey, like I said, haven't found a lobster roll to beat Neptunes.

Reviews.Author: Crystal H.
Reviews.Content: Lots of different types of delicious oysters. I got to try 4 types I have never heard before. Shared a 20 oyster platter with the bf.The clam chowder had real clams in them! So good!So generous with the lobster meat and portions!Bf got the hot lobster roll was buttery and full of lobster meat.I ordered the Monday special, which was lobster spaghetti and that was really good. For $38, there's like a full large lobster in it.  I ordered a glass of champagne to try with the oysters, but it just made the oysters tasted bitter..weird.The only complaint I have is that the place is really small. We got crammed in with another couple. Tables are practically next to each other. You can hear the conversations from the tables next to you.Seafood isn't cheap. Bill was like around $200.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy R.
Reviews.Content: In town and really wanted a lobster roll. showed up at 3 and after an hour walking around the north end we scored 3 seats at the bar. As stated before, the lobster rolls are AWESOME and huge. even the french fries are top notch. I only have one minor complaint. there was a smoked trout/caviar on a corn pancake app which we ordered and thoroughly enjoyed but with a lobster roll per person it was too much food. We had asked the waiter if we should only get the app and 2 rolls and he said no. So overall, amazing food but service was not optimal. Still, that was one heck of a lobster roll!

Reviews.Author: Jean L.
Reviews.Content: The Kumomoto Oysters and the hot Lobster Rolls are the best in this warm and cozy cafe-esque place. (But trying all the oysters on the list isn't a bad idea, either.)Prices are fair for seafood this fresh. If nothing else, the buttery hot lobster roll is a must-have. A must! Plus it comes with those addicting fries.Come with someone you adore since the wait may be long.

Reviews.Author: Patti W.
Reviews.Content: Three words: the lobster roll. Neptune Oyster introduced me to the hot lobster roll, and I've been addicted ever since! This is a North End hot spot, and there is always a long wait...well worth it! They don't take reservations, but will take your phone number and call you when a table is available.  An excellent place for seafood in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Kristina N.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll is hands down the best one I've ever had --and I take my out-of-town friends every time they come.  The lobster roll is expensive but a great value for the amount of lobster you get.  I've eaten here at least 10 times. The chowdah is just okay though. Stick with the lobster roll and any of the crudo appetizer options are great.  Grilled octopus salad is also amazing. The piggyback appetizer is not good (do not order). Just go early (line up 20-30 minutes before opening) on a weekend or at an off-peak time to avoid the usual 2-hour wait.

Reviews.Author: Adi H.
Reviews.Content: Seafood heaven, hands down. Worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Emily L.
Reviews.Content: The tl;dr summary: AMAZING hot lobster roll that was fantastic with a glass of white wine.  Allow plenty of time for wait.The quest for the lobster roll: I confess, I had never eaten a lobster roll in my life until July 2013 at Neptune Oyster.  I had always wanted to try one but never got around to it in my limited trips to the east coast, and I didn't really want to get lobster in Michigan.  This time, though, my friend Wayne L. was horrified to hear that I had never had a lobster roll, so we made it our mission to obtain some lobster rolls.  Needless to say, I was really excited, even though I had just eaten two lobsters at dinner the night before (the second lobster was officially hashtagged #lobsterofshame).After a lot of toll road craziness and maneuvering through the narrow alleys of the North End, we finally found ourselves at the restaurant.  The area by the front door was very small, and the person in front of us advised us that we had to wait to be seated.  After several minutes, the person in front of us was seated, and the server also mentioned to us that only the raw bar was available.  I was SO disappointed!  Pretty sure the server noticed my anguished-looking face, though, because she said she would check if there were any more lobster rolls left in the kitchen.She came back after a couple of minutes and said that there were two more!  WHAAAT!  I thanked her profusely, and we sat down to glasses of water.  The ice-less water prompted me to order a glass of wine, and Wayne got a selection of oysters from a very descriptive menu.But the lobster roll was the star of the show.  You could get either hot with butter or cold with mayo.  We went with hot, obviously.  Large, fresh, sweet, tender chunks of lobster, seasoned sparingly with just salt and pepper, cradled by a buttery toasted roll, and drizzled with melted butter.  Fries and ketchup on the side.  Conversation ceased, and I savored the religious experience that was this lobster roll.Of course I don't have any other lobster rolls to compare this one with, but everything just tasted so perfectly delicious to me.  This would definitely go in my "Top 10 Sandwiches" list if I had one.  Hmm, make that "Top 5 Sandwiches."  And Wayne, who is a lobster roll connoisseur, said that this was actually the best lobster roll he has ever had.

Reviews.Author: Debra L.
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to spot whenever I have a friend visiting from out-of-town and I always leave with a happy belly and a happy friend. I've always come Saturdays right when they open at 11:30 am to make the first wave of luncheon-ers but today we came around 1 pm on a weekday and I was pleased to find there was no line and that we were seated immediately. Be prepared to share a table with strangers, to be served relatively slowly, and to shell out more money than your average lunch. If you're okay with that, you're good to go!My favorites:1. Maine Lobster Roll -- Hot and buttery with heaps of chunky lobster meat. No mayo, no skimpy shreds of lobster, no filler, just lobster.2. Neptune Burger -- I know what you're thinking: Really? A burger? But this is no ordinary burger- it is a deliciously juicy and moist burger cooked to perfection topped with garlic mayo and fried oysters. It just works and it is so delicious and messy and one of the most affordable items on the menu.3. Seared Georges Bank Scallops with d'anjou pear butter, Long Island duck confit, Brussel sprouts, Maytag blue -- Yum. 4. Oysters! -- Not necessarily the cheapest/best value place to get oysters, especially compared to restaurants that do $1 oyster happy hours, but they have a wide selection with helpful descriptions of the oysters (size, plumpness, saltiness, the taste of the finish ie. cucumber finish). And the oysters are fresh and plump and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sunny L.
Reviews.Content: Upon entering NO in a seemingly chilly night without reservations, we were seated within a few minutes; We were ecstatic!. With a empty stomach begging for delicious food, we order several items from the menu: Hot lobster roll, Island creek oysters, cioppino, and clam chowder. While waiting for our food, we absorb ourselves in this restaurant by observing the interesting decor and details that were imprinted decades ago to this place. The patrons were friendly, the temperature was just right, and the service, Superb. As the food came out, a story unfolded to my palettes that hinted a great spark of satisfaction to my taste receptors. 4/5 - The lobster roll [HOt] was very good. It was complimented with a side fries which was good :)5/5 - The island creek oysters were delicious. Delicate and semi savory with a hint of sweet5/5 - The cioppino was yummy. It was filled with intricate flavors and textures.2/5 - The clam chowder was alright; i could skip the chowder. I felt it was lackingOverall, NO is a place to hit up when you want something that consistent please the hungriest of food mobs. Definitely recommended!Pros: Service, Staff, foodCons: Clam Chowder, Reservations because this place is small, tight seating...Stars : 4.5

Reviews.Author: Lisa N.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters I've ever eaten. And I've eaten a lot of oysters. The Moon Shoals are the best out of the ones I tried.1.5 hour wait for 4 people on a Monday night? I'll take it!The Lobster Roll is hot and you get a huge portion of lobster... I loved it. Spaghettini is the special for Mondays and it was OK. Plenty of lobster, but not worth the hefty price. Service is great, but the place is tiny. They cram as many people as they can in there (fire hazard?) but I can see why it's so popular. It's a must for tourists!

Reviews.Author: Nashrah R.
Reviews.Content: My first time trying lobster roll, and Neptune Oyster certainly delivered! You can either get it served hot with butter or cold with mayo. Since it was a cold snowy today, we opted for hot with butter option and were not disappointed. The bread was soft with just the right amount of warm butter, and the lobster chunks melted in your mouth. For nearly $30 bucks, it's quite expensive but worth it! The roll was served with a side of delicious (but somewhat soggy) fries.We also tried the clam chowder. The flavor was good but the consistency was too thin. It's not the best clam chowder so I wouldn't recommend trying it unless you're particularly craving chowder.

Reviews.Author: Jiyea C.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I need to downgrade my review based on my recent visits here. Neptune is still one of the restaurants I bring out of towners to when they visit, and somehow I can't help thinking that this place seems a tad bit overrated. Here are the GOODs: Oysters. Every single one I've tried here is DELICIOUS. Sometimes I wish I could just eat like 50 oysters here and call it a meal...albeit a rather expensive one ;)  Cioppino was actually better than the last time I tried it. It was more tomato-y but still had the heat, so hooray. Mussel appetizer: the broth is heavenly. Just get it. The NOT-SO-GOODs: Clam chowder. My friend and I were not fans of the chowda here, as it is very watery, bland, and had too many potatoes and not enough clams. Skip this. Lobster roll FRIES and BUN: The roll itself is still chock full of large chunks of lobster, but the bun was a little soggy, and the fries are just as limp and boring as ever. I mentioned this in my previous review. I should also note that although the place does not take reservations and there is almost always a wait, the staff here has generally been pretty accurate about wait times. I mean, how annoying is it when a restaurant tells you the wait is 30 minutes and you show up half an hour later just to wait another half hour? I'd much rather have a restaurant tell me that the wait is an hour from the get go. I've never had to wait significantly more than Neptune said I would. Also, unlike Giacomos, you can put your name and phone number down on the list and hang out elsewhere in the cute North End neighborhood until your table is ready. Much appreciated.

Reviews.Author: Phill C.
Reviews.Content: If you love oysters and lobster, Neptune Oyster is the place to go.  The place is small, with bar seating and a few communal tables, so it gets packed fast.  There's usually a wait for a seat and they don't take reservations, but they'll take down your name and give you a call once your seats are ready.  On my visit, a 1.5 hr wait turned into 45 minutes, which was just enough time to explore the area and pick up some cannolis for dessert.You order the oysters off a menu card you fill out, which includes oysters from various parts of the east coast as well as other items such as clams.  All the oysters we ordered were very fresh and delicious, but my favorite part of the meal was the Hot Lobster Roll.  Freakin amazing!  They do it different than the cold mayo based lobster rolls you find at other places.  There's starts off with a toasted buttered roll, filled with huge chunks of fresh sweet lobster, served hot and doused in butter.  So simple, but totally worth the wait.Boston has plenty of good choices for oysters and lobster rolls, but go to Neptune Oyster and you won't regret it!

Reviews.Author: Michelle D.
Reviews.Content: Overall: Love seafood? Want an unforgettable meal? This is it! Pros- maine lobster roll, make it hot and don't share this- it's way too delicious- try the raw bar oysters, they have all kinds from the sweet, lettuce finish to the more briny favors-clam chowder is more soup-y but still good Cons-the fries with the Maine lobster roll are just okay- the wait can be brutal, we waited 2 hours but we were impressed with the foodSide note-even though the wait is long, take a stroll along the north end - it helps pass the time

Reviews.Author: zoran o.
Reviews.Content: The most badass Bronzino baked that I ever had by MILES AND MILES - wow!!!!Fucking incredible.

Reviews.Author: Cait A.
Reviews.Content: Holy CRAP, the hot lobster roll doused in butter is AMAZING. And HUGE. And I could barely finish the whole plate. I was not incredibly impressed with the fries, but they weren't bad, but I mostly left them for the end to make sure I could finish the AMAZING lobster roll. Even the bun was amazing, crispy and buttery and oh my god perfect, but I had to stop eating that near the end as well to be sure I could polish off that lobster. Even when I was stuffed, I was determined to eat all that amazing lobster. Wow.Brought some NYC friends here and no one could resist the lobster rolls. One friends also got oysters. Everyone was very happy.

Reviews.Author: Anne-Marie S.
Reviews.Content: This place was such a surprise! My husband and I loved it :) As with most restaurants in north end the restaurant is super small and loud with a very long waitlist but it was totally worth the wait! They took our name and number and called us when our table was ready so we were free to walk around north end and get a drink somewhere while we waited. We got the famous lobster roll, shrimp and grits, oysters and clam chowder. It was such a fun experience and the food was great! Definitely a place to try when in Boston if you like seafood :) We can't wait to stop here again next time we are in town!

Reviews.Author: Jane N.
Reviews.Content: Amazing seafood. We went for appetizers and enjoyed a variety of raw clams and oysters as well as shrimp cocktail and clam chowder and some drinks. Everything was delicious. Plus this small place is super cute!

Reviews.Author: Kris I.
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was the hunger pang, but this place lived up to the hype. Can be hard to get in - super small, always crowded, doesn't take reservations.My sister and I were super lucky as there were two spots at the bar.The oyster selection was diverse and delish. As a Californian, I was excited to try as many local/Massachusetts-based oysters as I could. Also, this is one of the few places I've been to that offers the choice of butter or mayo on your lobsta roll. Had to do the butter, of course!

Reviews.Author: Margorie G.
Reviews.Content: I'm such a sucker for almost 2,000 yelp reviews! I live in Florida and restaurants here don't have that kind of admiration that Boston yelpers have for their food :)They are located in the northend of Boston and yes parking will be a pain and you might get a ticket if you don't read all the signs...we did.Like most restaurants in this are there are no reservations but unlike other restaurants in the area you can put your name down and they will call you. So you don't have to wait outside in line in the cold until they have a table for you. Our wait was about 1 1/2 hours so we went to a nearby bar and had a glass of wine.The restaurant is really cute and small, probably 4 or 5 actual tables and the rest is bar seating which probably has 10 seats. They have a great selection of wine and you can see them shuck your oyster right in front of you.We ordered half a dozen oyster which were cleaned to perfection and very tasty they are on the pricey side. We also had the crab bisque which was delicious. The star of the show and the reason we came was for their lobster roll. It was served hot with butter and side of fries. Everything about this roll was amazing down to the bun. I've never had a lobster roll so tasty and fresh packed with flavor. This alone is worth the almost 2 hour wait.

Reviews.Author: Isabelle E.
Reviews.Content: The best thing ever. Oysters: amazing, warm lobster roll w butter: amazing. No reservations, but i showed up somewhat late for lunch/after the big lunch crowd and was seated at the bar right away. Little pricey, but a must try, at least once!

Reviews.Author: Ryan O.
Reviews.Content: I think that I have written about Neptune Oyster previously and perhaps more glowingly.  I debated between 2 or 3 stars as my experience this last time was less than stellar - but I decided that "I've experienced better" sums up my last visit.  I get the feeling that perhaps this place is riding the wave of their past popularity and have lowered their standards, both in terms of service and food quality.We arrived right when Neptune opened on a recent Sunday morning.  We immediately got a table and after some time given menus and after some more time saw our waitress for the first time.  Even though the place was half-full at this time, she certainly seemed frazzled and having no time to wait for us to decide.  In fact, she walked away several times if there was a lull in our ordering.  This reflects the service overall, hard to get someone's attention to order another glass of wine or even get the check.  The staff definitely has an attitude and I am not sure that they buy into the customer always being right thing.The food was ok.  No question it was fresh...but people come on...it's oysters and lobster...not the height of culinary sophistication.  Having said that those are two things that I love and crave on a regular basis.  Somewhat disappointed by the lobster roll...sure it was big...it should be for $28.00...but the lobster was tough and too much mayonnaise.  Would much prefer the lobster roll at James Hook & Co.  I can also say that the Shrimp Cocktail was horrible...the giant shrimp were tough and rubbery...should have definitely just ordered more oysters.I think that everyone in my party came to the same conclusion...it was alright...not sure it was worth $300 for 3 adults and 1 small child.  There are so many great restaurants in Boston...not sure I would rush back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Agustin K.
Reviews.Content: Dinner wait is at the minimum an hour - thy do take your phone number so presumably you can get a drink somewhere else while waiting for your table.  We were starving so decided to come the following day for lunch.And wait time for lunch is no existent at least when we were there.  But since my party didn't arrive yet, they couldn't sit me which I completely understand.  I wanted to grab a drink at the bar while waiting, there was at least 5 seats open at the bar and the waiter would not let me!  Kept saying he couldn't sit me since I am a party of six and they were not here etc.  That just have me such a bad impression of the place.  Anyhow my party arrived, we got seated I the table that has been free for the past 15min.  Ordered the obligatory warm lobster roll and honestly I wasn't impressed.  It was good, different from the typical mayo based version.  But lacked flavor IMO and the bread didn't stand well to the butter.  The Neptune burger on the other hand was a nice surprise.  Everyone was shocked to hear by hubby ordered the burger in a seafood restaurant but I was glad he did. It was flavored well, juicy and the fried oyster with the tartar sauce was something I've never had in a burger before.  It was sized appropriately as well - I had a few bites of the burger and enjoyed it a lot.My party ordered a few other items - the oysters were fresh in their opinion but I didn't see anything that I couldn't have gotten elsewhere so decided to skip.I know you are the most popular restaurant t in Boston and people make adjustments to their vacation schedules to come visit you.   You are probably making a lot of tips considering your tables are always full.  Adjust your attitude and show a little reasonable care to your customers.  We were in vacation after all and having a nice drink at the bar would have been a very nice empty to have.

Reviews.Author: Idy T.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster has the best lobster rolls in Boston!!!I came on a weekday for lunch and there was a 30-45 minute wait. This shows how awesome Neptune Oyster is!I didn't try the oysters during my visit! But I did order their lobster roll. They have two options for the lobster rolls. You can have it cold with mayo or hot with butter. Butter?? Of course I went with the hot with butter. It is $27 and it comes with a warm buttery roll with a mountain of lobster chunks and a side of fries. The lobster was amazing! I love eating lobster rolls because it saves the hard work for me. I don't need to spend all my time and effort to crack the shells to get the the lobster!

Reviews.Author: Mary T.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Friday afternoon and there was a 30-45 minute wait. It is good that the host gets your name and phone number down and call you when your table is ready. So instead of waiting outside until I got seated, I walked around North End to get some pastry and coffee... I basically had dessert before my meal. After I enjoyed my cannoli at Mike's Pastry and coffee from Thinking Cup, I went back to Neptune Oyster. It was just about time. I got seated 5 minutes after I went back to Neptune Oyster. I knew what I wanted to order already so Idy T and I immediately ordered the lobster roll with butter. The roll came out pretty fast. There was so much lobster on there and I liked the brioche rolls. The roll got kind of soggy because it soaked up all of the butter and juice from the lobster. The lobster was very fresh and the butter enhanced the freshness of the lobster. They could use a little more salt for the lobster, but if you want it to be saltier, you can ask for salt. Overall, the service was fast. The restaurant is small to accommodate big parties. It is better for smaller parties. I will definitely come back to try their oysters!

Reviews.Author: Tamara W.
Reviews.Content: amazing! the lobster role is everything and more they say it is! awesome wine. Carrie is the best waitress EVER! love this place. they should get Bantam hard cider though :) for us paleo peeps.great oysters, great service, go at 3:30 a day before thursday!~tamara

Reviews.Author: Stephanie M.
Reviews.Content: I went here a couple of nights ago and I'm still dreaming about our meal. The oysters here were some of the freshest I've ever had--and I've had a lot of oysters. I ordered the halibut as my meal, which came with a sweet corn and mushroom ragout and an outrageously delicious sauce that tasted like it had some horseradish in it.The halibut was a contender for the best piece of fish I've ever eaten. It was seared perfectly on the outside, crisp and intensely flavorful. The fish was perfectly cooked on the inside, white and flaky.My boyfriend ordered the scallops which he raved about. Will definitely be back soon--we figured out the trick: Get there before 6 PM on a weeknight to avoid the infamous line out the door! But definitely go! (Fantastic service, too.)

Reviews.Author: Joelle K.
Reviews.Content: I had lunch at Neptune Oyster today (Sunday) with my husband and brother. There was a line to get in when we arrived at 11:20. We were able to get a table as soon as the restaurant opened at 11:30. As many people have mentioned before, the restaurant truly is tiny. I don't really love oysters, but tried a couple. I liked the well fleet oyster and my brother and husband really enjoyed the variety of oysters that they had. I had the warm lobster roll for my entree, and it was delicious. I highly recommend! The French fries were just ok. My brother had the cold lobster roll and my husband had the fish tacos special. I tried both...the cold lobster roll was very good as well, but I prefer the warm option. My husband's fish taco was awesome. The fish was cooked perfectly and the sauce was so tasty. Be prepared to spend a good chunk of change as nothing is cheap. However, it is very well worth the splurge.

Reviews.Author: Joyce T.
Reviews.Content: Since I first wrote this review I've been back to Neptune quite a few times and here is what I've learned:First is that if you go over for dinner on any night expect a 1-2 hour (more likely a 2 hour) wait. What I've discovered is that the best time to sample their food is right when they open during a weekday. The place is empty (for a bit), quiet(er), and you get the right amount of attention from the great staff there. Needless to say, it's harder (not impossible) to flag someone down during one of their regular dinner services.If you decide to take on dinner be warned - you will be surrounded by a lot of hungry, cranky tourists. They will go on and on about how hungry they are and how they've been waiting forever (even if they showed up after you did) and complain to the extremely professional staff about how they're ready to leave if they're not seated soon. Yappy, miserable tourists will ruin your appetite.Do one of two things. Leave your number with the hostess so you can take a leisure walk through North End - consider having dessert before dinner at Modern or Mike's Pastries OR come back for a lovely, hassle-free lunch during the week instead!Eat, drink, be merry, and tip well!

Reviews.Author: Anna K.
Reviews.Content: Before coming to Boston, I had never heard of a Lobster Roll. The hot one I had at Neptune Oyster was my first one, and I am officially spoiled. We were recommended the restaurant by two lovely ladies on the train from NYC. The service was friendly despite a very small space with a long wait, and sharing tables proved a really fun experience for my best friend and I. The food was INCREDIBLE, with soft, buttery fresh lobster on a delicious bun. It was melt-in-your-mouth seafood, and definitely worth the long wait. I cannot wait to come back as soon as I find myself in Boston again.

Reviews.Author: Bobbie P.
Reviews.Content: Hot lobster roll was so good! Oysters were great too. I would've liked to talk to the wait staff about the different oysters they offered, but nope. We didn't have to wait as long as most, but it was still really busy. Not much interaction with our waitress. Food was great, so I guess that's the trade off for so-so service. They were friendly, just not attentive.

Reviews.Author: Julia D.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster Bar doesn't look like much on the outside but on the inside it's one happy place.  The crowds here speak volumes about the quality of the food and it was definitely the best meal I had on my recent trip to Boston.  It's located in the North End and it is definitely worth the visit.  I couldn't go to Boston and not have a lobster roll so that's what I got.  You have the option of getting it hot with butter or cold with mayo.  I tried it hot and boy was it ever good!  You could really taste the lobster as it practically melted in your mouth.  The fries it came with were also good but the star here was the lobster roll.  I didn't try the oysters but they did have a pretty vast selection.It's a tiny place and they don't take reservations so be prepared to wait.  We showed up at 6 and got seated in 10 minutes however when we left about an hour later the host was saying the wait was 1 hour at a minimum.  This was also on a Wednesday.  I imagine on weekends the waits are worse but don't let this discourage you from trying some pretty awesome food.

Reviews.Author: Julie T.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars technically but since it was the best meal I had in Boston, bumped up to a 5!  It totally lived up to the hype.  We tried 6 different types of oysters - one of my favorites were the Bee's River oysters, but honestly they were all pretty good.  I loved the variety they had and it was great reading off the names and descriptions of each oysters and tasting them with our large group.  The seared scallops with brussel sprouts were my favorite dish, so so good. The sauce was the perfect compliment and the scallops were perfectly seared. Lobster roll is a MUST have and also very delicious.  They def do not skimp on the lobster, however it is a lot of buttery goodness.  The fish tacos, which was the special on sunday, were actually very delicious as well. Very crispy, they again do NOT skimp on the fish.  The coleslaw was an asian inspired side, not with the globs of mayo you may associate it, which I thoroughly enjoyed.  Someone else got a ribeye at our table, and they said ti made on point as well and super huge! I would definitely say this a MUST go to restaurant.  It is SUPER SMALL.  We put down our names for 7 at around 5PM, whenever it opens and we didn't get seated till around 7PM... so expect a 2 hour+ wait if you are going to do... luckily for us, we were staying in the North End so it wasn't too bad.  They called us and accommodated us easily. Would def recommend if you are in Boston! ]

Reviews.Author: Gaul L.
Reviews.Content: This is my go to place for the best Maine Lobster that the east coast has to offer.  I recommend this place only when the season is right. During the off seasons for the fishing industry this place isn't as prime as it would be when the stock is fresh. That also happens to be when it is the busiest, so you might have to wait around for a table or waiter. If you have to time to wait then it will be worth it.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: All 4 of my friends and I agreed that the hot lobster roll was the best lobster we had ever tasted and worth every penny of the $27 price tag.We waited 1.5 hours to be seated, but we had heard the great reviews and had no problem hanging out across the street until we were called. It's so nice that they call you so you don't have to stand out in the cold.The restaurant is tiny and you share table, but none of it matters once you get your food. The lobster roll and fries are a generous portion but we all completely cleaned our plates. It was amazing yet we didn't feel sick afterwards. Just a perfect meal. A side note to the lobster, but the fries are pretty excellent too.

Reviews.Author: Bob M.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll was excellent. Cioppno was also excellent. Place was small but so what? Not an oyster fan yet but will return for those.

Reviews.Author: Nikki Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING!!! I just wish it was bigger. You will be turned away if you don't get there early enough. If you have to wait in line just know that the food is worth the wait. Excellent lobster roll. Awesome hamburger with fried oyster inside. Oysters were so fresh and delicious! Clam chowder was a little thin and boring but 3 amazing dishes out of 4 is not bad. I love love love this place if I go back to Boston I would definitely make a pit-stop:)

Reviews.Author: Lauren H.
Reviews.Content: I'm writing a review strictly on the service here. I read so many great reviews about the food, and I'm sure it's amazing. But the other day when I came here with my friend, we were greeted with, "someone will be with you shortly". 15 minutes later, as all the servers and bartenders stood behind the bar and averted their eyes from us while they were laughing and talking, nobody even acknowledged us. Meanwhile, there were two spots available at the bar and three tables. As the line continued to pile up behind us, and some couple badgered their way in front of us to get in first, we had enough. Maybe the food is good, but I'll never know because the customer service is the worst and will not recommend this place again!

Reviews.Author: Bohn H.
Reviews.Content: If you really like seafood then you will probably really like this place. I am not a seafood guy so my options were limited when I arrived at this place. The food that I ordered that was your basic fillers for people who hate seafood. Fries and Sandwich. It was as good as anything but if I wanted this than I would have gone somewhere that specializes in it. Check this place out if you like seafood.

Reviews.Author: Greg P.
Reviews.Content: In Boston... I've had betterFans of the Neptune Oyster Bar are vocal and many in number.  However, to this reviewer, there are better Oyster Bars and seafood restaurants in Boston.  Neptune is located in the North End and is somewhat tricky to get to unless you live in the North End.  Parking, as with most places in the North End, is difficult. The ambiance is nothing to write home about and the service is quick and lacking much personality.  Expect to wait a good while for your table.As an Oyster Bar, Neptune is just okay.  They do offer a broad selection of oysters.  However, other restaurants such as B&G Oysters, Island Creek Oysters, and Oceanaire often offer a better selection.  The preparation and presentation of the oysters are standard... nothing special here.I found the clam chowder at Neptune to be ordinary.  Certainly, it hit the spot at the time but the memory was not a lasting one.The lobster roll, which is often cited on Yelp as the marker of excellence at Neptune, was good.  Large juicy chunks of lobster delicately seasoned (but not overly so) with a nicely toasted bun made for a nice dinner.  Was it the best lobster roll I have ever had?  Not by a long-shot.  Still good though.Overall, considering the ambiance, bland service, and slightly better than average for Boston seafood, Neptune comes in at 3 stars.  We're spoiled out here and there are too many similar restaurants that excel in places Neptune does not.  If Neptune were in the middle of Kansas, it might be 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Duy L.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch here on Monday, Oct 14, 2013 - Columbus Day.There was quite a line before the place opened, but I'm sure glad we stepped into it.  We really lucked out cause the guy in front of us was waiting for his wife and friend, and there was only a table for two left!  Fate!We were in the door at 11:30am, and by 12:10pm, the lobster roll was in front of me.  Let me tell you, this thing is pretty huge.  If you want to feel like you're getting bang for your buck, then this roll won't disappoint.  Flavors are pure lobster, healthy drizzle of butter, and a deliciously soft roll.The waitress recommended the fried clams, which I thought were aight.  I admit I'm not an avid clam eater, so my opinion bears little weight.The seating is cramped, but I quite enjoyed it.  Felt very communal, especially with the British rock star sitting next to us telling the waitress every few minutes how much  he loved each dish (he wasn't really a rock star, but some other patron asked too! just cause of that awesome accent and the leather rocker look he had)Despite a massive line, I never felt rushed by the waitress, and it was undeniable she took great pride in the restaurant and its food.  I felt welcomed, and I would be happy to drop $27 again for that lobster roll... except maybe with clam chowder next time too!(to be honest, I would NOT have paid $27 for the exact same lobster roll out of a truck... there was something about the ambiance and anticipation after having stood in line... definitely not for everyone)

Reviews.Author: Jenny S.
Reviews.Content: I love Boston for its surrounding, the history and especially the food.  A friend recommended this place and I'm so glad he did.  We ordered their famous lobster roll, Connecticut style (hot with butter), a dozen oysters and a few drinks on tap and chose to sit at the bar. Obviously, the lobster roll was amazing.  One of the best I've ever had.  Plenty of lobster meat, not mixed in with fillers with a substantial bun that can hold everything up.  Delicious!  For the price ($24), it is fair.  I've been to other seafood places and ordered their lobster roll for about that price too and it was not way as good.   The oysters are so fresh.  The staff is very knowledgeable on the region of each of the oysters and their distinct taste. The bartender recommended a few beers that would pair well with our food and he was spot on with his recommendations.  For a girl who doesn't drink much beer, I would definitely have another with my lobster roll. Most tourist places don't live up to all the hype you've heard, but Neptune definitely exceeds it. No complaints about the food or the service here, everything was top notch during my visit. My friend also suggested that we get there early because there is always a line.  He was not exaggerating, we got in line around 10AM and there was already a few people waiting before us.  This place is small, only a few seats at the bar and tabletops in the restaurant, but it does add to the charm of the place.  Despite the small size and long waits, Neptune definitely is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Rachel L.
Reviews.Content: A trip to Boston is not complete without a stop to my favorite - Neptunes! This place is tiny, I mean 10 tables and maybe 12 bar stools and they do not take reservations so you will wait. A LONG TIME...but in my opinion, its worth it.
