The Good - the menu is not huge, they have daily specials, they give descriptions of the oysters, they have hot and cold lobster rolls, great decor (cool marble tables), great wine/beer options and one of the servers has a huge seal tattoo on her forearm. The Bad - the wait, they wont allow you to add your name to a list even when you are in a cab on your way, the front door blasts cold air on the first few tables when people come in/out, its not cheap and people have nowhere to wait so they literally stand and stare and you...Ive been that person!Get there early - they are open for lunch at 11:30 or get there for dinner and plan on grabbing a drink nearby while you wait for 45 minutes.  I LOVE Neptunes!!!

Reviews.Author: Amanda L.
Reviews.Content: I live in the North End and always walk by this restaurant. There are always lines down the st... people even line up on Sunday mornings waiting for the restaurant to open. Combined with the rave reviews, I figured that this place must be good so my boyfriend and I decided to finally try it one Sunday night. We put our names in around 7pm and there was a 2 hour wait, which we were prepared for. They take your name and call you when your table is ready. I got the special, which was a whole roasted bronzino and my boyfriend got the lobster roll with hot butter. My fish was delicious and perfectly roasted with crispy skin and great flavor. I tried a bite of the lobster roll and thought it was delicious too, although my boyfriend didn't think it was as good as it was hyped up to be. He is a lobster roll snob and couldn't really find anything wrong with it, just said he thinks he would have preferred the cold lobster roll. One thing for sure is that they definitely do not skimp on the lobster meat! We also had some oysters and drinks. The oysters were fresh and they had a good variety that rotates frequently. The prices were very fair, especially in the North End area. We enjoyed the food and had a great time!

Reviews.Author: Chris W.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best restaurants in Boston, as evidenced by the fact that you can have an hour long wait at 3pm on weekday.  Swing by when you aren't in a rush though, and you can leave your name and cell number and roam the neighborhood until they have a table free up.  They have the best lobster roll in the city, and the oyster menu is killer.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Sarah K.
Reviews.Content: I grew up in a beach town where there was always an abundance of seafood. This reastaurant had excellent seafood and oysters but I honestly would not wait more than an hour to eat here. I recommend dinning in for lunch or trying off days like Monday to Wednesday. Other than the wait, everything else was great. Our waitress was very nice and made great suggestions. I had the Cioppino and my boyfriend got the scallops- both were cooked to perfection. My favorite oyster was the Kusshi... yummy!!!

Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: The only time I write reviews on Yelp if I think the overall rating is considerably off (either way); otherwise, I really don't have anything unique and meaningful to add.  That said, in this paritcular instance, I just don't understand the hype re: Neptune Oyster.  First, our party had to wait 3 to 4 hours on a Saturday night...beyond obnoxious.  It's a 38 seat restaurant, and the servers allow tables to linger until the patrons actually choose to get up.  If this is some kind of marketing ploy, fire your strategy agency because it only made me walk into the restaurant with a negative vibe.Let's move to the overall service after the 3-4 hour wait.  I was with a group of 4 that put it's name in at 6:15PM and was seated at 10PM.  Now, if I wasn't from out of town, I would have never stayed, but we had a gift certificate to use. Once we sat down, we ordered some beer and some wine, and then we ordered our meal.  8 different plates (including raw bar)...delivered in under 35 minutes total...with an average price of $25+ per plate, including appetizers.  Let me get this straight, you're gonna make me wait 3-4 hours to eat, and then try to rush me out in under and hour because your wait staff wants to go home at the end of the night?  Poor, poor form.  Now, the food.  Let's go 1 by 1 thru the dishes.  Blue Crab Cocktail...don't be fooled, it's a dip more than a crabmeat cocktail, which is what we were expecting.  The DIP, while tasty, was completely shredded and mixed with mayo, jalapeno, chive, and herbs.  While good, it was a dip, not a cocktail.  And for $24.95?  Pass. Enough said.  Dish 2..."made to order" Clam Chowder.  Really?  It arrived at the table within 90 seconds of ordering it.  And it was straight slop.  Heavy cream, which was not even closed to infused at all with the other ingredients.  The belly clams were quite tasty, but they were a standalone in the dish.  Everything was haphazard, nothing meshed, and the potatoes...what a total disaster.  The potatoes were hard.  Not crisp, really hard.  To the point of inedible.  Dish 3.  The fried belly (ipswich) clams.  Excellent.  Cooked perfectly, sweet, served with an excellent, spicy / lemon aioli.  Well executed.  Dish 4, raw bar.  Tough to screw this up as the chef can do nothing, other than to ensure the freshness of the fish and the temperature at which it's served.  Good on both counts, although the top necks that were shucked for me at the Farmer's Market outside the Union Oyster House yesterday were of better quality.  Meatier, more flavorful, same great temperature, and kept whole when shucked...sound crazy, but I am a clam connoisseur.    Fact.  Oysters (6 total, 3 West, 3 East Coast variety) well done.  Shrimp raw bar...overcooked to a rubbery consistency, plain and simple.  Terrible execution.  Dish 5 was the Yellowfin Tuna appetizer, which came out almost like a bruschetta...it was outstanding.  Yellowfin was a very high quality and portioned appropriately with the right amount of avocado as the other main ingredient in this dish.  Home run here.  Dish 6 was the Buttermilk JohnnyCake, which was sold to us by our waitress.  My reaction to this dish (and I like smoked fishes, caviar, etc)...what the f**k are you thinking?  Get this thing off the menu!!  It's basically a sweet cornmeal pancake w/ a slight balsamic glaze and a lump of smoked trout salad and sturgeon caviar on top.  First, the cornmeal pancake overpowers everything else in the dish.  Second, even if the trout salad and caviar could penetrate the ridiculous sweetness of the starch, there was nowhere near enough on the plate to offset the proportionally ridiculous size of the Johnnycake.  Fail, fail, fail.  Remove.Let's go to the 2 main courses.  Warm Lobster Roll.  Outstanding.  Cooked perfectly, great flavor, delicately separated meat, zero filler.  I'm more a cold lobster roll guy (with little to no filler), but this was outstanding.  Other main...Cippino, which was talked up by the waitress.  Only OK.  Good broth base, but zero seasoning.  The "saffron" rice was definitely in the long-grain category, but had zero saffron flavor...honestly, I'll point blank call the restaurant out here and tell them that I think they ran out of saffron and didn't use it.  Seafood was OK, nothing special.  Just a blah kind of dish, but what really rubbed me the wrong way was after ordering the dish, the waitress came back to the table and asked us if we wanted to "add" lobster to the dish.  We said no (because we were getting the lobster roll), and she kind of sighed and just walked away.  Everyone just looked at each other, and the expectation (true) was that the dish couldn't carry itself on its own.  Our suspicions were correct.  So there you have it.  We heard great things and read great things about Neptune.  Sorry to say though, it is very overhyped from both a food execution and overall service standpoint.  Even if the wait was 30 min instead of 3-4 hours, I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Author: Sophia P.
Reviews.Content: The wait here was a few hours, but the lobster roll was incredible. I'm not a huge fan of seafood, but this lobster roll was well worth the wait. Delicious!!!

Reviews.Author: Scot C.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely.  Fantastic.  This is all can say.  It is, in my humble opinion, one of the best places to go in Boston to get fresh seafood, let alone the famous Lobster Roll.We walked in without a reservation durning lunch on a Monday; the place (which reminds me of a scene out of an old 1930s or 40s movie) was jam-packed.  The hostess took my mobile number and we ventured back out to the North End to do some shopping to kill some time.  Five minutes later I got the call and we rushed back to grab our seats.  We sat right behind the oyster prep station, which is what I believe to be the best seats in the house, since you can watch the talent in prepping oysters AND look out the window into the street as passerbys gawk at the beautiful collection of raw oysters.  Speaking of...The oysters are fabulous, a myriad of fresh, local deliciousness that only New England can seem to deliver.  The list is impressive, I sampled about five or six different varieties, varying from salty to sweet with hints of metallic and champaign flavors.  I also ordered a bowl of clam chowder, which was hands down the best I've ever had.  Very creamy with succulent clams and potatoes.  I also split the famous lobster roll (hot with butter, recommended) and fries.  The lobster is impressive, extremely tender and flavorful on a toasted hoagie bun.  This is the dish to get at Neptune, hands down.If you're looking for a hole-in-the-wall local seafood joint in Boston, this is your stop.  If you like New England seafood, this is your stop.  I will go back to the Neptune anytime I'm in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Fiona D.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner on our only night in Boston and my bf wanted oysters. Used my handy Yelp app to find a good place and this one seemed like a winner. We get there and see the place is tiny. The wait will be at least 45 minutes. That seemed alright to us since we weren't starving or anything. We walked around a bit anyhow and got to stop in Mike's Pastry to get some dessert for after our dinner. After the wait, we finally got seated at a small cramped table shared with another couple. Kind of awkward sitting immediately next to another two people and trying to pretend they aren't there...Anyway, according to my bf all the oysters were amazing. I don't care for oysters personally so I didn't try any. I stupidly ordered something I do really like which was the stone crab claws. They were the worst crab claws I've had. Very mealy and mushy, not fresh tasting at all. A total disappointment but really, I only have myself to blame. Who the hell orders Florida seafood in Boston? Me. Because I am an idiot. We also had the clam chowder and beef tartar for starters. The clam chowder was really yummy. It's really thin though which I found odd but the menu says it's made to order so it makes sense that there isn't much time for it to get as thick. It's not sitting in a pot all day, it's made right after you order it. The flavor was amazing and the clams were nice and tender. Definitely the thing to order at this restaurant. The beef tartar was good but the anchovies on top overpowered the entire dish. Again, I ordered like an idiot. Should have gotten the fried oysters, not the beef! I'll like anything if it's fried.For the entree, my bf got the scallops and I had the lobster roll. Seriously, I don't know what was wrong with me that night but I guess since it was cold my brain must have been malfunctioning and I wanted the warm version with butter. Now, the lobster was delicious. The roll was packed with huge chunks of it and it was cooked nicely..but perhaps a touch over. However the warm butter made the roll very soggy and unappetizing for me. Should have stuck with the classic cold version! Ugh, what is wrong with me? The fries that came on the side with it though were absolutely delicious. Some of the best fries I've had. Wish I could do over my entire experience here because even though this place was good, I totally disappointed myself. I didn't think the wait was really worth it in the end and I have to say I would probably go elsewhere if I was told it would be any longer than 20 minutes. Don't make the same mistakes I did!

Reviews.Author: Victoria C.
Reviews.Content: I will forever remember Neptune Oyster as the place that made me an oyster snob! I love oysters but don't get to eat them much because they are so expensive and of course I live on the west coast so I don't get the variety sold on the east coast. But since I was on vacation, I went all out here!On a Thursday around 2pm, the wait was about 30 mins. I was expecting much worse so I considered myself fortunate. The place is tiny. Most seats are either at the few tables there are. I love the huge selection of oysters I was able to pick from. The other items on the menu like their clam chowder of other seafood items there were not part of the raw bar took a while to get. The kitchen just seemed very busy. I didn't get to try anything else except for the chowder and oysters but both were delicious! Oysters are of course expensive so think the price of this place is comparable to other places in Boston. It's basically market price.This is definitely a place I will go to every time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Sergey S.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great Lobster Roll, your search is over!

Reviews.Author: Heshan W.
Reviews.Content: If you want authentic and top quality oysters, then this is the place for you!My friend had the oysters, and he told it they were quite good.  They have a list of various oysters from all over the New England area. I had the clam chowder, it was nice and rich, not too thick. I would say one the best clam chowders I've had in a long time. Although, I wish they served it in a bread bowl :/ Small seafood joint, so expect a long wait, but its worth it.

Reviews.Author: Laila B.
Reviews.Content: This place is so adorable that I felt like I stumbled onto the set of a romantic comedy. My party of four was seated within minutes (we arrived around 8pm on a Monday night), which was a pleasant surprise. They have an extensive oyster menu and so I started off with a few of those. Delicious. Sadly, they were out of the scallops that everyone at my table wanted. To make it worse, the part next to us had gotten the aforementioned scallops and they taunted me all night.  Anyway, I got some appetizer with octopus and cauliflower, golden raisins and almonds maybe? I can't remember exactly and their online menu is not up-to-date. It was outstanding. I also tasted the mussels (good, but mine was better) and the lobster spaghettini (not AT ALL worth the $38 price tag). Staff was pleasant and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Author: Julia C.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the much raved about lobster spaghettini. It was a huge disappointment -- really did not like the extra breadcrumbs on a bed of pasta -- it did not add anything to the dish except bad texture. It was also flavorless and there wasn't even any salt on the table. You might ask, have I tried asking for salt and pepper? Why yes! After we placed our drink and food order and received said items, we were unable to get our waiter's attention until it was time to get the check. Super cramped eating area, negligent service, and subpar food? No thanks. I would highly recommend taking a quick ride down the green line to Island Creek Oyster Bar in Kenmore for seafood pasta, lobster rolls, oysters, excellent service, and plenty more space.

Reviews.Author: Lillian C.
Reviews.Content: This place is on the BEST list for lobster rolls and oysters so of course I had to come pay a visit. We came on a weekday a little before they opened for lunch (around 11:15) and there was already a couple of people in line. Good thing we came early since the place is pretty tiny and got packed pretty much instantly as they opened. We ordered some oysters to start and they were delicious and fresh! We also tried the buttermilk johnnycake, which isn't something I'd normally order, but turned out to be DELICIOUS!!! Next, we got the PEI mussels. The sauce was so good and went so well with the bread. The mussels were a good size and also fresh. And my main entree was the lobster roll of course, with salad instead of fries. It came piping hot and I devoured it so quickly! The lobster was so buttery... I want to go back now! The prices are pretty consistent with quality seafood and I would come back more often if it didn't always have such a long line...

Reviews.Author: Stephanie B.
Reviews.Content: BEST LOBSTER ROLL.THE BEST.For my second trip to Boston, I was determined to get a lobster roll. Neptune is a small restaurant nestled in North End, so you are likely to wait quite a while for seats. Luckily, they'll call you once they have space for you, which, for tourist such as ourselves, allowed us to explore the neighborhood. Btw - side note - I really loved the North End (during our wait, my friend and I even had time to visit Paul Revere's house! so cool!!!). Anyway, we ate at the bar. Shared a lobster roll and ordered some fresh oysters! I don't quite remember what type of oysters we got because once I tried the lobster roll, my mind exploded. Or my tummy. I think we got it cold? Regardless, that ish was packed with huge yummy pieces of lobster. The bun was perfectly toasted with butter. Ugh. So simple yet so fulfilling. It was love.

Reviews.Author: Kimiko L.
Reviews.Content: It was our first time here and my fiance and I were really excited... but we didn't know exactly what to order. When we asked the server about the triton plateau, he simply said it was an assortment of seafood, then walked away. We caught his attention a few minutes later to ask a second time and were told that it had oysters, clams, mussels, crab and lobster cocktails, and shrimp. We ordered the plateau and a bowl of clam chowder to split.Overall, the food quality was decent. The oysters were the best part of the meal. I wasn't expecting the thin consistency of the clam chowder, but my fiance really liked the flavor. On the con side, there were shells in the crab cocktail and the clams. The lobster cocktail had a little too much onion for me.I didn't think the food was anything special and the service could have been way better. Don't get sucked into the hype.

Reviews.Author: Yuan C.
Reviews.Content: So many different oysters to choose, but I can barely tell the difference :p

Reviews.Author: Christine H.
Reviews.Content: I came here specifically for the lobster roll! It comes hot or cold. I chose to get it hot per the server's recommendation/multiple yelp reviewers. It's definitely pricey ($27) but they give you plenty of lobster! It's covered in a warm buttery sauce that just soaks into the bread. Ugh this is just soo good! It also comes with a side of fries, which was a nice salty compliment to the sandwich. I also chose a lager that paired nicely with this meal. You know this is a perfect combo when the people on both sides of you are ordering the exact same thing!

Reviews.Author: Adriana T.
Reviews.Content: Another ridiculous restaurant with ridiculous 'policies' Saturday night-we decided to go there because we ve never been there before and we heard good things about it. We walked in, we were looking to get 2 seats at the bar -so far so good. While we were walking in a couple at the bar just left. When we were about to grab the seats the bartender goes we are on a THREE hours wait. Okay that's fine but there was NOT one person waiting and to not be able to grab 2 seats at the bar?? Usually they reserve tables not the bar..Anyway, RIDICULOUS

Reviews.Author: Mary Grace T.
Reviews.Content: NOMS. I've recently taken a liking to oysters and when in Boston... blah blah blah. I thought their oyster menu was fun and informative. I don't like oysters that are too salty so this helped me avoid wasting my money. Now I don't remember which oysters we had but all of them were delicious. They all had a nice crunch to them and definitely tasted fresh. Something not to miss getting is the Lobster Roll. I personally like it cold, but the boyfriend ordered it warm with melted butter, equally delicious and super succulent. I also ordered the Neptunes on Piggy. If I wasn't already so full I know I would have enjoyed them 75% more. Still, they were so good and rich! Me love some fried oysters  Everyone told us to go here, and since we're smart, we went during a non peak time, 3pm on a weekday. My only gripe was that the girls who worked there seemed to be having their own little party. They had cake and were a little distracting while I was sitting at the bar. I just thought it was a little unprofessional and hence me taking one star away. I will definitely be back with more friends the next time we are in BAH-STAHN.

Reviews.Author: Theresa C.
Reviews.Content: I really, really wanted to love this place. I read the rave reviews, had friends that loved it and couldn't wait to get in. This was going to be the highlight of my dining experience. Oh boy was I let down. We only had to wait for 45 minutes because we got in right as they open. We were seated at the bar. A word of caution, you are cramped at the bar and of course, everyone is bumping into you moving back and forth in the restaurant. It's really packed and I noticed there were not a lot of locals in the restaurant. This place seemed to cater to the tourist crowd. So time for moment of truth. I wanted to have what everyone is raving about. I ordered the clam chowder and lobster roll. The chowder had a great taste, plenty of potatoes and clams but was really salty. The famous hot lobster roll was well... underwhelming. Yes it's a ton of lobster meat but it was rubbery, overcooked meat. I felt like I was chewing forever just to eat the sandwich. No taste either on the lobster. It was hot bland mess. My mom couldn't even finish it because the lobster was so chewy. The best part of the dish were the fries and that's even a stretch. I really feel for the price tag of $92 (soup, lobster roll and one beer), I should have a meal that was edible. I don't mind paying extra for a meal but it has to be good. Complete disaster! I could go to Union St and get a better, tastier lobster roll. The one bright spot was our waitress. She was such a sweetie. Filling up our water and apologizing for how long our food was taking in the kitchen. I only wish her excitement could match the quality of food being served. This is an one and done. I tried it but I won't be back. This place is extremely overrated!

Reviews.Author: Christopher P.
Reviews.Content: No announcement of closure for Easter Sunday. Not on website not on phone line.  Found out from a contractor doing work that no one was inside and only after waiting until Noon after the regular open time leaving a line of hungry customers angry and cold.

Reviews.Author: Elleen P.
Reviews.Content: Dang.. I had no idea that this place was one of those "must-try" places in Boston. My friend was in town for a few hours, and she wanted seafood, so Yelp directed us here. We went in, gave them my phone number, and the waitress said she'd call when they had a table ready. Honestly, for the amount of traffic they get, they should expand. But anyways, we walked around for about 45 minutes, then she called us to come back. We were seated at the same table as another party of two (the table was meant for a party of 4) which was awkward, but oh well. We were happy to be seated. Since my friend and I were on a college student budget, we got 8 oysters, 2 shrimp, and a lobster roll to split and it came out to be around $60. I personally don't like oysters, but my friend was pretty happy with them. The lobster roll was great.. buttery and warm, it kinda fell apart in my hands but it was still great to eat with a fork. Overall, although prices were steep, I think it was reasonable for the quality of food that they serve. It was definitely worth it -- seafood is fresh and food quality is stellar. We didn't drink, so can't comment on that, but 5 stars for food.

Reviews.Author: Regina F.
Reviews.Content: LAH-B-STAHNow that I have that out of my system, on to realer things:Walking into Neptune is sort of like sauntering into a 1920s soda fountain, only sexier. Instead of a malts and milkshakes, the black tie waiters at Neptune will entice you with a comprehensive wine selection. Instead of tap soda, the bar is lined with a bounty of the most sultry beers. Where a whimsical teenager would usually be seen scooping ice cream, a sagacious oyster man shucks the freshest catches from the sea - his hands skillfully, and elegantly, opening the glistening shells, and placing the prizes over ice. Marble tables are quickly, and attentively filled with a rich feast: the hot buttered lobster roll is opulent beyond compare. The toasted roll serves as a merely functional vehicle for resting shimmering, warm, tender, juicy chunks of the choicest shell fish. Not to be crude - or maybe just a little bit - if a lobster must die, he justice will only be properly revered if served smothered in just the right amount of butter at Neptune.And then there's the side...the fries. These are simply the paragon potato pieces served anywhere in the bean. Rustic, golden, occasionally limp, mostly crispy - the french fries are a delicate, but necessary, accessory to the shiny sea sandwich.Oh...and...not that anyone else cares, but Neptune is a Scorpio. I know this because we were both born on November 7.

Reviews.Author: Jack K.
Reviews.Content: Here on Thursday night around 7ish and the wait was already 1.5 hour long... the place is pretty compact and the server/hostess asked everyone on the wait list to come back when it's their time. So we did... walked around the blocks several times, and eventually waited outside... time went by super slow as I stood by the door-front freezing my butt off while everyone inside was enjoying warm delicious seafood. Thought to myself, this better be worth the hype!As it turned out... it was! We were seated and served with the utmost friendly service. Really enjoyed a good selection of fresh oysters and jumbo shrimp cocktails. As for the lobster roll, the sweet buttery flavors soaked at the bottom of the soft fluffy toasted roll combined fresh chunks of lobster meat... it's was so heavenly tasty! I will definitely come back again, except in a warm season.

Reviews.Author: Court S.
Reviews.Content: Hot lobster roll w/ side of fries. Expect to wait at least 1.5 hours on the weekends. Sitting is tight so please don't go there with an attitude & ruin your neighbors meal. The staff is very friendly. Hot lobster roll w/ side of fries. Hot lobster roll with a side of fries. And a coke or rootbeer to wash it down.

Reviews.Author: Rob R.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a very popular spot in North Beach so be prepared to wait awhile for a table. With that said, what's cool about it is they take your phone # and call you when you're table is ready. Since you're in North Beach (Little Italy) it's a nice opportunity to walk around and check out some sites, shops, etc. in order to kill some time. Just a quick side note, North Beach totally blows away the lil 3 block joke of a Little Italy we have here in NYC. Anyway, I had my first lobster roll ever here at Neptune along with a nice tall glass of Sam Adams and it was heaven. I would imagine Neptune gets it right since they're all the rage. You know what they say...you never forget your first so Neptune Oyster will always hold a special place in my heart lol :-)

Reviews.Author: Jess C.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I waited over FOUR hours to eat here. And you know what? It was worth it.We put in our names around 5PM, walked around the North End, got cannolis from Mike's and Modern Pastry, got drinks @ Drink, and came back at 9PM to wait some more. So I can honestly tell you we were neither bored nor hungry.They won't call you when your table is ready, so you need to come back on your own. At around 10PM, we were seated! For such a popular spot, Neptune is tiny! There are no more than 20 seats (bar included) in the whole place.We got the Beausoleil oysters from Shippagan, NB, Kumamoto oysters from Willapa Bay, WA, and Kusshi oysters from Vancouver, BC. All of them were incredibly fresh and clean. The Beausoleil oysters were my favorite with the light aftertaste of champagne. The Kusshi oysters were refreshing with its cucumber finish.The clams were great! I loved the clear, flavorful broth with bits of corn and tomato. It wasn't too salty and the flavor palate was wonderful. Later, I tried to dip everything in sight in this broth haha.The clam chowder was interesting. It was served in a very flat bowl (or rounded plate) and tasted different from what I'm used to. It was very smooth, but a lot less milky than usual.The lobster roll was pretty good. It was rich, buttery, and seasoned. They used the good parts of the lobster meat and not an overpowering amount of mayo (like some other places). The highlight of the night was definitely the dinner special, the lobster risotto. This dish could have been disastrous, but it wasn't. It was AH-MAZING! The risotto was cooked to perfection and it wasn't too creamy or heavy. You could taste the lobster in every single bite, which is a feat in itself, and the corn kernels gave the dish a bit of sweetness.The hostess was very snappish and rude, especially when we called three hours in to check the status, but I have to give it to her - she has a pretty tough job and she needs attitude to do it. Still, just know that she will express no remorse for having you wait so long.Overall, the food was absolutely phenomenal, some of the freshest and most flavorful seafood I've had, and I totally get why the lines are so long. With that said, I took off one star for the long wait, but if you plan out your visit properly, it shouldn't be too bad.

Reviews.Author: Nga C.
Reviews.Content: With all the stellar reviews on Yelp, I was really expecting more!! A lot more but the only thing that was a lot was my BILL!!!In general I don't mind paying extra when it comes to good food, especially seafood. Since I'm a seafood addict, I will fork whatever I can sink my teeth into for fresh sweet nectar from the sea. Without hesitation, I immediately went for the Buttered Lobster Roll with Fries on the side. Although their lobster was plentiful, it was very over cooked, tough and rubbery -- not exactly what I was expecting!! As for the roll, it was soggy with lobster liquid instead of butter so eating it the traditional way was impossible. Instead, my friends and I had to eat most of the lobster first before we could attempt to hold the bread so it didn't fall apart. As for their fries, it was very yummy and cooked perfectly!! If you do go here, keep in mind, their space is very tight and it's not ideal for group dinning. For three people, my friends and I had to wait about 1 hour and 45 min. My suggestion to you is to get here around 10:30am, put down your name and number and they will call you when a table becomes available so you can stroll around and get back during lunch time. I think for the price tag and the wait, this restaurant is seriously overrated but people will probably still flock here because of the mysterious yelp repetition that it has received.

Reviews.Author: Samantha M.
Reviews.Content: My coworker insisted we try this place. Trusting his opinion in restaurants we arrived and were told it would be an hour wait. We ended up waiting and hour and half. I ordered the lobster roll, warm, with butter. The lobster roll was amazing. There was a very generous portion of lobster meat and it wasn't drenched in butter. The roll was also very soft and held up to all of the meat and butter.The reasons I'm giving it three stars is because of the long wait, set realistic expectations so I don't get frustrated. The second is because the fries that came with the lobster roll we slightly soggy and only had sea salt on them. I expected some old bay or celery salt, nope. Lastly, I ordered the Syrah which wasn't really that good. I'd recommend going for the seafood and setting expectations low for anything else.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany W.
Reviews.Content: Neptune is a cute little restaurant located in North End, but just like I found several other places in the area, it was small and crowded. At 3pm on a Monday, my boyfriend and I dropped in and were seated within the first few minutes of standing around. Although, that was after we were asked to get up from the empty seats at the bar just to be re-seated there a minute later. So note to self: don't sit down anywhere unless the hostess or bartender allows you sit in that area. But in the end, the service was great and our bartender/waitress was awesome. I had a field day at the raw bar and tried almost everything on their list. My favorites were:* Kumamoto - small oyster but don't underestimate how delicious these are. They're extremely plumped and super sweet, with a creaminess that just melts in your mouth. It's description says that the Kumamoto gives a honeydew melon finish and it does not disappoint. Hands down my favorite of the bunch.* Kusshi - another oyster not to underestimate or overlook due to its size. The cucumber finish was immediate, and the description of "low salt and sweet" was defined correctly. * Shrimp Cocktail - this was huge! It filled me up 100%. I didn't think the shrimp was as tender as others that I've had but it was SO HUGE, I am not holding anything against it.* Jonah Crab Claws - MUST HAVE. I can't even put in words how delicious the claw was... it was just that wonderful!!I say skip the clams. Not worth it, and the littleneck clams taste so much better in a clam chowder, but not by itself. And speaking of chowder, pass here. I'm a fan of traditional chowder (you know... thick and chowder-y), but Neptune's Clam Chowder was like clam potato soup. It was extremely oily and had way too much potatoes and not enough clams. The taste was good but I don't think it was worth the $11. That money would've been better spent ordering more Kumamoto oysters.

Reviews.Author: John-Paul P.
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to my meal at Neptune Oyster. I really wanted to like this place and thought it would be as amazing as everyone else had described it to be, but in the end, I can't think of a meal more anticipated that left me more disappointed.My girlfriend and I recently came here around 5:15 on a Thursday afternoon. Bear in mind that unless you come here between 2 and 4, or after 9, expect a wait. Just an FYI that a wait was expected and I'm not complaining about that, as it wasn't bad at all - they told us 75 minutes and called us back after an hour saying that our table was ready. Despite the place being very busy, the staff who took our name for the wait list, as well the staffer who called us back, were both very friendly.Moving inside, the place is packed and tiny. People also walk in with babies and young children, so it can be challenging to move around, especially when people are trying to carry collapsed stollers through to store back by the kitchen while they eat.Ok, so to eat? I had really been anticipating their lobster roll ($27) and ordered that. As for my girlfriend, she had the Flash Seared Nantucket Yellowfin Tuna ($34). I had the lobster roll served Connecticut style, which is just warm, with butter. I looked over the raw bar menu and while it looked tempting, we just stuck with our entrees and water to drink.When our food arrived, what others have said about Neptune's Lobster Roll is very true - it is epic! It huge and filled with a lot of lobster. The brioche roll is soft as well and it a nice touch, as compared to a hot dog bun.Unfortunately, that's where the good stuff ends. In terms of taste and flavor, the lobster roll was very disappointing. Both the roll and the lobster were saturated with butter, and I mean really, terribly oversaturated. Perhaps I made a mistake and asked for lobster with my warm butter roll? I've also tasted fresher lobster meat. Not that what they were serving had gone bad, but it really didn't have the taste of the ocean.I also tried some of my girlfriend's tuna and when it comes to flash searing, Neptune's definitely nailed the cooking technique. It was perfectly flash seared. However, in the end, this dish was also disappointing. It may have been perfectly flash seared, but it didn't seem to have any seasoning or flavor to it whatsoever. In the end, just the Lobster Roll and Seared Tuna, with tax and tip, came to $75.I'm sure the raw bar here is top notch. Definitely no complaints about the service. Perhaps that itself will warrant a second visit, or maybe the clam chowder? We shall see. I don't doubt there is greatness at Neptune's, we just didn't find it on our first visit.

Reviews.Author: Thai-Anh H.
Reviews.Content: Honestly do not know what the big deal is.  I live in the neighborhood and always pass this place and seeing crazy lines.  I decided to get the famous lobster roll to go after hearing so much about it.  The lobster roll consisted of bun and lobster meat with drizzle of butter and a side of fries.  The Fries were crunchy and great.  The lobster was sizable portion compare to the other that I've tried in Boston.  I would venture to say it's 1.5x the size of others.  It was good but not great!  I honestly do not know what the hype is about.  Also, the price is obnoxious.  It's also twice the price of other lobster rolls out there.  If it was mind blowing, I would shell out for it.  I haven't tried anything else here so I can't comment.

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice, romantic lunch at  Neptune Oyster. If you are driving in, my tip is to go on a Sunday, vastly improving parking options, and to hit it early or off hours between breakfast and lunch. The first seating is at 11:30, and by arriving at 12:15 we only had about a 15 minute wait.The tables are beautiful, heavy marble and I love the atmosphere. My husband had the clam chowder and I grabbed a bite. It was good, light tasting for a cream based soup.They don't have mimosas, but I had two delicious glasses of champagne. We started at the raw bar with Watch Hill and Kumamoto oysters, both of which were delicious. I preferred the Watch Hill. We also had 2 shrimp cocktail shrimp. Mine must have been an ocean bully as he was about six inches long.Then he had the lobster roll and I had Maine Lobster Salad with heirloom tomatoes, basil vinaigrette, mozzarella di bufala Campana, upland cress, and cracked pepper. He claims he has had better lobster rolls, but did he offer me a bite, oh no he did not. So, a little suspicion on that. My salad was delicious. Incredibly fresh, very light dressing, and a generous serving of lobster and mozzarella.It's a bit of a squeeze, but for me, the victory of scoring a table made the lobster all the sweeter.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra A.
Reviews.Content: Perfect - other than the no reservation business. Put your name on the list in advance and go across the street for a glass of wine. Recommended:- mussel appetizer (with fries to dip in the broth)- ichabod flat oysters- lobster roll

Reviews.Author: Donald S.
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER ever come back to this establishment again. This review is based solely on service and waiting etiquette. I don't care how amazing the food is at any restaurant, if you have terrible customer service, it will leave you with a sour taste in your mouth and ruin a perfectly good meal.We were seated at the bar. The bartender/waiter was the biggest douchebag in the world of food serving. He deliberately took his sweet time taking down our orders and especially when it was time for me to ask for the check. I mentioned to him that I had a bus to catch, in which he should have obviously realized the sense of urgency for the check. But no, the bartender was busy chatting to the bloke NEXT to me, mind you the register is only about two yards in front of me. I grew very impatient because at this point, it's been at least 15-20 minutes since we finished our meals and asked for the check. It was clear that he was doing it intentionally. I wanted to stiff that sob on his tip so bad, he was lucky I ended up leaving a $5 tip. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Author: Shawn H.
Reviews.Content: Crazy busy...a bit over-hyped IMO.Was the food good?  Yes of course it was...hence my 4 star review and the 4 1/2 star overall rating.  You already know the food is good even without you dining here lol.Was the food good enough to wait 3-4hrs+ with no option for reservation?  NOI dunno about the locals, but as a tourist, ain't nobody got time for dis wait!  I didn't want to spend my ENTIRE day trying to eat at this restaurant, so we hit the restaurant an hour or so after it opened, and STILL had a 2hr wait time.Enough with the rant, on to the food!I tried the Katama Bay, Browne's Point, East Beach Blonde, and Kusshi Oysters ($2.70-2.90) with a Jonah Crab Claw ($5.25). These were all pretty tasty! A little bit of shell/dirt hiding in one, but they were all pretty clean and not too briny tasting!  The crab claw was not bad, but I would use the money towards two more oysters next time.I also tried the Neptune Burger ($19): Cheddar Cheese, Fried Oysters, Garlic Mayo, Relish and Fries. This was an excellent burger! Super juicy and fatty, nice crispy fried oysters with just the right amount of salty briny taste.  This was a very good combination and I enjoyed it very much.But is it enough for me to come back?  No...not really.Especially since ICOB takes reservations, has plenty of elbow room, prices are the same, and the fact that I enjoyed their Oysters better there.Can't go wrong either way!  But my patience is low...esp on a busy vacation schedule!Check out the pics :

Reviews.Author: Patricia C.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster truly lives up to the HYPE!Reiterating what other fellow Yelpers have already said...YOU MUST TRY...THE MAINE LOBSTER ROLL!!! (oh the deliciously fresh chunky lobsters on toasted buttery roll!)There are 2 types of lobster rolls to choose from.  1.  Hot with Butter and.. 2. Cold with Mayo.  I, personally, liked the hot with butter more, but my fiancé favored the cold with mayo.  SO it depends on your own preference.  Simply order both to try!  =PAfter dining here, our Boston trip was complete!  =)Wish there is a Neptune Oyster in NyC so that I can have their lobster roll more often.. =/WARNING:  No reservation!  Expect a 1 to 2 hours wait before getting seated.  Leave your name and number and the host will call you back!  Our supposedly 2 hours wait turned into 1, so it was not bad.  You can go shop around in Quincy Market before the call back.  =) ..Worth the wait.  Worth the price.  Worth the hype..

Reviews.Author: Ashton A.
Reviews.Content: It's a very small place... Wait can be horrible. 1 1/2 hours if you go at the wrong time.I have eaten her several time... Food is consistently good but pricy. Don't go at peak dinner or lunch times... Earlier or later.shrimp and grits are great!

Reviews.Author: Danielle M.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a great oyster back with fresh seafood and Neptewn delivered! There wasnt a lot of seating so I go there early. I started with the fried clams that were outstanding. A new england favorite, but I dont remember them being this good! See my photos for the visuals...I next went for the lobster roll because of all the reviews. I got the hot one with butter...so delicious! The lobster was so fresh...we just cant get it like this on the west coast. They also had a great wine list...I left there a very happy girl.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: Probably a 4.5, especially in the food climate of Boston. The oysters are, as to be expected, excellent. So many choices and each with a nice description that I found very accurate. I had lobster which was also very good. Ultimately this is a smaller restaurant but worth the wait, put your name on the list and go walk to town and work up an appetite and you will ultimately enjoy whatever you have here. Please note, I am writing this as a west coast food fanatic that only believes in YELP as a food review site and use it in every city I go. I also note that yelp scores are not equal in different cities so please always consider that when you are using it.

Reviews.Author: J C.
Reviews.Content: This place is over-rated.  First, there is just no place worth waiting 3 hours !Second, this place is very expensive.The question is, with the long wait and price, is the food that good ?  I say no.Their Lobster roll comes with fries, but because of the long waiting line they seem to cook the fries ahead of time or something. They were very greasy and stale. The price is a whopping $25 (vs $18, 19 at other places with equal or better taste). Perhaps the oysters might be worthy of a visit, but again, there are many places in Boston that serve oysters at a better cost and little waiting time.... I don't understand those who gave this place 5 stars....  Just order oysters if you want try 'Neptune Oysters", but forget about other dishes...

Reviews.Author: Diana G.
Reviews.Content: All the reviews for Neptune Oyster are correct: 1. Yes, there's a 2+ hour wait, so plan accordingly (i.e.get there as soon as they open) If you do find yourself waiting for an extended length of time, I recommend going elsewhere in the meantime to have dessert first. :P2. Yes, the hot buttered lobster roll is last-meal-on-Earth-worthy. 3. The oysters are indeed the perfect appetizer. I recommend trying one of each kind. Wash them down with a glass of Prosecco.  Next time: I am getting the Triton Plateau and I'm not sure I plan on sharing! :P

Reviews.Author: Michelle R.
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6pm and then waited nearly 3 hours on a Saturday night. We were finally seated at around 9.Overall was not disappointed after reading all the reviews, though I didn't find it mind-blowing either. The oysters were fresh but you can find the same oysters at some other place that doesn't have as long of a wait. Lobster roll was VERY VERY good. Very generous portions of lobster with a lot of butter. Almost impossible to eat with your hands - I opted for a fork and knife halfway through. The accompanying fries were well-seasoned but otherwise a little soggy -- nothing special.We also had the flash-seared tuna... this was a pretty decently sized chunk of tuna which was basically rare on the inside. Good quality but lacking in flavor as there wasn't enough sauce!! Basically felt like I was eating a giant plain piece of sashimi. It wasn't bad, but don't think I would order again.4 stars for the amazing lobster roll and all-around fresh seafood, but NOT worth waiting 2-3 hours for. Would come back when the wait is closer to 30-45 min to have the lobster roll again and try some of the other items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Darryl P.
Reviews.Content: HAD to try the infamous Neptune Oyster while in Boston 2 weeks ago. First nite, 3 hour wait ( surprised, but not unexpected)...try again...Second afternoon, 1 hr wait turned into a call 30 min later! Were way across North End... No prob & they held our table. Host very nice. Server a bit slow, served people sat after us before us. Oysters A+...we live in Seattle & know our NW oysters & had to try NE oysters... Very nice. Split lobster roll (hot)  w/hubby. Nice sandwich & much fell out, so son got a few juicy morsels...tiny place, but worth the stop!

Reviews.Author: Erin C.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for charm, 4.5 stars for the food. Great small place in the north end - very euro feel. We had the lobster roll and fries. Both were great -- if the lobster roll didn't cost 27 I'd probably give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Cathy C.
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to have our first meal on our first night in Boston here but there was a 3-hr wait by 7pm so, we went somewhere else.  We tried to make a reservation for a different day but they don't take reservations EVER! Bullocks!  The advice given to us by one of the servers was to get their as soon as they open which is at 11:30am.  We had other things on our itinerary so we ended up going at noon the next day.  There was still an hour wait.  So, I talked to the people waiting in line, we went to the dessert shoppe next door and  walked around the area to kill time.  After an hour and a half, I got a seat at the bar.  It's a very small place and it does feel cramped. Patience ran low from servers to the about-to-be-if-you-don't-walk-out-from-the-­ridiculous-wait diners. So, I got a platter of oysters from a list of the many varieties of oysters they serve.  Not sure why I did that...I could only eat like 6 so everything went to waste.  They tasted fresh but a bit grimy.  I also got a lobster roll with butter which comes with fries.  The lobster roll was so warm, buttery and delicious.  The lobster juices and the butter made the roll soggy though so I had to eat it with a fork and knife. The fries were made from real potatoes. It may be the best lobster roll in Boston (I've had better in Maine though).  It was good but I couldn't finish it though. The wait killed my appetite.Next time I'm in Boston, I'd still come back here for the lobster roll.  I'm hoping that by then, they would start taking reservations.

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place is so incredibly overrated and overpriced. Came here for lunch with my boyfriend on our visit to Boston, luckily it was a Wednesday and there was no waiting time! Between the two of us, we shared a clam chowder and a lobster roll. These two items ended up costing us a whopping $45....that's crazy. I could have had a really nice steak for that price.Anyways.....onwards to the food:Clam chowder: There were pieces of shells from the clams in the chowder.......are you kidding? The potatoes were also undercooked. And while it was more watery than the traditional clam chowders that I'm used to in California, it was light and not bad. Just not great. Lobster Roll: So not worth the price. The roll's pretty small, and yeah, it's filled with lobster, but guess what? You can taste that the lobster isn't exactly high grade and super fresh. Very disappointing. I've had better lobster rolls off of food trucks. Point is, this place isn't worth the wait or your money. Go somewhere else for your Boston goodies!

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Boston, and based on the yelp reviews, I decided to try this place for dinner.  When we got there, we were advised it was a three hour wait. WOW!  I figured that although they said the wait was three hours, it was likely that a lot of people already on the list wouldn't wait around, they'd find somewhere else to eat, rather than waiting until ten pm to eat seafood.  NOPE.  We got in exactly three hours later.  As I made my way to the bar, I mentioned, "for a three hour wait, this place better be damn good."It was.  It was really, really good.  We received a little menu where you could mark your oyster choices.  The oyster choices were labeled with descriptions, which made it really easy to choose.  Then we had the much-vaunted lobster rolls.  You had a choice between lobster roll served cold with mayonnaise, or lobster roll served warm in butter.  We chose the warm version. They are every bit as good as other reviewers have said.  The service was good, the food was good, and the next time I come to Boston, I'll eat here again, and happily wait three hours to do so.

Reviews.Author: Kelly D.
Reviews.Content: Upon conducting research on places to eat while I was in Boston, I determined this was a place I absolutely had to try. This was my last dining experience in that city and it definitely upheld to the saying, "Save the best for last!"We wanted to try everything on the menu but decided on the following: Buttermilk Johnnycake, P.e.i Mussels, Maine Lobster Roll (warm w/ butter) and a series of raw oysters. Now I'm not a raw oyster connoisseur so I'm not going to even attempt to give a descriptive review on the oysters, but based on my experience, all the oysters we tried were absolutely as fresh as can be. However, the Buttermilk Johnnycake was perfection. The blend of ingredients was nothing I have ever tried/tasted before. It is an absolute must have if you go to Neptune's! The Maine Lobster Roll was also fantastic. The lobster was mouthwatering and they give you a very generous portion. I can't give you a full description of the clams as I was completely stuffed after eating the other dishes to even try the clans we ordered. A lot of the reviews indicated that there is a long wait. I can see this being the case as the place is rather small. We went at 3ish on a Monday afternoon and waited for about 15-20 mins. We had told the hostess that we had to catch a flight and she did her absolute best to accommodate us. I will certainly visit this place again when I visit Boston!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen L.
Reviews.Content: this review is insanely overdue.Was here on a foodie excursion from Chicago, on the way to Lobster Fest in Maine. Resorting to Yelp, and on a seafood kick, my bestie and I went here. There was a line, we had to wait for a seat, ended up at the bar, but it did. not. matter.I've always thought lobster rolls appeared unimpressive and just too simple.Oh. My. Lord.Everything about it was delicious, mouth-watering, heavenly, and I just didn't want it to end. This one broke my virginity when it comes to lobster rolls, but will also set the gold standard. Plus, it's hot (after sampling others that can never come close), which most lobster rolls come cold.We also tried several oysters, and did not disappoint. Love everything about this place. Is a must if you leave seafood and are in Boston. but just be warned. larger parties are probably harder to fit in this joint.

Reviews.Author: Christopher B.
Reviews.Content: I know I'm in the minority. People rave about this place. I think it is overrated. Let me start by saying that I'm allergic to bivalves, so I cannot eat most items on the menu. But my wife loves seafood, and this restaurant, so we waited to go until Wednesday, when Neptune offers a fish and chips special.I've had fish and chips just about everywhere. The fries were delicious, some of the best I've had anywhere. But the fish, while cooked perfectly, was so chewy and stringy that I could not finish most of it. Literally, I could not chew it to bits enough so I could swallow it. I later learned that they use skate wing for the fish and chips. There is a reason every other restaurant uses a basic flaky white fish, like haddock or cod, and the skate ruined the meal.I encouraged my wife to try something other than the lobster roll (she usually gets the lobster roll), which I understand to be quite good, but which is certainly not worth the $27 price tag. She tried and loved the vitello tonnato sandwich. Pulled veal and raw tuna created a great, unique sandwich. She also loved the oysters she tried. Despite any thoughts about the food, I just do not understand the fuss. We went on a Wednesday night, there was a 45 minute wait for 2 people, they ask you to leave the restaurant because it is so small you can't wait, and after we were finally seated, we were packed into a space for one at the bar, and right next to the door. I had to wear my coat throughout the meal.All in all, high quality food, great selection of exotic raw bar options, but avoid the fish and chips and be prepared for a lengthy wait.

Reviews.Author: Gary S.
Reviews.Content: Update 2 years later:Returned to Neptune and learned from my previous mistake and got my name in early. I still waited but I wandered the North End during a summer weekend festival, which was pretty cool. Overall wait during a summer evening for a party of 1? about 90 minutes.I took in about 12 oysters, all from the NE and East Coast, with the exception of my favorite Kumamotos (BC). They tasted exactly as I remembered. Buttery, briney, and delish.I tried the clam chowder which was quite a surprise. Smooth and not too rich. The tuna tartare was served on a toast point which was one of the best I've had. I also struck up great conversation with Ann, one of the wait staff behind the bar, and another woman whose name escapes me. She was very friendly, cared about her work greatly and ensured I had a great dining experience. Despite the wait, I'm glad I returned to Neptune. They continue to exceed my expectations.

Reviews.Author: Bryan L.
Reviews.Content: Like so many other have written, THIS is the place for oyster opulence. They serve only the the best and they serve them very fresh. But that's not what keeps me coming back. The Lobsta roll does!!!  I've had it both ways and love them both equally. I kinda wish I could get one that was 1/2&1/2....  But I digress!  I guess if I HAD to pick a favorite it would be......  Conn style. Hot and buttered. OMG.. I'm drooling... I take this stuff way too seriously.And tourists/visitors/people with free time... I have a tip for you. Don't come to Neptune at 7:00PM and ask for a seat. Do like i've done several times. Come between lunch and dinner... on a week day. I have NEVER waited one cotton pickin second for a seat here. I've always walked right in and sat down. Timing is everything!!!

Reviews.Author: Marcus A.
Reviews.Content: The hype on this place is somewhat overrated but a great seafood meal can still be found here. The restaurant is the size of a walk in closet.......hence the incredibly long wait that many complain about. However, they will take your cell phone number and give you a call when your spot is ready, allowing you to do other things (stroll the North End, have a drink at a bar.......I recommend the rooftop bar at Fiore's) A HUGE plus in my book. The décor is brasserie style with dark wood and white tile walls and lots of mirrors.               Service.....adequate. I sat at the bar and the servers/bartenders were nice enough but not overly informative with the menu. Crudo of the day.......they didn't offer, I had to ask.  "Do you have any questions about the menu?".....didn't hear that question, had to bring them up myself. Their work space behind the bar is incredibly cramped and confining so I'm cutting them slack. I would definitely NOT work in that space myself so I give them credit.              Food....ordered the buttermilk johnnycake with smoked trout tartare and California sturgeon caviar because I had seen it on a CookingChannel episode of Unique Eats. Very tastey. Loved the smoked trout tartare. The proportions were off though. Way to much pancake to fish ratio. The dish would be much more balanced with either less johnnycake or more trout tartare. The entrée was the North End Ciopinno with lobster (lobster is an optional choice but come on.......if you're going to do it, do it right!) Visually appealing and delicious. It could have been just a bit more spicier for my taste but that's a minor caveat.  It comes with saffron rice but I opted not to have the rice since I'm not a fan of saffron and why fill up on all that starchy rice when you have all that amazing seafood and delicious broth?              Overall a great place, despite the cramped quarters (Be prepared to make friends with your neighbors) Definitely recommended. Oh and please.......no more pics of the lobster roll.........the 850 that are already posted give people an adequate idea of what the dish looks like.

Reviews.Author: Shaun N.
Reviews.Content: Love the food but I was more impressed as Island Creek. I do not believe this restaurant accepts reservations so expect a wait. I do like that this restaurant is a hole in the wall, it makes for a novel experience. Neptune has better oysters than Island Creek, but the latter has the better main courses.

Reviews.Author: Angelina E.
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a business trip and had heard a lot of great things about this place so I decided to give it a try.I travel alone and have gotten very used to eating alone. When I walked in there was a lot of people waiting which I had expected. However, the host said that she really likes to accommodate single diners and would try to get me in ASAP (which I thought was very thoughtful). I told her it was no problem and that I would go explore the neighborhood so she offered to call me when a seat was ready (also extremely thoughtful). 30 minutes later I had a seat at the bar. I started with 5 different oysters that the bartender recommended. They were all equally tasty and fresh. I highly recommend trying them. For my entree I got the ciapinno and I added fresh Maine lobster. This place is the COMPLETE opposite of stingy. There was so much fish in my dish that I could barely finish it. They piled on the same amount of lobster that would go on a lobster roll plus 5 mussels, a few clams, giant piece of salmon, giant piece of white fish, and 2 HUGE shrimp. It definitely has a bit of kick to it so be prepared for that.It was AWESOME!

Reviews.Author: Susan H.
Reviews.Content: I still think that Neptune Oyster has the best lobster rolls.  Ever since I first had one 4 years ago, I've been daydreaming of having another one.  So, this past trip we made it a point to have a meal here.Neptune Oyster does not take reservations.  During peak hours, there can be long lines out the door which translate to long wait times as the place is small and cramped.   This time we went on a weekday around 4 p.m. and were seated immediately.  By the time our meal finished, every table was taken and there was a small line waiting.It took a while for our server to come to our table.  However, he was taking care of other tables and we wondered if he was the only server on duty at the time.  He was polite and efficient.  When we were done eating, we had to get  his attention to get the check.  That said, the lobster rolls are well worth the wait.  They are served either with butter or with mayo.  Instead of a New England-style roll, ciabatta rolls are used and are lightly grilled.  The rolls come to you overflowing with lobster.  Whether you get your lobster buttered or with mayo, it is dressed lightly.  As a result, the lobster flavor shines instead of getting drowned out with too much dressing.  I had a buttered lobster roll while my husband had one with mayo.  My husband will gladly eat the lobster rolls here which is saying a lot as he isn't a fan of lobster rolls!  Each roll comes with fries which appear to be fresh cut and are good.The menu here is very limited.  As its name suggests, several varieties of oysters are on the menu.  Since my husband and I don't care for oysters, I can't speak to how good they are.  However, we notice that many people do order them.  Plus, there are some other fish entrees.  However, one should go here  for the lobster rolls.  I doubt that you would regret it!

Reviews.Author: Joan Y.
Reviews.Content: wow! loved it. Im from tx and never really got into oysters until my bf took me here. fantastic lobster rolldownside- not too many beers on tap. had a bad martha from a bottle

Reviews.Author: Joanna H.
Reviews.Content: 1 hr wait on a Saturday if you get here around 3:30pm, 2 hr if you get here around 4pm. It's a tight, small spot, so definitely remember to make a reservation! $27 Maine lobster roll served hot with butter: Super super buttery (they definitely buttered the toasted roll as well) and a very generous amount of lobster. It comes with a side of crispy fries that were delectable.Had a taste of 4 kinds of oyster. I'd recommend trying them without any tartar sauce or mignonette and enjoy the oyster as is. They're way more refreshing that way. Also, order the octopus cocktail if you enjoy the taste of lemon & olive oil. It's a nice chewy appetizer. Other things on the menu worth noting: Neptune burger aka cheeseburger with fried oysters? Sounds intriguing.

Reviews.Author: Camy C.
Reviews.Content: super long wait on a Sat night. They don't take reservations and for 2 people, we were quoted 4 hour wait when we walked in at 7:45pm. We gave the hostess my number and received a call at 9:40pm.  We were walking on the freedom trail so took us a good 20 min to get back. Sat at the bar facing the window and saw lots of people on the streets gawking at raw bar's varied oyster selection. :)  We ordered to share - clam chowder, lobster roll, and baked little necks with bacon and corn.  The clam chowder was light but flavorful with huge crackers that stayed very crunchy. We liked the soup very much. The baked little necks were really tasty - white wine and bacon. I wish we had bread to soak up the sauce. It was a bit too salty to drink.  Lobster roll was delicious. Nice big chunks of lobster. I have recently been to Maine and the lobster is definitely up to par. But I wish there were some lettuce or celery. I needed a crunch in the lobster salad. The fries were really nicely done tho. Nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with just the perfect amount of seasoning.  The meal w/o wine was $60 total including tax/tip. :) We left with very happy tummies even though it was a late dinner.

Reviews.Author: Yas S.
Reviews.Content: Do NOT EAT AT THE BAR!!!I was visiting Boston and went to Neptune's Oyster the first night. Over priced and there are so so many better placed to eat in Boston. If your looking to spend over $100 for a quick two person meal with bad service go for it. After an hour wait for a table we were seated at the bar. The bartender there is a joke, and we didn't realize he would be serving us. When leaving we asked for a doggy bag and they almost look insulted, it was really strange. Honestly, try somewhere else first. There are a lot of restaurants across the street that may not be packed but the service and food is actually a lot better.  I would not go back here that's for sure.

Reviews.Author: Elieke D.
Reviews.Content: HINT: come at an odd hour....2pm worked well for us, as soon as we arrived with a party of 4 we were seated without a wait (WHAAAATT?!?!?! I know right!)If you can't come at an odd hour of the day then stick it out and wait because it is worth it! You have to get the hot lobster roll in butter....my mouth is watering just thinking about it.When in Boston...you need to check Neptune Oyster off your list

Reviews.Author: Monica W.
Reviews.Content: Best Lobster Roll in Boston..HANDS DOWN. Came here during a Sunday night and it was packed! They were already sold out for the night so we decided to go next door instead. Since we HAD to try this place before we left Boston, we came back at 4pm on Wednesday and there was no wait! We ordered the lobster roll, which was delicious and super buttery. Also, we had a sample of both their West Coast and East Coast oysters. I'm a big fan of the small sized oysters and they tasted really fresh.

Reviews.Author: Diane A.
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Boston we knew we wanted to go to an oyster bar but the one we picked was closed for the night so we ended up at Neptune's. I am so so happy we found this place! It's tiny and we almost didn't get a table because it was completely full but the hostess must have seen how hungry we were so she made it happen! We asked for the waitress' recommendation of oysters - they were all excellent! My boyfriend ordered the lobster roll - amazing- and I ordered the spicy shrimp and grits- scrumptious! If you don't like spicy food then the shrimp and grits probably isn't for you but I loved it! We didn't have any room for desert but over all our experience at Neptune's was excellent and I will definitely pay them another visit during my next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Author: Lu H.
Reviews.Content: Did we have to wait for an hour and half to get a table? YesWere we sweating nonstop at the restaurant due to the hot weather and weak A/C? YesDid we get every single oyster on the menu as well as the lobster roll and clam chowder (and the bill is close to $200)? YesDo I still think it's worth the wait and the $$? ABSOLUTELY!! And I'd do it all over again if I'm in Boston.   P.S. If you plan on getting there when it first opens, per our lovely waitress, merely getting there before 11:30am is not enough. Usually line starts forming up before 11am. But she did say the least busy time is probably between 3pm-5pm, with "least busy" being the shortest wait time...

Reviews.Author: Karen C.
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Boston (back in Aug.) and everyone recommended coming here. We made plans to meet up 2 of our friends when the place opens at 11:30. My husband and I got there 20mins before it opened and there was a line already. Our friends were running late by the time they sat us and after 5mins the waitress told us that we couldn't hold the table anymore. Timing is everything... the next party and my friends showed up at the same time right as another party of two was leaving, so the waitress ended up letting our friends sit with us. We ordered the seafood tower (the tower of seafood that everyone looks at when they bring it to your table - that's the one i'm talking about) and 2 lobster rolls. Since I was preggo I wasn't able to eat anything on the seafood tower, so from what was left of the seafood tower I could tell it was really good. To be honest I'm not a fan of lobster but the warm lobster roll was really good and the fries were the best. I would recommend coming here only if you're in the area and if the wait is around 30mins. The service is awesome and the food is good.

Reviews.Author: Jinyen Y.
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I feel that I am too harsh...but honestly, I doubt that my three stars will pull down the ratings of this place. I would give 3.5 stars...but Yelp does not do that.I was so so excited to visit this place after Yelping and seeing the number of shiny red stars. I planned my Boston itinerary so that I could visit this place at 11.30am (opening time) and not stand in line in the cold. I went at noon instead and had to wait for around 30 mins. Pro: You leave your number and they will call you, so you can explore the area and check out other foods. Just make sure to come to the restaurant when they call you saying when to go over rather than wait for them to call a second time (I don't think they will call a second time). We had the oysters and clams (all from the MA area) since my bf thinks that it makes sense if we eat oysters from the area rather than those from New Orleans or somewhere further out. He loves oysters and enjoyed them a lot. They looked extremely fresh as well. We then had the famous and recommended lobster roll. This was where I was disappointed. This was one of the most expensive dishes ($27). The amount of lobsters definitely justified the price , I am pretty sure there was an entire lobster meat in there...however, I wasn't crazy over the entire product. I felt that other places can easily reproduce that just by being more generous with the lobster meat and then increasing the price justifiably. An experience is worth it, but I don't think I would come here and get it again. Lastly, we had the clam chowder ($11). This was placed in a rather shallow dish so the amount wasn't a lot. However, as usual, Neptune Oyster is generous with their seafood and there was definitely clam to be seen in the clam chowder. I usually have the San Francisco style clam chowder (think Boudin) that is more thick and creamy, while this was more ... for lack of a better word..less creamy and more soupy. In my opinion, the pepper was too strong for me. To know where it really stands, I tried some clam chowder in Quincy Market and well, I guess the clam chowder in Neptune Oyster is more legit and not buried in milk and cream, but I would still prefer if it were less overpowering. Total cost: $60

Reviews.Author: Navin B.
Reviews.Content: Over-hyped. Oyster selection and quality were great! The ambiance was not ideal. The place is very cramped. My wife and I sat at a table that was shared with a group of four... who were extremely loud. I guess this place is fine if you happen to be in the North End and in a group of 4-6 people so you get an entire table to yourself. Otherwise, you are left rubbing shoulders with strangers all meal long. I would much rather go to Island Creek or B&G Oysters.

Reviews.Author: M H.
Reviews.Content: Solid 4.5 and here's why. Raw bar: average with a few misses. The jona claws were over cooked and the sauces were sub par. Clams were also slightly smelly. However...Hot dishes from the kitchen: 5 stars all the way. The Johnny cake and the lobster roll were some of the best things I have ever put in my mouth. Delicious! Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Author: Max R.
Reviews.Content: Pros: probably the best lobster roll (hot w/butter) I've tried in Boston.  Fries are great too.  Staff is friendly.  Cons: Tiny place with very limited seating and seemingly always crowded on weekends (even on miserably cold and wet winter days).  It's slightly pricey as a roll and a beer will set you back around $40 after tax and tip, but for an occasional treat I think it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Carrie L.
Reviews.Content: If you want to show a first-timer the best seafood Boston can offer, then you take them to Neptune Oyster.  I came with a friend from NC on a Friday around noon time and was told the wait was an hour.  Luckily for us, they called us after 15 minutes!  So don't get discouraged.. I think sometimes they overestimate their wait times.  The place is very small and intimate.  There is very little space between you and the next table over.The oyster list has precisely the size and taste of all the oysters they offer.  I didn't have to worry about blindly picking the oysters or wasting time to look it up on Google.  We had the Ichabod Flats (med-lg size, salty with butter finish) and the Browne's Point (Med size with citrus finish).  Both are delicious, fresh, PERFECT!  We shared the hot butter Lobster Roll and the Buttermilk Johnnycake.  The lobster roll was easy to cut up, with plenty of chunky lobster meat to share.  Too many fries on the plate though.. felt like a waste.  The Johnnycake was divine!  The cake is salty with sweet honey butter, trout tartare and caviar on top.The couple next to us recommended the blue crab cocktail to us at the end of our meal.  Claimed it's the BEST thing on the menu.  It was crossed out on the menu that day.. but I will be making a visit to try that soon.  I was a little hesitant to come by thinking it's a big tourist trap... but Neptune Oyster has surpassed all of my expectations.  I definitely don't want to wait over an hour though so I will be coming during the weekday day times :)

Reviews.Author: Albert C.
Reviews.Content: Best oyster i have ever had! A bit on the pricier side but was worth it. Great service and atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Patrick R.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll was unbelievable!I had absolutely the best experience at Neptune Oyster yesterday.I'm in town on business and I've been hearing about this place from everyone at the office. I decided to check it out.  I searched Yelp and came across a review with a picture of the famous lobster roll and I just knew I had to have it.  I drove from Burlington to Boston with no traffic; upon arriving at Neptune Oyster I found a parking spot directly in front!! - As I understand it parking is reserved for residents in the evening and you have to park in a lot of complex.As I was walking in I overheard the host explaining to a group of people they were booked for the evening and he wasn't seating anymore parties of 2 or more for the evening. I stepped up and said I need one seat; he seated me in front of the oyster bar facing the street and my car!!  I asked the waitress -Adriana if it was ok to park in front, she said if the meter maid comes by I can run out and move my car. It never happened.  I ordered 6 Ichabod Flats, lobster roll and a glass of wine.  It was the best meal I've had in a long time. Shoutout to Adriana!! - Very friendly and great conversation.

Reviews.Author: Helen K.
Reviews.Content: Very touristy, but delicious lobster roll.  You have the option of having a warm lobster roll with melted butter (the one I chose).  Minus one star because it is on the pricey side.  The oysters here are really fresh and they have great variety.

Reviews.Author: Kate P.
Reviews.Content: I ventured into Neptune Oyster a little reluctant at first. Looking over the menu I saw very few option of things I would want to touch my lips. Simply put god graced me with a lovely shellfish allergy, and so continues to flaunt this in front of me.We didn't wait for a table, despite the time and day we showed up on....it must have been the company. (I guarantee it was the company)We sat down for a feast of friends, drinks, and food from the sea. Most of my table didn't even look at the menu as they were all expecting to order a large array of goodness.  I on the other hand, stared at the menu. Faced with the idea of trying something that sounded so good, and increasing my chances of not seeing the following day.The waiter came over. Now I've been around people who order what seems to me to be an insane amount of oysters, but this was crazy. It was oysters, chowders, rolls, mussels, name something on that menu I can't eat and the table ordered it (maybe three times)Trying not to be a party pooper and a little flabbergasted by the company I was keeping I made some comment about craving fish. As I went to order my companion for the night who had dragged me into this amazing place that could cause my death turned to the waiter and explained I was allergic to shellfish and was it possible to get a few of the daily specials even if it wasn't that day.He said they'd work something out and bring out a few things.Note: I don't believe this is something they do on the regular...in fact I guarantee it was only because of the company I was keeping. SO unlike all the other reviews here I'm not going to tell you about the amazing chowder (although it sounded like it was much enjoyed) or tel you about how it's the best lobster roll ever (someone else words not mine) or about all the oysters (man were there alot of oysters) I can't tell you about all those things. Nope I can't tell you about all the things that had my table 'ooh and ahh' ing.  BUT I can tell you about three things.I can tell you about the best fish (fried) tacos I've had on the east coast! They were oh so yummy, oh so crispy, and perfectly simple.I can tell you about the yellow fin tuna entree which was cooked to perfection and came with this wonderful salad and potato puree. I could tell you about the pommes frites which were crispy and soft to perfection.Yeah, those are what I'll tell you about.

Reviews.Author: Scott R.
Reviews.Content: As a native Bostonian Neptune Oyster is wicked awesome. If you're going to be in Boston and your craving a lobster roll there is no other place unless you plan on driving to Maine. Now be prepare for a long wait during any hour. When I'm back in town, I try to arrive 10 minutes prior to the 11:30 opening and there is usually a line. Oh FYI, if you put your name in and you have over an hour wait, head south and around the corner there's a Boston public library. There is no admission fee to look around and read a book while you're waiting.
