Now the secret to a great lobster roll (lots of sweet tail and crawl meat stuffed into a New England style toasted bun and soaked in HOT butter).  Besides lobster rolls, I have sampled the oysters, clam chowder, mussels and fish tacos and everything is absolutely phenomenal!!Again, the only downside about this place is the long lines so get there early.

Reviews.Author: Kelly S.
Reviews.Content: Lobster rolls are slowly making their way into Austin. Before I broke the proverbial seal however, I wanted to get a real deal lobster roll in the heart of New England, covered smothered buttered and awesome. The inimitable Damien S will never steer ya wrong and after some great tunes at Boston Calling, we put our name on the 4 (!!!) hour wait list. I don't love wait lists but at least these guys call you instead of forcing you to wait outside like so many San Francisco restaurants. We got the call a mere 2 hours later so we hoofed it and were seated at the front table WITH the purse/coat hooks near us. Win. From here on out, I'm going to skip my normal editorializing and get straight to the useful stuff:The Oysters: Fresh, superb, served with a citrus vinaigrette. Yes, I still hate them but these were choice bits. The Cocktail Shrimp: Do this. Gigantic. Really firm and perfectly cooked. Get at least one. Feel free to shareThe Neptunes on Piggyback: These were okay. I'd skip in the interest of having eating roomThe Burger: Unreal. Maybe one of the best burgers I've ever had. Ever. The Vitello Tonnato: Fresh tuna, roasted veal, cucumber, tomato. Get it. Don't look back.The Hot Lobster Roll: At $25 its pricey. It's also freaking awesome. Tons of lobster piled high on the softest bread ever. If I were doing it again, I'd ask for extra butter. Because why the hell not?Really what you need to know is that there's kind of something for everyone. You're going to drop some coin at this spot but just skimp and eat hotdogs when you can finally fit something in your stomach again.

Reviews.Author: Bryce A.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars for the food. 1 star for the service. The lobster roll is really tasty, and the oyster bar is to die for, but you might want to find the second best place that hopefully has lively and enjoyable staff.So yeah, the service is bad. Most of the staff seemed very annoyed to be working there... not sure why considering the tip amounts.... maybe it's a classic case of entitlement and apathy that the the service industry seems plagued with due to the hung over late late 20's/early 30's generation that is realizing their dreams aren't coming true anytime soon. Basically, I was pissed by how I was treated when spending such a ridiculous amount on lunch at a place that makes you wait a long time to get it.

Reviews.Author: Danielle V.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed having a few oysters and of course the lobster roll. Oysters were good. Moon shoal and Kumamoto. The last was small, but quite tasty. I split the lobster roll, since it was evening, we decided on the butter and lobster roll (as opposed to the mayo). It was great. Fries as expected and if allowed I would have opted for the salad.Red wine selection a bit limited and obtuse but I made my way through it and settled on   a 12 dollar Nerello which (I guess???) is like a Pinot. I think a cab is sorely needed this menu.I would go back, and I also would note, it can be a three hour wait on a Saturday. Put your name In at 2-3.30 and have a martini and a cannoli down the street. Perfect day!

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: If you have a hankering for a nice collection of oysters in a charmingly small restaurant serving both inventive and traditional seafood preparations, then put your name in at this Salem Street treasure and go hang out until your table is called.  Countless other reviewers have said it well, and they are right.  This place turns out some stellar dishes.  Favorites the night we went:Johhncakes with honey butter, smoked trout tartare, caviar.  A perfect combination of sweet, salty & buttery goodness.  One of the best bites I have ever had. Anywhere. Period.Buttered lobster roll.  The meat was perfectly tender and enhanced, I think, with a reduction of the cooking liquid which concentrated the best notes in the lobster's flavor.  Oh, and it was drenched in butter. Of course, the oysters.  Great selection, expertly shucked.  The ICOs seemed a little briny, and I have had too many of them elsewhere not to think there might have been a mixed at the raw bar here.  The Kumanotos were perfectly sweet.

Reviews.Author: Jaime M.
Reviews.Content: We love this place.  Freshest seafood great service a must do it you are in hanging out for the day.

Reviews.Author: Ada L.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to try out this place for awhile, and finally got the chance during my recent trip to Boston. We arrived 10-15 minutes before the restaurant opened for lunch on a Friday, and there was a line already. We were lucky and snagged one of the last seats after the doors opened.I ordered the Clam Chowder Soup, Lobster Roll, and a few oysters. The Clam Chowder Soup was interesting-it was very milky and not thick like most clam chowders. Although I normally prefer my soups to be creamy, the soup tasted delicious. The Lobster Roll was worth the $25--the huge chunks of fresh lobster on a hot, buttered bun was delicious. I ordered 4 different types of oysters--all of them were fresh and tasty. I preferred the ones with a sweeter finish.Service was pretty good. Our waitress was friendly and our food came out fairly quick. It was odd to me how we couldn't just order food to-go, so we ordered the Lobster Roll and the waitress immediately brought out containers for us.I definitely wouldn't mind coming back again the next time I'm in Boston. I can't imagine the wait time on a weekend though--must be horrendous.

Reviews.Author: Xinyi G.
Reviews.Content: Love the johhnnycake! Oysters are great too. I enjoyed the atmosphere of the small oyster bar. The lobster roll ia very decent, but not as good as the one I had at Luke's Lobster in PHilly

Reviews.Author: Kristie B.
Reviews.Content: Neptune is one of my splurges whenever I'm in Boston. While a bit pricy, the hot buttered lobster roll is always chock full of fresh lobster and is insanely delicious! The fried Ipswich clams are among the best I've ever had. The staff handles the daily influx (that's putting it mildly) of patrons with ease. I like that I can sign in, take a stroll around the North End and head back over when they give me a call that a spot is ready. It's a tiny eatery, but it's cozy and the people - both staff and patrons - are always friendly on our visits. Looking forward to the next one!

Reviews.Author: Sara H.
Reviews.Content: On a steamy Sunday, Mr H and I found ourselves in the North End with oysters on our mind. Having read lots of Yelp reviews of Neptune Oyster, we knew to expect a bit of a wait. We gave our name and cell number to the hostess and spent a half hour at Vito's watching the Sox game. We got a phone call when Neptune was ready for us and we got two seats at the bar, overlooking the raw bar and window to the street.Our server was fantastic! Friendly, quick to pour us cold water and take our drink orders, offering tips on the menu and how to order from the raw bar. We chose 9 incredible oysters and they were so fresh, briny and full of flavor. Mr H went with the hot buttered lobster roll and I had the fish tacos. Both were delicious and plentiful. We were definitely pleased with our choices!It's not cheap, but it's good and the atmosphere is fun. I'd absolutely go back. Maybe not in the summer, though...the a/c was almost non-existent and every time the door opened, the heat poured in. We got there shortly after 4 and we only had to wait a half hour. Everyone coming in after us were told an hour and a half to two hours. It's a very small restaurant and they squeeze you in like sardines. Don't let it scare you away, though. Squeeze in and eat up!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: These reviews might've generated greater expectations, but it didn't disappoint. We arrived in the neighborhood about 30 minutes before Neptune opened but alas, the strict rules and limited parking in North End kept us circling around for about 40 minutes. The restaurant was almost full when we walked in and we sat at the bar. My boyfriend had the raw oysters while I had a warm lobster roll which came with fries. Our waitress was extremely friendly offering her own recommendations and talking to us about our choices. It's a little pricey (lobster roll was $27) but I'd definitely visit again.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie M.
Reviews.Content: This review is for a visit back in April 2013.  It's a tiny little place as other have said.  Somehow my husband and I managed to get in with just a 15 minute wait.  I really liked the atmosphere of the place.  The staff was very pleasant. We started with oysters and followed with the lobster rolls.  We both tried the butter version.  They were great, but I'm wishing one of us had gotten the mayo version so we could compare.  I was so excited that they had my favorite oyster the Stellar Bay Kusshi, Mmmm YUMMY!

Reviews.Author: Catherine K.
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere: This is small restaurant, with a bistro feel. There is a long bar and tables to the side. It is cozy and has some good music playing. The oysters are on display in the front window and you can watch them being shucked from the street. There is just one washroom for men and women - which is a bit of a draw back.Drinks: They have a good wine and beer list. I had a nice white wine and a prosecco and my partner had a beer. Food: We started by ordering from the raw bar - we ordered a variety of oysters and a few shrimp. The shuck was good and the oysters were fresh and delicious. The shrimp were gigantic and tasty. I would recommend ordering from the raw bar as a part of your restaurant experience. For mains, we ordered the North End Cioppino with lobster and the Seared George Bank Scallops. The scallop dish was great. I savored each bite. My partner raved about the cioppino being the best meal he ate on our trip.Service: We had to wait 1.5 hours to get a table, but we knew that they didn't take reservations and that we would have to wait in advance. Once we got in the service was prompt, friendly and knowledgeable. We sat at the bar, so we were able to get drinks and whatever else we needed quickly.Price: This is a little pricey, but you would pay similar prices at red lobster for mainstream seafood covered in butter. The seafood is fresh and the dishes are well prepared and the service is good - so it is well worth the price.Tip: They do not take reservations. Show up and put your name on the list and wait to be called. Make plan for while you wait. We strolled the north end and walked past Paul Revere house and the Old North End Church and had a beer.

Reviews.Author: Hector M.
Reviews.Content: At $27 for a lobster roll, I expect the cooks to wear diamond monocles and double / triple check for shells and cartilage (I found two shells and a piece of cartilage).  But let me start from the beginning....Perhaps I went on an off day, the stars weren't aligned, or there was a glitch in The Matrix.  I'm good at separating mishaps from the overall food experience (but the deck was stacked against me).  First, my car's GPS lead us to another part of the city with the same address.  When we finally arrive, we encounter a sizable line at noon, we're quoted a 2 hour wait, and I leave my name/number (luckily Faneuil Hall / Quincy Market are nearby).  We finally get a call that our table is ready and if it was 97 degrees outside, than it was 105 degrees inside (no AC, only a ceiling fan recirculating hot air).  Moving on to our food....- Oysters: I ordered Wellfleets, Kumamotos, and Kusshis. I found the oysters gritty, the Kumamotos shallow, and the cocktail sauce was watery (with a minuscule hint of horseradish). - Warm Lobster Roll: based on the reviews, I was expecting a transcendent religious experience.  What I got instead was a soggy roll (the butter compromised its integrity), limp french fries, and chewy overcooked lobster.  There was a lot of lobster meat, but when you're finding shells/cartilage and you're struggling to cut it with a butter knife....it wasn't the lobsta roll that I was expecting. Sorry, but I'll take Luke's Lobster any day....

Reviews.Author: Shiori I.
Reviews.Content: We went at like 11:45 (it opens at 11:30) and the place was already packed with an hour wait for two, according to the efficient and friendly server. No matter. Just go to the pub across the street or to Bread & Butter around the corner for an iced coffee. It ended up being a shorter wait than they said, and they're pretty good at flipping the tables quickly and giving you a call on your cell to let you know your seats are ready. For a place like this, I would:Drink: A crisp cold white wine to go with your seafood. They have a decent beer and wine list. Eat: Yes, get the oysters. There was someone earlier who reviewed this place based on their burger. Are you insane? It's called Neptune OYSTER. What the eff else would you get? Oh right, their super famous lobster roll, which comes either hot and buttered or cold and mayo-ed. We had it hot and it was straightforward and delectable. Yum. The crudo wasn't bad either. Wear: Some St. James. Fisherman's scarf and beard optional. Go with: Just one other person. The table wait is long, you guys.

Reviews.Author: Tom H.
Reviews.Content: I relocated to New York City from Boston six months ago, have tried many seafood/oyster restaurants here in my attempt to find a replacement for Neptune Oyster. So far no luck. Miss Neptune.

Reviews.Author: Christopher S.
Reviews.Content: It was good but I dont get the bid deal over the lobster rolls. I hate to say this but I have had better in Philadelphia. Crowded, long wait and food just average. I will not be going back.

Reviews.Author: Scott A.
Reviews.Content: Walking around on freezing cold day in Boston, nothing screams warmth and relaxation more than a properly prepared bowl of "chowda" and a perfectly prepared burger with fried oysters on top. Such a glutinous meal is a necessity in the winter of the polar vortex along with a few properly poured Harpoon IPA's. Definitely will return upon my next visit to Beantown.

Reviews.Author: Elena D.
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand why this place is so popular and people wait in line for so long!OK, true - the oysters are good, but you can get good oysters almost anywhere.The clam chowder was absolutely AWFUL - undercooked potatoes and cream! It should've been called "potato chowder"The only thing we ordered that deserved 5 stars was the overpriced lobster roll!It's worth checking out, just not waiting in line for...and don't get the chowder!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy W.
Reviews.Content: FANTASTICWent here for mother's day and there were 4 of us. I called ahead to ask them when I should come and wait for a table (since they opened at 11:30am and do not take reservations). They said to come at 11am, but I got there at 10:50am. There were already two group in front of us, so we were guaranteed a seat. At 11:25am, there was a HUGE line. Get there early people!The food itself was great. the group in front of us when I was waiting in line said that they came the day before and waited 2 hours for a seat but they decided to come back because they were on a business trip (how's that for commitment?) Once they told us they were back a second time, I was sold. I was skeptic about getting a lobster roll since I read on other reviews that it wasn't that good, but they said if you like lobster rolls, just get it and you can be the judge yourself. Wise Words!We ordered oysters, fried calamari, salty fish, clam chowder (it was the thin kind of soup, not the traditional New England Thick kind) and mussels, for appetizers. All fantastic, but my favorite was the fried calamari and the messels a close second (mussel sauce was spicy)For a meal which I shared, I ordered a lobster roll (hot- which means it was made with butter. Cold is with mayonaise) and Yellowtail Tuna. Yellowtail Tuna was great, but the highlight was definitely the LOBSTER ROLL. Huge chucks of lobster, it was $25, but so worth it. I've only been there once and did not experience a line, but if you want to get there for lunch, get there early (before they open) and wait! It's well worth it.

Reviews.Author: April K.
Reviews.Content: I couldn't decide whether to give this restaurant 4 stars or 5 stars. The wait is as everyone describes. Be prepared to wait at least an hour. The great thing though is that they take down your cell phone number so you do not have to wait around the restaurant. There is plenty to see in the North End/Fanuiel so you can wander around. However, coming in the cold winter may be a bit harder.The restaurant is incredibly small. You will most likely be sharing a table, and if you have a party of 5 or more, you shouldn't even expect to sit together. It is not really a restaurant for large parties. The oysters are decently priced at $2-$3 each, and they are shucked better than anywhere else. The oysters came right out of the shell. Sometimes at other restaurants I have to continue scraping parts of the oyster out myself. They also taste like they just came fresh out of the ocean.On to the lobster roll... hot vs. cold... I ended up trying both as my friend and I split them. The hot buttered one was savory and tender. The portions aren't as big as my friend described, but they are decent. The cold lobster roll tasted not too much different from lobster rolls elsewhere, but they are good. My only complaint is that the fries were two notches too salty and combined with two canker sores in my mouth, I was in extreme pain. Despite having the canker sores, I don't think I would have enjoyed the side of salty fries. It was also very expensive at $27 a plate. Overall, I don't know if I'd come here again just for the lobster roll considering there is a huge wait time and I wasn't blown out of my mind, but it was good and I think people should try it just to experience it.

Reviews.Author: Louise T.
Reviews.Content: I hate to say it......but this place is badly overrated. There. I feel better. Yes the food is good; great even. We had a couple of oysters, a lobster roll, johnny cake, a ceviche, and beers. The problem wasn't the food, it was everything else. We went early (4:45pm) in an attempt to avoid the largest crowd. Because the place is incredibly popular, there is always a line of people waiting to get in. It was a hot day, and because the door kept opening and closing it had to be about 90 degrees in the dining room. Also it was extremely noisy. I guess my point is that when I'm putting out that kind of cash (I think our bill was around $130 after tip for 2) I'd like to have an enjoyable dining experience. We did not enjoy ourselves mostly due to the heat but also because of the noise and the eyes of people waiting for our table rushing us to finish our meal. Sadly, I can't reccomend this place. That said, if you do go, get the johnnycake.

Reviews.Author: Justin U.
Reviews.Content: This place is super small, and serves up really really good food.  With these two hand in hand, expect a pretty long wait.  We waited about 2 hours and debated whether or   not it was worth it.  So gave our number and headed to Union Oyster Bar to kill some time and oyster pregame, then to a bar for some quick drinks.  After some quick oysters and some light drinks, we're finally seated.  Immediately, we start check marking various oysters off the list.  On the side, I order their Lobster Roll and clam chowder.  I figure what the heck, I'm a tourist, I'm hungry, and I'm here to do damage.  The food comes out.  One by one we down the oysters.  I don't remember how many I had, I just remember feeling like I was in food heaven.  But heaven wouldn't be complete without their LOBSTER ROLL!  OH-MY-DAMN!  This thing was drenched in hot melted butter, and the lobster was super fresh and in super thick chunks.  Between bites of this heavenly lobster roll, I'd wash it down with my side clam chowder.  Epic.We ate everything.  Very few times where I eat until I'm that full but wanting to eat more.  I recommend this to anyone that breathes air.

Reviews.Author: MissJ J.
Reviews.Content: 4 and 1/2 stars and over 1400 reviews?!I am really not sure why this place got such high ratings. Maybe we came on an off day?Hubby and I shared:3 different kinds of East Coast oysters - 2 of each kind; clam chowder; lobster roll (hot) with fries; cioppinoOysters were great! Juicy & flavorful. But everything went downhill from here. The consistency of the clam chowder was very watery, potatoes were still hard, kind of blend. We waited 1 and 1/2 hr for this - lobster roll. It sure was buttery! Good portions of lobster but a lot of it was chewy. The bread was good - but then again, with that much butter, I think you can make anything taste decent? The cioppino was better than my lobster roll. Service - the hostess was nice but when we got seated, we finally realized why the wait was so long! Yes the place was tiny - but the servers probably were checking on their smartphones/ texting/ talking to each other every 5 minutes or so.  This place can run more efficiently with the presence of the owner/ manager. The service was ok when they did pay attention to us. Total for the dinner was $100 for the 2 of us (hubby ordered a glass of wine).

Reviews.Author: Emily W.
Reviews.Content: Totally worth the hype and the wait. Two things you MUST order:Lobster roll warm with butter: gigantic, never-ending portions of plump lobster, with toasted bread soaked in butter and lobster juice.Seafood tower (variety): the shrimp were the biggest shrimp i've ever eaten....call them giant prawns or mini-lobsters. the oysters were divine. it was really neat to try different sizes and textures of oysters. best part is you can watch the guy in the front shucking the oysters fresh and know exactly when he's going to bring  the platter to your table.

Reviews.Author: Zahid L.
Reviews.Content: I was visiting a friend in Boston a few weeks back and she said that Neptune Oyster is a must. To be honest, I went in with the expectation that it was an overrated restaurant with a really long wait. Boy was I wrong.The wait time for 2 people on a Saturday was an hour and a half - the hostess took my phone number and we were free to roam North End until she called. It only took 45 minutes.The raw bar was delicious and our waitress was extremely helpful (and accurate) about the specific tastes of each oyster. The Wellfleets were by far my favorite and went down smooth like butter.  Speaking of butter that hot lobster roll was drenched in it! If you're going to eat lobster... this is the way to eat it!

Reviews.Author: Susana F.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll lobster roll lobster roll.... Wait one more time- lobster roll! Talk about yum-o! A buttery, lobster filled heaven on a plate type of thang. It absolutely lived up to the hype. So happy yelp geared me in this direction because it was oh so perfect! Great service, great food!

Reviews.Author: Allegra H.
Reviews.Content: My favorite restaurant in Boston, it is reminiscent of a French bistro.  The  interiors alone warrant a visit.  Last time i was there, Leonardo DiCaprio was eating at the bar (probably while filming "The Departed").  This time, the wait was quite long, but worth it.  The place was slammed on a Monday night, which speaks to their popularity and quality.  Everything from the oyster bar was outstanding.  The plated dishes, also amazing. And for such a chic restaurant, the portions are very generous.  They don't serve coffee, tea, or dessert (i think they want the tables to turn quickly).  The staff was very friendly and helpful too.  They don't take reservations so arrive early and make sure to call the host after a while if he takes your name and number after adding it to the list. I doubt they'd have ever called me without my calling him first.  Next time I'm in town, I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: K. Brooke Z.
Reviews.Content: Next time, I think we'll just order from the raw bar! The sampler we got as part of the Triton Platter was delicious!The oysters were by far the best, but of course you can expect that. The muscles and clams were great as well. The two seafood salads left a little to be desired, but the abundance and deliciousness of the rest of the platter certainly made up for it.We had a great server at the bar and I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for the freshest seafood in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Jeewon J.
Reviews.Content: Long waiting to get seated. But you will get some of the freshest oysters and lobster roll in town.Go when the place won't be too busy if you want to avoid long time.

Reviews.Author: Anastasia N.
Reviews.Content: We found this little hidden gem through yelp. The food was amazing (clam chowder was very light, the oysters were amazing and the crab claw was good). Fortunately, we didn't have to wait. I would rate this restaurant 5 stars for the food, however, the sisters working there held true to the stereotype that people from Boston are rude. We found this place via yelp and yelp misinformed us about the opening time, which is 11:30am and not 9. The sisters overheard about this and said, "if you listen to yelp, then I don't know what to tell you."  Interesting, because not only did we find this location via yelp, but as you can see, they got over 1500 amazing reviews. Talk about biting the hand that feeds you. All in all, if you're in town, do yourself a favor and stop by for some fresh seafood... Just not before 11:30!

Reviews.Author: CJenna P.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best! The wait was already an hour when we got there 10 minutes after opening, but it was well worth it. When the hostess called us for our reservation, we ended up with the choice of table or bar. We chose the bar and it was perfect. Service was friendly, but not annoying and the staff is knowledgable about food and drinks. We shared octopus cocktail (fantastic) and two crab claws (delicious) and we each had hot lobster rolls one with and one without bread; either way you cannot go wrong. Make it here at least once in your life, it was last meal status.

Reviews.Author: Aidan M.
Reviews.Content: Make sure to close the door after you enter because the cold air draft is a killer! This place is tiny but awesome. Lucky to get a bar seat as most people had to wait a while to be seated. The Maine lobster roll & fries is expensive but delicious. The lobster is the richest most tender piece of fish I have ever had and it's a huge serving! Lucky I shared with my fiancé.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R.
Reviews.Content: We had lunch at Neptune's on Thursday afternoon. We arrived at opening and there was already a decent sized queue. Luckily we got in at the bar as the second to last seating at opening. TIP: arrive early with your full party present and don't try to go in a big group.The food was terrific. I mean, fantastic and worth every penny. The service was great - friendly and knowledgeable.My boyfriend is allergic to eggs so we opted for a lobster roll without mayo, oysters and clams. All of it was fresh and tasty.If I lived here, I would want this place to be my local and all the staff my friends.

Reviews.Author: Remie M.
Reviews.Content: The wait was an hour and 30mins. . . a group of 5 girls.Luckily, our hotel was rt near this place.  As u walk in, u understand why there's such a long wait.  The resto is SMALL and quiant.The lobster rolls are UHmazing and so were the oysters (obviously)I really like the idea they give u a sheet that lists all the oysters and describes how they are prepared.  Really good price also!We ordered 2 HOT lobster rolls, 2 ciopinnos and the fresh fish.Food and service is WONDERFUL! Maybe its a boston thing, why don't they give u ice in your water?

Reviews.Author: Lil L.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll is the best.  Must go early but even if you have to wait, it's worth it.  Only downside is that it's quite cramped esp if you sitting at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Julia D.
Reviews.Content: SHUT. THE. FRONT. DOOR.AMAZING PLACE! We waited about 2 hours and almost left... thank goodness we DID NOT!  What we had:LOBSTER ROLL!!!!!!Hot with Butter!!! (my friend is afraid of mayo so we didn't get to try the cold one)  but thank goodness they had this option otherwise my mouth would never have had such an amazing opportunity!  Its an absolute MUST.  Filled to the brim with sweet, sweet lobster. The roll itself had great texture and flavor.  My mouth is watering now just remembering each bite.Jonas Crabs:SO So fresh! We had 2 claws each with the house cocktail sauce (love me some horseradish)  I will be getting more of these as well.Raw Oysters:Flawless, fresh, melt it your mouth.Can I go back now?Dinner was about $100 for 2, we split everything and a bottle of wine.  This is my new date night spot!  Screw the wait, have a drink down the street at Bacco and build your appetite! you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic seafood bar, cozy and unforgettable. Delicious oysters. Though I'm spoiled by kusshis and kumamotos in Seattle, the Island Creek oysters were delicious, liked these better than the beau soleils. Didn't care for the littlenecks, had a very strong sea taste. Georges Bank scallops: Luscious and fresh - some of the best scallops I've ever had, beautifully presented. Served with pear butter, a delicious duck confit, and perfectly roasted brussel sprouts. Requested this w/o the maytag blue. Whole-roasted branzino: Outstanding. Love branzino, have had it in Vegas and Seattle. This was perfectly roasted, a handsome dish.Lobster roll (hot) lives up to the hype. Definitely 1-1.5 lobsters in the roll, made with minimal filler. A bite you'll never forget.Pro-tip: Explore North End while you're waiting for a seat at Neptune. Plenty of cute shops in the neighborhood, pick up a snack at Modern Pastry. We put our name down around 5 (party of 3), were told the wait would be 1.5 hrs (not bad), got lucky and were seated by 5:50.

Reviews.Author: C.Y C.
Reviews.Content: Not worth the wait... maybe except for the lobster roll. I was attracted to Neptune because of their oyster selections. The first time I visited I was too late to get a seat as they have a waiting list till closing. I had to quench my desire for oysters during my Boston visit so I went to Island Creek the next day for lunch. It actually did not disappoint! Well, except they were out of razor clams... I guess I will write another review for Island Creek. I told myself that I have to go to Neptune during my next visit to Boston and I should try to arrive early during the day. I came again for July 4th - but it was closed. Maybe I should've got the sign that this place and me are just not meant to be...Tried the third time and was thinking if it is really that good, then I will come back the next day for another lunch so I get to try most things on the menu. I arrived around 1pm (instead of 11am as I would like to in order to avoid the line) as I had other arrangements, and was told the wait was 2 hours long... It was steaming hot and I didn't really have anywhere else to go, so I went to the cafe next door. Now the food experience: Oysters: I select the small/medium lobsters with sweeter, non salty finish. For example, kumamoto and kusshi. They don't even have that many that would fall under my favorite bucket. Tried 6 kinds. None of them left me with a wow and a sweet finish taste in my mouth... Some of the oysters are not even that clean. Definitely can't compare to Aqua grill in NY or Swan Oyster Depot in San Fran. Not even as good as Island Creek in Boston...Other cocktails: the clams are OK. The Indonesian Shrimp were HUGE and have great texture, not chewy not powdery. I loved it!Clam Chowder: Major disappointment. I don't understand how they can be proud of their chowder... There wasn't that much clam in it and the soup was simply watery, not creamy at all. It still has pretty good taste but not your typical think clam chowder.Lobster roll: I would give a 5 star for the warm lobster roll. Best I have had in my life. It could be too buttery for some people though. The butter really soaked the lobster. Scallop: the scallops were huge and seared pretty well. Good dish but nothing mind blowing. For lunch it was pretty good. But it became my most expensive meal during Boston visit for the items mentioned above. $140 total for 2! in North end! after 2 hour wait and we were sweating throughout the meal since we didn't feel any AC at all. Needless to say, I didn't come back the next day. Will I come back here next time I am in Boston? Probably nope. Would go to Daily Catch a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: This place does NOT live up to the hype. Came with my fambam at 4 pm on a Sunday and it was still packed (I really don't know why). The restaurant is small to begin with and there's only 6-7 tables plus the bar area. Waiters weren't super friendly when we walked it. It took a while to get their attention and the waiter who ended up seating us had the most miserable face I've ever seen -  I feel like her pet probably passed away recently or something. We only waited 15 minutes (which is nothing compared to the hours my friends have waited when they came) before getting to sit at a super crammed booth in the back. My mom and dad are HUGE oyster fanatics. I used to be too, but then when I was 13, I ate 36 oysters in one sitting and I could never look/smell/eat an oyster again. It was one of the saddest defeats in my eating history. Anyways, my parents ordered all the oysters on the raw menu as well as the clams. My sister - a huge foodie as well - ordered a Lobster Roll. She told me she had stalked it on Yelp for weeks leading up to her trip to Boston. And I ordered the clam chowder based on Yelp reviews. Food came within 20 minutes. I personally didn't have the oysters, but my parents tried all of them. I trust my parents' food critique just because they are huge foodies and the ones that introduced me to good food in the 626 WOOHOO. Anyways, they said the oysters were fresh but were just as good as the ones you can get for 99 cents at any oyster bar. It wasn't special. They said Neptune was probably popular because it had such a great variety of oysters- like there was 20 types of oysters on the menu. Are there even that many species of oysters? And they all looked the same too. I did muster up the courage and try the clams. The two types of clams, Littleneck and Cherrystone. Honestly, they tasted the same to me. Both were pretty salty - I felt like I was drinking the ocean. But once you got past that gross saltiness, the clams were pretty yummy, chewy, and rich. The clam chowder was good - nothing extraordinary. It was light, rich, and actually had a lot of clams in it. The lobster roll was HUGE. For $25, it was a pretty good deal. My sister refused to talk to me once it came, so I'm guessing she loved it. I had a bite and the lobster was SO good. Fresh, sweet, and chewy. I think Neptune is def overhyped. It's a good place to eat, but I don't get why people would wait more than an hour for this place. Neptune is one of those places you have to try when you're in Boston, but once is really enough.

Reviews.Author: J K.
Reviews.Content: Food: 6 starsAir conditioning: -1 star-----Total: 5 starsEven if I had to wait to be seated too long, the air was unbearably stuffed and the price was very high, I was definitely satisfied more than enough. We went there during our trip from Midwest. I am missing them a lot. :(We tried Clambake, lobster roll and oyster burger.The clambake was awesome!!  I am missing it a lot!!The lobster roll was super, too. Their lobster roll is not comparable with disgusting ones you can get from vendors in Quincy market. The lobster meat was juicy and tasty. The bread was very good, too.The oyster burger was relatively so-so, but not bad.I will definitely try oysters, next time. As this was my first time and I wasn't sure of their freshness. However, after eating their other food, I regret I didn't order oysters.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne C.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I waited about an hour. Not that bad as I saw others review. But the waiter was probably not in a good mood today.   We order hot lobster roll, lobster spaghetti and some oysters. The hot lobster roll and oysters were absolutely delicious. The lobster spaghetti was good and has a lot of pieces of lobster meat. But I will probably not order it again cause it's a little too salty for me. And compare to the hot lobster roll and oysters that the restaurant provides, I will just go with others instead of lobster spaghetti.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: It was my first time here this past weekend, and I got the oyster platter (obviously since this is an oyster house) and the lobster roll (based on yelp reviews). It seems like everyone who ate here also read yelp reviews before coming in because everyone there got the lobster rolls. First of all, this place is tiny couple tables and few seats at the bar. Prepare for a long wait during busy hours. I got there around 1pm and I waited about an hour but it's definitely worth the wait. First, I got 4 different kind of oysters based on the waitress recommendation (2 east coast oysters and 2 west coast..forgot the names). The east coast oysters are bigger and saltier while the west coast ones are smaller and a bit sweeter. I prefer the east coast ones just because they're bigger so I feel like they're more worth the price ($2.90 a piece), but they're all pretty tasty. The lobster roll was the best lobster roll I've ever had....warm, buttery, and tons of plump lobster meat. It was heavenly! Price is expensive but it's expected. I got lobster rolls, 4 oysters, and 2 beers and I think I paid around $60 including tax/tip. This place is definitely worth the hype and the wait. One of those restaurants that you have to take your friends to when they're visiting Boston...just try not to go during rush hours.

Reviews.Author: Lynn S.
Reviews.Content: Getting salmonella poisoning is not an idea outcome when you come to feast at Neptune Oyster.  And yet...Not cool, not cool at all.

Reviews.Author: Chakhay S.
Reviews.Content: As the name says, it's an oyster place, and there's no real technique or skill involved. It just depends on the quality of the oyster and how fresh it is. As far as those go, this place is good. The oysters we ordered were fresh, clean, no sand at all, and above all, priced reasonably. The Neptune on Piggyback was interesting and tasted good, I just wish there was more for what I paid for. Those white raisins in the sauce are delicious how they were rendered down to make them even sweeter. The fried oysters and crispy pork really was a treat. But like I said, probably not worth to get it again since its pretty expensive.The clam chowder though, don't even bother. It tasted like clam flavored white water. There was no body, no creaminess, even the potatoes were lackluster. Not even sure if there were any real clams in there. If you told me it was a canned chopped clams, I would have believed you. Didn't taste homemade. No love at all. Opening a can of Campbell's would have been more fulfilling. Maybe it's a New England style I don't know of, but I prefer the chunky, creaminess of a rich soup. This wasn't it. The service is also depressing. The waitresses are more interested in their smoke outback or leaving as soon as possible. They present the food like it's dogfood and would rather see you leave than ask what else you would like.

Reviews.Author: Bill G.
Reviews.Content: These are the best lobster rolls I have ever had. The cold one is quintessential new England and the hot one is as good as it gets!!!The oyster selection was amazing as where the shrimp,clams and crab. ciopino was excellent as worth scallops. The service was excellent. This a must visit in Boston. Just be prepared to wait awhile to get in...it's well worth it. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Bill L.
Reviews.Content: lobster roll , lobster roll, lobster roll.  forget the fries which accompany the lobster roll.  the lobster roll is amazing.  how could a simple dish like this turn out to be so fantastic.  three of us went here for lunch.  only one had the lobster roll.  we shared bites of the lobster and were astonished.  it was such a a simple dish - fresh lobster with butter on a soft roll.the rest of us had the octopus salad - great but small.  the third order was originally sea bream (disappointed that it was on the menu but they were out).  went for the snapper.  fish was cooked very well.  the sauce was sort of surprised us.  it was a blend of lemon grass, pineapple and other veggies.  think they were trying to get a sweet sour flavor.just order the lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Monica W.
Reviews.Content: Keeping my review simple. a) like everyone else saidb) kumumoto + kushsii (the small oysters are the best ones trust)c) lobster roll - toasted do not do cold.  if you do you are (...)d) hamachi ceviche - great but oysters were better so just order a double order.THE END

Reviews.Author: Jeff K.
Reviews.Content: when you're in town, head to Neptune and just stick around. actually... don't.  you're taking up space for other customers.  i don't know if neptune takes reservations, but i got extremely lucky.  my flight was at 2:15 and i stopped by neptune at around 11:50pm and got seated right away at the bar.  usually i hear the wait is around 1+ hours.... i guess since it was just me, its was easier for them to seat me.i started off with two different oysters.  and having tried oysters at other seafood joints in boston, i have to say that neptune carries one of the best tasting ones.  i forgot the name, but it has a buttery finish to it.  i could eat them all day!  (RANDOM FACT:  if you didn't know, oyster are an aphrodisiac)  haha...the one thing that you must get is the lobster roll.  everyone talks about it.. but yes.  its delicious.  i wish my roll had more butter with it.  the chunks of lobster were juicy and fresh.  i think for 27$ it was an fair amount of lobster.  the fries are also damn delicious.  i came in hungry and left sated.  my only gripe about this place is the size of the restaurant.  its so tiny.

Reviews.Author: Coast To Coas T.
Reviews.Content: I finally got to try this place after reading all the raving reviews and recommendations from folks and here is my verdict:This place is quite overrated.  Yes, the lobster roll was good but it wasn't mind blowing.  I guess their whole specialty is serving it hot.  The lobster itself was good but everything else... not so much (soggy butter soaked bun bleh).  Not to mention the fries that came with it tasted like your average cafeteria fries.  At least for $27 include some decent sides...some coleslaw maybe.Also tried the fried clam ($21), which was okay.It boggles my mind why this place is so famous and how people are willing to wait so long to get jam packed into a tiny place for average overpriced food.  Service was average as well and food came out very slow (which is probably why the wait is so long).  I don't think it's worth a 2+ hour wait.  We waited about 1 hour which wasn't too bad, but now that I've tried it I don't think I'll be returning.

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll is out of the this world. Neptune Oyster is the only seafood restaurant in Boston to which I will give five stars. Clams, oysters, scallops, lobster - you name the seafood and I can attest that they taste the freshest and best cooked here than anywhere else in Boston/Cambridge.Since the restaurant is tiny and it doesn't take reservations, come at an odd hour such as 4pm. Otherwise be prepared to wait 1-2.5 hours. Good luck!

Reviews.Author: Morten D.
Reviews.Content: Best Oysters I have ever tried! A must to try. Any negative is the service wasn't that great.

Reviews.Author: Steffi C.
Reviews.Content: Went here during my trip to Boston about month back after a recommendation from a friend who was living there. We decided on lunch there as we were in the area. At 2.30pm on a weekday, the place was still very crowded-- a good sign.Waited about 30min in the cold (it was particularly windy) despite there being no one else in the queue before us. We'd requested to wait inside, beside the entrance, but the waitress insisted that we were blocking the way (I actually didn't see how since it was just a party of 2 and we were standing by the door)... ok sure.The place was pretty cramped and we shared a table with 2 strangers. Service was quick to the point of insistent.Food: we had some oysters and shared a bowl of clam chowder and lobster roll as we weren't very hungry- top-rated things on Yelp. Oysters were good, fresh (though I'm not much of an oyster person, my friend loved it). Clam chowder was blah. I'd tried the Boston Clam Chowda Co's version the day before and that was WAY better. This tasted watered-down and the clams weren't as fresh. Lobster roll was good but not out-of-this-world extraordinary. For the price I'd expect better.The most infuriating thing was that we didn't think that the service was great and hence wrote something less than what you'd normally expect for the bill (we used the credit card to pay). When we checked our bill from the credit card company later we realised that they'd INCREASED THE TIP by themselves! THUMBS DOWN TO THAT. Even if we didn't tip enough, I don't think they had the right to increase the tip without asking.This will not be on the agenda on my next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Author: Mark L.
Reviews.Content: Perfect little place for some fresh seafood and beer with friends. The clam chowder was indeed remarkable with its ultra light, but flavorful, broth and filled with fresh clam bits and potato.  It was quite a refreshing change after eating chowders at many other places during the week.  The lobster roll was very good as well and one of the best in town.Hint:  Expect to wait in line because the place is so small.  I was lucky to get in without wait on a Friday at 11.30 am.  Plan accordingly and you'll have an awesome time.

Reviews.Author: Eric B.
Reviews.Content: In two words: overhyped and overpriced.I mean, to preface this whole review, I grew up in Southern Rhode Island, and am used to eating seafood that was pulled from the water an hour ago and brought in on a dayboat. I have high standards, and I know it.Neptune produces an excellent lobster roll, there's no doubt about it. Plenty of lobster, a toasty bun dripping with butter, and a whole lot of salty seafood goodness. But honestly, it's not worth the price tag for me. Equally good lobster rolls can be had in less crowded settings. The entire time we were seated at the bar, my girlfriend and I were bumped and jostled by patrons and waitstaff alike who were trying to make their way through the incredibly crowded space.I must say, however, that I love their system of assigning tables. They know it's a long wait, and make no effort to confine you to the area, instead taking down your phone number and giving you a call when your table will soon be ready. It's nice to have a restaurant that lets you go for a stroll and grab a beer while you wait. Neptune, I wanted to love you, I really did. I wanted to find my Boston oyster bar, the shining pearl among so many others, but alas, it's just not meant to be.

Reviews.Author: Jen D.
Reviews.Content: There are a million reviews, so I am sure I will add nothing unique. But I have to commemorate this awesome meal with a review.Visiting Boston from Chicago, friend in Boston says I have to try Neptune Oyster.  I had never eaten a raw oyster (never appealed to me... but Rockefeller style, sure), but figured the 2 hr wait couldn't be wrong.We almost made the fatal error of giving up on Neptune for an Italian place nearby, but I am so glad we stuck to the game plan.This was a life changing meal for me.  First, it made me realize the beauty of raw oysters.  Now it's true, my favorite part is probably the vinegary shallot mixture, but still. Wow, so good. We tried several varieties and I was able to figure out what my oyster preferences are. If you are oyster shy, let this place show you the ropes.At was also my first lobster roll in buttahhh.  Damn. Not surprisingly, delicious. This is now the measure by which I will compare ALL future lobster rolls.  The bread, lobster and butter were perfect.Now if I could just find more reasons to frequent Boston AND a way around the 2hr wait...

Reviews.Author: Ashley P.
Reviews.Content: Go here for the food, not the ambiance. As I have said in my other reviews of North End restaurants, do not go here expecting to be seated right away or to have a lot of space! Neptune Oyster goes right along with these rules. We showed up around 4:30pm on a Thursday. At that point the wait for two was about 20 minutes, but there were seats open at the bar so we happily sat there. I wouldn't recommend bringing a group here, but there did seem to be a few tables with 5-6 people, just expect a wait! I just don't understand how people are surprised when the come to the North End with 10 people and they have to wait...Anyways, now that my rant is over, on the the important stuff - The food is superb! We ordered a variety of oysters that were absolutely delectable. It was really fun watching all the shuckers (is that a word?) do their job. We paired it with some delicious white wine and the tuna appetizer. My mouth is watering just thinking about it! By the time we got our lobster rolls (one hot with butter, the other cold with mayo - both were amazing, just depends on your mood!) we could barely eat anymore, but we managed somehow. The service was pleasant and efficient, just how I like it. This is a great alternative to all the Italian places in the area. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: On my second weekend trip to Boston and I told myself that I couldn't miss out on it again like I did the first time. The wait was not pretty - approximately 1hr on a Sunday afternoon - but there were nearby shops that kept me company for the most part. Once seated, I was a delighted woman!The fried clams came out first and it was light, crispy and everything you'd expect it to be - AMAZING. Next came the lobster rolls. The fries were very flavorful and unfortunately, horribly soggy but who really cares when you have a mountain of lobster meat drenched in warm butter right next to it? Plate was spotless shortly after and yours should be too!

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: Had to wait 3 hours for a table, but we were expecting that.I'm glad we waited because the food was amazing.Oysters - mmmmmm.Clam chowder - delicious.Lobster Roll (HOT, not cold) - holy cow it was so damn good.This place should take reservations. I find it a little hard to believe that they don't, but I guess when there's a constant line up, they really don't need to worry about it.Next time I am in Boston, I'll be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Dan L.
Reviews.Content: So, I've had this account for several years and I thought I'd start off with this restaurant because it is pretty good.  Initially, I attempted to go here at an earlier date but the wait was too long - 2 hours.  We were starving so we didn't have the patience to wait.  The next day I took someone else here and they said the wait would be 2 hours again.  I was really determined to eat at this restaurant so I decided to wait.  Unfortunately, we couldn't and went to another restaurant for an appetizer.  The good thing about Neptune is that you can leave your number and they'll call you when your table is ready.  I walked around North End and got to visit Paul Revere's crib.  When we got there, they called me and it wasn't even 1 hour in yet.  I told them I couldn't make it and asked them to put me on the bottom of the list.  2 hours had passed and I was finally seated.The place is very cozy and intimate.   We were seated at the bar area and the service was great.  We ordered the oysters and clam; all were very fresh and delicious.  For the main dish, I ordered a lobster roll (what they're known for).  There are some variations to the roll.  You can order it hot (butter) or cold (mayo) and with or without a roll.  I would definitely come back when I visit Boston again.

Reviews.Author: Steph L.
Reviews.Content: Got here at 5pm on a Saturday night, and didn't get seated until 7:30. They stopped taking reservations at 7pm because they reached capacity, and their wait time topped 3.5 hours. I don't know if it is worth the 2 hour wait, but they definitely have some of the freshest raw oysters in Boston. My boyfriend loved the lobster roll, which i found too buttery and soggy. It would be better if they served it on a sub roll instead of a hot dog bun, because the hot dog bun breaks very easily and becomes soggy way too fast. The fries were extremely soggy as well, which was disappointing. The yellow fin tuna appetizer was really good. A bit too salty, but still amazing. Always order the red curry mussels to start!Overall, the restaurant was way too small and due to the traffic, way too hot! On a 98 degree day, the door kept opening, making it hard for the AC to make any impact on the dining room area. We wee sweating while eating, making the experience not so great.I would return, but only if the wait is less than 30 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Joselyn Y.
Reviews.Content: This is coming from someone who doesn't like Lobster!!! So if you also came upon this place and are saying "UGH! I don't want the lobster roll :( now what?" read me!So, as I said, I came here with my parents when they were visting me! My dad is really into seafood (which I now love) and thus, I wanted him to try the best of the best! We put our name down for a seat and were told that there was a 3 hour wait. Fine, thats cool, we went around and waited! One hour and a half later (just about) we get a call saying that our table was ready!! SAY WHAT~?! So we gleefly ran back to the place (we were just about to leave) and were promotly sat down. I went to yelp to see what other people who didnt like lobster recommened and alas, couldn't find something fast enough :( boo! But this takes me into what I ordered:The Flash Seared Nantucket Yellowfin Tuna: YUM YUM YUM!!! It was amazing!! The salad that came with it smelled strongly of vinegar (which I just ignored) and the mashed potatotes under the salad and tuna was simply amazing! Tasted great and was well worth the wait/price. The tuna was seared properly (which freaked out my mother, who was like "ITS RAW!!" no mom, its just seared/not cooked to death). I was left really happy with my meal and ready to roll!Clam Chowder: Now this unfortunately, is something that I have to say and urge others to skip out on. Not good. And for $11 a bowl, I was sad. The soup strongly tasted of flour and cream to me. That was it. There were bits of clam in it but really, the flour and cream were way over did and over powered the whole soup. As someone who is a bit of a New England Clam Chowder snob, I was left disappointed. If you are thinking of getting this, really, just order anything else, just not this soup.My father ordered the lobster roll, and as others said, thought it was amazingly good. My mother on the other hand got the this whole fish that was similar to bass, but was from Europe??? (I forgot the name) but she thought it was good and really enjoyed the salad that came with it. Overall, we left really happy, and felt good about ourselves and the wait. This place lost a star because of the complete 180 with the clam chowder (don't order it!!). Anyway, overall great place, will be back :)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer W.
Reviews.Content: I came here for my first meal on a 3 day trip to Boston. Yelp listed this place #1 out of all the restaurants in Boston, so I was pretty optimistic that it would be tasty (and I was right!). My friend and I arrived at the restaurant around 4:45pm on a Wednesday night. I was surprised to see there was already a line forming at the door -- always the sign of a good restaurant! Thankfully, we arrived right as the previous round of tables was finishing up, so we only had to wait about 5-10 minutes.At this point I have to mention that this restaurant is not the place to go if you're looking for comfortable seating. My first impression when walking through the door was this place is TINY. Also, it has no AC or ventilation whatsoever! Honestly, it was hotter inside the restaurant than outside (and I'm writing this in July.Because the restaurant is so small, my friend and I had to share a table with another couple. We tried detaching the two tables so we could comfortably have our own space, but the waiters told us the tables are stuck together. So that was a little awkward, especially as we were close enough to smell each other's dishes and touch each other's elbows. But it wasn't the end of the world. For drinks, I ordered a Blood Orange Bellini (tasty but really pricey at $14) and my friend ordered a Duvel beer ($9). The Bellini was tasty and cold, but the volume is pretty small especially at that price point. The beers and cocktails aren't listed on the menu so be sure to ask your waiter for options if you want something besides wine.Now to the good stuff: the food! After reading other yelp reviews I couldn't NOT order the hot lobster roll. And boy was I glad I did. The bread was toasted and soft, the lobster was buttery and moist. I've had other lobster rolls with added garnishes and sauces, but this hot lobster roll is literally comprised of JUST lobster and butter. Which is fine by me any day! The french fries here are also very soft and moist -- I tend to enjoy crispy fries myself but these complimented the lobster roll well.All in all I'd give this place four stars because the food was certainly tasty but the comfort left a bit to be desired.

Reviews.Author: Cindy K.
Reviews.Content: Their food is awesome.  I love the variety of oysters and other raw shellfish.  But their lobster roll hands down is the best I have ever had.  You have two options for it: cold- mayo styled and hot with warm butter.  I love the hot version.  Usually when I go there with my husband we can never finish our meal because we would get so many oyster and would have left over lobster from the roll.  We would then reuse the lobster the next morning in our omelets, so its really two meals in one.The only thing I do no like about this place is it is constantly busy and wait is usually about 1-2 hours and they don't take reservations.  So always have a backup plan if you plan on going here for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: wow .. friend from boston recommend me the neptune oyster and I wasn't disappointed. It's a small familiarly like place, where the oysters and clams are opened in the window and you can watch then from the bar as well. The choices of origins for the oysters are amazing. West, East Coast, Vancouver, MA, etc ..I really can recommend the Vancouver Oysters called "Kusshi", smallbut with a really soft meat and a really rich taste, which I never had before with an oyster. Other recommendations are the Neptune Burger or the Grilled Tuna Steak. Enjoy guys

Reviews.Author: Sanah K.
Reviews.Content: MMMMM...LOVE this place!Have you tried their burger w fried oysters on top?  IT is a MUST!!Would def come bk here again :)

Reviews.Author: NINI P.
Reviews.Content: BEST LOBSTER ROLL EVER. Please give Warm Lobster Roll a chance, it sounds weird, but its soooo gooooooooddd. Just sucks that they don't take reservations. Tip for getting a table: get there in the morning just before it opens, you'll definitely get a seat within a short/reasonable wait.

Reviews.Author: Katie T.
Reviews.Content: Delish.  What else can I say?We got there around 6 or 615 and only waited 20 minutes tops for a table. When we sat down our neighbors were friendly (you share a table at this tiny place) and gave us some recommendations. About 20 minutes after we were seated, we overheard people saying the wait was 2 hours. Thankfully we missed that!My brother and I split everything. He ordered some oysters, but I didn't partake in that. All of the best sellers were already sold out by that time, but he enjoyed the ones he ordered.We ordered the johnnycake based on our table partners recommendation. Holy cow. Amazing. I love a good lobster roll, but my brother and I were both extremely surprised and impressed with how delicious this was.The hot lobster roll is a must. The clam chowder, another must.When we come back to visit, we'll make sure to stop by here again.

Reviews.Author: Jamie Y.
Reviews.Content: The first time I came here, I came in a group of four on a Saturday night and the wait was ~2-3 hours. (They take your phone number and call you when your table is ready). We didn't have a problem with that because we found plenty of things to entertain us in the North End neighborhood.  The last two times I've been here I came during lunch on a weekday and there was barely a wait, so if you hate waiting, make sure you do that.  I always get the hot lobster roll.  Lobster chunks in butter on a toasted brioche roll with fries.  It's the best.  This is the only place I've been to that has this version.  There may be some more out there, but for the most part, most lobster rolls are cold and slathered in mayo.  Those are great, but this one is awesome!!

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: So overrated. Huge disappointment. Arrived at 9:55 with my 15 year old son after the Patriot's game. Website and sign on door says they are open until 11 and, "Kitchen open until 10:30".  We were denied service in a most unfriendly way, basically "put out with the trash".

Reviews.Author: Damian S.
Reviews.Content: This place is Wicked Good! LMAO, I'm from Jersey; I don't even know if I used that term right but OMG the food here is terrific! My girlfriends friend apparently "spends a lot of time in Boston" and she recommended this place. We were walking around and happened to walk past it and said why not.....I walked in and gave my name, there was a wait (apparently there is always a wait) we were told 2 1/2 hours (it was 6) ouch....okay. We walked back to the hotel, had a drink and while we were there my phone rang (I forgot to mention they take your cell phone number and actually call you when they have a table) it was Neptune letting us know they had a table ready. I told the girl we had walked back to our hotel and it would be a good 30 to 45 mins before we'd be back....she was fine with that and said she "would have a place when we got here." We took a cab and got there in about a half hour. I walked in (girlfriend waited outside due to the size of the place). The guy in front of me was told a 2 1/2 hour wait (sounds familiar) the hostess asked who was next and while others were waiting I told her we had received a call back and we were seated right away (amazing). The place has maybe 15 stools at the Bar and 25 table seats. When I went to sit down I felt guilty cause I thought my butt was touching the appetizer at the table next to us...it was really a tight squeeze between tables. We sat down and were quickly asked for our drink orders. I chose a local (Harpoon) IPA and girlfriend chose a sparkling wine.For apps we had a P.E.I. Mussels which is a mussels in a red curry broth...absolutely delicious...as I ate this and wished there was bread to soop up the broth in this dish the waitress came out and offered us up bread....Thank you Neptune!!!! We also ordered the Neptune's On Piggyback which is described as: crispy oysters, Berkshire Pig, golden raisin confiture, pistachio aioli...it was good but not as good as the mussels.For dinner I ordered the Monkfish Cassoulet and my girlfriend ordered the Bank Scallops...both were amazing in their execution. We sampled each others and I think we both think we should have ordered each others dish.....It is cramped, but it is beyond delicious! I would come back here again and again....amazing find....

Reviews.Author: Jess R.
Reviews.Content: Dining at Neptune is a true test of patience, but you will be rewarded with some of the best seafood you've ever had.During a recent trip to Boston, I flagged Neptune as our #1 to-do.  We came by with my husband's Brasilian family for lunch.  There was probably 9 of us.  We were quoted about an hour wait.  They took our number, and off we went.  There are plenty of things to see and do in the area.  I suggest going to Neptune, putting your name in, then strolling the area.  It is essentially on the Freedom Trail, so you can take in the historical sites as well as the great shops in the area.We get seated in the back corner, and I happily took in the surroundings.  It is a small restaurant, sits maybe 30, give or take a few.  The great part of being with a big group is the excuse to pig out!We promptly ordered the mussels, as well as a few of each of the oysters and other shellfish.  We shared a crab cocktail.  All of which were divine.  I moved on and went for the hot lobster roll, made with butter, not mayo.  It arrived overflowing with fresh lobster meat.  The flavor of the meat and bread were just perfect, and it has officially ruined any other lobster roll for me!The staff was nice, and handled us quite well.  A few nights later, I returned with just my husband for one more glorious meal before headed back to LA, but alas, the wait on a Saturday night was just too long for us.  Our waitress from the other night approached us to say hello again, which was really sweet.My only regret was not trying their clam chowder!!!Neptune, I can't wait to see you again.

Reviews.Author: Joanna L.
Reviews.Content: This review is purely for the staff experience.  We went in for a late dinner last night, and checked yelp to make sure they were still open.  It was 45 minutes til close, and it said "open."  We then called, just to make sure (hey, it's north end and some small businesses might step out early sometimes, esp on a Sunday night).  Person answering phone said "yep were open til 10:30," so we headed over and made it there by 9:50pm.  That's 40 min before close.  Plenty of people inside eating and drinking and one table even still was browsing a menu.  Once inside one of the waitstaff caught our eye and told us, "uhhhhh, yeah, sorry kitchen is closed, guys."  Really??  It was pretty obvious from the way he looked at a couple other annoyed wait and kitchen staff there that they were calling closing time just because they wanted to go home.  Frustrating considering we had paid and taken a cab there just to eat there and wouldn't have if they had simply said the kitchen wasn't open.  Have been looking forward to this restaurant for months, and even wanted to host a small event there, but now will never be back.  Bummer, I bet the food is awesome but the experience was pretty insulting.

Reviews.Author: J B.
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the food here is probably a 6 out of 5. The problem here is that the space is so small, its impossible to get in w/o waiting an hour. I've tried over a handful of times over the past few years and have been too impatient to wait 1 to 3 hours; until yesterday.Get the lobster roll - leave happy. The lobster roll here is f*cking perfect; there is no other way to put it. Its comprised of huge chunks of claw and tail, which isn't overly dressed with mayo - but has just the right amount. The lobster in it is the absolute finest: fresh, juicy, crisp. And as an added bonus its served on a slightly grilled brioche bun and accompanied by some of the tastiest fries I've ever had in my life.If that's not enough to convince you - you're stupid - but the oysters here are phenomenal (the restaurant is aptly named). Every oyster they have on the menu is perfectly described - these are not the dollar oysters from your local watering hole - they are the creme de la creme.One thing I will say about the wait time, if you put your name in, they'll call you when a space is available. Its a nice touch, but I am admittedly just very impatient.

Reviews.Author: Florina K.
Reviews.Content: Well the lobster rolls are good here, and the staff is usually very friendly.... But I guess something's changed?Per their usual 1 hr wait(also what was quoted to me) I went to put my name down, and about an hour later I called Jerry the hostess to see if I should start walking back as I was a 15 minute walk away. She told me to start heading back, so I did.When I got there I checked in,  Jerry told me to go wait outside..and about 15 minutes later I nicely asked her how much longer does she think the wait will be. She snapped at me and asked me if she should take me off the list...  I understand that they are busy and it can get hectic, but when I asked there was no one else checking in, and I asked very politely. No matter how good the food is in a place, hospitality is always important!! And this is why this place is successful... not only because the food is good, because of the customer service as well.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying it took us three attempts to successfully dine at Neptune Oyster.   Yes, it is THAT popular.  With that said, it was well worth the wait. We started with a combination of a dozen east and west coast oysters.  They were fresh, well prepared and delicious - everything you would expect from a quality oyster bar.  For mains I had the warm (butter) lobster roll, which was probably one of the most delicious things I have ever tasted.  My friend had the North End Ciopinno - lots of fish and seafood, in a very tasty and somewhat spicy broth.  We'd highly recommend all of the dishes.  Neptune has a pretty good drink list, and you'll likely be able to find something that pairs well with whatever you decide to eat. So with all of the positive things out of the way, here are a few things to be aware of: - Get there early or pick an off-peak time to visit.  The day we were able to successfully get a seat we still waited two hours.  - The restaurant is tiny and you must be comfortable sitting in close proximity to others.  Do not expect any privacy. It's also reasonably noisy.- It's not cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Author: Joel G.
Reviews.Content: Man when you toss out the sentence "best lobster roll" this place is the first thing out of my mouth.  Absolutely the best I have had.  The place is a charming white tile small little joint in the North End of Boston.  Tables are old school marble top, the location has maybe 10 tables and a large bar.  Get here early and put your name in to sit down for dinner.  No rezy's and always jammed.  Last time I was here we put in our name and wandered just down the street to a little Italian place and had antipasta and a nice Amarone then went back for dinner.  I like this place on a Sunday where you get there before 11 and put you name in for lunch. Great oyster selectionMust have Neptunes on a Piggyback... Fried oyster on Berkshire pig, on a little croutonClams are awesomeChowder is darn good, close second favoriteOf course the hot buttered lobster roll... i'm sure someone would tell me I'm nuts but I like the hot better than the cold.  Have had both and they are both tops.Being from Chicago every time we go to Boston this is a must hit along with Island Creek...... These are the two best places in Boston for seafood

Reviews.Author: Greg M.
Reviews.Content: Very tasty and fresh Tuna Steak entree. Also ordered two each of Island Creek, Ichabod Flats and Pemaquid oysters. Very happy with it. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Author: Victoria P.
Reviews.Content: Ended up waiting an hour and a half for this place, but definitely worth the wait. We also went over to Caffe Vittoria's for their DELICIOUS pistachio gelato so that definitely helped in the meantime.To be fair, we went on a Saturday for dinner and it was packed. We finally sat down at a table got some water and was looking over the menu. The waiter asks us if we could move to a spot at the bar because he needed our table for another guest. Admittedly I was annoyed because we already sat down and the place at the bar was right in front of the bathroom. We reluctantly agreed and the waiter was really nice about it. After sitting down at the bar, the bartender informs us that the waiter wanted to buy us each a glass of prosecco for moving - sweet...definitely feeling better now.The rest of the meal was delicious. We ordered some oysters and the shrimp cocktail from the raw bar. Although the shrimp cocktail was actually only one shrimp...it was huge and really meaty. We then split the clam chowder and the dinner special that night (a whole fried bass with mexican style rice and beans, guacamole, and fried plantains). The clam chowder was too thin and not worth the price. I liked my chowders thick and hearty. The fish was cooked perfectly and the accompaniments were surprisingly tasty. The waitstaff was really nice and apologized for having to move us - so be nice to them when it's busy...things are hectic there as it is. You might even get lucky and get some free drinks! :)

Reviews.Author: Farien F.
Reviews.Content: Oysters are delicious. Clam chowder a bit watery for my taste, but otherwise everything I've eaten here is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Richard K.
Reviews.Content: Three of us went to Neptune for a small bite to eat with the anticipation of eating dinner at another restaurant in the North End.  We shared the clam chowder, a variety of clams and oysters, as well as the P.E.I. mussels.  I am not a fan of oysters.  But after visiting Neptune and trying oysters for the third time, I will now have an easier time ordering oysters where ever I go.  As for the clams,  I'm sure Neptune has great quality clams but I am not a fan of raw clams.....PERIOD. Needless to say, I tried the cherrystone clams and didn't like them.  I think their large size and consistency had a lot to do with it.The clam chowder tasted great but was a bit watery for my liking.  I'm learning that everyone makes their chowder differently so my critique is simply my opinion and not a reflection on the quality of their chowder.LOVED LOVED LOVED the mussels.  I just recently discovered the awesomeness of mussels. The curry broth with lime, cilantro, and chili are reminiscent of a coconut curry dish I made a few weeks before.  Love that they used a shell fish stock in the broth.We only waited 10 minutes which I understand is unusual for this place.  LUCKY US!!  The restaurant is small and definitely a bit cramped for my taste.  I'm 6'4 so things were a bit tight for me.  The atmosphere is great though.  It's a good sign when every seat is taken.  Our server Bonnie was knowledgable, pleasant, and didn't rush us.  She also KNEW about the food which is always a plus in my book since I'm a foodie.The only regret I have is not trying the LOBSTAH roll.  Our neighbors all had the lobster roll and it smelled and looked delicious.  Definitely having that the next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Michelle R.
Reviews.Content: I honestly am baffled by all the Neptune Oyster hype. Long wait, cramped space, uncomfortable seating, slow seating, mediocre burger, overpriced.I realize I am totally in the minority here but Neptune Oyster... I'm just not that into you.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie D.
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to arrive early enough (6 pm) to get our on name on the list for a table for around 8:30 pm. It seems like the list fills up rather quickly, even on a Tuesday night. I was surprised to receive a call half an hour early. We arrived to find two bar seats saved just for us. I was expecting the typical, thick clam chowder + some spices. Instead, my bowl was filled with a light mix of potatoes and clams in a smooth, milky broth. The hot lobster roll was delicious. The bartender advised us to eat some pieces of lobster before eating the entire sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Steve C.
Reviews.Content: Heard a lot about this place so I made it our first stop when getting into Boston this morning. We got there at 11:25 am, and there was a line around 40 persons long. There were 2 parties ahead of us that did not get seated for the first seating. A guy took our name and number down and said he'd call us in about 45 minutes. 30 minutes later we were called and there were 2 seats at the bar for us! I started off with a couple of oysters. I'm not a big oyster fan so I have no basis of comparison really on these. I thought the taste was interesting. We also ordered clam chowder. It had great flavor but was on the runny side. I like my clam chowder nice and thick. Maybe that's not how it's prepared here in Boston. Lastly, we ordered a hot lobster roll which was pretty delicious. I don't think I've ever had one quite like this. The lobster meat was very fresh and the roll was soft. Loved the butter sauce! Kudos to the servers as well. They were very nice and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Mabel N.
Reviews.Content: We got here a little before 7pm and they said the wait would be around 2 hours. We said okay because we heard such good things about their lobster rolls. We walked around Faneuil Hall Marketplace and by the time we went back, it was a little before 9pm. They said it would take another 30 minutes so we went to this take out place next door because we were really hungry at this point. We left the place and they said it we won't be seated till 10pm. At this point, we were like this is crazy because it was raining outside and cold.When we got seated, we sat at the bar. We were starving at this point even though we had some food before. We ordered the hot lobster rolls because I heard it was better than the cold one. I had much better lobster roll elsewhere. Some of it was fresh but some of it tasted like it's been out for the whole day. We didn't want to ordered from the raw bar because it's so late already. And then the waiter asked us if we wanted wine. We said no because we really just wanted food at that point. After we said no, the waiter didn't pay attention to us at all. He gave us an attitude just because every time we asked for something. It took forever for him to even notived us and reminder, we were seated at the bar and he was behind the bar. He was so rude. I would never come here again.

Reviews.Author: Erica R.
Reviews.Content: Visited a friend in Boston recently and he took me here so that we could get lobster rolls...and seriously, their warm lobster roll with butter? SO delicious. It's quite big, and so filling too. It was just so good...so the $25 cost was fine by me.The wait for a table in this place is pretty inevitable. Oddly, though I've heard you should be able to put your name in and then come back, my friend and I tried to do that and the girl working the door/tables wouldn't let us. We just ended up going out, walking around for about an hour, getting iced coffees, and then trying again. Fortunately, we arrived back at the restaurant JUST after another small table had left... and because there were only two of us, we got seated right away.
