We were kinda smooshed into a corner and sharing table space with another group... but it's not like this restaurant is big with plenty of table space. It's a smaller location... so being a bit cramped is to be expected.Fun experience, delicious lobster rolls...and though it may not be a go-to dining location for me whenever I'm in Boston (cost + wait + cramped), it was still totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: This is a must go to destination for lobster rolls!  My trip to Boston was shorter than I would have liked it to be, but before I left I was on a mission to have the lobster roll at Neptune Oyster.My last few hours before I boarded my plane back to Los Angeles, I made my way to North End.  Upon entering the restaurant, I noticed the charm and appeal that it had right away, but it was smaller than I thought it would be.  That being said, I was very glad to come by during lunch and not dinner like I previously planned.  I later found out that there was a two hour wait for dinner the night that I wanted to go.  By the way, they do not take reservations so keep that in mind.  Lunch time at Neptune Oyster has a manageable number of people coming through, so you don't have to wait long at all.In any case, I sat down at the counter and was immediately greeted by the friendly wait staff.  I was given a menu and asked if I'd like anything to drink.  That's when I noticed that they have mircobrewed beers on tap.  I then said to the bartender that I'd like to order the Maine Lobster Roll with fries and asked if I could sample the beer.  She put in the order and gave me my samples.  The beers were good, and they would've gone well with my meal, but I ended up getting the Guinness.  I made the right choice because it was the perfect drink to wash down my amazing lobster roll.This meal was my last in Boston, and it was my absolute favorite of all that I tried in the city.  They serve the lobster roll on a toasted brioche bun with the option of hot with butter or cold with mayo.  I got it hot.  This is one of the many times I wish the internet could allow us to taste and smell what we see in pictures because I do not have the ability to convey how much flavor this lobster roll gives off.  On top of that, they are no where near stingy with the portions of lobster.  I was full well before I got to the end, but that didn't stop me from polishing off the whole thing.  I do have to mention that the lobster roll is priced at $27, but it is well worth the price.  Additionally, the fries were a good compliment to the roll, but the next time I go I will be asking them to make it a little crispier.  All in all, go to Neptune Oyster.  It's worth the trip.  I know I'm going back next time I'm in town!

Reviews.Author: Swan Z.
Reviews.Content: First meal in Boston; also the most anticipated meal--over one thousand reviews on yelp with an average of 4.5 stars. What can go wrong?BF & I arrived around 4:30 for a late lunch/early dinner. For such an odd hour, it was pretty crowded, though not yet packed full. We were seated at the bar and ordered some oysters to start off with, the johnnycake, hot lobster roll for him and seafood cioppino for me. The oysters were good; the island creeks were the best. The johnnycake was amazing: very savory with the smoked trout and the caviar. Then it just went downhill from there: the lobster roll was nothing special. BF said it was TOO buttery. The cioppino had no flavor. I didn't even finish it.Basically, we were very excited to have something very "boston" with very fresh seafood and have a good solid time. But everything was below par compared to the seafood we've had in our hometown NYC and the service just sucked. Throughout our trip, we've come across a lot of super nice Boston natives (some guy actually stopped and helped us find our way without even being asked to. who would do that for you in nyc???)  and so it just shocked me how rude the staff was here. We were seated at the bar, facing three servers and not one of them will give you any attention unless they're handing you your food. I don't remember the last time I had trouble getting my water glass refilled. Here, I asked for it to be refilled and was promptly ignored. That's over the top even for new york standards.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie G.
Reviews.Content: I frickin' love me some Neptune Oyster.Seriously....anywhere I go, I can never get better oysters or a selection than here. Be warned: the place is TINY. You can opt to put your name on the wait list (good luck!) show up at off times (anytime right before or after the lunch rush) or stalk the bar. I generally do the latter two. I've never had to wait more than 35 minutes this way.I almost ALWAYS stick to the oysters here. I've had sweet, I've had salty, I've had briny...but I've never been disappointed. Service has always been fantastic as well--they really know their stuff. Drinks wise...I generally stick to vodka waters when I'm here--this place is all about the oysters. I HAVE tried their lobster salad roll and that was pretty awesome--fresh lobster, light on the mayo and a little dill. I always rave about this place when I start talking oysters to someone (most recently at Spoto's in FL) and if they know their seafood....they know Neptune.Word of advice: if you want some sweet treats after, don't go to Mike's (blah) or Modern (much better.) Check out Lulu's next door for a cupcake.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D.
Reviews.Content: We shared raw oysters/clams and neptunes on piggyback.  I had the hot lobster roll, and she had the cioppino.  All we could say throughout the meal was "wow.". Amazing food and very friendly service.  Make sure to wash it down with bubbly, white wine, or a micro brew.

Reviews.Author: Alex K.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll and fries anywhere.  The se vice was terrific and friendly. Also really enjoyed the bottle of wine.

Reviews.Author: Eric G.
Reviews.Content: The gold standard for seafood in Boston.  Get to the restaurant at 5 pm (or even earlier) or expect to wait about 2 hours for seating.  But it is worth it!Recommended Dishes:-Lobster Roll (Hot with butter)-Fried Clams-Seared Scallops-Johnnycake (make sure you smear the butter, trout and caviar on top of the Johnnycake)NOTE:  If you are a party of two, you may get seated at the bar rather than a table.

Reviews.Author: Omi H.
Reviews.Content: FINALLY, was able to get into the Neptune Bar in North End.  After 2 years of trying to get in, a couple of co-workers and me finally made it!  The wait is crazy, so we sent a co-worker over when they opened at 11am to get in line.  He said there were about 40 people in front of him waiting in line when he arrived.  Once the doors opened, he was the 2nd person to be put on the waiting list.  Which they said would be about 1  1/2 hours.  The good thing was that they said they'd call us when we had about 15 minutes before we could sit, which was perfect since we work down the street.  A couple of us ordered both the cold and hot lobster rolls and split them.  The hot lobster roll is definitely the way to go!  Except I think they should serve a little dish of additional hot butter because some of the pieces of lobster didn't get much butter since it soaks to the bottom of the bun.  MMmmm.  The lobster pieces were huge!  We also ordered the pancake smoked trout tartar with caviar and a couple of dozen of oysters.  The pancake was good, but I think a little too rich for 1 person, it was a great piece to split though.  The oysters were really good.  It's tiny inside, we sat way in the back left hand corner in a booth, which was almost perfect, except one of my co-workers had to keep getting up to let someone in or out from the table right behind him.  Besides that, it was definitely worth the wait!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Aimee C.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant definitely deserves a solid five star rating. The food is so amazing that even a two hour wait is worth it. The only downturn is the space. They don't have a lot of seats so we had to share a table with another couple and the wait was usually more than two hours. But if you don't mind waiting, give this restaurant a try!

Reviews.Author: Matthew L.
Reviews.Content: This is a small place that does not take reservations.  Stop by first, put your name on the list and go for a walk.  They have a good selection of raw bar foods.  We got a mix, and the day I was there the kushi oysters were the best.  (obviously this will change by the day).  They have a lighter clam chowder.  The one dish I tried that really stood out was the lobster roll hot.  Absolutely delicious and packed full of lobster.  My one tip is that it is not good for larger groups due to size constraints.

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is very small in nature but is known for their Lobster Roll and Oysters. Both of which my wife can attest to are amazing. She had the butter based version of the Lobster Roll and was not disappointed. Where this restaurant will disappoint however is on service and also if you have any non seafood eaters. Their entire menu, every item, has seafood in it or on it.  So there are no real opinions for people that don't like seafood except to start modifying items to exclude seafood. We also found the service very lack lustre and despite ordering drinks twice we never received them.  So a great location if you want amazing seafood.

Reviews.Author: Celeste L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing tiny seafood place tucked at the entrance of the North End's Salem Street.  We got there about 7 pm the other night for dinner and only had to wait about 20 minutes.  Meanwhile, great people watching - folks briskly walking home from work, preppy girlfriends going for dinner, pushy Asian businessmen jockeying for their position in line, an Indian couple that was doing a horrible job of parallel parking - bumping the car in front and the Mercedes behind them. Dinner for us was 5 gigantic pink Indonesian shrimp, a bowl full of briny New England steamed clams, a decadent lobster salad roll, and fresh cioppino. The seafood was sweet and juicy, the ambiance busy and lively.  Be prepared to sit in a shared table with those preppy girlfriends.  Seated next to the drafty doorway, we kept seeing the waitress kindly but firmly turn people away as they had sold out for the night (at 8:30!) I felt so much more grateful that we had gotten a table so easily.  Places like this make me miss living in the city.

Reviews.Author: Alyn P.
Reviews.Content: I'm not from Boston, but have heard a lot about this place and how amazing it is so definitely had to go check it out. I went on a Saturday morning at 11 AM or so. Got there and there was already a line outside the restaurant. The restaurant opened promptly at 11:30 AM and we got seated right away. The set up of the restaurant inside is not very big; there's lots of bar seating in addition to tables that line the wall. The staff were all extremely friendly. I think for those come later and can't get seated, they get put on a wait list and then the restaurant will call you when seats open up. What I really liked was that there was a separate oyster menu that featured the different types of oysters they had available for that day. For example, when I went they had Moon Shoal, Watch Hill, Kumamoto, Summerside, East Beach Blonde, Pleasant Bay, etc. They even list a description of the different oyster types, including size, salt level, and flavor. I heard the Lobster Roll here was amazing so I had to order that. Got the hot lobster roll and had to say it was quite yummy. I'm a big fan of butter - so I asked for some butter on the side. I'm not going to say this is the best lobster roll I've ever had, but I loved the fact that they definitely filled that roll up with lots and lots of fresh lobster. No skimping out on meat is a definite plus in my book! I also had the neptunes on piggyback. The pork they used in this dish was moist and flavorful. There's supposed to be crisp oysters in this appetizer as well, but I felt like the pork is what made this dish and was the flavor you could really taste. If I had to recommend a dish from this restaurant, I would say to go for the seared georges bank scallops. This was my favorite part of my meal. The scallops were cooked perfectly and it's on a bed of duck confit. The duck was a bit on the drier side, but still had really good flavor. Found that the one thing my companions with me didn't like was the brussels sprouts. Personally, I like them so it just added to the dish. The ones they use are small also, so I felt like the taste ratio between all the ingredients was awesome!

Reviews.Author: Nathaniel P.
Reviews.Content: It is good. Not out of this world awesomely good -- but without argument good quality seafood.  But probably not as good as people seem to think.  I could never get in here during normal hours, so we went for lunch at 11:30am, and got the lost spot at the bar, in front of the door, on a freezing cold rainy day (and thus people constantly stood with the door open trying to get the attention of the waiter, subjecting us to a cold blast air, as we tried to tell them it was already over an hour wait, which the waiter would finally tell them 5 minutes later.)   The hype and the crowds is over the top. The food is not quite, but still good.   If this was a quite little place near the water on the North Shore, it would be greatest discovery ever.  As a really busy place in the North End, it is pretty good -- but doubt I will ever repeat.  The prices are very high, even by North End standards.  The food again is good but not over the top, the wait staff is attentive but overtaxed dealing with the naive crowds are of people who think they're going to get seated any time soon.  Boston should have best seafood in the country.  It doesn't, or at least it is hard to find.  And places were it did like Skipjacks and Legal Seafood have seen quality drop precipitously and prices go through the roof.  So there is a void for places like this.  Boston deserves to have an awesome 5-star quality seafood restaurant, but this isn't it.

Reviews.Author: Sophie C.
Reviews.Content: I got the fish taco because they do fish tacos on Sundays. BEST FISH TACO I HAVE EVER EATEN. Man, I could definitely go for another one of those. I really liked how huge it was and the fish fillets had great crunchy breading on the outside and the fish on the inside was hot, juicy, and tender. The slaw and sauce on the side enhanced the flavors of the fish! To my disappointment, I was not impressed with the lobster roll! :( The lobster pieces were chewy and overcooked! D: whattttt. but at least the flavor and the melted butter were satisfactory. Not worth my $26. :/ I wish I had just ordered 2 fish tacos instead! :P I'm not a big fan of raw oysters to begin with...so I didn't order any for myself. But, my friends did and they kept talking about how they were so good, so I tasted one of them and I have to admit, it was one delicious raw oyster. Very smooth, good texture, fresh, not dirty and sandy at all...it didn't turn me into a raw oyster fan but now I know how good a raw oyster can taste. The staff seemed pretty nice and friendly for how busy and hectic it can get. The wait was SUPER LONG. We waited about 2 hours. The place is also tiny but it's cute. This place is definitely pricey but I think that fish taco was worth it! :D And I guess now I can say I have tried Boston's famous lobster roll! But i suppose there may be a better one out there?! :P If you want to see the food and environment for yourself, feel free to watch my video!

Reviews.Author: Bryanne M.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll- warm with butter. Enough said. There will be a wait. A crazy wait- go in the afternoon at a random time, put your name in, and then go walk around (probably for at least an hour). Then order the lobster roll. Oysters are good, but that's what I go for every time.And for the crazy rush (all the time), they don't rush you out of your seats. It's a pretty great experience- just be prepared to wait. And it's not cheap. But worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jeanna S.
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS OYSTERS! (obviously since it IS called neptune OYSTER)delicious melt-in-your-mouth lobster roll. MUST GET the buttermilk johnnycake (best johnnycake i've ever had!!)overall, superb food but with a price tagTAKE HOME NOTE: good for special occasions or when you want to ball out or when you want to impress someone.

Reviews.Author: Long P.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for a two hour wait, but believe me, it's totally worth it.Kill the time by grabbing a drink at one of the local pubs, or head down the street to Mike's Pastry to eat dessert before dinner.Once you do a get a seat, here's what you need to order:-OYSTERS: You'd hope a place with Oyster in the name would do it right.  Yup!  More than 10 different varieties of east and west coast oysters.  My favorite was the Wellfleet from Wellfleet, MA (salty with a sweet buttery finish).  I've never been an oyster connoisseur, but this place opened my eyes to the wonderful world of oysters! -MAINE LOBSTAH ROLL: They give you huge-@$$ chunks of lobster.  You can have it warm and buttered, or cold with mayo.  All for $25.-SEARED SCALLOPS: With pear butter, brussel sprouts, duck confit = party in your mouth.  Absolutely delicious.

Reviews.Author: Joa K.
Reviews.Content: It's true. The hot lobster roll here is baaambdotcom. Yeah, the wait was ridiculously long even for 11am on a Friday (business lunch goers?). But I was on vacation - no worries. Roamed around North End until the restaurant called me to let me know my seat was ready. Um yeah, party of 1, but whatever. I have no shame...I'm a tourist!  :PI started with some oysters. All I remember is everything was really fresh and delicious. The Kushi was my favorite!But the hot lobster roll was the hero of my visit. SO GOOD. Generous amount of lobster, not an overwhelming amount of butter (too much butter IS gross). I'm happy just thinking about it. I long for it...I miss you.I'll hopefully be back someday.

Reviews.Author: Peter C.
Reviews.Content: SMALL.   This place is really, really SMALL.   If you don't mind sitting on strangers laps, ok maybe it's not that bad, but you will be elbow to elbow with EVERYONE in there.   The place is ungodly small.  I don't know how to stress this.  I'm convinced the entire place is about the size of a delivery van.  3 tables and bar area with no room inbetween.  It seats maybe 20 people.I am uncomfortable eating in an environment where strangers tables are right on top of mine.   This is coming from an italian who grew up with meals being social events.  Lots of people, but they were family and friends!  There is NO room to stand inside and wait, so people who want to come in out of the cold will be back to back with you as you sit enjoying your oysters or lobster.You're in store for an epic wait and constantly jostling from those moving around you.  I could not think of a worse dining experience.   I feel bad knocking them for the size of the place, but it's really not the environment where I can enjoy the good food.  If you don't mind the cramped experience or the 2 hour waits... you should go for the seafood.  I can't justify the wait or the dining experience for the food though.

Reviews.Author: Shannon G.
Reviews.Content: It's small. The wait is forever. And it's really small.Was it worth it?  Hell yes!We arrived at 5pm and it was already full with an hour wait. There's no bar to wait at. There's not even room right inside the door to wait. They put you on a list and take your cell number to text/call when it's your turn to enter heaven. It allows you to wander the North End looking at shops, have a cocktail, etc. That's civilized. I've always wondered why most restaurants don't do that. Finally somebody listened to my prayers!You will be packed in shoulder to shoulder with other patrons. I didn't like that part. The air conditioning couldn't keep the place cooled appropriately.We were seated at the bar facing the window on the street. That made for some great people watching while we waited for our food. The drawback was that it put us next to the door and folks would stand there for long periods of time holding it open letting out precious air condition. I'd be lying if I didn't say that I enjoyed it just a bit when people wandered in and were told it was two plus hours wait while we already had seats.They have a great selection of oysters, crab claws, etc. We picked about 14 or so. They were all fresh and prepared perfectly. No broken shells, clean shells, the muscle was fully detached, etc. The guy prepping them was right in front of us and we watched him discard several oysters if he broke the shell or made any minor mistake. My only minor complaint was I asked for horseradish and it was provided floating as a dollop in cocktail sauce.Our entrees didn't disappoint either.  Cooked and seasoned perfectly. If you can manage to get a seat you should go.

Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: I ate this lobster roll two days ago and I am still speechless. It was absolutely amazing! The lobster is cooked to perfection and you get a TON of it on your roll! Perfect amount of melted butter, and the bread was delicious! I know you want to hear about the roll, but the fries were the best I've ever had too! Amazing seasoning! Other than life changing food-- I was really pleased with the service! Each server was so kind/friendly and helped us so willingly! I was very impressed!This lobster roll is worth any wait and the $27 price tag. It is phenomenal! I'm dreaming about it!

Reviews.Author: Matthew C.
Reviews.Content: Yes, you will wait, and wait, and wait some more, at Neptune Oyster, but it's totally worth it!  Without a doubt, my experience at Neptune Oyster was the best meal I've ever eaten.  There, I said it.  Hopefully my grandmothers and mother don't hold it against me!  (I'm sure they'd agree.)After putting you name down, you'll probably have over an hour-long wait.  The host takes your phone number, so if you're from out of town and haven't ventured around the North End, this would be a good time to do it.  I swear, you feel like you're in the middle of The Godfather--super authentic Italian feel.  (I wouldn't push the timing, though, or you won't have a table when you get back.)Neptune Oyster is really small inside--dark and cozy--so you'll be squeezed right next to the people beside you.  Not that that's a bad thing.  What better way to make new friends than over some delicious food!We started with the Clam Chowder.  Best clam chowder in my book!  I like how it's on the lighter side (even though it's still cream-based).  The chunks of potato are cooked to perfection--not too hard or soft.  The large chunks of clam also don't have a rubbery texture to them.  (Get it with the cracked pepper.  It gives the dish a little somethin' extra.)But that was just a warmup.  The Hot Lobster Roll is awesome!  With an overflowing amount lobster and healthy serving of salted butter seeping through the super-fresh roll, this lobster roll requires a fork and knife.  Sweet, rich, and delicious.And though it doesn't get enough recognition, the halibut filet was the best prepared piece of fish I've ever tasted.  The large filet flaked easily with a fork and had not the slightest "fishy" taste to it.  The seasoned breadcrumbs that encrusted the top added an excellent flavor that didn't take away from the fish.  It was served on a bed of vegetables, but it was the grapefruit that added a nice--and unexpected--sweet and sour kick.  Considering that this seems to be a rotating feature, I'd be tempted to order it over the lobster roll (shock!) if they had it again.Really, for anyone who likes seafood, you can't visit Boston without going to Neptune Oyster.  And even if you don't like fish, I think you'd like the stuff they serve up here--though then you may be so spoiled rotten you'd never eat seafood again anywhere else!

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: The King, Queens, Prince AND Princess of all seafood restaurants in the Boston area. I love everything about this restaurant. I love their servers, who are helpful, friendly and attentive. I love the restaurant itself with their fish charts, warm glowing lights and the coziness. I love the hustle and bustle of the people who eat here. Yes, the wait can be brutal especially in the winter when it's 10 degrees outside but it is so worth it. If you couldn't tell, I am in love with Neptune Oyster. Every time I visit Boston, I eat here and I rarely, one may say never, eat at the same restaurant twice (there are too many great foods to try!). Below are the dishes I have tried and would get again.Clam chowder: probably my least favorite dish I have eaten here only because I prefer thicker chowders and Neptune's is more liquid but still flavorful.Lobster roll: FAVORITE dish here. I usually get the buttered one over the mayo. The bread is perfectly toasted and the lobster is well seasoned. I always end up wanting more.Oysters: fresh, well shucked and the condiments they give you for them are great.Triton Plateau: amazing and more than enough food for two. They don't skimp on anything. This one has oysters, clams, mussels, lobster and shrimp. Perfect for seafood lovers!

Reviews.Author: Robert F.
Reviews.Content: Very very good, it got better spending a little time there. I had 4 oysters. All had descriptions and were very good. The best was the fish. Cooked whole with head and bone. I navigated like a chainsaw through Brie but otherwise a great experience.  After my Hannibal lector like carving I was very proud and very satisfied especially with the succulent side servings which complimented the fish very nicely!

Reviews.Author: Lori N.
Reviews.Content: Hubba hubba, hot lobster roll!All I can say is that if I were on death row, the hot lobster roll here is a top contender for my last meal ever - it's that good! The lobster is generously buttered & piled high on a roll. The roll soaks up all that flavorful goodness & pretty much because butter with a side of bread. But the lobster is the main attraction. The chunks are huge & you get a ton of that tender sweet sweet lobster. Ahh, I'm drooling just thinking about it!! At $25 a pop, it might be offensive to your wallet, but once your taste buds have at it, you will not mind paying a mountain of gold for a lobster roll. The oysters here are amazing as well! They have so many varieties & describe each of them based on size, texture, saltiness, and finish. I felt like I learned so much about oysters the two times I came here in two days. That's right, i loved it so much I went twice in two days!The place is small & can get packed all day long, so I suggest getting there early, putting your name on the wait list (they call you when it's your turn to be seated) & just wander around the North End, even explore some of the Freedom Trial while you wait to work up your appetite. A must visit for your trip to Boston!

Reviews.Author: Dina ..
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll in Boston. Crazy good buttery and fresh. Make sure you order it hot. U won't regret it promise.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best lobster roll!!!! My boyfriend and I shared one hot (buttered) and one cold (with mayo) to get a taste of both. The hot def triumphed over the cold, but that should be obvious... who doesn't love butter?? Each lobster roll, while pricey at $25 a pop, is gigantic and is presented to you overflowing with lobster. Take a bit from one end and lobster will fall out of the other!I loved the layout of their oyster menu. Ordering oysters at Island Creek Oyster Bar was overwhelming to a noob like me but Neptune's menu describes in detail the taste of each particular oyster so if you know you like high salt, you can select from their high salt offerings. And who ever thought that something from the sea could have a "honeydew finish" to it?? (If that intrigues you, try the Kumamoto oyster from Washington). While I appreciated the ease in ordering at Neptune, their selection wasn't as impressive or tasty as Island Creeks'.I've heard of some crazy wait times, like 3+ hours. But I came at opening and was in the first round of seating, whew! Early bird gets the worm :)

Reviews.Author: Wai H.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food!Oysters - the best!Lobster Roll (warm- DEAD!Location - tourist spot, but so many options to kill time while waiting to be seated here, but I tell you it's worth the wait.Beer - good!!!!Price - not to bad for quality of food!!Must return!

Reviews.Author: Amanda P.
Reviews.Content: Got to the restaurant as soon as they opened waited on line 10 min to find out we had an hour wait - not surprised. They took my cell number and called before an hour was up to give us a table.  Place is tiny not many seats we sat with another couple pretty much. Service was great! If you like oysters and a raw bar this place is a must!My favorite part: lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Stewart C.
Reviews.Content: Holy butt liquid does this place scream tourist trap....  Literally so small you could get trapped by the other customers....  I have no idea what the big deal is, It's Boston there are tons of seafood places.  Yes not all are great but WTF the prices are perversely outrageous.  Go north of the city and you can find many many better places.... IF you have money to burn and like being squished then come here....

Reviews.Author: Carla S.
Reviews.Content: There's no way to describe this place! It's absolutely amazing! We had the clams, the buttermilk pancake with trout tartare and the lobster roll and I can't even begin to tell you which dish was more amazing than the other!  Small place and no reservations, but boy unbelievable and a most visit every time I come back to Boston. Incredible service and amazing food!

Reviews.Author: Brittany P.
Reviews.Content: IT DOES NOT GET BETTER THAN THIS RESTAURANT FOR OYSTERS AND HOT LOBSTER ROLLS. Came here for the opening time on Sunday 6/8/14. The rumors are true (thank god I'm an avid Yelp! reader and took the advice of others!) if you do not want a wait you MUST get here before it opens and wait for the first seating or else your wait will be 2+ hours. (They do not take reservations.) On Sunday it opens at 11:30 and we were in line around 11:15 and had about 10-12 people ahead of us. Luckily we made it in the first wave of seating as this place is small. They have about 5 -7 (not sure) tables that seat 6 each and you may sit with others at your table as they try to fill it as much as possible due to the wait. They also have about 10-12 bar seats also. I was sitting right by the door and before our appetizers even came out people kept coming in trying to get a seat and were being told that at this time the wait was around 2 hours and 45 minutes at this point and if they wanted to wait they would call them when their table was ready. Now, is all this worth it? YES. YES. YES. They give you a menu you check off of what oysters they have available and you choose which ones and how many you'd like. They're about $3-$5 a piece with some of the raw bar being $20 a PIECE. Best oysters I've ever had. So fresh. Then I ordered the infamous hot lobster roll. SO good. I saw a few people order the cold but from what I've heard hot is the only way to go. HUGE chunks of lobster and dripping in butter in the best way possible. Well worth the $27. It comes with fries on the side,  they were good but I was so full I barely ate them. Service was very good too. If you're a seafood lover please try this place and get here early! You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Author: Christine k.
Reviews.Content: Favorite restaurant in town! This is how good this place is: I came here with my folks while ghastly sick with a cold and could barely smell/taste anything. I've never felt more regret in my whole life because when the food came, even with a terrible cold I could taste how ridiculously delicious everything was. The whole fish is my favorite (I never order whole fish, never eat whole fish, maybe at a Chinese restaurant but certainly not an Italian one, but this one blew my mind). Not a single thing was bad here. Crazy crowds though (for good reason), so come prepared.

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: Like everyone I tried the lobster roll with hot butter.  The butter wasn't terribly overpowering though I felt the lobster roll was just that...a lobster on a roll.  I also tried samplings of many oysters which were ridiculously accurate in its descriptions and had a bit of the branzino...which I will definitely order next time!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer N.
Reviews.Content: If you're coming here for oysters - this place is great! I ordered a variety of fresh raw oysters and the description of these (on the list they give you) was spot on! You could taste the difference in each one. So fresh and delicious. I also ordered the hamachi ceviche - I don't like fish, but thought...I'm sure it must be good here..and I was right! The ceviche is not your typical ceviche with tilapia and lime juice and all that jazz. They serve it sashimi style with four pieces and a layer of kimchi and greens on top. VERY GOOD. The flavor, texture, freshness - it was all perfect. Now for the clam chowder...that's where the disappointment came in. For $11 a bowl..you'd expect the best clam chowder you've had. Meh. It wasn't bad, but it lacked flavor.  It's a VERY light chowder. If you're expecting a chunky chowder - this is not the one for you. It had a liquid, thin consistency. There was also more potatoes in it than actual clam. I probably had about 3 pieces of actual clam.

Reviews.Author: Jessica O.
Reviews.Content: Best Lobster Roll in Boston? You bet I'm gonna show up :)I got here shortly after opening on a Monday, and got a cozy spot right up at the bar. I ordered my lobster roll hot with butter, and substituted a salad for the fries, since I knew I wanted to engorge myself on local pastries afterwards.Though it was my first and only Boston lobster roll, this really felt like the one to have. The lobster was tender and soaked in rich butter. The roll was toasted beautifully and soft inside. There really is no graceful way to eat this, so maybe don't order it on a first date. But other than that scenario, there is no reason that you shouldn't be eating this right now.

Reviews.Author: AJ R.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I do respect Neptune Oyster, the food is excellent, well executed with true thought behind the dishes. I had the Lobster Roll (hot buttered CT style), my wife had the Cioppini which was also very good. While prob the best Lobster roll I have had in Boston, its really simple execution which most places can't seem to nail. Fresh picked Lobster meat (def not frozen) with a nice grilled, buttered bun. The Cioppini was very good, although you can find dishes of similar auality elsewhere in Boston. It is delicious and the quality of the seafood is superb.The only reason I am giving it 3 stars is the ridiculous wait time both times we have gone there. Neptune is good and definitely worth a visit, it is not however, worth a 3 hour wait on a Saturday afternoon. Also, our waitress seemed "annoyed" that she forgot one of our guests chowders orders, then even more annoyed that she forgot one of our Steamed Littleneck orders. Be apologetic, not defensive. Most people have worked in the food industry at some point and understand mistakes can be made.Troquet, Mistral, Sorrelina are the best plates in the city, on their busiest nights you will wait no more than 1-1/2 to 2hrs. Add 30min to an hour on top of any wait time they tell you, happened both times we went.

Reviews.Author: Sid A.
Reviews.Content: Waited for 2 hours. Get there early because they close early after the wait.SUPER good oysters.Was expecting A LOT for the lobster roll. It was really good but a little bit too dry.

Reviews.Author: Sharon H.
Reviews.Content: When in Boston, do as the Bostonions do. And the Lobsta Roll certainly is what Bostons LOVE. This is it, this is what everyone hypes about and do I hate giving into the hypes, but hey, we only live once, why not give it a shot? So, after grabbing amazing pastries at Modern Pastry and Mike's Pastry, we headed over for lunch at Neptune Oyster... and boy is this place tiny. And I mean, tiny. It is literally a one person walkway with a row of booth seating at your left hand side and about 15 bar seats to your right hand side. And directly infront of you is the kitchen and a small restroom. Okay, so this place was already packed on a Sunday afternoon at 11:30am. Figured. Nonetheless, we were here and we were ready for some lobsta. The one waiter holding down the fort of 10+ people at the entry way, squeezing side by side, was able to take down our names and phone number for our small party. The wait was going to be an hour and a half and that he'd give us a call once our table was ready. So definitely plan somethng to do within that time. We went to see Paul Revere's house (2 minute walk). Surely enough, after exploring the Paul Revere house two streets down and around the corner, an hour and a half passed and our phone call drew us back out into the 23 degrees F boston air and into the warm Neptune Oyster abode.Obviously, it was a given that we came for the hot, buttered Lobster roll $27 that everyone has been raving about. Man, was the lobsta and buttered roll so freaking delicious. Gracious chunks of lobster meat, lean, tossed in a light mayo dressing, and wrapped in a hot, buttered, toasted pillowly bread. Yeah, it was good. The french fries were just as amazing, though a bit salty, but so devilish good. Hot and crispy on the outside and cotton soft on the inside. We also ordered the large North End Cioppino $25. And, honestly, I thought the North End Cioppino stole the show with the flavorful seafood broth and generous amounts of seafood (mussels, shrimp, scallops, etc) drenched over delicious saffron rice. My spoon just kept going for more and more. It was 1000x more delicious than any Ciopponi I've ever had in San Fran. So, all I've really got to say is, if you're in North End with enough time on your hands, you've got to try Neptune Oyster's lobster roll and cioppino. Its a must. I dont want to overhype it, because you will have too high of expectations and then not enjoy it as much. But, really, its delicious.

Reviews.Author: Jamie F.
Reviews.Content: ***200TH REVIEW***Saved this special review for one of my fave restaurants in Boston!Neptune Oyster is a must for anyone with OOD (obsessive oyster disorder). You know you have a problem when you crave oysters 24/7, you dismiss all health risks each time you slurp one, and you unfriend any oyster haters.The bivalves here taste fresh, are always shucked clean, and each type has a nice finish to them. All my meals here (countless times) have been nothing short of amazing, and I've tried almost the entire menu (I'm fat, leave me alone).If it's your very first visit, the obligatory order is raw oysters on the half shell (there's a dozen variety to choose from) and the hot butter Maine lobster roll, which has been featured in gourmet food magazines. I like to complete my meal with a refreshing blood orange bellini. My other fave items from the menu: blue crab cocktail, buttermilk johnnycake, yellowfin tuna, fish tacos (Sunday Special) and lobster spaghettini (Monday Special).Despite the long wait and no reservation policy, I always find myself returning to Neptune Oyster for every occasion and even when there's no occasion at all :)

Reviews.Author: Christina T.
Reviews.Content: If you like warm lobster rolls, this one will NOT disappoint. Very delicious and perfect for dinner since in the past I've always only had lobster rolls for lunch. Skip out on the fried clams.. wayyy too much batter. Need to come back to try the Johnnycake sometime!

Reviews.Author: Tony M.
Reviews.Content: This spot is as good as it gets... there are so many oyster bars in boston and neptunes is always packed... over a hour wait or more during prime lunch / dinner time.  While neighboring oyster bars are empty!   The oyster and clam raw bar selection are super fresh and hits the spot.   Had a whole Branzino (fried) and it was amazing.  Nothing better than a whole fish on your plate.The steamed wellfleet littlenecks were the best i ever had... the portion size was rediculously big too.... Service was great too...Nice work Neptune Oyster - Five Effen Stars.

Reviews.Author: Olivia J.
Reviews.Content: Go here when it's off lunch/dinner hour... M and I were able to get seats at the bar without waiting when we went at 4pm for dinner.We had oysters, warm lobster rolls, and clam chowder.  They were good, but not sure if they are worth the hype / wait... still, the lobster roll explodes with fat, juicy lobster meat if you're craving for it!

Reviews.Author: JieHeen Y.
Reviews.Content: The oysters were so fresh. Mussels as appetizer were fantastic and a good portion for the price. The lobster roll was very very good. The lobster meat was fresh and tasty. However, the only small issue is that the roll used could have been a bit better. Its small, crowded and you can expect a long wait. But they take your number and call when table is ready. No reservations allowed. Overall, a fantastic place, somewhat expensive.

Reviews.Author: Cristy M.
Reviews.Content: I love oysters and have enjoyed them many times at many "top" places in Boston.  Upon entering Neptune Oyster, I have to admit that I was expecting more.It was a warm summer day when I visited. The restaurant was uncomfortably (unexpectedly) warm, and as I ate one oyster after another, it felt as though each gulp was even warmer too.  I just couldn't take it at one point and stopped eating.  I made it through 5 oysters by the way. Perhaps this was a fluke visit on a day that the A/C wasn't functioning properly, but we all know what warm interiors and raw seafood elicit.  Service was steady and professional, and of course, the interior was impeccably clean.Am I going back anytime soon? Most likely not.  You should consider updating your A/C Neptune - both for us and your hard working staff.

Reviews.Author: Lin Z.
Reviews.Content: Went at 5:30 in a party of 4 and was able to put our name down and sat down by 6:30. The lobster roll was very heavy, buttery and disappointing.  You do get a lot of lobster, so if you like that, it's great. Personally, I thought alive and kicking is a much better value

Reviews.Author: Kawai Y.
Reviews.Content: A small place, long lines and long wait especially for dinner. I came with a party of about 12, and we waited for almost 2 hours (no surprise). We just ended up wondering around the North End during the wait, which has a lot for you to kill time with. The place was small, so they seat us at a 8 person table to cram into.I got a lobster roll with butter, which was darn delicious, and one of the best lobster meat I have had. We also shared a plate of raw oysters , which was pretty decent and quite fresh. I also stole several razor clams from a friend's dish when her back was turned, and they were delicious as well which I dipped with their cocktail sauce. Service was prompt. Expect a long wait, and try to get your name on the list at an hour or two ahead, especially for dinner with a large party. The main highlight for me here was the Lobster Roll --- just to emphasize again.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: I would've given them 5..BUT the hostess last weekend was really rude! they have the best lobster role ever. Didn't really try much else. I would love to go back. But IF JERRY is working I may go to one another restaurant that doesn't have 1 and half hr wait and rude servers .. and no real room to stretch your arms out.. smallest cramed restaurant I have ever been in ...

Reviews.Author: Andy D.
Reviews.Content: Hot. Lobster. Roll. This was the crown jewel of my three week stay in the Boston area. The hot lobster roll wasn't really soaking in butter. Now I may be from the south and all, but this is how God intended lobster to be served. I felt that the sandwich was also appropriately priced for how much incredibly scrumptious meat I received. Is the place pricey as a whole? Yes. But you do get what you pay for. It's the freshest seafood prepared very well. The largest shrimp cocktail I've ever seen on their raw bar!Make sure to get a reservation or call ahead. I walked in for lunch, and I waited 45 minutes just to sit at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Azadeh M.
Reviews.Content: I loved their lobster roll and the oysters were pretty fresh. My only complaints are their shrimp and clam chowder. The shrimp cocktail was really meaty but it lacked flavor. The clam chowder was also bland and really watery. It seemed like they just watered it down and added a bunch of butter.

Reviews.Author: Igor Z.
Reviews.Content: Get the Lobsta Roll. If there was one lobsta roll to rule them all, this is it. Tons of fresh lobsta, butter, and goodness all in one bite. Clam Chowda was pretty good, I'm more a fan of the thick variety whereas this was a very light chowda. For desert we had an assortment of East Coast Oysters that were amazing, the perfect food...I can die now, thank you Neptune.

Reviews.Author: Jeanette L.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the warm lobster roll. Just wow.Oysters were delicious, too.

Reviews.Author: stephanie b.
Reviews.Content: SO WORTH THE WAIT!!!After reading all the reviews, my husband and I decided on a plan of action to get a seat without waiting for hours - go on our run early on a sunday morning and arrive at Neptune within a half hour of their opening at 11:30am.  Mission accomplished as we arrived at 12:00 PM to a full restaurant with people and fish everywhere!!  They took our name and number and said 30-45 min, we will call you.We walked around and finally 40 min later they called so we practically ran back. Once back we still waited a few minutes, no biggie.  Placed at the bar with a raw bar menu we were ready!  The descriptions offered on that menu were extremely accurate.  We love oysters and were looking forward to some east coast varieties.  So happy to have killer descriptions to keep us in the flavor profiles we prefer while being able to expand to some alternate flavors.Post oysters, I had the shrimp cocktail and I have NEVER had shrimp like that!  The server was very knowledgeable and when she suggested four shrimp as my "meal" I decided that I could always order more later.  My husband ordered the hot lobster roll with "light" butter.My shrimp: HUGE - almost the size of a 1.5lb lobster tail.  No joke.  I wasn't sure I could eat all 4!His Roll: ALSO HUGE - based on the 1.5lb lobster I had today, there had to have been 4lbs worth of whole lobsters meat on that roll that was so soaked with the light butter that he couldn't even eat it but man, was it so fresh and tasty!!Go.  Whenever you can.  Fresh, clean, tasty and fun.  The hustle and bustle works there.  Phenomenal and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Billy D.
Reviews.Content: It's as good as the reviews say. Every god damn bit.Get there early. Have a cocktail. Order tons of oysters. Get a bottle of wine. Choose a bunch of food - the menu is brilliant. Then, be ready for a sizable check. Then realize it's one of the best meals you've had in a while, and get over the check.

Reviews.Author: Christina Y.
Reviews.Content: So, the food is great, but not THAT great for there to be a HUGE line. If you really want to try this place, I would recommend going 15-20mins before they open and wait so that you will be seated when it opens. There isn't a lot of seating, so def. get there early!Lobster roll was great.. you get a lot of lobster (but pricey).. Oysters were fresh as well... but nothing special. I really think places like get great reviews based on the amount of lobster/food you get, however, not sure you can justify price to the quantity... after all, it's just a roll...

Reviews.Author: Ken H.
Reviews.Content: Probably my favorite restaurant in Boston.   Highly recommend the raw oysters, they are some of the best anywhere.  Also, while not a huge mussels fan  Neptune's Oyster is the best that I have every had.Neptune's is a small restaurant with awkward seating,  but just adds to the charm.  Definitely worth the wait on any given night (even in January!)

Reviews.Author: Connie H.
Reviews.Content: WOW. BEST oysters I have ever had!The place is small and kind of crowded. We waited for almost over an hour (got there around 8:00PM on a Thursday), but it was all worth it. If you have guests coming to Boston and you can only take them to one restaurant, Neptune Oyster should be your first choice!! Hot lobster roll is also recommended.Damn this college student budget that doesn't allow me to eat this every weekend...

Reviews.Author: Schiffon W.
Reviews.Content: For my birthday, it was finally time to have our first sit down dining experience since moving to Massachusetts.  To expectation set, I will lead with two things that I wish I had know upfront, first there is no dessert menu and second having their alcohol offerings are limited to beer and wine. Given that this is New England and I have heard favorable feedback we had expectations for great seafood. While our food was good, it was not exceptional. We have had far superior raw bar offerings in Princeton,  NJ and Las Vegas. The Monkfish entree was tasty however the rabbit was suboptimally prepared month and didn't enhance the dish. Given the horrible parking situation and the lack of intimate space to enjoy the meal, we really don't have an incentive to return as there was nothing strikingly positive about the restaurant,  especially not for the price.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Delish.  Food was amazing, service was exceptional.

Reviews.Author: Dorothy W.
Reviews.Content: Teeny place with lobster rolls Wins in all the voting polls. This is where I plop my fannyWith my family and my Granny. You will scramble for your seatsWhen you look for North End treats.Tourists flock here by the dozens;Parents, siblings, distant cousins. Local oysters on your plateWill obliterate the wait; Littlenecks and Neptune CaesarsSatisfy both youth and geezers. You'll be packed in here quite tight, But the food makes that all right. While you wait, just don't complain,Unless you're slammed with snow and rain. They summon you when tables open;The shortest wait, we all are are hoping. You'll see celebs and local mobsters;Don't say, "Lobstahs." Ask for lobsters.Scallops, shrimp and shellfish stew; Johnnycakes and mussels, too. See those crowds on Salem Street? Grab your spot, then grab your treat. It is open every day,Which would please Ernest Hemingway. *Drink some wine and make some plans.You'll soon become true Neptune fans. * "As I ate the oysters with their strong taste of the sea and their faint metallic taste that the cold white wine washed away, leaving only the sea taste and the succulent texture, and as I drank their cold liquid from each shell and washed it down with the crisp taste of the wine, I lost the empty feeling and began to be happy and to make plans." Ernest Hemingway, A Movable Feast.

Reviews.Author: Natalie I.
Reviews.Content: I know that there's nothing to really add to the bazillion rave reviews on this site but I'm going to give it a shot anyway because I can not stop thinking about the damn  lobster roll.  We must have been extremely lucky because we arrived just before 1130am and there was no line = no wait.   Awesome. We were seated at the bar, had the warm lobster roll.   It was so good infact, I would have waited outside in a hurricane for it.    The fries that accompany the buttery piece of lobster heaven were also fantastic.   Oysters were good but the standout here is definitely the lobster!  Loved watching the staff shuck the oysters. Basically....   a ton of lobster + butter + brioche = heaven Neptune Oyster does it right!  I can't wait to return when I'm back in Beantown.

Reviews.Author: Jason D.
Reviews.Content: Food is amazingly fresh.  Cozy space.  The wait come sometimes be out the door.  The staff will therefore try to get you in and on your way as quick as possible.

Reviews.Author: Julie H.
Reviews.Content: I'm not an oyster fan. I always thought it was weird eating something so slimey and my first experience was at my aunt's house. The oyster did not taste good, had a foul seafood after taste and I wondered why in the world would people like oysters?? Then, my boyfriend took me to Neptune's. I was skeptical and really didn't want to. He said that these are different. These will be the best things you will eat on this trip. Boy, was that an understatement. It's probably one of the best things I've eaten in my life. I love the east coast oysters. That oh so melt in your mouth buttery finish with that wonderful mignonette sauce. The champagne finish oysters were great! I have yet to try a west coast oyster--not sure how I will like the briney, mineral finish but if it is at Neptune's--I think I will try anything. The Lobster Roll. Ohmahgerd. I didn't expect something with SO MUCH lobster. They are VERY generous with the lobster. It was soooo good but be warned--your jaw will hurt from chewing. By half of it--I was just discarding the bread and eating the lobster. The clam chowder was not very--chowdery. I guess I am used to the thicker chowders and this was more liquidy. Good but not the best.The reviews that this place really lives up to it. Before our flight back to Virginia, we made a pit stop here just for the oysters. They are worth every penny/dollar. Can't wait to go back! Go during off hours--this place gets VERY busy. We were lucky when we got into our hotel--we went straight there and ate at the bar but a few minutes after--it filled up quick with people waiting out the door.

Reviews.Author: Toulaphone C.
Reviews.Content: I think my expectations were too high for this place after reading that it was one of the top restaurants in Boston. We ate there two hours after we put our name on the waiting list, so expect to wait! Clam Chowder - Very watery and didn't taste like what a New England Clam Chowder should have tasted like. It reminded me of condensed milk. Flash Seared Nantucket Yellowfin Tuna - Very tasty, tender fish, and had lots of flavor. Enjoyed eating every last bite.Oysters and Shrimp - Shrimp was huge! Oysters were marked as low-high in salt. We chose a few, and they were OK. We had ginormous clams before that at a local farmer's market for cheap so we probably had too high of expectations for these oysters! Their sauce (cocktail mixed with horseradish) went well with them.Place was OK, wish I tried the lobster roll!

Reviews.Author: Herbert K.
Reviews.Content: Whoa...  It's pouring, a bit before lunch, a Friday....passing by the window - there are empty seats at the bar - score!You can read all about the place above and below me.  Let it be said that they fed, warmed, and comforted me when I needed it.  Can you ask for more than that? :)

Reviews.Author: John J.
Reviews.Content: Over rated over priced, the chowder is too thin.  Decent raw bar but the place is small and deifnes the phrase "tourist trap".  They must give out free chowder to anyone who says they blog on Trip Advisor or Chow Hound.  If heading to the North End, skip this place and stick to Italian.The lobster roll is a minimum of $ 25.00.

Reviews.Author: Mad I.
Reviews.Content: Do NOT go anywhere else.  Wait your 2 hours and have the best lobster roll in Boston.  Nothing else compares...no really....I tried like every-single-one.  The thing is...this one is legit lobster chunks on a large scale...all the rest have a similar price tag (this one is $25, the rest are $17-23ish) but they are all lobster salad/mayo fest, blech.  This is the ONLY place that gets it right.  So... don't ask to sit at the bar, yes that is on a wait too, and don't fuss about the teeny tiny bathroom located in the server station...just put in your name, walk to Mikes around the corner and RUN back when they call your cell!HOT-buttery chunks of lobster, that's itCOLD-more of a lobster 'roll' with some seasoning and light sauce/mayoAfter much debate, my husband and I agree, get the cold, but try both!

Reviews.Author: Zilla K.
Reviews.Content: When visiting Boston, we knew that Neptune Oyster was a must. Our friends raved about it and so did yelp, so of course we went. We got lucky and only had to wait 10 minutes without a reservation - the place is pretty small and everyone is very closely seated. We shared a variety of fresh oysters (Kumamoto and a few others), neptunes on piggyback - which is a dish made of crispy oysters and pulled pork (divine), clam chowder (probably the best I ever had other than San Francisco's chowder in a bread bowl!) and we finished off with a warm, buttery Maine lobster roll - definitely the best lobster roll we ever had. In NY they always serve them cold with mayo, but hot with butter is wayyy better. We were happy with their selection of wine and beer and they have a full bar as well. This was a very memorable dinner and we can't wait to be back in Boston to do it again.

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best restaurant in Boston.  If you're visiting and have to pick just one place, make it Neptune!This place is tiny so be prepared for a 2-3 hour wait if you get here past 6 on a Friday or Saturday but it's worth the wait.  They take your phone number so you can walk around the North End while you wait.  Once sat, you can enjoy the best/freshest oysters you've ever had (shucked right in front of you) or any other fresh seafood you can imagine (shrimp, stone crabs, you name it).  To me, the hot and buttered lobster roll is a must nearly every time.  Probably my favorite meal in the world.  It's 100% pure lobster meat, no mayo or any of that garbage and it's SO fresh.  Can't beat i!

Reviews.Author: Nick A.
Reviews.Content: lobster was was solid but definitely overatedfries were decent but portion was smalldefinitely not a must visit

Reviews.Author: Hae A.
Reviews.Content: Best restaurant I have been to in Boston! :) Almost everything was delicious! The oysters were fresh, although I did not like thier mignonette. It had a chemical taste and so opted to use some of their amazing tasting cocktail sauce.I loved their fried clams. The clams were thick and meaty. Their tartar sauce was thick and wasn't the usual store-bought creamy sauce. Rather it was chunky and was amazing! I've never had anything like that before. There was a Johnny cake like thing we also ordered, which tasted amazing. It was a savory pancake like dish. The mussels were slightly dissappointing. Flavor was great but the mussels could have been plumper. Lobster roll - we got this hot and it was a fantastic lobster roll. There is a lot of butter though, so if you don't want an instant heart attack, it's probably best to share. The bread was perfect with the lobster. Lobster was also cooked nicely. The clam chowder was on the watery side. :( Oh one important thing. Expect a wait. We were a party of 7 and had to wait more than 4 hours to be seated on a Saturday.

Reviews.Author: Dan P.
Reviews.Content: I think this place might serve more than lobster rolls and burgers, but I couldn't tell you. Went in to get the burger with a couple friends today, and wow. They really do it up. To be completely honest, my burger was a little over done, (both my friends were cooked well though) however, it was so juicy, and tasty. The bun was nice a crispy, and buttery, oysters were done well, and the garlic mayo and relish (I'm not a relish person) were amazing. If you're in the area, and can find a seat, make sure to stop in. Beware, the burger does sell out from time to time (went the week before and it was out) so try to get there early in the day.

Reviews.Author: Leslie A.
Reviews.Content: I can't say much for you Neptune because I was only in here about 30 minutes to explore your oyster and beer selection. However, I can say what I experienced was quite wonderful. My dad went ahead ordering us each a variety of oysters off the given card which was great to see where they are coming from (he picked places we have vacationed as his motive) but the friendly waitress was more than happy to recommend some other favorites as well. It took about 10 minutes to get a beer as there were only two servers and the place was full but only 5 minutes to get our dozen oysters and 5 more minutes to devour them. They were amazing! So fresh, no sand or particles, didn't even need sauce because of the richness of flavor, and keeping the card was great to see where the oysters came from that we were eating. The place is very tiny so I'm not sure how the line is on busy days but we went around lunch time on a Wednesday and were able to get a table right away.The portions I saw (especially the fish and chips special, $24) were enormous! The pictures almost don't do it justice for how large these plates looked coming out. The only reason I am not giving Neptune 5 stars is due to the fact there was no lunch or smaller options. Our waitress informed us that even the appetizers and salads were quite filling. Since we weren't that hungry the oysters fit perfectly. In the future I would come back here for a dinner date or another pre-dinner raw seafood snack. Lastly, I don't know why I am calling it Neptune, it is Neptune Oyster. That second part is my favorite part so if you love seafood as much as I, find some time and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: San W.
Reviews.Content: Who: With b.When: Past Friday evening, 6ish. This was after we had put our name down on a list, waited for two hours, and ate a light meal at another place during the wait because we were so hungry.Where: At the bar. The place was crowded and kind of stuffy. The A/C only seemed to be half-working, which was unfortunate because it was the hottest day of the week and we had just speed walked over from the other restaurant when we got the call that our table was up.Why: b had been wanting to try it and I was craving a lobster roll.What:Allagash White- b's usual. Light.Sankaty Light Lager- Bar's recommendation when I asked for something light. It was alright. A little bit too bitter of an aftertaste but then again, I'm pretty sensitive to bitterness.Oysters! (duh)- They give you a handy dandy cheat sheet with all of the oysters' names, where they're from, their price, and a short description of their taste. Although whether the taste matches the description is pretty subjective.Island Creek (MA)- b's favorite. We did not find them as salty as they were described. Plump and juicy.Pemaquid (ME)- I liked these. Again, did not find them as salty as they were described. Plump.Browne's Point (ME)- Forgettable.East Beach Blonde (RI)- I really liked these from when I had tried them at Eastern Standard. Maybe I was tipsy at the time. They weren't as awesome as I remembered them. One was also super salty while the rest were moderately so. Fairly small in size.Summerside (PEI)- Forgettable as well.Lobster Roll (I chose to have it served hot and buttered on a toasted roll with fries)- It was good but I was expecting more what with the hype and the price tag. There were plenty of lobster chunks but they were a little bit too drenched in butter. Because of that, the roll, which wasn't very toasted to begin with, was somewhat soggy.Overall, it was kind of underwhelming. Granted, we might have been slightly more excited if we weren't all stressed and sweaty from the mad rush over from Chinatown to keep our table, if the place had been a little bit cooler, and if we hadn't already eaten another meal during our wait. If I do give it another shot, I'll be more prepared for the wait next time. Although I'm not sure what would warrant waiting that long again.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch on a business trip ending celebration.  We had all east coast oysters: mostly Maine and Rhode Island.  I really like the east coast oysters for their more brininess and mineral flavors.  Oysters by itself is very clean fresh and COLD.  But their cocktail and mignonette can use some work.  Also had littleneck an cherrystone clams.  And stone crab claw.  Very fresh.Clam chowder - too butter taste.  Not enough natural salt from the clam juice and clams.Tried the hot lobster roll.  Only place that we've been in the 3rd day that had it.  I didn't like it and now I know why most serve it cold.  Having it hot, again you just taste butter and the meat seems over done.  When its cold, you can taste the sweetness of the meat and the meat feels less dense.  Also, the fries wasn't anything special.  Belle Isle Seafood - best lobster roll and fries, fried oysters and clam chowder.Very pricey too.  $9.50 for one stone crab claw from Florida.  Wow, it wasn't that good.  I can get a 2 pound whole Dungeness Crab in San Francisco, make it at home and my satisfaction would be way higher.Champagne: Roger Coulon Brut.  Very clean and went well with everything.They had a foie gras on special online but not when we visited.  Was a bit sad and server didn't even remember like she didn't care for the foie.  Server was good.Will be back for the cold lobster roll and some oysters.

Reviews.Author: Melody N.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a small restaurant with excellent fresh seafood.  We went for the first time in around 5:30 pm to put in our name for a table of four and were told that the wait will be three and a half hours later on a Friday night.  Yes, you read that right, a three and a half hour wait.  We read other reviews on Yelp that the wait would be long and were 'prepared' to go to nearby bars and have a small snack/drink to kill time.  You cannot go in around 7 or 8 or 9 pm and expect to be seated in an hour or at the bar, etc.  There are others who have waited longer and the hostess will tell you and many others.  You cannot make a reservation over the phone, you have to physically walk in and see what time you can be seated.  Soo, be prepared to plan your night accordingly.  Who knows, maybe you'll go on a slow night and not have to wait that long.That being said, the food is amazingly fresh.  We had the Triton Plateau that consisted of crab cocktail, lobster cocktail, freshly shucked oysters, mussels, littleneck clams, and shrimp cocktail.  Our favorite was the crab cocktail.  We also ordered the clam chowder.  The clam chowder is a little on the runny/soupy side, but I enjoyed the flavor and the fresh taste.  My husband and my sister's boyfriend preferred a more hearty/thick clam chowder.  The men had cioppino with lobster while my sister and I shared a hot buttered lobster roll.  Both items were excellent.  The service was also excellent and attentive.  Conclusion, excellent food.  Be prepared for a wait and to plan ahead of time.

Reviews.Author: Angeline K.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is one of those restaurants I always remember and yearn to go back to. There is so much I love about it: the intimate vibe, the interior design/decor, the warm service, and of course, the amazing food. The only negative I can think of is that they don't take reservations. My husband came early for dinner (about 5:45 p.m.) and luckily, we were able to sit at the bar immediately. However, fifteen minutes later, people walking in were already looking at hour long waits. So if possible, definitely try to come earlier than typical lunch or dinner hours.The oyster bar here is an oyster lovers dream! I wanted to try every single one! Some of the things we ordered:Oysters - Kusshi, Kumamoto, Summerside, Watch Hill, Island Creek, Wellfleet. All fresh and delicious. I am partial to Kumamotos so those were my favorite. 15 oysters for 2 people and I still don't think it was enough haha.Buttermilk Johnnycake - I didn't even know what this was but it sounded so good on the menu I had to try it. Honey butter, smoked trout tartar, caviar and chives. OMG, next to the lobster roll, this was sooooo scrumpdiddlyumptious! It is a must try!Clam Chowder - This was the only "average" item for me. I thought the chowder at Atlantic Fish was better. Seared Georges Bank Scallops - Some of the best scallops I've ever had. D'anjou pear better, Long Island duck confit, brussels sprouts, Maytag blue cheese... what's not to love? Hot Butter Lobster Roll - I have had maybe 4-5 lobster rolls in California. All were disappointing. I never knew why people liked lobster rolls so much until I had Neptune Oyster's. Best lobster roll ever!! I don't know what makes theirs so good, but it is bomb diggity!Oh, how I wish there was a Neptune Oyster near me. I'm salivating as I'm writing this review!

Reviews.Author: Eugi H.
Reviews.Content: We came the last day of our trip to Boston, to have our last meal here before our flight. They opened at 1130AM, and we got there around 1145. The restaurant had less then 10 diners, so we were seated immediately, yes! I had read about the 3hour+ wait some people had experienced, and was trying to avoid that at all costs.We ordered 6 oysters, a hot lobster roll, and the clam chowder to split. First and foremost, Neptune has the best oyster selection and menu I have seen to date. I love how they have it in a list format, with the name of the oyster, where it comes from, price, and the taste/size. It's really helpful in picking out oysters that suit your tastes! The prices are very reasonable too, all in the $2something range. I don't like large oysters, and prefer the briny taste, so we ordered 2 Tatamagouche, 2 Weskeag, and 2 Kusshi. Each one was a winner! This was a much better oyster experience than my visit to Island Creek Oyster Bar because I knew exactly what I was picking. Like all the seafood I've experienced in Boston so far, the oysters were super fresh and delicious!The lobster roll was huge. Generous would be an understatement for the amount of lobster they stuffed into that roll. We got the hot variety, which came coated in butter instead of mayo. I had never heard of serving a lobster roll hot, so I wanted to try it out. It was ok, a bit chewier I think because it was hot, and super fresh of course. My bf appreciated this more than I did, but we both thought it was very good. The fries it came with were wonderfully seasoned and very crisp, just how I like it.The clam chowder was a big let down though. Since it is one of the popular menu items, I expected great things from the bowl. However, it was very thin and watery, and tasted more of potatoes than clams. I was so disappointed. And I absolutely love clam chowder too! I ended up just fishing out the clam bits, and leaving the soup and potatoes. Overall Neptune is a great restaurant and the oyster selection alone is good enough for multiple repeat visits. Service was good and if you come right when they open, you don't even have to wait!

Reviews.Author: Joseph D.
Reviews.Content: If you want a great selection of oysters that are fresh, this is the place. Expect a wait and to eat in close proximity to strangers. The line starts early before they open and is a tourist trap. Service and décor is not a reason to go to this oyster bar. It is very small and, again, very touristy. I have never had an unsatisfying oyster here and am awed by the wide selection.   I can't give it five stars and my wife is not impressed with me. She loves this place. But, of course, she loves oysters. The service, environment and price is lacking. However, you can't get a range of consistent oysters and variety anywhere in a city atmosphere (in Boston, anyways). I like to think I am gaining an understanding of oysters since I've eaten them all over New England, Nova Scotia, New York and New Orleans... but you be the yelping judge :)

Reviews.Author: Kenny D.
Reviews.Content: One of my all time favorite restaurants. The lobster roll is one of the greatest tasting foods I've ever had. Something I need to have anytime I'm visiting Boston.  The oysters are very fresh and the customer service is great. The restaurant is fairly small so there usually is a bit of a wait. There is a bar next door where you can kill some time until you get seated. Definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Hodor Z.
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobster rolls, amazing oysters with full description, great service, accepts majority of credit cards including AMEX, nothing to hate. But if you plan to eat here, come early. This place is packed the second they open. You will not be able to come in and sit down, you will have to put your name on the list and wait at least an hour. But when you do come in, go all out and get oysters and hot lobster rolls. If you don't get them, your trip was just wasted.

Reviews.Author: David V.
Reviews.Content: The place in the North End for Fresh Seafood!  Neptune has wonderful selection of al-a-cart oyster, traditional oyster and seafood dishes and inventive fresh options.We kept hearing about the warm lobster roll...$25...could it be that good?...yes..wait, I mean YES it can!  To call it a lobster roll is a little deceiving in these parts since it is just huge select chunks of lobster in a roll covered with warm drawn butter...but then again no one would really complain unless you wanted a classic cold version...and oh guess what...they have that too!  The conclusion: best lobster roll around...even if the warm version is cheating!They also have a good selection of local craft beers!Great food, great drink, great service...was there anything else you were looking for?...if you're good with the price tag you'll love your time here!

Reviews.Author: CeCe C.
Reviews.Content: Last year I flew quite often to Boston just to stop at Neptune for lunch and have a delicious lobster roll ($25)! I order it hot with butter! :) Every bite I took was filled with buttery goodness. Is your mouth salivating yet? Can you smell the salty butter on the warm toasted bread? I can! :PThey do make the best lobster rolls, even my NYC and Philly friends would agree! I've always wanted to try other things on their menu, but I'm usually too full after consuming the roll. The clam chowder, oysters, cioppino, etc. all look very good! I love coming here again and again. I've never had to wait in line because I think I come at the odd hours (2pm/3pm). It's a small restaurant and I can see how it can get packed since it's so popular!Maybe when it gets warmer, I'll fly to Boston for another lobster roll at Neptune! :)

Reviews.Author: Merry L.
Reviews.Content: Nothing like freshly shucked oyster. It is a small joint so be prepared to wait a little, and when busy, good comes a little slow. If you're in a rush, dine elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Vicky W.
Reviews.Content: Was told to wait in line for 2.5 - 3 hours but only ended waiting around 1.5. My family and I tried the Neptune Plateau; everything tasted extremely fresh which made my first time eating raw oysters really enjoyable and the shrimps were gigantic. The clam chowder was creamy and the clams were tender (which is hard to find for a lot of chowders). And as everyone else is saying the lobster roll was hands-down the best I've ever tasted. Definitely worth the wait. Service was amazing except because we went during the winter, every time someone walked in to put their name down the entire restaurant got this huge blast of freezing cold air. Had an amazing experience and will definitely be back to eat the lobster roll again!

Reviews.Author: Assaf B.
Reviews.Content: The best oysters I ever tasted!After this well deserving start, let's deep dive to the details.This unassuming place, small, not too fancy with a very quiet exterior is a hidden gem in north Boston.Prepared with Yelp tips about how crowded the restaurant gets (thanks Yelpers!) I came here for a late lunch / early dinner around 4pm and found the place half full.The menu is simple, straight forward and full of goodies.We had a dozen oysters and I had the lobster roll for a main. What an amazing roll.. I was getting orgasmic just smelling the buttery deliciousness, not to mention eating it.There was only one thing that didn't click, the service was not balanced.. our waiter was a little impatient while a waiter for a table next to us, was super nice (to a much more annoying diners if I may say).If you're in Boston, a must visit for the right price!

Reviews.Author: Sherry H.
Reviews.Content: This is a small place and they don't take reservations. It could get ridiculously crowded on weekends. We visited twice on Sat and Sun and the wait was too long that we gave up. We tried again and arrived before 5pm on Mon and we got in without any waiting.I would say this place is worth the three visits. We had the oysters, lobster roll, and the Monday special lobster spaghettini. Everything was amazing.The oysters were great, fresh and tasty. The oyster menu was amateurs-friendly - there were descriptions of the size and flavor of the different types of oysters. The lobster was so buttery, it was one of the best I ever had. The sauce for the spaghetti was so good that i felt guilty if i didn't share it with my friend, and when i did, she ordered extra bread to eat with it.Btw, the wait time we got on Sat was 4 hours. It could be an exception as the waiter said there were unusual amount of large groups that day. Anyway, be prepared:-)

Reviews.Author: Tiffany V.
Reviews.Content: They really should be called Pluto Oyster?  Bad joke!?  FINE. But, this place is TINY...  i mean REALLY TINY like how Pluto is now a rock and no longer considered a planet!!!  It's like the size of a tiny oyster but it's a pearl once you get to it.  Youc oudl sit around the bar and watch the oyster $2.70-2.90/ oyster with about 10 types to choose from (changes with the seasons)  The so-called smaller, nuttier and "sweeter" oysters from the pacific coast  were not that sweet at all compared to what I've had in the past.  The Atlantic medium, saltier oysters were better here.  I'm sure this changes throughout the year.  Overall, I was happy with my experience with the oysters.The Lobster Roll and fries is the bombdotcom.  Lobster is plump, juicy, heavenly and a very good amount.  You'll definately get full off this dish or could even share it.    The New England Clam Chowder (you know you've got to try New England Clam Chowder in New England!!) was really thin.  Flavor was enticing but the thin liquid was a little disappointing.  Not sure if that's normal in Boston.  I tried looking it up but was not able to find any information.

Reviews.Author: Rachel C.
Reviews.Content: they make a damn good lobster roll, obviously eaten with hot butter. The chunks of lobster are large and the meat is so so sweet. ahi tuna was great with the fried onions.

Reviews.Author: Donna Y.
Reviews.Content: Saturday 30 min prior to the opening, a long line was already forming. Lucky for us, we were among the first wave of customers. I am not a big lobster fan, never have been. So prior to coming, I was told if i absolutely had to try lobster, I HAD to come here to get the real thing. I ordered the new england clam chowwwdaa (said it exactly like a local) and the hot buttered lobster roll with fries. The chowwwdaa was not your typical NECC but a watery/thinned down version annnd let me tell you what.. I loved it! It was nice and clam-y with some potato chunks. The buttered lobster was nice and tender and surprisingly really flavorful. It didn't convert me to a lobster lover but I'll know a place to refer someone if they are :)

Reviews.Author: Ashley V.
