Reviews.Content: BEST LOBSTER ROLL.Line: Opens at 11:30am but line was already pretty long when we got there at 11:15am on a Friday. Managed to get a seat though! If you don't get a table, they take your name/number, wait is usually ~1.5 hours, then they call you when they're ready. Pretty nice.Food: 1) Clam chowder: different from your usual thick hearty chowder. This one packs a lot of flavor but is pretty watery in consistency. Some people might not like that with their chowder but I actually really enjoyed it.2) Hot/Cold lobster roll: ordered both and split it with my brother. Hot wins it for me, my brother loved the cold one. Portions in both are VERY generous, chunks of lobster meat was huge and not stringy. Cold: Peppery, cold, mayo, and tender. Hot: Coated in hot butter and very delicious but less tender. Can't go wrong with either.Didn't eat the oysters (not a fan of raw oysters in general) but the rest of my party raved about it. Will definitely be back here.

Reviews.Author: Christina H.
Reviews.Content: Neptune... so delicious! We came on a recent weekend trip to Boston with the intent of just having some pre dinner oysters and a glass of wine. Once we were seated (after a 20 minute wait at 4 pm... this place is popular!) we could not resist ordering more. we ended up with basically a self selected cold seafood platter (oysters, shrimp, crab, etc) and then topped it off with a warm buttery lobster roll. everything was delicious. you wont get out of here without dropping some serious cash but it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Matty L.
Reviews.Content: Visting from out of town and on saturday morning, we waited in line and low and behold- we were put on a wait list. Waited and hour, almost went to another place but luckily we were able to make it in. Their selection of oysters and clams were so precise. Fresh and light. Their lobster roll sandwhich is beyond worlds. Mild yet incredibly fresh and incredibly rich. Definitely worth the wait and experience. Never had seafood this fresh up in NYC. The staff overall was amazing and precise. If and when I do find myself up in Boston, I am definitely hitting this place up.Worth the wait, and definitely worth the fresh seafood.

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Hello Neptunes. Remember me? Sorry this is short and quick. I love oysters and these couldnt be fresher. Good selection. Clam chowder was good. Lobster roll was perfect. I got it hot with the drawn butter oh man I could die and go to heaven. A lot of the places in this area are small including Neptunes. It seats about 25 ish at full capacity if im not mistaken. Maybe 30. But the oysters and food here are good. Thanks Neptunes. I was there in May 12'

Reviews.Author: Andrea P.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster rolls ever!!!!

Reviews.Author: Young J.
Reviews.Content: well...well.. what more can I say.they have by FAR the best oysters and lobster rolls. those buttery heaven..just thinking of it gives me saliva overfilled mouth.sooooo worth the waiting.BUT their drink menu is not so great.

Reviews.Author: Christine D.
Reviews.Content: I've heard that there is usually a wait at Neptune Oyster. Luckily, when I visited, we only endured a mere ten minute wait on a Sunday afternoon. The staff was very friendly when we asked questions regarding items on the menu and thoroughly explained how the oyster menu worked and the difference amongst the variety of oysters offered. We ended up ordering Maine Lobster Roll - hot with butter on a toasted roll (highly recommend), Buttermilk Johnnycake, and a dozen oysters. The lobster roll was huge and delicious, hands down one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had and they don't skimp out on the lobster. The Johnnycake was good, but once was enough for me. I would recommend it to try, but probably would not order again. Overall, Neptune Oyster is on the pricier end since our total came up to ~$87, but the experience, the quality of the food, and most importantly, the company of my partner made up for it.

Reviews.Author: Danielle B.
Reviews.Content: No reservations. But if you're lucky you can sit at the bar and enjoy an amazing meal without people breathing on you as they wait for a table! Lobster roll is amazing! And the raw bar, sure can't go wrong!

Reviews.Author: Kevin J.
Reviews.Content: NEPTUNE OYSTER F.T.W!!Being in Boston only a short while, I took some friend's advice and came here for an AMAZING dinner!! The place is pretty small, and they don't take reservations, so it's good to come early before the dinner rush. The service was really friendly, and the place was lively with all the people.I came here with a friend, and we ordered loads of their shucked oysters, and their famous lobster rolls. The oysters were well shucked, and their descriptions of each type were spot-on! Such a wide-variety of oysters from a variety of places. Simply amazing!I ordered the cold lobster roll, and it was excellent! Such a reasonable price for the HUGE amount of lobster in the roll. Such succulent pieces, such large pieces, and I enjoyed every bite!!If I was ever stuck on an island, and I had to pick on item of food to eat...DEFINITELY Neptune Oyster's lobster rolls! Neptune Oyster is definitely a place to eat if you're ever in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Ken H.
Reviews.Content: If you like Oyster and Lobsters and have not yet visited  Neptune Oyster in Boston, you are SO missing out.No doubt there is a long line that takes hours of wait because the food is SO good.Their Lobster Roll rocks.  Make sure to get it HOT. It rocked my world upside down when the butter melted perfectly into the fresh Maine Lobsters Meat with the perfectly grilled fresh bun.  As a consequence, I gained more than a few pounds from Boston, but so what? Its so good you should not miss it unless you have serious health problems.Oyster wise, they are good too.  Many varieties to choose from but be sure to come early as good oysters sell out like CRAZY.Staffs are very nice too!  Our waitress even recommended her favorite oyster joints too besides Neptune.  You don't hear that very often.  Very honest people that works there.  Make sure to pick some Wellfleet Oysters while you are here. They also serve Island Creek Oysters but its better to eat at that particular restaurant.  They are both VERY good in my opinions.

Reviews.Author: Kimmy T.
Reviews.Content: I've been here too many times to count, and I'm on a break from eating their world-class lobster rolls, but still count myself a huge fan. Neptune is obviously popular and widely loved. But the reason this place is great is b/c it never rests on its laurels. The service is always down-to-earth, the oysters are always fresh, and the menu always changing to offer creative new takes on dishes. Good wine & beer choices. Just good luck getting a table!

Reviews.Author: Kelly b.
Reviews.Content: Went out to eat for my birthday and all I can say is OMG! Best lobster roll I've ever had in my life!! The food was amazing!! The restaurant is tiny so plan on waiting but they do a great thing there- When you put your name down they take your cell phone number and call you when your table is ready, allowing you to explore the area instead of standing there waiting on a table. I can't wait to go back and get another delicious lobster roll!

Reviews.Author: Tom C.
Reviews.Content: Popular spot. Be prepared for a short wait for a table even in the middle of the day (2:30) in the middle of the week (Thursday). After about a 3 mile hike through the streets of Boston, I was tired, hungry and in no mood for the line of people waiting outside the restaurant. I overheard "45 minutes" and started considering the place 2 doors down advertising 'wicked lobsta' while HB went to put our names on the list. 10 minutes later they were calling our names. The hostess was a pro, calmly dealing with a line cutter as she directed us to the counter. It's a small little hole in the wall with a lot of character. Nothing fancy just a tin-roofed, old school, neighborhood joint. Don't let that fool you, there's a sophisticated seafood menu waiting for you to explore along with a raw bar stocked with all types of fresh clams and oysters. There's a solid selection of wines but I went with an IPA (or two) on tap.Honey Bunny had read that they had the best lobster roll in Boston and it would be hard to argue against that statement. They have it both ways, hot in butter or cold with mayo ($25 either way). I went with hot and that seemed to meet the approval of our host behind the bar. Honey Bunny ordered the Cioppino, a fish and shellfish spicy stew served over saffron rice, and splurged on adding Maine lobster to the mix. Pricey option (adds about $12) but again, worth it. Just the right amount of spicy according to HB. She prefers her giant shrimp sans heads and little feety things but gamely ripped the little buggers apart and went to town. A couple of pieces of fresh bread to sop all the stewy goodness and viola!, empty plate...er..bowl.My lobster roll did not disappoint. A large portion of sweet lobster meat covered in just enough butter to impart flavor but not overwhelm, piled into a large brioche roll. Served with fries that were good but not great. No matter, I wasn't there for fries. I was there for the best lobster roll in Boston and I think I may have found it.Can't wait to go back to try the raw bar!

Reviews.Author: Tim G.
Reviews.Content: NEPTUNE OYSTER IS BOSTON'S FINEST!!!As a California native and not knowing where to try the best local food, we took the advice of friends and Yelp to hit up Neptune Oyster.We came on a Friday night and were told that the it would take 2 1/2 hours to seated. They called us back in 2 hours so the LONG WAIT WAS WORTH IT.I ordered the Maine Lobster Roll since everyone hyped it up, and it EXCEEDED GREAT EXPECTATIONS. How so you may ask??? Well, the LOBSTER was HOT and served in BIG CHUNKS, COOKED TO PERFECTION in BUTTERY GOODNESS on a brioche bread. It also came with fries that were well-seasoned but I didn't really care much for them because IT'S ALL ABOUT THE LOBSTAH!!! So definitely worth $25. If you prefer a cold Roll, they also serve that also.Also tried a couple RAW OYSTERS and they were AMAZING. Since their oyster selection is huge, I recommend going LOCAL.So yes, WOOHOO! AS GOOD AS IT GETS for Neptune Oyster

Reviews.Author: Lisa Y.
Reviews.Content: One word:  Bug. Disgusting.

Reviews.Author: Gabriele d.
Reviews.Content: Best lobstah roll in Boston. I will never be able to eat it anywhere else (hear that, B&G? Time to get busy in the kitchen!).

Reviews.Author: Nick S.
Reviews.Content: Neptune is epic, no doubt. But depending on your dining partners, it may not be the end-all for seafood in Boston.I took my parents here this past weekend, and while I was well aware of the long wait times, negotiating when to go put down your name vs. when you'd eat turned out to be a bit more hassle than it was worth.If you go early, say before 5pm, you may get seated quite quickly. However show up too late, anytime after 7pm, and you likely won't get a table at all. It's a gamble.The food is delicious, especially the fried Ipswich clams. But the hot lobster roll was a bit of a disappointment. It's chock full o' lobster, that's for sure, but it's too much meat and not enough flavor. I was sick of eating it by the end.All in all, it's a great place and a Boston institution, but the small interior, long waits and chilly wind gusts (if you're near the door) may not make it the ideal choice for everyone.

Reviews.Author: Natalie G.
Reviews.Content: Great service and great food... There isn't anything more to say! Other then get there early! After waiting in line 30 minutes for the restaurant to open on Saturday am, there was an immediate hour wait after the first of us were sat.

Reviews.Author: Earl L.
Reviews.Content: I never knew that a lobster roll could be this good.  It's worth the price of airfare from PHL to BOS.

Reviews.Author: Nicole S.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll was fantastic without a question. BUT the seating situation is kind of strange. I came kind of early 5-6pm and I found a space at the bar, so I sat down. The waitress made me aware to talk to the hostess to make sure that there are no reservation for this one seat at the bar. I found that odd especially you cannot even tell where and who the hostess was. Anyways, as I said the lobster roll was great and I would come back for it but for sure in the early afternoon since the place gets super crowed with long waits.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence C.
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! What more can I say? When in Boston I try to make it to Neptunes. Was there a couple of months ago with m y wife and friends as we were in from Chicago for a meeting. The place is laid back and they have a large selection of shellfish as well as other seafood and meat items. Haven't had any of the main courses yet as I usually go in there after a meal over on Hanover Street.I highly recommend Netunes!!!

Reviews.Author: Jimmy M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. The hot lobster roll sandwich with butter is SO GREAT. The fries are good as well. The staff is really friendly and attentive. The beer selection is good as well. And they have some great oysters. If you go to Boston you must eat here.

Reviews.Author: Laura A.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate his birthday as well as my graduation.  It was a risk to go somewhere we had never been but this was a risk well worth taking.Although the wait was a bit tough (~2 hours on a hot summer Friday), we grabbed an appetizer and a beer across the street which made it bearable. Honestly, I would have waited two more hours for what was to come.  We sat at the bar and had a wonderfully knowledgeable server who helped us pick out oysters as we are hardly experts.  She also gave us some tips on wine which proved helpful as well.Highlights were the clam chowder as well as the seared scallop entree. I swear I still dream about the scallops. With duck confit, pear butter, blue cheese, and brussel sprouts, I truly cannot imagine a more perfect dish (and so I continue to imagine this one. Pretty regularly).  My boyfriend got the famous lobster roll and enjoyed it. I'm sure it was really great. It's just that I was in the middle of something with the scallops and had trouble tearing my attention away.We are huge seafood lovers and would highly recommend this to anyone who feels the same.  Although the wait may be rough, I agree with other reviews that you can use that time to bop around the North End - the food and service are worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jerry G.
Reviews.Content: In the middle of the North End/Little Italy our the best oysters and lobster roll in Boston. A big statement to make, I know, but I can't help craving Neptune's food every time I'm in the area. Waiting the expected 1-1.5 hour line (even on weeknights) will be worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Bryce C.
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great raw bar, better appetizers, best lobster roll on the planet (get it hot).  Will run between $50-$70 / person for a three course meal and 2 drinks.  Having eaten at many of the top restaurants al along the East Coast, I always come back here...  every time I'm even close to the city.  Kids wont like it as its crowded and loud.  Bring 1-3 colleagues to impress...  seating for more than 4 is nearly impossible after 4:30 PM.Enjoy it all!

Reviews.Author: stephanie f.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we fell into the small percent of Yelpers that didn't truly love Neptune's. If we hadn't already fell in love with B & G oysters, we may have given this place a 5 star review. Yes the wait was 2 hours, yes it was super crowded, yes we were one of the last couples sat, and yes we were prepared for all of that. In fact we parked ourselves at the bar a few doors down and held ourselves over with beer and bread for 2 hours. The staff are all really great even with all the nonstop craziness. They aren't shy at choosing your dozen of oysters if your unsure what to choose, which was helpful for my husband. Since he's the oyster guy he made the comparison quite quick when deciding who's oysters he liked better and overall he liked the oysters and B & G's oyster restaurant better. The lobster in the lobster rolls was also fresher and tastier at B & G's. Here it was too chewy, which was a bummer. The fries were really good tho.I had the chippino, it was full of mussels, salmon and added lobster. The broth was hot and spicy and the bread was perfect to soak up the juices. In conclusion, If your looking for a more relaxed place in a quite, local neighborhood we say go to B & G's in the South End.

Reviews.Author: Yiwen Z.
Reviews.Content: I am not too good at the raw oysters,but the matomawo or something （small) is really good! Sooo much lobster but a little overlooked ( tender for me)

Reviews.Author: Kevin J.
Reviews.Content: This place is tiny, but well worth the hour wait. Tried the Kumamoto oysters and they were awesome! Couple before us leaving said we had to order the Lobster Roll HOT, we did, and it was EPIC!! We're from the west coast and I don't think the lobster rolls I've had in Cali come close to this. Do yourself a favor and go here!

Reviews.Author: Angela Z.
Reviews.Content: This is honestly my worst dining experience ever!My friend recommended this place, so when we were told to wait for an hour, we were not surprised. However, the server told us after taking down our names "You can't wait here. I will give you a call when we get a table for you", so we had to walk out in Boston's cold winter and find a coffee shop to sit down and wait. Then when we were finally called back and ordered the food, the server didn't even ask if anyone has any food allergy and I had to stop her from rushing away and ask if  the dishes can be served without dairy. "What without dairy? All are served with butter, so there is dairy in everything." And when we were still eating, she came again and again and asked if she could take the dishes away....The food was fairly OK, but the service was very disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Sissi W.
Reviews.Content: delicious. Oyster so fresh! Big lobster roll. In this snowing day, still crowed has to wait for the seat!

Reviews.Author: S H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent oysters obviously.

Reviews.Author: taran K.
Reviews.Content: I dined here a few nights ago on my first trip to boston and I must say this place def lives up to the amazing reviews. I heard so much about the lobster roll that I decided  i had to try and it was was spectacular. I also had some sicilian wine and clam chowder. The service was great.The place in itself is very, very tiny so if you're claustrophobic then this isn't the place for you. it is always insanely busy so don't be surprised if you have a 2 hour wait. I assure you this place is worth the wait if you want amazing seafood.

Reviews.Author: May N.
Reviews.Content: One of the best restaurants in Boston so, of course, had to make a stop on a recent trip.  A couple of friends and I came on a Wednesday evening.  Our local friend tried to make a reservation early in the evening, but they weren't busy at that time and didn't take the reservation.  When we came around 7:30, the wait was about 30 min.  It's a small restaurant and we got seats at the bar so we definitely used the coat hooks by the door.  I think they're best known for their raw bar so we got some oysters ordered sushi style checking off a small menu with a golf pencil.  The friend who'd spent the least amount of time in Boston got the lobster roll warm with butter.  She learned the "roll" is a sandwich - we hadn't told her because we thought she knew!  It was tasty and came with a lot of lobster meat, along with fries.  We also got a chowda and I enjoyed my scallops entree served with mini brussel sprouts, greens, and cream sauce.  The scallops were raw with a briny taste, little salt, and it was all sooo goood.  Bartender/waitress was lovely and split up our tab 3 ways without any fuss.  Accepts credit cards!  Always a good thing.  When we left around 9, there were at least 10 people waiting for seating.

Reviews.Author: Vy D.
Reviews.Content: Oh my god..I wish I could give 6 stars.Okay. Let's get to the point if you're yelping and reading this right now. Get the lobster roll. I bet my house, car, and every possessions I own, that this will be the MOST DELICIOUS LOBSTER ROLL you'll ever going to have. The bread really made the roll in my opinion. I got the hot roll. The combination of the hot lobster and butter with the really good bread was to die for....Along with Sam LaGrassa's, this was theeee place we wanted to try as soon we got to Boston. ***Please be aware of the long wait here***I arrived at around 6. The hostess took our name and # down. She said she'll call us in 1 & 1/2 hr.... We actually received a call a hour later. It rang once and the hostess hung up. LOL. So yeah, be ready to wait for a long time.Oh yeah, the fresh oysters on ice were absolutely amazing. Up to par with any I've ever had. SO FRESH. It's well worth the wait. I promise you.

Reviews.Author: Chris N.
Reviews.Content: I don't like Boston, but I love this place. Truth told: the oyster selection, warm lobster roll, cava and wine pairings couldn't have been any better.

Reviews.Author: Felix H.
Reviews.Content: At 5:20 on a Monday we were told the wait would be 1.5 hours.  It turned out to be closer to two- Well I can tell you it was worth every minute!  Small space and cramped seating but great service and the food was really incredible.

Reviews.Author: Caesar R.
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend trying to get in for lunch as the wait for dinner is usually prohibitively long. HOT BUTTERED LOBSTER ROLL...nothing like it anywhere else!  So good.  And the fries.  I got the mussels and drooled over my wife's lobster roll.  Also, the fresh oysters.  A great East and West Coast variety for all your bivalve needs. RUN, don't walk to get here...and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Cathy S.
Reviews.Content: It is my goal to shove as much lobster in my piehole as I can during my relatively short visit to Boston. This is the first of what I anticipate will be many lobster rolls I plan to consume.We came to the cute, but very small Neptune with the expectation of a long wait for a table, I just didn't think we would have a long wait just to get on the long waiting list! The lack of a 5th star for this rating comes from the fact that I think a place that does not take reservations and which does as much business as they do should not make customers wait more than 10 minutes just to leave their name and number with a guy that could use a major attitude adjustment.  About 90 minutes after our initial wait we were finally seated at the bar.Once seated our experience was stellar. Our server was delightful. When my husband couldn't decide between a couple of beers on tap she gave him a sample of each. She was attentive without hovering and certainly anticipated our needs. After much deliberation we opted for the Connecticut style lobster roll, or as I now refer to it,  manna from heaven. 1/3- 1/2 LB of warm buttery chunks of sweet lobster goodness on an exquisitely toasted brioche roll, I can't think of anything to eat much better than that. One also can't overlook the outstanding fries accompanying the lobster roll. Cut fresh daily, fried crisp in oil changed daily and seasoned to perfection, I don't even really like fries yet I ate a lot of them.You can bet money that I will be returning for another hot lobster roll here (as soon as the newly installed plaque in my arteries from this meal starts to disappear).

Reviews.Author: Mel T.
Reviews.Content: If I'm waiting three hours for a damn lobster roll, it better taste like I died and went to heaven.We went on a Saturday night and the place is super tiny so obviously, we were planning to wait. So we went in, put our names down and were told the wait was 2.5 to 3 hours. So we thought, why not? We won't be coming back to Boston anytime soon. Might as well see what the hype is all about, and explore Quincy Market to kill time. Service - we finally got our seats exactly 3 hours later (so at least they didn't lie about that) and were seated at the bar. At that point, we were all so tired and cranky, we knew what we all wanted (hot lobster roll with butter) so we just ordered immediately. The waiter seemed pissed that we didn't order any drinks because he was really inattentive the whole time. He was loitering around the bar, not doing shit, clearly saw we needed water and just ignored it. When he finally poured it for us, it was only half a glass. SERIOUSLY???! I'm sure the place already makes enough off of their so-called delicious food.Food - Don't let the good looks fool you. I'm all for butter but there was WAYYYY too much. It was to the point that the roll was soaked in it and was falling apart. Some pieces of lobster seemed kind of chewy. The fries that came with the sandwich were either all burnt on the ends or they were soggy.My advice - Don't believe the hype. Save your time and money and you'll thank me later. Though I haven't tried any other lobster roll places in Boston, I'm sure there are plenty of better ones where you won't have to wait a bajillion hours. It definitely was not "wicked awesome".

Reviews.Author: Ben H.
Reviews.Content: Chowder was watery and oysters were overpriced. Sad because the reviews were so good.

Reviews.Author: Gerald F.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely dynamite. FRESH. Be prepared to wait. Small space, i.e. do not attempt to eat here if you weigh more than 240--I'M SERIOUS-you won't fit. For a man, if your waist is over 42, jacket over 48 don't try it. Ladies, wanna be embarrassed? Then go here if you're a size 14+, Holy S___. You'll never live it down.

Reviews.Author: Mary C.
Reviews.Content: For the last dinner of my Boston trip, decided to try this much recommended restaurant.It's small and ridiculously touristy, so be prepared to come early to line up. As in if you want to eat at 8pm, come at 5pm...because that's what we did for our table of 6.Memorable Orders:Clam Chowder ($11) -The chowder is runny, like a slightly reduced cream. But the flavour profile is definitely impressive. Settled on the bottom of the soup are lots of cooked clams, potatoes, and other treasures. It's a good bowl of soup, but not the best chowder in the traditional sense.Maine Lobster Roll ($25) -This was definitely the best part of the meal. The lobster is served chunky instead of ground up, giving that good succulent seafood texture. Drizzled with warm butter and a soft roll, it is to die for!Cod ($35) - If you happen to come here on a Saturday, the cod is the special of the day which isn't on the regular menu. My advice? ORDER IT. I don't normally like cod but this was was a pleasant surprise. The fish was flakey and light at the touch of a fork, while still being firm when you bite through it. A nice light entree.Not-so-memorable Orders:Dayboat Scallop Crudo ($12) -For $12, this Dayboat Scallop Crudo was definitely underwhelming. Barely sharable, and it wasn't anything to write home about. Neptunes on Piggyback ($13) -crispy oysters, Berkshire pig, golden raisin confiture, pistachio aioli. It's a little bit of a confusing dish. You don't really know what you are tasting, but all the flavours and textures do work. Decent, but not my top pick from the menu.

Reviews.Author: Chad T.
Reviews.Content: This review is purely for the lobster roll, which we got via takeout.  Restaurants that don't take reservations and have an hour-long wait in the middle of the day annoy me so I doubt I would ever come back for a full meal.  But if you want a dominant lobster roll, just give them a call and pick one up.

Reviews.Author: Matt C.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely worth the wait.Was in Boston for a wedding, wanted to hit the quintessential Boston oyster house. Neptune delivered in spades. The oysters tasted like they jumped from the water to the plate and, the scallop dish I had was mind-blowingly good. The lobster roll was insanely delicious. The shrimp were the biggest I've ever seen but with none of the fishy, iodine-y taste that big-ass shrimp sometime have.Delicious seafood, friendly servers/bartenders, cozy "locals spot" vibe.Wish we had this place in the Chi, just awesome.

Reviews.Author: Nikhil P.
Reviews.Content: One of the rare 4-stars...   Pros: Atmosphere, super wait staff, effort to get us seated as quick as possible, knowledgeable serversCons: We're not huge people, but the spots at the bar were a little tight.  Minus the fantastic hair, sharing a bowl full of clams while seated tight between other diners made me feel like Edward Scissorhands.  Overall, the food and the wait staff was great.  Super chill, not at all pretentious, and really friendly.  The food was excellent, but maybe not as out-of-this-world as I'd have expected.  I suppose that's the challenge with such a highly rated place ... larger than life expectations.  The price is right for a nice dinner out though, and while not "incredible," it was overall very good.  What we had?  Monkfish, Cioppino, Littleneck Clams.  All = 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Danny N.
Reviews.Content: The place is small, tight, but definitely a hot spot as the reviews can attest to. I got here at 5pm, told there would be a 1-1/2 hr wait. The nice thing, they give you a call when the table is ready. If you're interested in staying in the Freedom Trail, Paul Revere, or the Old North Church, there are some nice places to check out as you wait. So I can't subtract a star, especially how accommodating they are.The oysters are a huge draw, I had two of the many choices after getting the server's recommendations and was pleased. It's 2.50/each but definitely worth trying, especially when other parties, ordered plates of 10. A regular of the restaurant shared his recommendation that night to try the "Johnny Cakes" appetizer (honey butter, smoked trout tartare, Little Pearl Caviar). Thank you stranger, you made my night. The Johnny Cakes will forever be one if not the best thing I had in Boston. The sweet pancake with salty tartare and caviar were paired beautifully. The rest of the meal was solid. I had the lobster roll with fresh cut fries. It compares well to other lobster rolls I've had, including in Red Hook (Brooklyn, NY).The meal is $$$, about $60. The service was great considering how busy it is.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: Too much hype.  Had the seafood platter and the seafood was fresh but I didn't think it was worth the price.  I loved the lobster roll and would go back for that but the wait was way too long and couldn't wait that long again.

Reviews.Author: Jessica H.
Reviews.Content: I got sucked in here by Yelp when my planned restaurant was booked up for the night. There was one seat left at the bar, so I took it. The whole restaurant has maybe 20 seats at the bar and another 25 at tables in a row.The atmosphere is so cute, and my waitress, Arielle, was extra-nice (taking pity on me out by myself on a Saturday night?). The menu was mouth-watering, and I could watch the oysters getting shucked by the front window and enjoy my generous pour of white wine.At first I didn't know what to make of my caesar salad, which was the inside part of an entire head of lettuce, with cheese, white anchovies, and dressing on top. "They didn't even both to cut up the lettuce?" It's not like it was stylishly grilled or anything, just one big head. Then I got used to it. The dressing was nice and the anchovies were great.I also had the steamed littleneck appetizer. It kind of tasted like mud. I asked for some bread to sop up the juice, thinking maybe that would taste better (I know, can't explain that one), but it didn't. My only guess is way too much saffron, but would that taste like mud? 4  stars anyway because the whole place is so cute. Just don't order the littlenecks.p.s. No idea why this says "Arabian" next to "Seafood" for the cuisine. This is not Arabian.

Reviews.Author: Javier L.
Reviews.Content: WOW - POOR SERVICE IS KING HERENeptune appetizer - $99  - "No oyster substitutes" whatsoever!! is what we were advised right off the bat.Next ordered a 2010 Wine and got a 2012. Waitress says "Its the same!"When disputed, she takes up the bottle and glasses from all and will "Take it off the bill"Next: ordered a 2009 Paleo Toscana  @ $125 - but THAT WASN'T ENOUGH - THEY charged an extra $10 - UNDOUBTEDLY TO MAKE UP FOR THE PREVIOUS BOTTLE they opened for us!!!What a facade for good food. BEWARE!!!Javier Lopez

Reviews.Author: Damien S.
Reviews.Content: So, they serve a lobster roll. I hear it's good.It is good. Incredible, actually - I've killed more than a few, and I should tell you about them because after reading through a number of reviews, not many mention the dish. Instead, this man's humble opinion will focus on the unknown or underloved items offered by the North End icon.Announcing, Neptune's Goonies:- The Mikey: If Brandon is the lobster roll, then Neptune's soft-spoken clam chowder earns his asthmatic little brother's moniker. Bold in its own right, thinner than peers yet meatier where it counts.- The Fratellis: Tuna and cold veal is a winning combination Italians have known for generations, and Neptune's vitello tonnato sandwich ($19) will undoubtedly grab you by the gabagools or whatever the Sopranos call "your balls." Easily my most ordered dish, roasted sliced veal topped with sushi-grade tuna tartare, cool marinated cucumber and a wasabi spread. Boasting the same amazing dark russet fries that side the lob roll, you've gotta give this guy a try.- The Data: Kumamoto oysters served regularly. Little, shiny, slightly fruity pearls of love. A mist of mignonette and I get slick shoes. Buy as many as you can with your FIFTY DOLLAR BILL.- The Mouth, aka Corey Feldman: Raw, fresh, remarkably delicate and surprising us daily, look to the Crudo Special.- The Chunk: A perfectly seasoned cheddar cheeseburger under fried oysters, aioli and a pickle relish. Holy shit, the richness that is the Neptuneburger ($15) doesn't belong in a raw bar. It belongs in every bar. No wonder its best friend is Sloth.No reservations means it drops from six stars to five. Eat here immediately.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra S.
Reviews.Content: I just might be the last person in Boston to get to this place but the problem for me has been the typically long line to get in.  Patience is not one of the virtues I am naturally blessed with. I have to work it...but a long line is not one of the places where I usually practice.  Given how tiny this place is, the waits can be annoyingly long. But on this past Friday afternoon around 3:30, I was actually able to saunter right in with a dear friend and we bellied right up to the marble topped bar where two seats seemed to invite us to sit right down.  Hallelujah, such good fortune, perhaps divine intervention: hallelujah; we were actually in!   I do believe my jaw was hanging agape.I love the look of this little shoebox of a place from the black and white tile floor which must be original...and if it isn't someone did a seriously great repro job and I want their name, to the tin ceiling to every old world charm detail. We ordered two of probably every oyster they had on the menu and had fun comparing our impressions to the ones written on oyster description card...nutty, creamy, pea-like, etc. I have yet to meet an oyster I don't love and enjoy experiencing the nuanced differences amongst the different kinds.We were savoring these oysters with a lush bottle of prosecco when a feeling of well-being came over me and it occured to me that I was happy and in a gustatory heaven. Such is the power of oysters and prosecco. In fact these two items are on my "Last Meal" Yelp profile list.I hoped I wasn't jinxing myself because I had an otherwise busy weekend planned and was not quite ready to kick the bucket despite how delicious the food and drink were.We followed the oysters with one of the now famed and much Yelped about hot buttered toasted lobster rolls which we split.  Don't get me wrong, I could have very easily eaten the entire fabulous dripping with deliciousness whole thing. I bet I could have eaten two of them.  It is in fact as superb as everyone raves.  But it is incredibly rich and so it was probably best for our arteries that we split one.  It comes with a side of fries but they were really beside the point.The minus one star is for the less than friendly, indifferent service we received.  Would it have killed one of the gaggle of gals behind the bar to smile, or to utter something remotely inviting or even to just fake a look if they had to, of being even vaguely interested in us? Sadly, this is what sometimes happens to places that go "viral" in popularity.  They don't feel like they need to do much because regardless, people will still flock to stand in line outside the door forever and a day just try those dang lobster rolls and oysters.  But this kind of service mars the overall experience. The 3 young woman behind the bar on this past Friday afternoon bummed me out. The food, prosecco and the decor luckily did not.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: Instructions for having an awesome time at Neptune Oyster:1. Arrive.2. Put your name and number down on the inevitable waiting list.3. Grab a latte and a nature bar (read: gut bomb) from the coffee shop down the street.4. Wait for a call.5. Return to Neptune Oyster in five minutes.6. Get seated (ideally at the front bar, where you can watch endless oyster-shucking and ogling passersby).7. Order beverages (zOMG, Belgian-style beer crafted by Ferran Adrià!)8. Order one hot buttered lobster roll for yourself, and get your sig-o to order a cold lobster salad-style roll to split.9. Gorge and imbibe.10. Depart, stuffed to the gills and happily medicated.NB: We made the mistake of -also- ordering a bowl of chowder to share as a starter.  Unless you have the appetite of a sumo wrestler, I wouldn't advise it.  Uncomfortably distended tummy, regardless of the fact that it was delicious, is just not a happy situation.

Reviews.Author: Kiwi H.
Reviews.Content: Lobster Roll:- Big, fat, tender, juicy pieces of knuckle and claw lobster meat.- Dressing including any or all of: Mayonnaise, lemon juice, BUTTER.- More butter for dipping if desired.- Warm toasted bun.- Vegetables such as lettuce if desired, otherwise stuff with more lobster.Excellent lunch to break up a work day:- Neptune Oyster's cool, chic yet not pretentious decor- Comfortable seating- Sparkling plates and silverware on clean, welcoming tables- Friendly staff, tall glasses of cold water - Great company for good conversation- Yummy seasoned french fries. They seem like they'll taste strange since they look so dark and crunchy, but they're actually decent.- Delicious, buttery, fat-sized, oh-so-satisfying lobster roll crammed with oodles and oodles of tasty, fresh, wonderful, generous servings of lobster crammed into a warm and toasty roll. Mmm.Serves up joy and yum-factor satisfaction.Update 06/02/08:See Tom E's review: I'm sorry! I usually always offer tastes of my dish! Maybe it was really just that good!? (I remember a hazy, butter-drenched lobster moment so I think yes). And no, I was not offered a bite of the oyster burger hehe, but considering I'm allergic to oysters, you unwittingly did the better thing ;) hehehehe.

Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: "Uhhhhhhhhhhh, Neptune Oyster, you make me feel so good. I just want to rub you all over my body."  Yeah, I know, gross, right?  I like to think I didn't hear that from a 70 year old blue-haired lady as I was eating here, but I can't, because I did.  Okay, maybe she wasn't 70, more like mid-twenties.  Okay, and perhaps she wasn't a she but a he.  ALRIGHT, fine, it was me--geez man, back off with the inquisition already.So what kind of restaurant can make me moan with ecstasy you might ask?  Easy, one with oysters so fresh and lobster rolls so delicious you'll want to take a submarine to the bottom of the ocean and pimp-slap Poseidon for not giving you more.  This place is crazy delicious.  Easily the two best things are the burger (topped with fried oysters, garlic mayo, and relish) and the hot buttery lobster roll (leave that cold mayo-laden crap at Long John Silvers, this is a man's lobster roll).  If you've never had a lobster roll, don't start with this one because you wont be able to appreciate how truly amazing it is, its a work of art.The inside of this place is amazing, it has an old world vibe with marble counters tops, brick tile, mirrors everywhere you look, and is situated just off the beaten path of the almost always gimmicky North End.My one complaint is that this place is tiny and they don't accept reservations.  I mean its not like I don't understand, people are more than willing to give their number and then wait next door for a seat, but come on, its impossible to exploit this place for what it is, the perfect spot for an awesome date or surprise bit of romance.  You're killing me Neptune, you can't have food and ambiance this awesome and then wave it in my face, that is just being dickish. Neptune, in all seriousness here, if you wont do it for me, do it for all the girlfriends of the world who would love to be surprised when their guy doesn't turn into the 99 parking lot and instead stops here.

Reviews.Author: Annie P.
Reviews.Content: This was a major change. My usual bring the bratty "GIMMIE SEAFOOD I'M IN BOSTON! WHINE WHINE LOBSTER ROLL. C'MON LET ME GET SOME CHOW-DA IN A BREAD BOWL" out of town guests place has always been Union Oyster House or some dingy place like No Name Restaurant/Summer Shack.. or pasta seafood places like The Daily Catch. Those places aren't bad.. they just don't do it for me personally. In fact.. I don;t really hear running excitement of the mouth from the tourists either. They just turn silent and kind of let me take them to neighborhood hole in wall's after that.. which is good for me.. but sort of saddening.Neptune Oysters gon' dit it and killed it... in a living sense way.I've got to tell you.. Yelp did a good job placing this as one of the top Seafood in Boston places. I've also got to tell you how pissed off I was when we sat in this tiny place and looked at the prices. I felt uncomfortable for bringing two other people with me here.. but blah blah blah..as soon as we started eating and the glasses of wine followed..it was all monopoly money and Rich Millionaire was back in business. The mood in there made me feel like cash too. Jazz, that white tile against the dim yellow brown-ish sexy lighting in large leather booth night time clean 40's diner ---oh baby.Liked the easy to order check off oyster list with simple descriptions.  I recommend going hobo style and splitting half's of the oyster burger and HOT lobster roll's with another.. try both. SOOOOOOO GOOOOODDDD.So stuffed. So going back with every single one of the losers who come to visit.

Reviews.Author: Miriam W.
Reviews.Content: I thought I knew everything there was to know about Neptune Oyster - get the lobster roll warm with butter, substitute out the fries for salad - but a recent Sunday lunch there proved me so very, very wrong.Sunday's special is fish tacos: griddled tortillas overflowing with thick pieces of lightly battered fish, drizzled in a slightly spicy aioli with a piquant pickled slaw on the side. These fish tacos are the best I've had on the East Coast and, in fact, I think they could stand up to fish tacos in San Diego!A new reason for worship on Sunday: Neptune Oyster's fish tacos.

Reviews.Author: Jelena Z.
Reviews.Content: I feel sorry for the man I'll eventually marry, 'cause when I'm hugely pregnant, he's going to have to figure out how to get Neptune's warm lobster roll from Boston to Chicago, stat. Can someone bring back the Concorde, please?But I digress. With 399 reviews referencing the warm lobster roll, there's not really much I can add. Except that it's only the most perfect lobster roll in existence.I do like the standard mayo-based lobster roll, but when I'm in Boston, I head straight to Neptune for the warm one. Imagine a big, buttered and toasted roll overflowing with chucks of luscious, sweet lobster. All doused in drawn butter. It's a messy experience, so I usually make it a solo mission and grab a seat at the front bar. The only companion I need is an ice cold Peroni and I'm set!It's only been nine days and I miss you already. This distance just ain't right!

Reviews.Author: Lucy X.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll is To. Die. For. I don't think I've ever had anything so gastronomical, I don't know. And I don't know why I was so astonished by the quantity and quality of the huge juicy chunks of lobster they put into it. I really shouldn't have expected anything less. Also I don't know why you would get it with anything but the buttery toasted bun? Because the two go together like any two things that go together.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn C.
Reviews.Content: Oh. My. Gawd. I was pretty blown away by this place last night. It was as if some higher power created a restaurant just for me (except it would serve beer... guess not everything can be perfect). They have an oyster list that's just as extensive as their wine list, and I wanted to try one of each... unfortunately, I only have so much money, so I only ordered a few of them. Each oyster was even better than the last. I was trying to find a favorite, but it's like asking a parent to pick their favorite kid. It can be done, but you just don't want to have to make that choice.I had the neptune burger after my sampling of oysters, and it was amazing. A big, beefy burger topped with fried oysters? YES PLEASE. Not too bad for $13 either (It was the cheapest entree item on the menu. Order anything else and expect to pay at least double that... but know that it will be worth it, no matter what it is). I also tried a little bit of my friend's lobster roll, and whoa mama! I want to live here and eat oysters all day long. Is that okay, Neptune Oyster?***EDIT*** I just went again this weekend, and they DO serve beer!!! They just don't have them listed on the menu, but they're right there on the bar in full view (unless the place is packed with people, which it usually is because it's so tiny). This place really IS perfect!!!

Reviews.Author: Jen H.
Reviews.Content: -Lobster Roll Review-I was asked recently why I didn't give Neptune Oyster a 5-star review and it made me contemplate the core reason. Although the Lobster Roll was delicious, it was lacking. To be fair, I went there for the second time to truly enjoy the Lobster Roll on it's own with nothing on the side. The chunks of lobster were plentiful on the buttered bun with each of the pieces lightly buttered. What was lacking was the heat (temperature) of the lobster itself. If the lobster chunks were even slightly more heated, it would have been a home run! Besides the temperature, the lobster was also not de-veined with little 'poop' strings in my roll, ew ew ew.Delicious fries also comes along with this dish that seemed to be double fried for your tasting pleasure. Overall, do get the lobster roll and enjoy. Can it be better where it's a slam out of the park? Yes! Until then, I would still recommend this place and get your $25 Lobster Roll!

Reviews.Author: Lei B.
Reviews.Content: So from what I heard, you can't really experience Boston without a lobster roll. Supposedly this is the joint to get THE lobster roll. I've had several friends rave about it and I had to come here on my first night in Boston.I met up with a friend and we were seated not too long after I got there. Just a heads up, parking in the North End is a complete NIGHTMARE! Try not to drive around like a mad person like I did, just find the first parking garage and walk. Everything is close by.We started off with a couple oysters: Wellfleet, Island Creek, Wianno, Kumamoto, and another that I can't remember the name. All were extremely fresh and juicy. No grit or brine in the ones we ordered. I regret not ordering more.We each ordered a lobster roll for our meal, one hot (with butter) and one cold (with mayo) to share. It didn't take too long for our food to come out and when it did my eyes completely bugged out and my jaw fell to the floor! Huge mounds of lobster right before my eyes. They don't skimp out at all! We had a discussion on which was better: hot or cold and I'm still debating on which one I liked better. With the hot you get the nice lobster slathered in butter. With the cold you get not just standard mayo, they have some seasoning in there that I can't put my finger on. I think just by ease of eating, the cold one wins by a hair. The roll was a little soggy because of the butter so it was a little harder to eat. You can also order it without the roll but what's the fun in that?! The roll also came with french fries, they were good but a little on the salty side.The $25 price tag on just the lobster roll may scare people but it was soooo worth it! From now on every trip to Boston will require a mandatory trip here. Damn I want one right now!As seen on TV: America's Best on Food Network

Reviews.Author: Gigi F.
Reviews.Content: I went to Neptune Oyster this past weekend after seeing it recommended on the television show The Getaway.  I am from Boston, now live in LA and thought I would try something new with my family.  First, the oyster selection was fabulous...tried them all.  It was nice to find a place that serves such a selection and with an extensive wine selection also.  My only criticism is that the wait staff seemed (for my party anyway) to have an air about them...as if somehow they were better than me (and my family)...snotty I guess would be the right word.  Had that not been the case, I would have given 5 stars.  Staff....check yourself please.

Reviews.Author: Ligaya T.
Reviews.Content: This is where you taste divinity in the form of a warm lobster roll drowned in butter. My minestrone soup was so fresh that the herbs floated to the top, a layer of HERBS. A little tip: the fries are a bit brown and crispy so I always opt for some green salad on the side instead.As for the pretentious people with all their shiny platinum, cashmere and clunky keys that other yelpers talk about, IGNORE. Just try to notice anything when one of their plates is in front of you. Impossible, too riveting.During courses you might notice the nice tiled walls, prosecco concoctions written on their tilted down mirrors, retro red booths, cute but clueless student serves and how with their maybe ten tables you were lucky to have wandered in during OFF HOURS and cheerfully found yourselves a seat.Oh, and be prepared to spend some mooooola.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen C.
Reviews.Content: I braved an HOUR, yes, an hour, of driving around the block to eat at Neptune Oyster...well, the hour I drove around took up approximately 1/2 of the 2 hour wait that we had to eat at Neptune Oyster.  I love eating dinner at 9pm on a Sunday before a 7am flight...yep, I do....sigh.Anyway, I'm glad I visited, though I think next time, I will try to go for lunch.  I really was craving a lobster roll.  It's not that they're not tasty in Chicago, it's just that it's a Boston tradition for me to annoy my family until they come with me for lobster rolls (note, it's way easier to convince my sister to do this than some of the family...).I, of course, ordered the lobster roll, which was all kinds of delicious.  It was meaty, flavorful, not claw meat, and it was mostly just lobster (and a mini bit of mayo).  The fries were ok, but I was there for the lobster, and I was happy.  It's a bit steep at $25, but hey, it's not every day I get one of these.My sister had the fish tacos (also delicious).Service was friendly, and he didn't get flustered when the 2 tables of tourists next to us insisted upon asking questions about every item on the menu and tried to share a lobster roll with 4 people....Bathrooms - 4 (small and hard to get to)Value - 3 - pricey!Food - 5Service - 4 (moderate attempt to upcharge me on the wine...)Atmosphere - 4 (a bit touristy...)Worth a stop, though be prepared to wait (and most likely, you'll be waiting at another bar).

Reviews.Author: Mcslimj B.
Reviews.Content: Outstanding raw bar boosted by great, French-tinged, richly-flavored treatments of cooked seafood, and terrific seafood-friendly wines.A challenger to the North End's Italophilic status quo, Neptune had the cojones to open up a raw bar with an amazing menu of cooked dishes that show worldly sophistication and a lot of refined, French-leaning technique. The raw oysters ($1.70-3.20 a pop) are bicoastal and superb, always expertly shucked with nary a grain of shell or sand. But you'd be missing out terribly if you didn't let the chef cook something for you, too.Every day of the week offers a new little revelation, some perfectly composed, beautifully plated dish with a streak of complex, deeply-flavored sauce. There's so much to love here, I hardly know where to begin: maybe the ham hock hash ($12), an appetizer of chewy, slightly gelatinous offal with beets, fingerling potatoes, a fried egg, and softly warmed goat cheese. Or a vitello tonnato ($16) turned into a sandwich, riffing on the classic Italian summer dish with roasted veal and tuna (here a tartare instead of the traditional poached), pepped up with a cucumber salad and spicy mustard. Terrific frites on the side are a big plus. To my utter amazement, the burger is actually fantastic, too.Specials of the day are generally amazing, like Monday's lobster spaghettini ($34), which features a lot of lobster meat in a rather spicy marinara with parsley and bread crumbs. I have a quibble with the lobster roll ($22): I find that the eggy, charred brioche overpowers the delicate, bulging pile of lobster meat in both styles: Connecticut, hot with melted butter, and Eastern New England, cold with a bit of mayo. But mostly I find this food transporting, if a big costly for everyday eating. I'm not surprised that nearly every time I dine here, some locally-famous chef is chowing down a few seats away. Unlike many North End places, Neptune actually deserves its nightly lines; all the more reason to go at lunch, when no one stands between you and its remarkable food.

Reviews.Author: Ambrose C.
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for a quintessential and tasty New England seafood dish? Are you willing to wait a really long time to sit inside so you can order it? Are you willing to splurge a lot of money for it? If you said yes to all three questions, this place may have your answer. This place has been high on my list of restaurants to eat at in Boston and I finally found the right timing and opportunity to eat here. I took a friend to this place and here is what happened.We arrived at the restaurant at around 7:45 PM on a Saturday night, hoping that there would be less people, since they do not take reservations. The server said to me that it is going to be a two hour wait. This place has broke the record for the longest time I had to wait to eat in a restaurant. My expectations for the food made a significant jump from really low, to extremely high as my friend and I thought of ways to kill time while waiting as I gave the waitress my cell phone number.At around 9:55 PM we came back and a feeling of relief came when the waitress yelled out "AMBROSE?!" indicating that my friend and I got a spot to sit, even though it was at the bar. We quickly ordered the Maine Lobster Roll (both cooked with butter). Since I knew that I was not going to come back here for a long while, I also decided to order a piece of clam and a piece of oyster on the list and marked it.  The clam and oyster I ordered were the Cherrystone Clam and Island Creek Oyster. They were served in a tray covered in ice and came with some sort of cocktail sauce. The Cherrystone Clam was decently good. The meat in this clam was tasty due to the sauce and also had a nice juicy taste to it. I am not much of an oyster connoisseur, but I did not detect much of the fruity finish according to the description of the Island Creek Oyster. Although I had meatier and tastier oysters compared to eating the Island Creek Oyster, it was not disappointing at all. It was decently good, very soft and refined in terms of tastiness. I felt like a high class wealthy person as I held up the oyster and began to eat it.Finally, the Maine Lobster Roll. It arrived within a very short time frame, and it came with a huge pile of French Fries. As for the size of the Lobster Roll I would say that it is approximately 16 cm in length, but definitely under 30 cm using rough estimates. I took a piece of lobster from the roll and put it into my mouth. I closed my eyes and began to chew. My taste buds and palate communicated with me..."YUM YUM YUM! Buttery, tender and meaty deliciousness! MMMMM... MMMMM.... MMMMMM!!!!"Yeah, my taste buds and palate experienced a feeling of jubilant rapture from the buttery flavor and the meaty tenderness of the lobster. It was probably the best cooked and most delicious lobster I have eaten. The bread was okay, tasted almost like a hot dog roll that you would get from a supermarket, but the tasty butter just made the bread five times tastier. As for the French Fries, they were pretty tasty with the right amount of softness and saltiness that made fries typically addicting to eat. They were not memorable fries, but definitely several steps above fries that you would get from Wendy's. Ketchup was also tasty as well. My friend really loved the Lobster Roll here, and thought he had some of the best seafood here. However, he said that he would not have the lobster in a roll because he did not like the bread that much. As for service, it was okay, somewhat effective. I could see that my server was trying to be nice but he also seemed to be under a lot of pressure because he was handling so many people and orders. It does not appear to be easy working in one of the busiest restaurants in Boston so I was extremely nice to the people who work there.The WC (means "Water Closet", another term for a lavatory) was small but decently clean. There is a quote on a giant mirror above the toilet by prominent American author Ernest Hemingway, so you can get a dosage of some Hemingway to read if that interests you while using the lavatory. Overall, this is one representation of Boston's food at its finest. If you are going to be in Boston for a short period of time, and you are looking for a very worthy restaurant to splurge, this is a strong candidate. Just be prepared to have a lot of time to kill if the wait is going to be really long. Despite the long wait, I believe that I have eaten some of the best lobster in Boston so far and I'll never look at lobster rolls the same way again.

Reviews.Author: Kat F.
Reviews.Content: I'm adding Neptune to my list of favourite dining experiences of all time. Everything about the meal was perfect, from the moment we arrived and took our seats at the bar to the moment we left. Bear in mind that this review comes from the most unlikely of Neptune patrons - a VEGETARIAN. An actual vegetarian that doesn't eat seafood (don't get me started on people who profess to be vegetarians "but also eat fish"...). I thought I would be at a disadvantage in an oyster oasis like this, but it turns out I was in for the meal of a lifetime under the fine care of owner Jeff, who is a total sweetheart and a hotter version of CSI's Gil Grissom. It's true.We arrived at around 10pm on a Saturday night and the place was filled with diners. We started off with a few glasses of Albarinho and worked our way down the menu. Jeff, who I didn't even realize was the owner until I overheard someone asking him how long the place had been open, was incredibly humble and charming. I could not believe that the owner of a restaurant like this was behind the bar taking orders and serving us like a regular joe. After I told him I was vegetarian he asked me what I liked on the menu and then offered to make me a combo plate of the things I had picked, making a few suggestions along the way. At no point did I feel like I was going to have a meal that was any less awesome because it didn't have seafood in it - I had full trust that the food was going to be amazing and I was completely right.My plate (bowl, actually) arrived and was heaving with goodness - each item was perched on top of the next in a lovely display of coloured foods. There was the crispy gnocchi, which were boiled and then pan-fried like pierogies to give them a crunchy exterior, the green garlic broth kale with fresh peas, butternut squash puree & braised bok choy, apple slaw and avocado & grapefruit salad. Every last bite was incredibly yummy and unique in flavour and texture. I also loved the decor at Neptune - it was in a really nice part of the city that felt very European and cozy, and dark with soft lighting and a sort of sexy, jazzy feel to it. This goes down as one of the best vegetarian meals I've ever had at a predominantly meat-centric restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Juliana C.
Reviews.Content: I thought I was leaving Boston Tuesday night. JetBlue cackled and cancelled my flight. Politely. So there I was, trudging back to the T with my duffel, another evening free to dabble in the dark arts of stuffing my face. Where to go on my (second) last night in the city?Duh. Everyone had told me I needed to try a lobster roll, and everyone had told me where to find the best one in Boston. So I grabbed a stool at the bar of Neptune and ordered one (cold, with mayo). In the meantime, at Damien S (my hostest with the mostest)'s behest, I tried a Kumamoto oyster, and it was a zesty summer tonic. So was the sauvignon the bartender suggested.When my roll arrived, it was bulging with lobster meat and flanked by a frisson of fries. Seriously, I couldn't decide which part of my plate to turn my attention to. I had been warned that lobster rolls could be bread-heavy, but this one was overflowing with tasty morsels. So I inelegantly dove in. So. freaking. good. (and for $25, it better be).After that it was hard to stay disappointed my flight had been moved back. Ohhh wellllll.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Either I have butter soaking through my pores or I am still showing post-lobster afterglow. An afterglow from the most hedonous lobster-consumption experience that even the most attentive and thorough of lovers couldn't match. And I'm a nymph. That's saying a lot.A few months ago, my homegirl Alexandra S. Yelped that she was probably the last person in Boston to go to Neptune. I assured her that she certainly wasn't...that it was me. This place has been bookmarked since my first week as a Bostonian--in August of 2010. Since bookmarking it, I built it up a bit in my head. I allow one lobster meal as a line item in my humble, monthly grad student budget. But I never went here until today.Early on, something told me that this place was special...and that it deserved a special occasion. I tried to get out here in October when my former colleagues were doing business in Cambridge. I almost got them here too! But the World Series was on...and we wanted to watch the Giants....and Legal Seafoods had TVs. To be fair, that was also a great meal. And my old company even paid for it.However, one of my bestest friends and most favoritest people from back in the East Bay Area landed on a red-eye this morning so that she could attend an open house at Boston University's School of Public Health. This gal is probably the only person I know who loves lobster as much as I do (to be fair, I've only met one person from Maine) and she was the PERFECT occasion to go. She loves Legal Seafoods though. I had to tell her, "Look, I know you love Legal. But I ain't taking you there. I'm a local now. I'm taking you where the locals go." Both of us were supremely happy with our hot, buttered lobster rolls. Holy eff, it is a massive mound of lobster. I used to think that I could eat shellfish competetively and neither of us could finish our meals. AMAZING. Amazing. And then, because it's in the North End, we had cannolis at Modern Pastry when we were finished. :)I'll go back after starving myself for three days so that I could actually finish a roll and also pile in some raw oysters. Way to go, Yelpers. You certainly bulls-eyed this one.

Reviews.Author: Von E.
Reviews.Content: Not that Neptune needs another 5 star review, but we were visiting family and decided to see what all the hype was about. It was for sure worth it, if you can get in.I wouldn't wait more than 30-45 mins for a table b/c its not mind blowing.We walked by right at 11:30am, when they opened, and there was a line. We decided to wait until the line was in the door to check it out. We got very lucky and snagged the last two-top. Food: Pulled Pork w/ fried oysters, amazing! Good size sandwich and well executed recommend this dish.8 oysters on ice.Service: polite and to the point during a very busy lunch hour. We had a table near the door and our server was very good at handling orders and dealing w/ the incoming customers taking names and explaining the up to 1 hour wait times....Atmosphere: tight space, clean, lots of tile, casual, mix of locals and touristsBottom line: very good and we'd recommend it you're ever in town.

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: HOT BUTTER LOBSTER ROLL!! I think I died and went to lobster roll heaven! It was soooooo delicious and all that I hoped it would be! (Thanks Leighann F. for the rec) But I'm getting ahead of myself. Let's rewind. It was a dark, stormy Sunday night in Boston. The last thing I wanted to do was to go outside but since I was leaving Boston the next day, I knew Sunday dinner was my last chance to eat at Neptune Oyster. In a struggle between my mind and my stomach, my stomach won as it nearly always does. Hence the reason why I find it so hard to diet... but that's another topic for another time. My friend and I braved the heavy downpour and schedule changes in the T, and journeyed to the "best seafood restaurant in Boston." The horrid weather turned out to be a blessing in disguise because the restaurant wasn't busy at dinnertime and there was almost no wait to be seated.Neptune Oyster could probably thrive by serving just their famous lobster rolls, but they also have an awesome, extensive raw bar. I love how the raw bar menu comes as a paper checklist with descriptions of the size, salt content, and finish of each type of oyster - descriptive enough to make anyone feel like an oyster pro. I was tempted to order one of each type of oyster but I restrained myself so that I would have tummy space for the coming lobster roll. We decided on an oyster each of the Wellfleet (MA), Summerside (PEI), and Kumamoto (WA) oysters. yelp.com/biz_photos/y2w6… They were all really fresh and a great appetizer before the Maine event...... the Maine Lobster Roll! I had it hot with butter instead of cold with mayo. yelp.com/biz_photos/y2w6…  The giant lobster roll was absolute perfection; the lobster meat was buttery, fresh, plump, juicy, drool-worthy... need I go on? The bread roll was toasty warm and somehow managed to hold in the mountain of lobster meat. It also comes with a side of tasty battered fries in case you still have room in your tummy after the lobster roll.Next time I visit Boston I want to give the cold mayo lobster roll at Neptune a try. But in the meantime, the hot butter lobster roll at Neptune is a serious contender for the "Last Meal on Earth" slot in my Yelp profile.

Reviews.Author: Ben G.
Reviews.Content: Over a year later, this is still hands down my favorite restaurant in Boston.  All I can say is: Lobster roll, lobster roll, lobster roll.  Fuck location.  Its all about the lobster roll.  They make the lobster rolls two different ways.  Sure there's the traditional way with the mayo, kinda cold, a refreshing summer treat that most new englanders are familiar with and then there's the hot lobster roll.Oh my god, I can honestly say that this lobster roll was hands down the greatest thing i've ever eaten in my life.  The lobster tastes as if its been poached in butter and vanilla bean and chopped up and dumped into a toasted bun.   We're talking sheer ecstasy people.  The kind you feel when your whole body warms up and you feel a tingling going up and down your spine.  It took all the restraint in my body to stop me from ordering 2 more right there on the spot.Now listen very closely, if you like lobster and can afford a 20 $ sandwich that can envoke the same feeling as one of those "special massages" in chinatown, then go to Neptune and enjoy.  Just try not to drool on the bar.

Reviews.Author: Nik B.
Reviews.Content: Hemingway was a foodie.So it was no surprise for me to see a Hemingway quote written on on the bathroom mirror of Neptune Oyster.He "ate the oysters with their strong taste of the sea" and "drank their cold liquid from each shell." I too did this today. I ordered the Island Creek Oysters. They were definitely the most fresh-tasting and perfectly textured oysters I have encountered. The "sea taste and the succulent texture," as Hemingway describes, is a very enjoyable experience. They were delightfully salty, and came with a delicious horse-radish sauce. I washed it all down with Harpoon IPA. I cannot imagine a Boston oyster experience as perfect as this.For my entree, I ordered the Lobster Roll, cold. The plate: a large, fresh, moist, toasted bun topped with a heaping pile of expertly mayo-ed and seasoned lobster pieces. On the side are some of the best fries one can imagine. The toasted bread topped with lobster is the perfect bite, and seems to be endless with the large satisfying amount you are given. If you are lucky enough to have eaten at Neptune Oyster as a young man, then wherever you go for the rest of your life, it stays with you, for Neptune Oyster is a Moveable Feast.

Reviews.Author: Jenny T.
Reviews.Content: So I went on a food road trip with my friend K and when we stopped through Boston, I AM SO GLAD WE ATE HERE.  K had a cousin who recommended this place and she did not lie.We had raw oysters (amazinggg selection) and shared a lobster roll.  They give you the option of cold with mayo or hot with butter.  OMG if you take anything away from this review, please please remember to get hot with butter.  *drools*That lobster roll was not just the best lobster roll I've had, not just one of the top foods I had in my 25 state road trip, but one of the best foods I've had EVER.I wish this place was (a lot) cheaper, but if I'm ever in Boston again, I will not hesitate for a second to get this again.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie B.
Reviews.Content: My trip to this Boston institution for lunch turned out to be icing on the cake of an aquatic-themed day. I walked over the few blocks from the New England Aquarium, put my name in, and waited about 7 minutes before the wicked cute host snagged me off the stoop and placed me at the bar. Let me just tell you that flying solo virtually assures you a seat at the North End hot spot. Seated between two French speaking tourists on my right and a group of three film makers on my left, I never felt out of place or awkward as sometimes happens, and made pleasant conversation with my cohorts, pleased with the comfortable painted tin ceiling and classic white tile walls. So French. Presented with a fresh oyster list, I stuck with good old Wellfleets, and followed them with the Spanish octopus salad. I can safely say that I have never in my well-traveled life tasted anything like that salad. Tender, flavorful, and unexpectedly warm octopus with roasted cauliflower and nuts and labne and spices -- simply incredible. A warm salad! Paired with a lovely riesling, it was a perfect lunch. The highlight? Ann, the bartender -- easily engaged, knowledgeable, and such a fun lunch partner that I left feeling lucky to have followed my heart over to Neptune. Ann, I hope you get to meet the seals soon. And then we'll have to discuss.Absolutely awesome.

Reviews.Author: Brian D.
Reviews.Content: There are things in the ocean that can kill the saltiest, surliest of fishermen.There are sights to be seen like the mermaids, giant squids and the ferocious orca.And there are, most importantly, lots of living things that need to be served raw on a plate in front of me.Neptune Oyster is no joke and is THE place to eat said raw, sea bits. I mean, if you feel OK joking about raw bar and mesmerizing wine lists then go ahead, take a stab at it but I bet your one liner will be about as funny as that time when I *blanked* your mom.Here is a recipe for a perfect Sunday afternoon in Boston:-wake up with a mild hangover-head straight to Chinatown and eat things that will burn the demons out of you-go for a long, scorching walk and navigate herds of gregarious tourists-enter the North End and find Salem St-go to Neptune Oyster ahead of dinner crowd and sit at the bar-get an oyster card and order with abandon -order crisp clean beers and white wines as well-rinse, repeat-make nice with Vinny the bar guy and make plans to return to Neptune Oyster sooner rather than later-get sidetracked on your way home and drink more beer

Reviews.Author: Jim D.
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype, folks.  Believe it.  I came here specifically to satisfy a crustacean hankering after hearing such overwhelming positive reviews from locals.  We arrived around 5:30ish and the place was busy but not crazy packed.  Magnifique.  We landed primo seats right up front by the raw bar.  Their no reservation policy in conjunction with their stellar reputation should really make you consider coming as early as possible to get a seat in their tiny little restaurant.  Lines were already formed by 6pm and it was only Thursday.  I started out with several varieties of oysters which were all great -- salty, buttery nibbles of ocean lusciousness.  But that lobster roll.  Wow.  It was served hot with butter in the perfectly toasted, eggy brioche.  It was sublime and arguably one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had.  My friend ordered the mussels which were quite delicious as well.  The only minor gripe is that they didn't serve any good crusty bread to soak up all that yummy broth. The service was great.  Since we sat at the bar, we had a very attentive bartender.  They had a great wine selection but I opted for a nice cold beer.  Prices are a bit steep, but the food is truly worth it.  I can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Author: Tom E.
Reviews.Content: In both Asian countries like Taiwan and Arabic countries like UAE, it is the culture of dining to share the dishes. This is also a trick many top-Yelpers will employ to allow them to taste as much as the menu as possible and get a sample of more than one great dish.***  Knowing all of this I have to ask:***  YiHwa:     Why didn't you ever give me a bite of that Lobster Roll?Was it just too good to share?:(EDIT: In attempt to reconcile this dastardly act, please let the record show that I had the $11 Oyster Burger, which disappointingly was not a burger made out of oysters (still dreamin') but a fabulous huge juicy burger garnished with two token fried oysters that don't really add much. I may or may not have offered YiHwa a bite.

Reviews.Author: Katie B.
Reviews.Content: Hail to the oyster Gods.I was in Boston recently and my Bostonian hostess with the mostess and I were walking through Little Italy when we happened upon the most precious little storefront I have ever seen. Little lemons lined the window, but they were the most vibrant color of yellow one could imagine and it was perfectly combined with a navy shade of blue ripped straight from the ocean. The bright lights coming from inside and outside were beautiful.  I couldn't help but marvel in its nautical glory.I've never ventured into the realm of crustacean inspired culinary dishes, but I could appreciate the assemblage of shelled creatures through the window.  It was dinner time and the place was bustling. Everyone looked so engaged with one another and their sea-faring creatures. It was a moment in time I will never forget.So, the next night (we had plans the night of "spotting"), I mentioned to her that I would love nothing more than to go back and try this little oyster bar for myself. My only experience with oysters before was at a Mexican buffet with heat lamps (you can imagine why I hadn't been clamoring to try them again any time soon), so I really wanted to do it right this time (turns out she had never partook either).  We got there mid-afternoon on a Friday. We sat at the bar (the place is small) and Julie provided us with superb service that included knowledge, personality, sympathy, excitement for our new venture, attentiveness, excellent wine pairing suggestions...I mean the works.We only had a couple of oysters each and although I wasn't so much a fan (since I couldn't discern one taste from another), Julie reassured me that I shouldn't worry to much as it was technically my first time and if I stayed with it, I would be on my way to oyster oinker soon enough!Everything was so fresh and I will always look back on Neptune fondly.

Reviews.Author: Sarah J.
Reviews.Content: Going to Neptune Oyster is like visiting a close relative you have known your entire life.  You go into her house, and everything is the same.  It has the same smell, same look, same friendly, welcoming vibe.  When I walk into NO, I feel at home.  Maybe it's because it's so familiar to me having gone there for so many years.  Maybe it's because there is a ton of family history oozing out from Neptune's--my grandfather used to take my mom here when she was a kid, and my mom did the same for me.  Regardless, I love how I feel when I come to Neptune's, not only because the food is delicious, but also because it is so comforting.Just like I do when I visit home, I want to eat the same thing upon each visit.  That means classic clam chowder with oyster crackers piled in, causing the chowder to ooze out over the top of the cup.  Sharing a plate of fried oysters with my dad, extra tartar sauce and lemon.  Scarfing down a lobster roll--toasted bun, cold with mayo.  My mom's lobster rolls are the best in the world, but Neptune's are a close second.  If you want an authentic New England seafood experience, skip tourist traps like Union Oyster House and come to the place the locals love.  Your stomach and heart will thank you.

Reviews.Author: Rhett S.
Reviews.Content: 200+ reviews... what else is there to say? How about... MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT [to date 11/23/2009] How about... 3lb of LOBSTER in their roll [get with butter NOT MAYO] How about... Kumomoto Oysters [the LEXUS of Oysters] How about... Foie Gras melted atop apple infused steamed PEI mussels [seriously!] How about... Octopus over polenta in a lobster broth with roasted vegetables [I can go on...] How about... Venison and Tuna Tartar Sandwich with cucumber relish [the tri-fecta!] How about... Arctic Char crudo atop creme freche with pastrami seasonings [the bomb!] How about... Harpoon IPA on tap [In a frosty glass :] How about... doing all that is above two days in a row... Son!  Now that's a Wicked Pissah!

Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: Q: Shall we sample sometimes staggeringly priced sumptuous sea-sourced selections of the famed Neptuzzy? A: Ain't gotta ask me twice.I've never been here, and it was high time I gave it a go.
