Reviews.Content: Three of us went to Neptune Oyster on the night that Italy won the world cup, so the waitstaff was still recovering from the celebrations that had happened there that day.  Nonetheless, we were able to snag a table in this little place and we enjoyed a really wonderful dinner.  The oysters were fresh and tasty, with interesting takes on condiments and sauces.  Shrimp cocktail was good.  I had the cold lobster roll - very good.  My fiancee had the hot lobster roll - even better.  The other person in our party got a sandwich that included some kind of fish and also roasted veal.  The roasted veal looked and tasted a lot like turkey, but apparently it was pretty good - I didn't eat any.  Neptune is great if you're in the mood for a splurge - it's pricey.  A great place to bring someone from out of town too, assuming you can get a table.

Reviews.Author: Alan C.
Reviews.Content: It was a rainy wednesday afternoon in the north end. after spending the morning at the new england aquarium, my girl and i happened to stroll by neptune. the variety of seafood from their front window lured us in. plus it was pouring outside so what the hey, let's gooo...what a suprisingly delicious spur of the moment choice. the restaurant itself is small but cozy. the oyster menu was plentiful of both local and far away choices...i liked how the menu specificed the orgin of each type of oyster...the cape cod ones were especially fresh. the waiter was nice and efficient...asked what was on draft...a lot of dark beer but they had a beer made from oysters...naturally, i'm curious so i decided to try it. it tasted a lot like a guiness with a small cup of ocean water mixed in (and expensive **$15!!).  when it comes to seafood, i always splurge. i grin as the plateful of delectable seafood arrives...my mouth waters...littleneck clams = creamy, oceany taste...w/ some lemon juice....perfecto!cocktail shrimp = colassal sized, fresh, a definite mustsea urchin = interesting but not for mecooked mussels = this was on their regular menu...the sauce from the mussel plate was like a soup...dip it in with some bread...so delicious!oysters = tried to order some from every region...some were creamy, others were oceany sweet...i enjoyed every one of them...i highly recommend this place for the raw bar...can't say much about their regular stuff but i'm sure it's good too. they say oysters are an aphrodisiac food. later that night, my girl and i confirmed this fact.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly B.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster bar feels more like Brooklyn than Boston. It's as if someone transported Prime Meats in Williamsburg, brought it to Boston's North End and substituted steak for seafood. Needless to say, I'm a big fan.Covered in subway tiles with a long bar that spans the length of the restaurant, there's always a wait for a table, a buzz in the air, and a scene-y energy that makes me feel like I'm back in New York. I prefer a seat at the bar and a pint of a local brew, while scanning that evening's oyster list. There are plenty of local bivalves and beers on tap, but Neptune also flies in West Coast oysters...my personal fave.Start with a smattering of oyster selects and then move on to crudo; I tried both the hamachi ceviche with jalapeno-lime vinaigrette and the dayboat scallops with local apple marmalade...equally on point. The plated menu items are generously portioned and genuinely prepared with seasonal ingredients you can feel good about. The fare is "elevated seafood shack" featuring: fried Ipswich clams, buttermilk johnnycakes with smoked trout tartare and caviar, whole fish grilled a la plancha, and their signature dish, your choice of a hot butter or cold mayo Maine lobster roll served with french fries. For me, a hot buttered bun gets my vote every time.Bonus: there's not a TV playing a Boston sports game in sight! Like I said, elevated.

Reviews.Author: Tony T.
Reviews.Content: Excellent lobster roll and very good oysters. Would go back daily for lobster rolls if I could afford it. Need more mignonette options for oysters.

Reviews.Author: Michelle W.
Reviews.Content: Likes:- Fresh delicious oyster selection- Little neck, cherry stone and razor clams- Lobster carbonara is to DIE FOR!!  (that was a daily special)- Basically everything!  Best seafood I've had in Boston so far :)

Reviews.Author: Phyllis K.
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of an oyster person.  Sure, I like 'em, but if you were to put a 4 buck oyster in front of me, I probably wouldn't notice the difference between him and a kinsman of his for half the price.  So for me, my visit to Neptune Oyster was all about the Lobster Roll.  Good gravy, that thing is a tasty treat!  I've never had a hot lobster roll, I see now what I was missing.  Delicious and succulent lobster chunks healthily doused in butter, the true nectar of the gods, brought to me unparalleled levels of epicurean pleasure.  Or in short, "ME LIKEY!"     I can't say that I had the same enthusiasm for the octopus app that everyone's been raving about.  It's all sauce, and over-seasoned at that.  I was tempted to play the Where's Waldo game, but with Mollusk instead.  And the veal and tuna sandwich, while great to read and dream about, had waaaay to much veal on it.  It was like a bodega deli sandwich, they just keep piling it on, till your sandwich is too tall to comfortably bite into.  Also, compared to the lobster roll, it definitely falls flat, but then again, I doubt anything there could be as wondrous as that roll/  ME LIKEY!**OK, and next time, I'll get the oysters

Reviews.Author: Joanna S.
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth a trip here if you're ever in Boston! 4 of us came here on a busy bustlin' Friday night. They didn't take reservations, and the place was pretty small so our wait time was about an hour and a half. Still so worth it! We got a sampler that was a 3 tier tray with oysters, clams, crab, lobster, octopus. Just a bit of everything! It was so great, and we loved the east coast oysters, comparable to the Kumamoto oysters we get on the West Coast. The hot lobster rolls is a must! This was the best I've ever had. We had a cold lobster roll the next day at Faneuil Hall but the one at Neptune Oyster was SO MUCH better! Buttery soft, warm roll, with tons of lobster meat. Really got my seafood fix here in Boston, I can't wait to come back to get the hot lobster roll again! So yummy.

Reviews.Author: Deb L.
Reviews.Content: Imagine the scenario...a romantic walk thru the North End of Boston , quaint historic streets , warmly lit bistros and cafes with delicious seafood and Italian specialties.  Salem street is the home to a gritty romantic ambiance that thrills my soul. Neptune Oyster is the perfect high end- hole in the wall, a tiny restaurant full of what appeared to be locals who know their way around an crustacean or two. Could be crowded at times, but on our visit the stars were aligned and we got right in.   And for a moment I felt like a local ,too.  Rat pack music playing ,cozy table ,a giant sampler plate of Oysters with wonderful  names like  Bees River ,Peacock Cove and Well Fleet ( my fave ), as Frank sang we ate well and then shared a luscious fried treat of the best clams ever. I had no clue they could actually taste light and airy.  I highly recommend Neptune, service was spot on and they gave us not only wonderful food but a beautiful memory as well.

Reviews.Author: Evie B.
Reviews.Content: This place totally gets the 5 stars for quality of product..not the service, but definitely based on the food!If you've ever seen the movie "When Harry Met Sally" you will recall a scene where Meg Ryan fakes an orgasm...Well, the lobster roll (warm, buttery, sweet and oooooh so tasty, all served on a warm toasty bun) took me right to that spot!!! DAAAYUM that was good!It's an itty bitty lil' place. You will get cozy with strangers, but will be so lost in the food, you won't care who is sitting next to you.(not a place for large groups) Service is abrupt, quick, and all without personality, but I was willing to overlook this, and enjoy my delicious bit of heaven. The roll is $25 bucks and for a treat here and there, so worth it. You will most likely have to wait a bit to get a seat. They will take your name and cell number and call you when seating is available. Get there quickly, they don't want to wait for you.This place is located in the area of Paul Revere's old house/Lil Italy.Enjoy : )

Reviews.Author: Sherry S.
Reviews.Content: Great little seafood Bistro.  We had lunch and arrived at 11:10 for the 11:30 opening and there was a line outside.  We got in with the first wave and had a choice of a table or sitting at the bar. We chose the bar.  Had some oysters on the half which were really fresh and good.I then had the Cioppinni with lobster added and my husband had the lobster roll. Both were very good.  Glass of wine and a beer for drinks. The tab was $100.The food was rich and well prepared but I felt the price point was a little high.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth F.
Reviews.Content: Amazingly fresh oysters and clams.Hot lobster roll buttery - goodness.  Their fries are also perfectly seasoned and comlement the roll great.  Food coma instantly.However, it is a bit pricey.  But that's ok - I'll justify it by taking friends/family that visit me.

Reviews.Author: Tom K.
Reviews.Content: Yup, believe the hype. Its just that good.I, like every other Yelp reviewer apparently, ordered the $25 worth every penny lobster roll. Its giant, delicious, and dripping with butter. When I return, I won't even look at the menu, I know what I'm getting again. Sold. My dining partner and I also split a number of raw oysters. Neptune makes ordering oysters as easy as it can possibly be- they give you a little slip of paper with all the different varieties, a short description, and the price. You mark down how many of each you want, and you're good to go. Many sushi places employ the same technique- if you can call writing your order down with a pencil and paper a technique. Overall, the place is amazing. Food is fantastic, the small restaurant has a great vibe, and service was spot on- there without being overbearing. All in all, a solid 5-stars. NOTE: They don't take reservations but will take your name and cell number at the door, quote you an estimated wait, and give you a ring on your phone when your table is ready. Take advantage and go for a stroll or grab a drink nearby while you wait!

Reviews.Author: Cathy S.
Reviews.Content: FUCK YEAH! Finally made it to Neptune!For the sake of all 98570364189 reviews here, i am just gonna say two things and shut myself up.1. If you, like me, ever question why lobster drenched with butter will be a better choice, here is the answer: it is not drenched with butter, but some sauce formulated with butter and stuff from the lobster head (or body) during the stir-fry process. Now keep in mind that this is my guess, so it may be wrong, but you WILL NOT get lobster soaked in pure butter, which would be a disgusting thing even to type it out.2. Get some oysters to start with, figure out which ones are your favorite, and then order them again after you devour that lobster roll. Best way to start and end the meal.

Reviews.Author: Joe A.
Reviews.Content: Arguably the best seafood in the city. Yes the place is small, I'll even say it's a tight squeeze, but don't let those other reviews deter you.  It's well worth the wait, the space, and the price. The wait can be long. BUT! They will take you're name and number, and call you when something opens up. That allows you and your entourage to go and hang out at some places on Hanover. Have a stogie at Stanza, some Sangria at an open air restaurant, or pick up some cannolis at Mike's or Modern. Of all the things I could get my lady, when she graduates Med School, she wants a bottle of good wine, a round of oysters, and a Neptune's lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Dawn E.
Reviews.Content: Recipe for an ideal Saturday afternoon: -get thee to the North End with someone you love, or at the very least like a whole lot-go directly to Neptune Oyster-sit at the bar-order up a dozen assorted oysters and suck 'em down with a glass of prosecco or a Geary's Pale Ale-embark on a life of happiness and fulfillment.This place does not mess around - they have a great reverence for frutti di mare and though the menu is limited, it is purely brilliant. If you are into oysters the staff are especially helpful and forthcoming with their recommendations and expertise (the fanny bay oysters really do have a cucumber finish- unbelievable!).If the thought of eating raw shellfish turns your stomach inside out, I've heard that their cooked offerings are just as amazing. Someday soon I hope to find that out for myself.

Reviews.Author: Joe J.
Reviews.Content: Friends from Boston had told me that I must go to Neptune's if I wanted the very best in seafood. They were correct. The tiny place offers incredibly fresh seafood prepared with exemplary finesse. We sat at the white marble counter and chatted with the attractive and knowledgeable staff about their favorites. The fried Ipswich clams were succulent and coated is a delicate breading and served with house made tartar sauce that has nothing in common with the store bought variety. Crab salad was blended with avocado - sweet and creamy. The Neptune platter is herbed lobster salad (virtually all meat), and horseradish inflected crab salad (again, all meat), plus several raw bar offerings (oysters, clams, mussels, prawns). They also offer a daily crudo plate, which for us was actually ceviche. Every item was incredible. The place is very small, so you will likely have to wait. However the neighborhood is fun to explore, so waiting to be called on your cell phone from the wait list is not so bad. Neptune's is an absolute must. It is not inexpensive, but it is a great value.

Reviews.Author: Richard R.
Reviews.Content: I honestly hate when people on Yelp rate a restaurant based on service over the food, but I can't help it. They have the most amazing lobster rolls I have ever had, but the hostess is the WORST. We have been craving this lobster roll for A FULL YEAR. We live in California and were back in town with a band we manage who just sold out the House Of Blues. We called ahead to ask what time they close. I was told the kitchen closes at 10:30. We called at 10 to place an order for 8 lobster rolls for the band, some of the crew and for us and had the hostess tell us it was too bad, they weren't taking any outgoing orders. So we spent $20 for someone to take a taxi over there to place the order and when he got there, she wouldn't let him order either! So we I to call to explain what the deal was, and she was the most unprofessional person I have ever dealt with at a restaurant. Every word I said she would say "nope", "nope", "nope", "nope" until I just lost my temper. I really hope other people who have bad experiences with her write reviews and tell management so they get a competent hostess.

Reviews.Author: Suji C.
Reviews.Content: On a week night, the wait was short and sweet. Friend and I split the top items reviewed on yelp: Hot lobstah roll, clam chowda and 2 oysters (1/each) Stuff is fresh, indeed! You taste the fullness of the seafood. Definitely would recommend the lobster roll and chowder, and it'd be best to enjoy them together. And eat it up while it's hot! Oysters are fresh and fatty, but trying one was good enough for me. For now, this place is a 4-star in my book. After trying Neptune's finally, I would never want to wait over an hour for this, esp. in the cold. Plus, I feel a bit sick eating seafood without carbs. As long as you're ready to rough it in the cold and spend some, you'll enjoy Neptune's. Just avoid heading here in big groups.

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: This unassuming restaurant serves fresh seafood and really lets the ingredients shine. We lucked out as we were able to score some seats within 15 minutes of showing up, and boy were we happy. I had a delicious warm lobster roll and a variety of oysters. The lobster roll had a generous serving of lobster meat, warmed nicely, doused in butter. The bun was crispy and buttery and delicious. Simple but amazing.The oysters were also delicious and fresh.Definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Rob J.
Reviews.Content: The oysters are excellent.  They served probably 10 different types, from CT, MA, RI, ME, and WA, along with of course, two sizes of clams on the half shell.   If you are an oyster fan, you will definitely appreciate the freshness and quality (although you are paying the premium).   Had one of the appetizers, the Crab Scampi (basically gourmet lasgnepasta and rich chese with lump crab),  which was very tasty.  However, I couldn't help but asking myself if any  other dish pumped full with the same amount of fat would be just as good...Was not happy with the service at all.  Went around 7pm on a friday with my gf,  hoping to have some raw bar and drinks  before going to dinner at a favorite.  We had to wait 30 minutes to get in, until we were seated in a uncomfortably cramped table which was shared with another couple.  Later on, the waitress made a big deal over the fact that we did not order entrees--- unnappropriate considering our drinks,  raw bar and appetizers alone racked up a  50+ dollar tab.  I understand you are trying to make a f-ing living, but way to make your customers feel unwanted...Can't speak about the entrees firsthand but , other patrons seemed to be pleased with their dishes.Next time I get a craving for oysters, ill buy a couple dozen at the market and shuck'em myself.  Neptune wasn't worth the trip or the dent in the wallet

Reviews.Author: Eddie W.
Reviews.Content: Update as of 9/21/12: I have yet to step foot again in this dump....but OMG they filmed a scene in The Town here!!!!1!!!!! Who f'n cares....2+ years later this review still holds true....It absolutely pains me to leave a 1 star review for Neptune Oyster. I had every intention of giving it 5 stars. I've eaten here before and it has always been great, until a night I like to call, "1 star Wednesday". After that day I'm afraid I shall never be able step foot into Neptune Oyster again.I should have known better than to stick around when I was told that they were out of lobster rolls. Apparently that is the straw that breaks the camels back and causes Defcon-1 at Neptune Oyster. I guess when the line can't just scoop cold lobster into a hot dog bun and they actually have  to cook, god forbid, everything falls apart.I ordered a half dozen oysters while I looked over the menu. The oysters came out promptly and were quite good. I then went ahead and placed my order and found out that lobster rolls were sold out. I should have left but after waiting 45 minutes to get "the call" I decided to stay and ordered tuna meatballs and scallops. The crispy tuna meatballs were OK, I have had better. They were defiantly lacking in flavor. Just seemed to be missing something. My plate was cleared and this is were things went down hill. I sat, and sat, and sat, and sat some more. The bartender then came over to tell me that my tuna meatballs would be right out. Ummmm I have been done with those for a good 20 minutes now you chooch. I then proceeded to wait close to an hour for an order of scallops to come out that were way over salted.It was totally unacceptable and to top it off when I mentioned to the bartender that I had been waiting an hour for an order of 4 scallops he chuckled a little and said to me, "No, you haven't." I have worked in many restaurants over the years and have had problems with ticket times but have never laughed in a guests face and told them that they haven't waited that long. Total amateur hour stuff right there.Goodbye Neptune it was nice knowing you. Like a crazy ex-girlfriend you won't be missed.If you go on a night when they are out of lobster just get up and leave. Seriously you'll thank me later. There are much better seafood options in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
Reviews.Content: Got there on a Saturday morning, party of 2, arrived ~15m before open. Total wait time to get our name on the list was around 25m. Waited another 25 minutes to get a call to be seated. We worked up quite an appetite with all that waiting. Ordered a dozen oysters, lobster roll (hot butter), and cioppino to share. Deliciouuuuus! Oysters were fresh, cioppino had a great spicy kick, the roll was overflowing with lobster meat!    Gulped down white wine between mouthfuls of seafood. Awesome start to the day.

Reviews.Author: Tony V.
Reviews.Content: At it's best, this place is awesome. Let me first explain that my low rating comes as a warning.I love their warm lobster rolls and oysters. But I've always gone during the weekend and in the evening. Though the wait has been hours (best spent by going to a dive bar or having a cannolli dessert first), it's been great. Today I went after the lunch time rush. We were first seated at the bar, but later moved to a table because the AC was blowing right on us. Well, the problem was that at neither the bar nor the table did we get any service, even though we watched the two waiters chatting it up with some what I assume as regulars at the end of the bar. That'd be okay if it wasn't at the sacrifice of the service for the rest of us. My glass of soda water was never replenished. We were never asked how things were (where my dad, visiting from Michigan, was missing utensils after the move and just went on sharing a napkin with me). And worst was when our oysters never came. We moved to the table just in time to receive our entrees. When we told the waiter to make sure the oysters weren't on the bill, she said it was because of our move that she missed the oysters. SHE BLAMED US, TO OUR FACES even though the oysters should have already come to us! She even bad-talked about us to the other waiter! I was shocked. Look, I would say that before this stop, I would and have given Neptune 5 stars. But on the merits of just this visit, I was insulted and really considered giving 1 star. This place is worth the wait. Because if there isn't one, chances are you'll have a sh-tty visit. :(

Reviews.Author: Irene Y.
Reviews.Content: A little bit pricey, but the oysters are fabulous! :) Recommendations*don't eat the bread or crackers? it's not worth the stomach space*the lobster roll was good, but it's all about the oysters here :)*get the kusshi oyster: it's small, but it has a zesty cucumber taste*come here for a snack instead of lunch

Reviews.Author: Lorrie M.
Reviews.Content: No wonder this place garnered such great reviews from the crowd. I was happy to be able to stop by here on my last day in Boston and experience the coziness of Neptune Oysters.We were immediately sat at the bar (the tables can fit at most 6 people and the whole place probably fits 30 max) even though it was around lunch time and I was pleasantly surprised to find that it wasn't too packed. Our waitress was very knowledgeable on the oysters list and recommended us some choices that we loved. Cafe Breton (or Cave Breton?) was delicious! This place has a healthy selection of beers and wines, I got some Harpoon IPA and loved its freshness having been there a few days prior at the actual brewery. I love their selection of unique beers right at the counter including ones with pull tabs! The veal and tuna tartare sandwich was delightful and very unexpected. The combination works better than you think! The fries are delicious and the whole atmosphere was just so inviting and warm. I wanted to stay there forever. I wish there were places of such caliber on the west coast!

Reviews.Author: Cassy H.
Reviews.Content: I came back here with one of my foodie girlfriends and of course, got the warm, buttery lobster roll. Still delicious with lobster cooked to perfection. Still my favorite lobster roll place in town. Still about an hour wait on average even if you come in the middle of the day during the week. Anyway, please don't ever change, Neptune Oyster. For once, I have to agree with Bruno Mars, because "there's not a thing that I would change, 'cause you're amazing, just the way you are..."

Reviews.Author: Monica R.
Reviews.Content: Best meal we had on our trip back to Boston - we split 6 oysters, the clams appetizer and the lobster spaghettini (Monday special).  We showed up at 2 pm and were immediately able to grab a seat at the bar.  The oysters were obviously fresh and we practically licked every speck of food off the bowl of lobster spaghettini.  When we sat down the bartender was in the middle of dealing with a very rude customer.  She handled the dispute very professionally, and even took a round of drinks off the tab of a couple who chimed in supporting her against the rude guy.  Thought that was nice!

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting for MONTHS to try this place.  I'm a sucker for good seafood, so this weekend when my boyfriend came to visit, Neptune Oyster was at the top of our must-go list!One thing I wasn't prepared for was just how TINY this place is.  We got there around 6:15 last Friday night, and by sheer dumb luck, we managed to get the last two open seats, next to another couple.  Is it kind of awkward to sit at a table with people you don't know?  Yes.  But sacrifices must be made for a delicious meal, and I can say with confidence that it was worth it.We started with a half dozen oysters, which were silky and delicate.  I loved the little sheet that described the way each one tasted, which made ordering easier for oyster n00bs like me and my boyfriend!  For our entrees, we both ordered the hot buttered lobster roll.  HEAVEN.  My question: why don't other places do lobster rolls like this?  Make no mistake, there's nothing wrong with the mayonnaise version, but the hot butter is such a lovely change!  I just don't see why Neptune has a monopoly on this.  Maybe it's time for me to open up a hot lobster roll stand and make a million bucks?

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: After waiting, for months it seems, to try this place, I finally went last night. I'm so glad--it was indescribable. Our selection of oysters were very, very fresh and delicious (save for the Fanny Bay oysters which naturally tastes like cantaloupe, blech!)--and the entrees were equally unbelievable. I got a pecan-crusted grouper with shredded pears and jalapenos on TOP of sweet potato puree and marshmallows! My boyfriend got the Tuesday night special--get this--Fried Chicken & Pancakes!!! These were the best pancakes I've ever tasted in my LIFE(with an amazing syrup--it was thinned without being runny, I think they boil the syrup and add butter to it! It was spiced with nutmeg and cinnamon and all that goodness...)and the fried chicken crust was perfectly salted and melted in my mouth.The wine selection was great--I had to have the bartender interpret and recommend a wine--but after I discovered the Bellini menu (written on the wall) I had several of the Blood Orange flavor (tho there's Peach and PassionFruit too!). They were blissful! Champagne and fruit, oysters and fried chicken? Oh my god.

Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS!!!We have eaten here several times and it is always great. The place is always packed. We go and put in our name and head across the street for a couple of drinks. The place is a bit small, but the food and service are great. We have been there for lunch and dinner and it is always good. We always get at least a dozen oysters. They have many different kinds. They are all from the region. I usually get a beer and my girlfriend always gets the blood orange Bellini. She loves them. Most of the time we will order the lobster roll with hot butter. While it is $25 dollars for the roll, it is heaping with lobster, comes with great fries and is always perfect. There is so much lobster that my girlfriend cannot even finish hers. Fortunately Ive got her back and finish it off for her.  I dont know how this place cannot get 5's all time on Yelp.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia L.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 Stars - By far the best lobster roll I have had in Boston or Ever (drool).We tried 2 of their oysters (I'm not an oyster connoisseur so I can't tell you whether they were good or amazing, but they weren't old/bad) and their famous buttered lobster roll.  I think this is the only place that offered hot buttered (not mayo) lobster roll; their lobster by far was the largest pieces.  It was amusing to see that just about everyone in the restaurant also ordered the butter lobster roll.- There was a line well before they opened at 11:30am...on a Sunday!  Luckily we were first in line and got a nice seat at the bar viewing the employees shucking open oysters.- This place is tiny (seats probably only 50 people at a time, including the bar).- North End = Street parking = No Parking

Reviews.Author: Bryce S.
Reviews.Content: One of a handful of Boston area restaurants to offer an expanded and kick-ass list of a variety of oysters and clams. Try a West Coast oyster next to an East Coast oyster and you'll discover subtle differences in flavors. You'll also understand why their raw menu reads like a wine list, dropping words like "hints of melon", "clean finish", "briny flavor", etc. Tiny downsides: their crudo ("raw" in Italian) specials, served in small salad form, seems to be getting a little more greasy than when Neptune first opened up. Also, the menu's pricey but other than that this place is nearly perfect. Don't miss their fried offerings; the breading is divinely light.

Reviews.Author: Lisa L.
Reviews.Content: I had heard so many rave reviews about Neptune Oyster, but sadly I was extremely disappointed. And to top it off I think I got food poisoning!!!!! My mom and I arrived at Neputne Oyster on a rainy Friday afternoon around 1:30pm and the place was packed! The restaurant is extremely small that you have to share tables with strangers. The wait staff doesn't even bother separating the tables out a little bit b/c there just isn't any space. And to make the lack of square footage even worse, camera crews were pacing back and forth filming a TV series for the Food Network (which was kind cool if the food was actually up to par). Okay....so I'll eliminate the service aspect of Neptune Oyster from this review since it wasn't an ordinary restaurant day b/c Food Network was filming. So..onto the main topic..THE FOOD! Between my mom and I we ordered Kumanoto oysters, Littenecks, shrimp cocktail, the hot lobster roll and the Vitello Tonnato sandwich. The Kumanotos were about $2.90 each and they tasted really fresh, however, I had got really sick after we left the restaurant.  I've had my share of raw foods at various restaurants and different parts of the world, and this is the first time I've had this happen to me. So you've all been warned...I've never seen shrimp cocktail the size of my palm, but unfortunately, in this case bigger isn't better. The cocktail shrimps were overcooked which made the texture of the shrimp way too firm. FAIL! And as for the hot lobster roll, I was not impressed whatsoever. For $25 I expected a lot more. I agree with the other reviews that the roll was overflowing with lobster, but the bun was not toasted and our lobster roll was definitely not "hot", at best our roll was lukewarm. I was thoroughly disappointed when I took my first bite. If I'm going to eat a lobster roll dipped in butter I would expect to taste the butter. Our roll lacked everything I expected it to encompass. FAIL! I decided to step out of my comfort zone and try something that didn't necessarily sound appetizing. I ordered the Vitello Tonnato sandwich which was served with tuna tartare, roasted veal with a cumber salad inside. I thought I would try to let my palate experience different things, but this sandwich made a statement to my taste buds to never mix fish and veal in sandwich. The textures did not merry well and it was just a weird combination. I think the sandwich would have been better off just the tuna tartare and the cucumber salad. Also, the sandwich had way too much roasted veal and it masked the freshness of the tuna tartare. Again...FAIL! I'm sure after reading this review, you know what I'm going to say. Don't waste your time with Neputne Oyster because it's overrated and there's a pretty high chance you might get sick. I'm willing to give this place a second chance, but for now...I won't be coming back to Neptune Oyster anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Gina P.
Reviews.Content: This place lives up to its five star ratings. I've heard about this place and saw it the other night on Chronicle and decided that I had to give a try, because I love oysters. No one was around to go with me, so I decided to go it alone. I have no problem going to a place to eat lunch by myself, especially in the North End. You always end up talking to someone. Because its not a very big place, I decided to go at about 2pm for a late lunch to miss the crowds. However, because of all its recent publicity, in The Boston Globe, Chronicle and soon the TV Food Network, I did have to wait about 10 minutes, but it wasn't a bad wait at all.While line, I ended up talking with two very nice women, a mother and daughter who were in Boston for a day trip and and older couple. All at the same time a table and three seats at the bar opened, so the older couple took the table and myself and the other two ladies in line sat together at the bar. The restaurant itself looks like something out of the 40's. White tile, dark wood, old style fixtures etc. Very nice, comfortable feel to it. Clean, but not cold. They have a wide variety of oysters to choose from. I really liked how they give you a list with the name of the oyster, origin, the price of each, their size and accurate taste description of each oyster. You just go down the list and put a the number of oysters you want next to its name. Its almost a cross between a sushi order sheet and a wine list. I wanted to compare several different varieties of oysters, because I compare all to the Welfleet oyster. I was raised on those. So I ordered a few Welfleet, a few Katama bay, Kumamoto- from WA, and a Pemaquid from ME and a few cherrystones for good measure. I have to say that the description given on their order sheet is very accurate. For example, they describe the Kumamoto oyster as "Sm. sweet, plump, creamy, with hints of honeydew melon." Yeah I know, honeydew melon?! Well I'll be danmed! It did have a honeydew tasting finish on it! LOL! Unreal The ladies next to me had Neptune's famous hot buttered lobster roll and it looked great! They were both very pleased with it. If you have eat a lobster roll with a knife and fork- isn't really a bad things. Lots of glistening buttered lobster meat in a beautifully buttery toasted roll. They were great company as well. Thank ladies!I would have like to have tried their clam chowder, but they only offer it by the bowl. I  couldn't have finished a whole bowl. I would have liked just a cup with my raw bar treats, That would have been perfect. I also think they should give that poor bartender a raise or little extra help now thru the holidays. She was slammed. No one just drinks at this bar. She was the bartender, server, cashier, informant, buser, etc and she handled it all very well and with grace, but if that were me I  would have told the owner if he left me out to dry like that again I would quit. But again, she never complained, just apologized for any wait and just kept moving right along. She was like a machine.Also BONUS for pulling the Guinness in three pours. Everything is done right here. Can't wait to go back! The vision of that lobster roll has been calling me all day!

Reviews.Author: Gary S.
Reviews.Content: The best Lobster Roll ever!I found this place on Yelp and when we got there we knew it looked proper for New England seafood.  The menu is small but still gave me a tough decision.  That was until the guy next to me got a lobster roll and I knew I needed one of those.  I got mine hot with butter instead of cold with mayo.  The waiter told me they were famous for the hot version so that's what I went with.  I went back again a few days later and had a lobster salad with heirloom tomatoes and just about the best mozzarella cheese I may of had since I was in Tuscany.  This is a must go.  Seating is very limited and we got there around 11:45am for lunch.  I am telling you this is a winner.Great wine menu as well.

Reviews.Author: Randy F.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is the real deal.Amazingly popular and super small (the interior fits about 20 or so), the key to Neptune Oyster is getting there early.  Lines form about 15-20 minutes before opening time and we were lucky to be among the first seating.  Given the fast pace and crowds, it's nice to see the interior is very classic and nice.  You'll probably share a table with another group and forget sitting together if you have more than 4 in your party.  But it's all worth it.  We started with a small selection from the raw oyster bar and then finished with their famous lobster rolls.   Our oysters were the Wellfleet and the Pemaquid and we paired them with some Cherrystone clams.Both the oysters and the clams were probably the freshest I've ever had.  They had a great salty brininess and were crisp and cold.  I've shucked oysters at two places and the quality of these easily topped Hog island.  Much sweeter, more refined and ultra smooth.  It was a treat.  The clams were a similar story.  Very fresh and not as chewy as I feared as I rarely have rare clams.  The only knock is that the price of the oysters here (very) quickly ramps up.  Blink and you'll be going into 3 figure lunch or dinner territory.The hot lobster rolls were next and I loved the fact that the buns were toasty and the lobster meat was warm.  As someone who dislikes cold sandwiches, I appreciated the choice between hot and cold.  The hot is also more naked, essentially ginormous pieces of lobster just topped with subtle butter.  No mayo, no garnish....it's all about the lobster.  I personally like a little mayo, but when you're downing huge pieces of tender lobster, it's hard to complain.  $26 a roll makes you pause a minute too....If fresh and seafood is what you want, you must make a stop at Neptune's.  While the place is very crowded and pricey to boot, the quality more than makes up for it.   Neptune Oyster takes credit cards, including American Express.

Reviews.Author: Jeff F.
Reviews.Content: Came back in Monday night - I've decided that there's no reason to move on to another seafood restaurant in Boston until you've indulged in at least 70% of Neptune's Menu. Here's the rundown on the grub:- Best Raw Bar anywhere...period- Hamachi Ceviche & pretty much anything off the Crudo part of the menu rocks- Maine Lobster Caprese was not what I expected - awesome- One of the best lobster rolls you'll ever have - period. Get the cold and not the hot. It makes no sense that this place has some of the best fries you'll have anywhere- PEI mussels in the curry broth were incredible (order toasted bread w/ it)- Bronzini is awesome- Scallops on the pork with veggies were ridiculous- Cioppino is good, but not really worth ordering - there's a lot of other places in the US that do better Cioppino - I'd order pretty much anything else off the menuHands down one of my favorite places to eat in Boston. Worth the extremely long wait.Notes from additional visits: the Lobster Spaghettini is worth getting on Mondays and The Tuna 'Steak Frites' is exceptional. Matt's the dude

Reviews.Author: Randall F.
Reviews.Content: When in Boston, you'll eventually think of that decadent and indulgent luxury food item - Lobster and the most approachable way to check off the list is to find a great Lobster Roll.Neptune Oyster only seats 34 in a simple, clean place with tables and counter seating.  One would think with all the reviews that a bulky line would constantly clog the narrow street in The North End, but a great system to get your name on the list with an estimate of wait time and a cell phone call to have you return to your open table or counter seat.  Oysters are listed on the large mirror menu and average $2.50 each...be careful but they looked fresh.  I had the Harpoon IPA which is just right with the cold lobster roll with mayo....fresh chunks of meaty lobster mixed with mayo and served with crispy seasoned fries.  A very close second with an equal quantity of lobster is the lobster salad caprese - it is drizzled with a light pesto sauce that absolutely blends perfectly....share with your companion for the best of both lobster worlds.While I didn't have room to try the clam chowdah, it looked creamy but not thickened.  Service was very good with the best system of taking your name and mobile # and allowing you to browse the neighborhood, much better than those Space Invaders buzzers that forces you to stick around.

Reviews.Author: Brian D.
Reviews.Content: Someone asked me the other day what my favorite food of any kind was.  It's the warm lobster roll at Neptune Oyster.  I swear I can eat this everyday for the rest of my life and never get sick of it.  Everytime I come in, I think about having one of the other amazing things on the menu (including their burger), but I can never resist the lobster roll.   The fried clams and Johnny Cake are my favorite appetizers.  If you are visting Boston (or live in Boston, but have been living under a rock), this place is a must.I used to live down the block so waiting wasn't a big deal for me, I just went home and watched TV until they called.  Otherwise, be prepared to walk around the North End, or go into one of the other bars to have a drink while you wait for your turn.  In my experience, the wait is never as long as they quote.  I think they like to keep expectations low.

Reviews.Author: Tucker H.
Reviews.Content: There are so many reviews already that I'm not going to go crazy describing how good this place is.  Instead, a couple tips:1) Get there early, especially on the weekend.  We showed up at 5:15 and the wait was already 90 minutes for a two-top.  By the time we sat down at 6:30, the wait for two was 2 1/2 hours, and for 3 or more it was 3 1/2.  The nice thing is that they don't make you stand in line like Giacomo's, you give them your cell phone and they call you when you table is nearly ready.  2)  If it is hot or cool out, don't be a jackass and stand in the doorway.  Get in or get out, otherwise the poor people at the end of the counter will suffer for your lack of manners.3) Don't be afraid to sit at the counter, especially if the seats face the street, it's like looking into a fishbowl as people walk back and forth in front of you.

Reviews.Author: Dawn R.
Reviews.Content: On the quest for a nice lobster roll before leaving Boston, my friend suggested we go here.  I knew nothing about it and went in blind.  Little did I know I was in for one of the best lunches of my life.  First off, I was utterly charmed by their oyster crackers.  I've always enjoyed oyster crackers, but I had no idea what an amateur I had been.  These guys have serious oyster crackers, presented in a bowl they are crunchy little nuggets of genuine serious cracker.  And the oysters...oh, the oysters.  I had earlier this weekend visited a tourist place I once revered, but let me down.  By comparison its oysters were just sad.  Neptune's oysters were absolutely beautiful.  I have no more words to describe them.  And the lobster roll we sought out?  So delicious!  In addition to the food being wonderful, I really dug the atmosphere. I was absolutely shocked to learn it was only 5 years in this location!  It felt like it had been there forever.  So well put together and lovely!Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Doreen X.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a destination restaurant.  In fact, it's probably THE destination restaurant for Boston, since it beautifully captures all that's good about this city: clam chowder and lobster rolls.   The hot lobster roll is the best rendition I have had, and one of the things that Boston schools New York on (Mary's Fish Camp, Pearl Oyster Bar, Mermaid Inn).  Someone mentioned the other day that temperature, including that of the plate, is key to good food.  If so, Neptune Oyster has mastered this concept with its provision of lobster rolls either hot with butter or cold with mayo.  I can't quite capture the lobster roll's glory in words, so I'll do the Sam Sifton and try by analogy: the satisfaction of your first bite is akin to tightly embracing a loved one whom was thought to be lost.  Subsequent bites are like locking lips with him (or her) and so on . . . When done, you'll wish to replay the experience.   Unfortunately, hordes of people feel similarly about Neptune Oyster.  So, avoid weekends or risk disappointment.

Reviews.Author: Lisa P.
Reviews.Content: What's better than a really, really, freakin' good lobster roll? Having the option to have said lobster roll in one of two ways: 1) cold, with mayo, or 2) hot, with butter.I chose option 2, and it was unbelievable: the lobster was sweet and succulent, the warm melted butter added just the right saltiness and creaminess, and the toasty, New England top-split hotdog bun was perfect for soaking up the lobstery, buttery drippings. The fries that came with were also amazing- perfectly crispy and seasoned. The oysters are great, and they offer a good selection of whites and roses by the glass. No reservations, so be prepared to wait. The good news is that they'll take your cell number and call when your table is ready, so you can at least explore the North End or grab a drink while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Cindy H.
Reviews.Content: Review for lobster roll only: I came to try Neptune Oyster after reading all the good reviews on their lobster roll. I can't believe that the wait on a Sat night was 3hrs long, but since I was by myself, I walked in and took a seat at the oyster bar. Score! The selection of oysters looked good, but too bad I'm not a fan of raw oysters. So my review is solely on the lobster roll. I ordered the lobster roll with hot butter but most of the butter made the bun soggy so I barely tasted the butter on the lobster meat. I wish I could taste the toasty-ness of the bun. But nonetheless they are very generous with the amount of lobster meat. (Maybe the cold lobster roll would have been a better choice.) The french fries on the side were a-ok - they didn't look fresh so maybe fried twice? Since the lobster roll is so heavy, a light side dish would have been nice.

Reviews.Author: Jamie Q.
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading the reviews here. Everyone was commenting about how small the place was and how horrendous the wait can be, so I was expecting an hour wait when I showed up at prime lunch time on a Saturday. Luckily, the place was empty so we were sat immediately.I have read the rave reviews about the oysters here, so I decided to get some. Now I must confess that I know nothing about oysters, so I asked the waitress to select half a dozen of differing tastes. She was glad to do so and picked a variety of differing salt contents. I never knew that oysters could have such contrasting tastes.Now the reason I came here was the lobster roll. Every once in a blue moon, I encounter what I call a Five Star dish. Examples of them would be the pizza at Grimaldi's and Pizzeria Bianco, the steak at the Metropolitan Grill and Cut, or the burger at the Bobcat Bite. Well the lobster roll from Neptune Oyster has just joined that group. The brioche bun was toasted perfectly and soft, and it was topped with a generous helping of lobster. I recommend going with the hot lobster roll because the warm butter complements it well. It's so simple, but oh so good at the same time. It's served with fries, which are not good at all, considering what it was paired with.Cost: $150 for four lobster rolls, a dozen oysters, a glass of Prosecco, and a bowl of clam chowder

Reviews.Author: Paul W.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmmmm mmmmm mmmmm..... Buttered Lobster Roll!  A friend told us the lobster rolls here were awesome and in my quest for finding the best lobster rolls places in NE, I had to try it.  I was not disappointed at all and although it was a hot butter lobster roll and one can't really compare to cold lobster rolls but in the category of a lobster rolls, it's #1 on my list so far.  For reference, Legal's cold lobster roll is one of the best and Summer Shack running up second.  The oysters menu is very informative and descriptive.  A little expensive compared to other restaurants but they were cold and delicious.  The waitress suggested stout beers that were created with oysters to pair with them.   The oysters were cold and good but one can still find $1 oysters out there that cost $2-3 here.On a note on seeing other people's food, the shrimp is huge!  The shrimps were about 1-2" thick and about 3-5" long.  The mussel appetizer was looked good too.  I'm going to have to try the shrimps when I get back here again.The place is small and you'll have to wait outside in the cold if there is no room.  No reservations too.  Also, if it is cold, make sure you shut the door quickly since it doesn't shut on it's own.  You'll appreciate the effort from others once you get seated yourself.Oyster selection: 9/10Food: 8/10Ambiance: 8/10

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S.
Reviews.Content: !!!!!! Words cannot explain how good this place was!!!!There are only a few things that I have ever ate that I will have dreams about. This place will have the honor of gracing my dreams with its deliciousness. WHY OH WHY does this place have to be all the way in Boston when I live in Cali?!Why am I raving about this place? Two words: LOBSTER ROLLI tried a couple different places in Boston with lobster rolls. And this place is the bomb-diggity when it comes to lobster rolls. They do it justice and then some. You can either choose it hot (with butter) or cold (with mayo). What can I say? I like mine hot. It turned out to be the best thing ever!! It was loaded ( I mean LOADED) with FRESH lobster. Fresher than the fresh prince. It was perfection. I also tried the clam chowder there. It was pretty good but it was different from other clam chowders out there. More liquidy, not that chunky, but very flavorful. Oysters there were amazing! So fresh!Con: very limited seating, not good for large groups. Come early!! Expect a wait!

Reviews.Author: Val F.
Reviews.Content: Warning: You're better off taking your food to go!!! (read as, service is PAINFUL)We ate here last night and our experience prompted me to join Yelp...plus it's about time I offered something up after enjoying this site and its reviews for so long!Back to the point: the service at Neptune Oyster was not just completely underwhelming, it was plain rude. Our bartender (young brunette, don't look at her sideways or ask any questions she doesn't feel like answering or you'll get the skunk eye) couldn't be bothered to reach over after we sat down at the bar, asking my husband to pass her some dirty napkins and plates. When my friend asked her how the pricing on oysters worked, she glumly responded, "it's up there" pointing to the chalkboard and walked away. And when we handed in our scorecard tallying up the oysters we wanted to order, she came back after looking at it and basically told my friend her handwriting was illegible forcing my friend to explain the cheap golf cart pencil they gave her broke. Our meals were delicious and well-prepared but is it worth the aggravation? I think not! Oh, and they practically locked 6 of us in at 11:15pm forcing us to duck under the metal security door to get out....guess they had places to be!!

Reviews.Author: Zach M.
Reviews.Content: Atrocious, I'm not sure how this place gets such great reviews.  There is no AC, we ate there on a day when the heat index was 101° F, that alone made it an unpleasant experience.  Second, as noted before this place is small.  So small that communal seating is used, and on a day when it feels like 100° I would like some personal space. Third the choice in glassware is disappointing.  It felt like I was doing shots of water, which would be refilled about every 10 to 15 minutes.  I also ordered a beer which came in a glass I've seen breweries use as a taster.  I may be in the minority here but when I order a beer I expect at least a 16 oz pour.Finally, the food.  We ordered the fish and chips to share.  Nothing was wrong with it, but it definitely was not the best fish and chips I've ever had.  The cod was fresh, but not right off the boat fresh.  The French fries were good, but nothing I would ever need to go back for.  Also that tiny beer I ordered wasn't my first choice.  I was informed that the IPA I had ordered was tapping too heady so I should pick something else.Overall I understand that this is primarily a raw bar, and I didn't order anything off the raw menu so I can't say how that is, but just based on the seating situation and lack of AC I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone I liked.

Reviews.Author: Drew B.
Reviews.Content: So I will start this review out by saying that I did not eat at this restaurant. With that said, I was surprised that with a 4.5 star rating this restaurant felt just about as claustrophobic as an overcrowded closet space. I had to scoot my seat in twice in the few minutes I was there to let people through the main entrance - the proportions of which seemed more fitting for a back exit! Decor doesn't seem to be their thing either. I was surprised by tables and chairs that were more fitting for a diner than a fine seafood restaurant.Then there was the problem of their poor supply of seafood. They were out of lobster meat even though it was only 6:30 on a Saturday evening! Now I don't know about you, but the North End probably receives the greatest bulk of its patronage on a Saturday evening and they're telling me there's no more lobster?! The hostess was not all that polite either and didn't show up until after we decided to finally seat ourselves after standing, waiting and ultimately feeling ignored by everyone that seemed like they worked there.While I'm sure the food has much to offer given the rave reviews, I must play devil's advocate and say that until Neptune gets a better floor plan, learns how to more effectively match their food supply to the demand of North End patrons - the inclusion of cocktails wouldn't hurt either - and give their customer service a major overhaul I will have to rate this as I would any other sub-par restaurant, 2 stars. If you expect good service, comfortable eating conditions and a fully stocked menu Neptune is not for you.

Reviews.Author: Ron U.
Reviews.Content: A great seafood place in the heart of North End. If you're an oyster fan, they have a wide selection, and oh the freshness. You will not see just regular 'oyster' on the menu - there's actually a separate menu for oysters that goes into much detail on the various types and their flavors - salty, sweet, plump, juicy, nutty, fruity. Wellfleet, Island Creek, I.C. Neptune, Cape Breton, Pemaquid, Summersides. I never imagined so many different flavors of oysters and clams. We washed down the oysters with a pint of Guinness and finished up with a lobster roll. In Boston, lobster rolls are almost as prevalent as clam chowder, but these are a cut above the rest and definitely are worth the $25. Most other places, you get a stale bun, mayo-smothered claw meat, and buyer's remorse. At Neptune, you will be proudly presented with a lightly toasted slightly buttered bun, huge chunks of premium lobster meat, perfectly seasoned, and a side of french fries.

Reviews.Author: Not Really Cajun T.
Reviews.Content: Three stars for the food.  I am probably in the minority, because I preferred the cold lobster roll over the hot. Great french fries, amazing Wianna raw oysters.The good review ends here.My friend and I sat at the bar, and the server was an absolute C U Next Tuesday. If you're wondering which one, she has curly hair pulled back and wears glasses.  Oh, and this was on a Sunday, 6/5/11 to be exact.After bringing our food, she failed to bring over napkins or silverware. Nothing. We waited about 5 minutes, still nothing. Waited another 5 minutes, nothing. Then I walked over to other side of the bar where the servers were ignoring us, and I asked very politely for napkins and silverware. I used to be a server, I get the drill.  She said okay, but about 3 minutes later, she walked over to us with a huge attitude and basically shrieked at us with her shrill voice for us to be patient. Keep in mind that there was a box of folded up napkins that we were staring at. Five minutes after that, she came over with silverware, threw them at the counter in front of us. When I asked, "Oh, napkins?" She huffed and puffed and grabbed a couple and threw them at us.  Not only does she deserve to be fired, she belongs in the Worst Server Hall of Shame.And I probably didn't like the hot lobster roll because it went cold while waiting for silverware and napkins.Never again.

Reviews.Author: Michael G.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is the only table in Boston I'll happily wait for.  Wait, that's a lie.  It's one of two tables I'll wait for, the other being Toro in the South End.  I'll wait for Toro because by some small miracle, no matter how jammed it is in there, I always seem to find a seat at the bar.  Neptune Oyster, on the other hand, I'll wait for because they had the brilliant idea to simply take your cell number and call you when your table is ready.  So you can stroll around the North End, admiring all the enormous men in tiny hats with giant cigars and lost tourists wearing "Cheers" t-shirts asking you where the Freedom Trail is. Sure beats the hell out of standing in a hot crowded sweaty hallway waiting for a table.The food here is honestly the best seafood in Boston.  This is no exaggeration, and I'm not misusing the word "literally" when I say it is literally the best.  I've lived in this city for my entire life and have tried them all, repeatedly, just to be sure.  This is seafood nirvana in a tiny storefront on Salem Street, people.  The oyster shuckers are three women from a landlocked town in Colombia who were imported by the restaurant specifically for their oyster-shucking prowess.  They were recently written up in Boston Magazine as a matter of fact... wait... right here:bostonmagazine.com/resta…This may be the only restaurant on Earth that I do not even know if they offer dessert, because I've never been interested enough to bother finding out.  The food leading up to the end of the meal is so incredibly delicious, so exquisitely fresh and perfectly prepared, that the thought of shoving something overly sweet down my gullet after it was never even considered.  This is a monumental admission from a clinical chocoholic such as myself.  Trust me, you'll regret nothing at all about a visit to Neptune Oyster.  In fact, if you are going, I will valiantly offer up my services as a guide to the food & menu.  I'll even let you pick up the tab.

Reviews.Author: Catherine W.
Reviews.Content: Finally got a chance to eat here - put our name  in at 4pm- ish and was told the wait would be 2 hours. They take your name and cell, and then call you when your table is ready. The place is SMALL. You either sit at the bar (maybe 20 spots) or at one of the tables (maybe another 20 spots).Enjoyed raw oysters - liked the Kumamotos from WA the best, followed by Beach Point and Moon Shoal, both from Barnstable. Also had the little neck clams but they were too salty for my taste. For other appetizers we tried the day boat scallops (prepared in a similar manner as ceviche - delicious!!) as well as the neptunes on piggyback (fried oysters with pig) - also very good. for entrees we had the pescado Cubano special of the day (whole roasted fish over beans and rice , topped with guac )- delicious. Also had the ciopinno - which was also good. The restaurant indeed serves very good seafood and so I was glad we finally tried it after hearing its reputation. Unfortunately one of us didn't feel so good afterwards so we either overdid it with the raw bar or ate a suspect food item. It would be difficult in my opinion  to bring a larger party here or young children due to the cramped size of dining room. We did have a great time and our server Adriana was excellent - knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Ann L.
Reviews.Content: We went to Neptune Oyster House after my friend recommended the place.  I thought it was ok, but way overpriced.It's a small place fits about 50 pp only, but we got there way before opening hr and had to wait around.  It finally opened at 11:30am.Same menu for lunch & dinner, but I thought it would be cheaper at lunch - no way!  Be warned!We got:bowl of chowder - nice, though overpriced $11.  Waitress didn't give me crackers, though I saw her give it to another table later.  That's evil.Lobster roll - $24!!  One lobster roll w/ fries.  Overpriced, but tasty.  Didn't try the fries - husband said just ok.Bowl of littlenecks $12 - tasty, lots of garlic in sauce.  One unisex bathroom in the back of the small restaurant, before the kitchen & bar.Credit cards taken & you'll need it.  So expensive.

Reviews.Author: Heather G.
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere here is fun and cozy, which was an automatic plus for me, so regardless of the food, i was bound to have a good time.Started with a mix of oysters from various places.  Personally, I prefer east coast oysters as the west coast ones have a consistency I don't love.  Thought i'd give washington oysters another shot, but alas, compared with my east-coast wellfleet friends, WA does not hold a candle.  Aside from the WA selection, the rest of the oysters were cool, salty, fresh, and delicious, even sans sauces.On to the appetizer, we thought we'd be creative with Neptunes on Piggyback, which is a plate of crispy oysters, pork, golden raisins, and pistachio aioli served on toasts.  It sounds odd but is actually spectacular and was the star of my meal.My dining companion chose the entrees, which were the lobster roll (hot with butter) and the burger with fried oysters and garlic mayo.  The lobster roll was very good: hot, buttery, and stuffed into warm, squishy bread.  However, it was just a lobster roll.  The burger was cooked well, moist, and the fried oysters on top made it special and stand out from other places.  But again, just a burger.  Fries were great - they're similar to Marliave or Kingston Station fries - house-cut and perfectly seasoned.  Were I to go again, I would try something more adventurous than sandwiches.Side note: I attempted to order the tuna tartare sandwich with roasted veal for my entree, but at 5:30pm on a Friday night, i was informed they were out of that particular dish for the night....at 5:30pm.  How does that happen?  Uncool, Neptune.  If you're in the mood for tuna tartare, get there early.I would certainly go back again to try some of the more seafood-y items.

Reviews.Author: Michele G.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we came here on a Friday night. Put my name in, gave my number. Didn't get a call, so we went and checked in and our seats were available.Except... That those seats at the bar were TWO FEET AWAY FROM THE BATHROOM. Sorry, but that's vile. You shouldn't be allowed to sandwich people between where waiters pick up drink orders and where others defecate. Especially if you expect those paying customers to eat your food. Disgusting. I was so disturbed that we asked to move as soon as other seats further down the bar opened up. Thankfully, we were granted our wish. Because if that wasn't the case and if this place hadn't received such good reviews, I'd have walked out and spent money elsewhere.On to the food and drink.... Woefully, this place is beer and wine only. The bartender offered to make me a bellini, which was cool. He offered me a few juice choices and I chose passionfruit. It was extremely sour, to the point of needing a water chaser after every sip. Sadly, it was expensive as well.Ordered the hot buttered lobster roll. Good, but not any different from steaming a lobster at home and then putting its meat in a roll and drizzling melted butter on it.Fine. But what a pain it was to pay. The bartender took the credit card and placed it next to the computer. Then decided to go about other tasks and serve other customers for the next 15 minutes. Seriously? We won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Helen L.
Reviews.Content: It was so busy and popular in there! I got there just in time to grab a 1 seater by the bar. They had local beer! Can't beat that. Unfortunately, I was not impressed by the warm lobster roll especially for $25. Yes, it was covered with butter and oh-so-warm chunks of lobster meat. There was something missing. I'm not sure what it is. Should I try it cold next time?The guy next to me had a nice chunky piece of scrumptious fish. Now that looked good! There are many other things that were good. The OYSTERS were wonderful. I ordered a few to sample that I suspected I would like. I loved them! I liked it so much that I had to order another sample set (even though I couldn't breath anymore). The bill I racked up was not to be envious of. Yikes! So juicy though. mmm.

Reviews.Author: Amy B.
Reviews.Content: If you want delicious, fresh shellfish, Neptune Oyster is your place.My favorite things to eat here are of course oysters, as well as the hot lobster roll. The lobster roll is prepared so that you really notice and enjoy the lobster itself first and foremost above the other flavors. Neptune offers a variety of oysters, and provide a small guide that describes the flavors of each type (if you sit at the bar, you can also chat with the raw bar person directly for advice on what to order). Everything I've eaten here has been fresh, fresh, fresh, which is so important with seafood generally and raw bars in particular.Another menu item which I ordered because it sounds interesting is the veal and tuna sandwich. This was actually really yummy! It featured thinly shaved veal and tuna tartare. It sounds odd, but the combination works.They do have a few non-seafood items on the menu, but I don't know anyone who's tried them. The beer selection at Neptune is limited. They have maybe four types of beer on draft, including Peroni, and pours are smallish (maybe 12 ounces?). The wine list is more expansive and seems particularly strong on the whites, which makes sense since those are typically paired with seafood.As others have mentioned, Neptune is really small, so you'll probably have to wait for a seat. If you're with a small group, you may have luck sitting at the bar. When I came with a larger group (8 people), they took my name and cell phone number and called me when the table was ready. They told me it would be 2 hours and it was, but because they took my cell number we were able to go to a nearby bar for drinks while we waited. It worked really well.My one hesitation with Neptune is that it is very expensive. I've been a little shocked by my bill every time I've come here. That said, I think they do deliver extremely high quality so I can't begrudge the price. I just need to accept that I will probably eat at Neptune very rarely, unless my Megabucks number comes in.

Reviews.Author: Rob B.
Reviews.Content: Adding a review to this place is like tossing a penny in fountain and hoping it be noticed. SO! I offer this review as a gratuity.   A thank you to our hostess who said "it's going to be an hour, but give me your cell and we will give you a call five minutes out" We got our call while nibbling dessert at Mikes.   A thank you to our server, who had the answers for every question and more so, said 'just let me take care of it', and he did.   A thank you to our Swedish table mates, a joy to share love of seafood.   And a thank you to the kitchen, it must be hard in that small space but you deliver awesomeness.   Finally a Thank you Neptune's and while we come for the creative fresh seafood, and enjoyed it! Your fries BTW totally ROCK! P.S Please ask for malt vinegar for the fries"

Reviews.Author: Nida K.
Reviews.Content: It almost wouldn't seem right if you came to Boston and didn't eat at Neptune Oyster. It's centrally located with all the historical landmarks nearby. It's a very, very small restaurant especially for the crowd it draws in. The space is very tight, so that's fair warning for those with personal space issues. My friends and I came here for dinner and there was about an hour and a half wait. They told us that they'd call us when our table was ready so we just hung out at a bar nearby. When the time finally arrived to eat a plethora of seafood, we were excited. I'm no seafood lover like my friends were, but even I was excited to try what they had here. We ordered the Triton Plateau for the three of us to share. It was a platter of oysters, crab, shrimp, and lobster. It was delicious and perfect for sharing with others. The North End Cioppino was seasoned perfectly. It reminded me of paella and stew, but the flavor of it was delightful. My friend had ordered a lobster roll that I didn't get to try, however, she said that she's had better in NY. Overall, a very satisfying dinner. We were stuffed silly before we left and went to enjoy our one night in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Author: Korri Leigh C.
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Went here last week and tried their scallops that was named the "Best dish in Boston" by Boston Mag.....I have to agree.  Amazing.  Still one of my favorite spots in the North End.  Upgrade to 5 stars cuz I'm good like that.Do yourself a favor and order the Trident, for $45 you get a huge ice tray full of raw seafood - oysters, cherrystones, littlenecks, mussels, shrimp, crab, and lobster.All the food I had was delicious, and I found the prices to actually be pretty reasonable.  One cavaet however, we dined at 730-8 on a Sunday and they had ran out of about half of all the dishes listed on the menu, for that fact alone Neptune loses one star.

Reviews.Author: pete k.
Reviews.Content: Fried Clams. Lobster Chowder. Lobster Rolls (hot and cold). Veal/Tuna Tartar Sandwich. DANG. Party of 3 went on a rainy Saturday for a late (2pm) lunch. Would have gotten some oysters but just could not avoid the other menu offerings.  The fried clams were the best I have ever eaten, and perhaps ever will. Light coating, and practically.. fluffy.. meat. Amazing. These were not your bottom of the barrel clams. The lobster chowder was incredible - with a thick blended veggie base to not overdo you with heavy cream. Local (Verril Farm) ingredients were noticeably fresh.After reading much praise of the lobster rolls, each of those had to be done. So as not to have a duplicate meal, I went with the roasted veal/tartar sandwich. Hot lobster roll - its just like eating a lobster with butter, without any effort. My preference is cold - and it was every bit as delicious, with just the right amount (not much!) of mayo. The rolls were of course a great match - not lame Wonder bread - Neptune's toasty brioche is THE winner here. The veal/tuna exceeded every one of my excpectations. Served on fantastic thick toasty bread, the sandwich was piled high with meat. The cucumber salad and mustard are in there, but only really noticeable when you start chowing down. The coolness and spice work in an amazing way with the crazy fresh tuna and warm, tender roast veal. The sandwiches are all full meals - while served with some delicious fries (really great, dark, crunchy, with skin and nicely seasoned), the sandwiches were filling enough that no one finished their fries.Great service, never pushy and always there to top off your water. I will be back.. and I will be sending many others along.

Reviews.Author: Rich G.
Reviews.Content: Short Version: Definitely eat here (hot lobster roll is amazing), regardless of how long the wait is for a table.Long Version:Was in Boston for a family event and wanted a meal at a good seafood restaurant.  Thanks to Yelp and all the great reviews, I found this place.  Got there on a rainy Friday night and even with the bad weather, there was a 2-hour wait.  Normally, I wouldn't wait that long for any restaurant, but with all the great reviews, I figured it was worth giving it a shot and boy was I glad I waited!  We ordered the hot lobster roll based on the recommendations from others and it was BY FAR, the best lobster roll I ever had.  The North End Cioppino (with lobster) was great too and had a nice spicy kick to it too.It was so good, I went back on Sunday morning to grab another lobster roll before heading back home.  I got there just before it opened at 11:30am and there were already about 40 in line ahead of me.  Sad to say, those people got seated and the place filled up before I could get a table and I would have had to wait an hour for the next table, and that was time I just didn't have to spend.Looking forward to another reason to go to Boston so I can go to this place agian.

Reviews.Author: Jaime V.
Reviews.Content: We arrived at around 3 PM on a Saturday and were seated right away. Apparently it's tough to get a table at peak hours, so this was perfect.To start off we tried a dozen different oysters and much like with wines, they all had distinct  flavors and textures. The oysters were so fresh that I didn't have a need for helpings other than lemon, although their shallot vinaigrette is delicious.As an entree I had the cioppino which was finger licking good, although a little on the salty side - and I don't mind salt. However, the langostinos were very fresh and the rice was perfectly cooked, which is a little tough to pull off with this dish.The service was prompt and attentive even after it started filling up. Neptune definitely pays attention to detail, you even see this in the pearly gloss surface of their beautifully printed business cards.

Reviews.Author: Nick B.
Reviews.Content: I went here on the recommendation of a co worker. If you can get over the claustrophobic seating arrangement (honestly how did they ever get a permit to seat that many people) it is a great restaurant. I just went for the raw bar and the chowder. Service was decent considering the place was packed. I appreciated the descriptions of all the oysters. Also, +1 for watching people from the midwest awkwardly eat seafood.

Reviews.Author: Zsaleh H.
Reviews.Content: This place makes me sad that I ever gave any other restaurant five stars, because Neptune Oyster is in a class of its own.I am not a native New Englander, so I didn't cut my teeth on shellfish.  In fact, I had my very first oyster and my first Maine lobster roll ever last (and only my second bowl of mussels ever).  But I never tasted such flavorful, fresh lobster before, and the curry that the mussels were served in was divine.  Every single bite of everything we ordered was absolute heaven, and even though I was completely stuffed, at the end of the meal my only question was, "When can we come back?"The atmosphere is also cozy and fun, and the service was fantastic.  Get there earlier in the evening and you won't have to wait as long--we arrived at 7:10 and they seated us by 7:40 (there were only two of us).

Reviews.Author: paura h.
Reviews.Content: There's more than just the lobster roll to Love.* Blue crab bisqueI'd like to dedicate an entire paragraph to the bisque because it's well-deserving. The bisque was smooth, and rich, in color and in taste. It had a bounty of large sumptuous chunks of crab meat, but despite it's substance, there was something very delicate about it. Lovely kick and perfect flavor. I wanted to lick the bowl clean!* Scallops with braised pork and brussel sprouts on a bed of pureed    fingerling potatoes. (topped with an apple garnish)* East Beech Blondes (nutty finish oyster)* Kuushi (cucumber finish)Every menu item was drool-worthy, except the clam chowder; subpar considering the caliber of the other dishes. Do visit!

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: Neptune is a nice quaint place surrounded by Italian bakeries and eateries.  Their daily oyster selection rivaled no other restaurant or oyster bar I have ever been to in terms of variety and quantity on hand.  Friend and I ordered two dozen oysters and two lobster rolls.  Sounds like a lot, but everything was so fresh and delicious that this will be one of the first spots we return to next time in Beantown.  Service was pretty good, especially given the place was crowded.  Prices were on par for the type of fare and the wine selection was good.  Street parking in front.

Reviews.Author: Claire J.
Reviews.Content: This place is small so the wait is long.  We put our name on the list and waited their call.  $ 25 Lobstah roll yum.  It ain't cheap, but they're not stingy.  They give a lot to make it worth $25.  It was soooo filling.  Oyster was fresh yummy.  Service is on and off.  We had to wait a while to get their attention in the beginning.

Reviews.Author: Heath G.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I just returned from a food and party weekend in Boston, MA and if you have been to Boston, then you know....it is a top 5 food city without a doubt! Now that being said, Neptune Oyster may be one of the top restaurants in the city! It is a very small venue which may seat only around 60 people and that includes the bar. Although small it packs a very big culinary punch!Now that I have told you it is small, you should know to expect a wait (ours was 45 minutes to 1 hour) but what is cool, the staff will call you on your mobile phone to let you know that your seats are ready! This indeed is very awesome because it allows you to venture to one of the other hundred bars or restaurants in the area while you wait, which we did.As you will read from most just about everything here is good....my opinion is everything is excellent! I love oysters and lobster so below is what I had and all amazing!1. Island Creek Raw Oysters- Medium size and very high salt- excellent with beer2. Glidden Point Raw Oysters- Medium/ Plump size/ very high salt/ citrus finish- also excellent with beer3. Kumamoto Raw Oysters- small/ sweet oysters- but guess what also great with beer4. Jonah Crab Claws- From Maine and they are large and sweet5. The Hot "Lobster Roll"- This my friends was the Holy Grail of food! It was by far the best lobster I have ever had in my life. I ordered it Hot with drawn butter. It is so good that you can eat the lobster off of the roll with a fork and then take a bite of the bread and it taste like you are still eating lobster. This is the deal!!!6. Whale's Tale Pale Ale- Drink lots of these!Ok I went with another friend who also loves to eat and drink, so that explains the above spread. We spent $240 but look at what we had and to be honest I would have happily paid $100 for that lobster roll alone. Whatever you do do not miss this place if you find yourself in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Rachel And Gabriel T.
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for this place and were VERY disappointed. The food was okay.. Nothing special. We've had better. What made us give this place a star is its horrible service. First, they missed items in our order and the server kept asking us if we just pencilled in those items even though there was no pencil nearby. Second, our food came very late and the tables that were seated later than us got their food way ahead. And the best part was halfway through our meal..
