The server asked us to move to another table because there was a large party coming in and we were seated between two tables that cleared up. We didn't even respond yet and she started moving our food plates. So thanks for ruining our dining experience and we will never ever come back.

Reviews.Author: El Huron I.
Reviews.Content: We should have known by the touristy feel to the place. Everyone seemed eager to tell the waitress and bartender how they are from Maine, Montana and Wisconsin. I experienced the same redhead (her name is Sara) as one of the previous reviewers. What a terribly unhappy and rude woman.The food: Lobster roll was your average lobster roll, and it was good. The clam chowder was the worst I'd ever had: it was watery and overpowered by the celery, and there was barely anything to chew on. My college dining hall made better chowder.This is a needlessly expensive place with some oddly-trained staff.Sara, the lobster roll nazi, put a damper on our visit by berating us repeatedly from behind the bar, ensuring that everyone, including the kitchen staff could hear her orders. Pitiful bipolar woman. She needs to be seen by a professional. Please tip well.

Reviews.Author: K.C. K.
Reviews.Content: Hugely disappointing.We went out to celebrate and I had been wanting to try Neptune Oyster and its famous buttered lobster roll. We knew to expect a wait and we strolled around the North End until we were called by the restaurant.We were seated at the bar, which was somewhat annoying as we were jostled by patrons and staff throughout our meal. I looked over the wine list, hoping to get a glass of sauvignon blanc. When I didn't see one I asked our server if one was available; she seemed exasperated and snapped that they have one. I was taken aback and stammered something like, "um, okay. What is it?" However, she had already walked away. When my wine arrived I thought she might tell me what it was but instead she just stared at me until I drank it and said it was fine. When we got our bill I saw that it was $17 a glass. It would have been nice to know what it was, particularly at that price point. I should mention here that I'm not cheap, especially when it comes to food and wine.My husband's clam chowder was truly awful; thin, watery and very few clams. My lobster roll was okay but honestly not worth the hype and certainly not worth the attitude and hassle here.Perhaps the oysters are outstanding; I'll never know because I'll never return.

Reviews.Author: Dan F.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll I've ever had. Warm with butter.

Reviews.Author: Jenny J.
Reviews.Content: #22I'll start with the lobster roll cause that's what they're famous for and it was not good for me.  I chose the warm version and regretted it right away.  I think cold is the way to go on lobster rolls.   There was just nothing mind blowing about it.  No real reason but it didn't wow me like the rolls did in NYC (hint hint. Pearls). The fries were good but no biggie.   Not like the shoestrings at pearls again.  The raw oysters and clams (Kumamoto and little necks)  were delicious and fresh.  The mussels also excellent and ask for bread to dip in a most delicious soup base      The place was packed as I understand it always is.  Too much hype and not enough substance.

Reviews.Author: Bela S.
Reviews.Content: Best Lobster Roll in town. Don't be fooled by those who say it is not authentic because of the bread (they used a better buttered and toasted roll) or because they give you a warm (buttered) option. So it's not crazy traditional. That doesn't mean it can't be BETER than traditional.This place fills out, especially at night. They were "sold out" at 7pm on a Thursday the last time we went. Gotta get there early. Plenty of seafood on the menu. All we have had is the lobster roll and clam bellies, but based on how good those were, I am sure everything else simply rocks.

Reviews.Author: Athena C.
Reviews.Content: Fresh and Tasty Oysters and SeafoodAfter consulted Amy Cao, the famous and most friendly food blogger, on where to go in Boston, I have come to the conclusion to try out Neptune Oyster. My first attempt on the Friday night before Valentine's Day failed. I would have to wait 2 hours just to be seated and there was no way I could hold my hunger for that long.Therefore, I decided to come back at noon the next day to give it another try. Luckily I arrived early enough to beat the crowd at 12PM. It just so happened my friend from NYC and his date happened to visit Boston and Neptune at the same time and they went all out to order all the oysters they have on the menu. We ordered some oysters, shrimp cocktail and lobster rolls on our own.Since I don't eat oysters, I could only quote my friends and boyfriend's sayings. They really love the oysters for their flavors and freshness. They dislike the clams because they are too salty and you could taste sand in your mouth.I personally, love the cocktail shrimps because they are huge and super fresh. The best part of the meal though, is their lobster roll made buttery. It costs $25 but it has so much lobster meat, fresh and buttery soaked in a nice bun with a big side of french fries. I feel like in heaven when I bit into the roll.If you are ever in Boston, make sure you check out this tiny but intimate seafood restaurant. The long wait is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Amanda E.
Reviews.Content: The gods were smiling on us as we ended our day of touristing. There were empty stools with no wait list upon arrival and we saddled up to the bar for one final meal in Boston.Our waitress/bartender was super friendly and helpful as we chose from the day's oyster menu. The sushi-style oyster menu helped choose which mollusks would be our appetizer, complete with flavor profiles for each.The lobster roll warm with butter was exactly what I hoped it would be. Writing the review now I can taste the lobster goodness once again. The fries were a nice touch...but no way was I crowding out room for my crustacean. Franky N. went with the Monday Special: Lobster Spaghettini. I had sticker shock at $36, but it was delish. If it weren't my last day in Boston and potentially the only time I'll ever eat there, we could (and should) have shared the oysters and Lobster Spaghettini.Oh well. Stuffed and happy with a crisp glass of white, life was good.

Reviews.Author: Traci K.
Reviews.Content: Ok - so I read all the reviews and demanded to be taken for the hot buttered lobster roll. Pros:- They take your name and phone number and call when the table is almost ready. Sat at one of the local watering holes and had a casual pre-dinner bevvy before being called up for our table. Awesome.- The decor is great. Tiled floors, great sea life posters, huge mirrors spanning the walls.- Hot buttered lobster roll. I came, I ordered, I ate, I licked the butter up off my arms, I died.Cons:- They pack you tighter than sardines in a can. Being continually elbowed throughout the meal by the diner to your left is not pleasant. (Though when I was in hot buttered lobster heaven, I didn't seem to mind as much).- Because the space is small, it's loud. Not the best place for an intimate date, unless your date is with a hot buttered...yeah yeah you get the picture.

Reviews.Author: jun k.
Reviews.Content: Neptune was tasty.  The service was great!The wait was long (but expected in North End).The food was good.I split a hot lobster roll and a roasted cuttlefish appetizer.The appetizer was yummy, but I wouldn't get it again.The lobster roll was yummy, but I don't think I'd really go back and get it again.I guess, ultimately, even though I totally think this place is quality, the wait and the price just isn't worth it . Which is WHY, for ME, this is just A-OK (3 stars).  ** one good thing about this place is that when you get put on the waitlist, they call your number.  So you can walk around the area.  The BAD thing is, if your phone is on vibrate, you might not get the call :(  They told us there was about a 45 minute wait, but instead they called after 20 minutes, so yes, we missed it.  Thankfully, another table was leaving, so we got seated about 15 minutes later.  In total, the wait was 1.5 hours. So yeah.  Expect to wait, expect to be in a crowded area.  Expect good food.  annnd.. expect large prices.(They automatically charged us gratuity for 5 people, just fyi).

Reviews.Author: Clara L.
Reviews.Content: Finally got a table within 2 hours after almost 2 years in Boston.  Score.  Got a plate of oysters, and their descriptions of the flavors are spot on (cucumber, honeydew, butter, anyone?).  Double score.  Ordered the Johnnycake with smoked trout and caviar.  Amazingly delicious triple score.  We dared some people to order the johnnycake and offered to pay for it if they didn't like it.  They never claimed that one.  Warm lobster roll with Old Bay seasoned crispy french fries.  Icing on the cake quadruple score.  The service is spot on, and the bar is a great place to park yourself.  Well worth the wait, but get there before 7 pm, as they sometimes shut down the waiting list once it passes a 3 hour wait.

Reviews.Author: Asavari G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent dishes - the seafood, raw bar, even down the the greens and dressing garnishes, the food is scrumptious.We aimed for an odd time in hopes of a shorter wait (we also had a party of 5, a large group for this hole in the wall). No luck - even at 3:45pm on Saturday, it's full. We had a 1.5hr wait for 5 people, but ended up getting luck and were called at 4:20pm, seated by 4:30. We went family style. Shared everything so that everyone got a taste, $50 per person. Every dish was delicious. Buttermilk Jonnycake: Pancake-like bottom with tasty tartare. A mix of slightly sweet and savory. Easy to share.PEI Mussels: The curry was so yum and spicy that we kept asking for more bread and alternating dips between the curry and the clam chowderClam chowder: More like "clam cream soup". I agree with others here, this was no chowder, but it was still ok. Good to share as it comes in more of a bowl size than cup sizeHamachi Ceviche Crudo: Raw fish, fun sauce. Do it.Flash seared nantucket yellowfin tuna: Tuna melts in your mouth, and the salad and light light dressing and light 'mashed potatoes' complement each otherGreek Whole Fish: Dont' get this if you can't de-bone a fish. We skillfully removed the spine and fins and dug in. Fresh, light, tasty while fish came with some meaty mushrooms and cooked kale greens. It all tasted good together.Lobster roll: Buttery deliciousness. I barely even like lobster and enjoyed this. I would have found it overwhelming if I'd had to eat it alone, however.Oysters: Each person ordered 3, all very good, fresh, no sand. They give you a dim sum like card where you mark how many of each you want. Service was also good. Waters were full (even though it's hard to gracefully reach some of them), and whenever we asked for bread/a drink/ another dish, they obliged. When we ordered, we just said "the Tuna" and at first, we were brought the tuna appetizer. We mentioned that we had ordered the entree, and they kindly took it back and did not charge us, given that the ordering was unclear.Worth a visit. Make it out to Neptune Oyster.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Ate: Oysters: Katama Bay, Summerside, Kumamoto, Kusshi, Johnnycake, Neptunes on piggyback, Maine Lobster Roll (butter)Drank: Beer (can't remember)Liked: Everything was amazing.  The Summerside and the Kusshi are probably my favorite oysters.  The Lobster Roll was perfect.  One of the best meals I've ever had.Disliked: Small space results in a long wait, but it was worth it.Chicken: Not tonight, baby.  We're in a seafood joint in Boston.Would mom like it?: Hide the prices from Mom and she'd also think it was the best.Would I go back: Oh yes.  Next time I'm in Boston, I'm there.Recommend: Oysters are pricey but well worth it.  Lobster roll is the best bang for the buck on the menu!

Reviews.Author: Matthew D.
Reviews.Content: I came here based on some help from some Boston Yelpers.  I was looking for the cities best Lobster Roll and with their help, I do believe I found it.  The place is tiny, there are larger closets in the McMansions OTP, but none of those have lobster so fresh you can almost taste the sea itself with every bite.They serve it two ways, with hot butter or with a little mayo and some fixings.  Like any good glutenous American I ordered one of each... consecutive days.  it is of course personal preference, but I enjoyed the mayo version more.  Now I am far from a connoisseur of Lobster rolls, but I have never had one with so much lobster that you better it eat first before you touch your fries or you may not finish your sandwich, incredible.  It also justifies the price ($25).I enjoyed a fine Italian beer and left so full dinner was a distant idea, not a priority for the evening.To Recap:The Good:  The best lobster roll I have ever had.  The decor is simple and classic.The Bad:  Even if you try to eat lunch at 3:30 expect a wait.  They do allow to leave a phone number so you can go walk around, so get there early, put your name and be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes.  No way around it.  The service was a little more New York attitude than Boston charm.The Band This Restaurant Most Resembles:  The Avett Brothers.  The best at what they do and they don't care if you know it or not.

Reviews.Author: Marilyn T.
Reviews.Content: Even if you're not a huge oyster fan (though theirs are SO fresh), there are lots of other options.  You can share the fried Ipswich clams with some beers, but you can't miss the warm lobster roll.  I'm generally don't like mayo, so I never get the cold ones, but the warm one, drizzled with butter, on a toasted roll - that's what a true Lobster Roll should be - you actually taste the sweetness of the lobster.If you're there on a Monday night, be sure to get the Lobster Spaghettini special.As painful as it is to get in and out of North End, Neptune is worth it.  Tip: get here at 11:15am to wait in line for right when they open at 11:30am (there will already be a line when you get there), and hopefully, you can make it in the first round of seating.

Reviews.Author: Tim O.
Reviews.Content: I live thousands of miles from Neptune the restaurant and millions of miles from Neptune the planet, but my head is close enough to Uranus to know that some similarities exist between the two:(1) Neptune the planet contains a high proportion of ice. Neptune the restaurant serves dozens of top-quality East Coast oysters on platters full of ice.(2) Neptune the planet is the farthest planet from the sun. Neptune the restaurant never lets mediocre seafood see the light of day.(3) Neptune the planet has an impressive gravitational pull. You could say the same thing about Neptune the restaurant once you've eaten there.(4) Neptune the planet's name is tied to the sea. Neptune the restaurant's profits, menu and some of its best customers are tied to the sea.(5) Neptune the planet has a mass 17 times the size of Earth's. After a proper experience at Neptune the restaurant, your gut's mass will be 17 times the size it used to be.

Reviews.Author: Winnie T.
Reviews.Content: There isn't much I can say that has not already been said. But I will say this:LOBSTER ROLL w/ FRIES. YUMMMM.I was amused by lady sitting next to me at the bar who was eying my food who then says to me, "mm that looks so good" I think if I turned around for a second she would've stolen some of my fries. I saw the way she was looking at them. It was the same way I looked at them before I ate them all.

Reviews.Author: Anonymous P.
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the oysters. Like someone said, they really do have great variances in subtle flavors, like a wine. The watermelon flavor of one variety was unmistakable.Thought the hot lobster roll wasn't all that, though the fries were good. Too much butter and bread overwhelmed the delicate lobster, though there was plenty of it.Good wine list, Duvel tops the small beer selection. Nice relaxed atmosphere. Pricey. Would go again.Did go again. I really enjoy the raw seafood, but the fried clams weren't all that imo.

Reviews.Author: Vloritine H.
Reviews.Content: I came for the burger once 4 years ago, and its kept me coming back! It's one of the few burgers I'll eat anymore.The lobster roll (hot) and everything else is awesome too!

Reviews.Author: S. J.
Reviews.Content: Ate here last winter, and it was a little underwhelming -- especially considering how long the line was and how many folks have recommended this place to us.This place is TINY. Then again, it's in the North End, so that's pretty common. Still, be prepared to literally bump elbows with other diners and the staff. We were seated in probably the worst seats in the house -- directly at the end of the bar, about 3 feet from the door to the only bathroom in the place. Yeah. Not only do you smell the bathroom, but you have to constantly watch your back so people using it and waiting for it don't bump into you. PLUS, the waitstaff is always running behind you since this spot is also where they pick up and drop off dishes.The lobster rolls were just okay -- but my girlfriend did not enjoy her bellini cocktail at all. Bar tenders were VERY COOL, though. In fact, we liked the staff. The menu isn't very big though, but I suppose that's fitting for this tiny restaurant.Go here if there's not a big line and you want to chat at the bar and have more common drinks.

Reviews.Author: Caroline L.
Reviews.Content: Goddamn you, lobster roll. You are expensive and delicious. And worth every penny.I don't know what I was thinking... in my head the only thing in Boston I could think to eat was clam chowder. How I must get my hands on the best clam chowder in the city. How I must drink beer and eat clam chowder. Never did it occur to me to try and find some lobstaaah and a lobstaaah roll. And I found one! It's such a quaint looking place, which reminds me of something I would see in North Beach here in SF. Really classy, maybe too classy for me... but that's just how it appears. And yes, I only had that lobster roll, but I would definitely go back for that and whatever else they have to offer. It was the best thing I had to eat in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Trung N.
Reviews.Content: I agree with what everyone says...the hot lobster rolls simply amazing. No other lobster roll will be the same after eating the one at Neptune Oyster.I also enjoyed the few of the oysters that I had. I am not oyster connoisseur but the description of the oyster's flavor were accurate and the oysters are all from the local area...fresh!!!I can't wait to go back the next time I am visiting Boston. It's good to have foodie buddies that will txt you where to go eat at the last minute. :)

Reviews.Author: Connie C.
Reviews.Content: After all the reviews, I just had to give it a shot.  The restaurant is small and cozy.  Definitely not for those looking for privacy--you are almost sitting on eachorhers laps the place is so small but to be honest it didn't bother me too muchThe clams and oysters were quite a disappointment.  They were too salty and not as described by the waitress. The scallops On the other hand were to die for!!!!  Mixed with greens, duck and blue cheese----amazing!!!!I recommend the Melbec wine!

Reviews.Author: Sandy W.
Reviews.Content: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Boston.  I've been here probably at least 40 times in the last year and a half.  If you like raw bar, you'd love this place.  On any given day, they have at least a dozen different types of oysters.   They also carry cherrystones, littlenecks, bay scallops, shrimp cocktail, crab claws and lobster.  I think the cherrystones deserve a special mention because they are the freshest, sweetest and plumpest cherrystones I've ever had!  The crudo specials are also really good so they are different worth a try.  My fiancee doesn't touch the raw bar but he loves the cooked dishes.  He always tries the specials and has yet to be disappointed.  I know that a lot of people like their lobster rolls (served either hot with butter or cold with mayo) and they're good but I think Alive & Kicking has better ones (served in toasted scali bread instead of rolls).  One tip: make sure you come here at odd times because they tend to get really busy during lunch and dinner hours (esp. after winning Best of Boston).

Reviews.Author: Cobra K.
Reviews.Content: Woke up and ate a hot buttered lobster roll.  Yummy.Place is tiny and doesn't have any booster seats or highchairs.  It is completely not kid friendly.  Also, if they are busy, don't even try getting a lobster roll togo.  Best I've had in Boston though...those hot buttery lobster rolls are to die for.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: I've been here four times.. Everytime is great!  My only complaint is that they sometimes blast the air conditioner (so bring a sweater or jacket!) and that they also have 2 old fashioned fans (that have old fashioned 1-inch thick dust on them) that I thought were only for decoration.  Turns out that the last time I was there, they turned on one of them.. Pretty gross!  Ok, so other than that, the warm lobster roll was very good and the scallops were beyond good.. Beautiful in fact in every way.  They have a great system for their wait list.. They will call you on your phone!

Reviews.Author: Vina A.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. My bf went with a friend a couple of weeks ago and loved it so much he was excited to share it with me so he took me last night and ordered exactly the same dishes. We did wait 2 hours on a Saturday but wow, what a treat!We started with a number of local oysters and wine, moved on to steamed little necks, chowder and finished with the amazing lobster roll.RAW BAR:Island creek - a great introduction to oysters for a newbee if you ask me. Medium amount of brine, large sized, and smooth.Summerside - These really stood out to me for their medium brine that turned suprisingly nutty at the end. Truly satisfying.Kushi -  petite, mild and creamy. I think I might prefer the kumamotos though.Shrimp Cocktail - I don't remember the last time I've seen such a large shrimp.Btw, I would highly recommend the book "The Big Oyster. History on the Half Shell" by Mark Kurlansky, a fascinating read about the history of NY through the role of the oyster.LITTLENECK CLAMS: tasty but I'm not a big clam fan ever since my mom fed me a raw one with hot sauce out of her kitchen that made me sick when I was 12. Everyone else really enjoyed them though.CHOWDER: I can't describe it other than perfect. It is light, fresh, fragrant, not heavy not salty and not overdone. It was simply lovely. LOBSTER ROLL: Wonderful. Truly. We knew we had to order it when we looked down the row of tables and nearly everyone had that 5" or so warm, ever so buttered, bread overflowing, no, exploding! with absolutely succulent lobster tail and claws with a side of hot browned crisp fries. I loved that the sandwich did not have a lot of sauce. I've had lobsters in the past that rely too heavily on butter and never gives the lobster enough respect - this lobster itself was so flavorful it stood alone, and the bread was not oily or over toasted (I hate when I have to fight the bread or risk cutting the top of my mouth to get to the star of the bite) - this bread was just firm enough to serve as the perfect transport for the delicious chunks of lobster.YUM. Amazingly, and telling of a good meal, if you ask me, I did not feel like falling over in a cholesterol filled coma. Instead I felt elated, energized and thankful for the opportunities to eat so well. Hope you will enjoy it too!

Reviews.Author: P M.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best lobster rolls ever. Unadorned. Huge chunks. Fresh. Delicious. You can actually choose to have it with mayo or just butter. Go for the butter.The oysters of course were incredible - one of the few places you get Kumamoto oysters. That and the Windy Bay are my favorites. The fried oysters are heavenly as well. I  can't wait to go back to this place.So why the 4 stars instead of 5? The place cannot seem to find a manager with the good sense to stock them well enough for a weekend nights. Three times I have gone there (and twice that another friend went) they were out of lobster rolls by 6pm. Come on people - figure it out. Weekend = stock up on lobster!!Besides that, this place is tops.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: 1000 reviews. What could I possibly add that hasn't already been said? Probably nothing, but it's worth repeating for the 1001th time. Just get the lobster roll. Don't worry about any of the other food. Trust me - it's all you want.We got to Neptune Oyster around 5:45, which is about 45 minutes after it opened. I knew all about the wait I might be in store for. For a party of two, it was 2.5 hours. Fine. Sign me up. They take your cell phone number so you don't have to stand around there forever until they're ready for you. So we did what I assume everyone else does - find a bar close by and just drink for 2.5 hours. We actually talked to another couple at a bar nearby who was doing just as we were.I would recommend getting there as early as you possibly can, especially if you have a larger group. At 5:45, the party of 4 behind me was given a wait time of 4 hours. I'm assuming not long after that did they stop taking names since they do eventually close for the night.The call came in almost exactly 2.5 hours later. We walked back over and were seated at a table with another couple. Just the name of the game I guess. No big deal for me.They gave us a menu and a piece of paper with all the raw bar options for the day. They also give you a pencil to make your choices. Well, I couldn't resist at least trying something, so we started with a half-dozen oysters based on our server's recommendations. They were delicious and a perfect way to start. Then came the famed lobster roll and all of its hot, buttery goodness. I'm drooling thinking about it right now. But is it worth waiting 2.5 hours for?Yes.

Reviews.Author: Paul D.
Reviews.Content: whenever i have a lucrative Lunch shift, there's a real good chance you'll , find me on a barstool here like a pimp.  The lobster roll is top 3 in boston, but if you can handle things that are better than you,  get the sliced veal and tuna tartar sandwich...yup....wine selection is impressive, beer selection is better than average...oyster selection is super-tight... its on the expensive side but taking a date here will get you laid...  only thing:  Neptune is best enjoyed during off hours, as its small, and waiting in line is bogus...

Reviews.Author: Aboud Y.
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: Beautiful restaurant that delivers the goods.  A nice place among all those other North Ender Ragu tourist traps.You come for the oysters, you leave happy.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl C.
Reviews.Content: Things to know (that I didn't) about Neptune Oyster:It's very small and cramped insideYou're going to wait to get a table (and not in the restaurant - find a coffee shop or some place near by)It's completely worth it!Started out with a dozen oysters; 6 West, 6 East.  The West Coast oysters are very plump and have a sweet, melony-taste to them.  The East Coast oysters have more of a briny taste to them, but very, very tasty as well.Also shared a Johnny Cake.  Simply amazing.  The smoked trout and caviar pair perfectly with the buttery cake.Finally, we shared a hot lobster roll.  As everyone else has said - worth every penny.  Loaded with lobster, buttered roll, and a nice side of fries to go along.All this came to about $80 (not including tip) and was a good amount for two people.  Will be going back soon!

Reviews.Author: Jessica T.
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for only two days and was on a mission to find the best raw oysters and lobster available to a FL foodie. I was willing to wait and willing to travel across the city for such a mission.We did just that. We waited until 9:30pm to sit down. Let me tell you it was well worth the wait, though.We started by splitting the lobster caprese salad. It was incredible! The perfect blend of chilled cooked lobster mixed with fresh basil, tomatoes, and fresh mozarella. It was an incredible combination of flavors and the perfect start to our dining experience! The service was fantastic. You would think by 9:30pm on a Wednesday the service would start to fall off, but that wasn't the case at all. Next we moved on to the raw oyster bar. The server did a great job recommending what types of oysters were most popular and did a fabulous job explaining why each one was so popular. We tried a few different types and for the life of me I can't remember their names, but they were all very tasty. We even ordered an extra 4 more to split.Great atmosphere, great food, great wine! I can't wait for my next trip to Boston to try something new at Neptune Oyster!

Reviews.Author: Quyen T.
Reviews.Content: 10 stars for clam chowder soup. Just perfect! 4 stars for hot lobster roll. The bread was nice and soft but soaked in too much butter.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food. Clam chowder was good, not great. It's a bit on the watery side, personally I prefer a thicker consistency. The oysters were phenomenal, very fresh. The lobster rolls (and fries) were excellent, as good as I've ever had. Get the hot lobster roll (butter instead of mayo)!

Reviews.Author: BY S.
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend brought me to this place because of its amazing reviews on Yelp. As a first timer in Boston, I had to order the chow-dah and it was indeed very good - thick, has bits of clams or stuff to bite; it was very appetizing.For entree, my mate ordered a plate of seared scallops while i settled for a salmon. I'm actually writing this review because of the absolutely out-of-this-world seared scallops. The scallops were rather big, not ginormous, and were seared perfectly that the outer layer was firm, beautiful in its caramelized color and very tasty to the bite. The insides of the scallops remained moist, juicy and perfectly cooked. It, was, just, so, good!My salmon was just so-so, in fact I've had better. So 1 star less in rating.

Reviews.Author: A M.
Reviews.Content: WARNING: I've been eating at this place ever since it opened. It was a nice little neighborhood place. The owner would say hi upon entering. Now he's not there that much, it's always crowded, and the staff doesn't appreciate your visit. Seems strange when there are 50 other restaurants within a few blocks. My last visit was not a good experience. They ran out of so many items on the menu in the middle of the day. I asked for a Geary's Beer. Nope. I asked for the Burger. Nope. I asked for the Tuna Sandwich. Nope. Finally I asked for the Cioppino. A good seafood stew on a cold winters day. I've had it before and it was fine. Not the same result last Friday. Long story short......after getting denied on three menu items and settling on the seafood stew....I GOT FOOD POISONING. Great way to spend NYE. I was up all night but not in a good way. Just want to warn you before you spend your hard earned cash in this fading star.

Reviews.Author: Alex F.
Reviews.Content: I give this restaurant 2 stars not because my evening at Neptune was unpleasant, but because "Meh. I've experienced better," exactly sums up my experience.Having lived in Boston for almost 5 years now, I've heard only good reviews about Neptune, both from food celebrities like Anthony Bourdain on the Food Network, and real life friends and coworkers. As such, I had high hopes when I suggested it to my mother who flew in to Boston to celebrate Mother's Day. Everything I'd heard about Neptune's was about the same: "it's worth the wait."I'd hoped that by arriving around 6, we'd beat the dinner rush, but even so we were told that the wait for a party of two was 45 minutes. We wandered the North End a bit, but spent a majority of our 1 hour and 15 minute wait huddled inside the Neptune entrance. When seated, we ordered a dozen Cherrystone clams, the hamachi ceviche, and the gold coast red snapper. My mother asked for a hot water with lemon, her customary drink order, but was informed that hot beverages were not an option. From what I could surmise, the beverage selection ranges from wine to water and nothing in between.There's no question that our food was absolutely delicious. The clams, with lemon and sauces, were delightful. The ceviche, though not what expected (it was really more along the lines of strips of fish with sauces laid on a plate) was lovely, and the red snapper was one of the tastiest dishes I've had in some time. I rate Neptune Oyster only 2 stars because the food, while delicious, did not make up for the exaggerated wait time, the cramped and noisy seating situation, the lack of choices, and the high prices. For an equally delicious meal at the same rate, I recommend the Oceanaire Room on Court St. right by Government Center.

Reviews.Author: Xiaorui H.
Reviews.Content: Pretty normal. Pretty expensive. Swordfish not so good, very dry inside. Lobster roll is also just so so. I would recommend go to Chinatown little peach restaurant and ask for "ma la shuang long" which tastes way 100 times better than this.

Reviews.Author: Shuchi K.
Reviews.Content: Food is excellent!!Service is as good as it can get!No reservations are allowed so it's a pain to go if you actually have something to do (like work or study). I've tried everything: sunday late afternoon, monday dinner, tuesday lunch. I was only able to get the Tuesday lunch one. Me and 3 friends got there at 1 and they told us it'd be a couple of hours wait. We were so hungry (and not so willing to walk or wait around) that we went to have lunch some Italian place near by and they called us that our table at Neptune was ready. Unfortunately, we could't get any main dishes and went straight for the oysters, which were sublime! We don't know much about oysters, so we let the waitress choose few to try amongst us. Price is good also. Problem with the place is that is so tiny that you're almost eating your neighbor's oysters!Good luck being able to eat the delicious food!

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: I don't usually flip for lobster, or lobster rolls. I don't like picking apart a lobster to eat it, and am not a huge fan of mayo (if only I'd been born Swedish). But Neptune Oyster? OMG heavenly. Take a lobster roll. Subtract the mayo and whatever lousy toppings are tossed on the equivalent of a hot dog bun. Replace with the following: a delicious, buttery bun and big and warm pieces of lobster. Top with large quantities of melted butter. My old officemate explored Boston to find the best lobster roll in Boston. This is it. And, in fact, in my opinion it's the best lobster roll in the world.PS. the decor is adorable, but you'll be so stoked about your food you probably won't notice it.

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: yes...Yes...YES! I finally treated myself to Neptune and I have a feeling that I'll be treating myself a lot more often for the rest of the summer. This past Tuesday my friends and I stopped out of the intense humidity to grab some beers and seafood. Our waitress recommended the oysters from Duxbury, which were delicious and almost sweet. I'm not an oyster person, but these tasted fresh and perfectly briny. We also tried the IC Neptune oysters from Wellfleet. After we washed the oysters down with some Harpoon Summer Ale, we quickly ordered 3 hot buttered lobster rolls, as there were only 4 left at this point. WOW. This is unlike any lobster roll I've ever had. The delicious potato roll was packed with succulent lobster and a decadent butter sauce. Although the concept is simple, their perfect execution (and the salty fries that come with it) made the dish one to remember. The service was wonderful; the waitress even offered to call us when our table was ready. I will be frequenting this place much more often from now on. FYI - get there early or call ahead for the wait time because they don't take reservations!

Reviews.Author: Velina L.
Reviews.Content: Small restaurant with bar seating and tables, lively but intimate atmosphere, and delicious food. The oysters were fresh and came in a good variety of choices, the cioppino arrived with a generous amount of fresh seafood (mussels, large shrimp, fish), saffron rice and a delicious slightly spicy broth, and the very large lobster roll was succulent, buttery, and also came with a very generous portion of the yummy crustacean. The side of fries it came with were also pretty good. In sum, wonderful place with lots of delicious food. Definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stood outside Neptune Oyster waiting for them to open at 11:30 am on a Friday, and it was sure worth it.  These tables fill up fast!Since my friend had never been here before, I told her she had to try the hot lobster roll.  She absolutely loved it.  I helped her finish off the tasty seasoned fries.Since I had eaten the lobster roll before, I decided to try the local seasonal fish, which on this day was a snapper served with Japanese mushrooms, fresh peas, fava beans, and baby spinach.  The fish was cooked perfectly, and the vegetables were divine.Neptune Oyster is definitely one of the best seafood restaurants in Boston.  I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Nick N.
Reviews.Content: Food: 5/5Service: 3/5Cleanliness: 3/5Decor & Style: 2/5Yes, I used Yelp to come here. the Lobster Roll was indeed amazing! I still would not come back because it was WAY too small and crowded. The slowness made the experience real bad. Still, must come here at least once for the Lobster roll. The clams and oysters were so-so.

Reviews.Author: Helen Z.
Reviews.Content: After reading all the hyped up reviews on Yelp, I knew I had to try this place. An old high school friend and I decided to try to beat the Friday night dinner rush and showed up at the restaurant at 5 PM. As soon as I walked in, I realized why the place is known for its wait - the restaurant is tiny! There were probably a maximum of 30-40 seats in the whole place, and this was with minimal open floor space. Regardless, I had heard too much about the lobster roll to walk away and the waitress was kind enough to take down our cell number so we didn't need to wait in the restaurant. About 10-15 minutes later, a surprisingly short wait, we got a call and headed back to be seated at the bar. First we started with a single oyster each - my friend got one from MA and I got one from NB (described as med size, med salt, with a champagne finish). Neither of us are really oyster connoisseurs so I can't say if the oysters were very different from the fresh ones I had just eaten at the Haymarket outside but unless my tastes become much more sophisticated, I probably won't be paying $2.70 for an oyster again. I had a small debate over whether I should try the cioppino but ultimately followed through with my original plan to order the hot butter lobster roll with a side of salad rather than fries. The very first bite was DELICIOUS, meaty, buttery, warm, and good. However, I have to question the $25 price. I haven't had many lobster rolls so I'm not sure how this one compares but I hardly think that substituting mayo with butter and heating the roll a bit should constitute a doubling in price. Adding butter generally makes everything taste good - so I wonder how difficult this actually is to make with the right ingredients. Also, the butter seeped into the bread and made the bottom half a bit soggy. Perhaps toasting the bread would help with this problem. Finally, the salad that came with it had a pretty presentation of lettuce leaves arranged as a flower but the vinaigrette was overwhelmingly salty.All that aside, I still really enjoyed my experience at Neptune Oyster and was very sad to come to the end of my lobster roll. For those of you who love fresh seafood cooked well and aren't afraid to pay a premium for it, I have no doubt that Neptune Oyster can provide.

Reviews.Author: Jenn B.
Reviews.Content: Tip - There will be wait Thursday - Sunday nights, especially in the summer time. But it's worth it. Leave your name and number, then go have a drink across the street at Vito's. Wait for a text or phone call letting you know when your table is ready. To start order a bowl of muscles for the table and save some of the amazing bread to soak up the incredible broth.  You'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Author: Elizabethe A.
Reviews.Content: This is what I had:A few random oysters: sorry I don't remember their names or even where they were from. The point is that they were all delicious, fresh, and different. Some are quite pricey but you kind of have to accept that when you go out for some really fresh seafood.Lobster Roll: Freaking awesome. I had the cold with mayonaisse because I feel that it is the right way to eat a lobster roll. Besides I've heard that the hot butter one is just ok. This is also pricey ($25) but it's completely worth it. You probably get a whole lobster or two in one sandwich.Fries: surprisingly good and went well with the lobster roll. Not too greasy and had a good crunch.Peach Bellini: Really good. I could barely taste the prosecco. Just peachy bubbly goodness and that's the way I prefer it.Atmosphere: adorable little place. Sitting at the bar is fun and even though it's tucked away in a little alley way, it's really quite classy.

Reviews.Author: Anthony C.
Reviews.Content: Wow. How had I not been here before? Neptune Oyster is possibly the most perfect spot for this here Yelper.Located on the edge of the North End (Boston's Little Italy), this place is easy to get to, but not easy to park close by - we had to valet the car at a different restaurant and walk a couple blocks to the tiny but wonderful Neptune.Walk through heavy curtains keeping the cold out, and then through another door, into simple seafood paradise. With only a few high tables and the bar, Neptune seems to crowd easily, but that's part of the fun. If you're a small party (we were three) and it's full, you might make nice with your fellow diners sitting at the same table, but don't fret: these patrons are Boston's desirables, so you're in good company. The atmosphere buzzes with either excited or already satisfied customers and proud, sociable, attentive servers.Everything on the menu looks delicious, and the daily specials are not to be missed, so our table summoned 18 oysters, two orders of the lobster spaghettini (Monday's special), one order of seared scallops atop braised pork shoulder, and an order of fried clams, in that order. I could rant and rave about the flavors for pages, but for brevity's sake I'll simply mention that I haven't had better, well, anything! I could return and have the exact same meal time and again, never tiring of the deliciousness.To quench one's thirsty cravings, Neptune serves up some of my favorite beer, which can pretty much only be found in Massachusetts: the Whale's Tale Pale Ale from Cisco Brewery, which is located on a favorite island, Nantucket. While the ale pairs well with oysters and fried clams, the spaghettini and scallops called for something deep, red, and decanted. Though surprisingly small, and not as Italian as one might expect, the wine list sports some decent bottles, and the reserve list (called "Pearls") is, while equally limited, aptly named. After trying for a Brunelo, then a Barbaresco, there was finally a Barolo in stock. Not what I'd initially wanted, but who can complain about a Barolo? A Pearl indeed.See you next time, Neptune - I hope it's soon.

Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: The food is excellent.  I'll get that out of the way first.  Everything I had was great.  Service was fast, efficient and friendly.now the question is...is it worth the wait....I don't know.  I have to believe there are other restaurants just as good that don't have as long a wait.  I was there by myself and the wait was 1 hour...group of 2 was 2 hours...groups of 3 or more were being told 3.5 hours.

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: A very delicious raw bar indeed.  Now, this is a very small space.  Smaller than Taro Sushi even. You're literally squeezing between north and south oriented bars tools and seats just to get to the tables, bathrooms and exit. No reservations are taken and my guess is you'll be playing musical chairs like one plays musical pizzas at DiFara in Brooklyn.  On to the food.  Each oyster is intense and distinct in flavor.  The kitchen food is a different story, it's not horrible but IMO it's too expensive for what it is.  Creative but certainly way too mellow (ie bland).  Oysters seem to go for an average of a $1.50 a pop no matter where they're from.  Pretty damn good for what you get.  Follow those with a Whale Tail Pale Ale and you're doing well.So, between the very briny oysters and equally briny beer, the ambiance and antique decor, the lack of bad attitude from the servers, all this more than makes up for the space and kitchen food hassle.  In fact all of this combined has a nice calming effect.  Something very rare in a city where it's nowhere near the population of the Big Apple and yet you have less elbow room and certainly crazier drivers. I just may be able to tolerate all you Pepperidge Farm soundin' , Boston Red Sox lovin' bean eaters after all..

Reviews.Author: Amy Y.
Reviews.Content: There's almost no point that I should write in this 5 star review of this restaurant (how many restaurants have 4.5 stars from almost 400 reviews?)...besides to give myself a peace of mind that I've added my two cents onto this page. Neptune is hands down my favorite seafood place in Boston. This is the only place that I am willing to wait for a hour to be seated, and to feel lucky, that I am sitting at a table and at not the bar.  If I could eat shellfish all day here, I would. (And if I had the money...). Many choices from the raw bar.... and all very fresh. If you come here for lunch, get the warm butter lobster roll. Sooo much scrumptious lobster in a bun. Each time I order the roll, I look at the plate and say "Oh, wow, so much food, I won't be able to finish it this time," but without fail, I devour it like a gluttonous beast. Everytime. It's a phenomenon that continues to baffle me. If I'm feeling healthy, I get the bib lettuce salad instead of the the fries. The scallops, an entree recently added earlier this year, are seared to perfection and taste phenomenal on top of a creative bed of greens, pomengranate, and duck confit. The foie-wich is one of my favorite appetizers. But beware, it is deceivingly filling, so be sure to share. Each bite is heavenly...The only thing I do not recommend is the oyster burger. It is quite underwhelming for a specialty seafood burger, as the oyster becomes completely lost in the mess of cheddar, garlic mayo, meat, and batter. It's like a treasure hunt on your palette... with sadly no prize in the end. All in all, I always look forward to dining here. I like how they have a small, consistent, set menu with daily specials. If I have any room left after dinner, I always try to grab a ricotta florentine cannoli at Mike's Pastry. Mm you can never have too much buttery, cheesy, artery clogging goodness. Neptune does not disappoint!

Reviews.Author: Ella B.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, but pricey!  We went on a Monday to avoid the long lines out the door and was seated quickly.  We ordered 6 oysters on the half shell and they were good -- but I think Island Creek may have shucked them a little better -- Island Creek can def. give Neptune's a run for their money!  We also ordered a lobster roll - warm, comes with fries.  Clam chowder - made to order, 2 glasses of Chardonnay (not on the menu, you have to ask), total for each person including tip was $53.  A bit pricey lunch, but it was fun and great ambiance in the North End. Very small location -- not good for groups, accepts credit cards.

Reviews.Author: Courtney Y.
Reviews.Content: Neptune's definitely lives up to its hype. The one thing that I did a lot of research on before coming to Boston was finding the BEST lobster roll.I was told by many that this place has the best one, so around 2:00 on a Friday we walked up to this little restaurant Neptune. The place was packed and the waitress told us it would be a 45 min wait... Whaaa?? Its not even lunch time.. We weren't even hungry so the wait wasn't a big deal at all. So, I gave her our phone number and we decided to walk around North End. We left and grabbed a Cannoli at Mikes Bakery and only 20min after we placed walked into Neptunes we got the call. Your table is ready! Yay, so like I said we weren't THAT hungry so all we ordered was 1 hot lobster sandwich (to split between the three of us) and three Kumomoto Oysters. The Oysters were delicious, nice and creamy w/ a ton of flavor.. Now the Hot Lobster Roll was definitely the best Lobster Roll I've ever had. The bun is soft and butter and the lobster sooo fresh tasting. Even the fries that come w/ the roll are delicious. My sister and cousin who went to another restaurant to try their lobster roll said it didn't even compare. So my recommendation is to go to Neptunes, get a lobster roll and don't feel bad for paying $25.00 for a sandwich. It's definitely worth it!

Reviews.Author: Jared O.
Reviews.Content: Never again!  Try Legal Seafoods Harborside, Island Creek Oyster Bar, or B&G Oysters...you will be better served.We experienced non-existent service and when we expressed that our server was argumentative, confrontational, and standoffish.  The customer is not always right but in this case we are!  Basic points of service were ignored and it really counts because the space is so small that real estate is at a premium.  "Basic" meaning clearing the menus off of the table, table maintenance, water refills, selling us more cocktails, and a quality check.  There wasn't a manager there and I've made several attempts to reach out to the owner, Jeff to no avail.  It seems that they are relying on a captive audience and don't really care...fair enough.They don't take reservations, wait times vary, parking is terrible in the North End and the space itself is small and cramped.

Reviews.Author: Eleana C.
Reviews.Content: Oh my god, I love this place. Everything was so incredibly fresh, and though the wait can get slightly crazy, the restaurant is located in the Italian North End area so there is plenty to walk around and see while waiting for them to call you. CC brought me here because I announced that I wanted to sustain myself on nothing but lobster rolls the entire time I was in Boston (and I practically did).However, we ordered the fried Ipswich clams, razor clams from the raw bar and cherrystone clams from the raw bar. Entrees consisted of a New England lobster bake (entire baked lobster with an ear of corn and sausage) and a lobster roll (warm with butter) and fries. Everything was swoon-worthily delicious and easily the best restaurant we ate at during the trip. Just thinking of the cherrystone's fresh brineyness makes me want to go back and order a dozen. For myself. CC can get his own.

Reviews.Author: Marcus L.
Reviews.Content: BEST. SEAFOOD. EVER. After reading the reviews on Chowhound and Yelp, I concluded that Neptune Oyster will on my list of things to eat in Boston. All of their seafood is so fresh and they give you a generous amount. We ordered the Triton Plateau (lobster salad, crab salad, raw clams, oysters, shirmp cocktail), Razor Clams, Clam Chowder and a Lobster Roll hot with butter. The Triton Plateau was more than enough to sample all of the fresh seafood that Neptune Oyster has to offer. The clumps of lobster and crab in the salad were huge. Oysters and clams were freshly shucked and tasted like they were fresh from the Boston Harbor. The shrimp cocktail were the biggest shrimp I have seen, which had the sweet taste of fresh shrimp. The Clam Chowder was very flavorful, but a little but too water for my taste. And finally, the Lobster Roll hot with butter. The fresh toasted roll was stuffed with a large amount of huge chucks of lobster and topped with hot butter. It was also served with season French fries, which were also delicious. Everything here was simply amazing. The price of everything was definitely worth it for the the amount of fresh seafood you get. Neptune Oyster is another place I would always go to whenever I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Renee M.
Reviews.Content: I am not an expert on lobster rolls and don't claim to be  (I think I've maybe had 1 other in my life) but this lobster roll was AWESOME. I got it cold with mayo and it was fantastic. The mayo didn't overpower the huge chunks of lobster as I thought it might- it was light and delicious. Duxbury oysters are awesome. The ones from Neptune Oyster were no different.Atmosphere here is quaint and cozy. In short, I loved Neptune Oyster.

Reviews.Author: Christine S.
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite sure how this place maintains such highly rated reviews. First off, it's ridiculously crowded and takes no reservations making you think it's THAT good. Well, let me tell you: I've had better.Oysters: I guess a good thing about this place is that they offer a variety of quality oysters. I tried 3 different types are they were delicious. However, I know I can buy it at a fish market, shuck it myself and it'll still taste the same. Clam chowder: The soup was a bit thin but the clams to soup ratio was good. I liked that the clam chunks were good sized but I wasn't blown away by the soup as a whole.Lobster roll: Basically lobster chunks in a "butter" roll. I've had way better. In my opinion the roll is very important and the one they served was not buttery or soft enough. I can boil a lobster myself and buy my own bread to make my own roll and I know I'd enjoy it more. Lobster Spaghetti: This was decent. They put a lot of lobster in the spaghetti so there was no way you could forget that this was a LOBSTER dish. Overall I was quite disappointed. I wish I spent my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Toni M.
Reviews.Content: This place has great seafood- super fresh and cooked perfectly.  They even put an oyster on a burger WTF?!? but it works! The place itself is small, and you may be sitting on top of the people next to you, but hey its Boston make friends.Its the North End so there will be a line when you go, but leave your number with the host and they'll call you when your table is ready (so go when you've got some time to kill).

Reviews.Author: Daisy S.
Reviews.Content: small but they'll take your cell number and call you while you get a drink in the neighborhood

Reviews.Author: Eddie Y.
Reviews.Content: "The gods of the sea have spoken"I love fresh shellfish and when I vacation in New England I simply cannot have it often enough.We have passed Neptune Oyster on many occasions traveling through the North End in search of the Italian restaurants but this time we decided to stop in. The wait is always forty-five to sixty minutes and you can always check out the many little shops in and around Neptune while you wait, as I can not stand waiting in line and in this case waiting out on the street in front of the restaurant because this is a VERY small place.The interior is very tight and if not sitting at the bar you sit at a long communal table but the surrounding conversation is usually very entertaining. The one page menu features the seafood they are noted for and the wine list is very extensive. Now let's eat!We started with the PEI mussels and OMG this was the most fantastic preparation of mussels ever. Cooked with toasted garlic, fennel, trebbiano wine, sausage, caraway seeds and cream. Way beyond amazing, I almost picked up the bowl and drank. Ask for extra bread to sop up the juices.We also had a wonderful fresh selection. Check the black board to see what came in on the boats today.On to the mains, I ordered the North End Cioppino and Robert ordered "hamburger"! I can never understand the ordering of meat in a seafood restaurant but alas it came to the table topped with fried oysters!! The Cioppino was a wonderful seafood stew a little on the spicy side with lots of grilled seafood and was amazingly fresh and delicious served with saffron rice.With so many other seafood selections to choose from, a think a return trip to Neptune Oyster is a must.(July 11, 2008 Friday)

Reviews.Author: Jack W.
Reviews.Content: I rely on Yelp for great reviews and Neptune Oyster was perhaps one of the best pointers I've received from the site.Before I had an oyster at Neptune, I didn't even like oysters.  My girlfriend ordered a few and when they were brought out to us, I said something along the lines of, "enjoy, those are all yours".She convinced me to give one a try and after that we ordered two more rounds.  They were some of the most delicious things I have ever tasted.  We got one of each oyster, each with a beautiful, unique flavor.  My favorites were the ones with the mineral finish.We also ordered a tomato and oyster soup - fresh, flavorful, and delicious.  Angel got the skate which was stunning.  Even leftover it was fantastic.Before we left Boston for the weekend, we came back for more.  We still talk about our trip to Neptune and will surely go back.

Reviews.Author: Do K.
Reviews.Content: My former roomie who goes to Harvard loves this place and took me and our other friends while we were visiting her.Oysters are FRESH and SO tasty!! YUM, YUM, YUM! between $2.5-3 per oyster - if it wasn't so pricey, I would've eaten tons. Maybe it's a good thing so that I not as much in danger of health risks for eating raw, uncooked food (I do read pay attention to warning labels)... But, life's too short anyways, right?Lobster sandwich - $25 BUT YUUUMMMMMM - Oo, nice buttery (not too overly though), chunky lobster inside a tasty roll. My former roomie raved about it and I do have to say, I was a bit skeptical even though I trust her taste. I didn't want to be disappointed, you know? it certainly met my expectations! Goodness in my mouthness. :) It comes with delicious fries that we couldn't stop eating even though we were full. Didn't finish but ate a lot of it.My friend's appetitzer - octopus w/ polenta ($13) was tasty as well. My other friend's louis (crab) salad ($17) was also tasty - they know how to do seafood right - fresh and seasoned well enough to make it tasty but not overpower the freshness.You might think it's a bit on the pricer end but worth the quality! The portions aren't actually tiny either. I looked at other diner's plates and quantity seemed good. The salad may seem a bit pricey for those who values quanitity though. Nevertheless, I think whatever you get, yYou won't be disappointed with your meal! You taste buds will thank you and you will leave the restaurant smiling. :)Service was wonderful - waiter was attentive, filled out water as needed, had good recommendations,

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: I have always HATED raw oysters ever since I was young. Especially of the fact that oysters and all filter feeders tend to trap pathogens and harmful debris that can't be washed  off. But this place showed me the light and I am now a huge fan of raw oysters. The food was wonderful and the service was fantastic. It can't get any better than this place.Recommendations- Due to the price, get the oysters and come here for a snack rather than a full lunch.- The lobster is delicious and I would recommend it to anyone- Drink lots of water because some oysters are salty.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Come early, and come hungry!Hauling my fellow travellers to Boston's North End for dinner at 5:30p.m. was no easy feat. Little did they know of the long lines that were to come. We must have just beat the rush as the hostess informed us of only a 45 minute wait, she took my cell phone number so that we could wander the area. Left to our own devices, we wandered in and out of the various shops and bakeries in the area. Thank goodness the wait was only 30 minutes since we quickly got into the habit of purchasing a few baked goods at every single bakery (that's another review).After returning to the restaurant loaded with baked goods, we only loitered outside for a few moments before the hostess called me on my cell phone. I have to admit, I'm still impressed they called even though I gave them a phone number that was long distance.Seated at the bar, we started with a selection of 6 different oysters of varying sizes. They also left the order sheet on the counter so that we would be able to read of the different flavors of each oyster. I have to say the Wellfleet's were by far my favourite and warranted another round.No trip to Neptune's is complete without the hot lobster roll which put the decent lobster roll I had at Legal Seafood the day before to shame. Loaded into a buttery brioche bun, the almost whole lobster was tossed in butter with a side of yummy french fries. Fresh oysters and and hot lobster rolls make Neptune one of my best meals of the year. And I didn't even have room for dessert!

Reviews.Author: Sharon C.
Reviews.Content: Ask the servers for their best raw bar selection of the day.  They know what just came in and what gets the best reviews by their customers, so it makes sense to use them to enhance your dining experience.Don't be shy about sitting elbow to elbow with your fellow diners here--space is limited, and there's no shame in sharing a table if it's just the two of you.

Reviews.Author: D. L.
Reviews.Content: Do it. Put your name in and wait - around the corner with a coffee or a beer. They'll call you. And then you'll have the most fantastic lobster roll in the world. I like 'em cold (the hot one, although covered in but'try deliciousness, seemed a little tough compared to the cold roll). Yes, it is indeed worth the $25, and no, I am neither a tourist nor a yuppie. It is indeed worth the price because the mound of lobster, lightly coated in mayo with a hint of cracked pepper is enough to share. And when does that ever happen? Usually I'm waving my fork as a weapon to keep the fast eaters at bay while I attempt to savor what little flakes of lobster come in a standard lobster roll. Not the case at Neptune; their standard is as high as the moon. Huge chunks of knuckle and claw meat and no silly filler (celery, I'm lookin' at you). Absolute heaven. Absolutely worth the wait.I am compelled to add that, having eaten several times my weight in oysters for a dime or a quarter apiece when I lived down south, I get a little riled up when a joint has the nerve to charge $2.50, $2.75, even $2.90 for a single, local oyster! Really? REALLY?? Neptune's oysters are great, super fresh and taste as described on the menu. But if those prices make your eyes pop out of your head, just skip them and go for one of the fantastic appetizers, like the ceviche on it's bed of cilantro & grilled jalapeno puree. Also, and the following is not the restaurant's fault, but some of the patrons are super rude, attempting to cut in line or butting into a conversation between waiting patrons and the waitress who doubles as hostess. Keep your elbows out and your wits about you. Service was smiling and stellar. I have no idea how they coordinate themselves in that slim space behind the bar when the restaurant is slammed from open to close, but I applaud them for it.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Originally I wanted to go to Union Oyster House but after reading the reviews here on yelp, Hubs and I decided to go to Neptune instead.  We were not disappointed!  We had the Triton Plateau and it  was more than enough for the 2 of us.  I would give it mmmmaybe a quarter of a star less if it were possible.  I could have used  a chunk of bread, but that's just me.

Reviews.Author: Alice S.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place really does live up to the hype.Small, crowded, impossible to get a seat at a normal meal time, but absolutely worth it.  Call me a follower, but how could I come here and not try the hot lobster roll that so many yelpers before me have salivated over?  Huge, sweet, succulent pieces of lobster stuffed in a toasted bun soaked in an amazingly addicting lobster-butter sauce.  Heaven in a bun.  No joke.However, don't stop at just the lobster roll.  I'm not even a huge fan of raw oysters, but the oysters here are the best of the best.  As fresh as can be.  Also, for people who are not oyster conoisseurs, the oyster menu includes a description for each type of oyster, which is incredibly helpful (especially when you've devoured all the oysters you first ordered and are ready for a second helping).  This place would earn 5 stars in my book if only it was easier to get into.  Make sure to get there early.  And even if you fail to avoid a wait, don't give up on this place.  I promise, you won't regret it once you taste the food.What to order:- maine lobster roll, hot with butter- any of the raw oysters

Reviews.Author: Ashley C.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is small, but it packs in the crowds and the flavors.  When coming to Boston, I knew that this place was on my list.  We planned accordingly and came for an early dinner at about 5 pm.  The place was slammed but we were lucky enough to get a bar seat.  This place is small - maybe they can fit 40 people in at a time between the tables and the bar.  It is not a place for large parties and I would say 2 people is ideal to avoid an even longer wait. Neptune oyster certainly held up to the hype.  We tried three different kinds of Oysters and I the local oysters were amazing and packed with flavor.  We also split the clam chowder.  It was good, but not your traditional chowder - it is much thinner.  It is probably the only thing I would skip the next time, but that is in part to make more room for the delicious food. We had to have the lobster roll. You had a choice of hot or cold and we went with the cold.  The lobster roll comes out and the lobster is just falling off of the roll - it is that packed with lobster.  The roll was nicely toasted with a little bit of butter.  It was meaty enough to support the lobster, but still light so it didn't feel heavy or dominate the lobster.  The lobster came with fries that were freshly cut and nicely salted.  Neptune also has a very nice wine list.  We had a pinot grigio that paired great with the seafood.  Our waiter was very helpful in picking the perfect bottle for our tastes.  They certainly know their wine and seafood.  The only complaint about the service is that it was sometimes slow.  I can only guess it is slow because they are always busy and can only pack so many people behind the bar.And dessert? I have no idea because  I didn't get that far.  Instead, I choose to have another round of oysters for dessert.  This is very important for someone who loves sweets and chocolate.  So yummy!  Now that I finished writing this, I am hungry and want oysters.

Reviews.Author: Dave C.
Reviews.Content: How is it that I have been coming to Boston for almost 2 years and that I have not ventured into this joint?Oh yes thats right... terrible parking, extreme long lines and annoying Boston mass transit (i am looking at you T)But I was wrong to have blown this place off.Came here at an off hour 2pm and it was STILL packed, atleast there was no wait.The oysters here are very fresh.  I like how they give you an info card for you to order...informing you on such things as... salt level, size, finishing taste so you know what your eating.The mussel cooked with curry sauce was awesome.  Curry was subtle enough to still allow the taste of the mussel to come out.The lobster roll was just so so.  A bit too buttery if that is possible as the bread was soggy.  I've had equivalent or better in Maine, but whatever that is neither here nor there.The star of the show was the ciopinno.  As the waitress brought it out she told us to "Get ready for some deliciousness" and she was telling the truth.  Everything about it was right from the saffron rice to the perfectly cooked fish, lobsters etc...with just enough heat.  I made the mistake of allowing my fiance to 'taste' my dish as her taste ended up being HALF of all the goodness.  Def recommend adding the lobster to the dish.  FYI: Come at an off hour and have a great time.  Best for groups of 2-4.

Reviews.Author: SASSON S.
Reviews.Content: Pretty disappointed for a place that got such good Yelp reviews. Visited Boston for the first time and was looking to get our fill of seafood on our last day in the city today. We were in the area and the wait time for 2 was only 25 minutes during lunch hour so we dropped in.Clam chowder: Soup was very runny with a strong butter flavor. Sparse on the clams. Potatoes were not cooked through...almost crunchy.Shrimp cocktail: Fresh, but the sweetness and succulence were missing. Shrimp was huge and so thick that it was like eating a steak. Raw clams and oysters: They were all very fresh but just not as good as expected.We did enjoy their seasonal beer. Didn't get the name of it though.

Reviews.Author: Alexander M.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is FAR superior to B&G for many reasons.This north end restaurant  iz small but worth the wait.  i havent been for sometime, but every once and a while when I have the urge to eat the freshest seafood...i think of Neptune Oyster.top 5 reasons to go...1. the staff rules.2. the raw bar is EXCELLENT.3. great cocktails.4. their lobster roll and oyster po'boy.5. nice location (except for parking).

Reviews.Author: kwala t.
Reviews.Content: I think the fact that we went on a rainy night increased our chances for getting a table for 5 without much wait on a friday.  It was crowded, but we only waited a few minutes to sit down.  I take this as something of a feat from other yelp reviews.On to the food, the consensus was mostly delicious and a little pricey, but worth going back for a special occasion.  The extensive raw bar was delightfully fresh and well-priced, a definite treat.  The clam chowder was good - much lighter and more complex than the usual thick and hearty style, but perhaps not worth the $11 price tag.  Another appetizer, the grilled squid over polenta, looked fantastic and could serve as a main entree if you're not too hungry.The trout on the menu right now is wonderful - crispy corn crust, generous portion of perfectly cooked fish, and a light but sweet blueberry sauce as a contrast, enhancing the asparagus and whipped parsnip accompaniments, as well as crab hush puppies.  The cioppino looked decent, although being from San Francisco, I have very high standards, and a friend who got the lobster roll (not surprisingly) raved.  I was sad the lobster clam bake was priced so high ($55!), way out of my range for a casual dinner with friends.Nice wine list, good beers, and a pleasant experience.  The food wasn't mind-blowing, but it was incredibly fresh and well-made, and the prices were a little higher than expected, but not a complete rip-off.  Definitely a worthy option for high quality seafood, just keep your expectations reasonable and your wallet stacked.

Reviews.Author: Tim W.
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent. I went with my girlfriend on a Friday night and we could not have asked for a better meal. The oysters were extremely fresh and tasty and the entrees were amazing. We had the lobster roll and the cod (which was the special of the day). The lobster roll was good although a bit too buttery for my taste. The cod was perfect. My only complaint is that it is small and you can't make reservations. So we got there around 6:10 and got the last two seats at the bar. Otherwise who knows how long we would of had to wait. So get there early if you plan on eating.

Reviews.Author: Stacey W.
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a few days in Boston to visit a friend who transplanted there from Chicago.  She lives in the North End so we consulted Yelp to find a good restaurant nearby and we found Neptune Oyster.  We had a party of three and the wait was about two hours when we got there so we gave out phone number and headed to a little bar down the street.  Once we were seated we ordered oysters as an appetizer.  I'm no oyster connoisseur but these were super fresh and delicious.  I ordered the lobster stroganoff and everyone else got the famous lobster roll.  It was all delicious.  Unfortunately, the service left something to be desired though.  Our server was often short with us and wasn't every attentive. Overall a great place.  I'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca H.
Reviews.Content: One of my overall most enjoyable meals ever--both for atmosphere, company, and of course, phenomenal food. I've been twice, last spring and this past Monday to have an almost identical meal. Sometimes, I revisit the meal mentally--yum. Here's the rundown:Atmosphere: Tiny--fits about 12 at the bar and maybe 30 more in restaurant, but they do that great thing where they take your cell number and call you when space opens up. There's a cozy coffee shop a few doors down that you can wait at. The restaurant itself has a bit of an at the docks feel decorated with posters of various kinds of fish. Oysters: first place I tasted oysters and now hooked. The raw bar has both local and those from father afield. Sitting at the bar you can watch them shuck the oysters and watch passerbys peer into the restaurant to stare at them. Fresh and served with lemon and a cocktail sauce topped with a bit of garlic in truffle oil--yum.Neptune on Piggyback: fried oysters topping pork belly. The whole meal was so not kosher, but so, so delicious. Scallops: delicious scallops-perfectly seared on the outside. They come on a base of potato puree topped with a bed of brussels sprouts, chanterelles, and some more pork belly. Lobster Roll: get it hot with butter--it practically melts in your mouth. This is the lobster roll to measure others by. The previous time I went, we had the clams as well, brought on accident, which they comped. Also, delicious. Only negatives: no dessert (sad) and longish wait times (the 36 hours in Boston NYTimes article may have made it worse, but I did get seated immediately last time--at 6:30 on Monday night).Otherwise, when in Boston, grab your besties, order a glass of prosecco and dig into some phenomenal seafood.

Reviews.Author: Catie C.
Reviews.Content: Cold lobstah rolls are everywhere. For a warm, buttery lobstah roll, Neptune is where to go!Warning: Do Not chow down on this if you freak out on butter! I love to dunk my lobstah meat in butter every time I order a steamed lobster so this is perfect for me. A bun filled with lobster meat and butterized. Heart attack heaven!

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: I like to put up 5 star reviews for places that are exactly what I expect, and then they throw in something extra. 'Neptune Oysters: Go expecting an extremely small seafood restaurant that caters to clients with quite a bit of money to blow but don't feel like going to a pretentious restaurant.Charlotte and I were there to get a few oysters (she had only tried them once before, and was told to swallow it whole without chewing... kind of like funneling a 50 dollar bottle of wine, wtf?). Entering I wasn't expecting the place to be that nice or that small, but it is both. We sat down at the bar and ordered a beer. As we looked over the oyster list the food that came out of the kitchen looked incredible.They had an amazing selection, and really simple but descriptive explanations of each on a sheet that resembled a Sushi menu. The prices where what you'd expect at 2-4 dollars an oyster.The order came pretty quick, and the oysters were superbly fresh. I was also given back the order form along with the oysters so I could know which ones we were eating. This was a hugely appreciated, and in my experience unprecedented. I really liked having my cheat sheet as we tried each one.At 27.62 for two beers and 6 oysters it was pricy; but compared to what people around us were ordering, this was a remarkably small order. Neptune clinched its fifth star when my date pointed out that the server wasn't rushing us, even though the place was packed and they would shortly be needing the seats. I was trying to pay before we had finished our beers... the server laughed, and told me to relax.For Oyster lovers, this is a must as far as places to stop. Go on off peak hours because the place is tiny.

Reviews.Author: Melissa M.
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I recently spent a weekend in Boston. Aside from being eager to see the city (which none of us had ever been to) and seeing the sites, we were extremely excited to eat some fresh Seafood. In doing research for what sites to visit and restaurants to eat at, I found that Neptune Oyster came highly recommended.We arrived in Boston Friday afternoon tired, grumpy, and starvin like Marvin as we endured traffic (which was worse due to the rain), getting lost, and some car trouble along the way. The first thing we decided to do was eat. With my spreadsheet of Yelped places to eat in hand, we headed to Neptune Oyster. It's a small place and gets crowded easily. There was no room for us to wait in the restaurant either, but for our 30-45 min. wait we just browsed the shops around the area. We didn't have to worry about staying close since they took down our number and called us once our table was ready (this was awesome and I wish more places would use this method!).We ordered a dozen West Coast Oysters from the raw bar. The names escape me at the moment but the 2 kinds we ordered were delicious and extremely fresh! Then came our main meal - we each decided on ordering the Hot Maine Lobster Roll ($25). At first I was undecided between ordering it cold (served with Mayo) or hot (served with Butter). We asked the waitress what most people order and she said it was pretty much split down the middle and just depends on what you're in the mood for. I finally joined my 2 girls in their hot orders. The Lobster Roll was AMAZING to say the least. It came out on a toasted roll with large heaping pieces of fresh, juicy, delicious Lobster falling out of the roll. The butter made the roll that much more enjoyable! It also came with a side of fries. We were stuffed after our meal and that Lobster Roll turned our whole trip around! If you take a trip to  Boston, you HAVE, HAVE, HAVE to eat at Neptune Oyster and order their HOT Maine Lobster Roll. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Author: Gianguido G.
Reviews.Content: Lobster, oysters, lobster, oysters, lobster lobster..... prosecco!!!! Yes, I would say as good as it gets!!!! A Boston MUST visit place. I did it twice on my New England summer tour :) at the beginning and at the end. Lobster bun!!! Wooooow!! Served warm with butter and skin fries. Just so yummy you can't get enough. Lobster caprese. Triple wooooooooow!!! Tender steamed lobster with great greens, tomatoes, bufala mozzarella with a superb pesto dressing. More than perfect for a hot summer day lunch. Of course, get started with raw oysters!!! D E L I C I O U S!!!! after all it is an oyster bar. Get a glass.... or two of prosecco wine. Perfect companion for this food. Mmmmmmmm!!!  Really amazing. The fried oysters are dreamy also. Meaty and crunchy. Perfectly cooked. Yesssssssss :)The place is quite small expect to wait a bit, but totally worth. You can have a walk and an aperitif in the charming Italian neighborhood. Service is great and very fast. Perfect for dinner or a fast juicy lunch.
