You can not say you visited Boston if you did not stop here!!!Can be pricey... but way less than any other place outside New England. Two words: FRESHNESS, DELICIOUSNESS :)

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: ***updated to 5 stars****Went again cause the hot-w/-butter lobster roll was calling my name, man, I love that thing!  Also had the mussels which were amaaaazing. The spicy, hot, red curry broth was addicting and the grilled buttery bread tasted sooo good dipped in the sauce. Plus, the service this time was so much better, so that's why they get 5 stars!**************************************************­************************

Reviews.Author: Dia V.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll is *delicious*...the lobster meat is perfectly moist and flavorful. Ask for a little dish of extra melted butter. ;) The side of fries it comes with are honestly some of the best fries I've ever had too. I hate when restaurants skimp out on putting love into the sides, but Neptune does it right! I also had a variety of raw oysters...some good and some gross but I guess it all depends on personal taste right? They were all definitely fresh.The place is SMALL and gets really packed. The hostess can take down your number down and give you a call when a table is ready. That gives you some time to grab a cannoli (the BEST ever) from Mike's Pastry just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Author: Adam C.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite restaurant in New England. Yes, the wait is going to be agonizing on any weekend night. But you give your cell number and can walk around for a while so who cares - just don't make other plans for later, and let's be honest this is probably the highlight of the night regardless.  I have to mention that the hostesses at Neptune are patient and unfailingly professional in dealing with cranky, hungry people in a tiny space. I just don't think the atmosphere would be even close if it were Legal Sea Food-sized so the trade-off is worth it. And the food, "worth it" would be an understatement. Good selection at the raw bar, served flawlessly at surprisingly-not-that-bad prices.  All the various crudo and other specials of the day hit the mark.  The hot lobster roll is, in my opinion, the no.1 singular dish to recommend to an out-of-towner on their first day in Boston. Neptune deserves its religious following. I hope it never changes.

Reviews.Author: Anita C.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster opens at 11.30 on the weekends.  My friend and I were here at 11.15 and there was already a line.  They do not make reservations, so if you want to dine here for lunch on a weekend, get here early!!!We ordered about 11 different kinds of oysters and clams.  I'm not a big fan of raw clams apparently, but I loved all of the oysters except for the one that has a hint of cucumber taste.  The thing that "made" this restaurant was their warm lobster roll.  It was to die for and quite orgasmic!!!  Also, keep in mind that I went into this restaurant not liking lobster AT ALL!!  I usually find it very tough and chewy and have a horrible after taste in my mouth.  This definitely changed my opinion of lobster.  It was super soft and tender and you hardly have to chew the lobster meat.  Also, I was expecting a little bit of meat on a lot of bread, but it was quite the opposite.  The sandwich was literally overflowing with lobster meat!!!  I want to go again and order my own lobster roll, as I had to share it with a friend.  :( Next time...

Reviews.Author: Margarita Y.
Reviews.Content: If it's your first time, try all the raw oysters! My favorites are Ninigret from Charlestown, RI & Tatamagouche from Willapa Bay, WA.  They have a really nice clean finish. It tasted amazing. The hot Maine Lobster Roll was meh. I felt like I could have made that myself.

Reviews.Author: Anne M.
Reviews.Content: Mama Mia!  Me want another lobster roll!I'm not a 'lobster person' - in fact, though I enjoy it, I rarely eat it and really haven't had that much in my entire life.  However, purely based on the high praise for these things at Neptune Oyster, I felt I just had to order one on my first trip to Boston.  Me and Mister made our way from our hotel in Back Bay over to Neptune our first night in town (a decently-long, but nice walk).  We turned onto the street, and found the quaint little restaurant (much smaller than I expected) and stood in the tight space by the door until a table was cleared at the sexy red booth in the back.  Based on the talk of waits at this place, we really lucked out, because we only waited for a few minutes.We started with some beers and shared a bowl of chowder.  Very good, thinner than I've ever had, and also had the biggest pieces of meat I've ever had.  Served with big, tasty, cracker balls.  Then, not after too long of a wait, the clouds parted and the hot lobster roll arrived like a beacon of god's good light.  I was actually a little intimidated by the amount of lobster meat, b/c as I mentioned earlier, I typically don't eat that much of it.  But, I dived in and loved the soft yet crunchy roll (grilled), and the tender meat, and the oozing buttery goodness.  It was a simple but perfect combo.  The accompanying fries (good quantity) were great too.  I'd definitely go back to Neptune if I ever find myself in Boston again.  Good vibe, friendly service, cute place - loved it!

Reviews.Author: Melissa B.
Reviews.Content: I'm seriously planning a trip back specifically for a lobster roll! Obviously everyone seems to know about this place with all the reviews. If you haven't checked this place out you really need to! The (hot) lobster roll is to die for!! Everything we had was amazing!! Oysters, shrimp cocktail...it was all perfect! Try and go at off hours for less of a wait. We go between lunch and dinner and that seems to work out best. We've always had great service though no matter how cramped it gets!

Reviews.Author: Soroosh A.
Reviews.Content: When in Boston, Do as the Bostonians Do!And what do they do exactly? LOBSTER ROLLS!After scouring yelp for the best place to get Lobster rolls in Boston, all signs pointed to Neptune Oyster. We got there around 4:30 and were luckily seated immediately. This place is PACKED! With small tables squeezed together, be ready to sit elbow to elbow. But it is a perfect opportunity to strike up a conversation with locals. Or you can always sit at the Oyster Bar and watch the shuckers do their thing. The restaurant is top-notch. Great decor! Amazing vibe! And FRESH seafood! We ordered a couple oysters and a couple of cherrystone clams. Neptune's is an expert when it comes to seafood. They perfectly describe each type of oyster and clam, so you know exactly what you are ordering. There are no surprises (except how delicious an oyster can be). The oysters were delicious! As if someone just plucked them straight out of the ocean and put them on my plate! And the cherrystone clams are my  favorite! Very meaty!But now comes time for the big daddy of them all...the Lobster Roll. We decided to share one between us. (After leaving the restaurant, I instantly regretted that decision because the withdrawals started the minute I stepped out the place!) We ordered the hot lobster roll which is topped with butter. I haven't tried the cold, but I don't see a reason why. Huge, juicy, buttery chunks of Maine Lobster stuffed into a charred bun. Take a picture of it and send it to an art gallery because it is a thing of beauty! Sure, the wait would be long but the best things in life come to those who wait. Sure, it might be a bit pricey, but you pay for what you get. Neptune Oyster...BRAVO!

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: the wait is two hours long, but never has the wait paid off so well. We actually put our names down, went to the daily catch (AMAZING AS WELL) for lunch #1, chilled at the park, then came back for lunch #2. the LOBSTER ROLL. OBVIOUSLY.  so AMAZING. i wanted to come back again for dinner the same day. that's how much i loved it. omg that lobster roll. AHHHHHHHH SO GOOOOOOD SLDKJSLDKJFAS.

Reviews.Author: Christina T.
Reviews.Content: Wow. The lobster roll was perfect. This is a small venue with out 8 or so tables and bar seating. Very unassuming decor. Service was also good. We stopped by at 8:30 to put our name in. They called us at 10:30, exactly when then anticipated a table would be available. Lobster rolls and oysters were outstanding. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Eric A.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I both had the hot lobster roll.  It was amazing.  We lucked out and got a seat at the bar right away, but heard it can be up to an hour wait.  The bartender was just the right amount of friendly and helpful.   be sure to have everyone with you to get a seat, its a small place.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen M.
Reviews.Content: Everything is better with bacon.Almost everything is better with egg.Combining both of my faves in a delicious cod dish that is served over pork belly hash (salted pork, egg, and potato) with littleneck clams on the side is amazing!Another fantastic meal at Neptune this eve! Started with super fresh, super delicious assortment of oysters and some very good wine and brought it home with the cod dish described above...simply amazing!The food here is out of this world and the staff is fantastic! Nice, unpretentious environment makes it a superb dining experience.Remains at the top of my list!

Reviews.Author: Shaina S.
Reviews.Content: As a preface, I am not a big seafood eater.  In fact, it's something I've only really started to incorporate into my diet over the last few years.  I've tried to be a little more daring, especially when I travel, and I've gotten to the point where I can appreciate good seafood when it's done right, but the majority of the time I still opt for land dwelling proteins.I was entertaining a few friends for the weekend and one of them wanted some New England clam chowder for dinner.  I saw all of Neptune's stellar reviews on Yelp and after a quick walk from the waterfront, we put our name in for a table.  It was around 5:15pm so the place wasn't too crowded but as soon as we were greeted by the hostess about 5 more parties showed up.  We had made it just in the nick!  Sitting on a random stoop resting our sore feet, watching our "5-10 minute" wait slowly creep into a half an hour, I started to get grouchy.  The hostess seemed annoyed by us as we checked on our underestimated wait time.  I eyed the menu warily due to the high prices and interesting (read: frightening) varieties of fish and seafood and was all set to hate the place.When we eventually did get to sit in the bar-lined tiny rectangular room all of my frustration melted away.  Upon closer inspection, I found the menu creative and intelligent and actually couldn't decide what to order between all of the tasty items.  I wasn't so daring as to take advantage of the raw bar but the table next to us, which we were cozily close to, tried several kinds of oysters and seemed very pleased.We began with blood orange bellinis which mostly tasted like champagne to me but their crispness was a perfect compliment to the upcoming seafood.  The lobster caprese was sumptuous perfection with enormous chunks of beautifully cooked lobster and fresh buffalo mozzarella, halved red and yellow cherry tomatoes, delicate greens, and a splash of pesto and olive oil.  I tasted this salad slowly, trying to savor every element, looked up from my plate and proclaimed, "I have never felt this way about lobster before!"  And it's true.  Far from the heavy disguised lobster bisque of my past, this salad was fresh and light and complex and my mouth waters just thinking about it.Neptune's has also perfected the art of the sear.  On Saturdays the special is tuna and this one was cooked just right and served over greens, salty bacon, and creamy avocado, with a side of soft-shell crab.  I ordered the scallops which were nestled amongst mission figs, beets, tomatoes, and a gorgonzola fonduta which added a richness to the creamy melty scallops.  I would risk disease for this undercooked shellfish anyday.  I asked my friend how his mussel dish was and he shook his head and said "It was terrible," smiling down on an enormous bowl of empty shells.The service was the kind of subtle perfection I dream of providing in my own restaurant some day (if I were ever to open one)- magically refilled water glasses, empty plates disappearing from your table before you even know they're gone, salesmanship, personality, and best of all, an extensive knowledge of the food.  This smoothness was especially impressive in such a small and busy space.  The waitresses could have easily been bumping the back of my chair all night or trying to push us out the door.I think the main reason I was able to enjoy the seafood even as the most moderate fish consumer was the ease of the presentation.  I didn't see anyone eating a whole lobster and hacking away violently at the shells.  There were no fish eyes or scales or anything to suggest the previous slimy life of the food on my plate.  Everything was fresh and flavorful and elegantly presented and I couldn't have asked for more.  As you can tell by the novel I just wrote, Neptune's is wonderful.  They provide the kind of meal that transports you, relaxes you, and feeds your soul.  The prices were higher than my usual but not too high for a meal like this.  It was my first true 5-star meal experience of the summer.

Reviews.Author: alison k.
Reviews.Content: So this is probably not going to win the award for adding the most new information about a business, however, it would be very wrong if I didn't review this beloved institution. In short:cosy atmosphere on a freezing wintery nightdelish, fresh seafoodgreat variety of oystersyummy cioppinolovely wine listWell worth the wait

Reviews.Author: southern k.
Reviews.Content: So based on the latest Best of Boston mag, I hightailed my rear before my flight to Neptune's.  I ran around with my luggage going first to Mike's and then circling back to Neptune, by which point I was a hot tranny mess.  Yes, I looked like a deranged loon sweating profusely, sexy I know, but one would think I walked in with a Yankees cap.I asked for the buttered lobster roll to go only to have it made into a major production since apparently it is against their policy.  But after a short wait and a glass of much need water, off I went to catch my flight.  Even after three hours the lobster roll held up well.  What's there to mess up? Butter, lobster, and a white roll.  Simple, quality ingredients put together well.  You get a great deal of lobster tail meat that it's almost too much.  The only down side is I just found out that I'm not that fond of lobster.  But what a way to find out: by sheer excess!  All for $26 and you don't have to fight for your food, all the de-shelled meat awaits you in a hot, buttered hoagie roll.

Reviews.Author: Theary K.
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING THAT EVERYONE ORDERED LOOKED GOOODWe only came here for some oysters and maybe clam chowder, but kept ordering more stuff as we looked around the room. I could have passed on the clam chowder.  It wasn't my type of chowder.  It was the brothy type.  But everyone else was so yummy my tummy was so happy I brought it to Boston.Their special of that night: Escargo salad was to be remembered.  It came w/some kinda blue cheese dressing which I wanted to lick off the plate.  I practically scraped every bit of it off.They have a raw food order list that you can place how many of each item you want. It's great, you don't get stuck with the ones you don't like and then can order more of the ones you do like.Their deep fried clam was sooooo good.  Boston knows how to cook their clams!I can't remember if we ordered anything else.  Their Seasonal Harpoon Beer got me at hello.  Either it was a good strong beer or those oysters just weren't soaking up the alcohol.If you come here and not sure what you want to order, just look around. Wait... that didn't help us either.  I wanted to stay their and order everything !!

Reviews.Author: Lauren L.
Reviews.Content: Get the lobster rolls. Try some oysters. Get there early. While most prefer the hot-with-butter option, I actually like both the hot and cold versions equally, but they definitely are different. The chilled (huge) chunks of lobster in the cold sandwich are tossed with a light and barely perceptible layer of mayo, just enough to give it some extra flavor. Chilling the lobster also gives it a bit of a different and firmer texture, making it taste a bit more 'substantial.' That's not to say that the hot lobster roll wasn't swoonworthy, because it definitely was. Melted butter + lobster = infinite WIN. Go with someone else, and try both hot and cold. Die happy. Plus the fries are amazing, perfectly brown and crispy (I know, not really the point, but I never turn down delicious fries).Their oysters are, of course, unparalleled in freshness and variety. I'm normally not a raw oyster type of girl, but I'm a huge fan of their mignonette, which subtly enhanced the flavor of the oysters without overpowering them.  I brought the BF here at around 5:30PM and it was almost deserted. There were two guys sitting at the bar and I felt a slight twinge of fear. Had Neptune Oyster degraded to the point where the place was empty?? Were the 400 reviews mistaken?? But not to worry, not 15 minutes after we were seated the place filled up and there was a line out the door. Pricy? Yes. Crowded? Yes (a family with 3 small children practically shared our table). TASTY? Yes.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey M.
Reviews.Content: We waited over an hour on my b-day to get in as there are no reservations, but it was competely worth it. We sat at the bar and had a semi-dry Rose wine and a selection of Oysters, the West Coast were my Fav rich, buttery, and tender.I has the artic char over green beans and baby beets with a crème fraîche sauce to die for. Generally I'm not too adventurous with fish, but places like this ruin me. My expectations for seafood are now so high that mid-rage fare can come off mealy, dry, and/or generally lack-luster. Though I stick to two basic rules no fish 'specials' on Sunday/Monday/Tuesday and no seafood more than 300 miles from the coast unless in a very large metro area at a well vetted establishment. Okay.. sorry for the detour, back on track. Netpune Oyster has a way of focusing on a small menu of items with well thought out flavor parings and keeps everything simple, fresh, and executed with superior craft. There are very few people in the business that can pull this off without seeming pretentious, on that note the service was strait forward and top-notch. I would have never ordered a Rose wine had the bartender not recommended it to pair with my meal. I was pleasantly surprised to find his selection dry, changing my negative connotation with the style. It's also pretty easy to eat gluten-free or wheat-free here, because it's a small kitchen they don't guarantee it but I found a number of options that worked for me.This was one of the best birthday dinners I've ever had and I'll definitely be back again.

Reviews.Author: Katie W.
Reviews.Content: If you want to eat around 9pm, get there at 6pm to put your name down. Yes, Neptune Oyster is worth a 3 hour wait. But you don't have to wait there. They call you when your table is ready. Seafood is very fresh. But if you're debating on what to get, you HAVE to order the HOT Maine lobster roll with butter. You can't walk out this restaurant without trying this.

Reviews.Author: Boshann C.
Reviews.Content: Came here tonight the second birthday in a row, third time overall, and I remembered why I come back. This restaurant is consistently solid, it is really good seafood, prepared perfect every time. Get the oysters, get the Johnny Cake, get the ciopinno, get it with the spectacular Iggy's bread. The setting is charming and intimate and warm; the service is friendly and attentive. I would bet that everything on their menu is worth eating while you're here in Boston, it really is a gem.

Reviews.Author: Dan A.
Reviews.Content: I would give this place 5 stars for the food- the oysters are superb, and the hot lobster roll is amazing, but they need to work on three things (1 big thing, 2 side notes):1.  Their champagne mignonette sauce sucks.  Really sucks.  A good mignonette is both salty and tart, to provide contrast to the flavor of the oyster.  And it's not that hard to make it right... go to Troquet for an example.  Neptune's champagne mignonette is neither salty nor tart.  It tastes like watered down olive oil with some flavorless onion pieces.  And when I've asked for a normal mignonette, they've said that they don't even have the vinegar to make it (every time I've gone, same issue).  If you're an oyster bar, it's pretty essential to have oysters, mignonette, ketchup & horseradish, lemon, and beer.  So Neptune gets 4/5.Sidenote #1.  They have no reservation policy.  This makes it impossible to get a table during peak hours without waiting 20 minutes in a cramped waiting area, or outside in the cold when the bar is packed.Sidenote #2.  Service leaves something to be desired.  On average, it is good, but for a 5 star rating, I should have a positive experience everytime I go, which I unfortunately have not.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is absolutely beautiful and charming and would be worth going to just for the ambiance.  The fact that the seafood is incredibly fresh and delicious there makes for an overall incredible experience.  The place is small and there was a bit of a line when we came on Saturday afternoon for a late lunch/early dinner but it's worth the wait.  airy and bright with marbled bar & table tops, soft lighting, white subway tiled walls and beveled glass mirrors reading the specials give this place an enchanting old world vintage feel.  They have an extensive wine list and a selection of bellinis ranging from white peach to prickly pear.We ordered oysters and lobster rolls.  Both were absolutely the best.  You can choose from a variety of oysters and we picked Wellfleet and wood island (or was it hog island? cant remember).  both were some of the freshest and most delicious oysters I have had.  Be sure to get the buttered lobster roll.  It comes with fries which were delicious in their own right, and the roll is filled with huge warm chunks of sweet lobster meat dripping in butter.  Honestly one of the most delightful dining experiences I have had in a long time.

Reviews.Author: Tara Z.
Reviews.Content: Ohhhh Neptune Oyster.....I love this place so much! It is small and can be difficult to get in, but I suppose that is part of it's charm. Definitely suited for small groups (2 - 4 people). They have by far the best lobster roll ever (I prefer the HOT). I also appropriately had my first oysters here. Their entire raw bar in general is phenomenal - fresh and awesome! This can definitely be pricy, but if I want to treat myself, Neptune never disappoints!

Reviews.Author: Andrey P.
Reviews.Content: Being from Cali, I am spoiled by oysters, and the availability of variety, and price! Something that I found interesting that at Neptune and through out Boston the Oyster Happy Hour does not exist. Common east cost were is the $1 oyseter. The food is definitly 5 stars here, but paying $2.50 an oyster I am not a fan of. Probably the best lobster roll I had in Boston, and I had a lot...

Reviews.Author: Sean S.
Reviews.Content: Hey all!First review here. After being an avid Yelp user for about five or six years I thought it was time to finally give back. The fact that this is my first review should tell you something... this place is the real deal. I would give it five stars, but for a few little things.It is a bit pricey, but for the North End its on par with everything else.The wait can be long, but they take your number and call when a table is available. I usually put my name in and grab coffee at Cafe Vittoria.Sitting by the door can be a nuisance when it is cold out. The place is busy at all times of the day and even though they have a heavy curtain, when people hold it open, the air blows in. Unfortunately the servers and hosts have to constantly remind people to shut the door. I feel bad for all parties involved. It's just a tough situation. Bring a jacket just in case you end up near the door!Recommend:Hot Lobster Roll!     I've gotten this three times myself and every time I bring someone new here I make them get this. It's the best item that I've had.Oysters!    They have a fantastic selection and they tasted fresher than the ones from Atlantic Fish Co. (also good)Neptune Burger!    Solid burger with bombbb fried oysters on it. Can be a little messy, but overall very good and budget choice.I don't like the chowda (too watery... i prefer my chowder on the creamier side so its more about preference than anything else) or the johnnycake (too salty for my liking).

Reviews.Author: Tracey P.
Reviews.Content: I love love love so many things about this place.The oyster selection spans way beyond the ubiquitous Wellfleet, Kumamoto, Blue Point, Malpeque repetoire at every other raw bar.  While fresh lemon, mignonette and cocktail sauce are offered, the quality and freshness of these sea gems requires nothing.The icy cold Peroni on tap (this is the North End, yah?) was a lovely compliment on a hot day.I had a little sticker shock when I ordered the lobster roll ($25?! For something on a hot dog bun?!), but all was forgiven when I took my first bite. There could well have been an entire hot, buttery, perfect lobster unloaded into the oversized bun.  The decor matched the food, in that it was comfortably casual, but elegant at the same time. It is a small place dominated by a big marble topped bar. (I love eating at the bar and people watching.) The staff is attentive without being pushy. It was just well-executed the whole way around.The only negatives are that its size makes it a no go for groups and ensures long waits if you don't go at an off peak time. And the price point puts it out of the realm of the every day.

Reviews.Author: Susan J.
Reviews.Content: Totally meets the hype.I've tried B&G Oysters in South End as well, but this experience overall was much better. Better service, better ambiance, better FOOD. We thought we'd have to wait long after we put down our names and a phone number, but this wasn't the case at all! We settled down at a nearby cafe expecting a long wait, but we soon received a phone call that they were ready for us.And the lobster roll. YUMMMMM. Who knew something so simple could be so delicious? I've tried cold lobster rolls at other places in Boston, but the hot buttery version that Neptune Oyster offers is beyond amazing. I enjoyed their selection of oysters too. I think the bf had the cod? (which was good too) But I have to say it was definitely overshadowed by my lobster roll. Too bad it's so expensive. Or maybe this is a good thing to prevent myself from indulging too frequently

Reviews.Author: Lan T.
Reviews.Content: This place rocked!First it is a little hard to get to, well, it's not hard to find, it's just hard to park, but then again we are talking about Boston.The server was great, very nice man. Very informative, very competent, he made sure are water glasses were filled.He recommends the fried clams...GET THE FRIED CLAMS....the batter is to die for.Also the clam chowder is delicious. It is not thick, but when it is sooo good does that really matter?The Lobster Spaghetina was delicious. Someone in our group actually complained there was too much lobster!!! he was joking of course. Definitley try the place out.

Reviews.Author: Kinndy L.
Reviews.Content: I'm a Cali girl 100% but I would seriously consider moving to Boston if it means I get to eat at Neptune and their amazingly fresh seafood all the time!!!!We didn't have reservations so we just sat at the bar. The guy working behind the counter was really friendly and fast. Oyster orders were: Pemaquid, Neptune, Kumomoto, and Kusshi. I forgot which ones were which but I DO remember the ones with the buttered corn finish + cucumber finish were my favorite!!! So fresh, succulent.. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!Also ordered their clam chowder and Neptunes on Piggyback appetizer. Clam chowder was GREAT with the chowder being thin, smooth, and frothy. Clams were tender and sweet.. plentiful in quantity. I'm salivating just thinking about it!Neptunes on Piggyback was just delightful. Crispy oysters, Berkshire pig, golden raisin confiture, and pistachio aioli.. all on slices of crusty bread. The aioli provided a sweet undertone that complemented the oysters + pig. What an ingenious combination!!!!SOO very in love with this place. The vibe, the service, and most importantly, THE FOOD!!!

Reviews.Author: Vez K.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE seafood and am always looking out for local hot spots wherever I go in the world that has great seafood.  I grew up on it and know and crave good seafood.I must say that this restaurant served probably the best seafood I've ever had in my life.  My husband got there last night (on a wet October Wednesday night) at 8 pm.  It was an hour wait, so they took down our phone number and we walked over to Mike's to actually have a little dessert first.Right at about 9 pm when we were gonna get seated, a guy walked in and said he had a group of 3.  The host/server told him that they were full for the night.  Poor guy! He walked away looking so sad.At the bar, we saw a couple who ordered the grilled lobster, which looked amazing.  It was probably a 10 - 12 inch pan (like a round pizza pan) of grilled lobster in its shell, veggies, and clams.  It looked amazing.  But when we sat down and asked about ordering the $50 treat, they said they were out for the night. :(So I asked our server what other goodies she recommended.  She said the cioppino is really good - lots of seafood and rice that was spicy like New Orleans cookin'.  So my husband jumped on that, since we love spicy food.And boy was it amazing!  There were about 3 types of fish on our plate (about 2 inch pieces), 2 big fresh plump shrimp, 2 plump clams, lobster pieces, and rice soaking in really good broth that was actually spicy!  We were in heaven.  I even asked for spoons so that we could drink the broth/sauce with our food.  I was amazed at how plump and juicy both the shrimp and clams were (the shrimp was firm and crunchy, which is a sign of freshness!).  The fish were good too. I've had lobster rolls up and down the coast of Maine and even at the famous Red's Eats (supposedly the best lobster roll in Maine).  I liked the roll at Red's, but found that my lobster would've been SO much better had it been hot instead of cold to dip into my warm butter.  The lobster was really good, but cold.  It was a bit disappointing.So last night, I ordered a hot lobster roll.  It was amazing!  The bun was toasted and buttered on the inside and outside.  I had to eat it with a knife and fork, since it was so buttery.  The lobster was sweet, hot, and evenly buttered.  They were cut up into small pieces that were evenly buttered, though not dripping.  It was so perfect, and the pieces of lobster tasted amazing, even without the bread!And I forgot to mention that we ordered a few oysters off the check list they gave us before our meal.  The descriptions of the taste of the oysters were right on!  One of the ones I got was the one that was sweet, creamy, and had the honeydew melon aftertaste.  It was by far the best oyster I've ever had!  Very plump, sweet, juicy, and creamy.  They were extremely fresh and tasted clean.Just a hint, try your oysters with just a squirt of lemon juice instead of putting all that other stuff they give you on it.  I'm bit of a purist about some foods, and I like to taste the food and not cover it in sauces.  A squirt of lemon juice was just enough to let me taste the oyster and all its flavors.  If you're getting great quality oysters, skip the sauces and use just lemon juice to really taste the flavors (which is what you're paying for anyway).  Our whole meal was about $100 with tax and tip.  But my husband remarked on our way out that it was worth every penny.  When I go back again, I wanna try the lobster grill.  If not, the cioppino would be at the top of my list since it was SO good!

Reviews.Author: Chris F.
Reviews.Content: We dropped in here on the recommendation of a local friend who lives across the river.  One of my absolute, all-time favorite lunch experiences anywhere.  Unquestionably the best lobster roll I ever had, and some of the best oysters and clam chowder.The place was absolutely packed when we walked in, and we had to stand outside in the freezing cold.  Luckily, we weren't waiting long because the server forced two girls to get up and leave when the rest of their party took too long to show.  We took over, and immediately I felt in the debt of the waiter, who was friendly, efficient and gave great recommendations.I had the Harpoon dark Ale (on tap), the local Fisherman's Brew (in a bottle), a dozen local Oysters, clam chowder and a lobster roll with butter, fresh-cut fries and poured apple cider vinegar on them, Maryland-style.The oyster menu comes with flavors of the oysters, for true seafood aficionados.They have homemade oyster crackers people.  Homemade oyster crackers.Also, the vibe of the place is really cool.  They write the wine, oyster and beer menus on mirrors on the wall, and there's a long bar, and it's constantly packed.  It reminds me of going into coffee bars in Italy in the morning and trying to squeeze in to order an espresso.  What espressos are to Italy, beer and good seafood are to this town.  And Neptune is a shining example of great, fresh local seafood done right.

Reviews.Author: Annie N.
Reviews.Content: I am GLAD I'm single!!  Couples have a 2hrs+ wait.  I did a quick tour on Salem street, bought a bottle of wine, came back and my seat is ready.The food was excellent.  They say oysters make you fall in love...well, I have fallen in love--with the oysters!  These are the freshest I've ever eaten.  There were at least a dozen different kinds to sample from.  The ones I had were quite fruity and juicy (the good oyster juice, not the yucky sea juice).  Of course, I also ordered the delicious lobster roll.  It was everything I wanted in a hearty cholesterol filled roll and more.  And of course I had to take a picture of the monstrosity that eventually ended up in my stomach.  The guy next to me from Philly took a picture of my dish too...Which brings me to my next point, the ambiance.  Starting with the people, this place is filled with people from all walks of life.  At the singles oyster bar, however, the demographics tend to be (single) business professionals.  To my right is the gentleman from Philly who had a bit of a gangster Italian accent.  To my left is a gentleman from London who had a "posh" demeanor.  The three of us stroke an excellent conversation, over wine and good food.  The place was much too small, but perhaps that's to keep the quality of the food.The service was friendly and commendable.  After all the talking, eating, and drinking, I forgot the bottle of wine I had purchased earlier.  Luckily, I called in, and despite how busy they were, they found my bottle and kept it for me to pick up the next day!  Ahhh I miss Boston.

Reviews.Author: Gennadiy B.
Reviews.Content: I didn't like oysters, but for some reason I've decided that I should give those slimy little suckers another chance. I am glad it happened at Neptune Oyster, because this place is for people like me. Thank you, Neptune Oyster, for this wonderful experience - I am now a fan of oysters. There were great appetizers (smoked trout tartare, tuna ribbons salad) and majestic clam chowder with distinct lard undertones, but oysters stole the show.

Reviews.Author: Julia T.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to dine in Boston even if though they don't take reservations. The long wait is well worth it. Cute raw bar in Little Italy and perfect for date night.Neptune has the best hot Lobster Roll I've ever had. Can't go wrong with a toasty roll topped with melted butter and huge chunks of lobster meat and claws. Oysters are exceptional and fresh. Besides the fantastic food, service is top notch. A must try for anyone in the Boston area.  To read more about Neptune, visit my food blog at julialikestoeat.com

Reviews.Author: Elisha H.
Reviews.Content: I had never had a lobster roll in my life until about a month or two ago.  Ever since my first one while driving up the coast of Maine, I became obsessed, and I ate about five lobster rolls that month, trying everything in Boston and New York. Neptune Oyster was by FAR my favorite. Their hot buttery lobster roll is how all lobster rolls in the world should be made. TAKE ME BACK SO I CAN HAVE MORE!!!

Reviews.Author: Vien N.
Reviews.Content: food would have been better if the service was better .the service is lousy. they forgot our oyster order so we watched 2 tables served before us, and then when they finally realized our "ticket was lost in the shuffle" they had to resubmit the oyster order. then they brought us our dinner first, then our appetizer, then our oysters. kinda tough trying to figure out what to eat first - the $27 hot buttered lobster roll, or the raw oysters. so yeah. food is fantastic, just don't have high hopes for their service

Reviews.Author: M C.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars! This is place has a great decor but is small making it difficult for larger parties to fine here. The food experience makes up for it and has kept me singing the praises of this place long after my meal was over ! The oysters are so fresh and probably one of the best in the city that I have had. The warm lobster roll was so mouth- watering and buttery hot! It was great and have not had anything comparable to this in Boston! This restaurant will make you wait - be prepared ! It can be more than an hour. Great service but this place is on the pricey side. It is worth the wait and would definitely dine here again!

Reviews.Author: Tarheelfoodmonste R.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll is great but a little soggy.  Local oysters are tasty and the fries might be the best fries I've ever had.  Worth the price once but otherwise out of my price range to return.

Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: Best fried clams of all time, best cioppino I have ever eaten.Unreal fresh fish, really interesting wine selection (Italian whites go WAY beyong pinot grigio), and fresh, local beer.I love this place more every time I go.

Reviews.Author: Steven S.
Reviews.Content: This review covers two restaurants, namely B&G Oysters and Neptune Oysters, and only one dish at each of these restaurants, namely their lobster rolls.  Why, my dear friends, would I go to these two places with the sole purpose of trying out their respective takes on this classic New England dish?  Because it's a crap-load of lobster on a bun... that's why.With that said, the styles of these two lobster rolls are completely different:  warm and buttery vs. cold and mayonnaise-y.  Obviously, the cold version is the "classic" lobster roll, and there has been a plethora of posts about how a warm roll is akin to going to the Democratic National Convention and proclaiming that George Bush Jr. is the best president ever.  I have never been a traditionalist, so I am reviewing these dishes for what they are.First the similarities:1. You get a lot of lobster... not just enough to fill the bun, but enough to REQUIRE eating a good number of fork-fulls before picking the damn thing up and trying to take a bite out of it.  Unfortunately, I learned this the hard way, and ended up spilling about a tail's-worth of lobster meat onto my plate when I tried to take a bite from the get-go.2. Each goes really well with a beer, preferably something that can stand up to the natural butteriness of the lobster meat.  I suppose you could get a nice acidic white, but a nice New England draught (Geary's Winter Ale at Neptune and Tremont Ale at B&G) seemed like the perfect accompaniment to me.Differences:1. B&G:  cold lobster in a light aioli with lemon and chives sprinkled on top.  The lemon gave the dish the perfect amount of acid to balance the lobster.  Not really mayonnaise-y at all.  Lobster chunks broken up to just the right size so when you take a bite out of the roll, you don't have to chew through a piece of lobster or get an overly large piece in your mouth.2. Neptune:  warm lobster in butter on a toasted brioche bun.  The warmth allowed me to fully enjoy all the natural (and added) butteriness of the lobster.  Often times large chunks of lobster that were obviously crab or tail meat.  While a bit harder to eat, the large chunks gave me the impression that there was some dude in the back who cracked open a fresh lobster, chopped it up a bit, put it in the bun and splash some butter on it.The service in each place was great.  The decor was a bit different, with Neptune sporting marble tables and an old-school oyster bar feel, while B&G had a more modern touch with a nice open kitchen in the middle of the restaurant where you can watch them do their magic.Both of these places are must-go's, even if you only like lobster a wee little bit.  I'll be back next time I'm in town, but I think I'll bring some cholesterol-lower medications just in case...

Reviews.Author: lily l.
Reviews.Content: So. Many. Oysters... oysters galore!I can't believe as recent as one year ago I was still anti-oysters. Talk about acquiring new tastes! The place was great. I was visiting from SF and going to try out Neptune Oyster was the only thing on my must-do list. The oysters were fresh, the crudo plates were a B+ (hard to compare to Bar Crudo here in SF) and the lobster roll was good. I really regret not getting the warm version. It was 95+ degrees outside, so I thought going with the cold version would be a better idea. But I hear the warm one is better.Friendly service and atmosphere...

Reviews.Author: Asia B.
Reviews.Content: Yum!!!  Try the Bronzini!   That's what I had this time- I took my mom and grandmother.The lobster bisque was fantastic.  The clam chowder was amazing, and not like a thick glob of glue like many places...  Awesome!Nice wine list.  I just wish the waitress had asked before she assumed we wanted another round of the same thing- I would have ordered something else to try.

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: VERY busy place! The restaurant is beautiful and the outside and in, which is why on a Monday lunch there was still a line. We, a party of 3, order the clam chowder, yellowfin tuna tartare, lobster roll, and vitello tonnato.The clam chowder was not as thick as I thought it would be, so I was very happy because it was my first meal of the day. The yellowfin tuna tartare was spiced excellent as well, a must if you enjoy tartare. The main entrees came with salty fries, too salty, but we just took the salt off and we were okay. Some people exchange it for salads as well. The vitello tonnato was a bit too spicy (mustard) for our taste, but the taste was good. The LOBSTER ROLL, however, was really delicious! It was huge! I shared it with a friend and we were really full afterwards. Big chunks of lobster just spills out of the sweet bun - an excellent choice if you love lobster rolls!

Reviews.Author: Pedro C.
Reviews.Content: Came here last night after work around 6:30.  There was already a small line starting out the door.  They don't have a hostess, only one waitress who would occassionally come out to take names and phone number.  Also, there is no space to stand inside.  It was pouring out last night, so good thing the store front had an awning to shield us from rain. It took us about 20 mins to be seated.  If you've ever been there, you'll know it's a tight fit in there.  The waitress/waiters are understaffed. I think there's only 2 working the dining area, and 2 bartenders helping the big bar they have. There's also one person dedicated to shucking oysters.  So the pace overall is slow. On to the menu.  We ordered a dozen assorted oysters/clams.  Incredible how fresh, tasty, yummy, good they are.  I think we could have ordered 4 dozen and finished it. haha. As appetizers we shared the Fried Ipswich Clams and the Hamachi (yellowtail) Crudo.  First the fried oysters were plump, juicy, with a delicate batter.  Their tarter sauce is made there with diced pickles.  Combination is spectacular.  The Hamachi Crudo (not really sure what crudo was) came out as beautiful sashimi slices of yellowtail in a green parsley jalapeno sauce.  The fish was excellent quality and the sauce is sweet with a kick from the jalapeno.  Great combination. My wife and I shared an entree, the Neptune Burger, which is a beef patty topped with cheese, relish, and fried oysters.  The burger itself was good.  But I think we both agreed that the taste of the fried oyster got lost in the beef flavor.  I would classify it as a novelty burger that tastes great, but the intent didn't work out. Throughout out meal we had the sparkling prosecco. Light, a little sweet, and went well with seafood. My advice is to come here early. We see people come in around 8:30 and get turned away because the list is full.

Reviews.Author: Synie W.
Reviews.Content: WOWI came here at 7pm on saturday (bad idea) left my name and number since i was told there would be about a 2 hr wait. By the time 30mins rolled around I was hungry and grumpy so we went to eat at The Daily Catch (yummy!!) and im so glad i did. Even after waiting on line at TDC for over 30mins, eatting the food, walked around the area for abit, then drove all the way back to the hotel in Burlington... there was no call. At approx. 1030pm... Neptune Oyster called me LOL really???I did not eat here but i dont think the food is worth waiting over 3 hours for... Reservations???Maybe ill swing by and give them another try the next time im in town.

Reviews.Author: Kimberley S.
Reviews.Content: What can one say about a restaurant with over 1,000 reviews? The word, ladies and gentlemen, is Foodgasm.I had the good fortune to find myself here last weekend, and it did not disappoint. In spite of being likely the most hyped-up restaurant of all time, and in spite of the 1.5 hour wait in a torrential downpour, I can confidently say the meal was more than worth it.To start, Boyfriend and I tried a small sampling of oysters. I was impressed with the selection, but more impressed with how wonderfully clean they were - not a piece of grit to be found in any of them.But the real star of the meal was, of course, the hot buttered lobster roll. While it was only 3 or so ingredients (lobster, bun, and butter), the purity of the dish was magnificent, leading me to believe that the ingredients were bestowed upon Neptune Oyster by sweet baby Jesus himself. That's the only explanation for the flavor explosion brought by this lobster roll.Boyfriend got a monkfish dish. While I barely tried it, he puts it in one of his top 5 meals of all time. That's a tough list to crack.Rounding off the best food I have eaten in my life, the interior is delightful. Huge marble bar and subway tiles everywhere, it really is a treat to dine in this small cozy space. Of course the smell of fresh seafood permeating the restaurant didn't hurt either.

Reviews.Author: Courtney R.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster isn't much from the streetview, but it's oysters are absolutely delicious.  You have to go in about 1-2 hours before you want to have dinner and sign up for a reservation.  They take your phone number and kindly call you when the table is ready.  We were seated at the bar and the bartender was very knowledgeable and friendly. It was my first time eating oysters (!!) and he took the time to explain the different varieties for me.  We had 12 diffferent varieties and I have to say the kumamoto are my favorites. My date was a wine buff and approved of their wine list.

Reviews.Author: Rich K.
Reviews.Content: Place was good, had a nice selection of beers & raw bar.  Kitchen food was well made and presented nicely.  My only complaint is when I asked the owner where else I could enjoy a good meal in Boston he recommended his own restaurant.  Someone should tell him while his food was good, it wasn't worth going back to back nights when I was only in town for a weekend!  Also... who would ever recommend a patron to come back to back nights to their own restaurant?  That's pretty desperate in my opinion...

Reviews.Author: Lennie Ann G.
Reviews.Content: During our recent visit to Boston, a friend of ours suggested that my husband and I try out Neptune Oyster.  After reading several reviews from fellow yelpers we decided that we'd go and we were not disappointed.We arrived around 5:20 on a Saturday and we were told the wait was about an hour long.  If you haven't been to the north end before, there are plenty of things that can keep you occupied for that hour.After about an hour and 10 minutes, we were seated at the bar.  Once we sat down we ordered a dozen oysters, crab claws, and the hot lobster roll.  The food was fresh.  Everything was so delicious.  I have never been more satisfied.   We tried lobster rolls at two other restaurants but this was by far the best we had all weekend.

Reviews.Author: Gail F.
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in the North End, this little New England Seafood gem delivers 5 stars (and much more)!All summer long my boyfriend was on the hunt for the best lobster roll.  We had tried several Cape, Maine, and Boston spots but nothing beats the warm, delicious, buttery, toasty delightful Lobster Roll on Neptune's menu.  You are given the choice of hot or cold, but hot is the way to go.  The lobster melts in your mouth and the roll is toasted to perfection.  I decided to go with the scallops which were by far, the best scallops I've ever had.  The dish is served with pan seared scallops placed on a bed of sautéed rainbow swiss chard with a Dijon mustard drizzle.  The swiss chard was garnished with pancetta and perfectly ripe cherries which added the perfect combination of salty and sweet.  The clam chowder is delicious served with large house made oyster crackers, perfect for dipping.The decor is cozy and the atmosphere is warm and inviting.  We were seated at the bar and the service was great.  Neptune doesn't take reservations and the restaurant is relatively small, so naturally there's a wait.  However, its definitely worth it.  It was the perfect little evening in the perfect little spot.

Reviews.Author: Angelica B.
Reviews.Content: As a fairly regular visitor to Boston, I will say that I've had my fair share of lobster rolls, clam chowder, and raw oysters.  I've been to brand-name chains such as Legal and random mom and pops for my seafood fix.  While most have been satisfying, none have left me with the impression that I gained from Neptune Oyster.  Neptune Oyster was an amazing dining experience.  Low key, cozy atmosphere coupled with fresh and simply prepared dishes made me wish I lived in Boston and could savor this meal as often as possible.My dining companion and I had:a plate of raw oysters (variety of mostly local) and clamsclam chowderhot lobster rollMy companion, who had had his first lobster roll ever the night before, was in heaven upon taking the first bite of the hot lobster roll at Neptune.  He was utterly convinced of the praises he had heard of New England seafood as a result.  Chowder was very good; not too creamy and garnished with parsley gave it an extra kick. The oysters were among the best we had during our stay.  In particular, I enjoyed the East Beach Blonde variety as well as the Island Creek.  When in town again, I will definitely be back!  It is a bit on the pricey side, but it was worth it.  Dining tip: went on a Sunday around 3.  The lunch crowd was just clearing up so we were able to get a table pretty quickly and weren't rushed to leave since there weren't many people waiting.  During our hour and a half stay, the restaurant was never fully packed.  It is very small so not really intended for big groups. I'd suggest going with a dining companion who fully appreciates seafood and won't be afraid to try the raw bar and share a few things!

Reviews.Author: Kendall H.
Reviews.Content: Went on the search for Boston's best lobster roll an ended up finding Neptune's Oyster, best raw bar..... AND best lobster roll!Would recommend going at odd hours with smaller groups, the fewer the better otherwise the wait could be up to 3-4 hours long (No Joke).Love the kind of rugged, rustic, while at the same time clean and charming atmosphere.  Order ANYTHING and i promise it'll be awesome, the daily specials are off the charts, great striped sea bass and the SCALLOPS, SEARED GEORGES BANK SCALLOPS (salivating)...The place sets my standards for good new england cuisine.  The long wait and small restaurant space makes it one of my favorite places in the North End, the experience wouldn't be complete without it.

Reviews.Author: Nora A.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll here is 5 stars, but considering we had to wait an hour to be seated and the prices are not cheap I had to give this place 4 stars.  That being said, I've eaten at many places in the North End and if ever I wanted to go out there again, Neptune's would be my first choice.  I'm not a big pasta fan and I think most places in the North End let their reputation precede them, and they don't really do much in the realm of innovative or great cuisine (with the exception of maybe 2 or 3 places out of 100).  The buttered brioche lobster roll at Neptune's is unbelievable!! Far and away the best lobster roll I've ever had.  The brioche is grilled in butter and the lobster is lightly coated in a buttery sauce. It's really something everyone should eat at least once.Oysters here are great too; but I do think good oysters can be found at many restaurants in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Marisa W.
Reviews.Content: Certainly renown for it's seafood, but I declare the Neptune Burger is the best in the Commonwealth.  Great for a date.  Start with some Oysters.  Order the hot buttered lobster roll and the burger.  Then split each and share between yourselves so you can both enjoy the burger/lobster experience.Be warned.  If you're not there right at opening, you might have a hard time getting a spot.

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
Reviews.Content: Best things about Neptune:Lobster roll - hot!Their homemade fries are DELICIOUS.  The healthy option instead of fries is this amazing salad... also DELICIOUS.  :)Crappiest thing about Neptune:The wait... however, it's worth every minute!Tip:Go 20 minutes before it opens.  Read on your phone, talk to a friend, grab a pastry before hand.

Reviews.Author: Chi B.
Reviews.Content: We passed by the restaurant while discovering the North End and am so grateful we stopped to try it.  It was hands down, the best restaurant we tried in Boston.We luckily only had to wait 15 minutes for a few seats at the bar at around 8pm. We tried four different oysters from the extensive oyster menu and enjoyed the Hamachi ceviche, cioppino and the best scallop dish I've ever had.I cannot recommend this restaurant enough!

Reviews.Author: Theresa V.
Reviews.Content: Cozy and small.  large array of oysters and clams. Delicious fresh seafood. This place can be on the expensive side, but it's totally worth it!  They have a large selection of seafood bar options - oysters and clams all over the country.  We ha da fun time oyster tasting!  But of course their signature dish is their lobster roll.  It was absolutely delicious!People have raved about this place before and I am not really a fan of lobster rolls, I feel like it's a waste of a lobster to put mayo all over it and then stick it into a hot dog bun, but this was completely different.  Most of the meat was from the tail and there was very minor mayo on the lobster.  The warm toasted bun was spread with just the right amount of butter (and by that I mean it was slabbed on!) to compliment the lobster.  Together it was heavenly!  I could probably eat 4 of those, but at $25 a pop, I'd have to limit myself.  Keep in mind that the place is small and seating is limited... definitely plan for a wait or go when they open.  But definitely go at least once to try it - it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Ben S.
Reviews.Content: Based on Yelp reviews, we decided to make this our premiere seafood lunch during our Boston stay.  And we're so glad we did!We believe in doing our research, and planned our restaurant selection accordingly - we were here on a weekday right at 11:15am (15 min before opening), and we were the second party in a line that grew pretty quickly after us.  It is a bit non-descript before they open, we weren't the only ones to do the walk-by, double-take, walk-back while we were searching for it.  Tip:  look for the name on the awning, since the storefront glass is all covered up by what looks like bullet-proof armour which stays up until they open the doors at 11:30am.Anyway, the food was just delicious - we started with a selection of oysters and clams from the raw bar, and can totally understand why several other diners looked like that's all they had - they were the freshest we've had anywhere to date.  Next, three of us had to try the Lobster Rolls, of course (hot with butter) - they were wonderful.  I can understand why some people aren't overwhelmed by them - they really are just lobster meat drenched in butter stuffed into top-cut hot dog buns, but boy, when you put that much perfectly-steamed lobster, slather it in butter till it takes on both the flavour and colour of the lobster, and then let it soak into the barely dense-enough to hold together bun, it is heaven!Another reviewer complained about the fries only being meh, so I wasn't expecting anything great that way, but man, those were perfectly fried and salted (I know there're about as many opinions on what makes a perfect fry as there are people who eat them, but I challenge anyone to say they weren't good).As for the service, I found it on par with our other Boston experiences.  In one phrase:  no-nonsense.  Pleasant enough, but you can tell they care more about keeping the line moving than making you feel welcome (warm and fuzzy is not on the menu).  As long as you don't do/say something remarkably stupid, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: Taste the ocean with a platter of raw oysters!  Learn to appreciate the flavors, textures, and finishes of a variety of oysters from Massachusetts, New York, Washington, Maine, and Nova Scotia.  Visit this tiny, cute restaurant in the North End for an oyster tasting experience that starts with salt and brine but ends with a sweet finish.  I love the Kumamotos, which are plump, sweet, and creamy with hints of cucumber whereas the Gold Creek has a buttery, melon finish.  The Wellfleet and Island Creek slide in with salt, but end with a smooth, sweet, juicy, and fruity finish.  The Onset has a salty, plump, and meaty texture like that of a mushroom.  Refresh yourself with the Winter Point, Cummaquid, and Meetinghouse Blue with a crisp, clean mouth watering experience.  You can even taste a sweet corn finish after the salt explosion from the juicy Bee's River.

Reviews.Author: Pamela K.
Reviews.Content: There are very few things on this earth that make me cry, but Neptune Oyster's hot lobster roll is one.Cold can be done -- but hot ?? Chunky, delicious, perfect texture lobster meat covered in warm butter (not too dripping, not too dry) stuffed in a locally-supplied toasted brioche bun with the right amount of "soak" needed for the butter.You just shed a tear, didn't you. I did.Quality seafood and ingredients, creative gourmet entrees. Neptune has the feeling of being an old school, classy place, with top of the line service and food -- and somehow, they add in a comfortable, inviting warmth to the small, cozy space.I look forward to going completely out of my way to frequent this place. I enjoy waiting for a table. I love Neptune Oyster.

Reviews.Author: Vivian H.
Reviews.Content: OH my god. My boyfriend and I were like moaning during our meal, it was so good.No reservations. There was a horrific estimate of a 1.5 hour ("maybe more") wait when we arrived at 7:30, but they called us in 30 minutes. Unfortunately we went ahead and ate dessert first so we weren't that hungry, but we can always still eat.We ordered a selection of OYSTERS, CLAMS, & CRAB LEGS. The oysters were the star, but of course it is an oyster bar. We followed that up with NEPTUNES ON PIGGYBACK (crispy oysters, Berkshire pig, golden raisin confiture, pistachio aioli), which was when the moaning started.  The raisins made it sweet, the pork salty, a little crunch from the oyster (I couldn't taste it over the pig though), lots of greens on top... ah, heaven. After that delightful treat, our LOBSTER ROLL w/butter arrived, with more lobster than I've eaten in my lifetime and a mountain of perfectly crisp fries. It was simple but perfectly executed. Moaning continued. The bread wasn't toasted like I thought it would be, but I guess you can't have something crunchy with that much butter on it. :POur bartender/server was awesome and knowledgeable. There's no A/C in there and it's a tight space, but it makes for a more special dining experience I think, and I assume quality control in the kitchen.

Reviews.Author: Elaine C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobster roll and really good oysters! I thought the clam chowder was okay though. I prefer my chowder to be thick.Quick service once you're seated.

Reviews.Author: Pete J.
Reviews.Content: Not much to add that hasn't already been written by other reviewers, get the hot lobster roll - pricey at $25, but worth every penny. Had a selection of oysters and crab claws to start, all delicious.Our party of 6 did have to wait (expected) and love the idea of getting our cellphone number and calling when we are ready. Gave us the opportunity to go have drinks first at the bar on the corner. More restaurants should do this. Sure it may make your restaurant look cool and trendy to have a line outside, but this is Boston not Miami.Service was efficient.Can't wait until the next time I can go again!

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: Raw oysters were delicious. Lobster role was crunchy, buttery and full of lobster. Scallops were heavenly!! They came with some small greens (I think mini brussel sprouts???) and some shredded meat and garlic..droool...Definitely Recommended.We went at 2pm on 12/14  and the place was pretty empty (maybe it's a winter thing). If you are going to order from the raw menu, avoid the crab claw, 8-9 bucks isn't really worth it, just get a few more oysters.

Reviews.Author: Victor C.
Reviews.Content: This place is as cramped as it gets during lunch but the food is so good. Not my style of clam chowder but the lobster rolls were delicious. You want to savor it but you end up eating it all in one bite.And the best thing is that even though it's crowded, you don't have to wait. You can just give them your phone number and they'll call you when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Nancy L.
Reviews.Content: Best.(hot) Lobster Roll.Ever. The chilled lobster roll that I had in Jordan Pond in Acadia was amazing, but the hot lobster roll (with butter) here tops ever other one I've had, and the fries that came with it were also very good. Although the roll is a bit pricey ($25), it's worth every penny. We also had FRESH oysters and clams for appetizer. They have a very good selection of oysters from MA, WA, BC, etc etc. I really liked the ones from New Brunswick; those were tiny, but soooo soooo sooo good. The local ones were huge, but I still like the NB ones better. =PAnyway, if I'm in Boston again, this place is a must! Can't wait to be back...PS: there's usually a wait here, but they take your cell phone number and you can just come back when they call you.

Reviews.Author: Derrick T.
Reviews.Content: Made my way here away from my conference to get a meal with my best man.  Multiple citations of having the best lobster roll in town (which they better have, at $25 a roll), so I had to give it a whirl.Very crowded, so get here early, and then expect to go wander the streets of Boston or hang out at a bar somewhere to wait for them to call you when your seat is ready.  (Excellent choice by the way, instead of forcing people to wait around outside the restaurant).Sat down and ordered up a slew of oysters to try, two lobsters rolls (one hot, one cold), Neptune's on Piggback, and Clam Chowder.  Here's the word:Clam Chowder:  Excellent flavor, very fresh tasting ingredients from the clams to the potatoes and herbs.  A bit watery for my tastes (probably because I grew up on thick creamy Campbells like 95% of the US population), but even with the wateriness, there was no lacking in flavor.  Neptune's on Piggyback - Oh lordy, this was good... perfectly fried oysters on well made pork with golden raisins and pistachio aioli.  This is some fine dining... my only regrets are that I had to share this with my friend, and that there wasn't more when we licked the plate clean.Oysters and clams:  We ordered up a selection of Katama Bay, Bees River, Kumomoto, Kusshi, Little Necks, and Cherrystones.  All were excellent, fresh and delicious... stand outs were the Kumomoto (large and good flavor), as well as the Katama Bays.  Lobster Rolls:  The main course... we dove into the cold (mayo based) and hot (garlic oil based) and compared the two.  Maybe it was the slightly chilled rainy day, but I preferred the hot with the warm garlic oil softening the nicely toasted bread.  Both were excellent, the lobsters were cooked perfectly tender, and very enjoyable.  $25 worth?  I'm not fully convinced... you'll have to decide that for yourself... but definitely the best lobster roll I've had to date.Verdict:  If you've got time in Boston and don't 'mind a little wait, definitely worth checking out for the raw bar, the Neptune on Piggyback, and potentially the lobster roll.  I would love to go back for raw bar and Neptune on Piggyback alone, and still undecided about the lobster roll.  Perhaps trying some more lobster rolls will give me some better perspective...

Reviews.Author: Kelly O.
Reviews.Content: What else can I add... $25 hot buttered lobster roll (plus the tasty fries!) was totally worth every penny and I was a very very happy girl after my lunch here yesterday.Other notes: There was already a line at 11:25 waiting for the place to open but the 2 of us were able to sit right away come 11:30, so I recommend going that route. We sat at the bar, and the bartender was helpful, friendly, and efficient, plus we got to see some shucking going on first-hand (didn't order anything but the main meal for fear of wasting precious stomach space). The bread on my lobster roll was so soaked with butter that it fell apart and broke into 2 pieces (not a bad thing mind you, but I did end up losing one chunk to the floor which was so depressing, plus I had to change up my eating strategy). The boy wasn't as pleased with the burger as many Yelpers here, he doesn't eat oysters or mayo so had his without and thus didn't find it anything special, plus the burger was too grey for his liking (and his fries weren't as crispy as mine), hence the -1 star.

Reviews.Author: Allie L.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING. I was only visiting Boston for literally 5 hours before my flight and our friend in Boston suggested we go to Neptune.I love:-they give you a card with wonderful descriptions on what kinds of oysters they offer -great service-gorgeous interior-large bar seatingIt was pretty crowded at around 2pm on a weekday so I have a feeling we got in pretty fast compared to peak lunch/dinner hours.GO HERE!

Reviews.Author: Theresa C.
Reviews.Content: LARGE chunks of lobster...that's the way I like my lobster rolls and that's the way they do it at Neptune!  I tried the hot and cold lobster roll and I think the winner is the hot lobster roll.  The saltiness of the butter I think balanced well with the sweetness of the lobster.  The cold lobster roll just seemed overly sweet to me from the mayo.  The fries that come with the lobster roll were nothing to write home about....potato drenched in oil and soggy.  But obviously I didn't come for fries...The oyster selection is one of the largest I have seen on a menu and extremely fresh.  Little morsels of delight!  If you are going to order an appetizer, Neptunes on Piggyback is memorable....Berkshire pork and a fried oyster with a golden raisin confiture, pistachio aioli over crispy crostini....perfect combination of flavors.The service is a little slow here....and it's SMALL....so get ready to wait if you want to eat here!

Reviews.Author: Erin O.
Reviews.Content: If there is a problem with Neptune Oyster, it was that it took 5 minutes to leave our name at the door.  From that point on, the flow was smooth. We left our name with them, and walked down the street to grab a drink.  It is small, be prepared to wait.Because you're only tethered by a phonecall... the wait didn't bug me at all. Especially because I knew this was the case going in.  When we got back, we were seated quickly. We ordered a mixed dozen raw oysters, a naked lobster roll, and Neptunes on Piggyback and the buttermilk johnnycake.  Everything was delicious.  I admit, probably the weakest dish were a few of the oysters. Each type was very different in terms of salinity and texture, and I should know by know that I love Kumamotos, and it the aren't Kumamotos, I probably don't want them.  Their Kumamotos were wonderful, and the mignionette was very good.  The two appetizers were both excellent. I'd have them again in a heartbeat.  The crowning gem really was that lobster roll. It was stellar, with lots of very sweet tailmeat in the sandwich.  The staff was friendly, though a touch spacey at times. I felt like anything we needed was addressed, and it was just the dining experience I wanted.  I'd go back again in a heartbeat if I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Lisa N.
Reviews.Content: What is your most memorable meal?I can assure you...it will be here at Neptune Oyster.I had the absolutely BEST MEAL ON EARTH!!! And..it WILL be my last meal on Earth. You HAVE to get the LOBSTER ROLL! Make sure it's the "hot" vs the "cold". The Hot Lobster Roll is butter based and warm. The Cold Lobster Roll is Mayonnaise based and of course, cold. It comes with a side of yummy french fries. ALL I can say is, "OMG! OMG!" The waiter gave me props for "doing my hw" and knowing what to order. Their oysters are absolutely...the most fresh and yummiest oysters ever!!! They were so good, melt in your mouth kind of good. The restaurant: very small, but classy. I love it. Only enough space for one bathroom. Of course, not enough space to even walk through comfortably without bumping a person sitting at the bar. Let me just say, I loved this place so much, I came back for lunch and dinner the next day. I actually wanted to come every night there on out for dinner, but I didn't want to regret not trying other restaurants in the North End while in Boston! (however, I do slightly regret not doing so cuz I am craving for a lobster roll)The service was great! The waiters are attentive and the table was always cleaned. My fiance left for the restroom to wash his hands and the waiter came over and refilled our water, and he refolded my fiances napkin. wow.The staff is overall WONDERFUL..the FOOD however..is BEYOND WONDERFUL...I will pay to go back to BOSTON just for the LOBSTER ROLL!!!Ok..on another note, we were there again Monday night and my fiance had their Monday night special Lobster pasta. OMG! Another WINNER!!!! gosh i love this place. yeah, our bill was about $120 each time, but it is SOOO WORTH IT!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jenny T.
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston to visit a good friend who's studying at Northeastern. We waited for at least 2 hours to get in here, and it was a pretty small place, but it was worth it.The oysters were excellent! My fave was the Kumamoto, which had a slightly salty, fruity finish. I also had an amazing lobster roll. If you happen to be on a really long wait, you can walk around to Mike's Pastry to grab some desserts, or just walk around the area. There are plenty of cute shops!

Reviews.Author: Adrianne H.
Reviews.Content: Order:Mussels in red curry broth with garlic. Really fantastic!Clam chowder was aiiiight. Nothing spectacular. Blood Orange bellini isn't too bad but again, nothing out of this world.I did not try the oysters but my friend said they were really great and she loved the fact that the oyster list came with descriptions on the tastes. I agree!

Reviews.Author: Rachel N.
Reviews.Content: LOVE. Simply prepared, gorgeous seafood. Go early (like, be there when the doors open, early), and even then, be prepared to wait 1.5-3 hours for the honor of slurping on some of Boston's finest oysters, and the like.Space is cramped and loud, but kind of pleasant -- if you can learn to willfully ignore the billion people vying for your table.Din will easily run $100/pp -- but it's always worth it. If making a res is more your style, you're SOL here, but try B&G Oysters in the South End -- equally bitchin' food, but w/ the bonus of having the ability to manage your wait if you book on of their illustrious tables.

Reviews.Author: Ryan F.
Reviews.Content: If you can't figure it out from the reviews, you're going to wait. At least an hour. We waited for 2 hours at lunch.In the end, the food didn't warrant the wait. Yes it was good, but it wasn't mind-blowing. The lobster roll was generous but it better be for $25. Everything was good, but not worth the wait.4 stars for the food but 2 for the wait and pricing.

Reviews.Author: Emily L.
Reviews.Content: The classic: oysters and a hot buttery lobster roll :-) The wait is around an hour and the host will call you when your table is ready. Also, I think this place has to be in every Asian tourist book.

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: When I heard how long the wait was I initially was very hesitant as typically places that are full all the time come with snotty service and treat you like they are doing you a favor to eat at their place.  NOT here ! Wait isn't to bad because you give them your name and then go have drinks across the street until they call you And Wow was worth the wait all the way.Great Food and Great serviceTry the Buttermilk JohnnyCake

Reviews.Author: Yappy O.
Reviews.Content: This place is a tourist trap.  It was fun experience but very touristy.  Oysters are on a menu posted like fine wine made it a little to fu-fu for me.  It was fun trying the different oysters from different regions but variance was so slight.   The world famous Lobster Rolls were just OK to me.  For me if it could have been a Oyster Bar only at would have made it a little more special.  I was felt the clam chowda was overrated as well.  The kick was how much everything was $$$ for just an OK lunch.  All in all it was very fun and it was one of those places I enjoyed doing but no true desire to return.

Reviews.Author: Jack X.
Reviews.Content: I had heard great things about this restaurant before actually eating here and I was not disappointed. When I went to Neptune Oyster it was for my cousin's b-day and while there are a few complaints about location and spacing the food was better than anywhere else in Boston. It is in the North End of Boston so there is no parking and theres so much traffic you shoudlnt even think about driving. The place is also pretty packed so be sure to call for a reservation or be ready for wait for half an hour. That being said, the food we had that night was terrific,1. Fried Clams - delicious and not greasy, full of flavour 2. Clam Chowder - not your thick tasteless clam chowder but a full body chowder which is light and packed with clams - best chowder Ive ever had3. Lobster Roll - $27 and worth every dollar, the roll itself is huge, with a whole lobster packed into it. Your choice of butter or mayo (I went with butter) and it was just.... delicious (not like those crappy lobster rolls at fanueil hall and much better quality than Kellys)4. Fish and Chips - delicious fresh fried fish - you cant go wrong..Overall my experience was great even though the restaurant was packed... mainly due to how great the food was here. When compared with any other restaurant Ive gone to in Boston, this one definitely comes up top.

Reviews.Author: Natalie L.
Reviews.Content: believe the hype!waited 2 hours to eat here.. i'm not sure if i would ever wait that long again but the warm lobster roll was amazing. huge and plentiful lobster chunks with just the right amount of butter ;)the raw bar is also great. oysters were good but i'd pass on the clams. maybe a personal preference.food itself is worth 5 stars but the 2 hour wait plus the lack of A/C on a HOT july day justifies taking away a star.

Reviews.Author: Luci H.
Reviews.Content: Absolfreakinlutely worth the 2-4 hour wait. We got to sit at the raw bar, and watching them shuck oysters in front of us was a treat, and the service was great. Such a small place, and so friendly. We had a variety of oysters, all delicious. HAD to order the warm lobster roll with butter. I died. Maybe three times while eating it. It was that good. And while you're waiting, plenty of great places around to have a drink. The hostess will call you when the table is ready, so go pre-game for what is sure to be an epic meal.

Reviews.Author: Mandy A.
Reviews.Content: Pushing 1000 reviews, I'm sure you don't need one more five-star review from a tourist who loves lobster but I'm going to go ahead anyways.We got here right as it opened at 11:30am on a Tuesday which was a good call.  By the time we left at 12:15pm, the place was packed and about six people were waiting outside.  They don't take reservations and at a certain point at night, they realize they can't take any more groups on their list, they call it.  (Hence why we came back for lunch the following day...)We sat at the bar and ordered four shrimp cocktail as big as your ears and each got a lobster roll, one hot and one cold.  I dug the hot one and husband liked the cold mayo one better.  Both were good but you can definitely taste the lobster more in the butter.  Which makes sense now, husband loves to drench all food in condiments so that's all you taste...Anyways, not a cheap lunch but a great spot, full of character and amazing food.

Reviews.Author: Ted W.
Reviews.Content: I am officially declaring this to be the best burger in boston. Maybe the eastern seaboard. The oysters were perfect. Just the way Hemmingway described them.  I liked the lobster roll but is wasn't a religious experience for me. The Johnny cake though.. That's a totally different ball of wax. It will change your life. HFS that thing is good. It might be my most favorite food right now. I've been twice when it wasn't too busy. And both times I enjoyed the strangers sitting next to me. Best time to go is a Sunday afternoon I think.

Reviews.Author: Eileen B.
Reviews.Content: Did not have a chance to have the oysters!  Will definitely come back for that.So what are the five stars for?  The FANTABULOUS Ciopini (seafood stew).  The spices were just right, large shrimp, clams, mussels... yummmmm.  The atmosphere was great, friendly co diners too.  Not touristy which adds to two stars right there!  If you visit Boston, this is a must!
