Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: The hot buttered lobster roll is TO DIE FOR! If you don't want it to literally contribute to your death, they will kindly give you a salad instead of the french fries. It was honestly the best meal I have had within memory. I mean think about- when you crack a lobster yourself, you dip it in butter. Here at Neptune Oyster they have cracked the lobster, dipped it in butter, and put it in a warm roll for you. It is perfect!Except- there are no reservations, no place to wait, and no parking. Come early and be prepared to wait. They will take your name & number down once you are there so you can run down the street for a drink until you get a seat.

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: I went here on Mother's Day - Try the fish tacos on Sundays, AMAZING!!!  The pieces of fish were large, juicy and lightly fried.  stuff them into the flour tortillas and sprinkle some lemon and lime juice on it and you're good to go!  I forget the names of the fish but one was Atlantic salmon and the other was some kind of white fish, really really good, best fish tacos I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: T T.
Reviews.Content: Not nearly as good as it's made out to be.  I was disappointed in many ways with both the food and the service and would not go back.Clam chowder - Gritty, too much cream, very little seafood flavor.Neptunes on piggyback (fried oysters, pork, golden raisin confiture, pistachio aioli) - The combination of oysters and raisins was nice.  It was the best dish of the meal, but it was just pretty good.  Lobster roll - Way too buttery. The roll was essentially soaked in butter, and butter was leaking from the sides.  I couldn't actually taste the lobster since there was so much butter, and the sandwich left a very unpleasant butter aftertaste.  The fries were overcooked, and many were burnt.  Scallops with pork, Brussels sprouts, pear, blue cheese - I thought that scallops and pork seemed like an unusual combination worth trying, but the flavors did not meld.  The blue cheese really overpowered the dish, and the pork was very dry.  The pear sauce was actually quite nice but didn't make up for the rest of the dish.One of the waiters was very rude and essentially laughed when I asked him a question.  Overall, the food was very rich and not very good.

Reviews.Author: Sara E.
Reviews.Content: Holy taste explosion, Batman.Be flexible with what time you'd like to eat, stop by the tiny and cute Neptune Oyster, give your name and phone number, and take a walk around the adorable North End neighborhood surrounding it.Once you're called back, and hopefully sat at the bar (otherwise you are SO FAR away from the people you're dining with), and with beer or wine in hand, take a look around. This place really couldn't get any cuter and while they could cut down the waiting time by moving to a larger location, that would take away from the warmth and feel of the place. I had the hot lobster roll with french fries - I highly recommend this for all first-timers. Shellfish allergy, you say? Go ahead and rock that puffy look, I say. It's worth it.The lobster roll itself can either be served hot with butter or cold with mayo, but of course I'm gonna recommend the hot, buttery, melt-in-your mouth, dribble-down-your-chin one. A-mazing. I plan to go back to try the likes of their cold bar, shrimp, and crab claws. But let's be honest, when I see that lobster roll on the menu again, I know what I'm *really* going to go for.

Reviews.Author: Richie C.
Reviews.Content: Having been to several sea food places in Boston, this is by far my favorite restaurant and go-to-place to take people out for good food.The raw oyster selection is fantastic, compared to other decent places like Island Creek Bar, the oysters just taste so fresh and delicious.  Creamy, briney, melt in your mouth goodness.I've had their lobster roll, which is a great one, but a bit steep for the price.  If you want generous amounts of lobster sandwiched between a bun, I'd go to Alive & Kicking Lobsters for a cheaper affair.  Their burger is so juicy and so tasty, definitely one of the top burgers I've had.  The monkfish cassoulet isn't a standout, although their octopus is great in texture.  The johyncake is a mixture of buttery savory pancakes topped with the delicious salty umami of smoked fish and caviar, definitely worth getting.  I am also a huge fan of the ceviche and tartars.  Worth the wait, but I usually go at inopportune times.  The given wait time is typically much shorter in reality though.

Reviews.Author: Matt R.
Reviews.Content: Living in St. Louis now, I develop massive cravings for certain things...one of which is a lobster roll.  So when I knew I was coming to town I immediately began both salivating and looking for a place to satiate my need.Needless to say Neptune was up to the task (both cold and hot lobster rolls were great), and I didn't mind the fact that they were $25 apiece.  That said, as good as the lobster roll was, their fried clams might have surpassed it.  Simply the best I've had.  It can't replace the experience of sitting at a picnic table on the cape with your feet dangling in the sand, but good lord they were good.Well played Neptune, well played.

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: We went on a Friday night and had to wait an hour and a half.  Seemed like it is alway like this since it is a small restaurant.  Get the clam chowder for soup-excellent.  My wife and I got the lobster roll due to yelp recommendations and her brother got the lobster.  It was a 1.25  lb (I think) lobster for $43 - not bad.  It also came with many sides.  The food and service was excellent and well worth the wait and money.  Tip: They do not take reservations but you can stop by and give your phone number.  Then go down the street for some drinks and they will call you when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Terry C.
Reviews.Content: Do you like Lobstah?  How about buttah?  and a buttery roll?  and maybe some fresh Oysters?  Then please do come to Neptune Oyster!I was here over the weekend and the meal was absolutely delicious; service was great as well.  Neptune is a quaint little place so the wait can be a huge downside.  They do not take reservations but will take your phone number so that you are free to wander over to a cafe on Hanover Street while you wait.For appetizers, the group ordered a few oysters, the shrimp cocktail and the mussel.  All the appetizers were great.  I like that the give you back the oyster menu so that we can read the name & description as we eat them.  I ordered the lobster roll for an entree (warm which is with butter), if you prefer it cold, its with mayo.  My lobster roll was Heavenly with big pieces of lobster over-flowing on the buttery bun.  The side of fries was also delicious; i like crispy fries, so it was perfect.  The rest of the group ordered the Cioppino and a lobster roll with mayo for entrees and they were all really good.Neptune also has an extensive wine menu in case the lobster roll/raw bar is not enough to lure you in.

Reviews.Author: Michelle P.
Reviews.Content: Just one bite out of my hot buttered lobster roll, I knew it was a match made in heaven.  I nearly shed a tear when a big chunk of lobster fell off my overstuffed brioche roll and onto the ground (what a waste).  The fries were good, but the lobster roll stole the show on my platter.They have a large selection of oysters and other neat goodies at the raw bar.  Will I come back?  Most definitely. But probably before noon since this place had a line out the door.

Reviews.Author: Snuffles B.
Reviews.Content: Neptune made me realize that old people eat at 5 not because they go to sleep at 9, but because thats the secret to getting seated and served FAST. And by fast at Neptune, I mean if you get there at 5:30 on a Tues, you only have to wait 30 mins and it only takes 30 mins to get your food. - Oysters - Big selection, fresh, no surprise here- Clam chowder - Thin, "light" and chock full o'clams, move over Legals.- Neptunes on piggyback - Juicy fried clams, (B&G's are better, did same day back-to-back comparison) but overall unique and tasty- Hot lobster roll - Heaping fresh delicious chunks , but the butter laden roll needs some work. The fries were pretty pointless.Worth waiting 30 mins to do some catching up with Grandma? Definitely. Worth waiting 2 hrs for a cramped seat that has a 50% chance of being next to the kitchen, front door, or bathroom for at the price tag of $50+ per person? Not so much - go to Island Creek or B&G instead for comparable (if not better) food, prices, no wait with a reservation, and far superior service and atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Caro M.
Reviews.Content: For the sake of redundancy, I am going to rate this fine establishment five stars out of five along with all the other reviews, boosting up its insanely inflated ego as having the best Labsta Rolls in town.And it's true. Their lobster roll is god damn amazing. Well worth the $25. Not just because of their lobster, but the freakin' bun. I don't know what kind of bun it is, but it was fluffy and yummy and made me forget about how fat I'd be after consuming it. I also ate a ton of the fries that came along with the lobster roll... the thing was, I didn't even order this. I was like a seagull eating off of my friends plate... a true moocher.For myself, I ordered the mussels in the curry sauce. Super yummy! Request some extra bread and you're in heaven. The sauce was mind blowing.If I knew I was dying tomorrow, I'd eat up their entire menu today. This is definitely a destination to visit while in Boston. Worth the 2.5 hour wait!

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find things to say about this place that haven't already been said... It was definitely worth the wait, and the wait wasn't nearly as long as I was expecting. On a Thursday night around 7pm we put our name in, walked around the block once and had a spot for two at the bar.I agree with other reviewers that it's preferable to sit at the bar. Some of the tables looked a little uncomfortable.Great local beer list and helpful staff behind the bar. The oysters were super fresh-- we tried several different kinds and all their written flavor descriptions were spot on! The lobster roll was amazing, but the scallop/duck dish was a little disappointing. Small portion for the price and a little bland.Stick with beer, oysters and lobster, and this place is a knockout!

Reviews.Author: Anne H.
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, typically small North End restaurant which manages to seem like a 19th-century relic even though it's relatively new. The atmosphere is wonderful -- check out the wall-mounted fans with elaborate cast-iron bases, and the pressed tin ceiling. Someone put a lot of thought into this room. And the oysters are the best I've had in Boston (the wine list is stellar as well). Can't speak for most of the entrees, because I can't eat 'em, but my husband enjoyed his yellowtail salad. (Also, the prices are quite reasonable, given the quality of food and service.)Celiacs: the kitchen here is small, and the bartender advised me that he wouldn't recommend chancing a request for a celiac-friendly version of any of their cooked dishes. But the oysters are delicious and safely prepared far away from any breadcrumbs.P.S. Should Neptune lose points for being tiny? I don't think so -- I enjoy  smaller restaurants, personally. I'd rather go to a small "neighborhood" place than a big scene-y restaurant, especially for oysters. Most North End restaurants are crowded and small, actually, so if you're prone to claustrophobia, you should probably dine in another neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: stephanie c.
Reviews.Content: LOVED this place!! Kept hearing about it, but finally came out on Friday lunch to try it. Packed! Tiny restaurant and always busy. I like raw oysters but never really crave it....that was about to change.Love the variety of oysters they had, the descriptions, and how incredibly spot on and fresh it all was. Truly a great oyster bar experience even for newbies. It was like wine tasting...but with oysters. We also had a bottle of white wine which complimented the oysters perfectly!! Great wine list.Everything was incredibly fresh, incredibly tasty. Also had the octopus sashimi, clam chowder, and fried clams. Everything was superb!! Best clam chowder I've had in Boston. Not too rich and creamy, fresh clams, light and tasty. None of that superficial touristy clam chowder deal. Pricey but absolutely loved the food and experience and it is now a noted favorite in Boston!!

Reviews.Author: Linda M.
Reviews.Content: Visiting Boston for the first time, I decided to come here because of all the yelp reviews.I arrived around noon and the place was already half packed.  The fresh oysters looked amazing, but I didn't taste them.  My lunch companion got a few oysters and told me that they tasted very fresh.I ended up ordering what everyone orders - the lobster roll.  Actually, I got a cold lobster roll and my friend got a hot lobster roll and then we traded half and half.  The cold lobster roll has mayo and was good, but there were some overcooked rubbery pieces of lobster in it.  I thought I would like the cold lobster roll more, but really, the hot lobster roll is soooooo much better than the cold one.  All the lobster in the hot roll was cooked perfectly, and the lobster takes on the buttery flavor well.  And, as all the other reviews state, there was so much lobster, I didn't know what to do with it all!The service was excellent.  Our waiter was super friendly, almost comical, joked around with us, and made sure that our meal was perfectly timed (he had the lobster rolls fired just as he saw us finish appetizers).  Overall, it was a great, although pricey experience, and I wouldn't mind doing so again as long as I get a hot lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Peter K.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll and oyster burger. Need I say more?Best I have ever had in every which way possible.Tiny tiny place and you will need to wait a long long time but it is so worth it.Will definitely be coming here every time I come to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca Z.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of my favorite restaurants in all of Boston. I usually go here when the weather is hot and I want to eat fried things and have a really good, relaxing experience in an intimate (but not stuffy) setting.Prices are a bit steep, so I tend to avoid entrees so I can share some appetizers and oysters with my party. They usually have several varieties of oysters. My favorites are the kumamotos and the wellfleets.The best dishes are the fried oysters, the cioppino (In fact, their cioppino is my gold standard by which all other cioppinos are compared), and the hot lobster roll with butter. The service is attentive and friendly. Try to visit during off hours to avoid a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is my favorite restaurant in Boston.The lobster roll (hot) is the best I've ever had.The oysters are reliably happy -- we always get 3-4 per person to start a meal. Great to try different fresh, brisk flavors... especially when complimented by a very nice house prosecco.Most of the appetizers and crudo options are outstanding, and the fish is always perfect.Service is super happy -- really like the people there. Also love that they call your cell phone when a table is ready -- thanks for letting me not have to wait there! Confusingly, a lot of people seem pissed about the wait, but I'd like to say these high maintenance folks should really be happy about the quality of the food they're about to get. Chill, yo.I happened to be at this restaurant the night before "The Town" came out; apparently part of that movie was filmed at Neptune Oyster?Some notes about things I try to avoid: there's a veal and tuna sandwich I tried once which might not be super recommended, but interesting as a concept. Also, I'm not the biggest fan of the chowder. On my last visit, I tried a raw clam for the first time -- and I really appreciated the experience (this was certainly as good as raw clam gets) -- but I have to say, it was a little too much for me; fresh, brisk, ocean-y, oyster-on-steroids-ish, crunchy-but-not-too-much, yet altogether a larger bite than which I'm comfortable.So to sum up -- this place is absolutely fabulous, a destination restaurant for Boston.

Reviews.Author: Jenzy Y.
Reviews.Content: This is a true oyster bar. We could easily sit here and eat oysters for a whole day. The wait was well worth it. We were sat at the bar which was quite nice. We seemed to have more space than the patrons at tables. Of course, we had to try the oysters. We tried oysters from big bold-flavored ones (Wellfleet) to the small light-flavored ones (Kusshi). I quite liked the smaller, less salty oysters (Kumamato and Kusshi). The bar menu is great because if you are unfamiliar with oysters, there was some description of them so you know what to expect. We had to try the infamous hot lobster roll. We quickly found out that it takes 2 bites to clog the arteries. I'm sure a whole stick of butter was used on the 1 roll. Boy, was it delicious. The lobster meat was tender and full of flavor. The bread was very tasty and well baked. The sides were toasted just right and the middle was fluffy. We also ordered a bowl of clam chowder. This was unlike other chowders that I've tasted. The chowder was lighter; almost soup-like. I liked how not one of the ingredients overpowered the soup; some chowders that I've had were very potato-heavy. There were good sized clams in the shop; very good. Another dish we ordered was the Buttermild Johnny Cake. The Johnny Cake was cooked very well. It was thin but still flavorful. The smoked trout tartare and caviar was icing on the cake - literally!

Reviews.Author: Joey R.
Reviews.Content: I went to Neptune's Oyster will on a recent trip to Boston. I originally went on a Thursday around 8. They were completely full for the night so I wasn't able to get a table that night. Unfortunately the do not take reservations either. I heard such great things about it that I decided to go around 3 the next day and get my name on the list. 2 hours later we had a table. The wait wasn't bad since they call you when your table is ready so you can leave once your name is on the list. So glad we decided to give it a go! The lobster roll was amazing and they had an extensive selection of oysters. Great place!

Reviews.Author: Alex A.
Reviews.Content: great atmosphere and service.  Upscale, and great oyster bar.

Reviews.Author: Tracy T.
Reviews.Content: Thank god 3 o'clock on Tuesdays exist or else I never would have experienced this glory of a restaurant. My boyfriend and I had been jonesing to go here for months, and every time we stepped foot near here it was always on a Friday night. Note: DON'T come here on a Friday night. Also, don't expect them to seat yer sorry ass within a half hour on the weekend or even after 6 on weekdays. There ain't no reservations here, honey.While I was very excited to go here, my man-friend was even more so, having been dreaming lobster roll dreams since we heard how good they were here from someone. Our waitress (extremely patient and forgiving of our incompetence) suggested our appetizers, which were both amazing. We got the Neptunes on Piggyback, and I'm not talking about Pharrell and Chad piggybacking (hehe...eh.....). They were oysters, crisped, smothered in saucy goodness. There was also a large plate of raw oysters ordered, which at the time I was so not into, them looking like snot and all. We ordered our entrees and as soon as they arrived, we were greeted with hilarious caricatures of what we were expecting. Almost disbelieving the size of them. The heaping pile of lobster swallowed the roll my boyfriend got, and was covered in butter. No extra fancy-ness like mayo or what have you (which they offer). Just buttah. My scallops were as big as Tom Hardys head in The Dark Knight Rises and just as saucy. We devoured everything with the liquid helping of an oyster stout (can't quite recall the brand, but oyster stouts are never bad. Ever.)I can say, with much enthusiasm, that I will be returning here in about 3 years when the next table frees up and I have room in my belleh.

Reviews.Author: Jules K.
Reviews.Content: The food gods have guided me for years and my third visit to Neptune was testament to their power.  After a long day of moving daughter out of BU (the moving in review is below) I was exhausted and left her to party with her friends.  Upon returning to the Park Plaza I surveyed the neighborhood and resigned myself to eat at Legal Seafood (just some fish and white wine I kept telling myself, how can they screw that up?).  As I was walking toward the door a couple passed me and I overheard this comment:  "I have been tricked into going to Legal Seafood three times and each time it sucked"....This was a message to go forth and find dinner.  I started walking through the Theatre District and then passed the common without purpose when it hit me, I was heading to North End and a return to Neptune Oyster.  And I was rewarded.Sitting at the bar with cordial service (not cloying but friendly enough) and  a good local ale I started with a grilled sardine, yes one large grilled sardine, over a slice of pancetta with wedge of iceberg lettuce and blue cheese dressing and did it work.  The main was a local bass over a perfect succotash (fresh peas, green beans, and a touch of pancetta) topped with a light vinaigrette.  Every ingredient shined and the flavors weren't buried by unnecessary saucing.Really enjoyed the glass of brocheto (I think that is what they called it) for dessert, a slightly sweet Italian sparkler and walked home to the hotel a happy satisfied customer.I can't agree more with the other reviewers, this place a gem and the third time was the charm.  I try not to return to restaurants but I will be going back to Neptune.  Sure, it is a little rough around the edges, if you want to be coddled, go somewhere else....And 9 months ago.....We hit the Neptune Oyster bar twice in two days, once for dinner with the hon and then for lunch the next day with hon an daughter freed from her orientation at BU and starving.Dinner first.  Got to sit next to wife, always a plus, clam chowder was very good lots of clams and agree with Jenny, the home made oyster crackers were great.  I also agree that $3 a shrimp is very steep as was the chowder ($11).  Still the oysters were wonderful and we left full and content although I admit as someone not from the area the lobster roll (hot) left me confused.  The brioche was knockout though.Lunch was equally pricey, I was stunned at the $10 fruit/champagne cocktails, not the quality but the price of these drinks.    The chowder at lunch was a bit salty and while I could forgive it at a lesser price for that money the chowder has to be perfect.  We spent over 100 on soup, salads and drinks....So the atmosphere is five stars and the wine list is solid and the food is four stars but because of the price structure it just slips it down to three.

Reviews.Author: Kate S.
Reviews.Content: I would go so far as to say this is one of my favorite restaurants in Boston.  The oysters are, of course, delicious, but I think that the main course is what makes it special.  Here are things you must eat:1) The clam chowder (TO DIE FOR)2) The veal and tuna tartar sandwich (OUT OF THIS WORLD)Make a reservation if you're going at any popular time.The best time to go is on a lazy sunday afternoon, when it's almost empty in there.  Otherwise, it can feel a bit crowded.

Reviews.Author: Tracy L.
Reviews.Content: You can't be in Boston without trying the purported best lobster roll, right? And so, the foodie travels continued!The three of us ordered a trio of oyster twins, one of which I've forgotten the name of (it wasn't that delicious, but was okay), the nice Martha's vineyard ones, and the west coast Kumamoto? Something that sounded Japanese, at least. All were nice and fresh, although I personally did not enjoy the west coast ones. We also tried the clam chowder and hamachi, both of which were quite good. The chowder really has real clams in it, and you can even see them, which is refreshing. I loved the sauce the hamachi was in...the flavors melded quite nicely.And, yes, the lobster rolls. We had one cold and one hot. In each the chunks of lobster were so huge and so succulent that I nearly couldn't believe it. Really, really, delicious. Between the hot and the cold, I lean slightly to the hot, as the hot butter all over lobster and soaking into the roll is really delicious, not to say that cold mayo isn't good. It just kind of depends on the mood. The thing is though, they're $25/roll...so...if I were on my own, suddenly craving lobster roll, I'd probably go to Alive and Kicking for something more affordable. The fries with the lobster rolls were almost good too, but really too salty. Really, really salty. I had to brush off the salt before they were edible.Neptune Oyster has great food, to be sure, but nothing mindblowing. But if you seek fresh seafood, a nice live bar, or excellent lobster rolls then look no further. Just make sure your wallet can handle it first.

Reviews.Author: Y C.
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to yelp about this place  but once Ben Affleck's movie, The Town, comes out, the tourist hordes are going to come anyways so I might as well just shout it from the rooftop.Amazing food. Any place that can render me speechless with one bite is something special. In addition to their raw bar, you've got to try out their caesar salad, made with real anchovies, and the amazing, juicy, delectable neptune burger. It's a tasty hunk of beef with fried oysters on top. Yes fried oysters. But even without, it's still good. And the pomme frites are so good. And the rest of their entrees are incredible. I could go on but you get the drift.Prepare for a wait because it is a small location but it's so worth the wait. So worth it.

Reviews.Author: Garnet S.
Reviews.Content: Best oyster selection in all of Boston! All perfectly cleaned, shucked and presented. The quality of everything was amazing!I sat there on a Sunday afternoon/evening with my future husband and we made it through over 4 dozen oysters and clams before we called it quits.We each had 3 glasses of white, tried lots of different ones. They have some interesting wines I haven't really seen anywhere else by the glass.Neptune Oyster is a great place to snag a seat at the bar and watch your oysters being shucked if you're at the end by the door.

Reviews.Author: Krista D.
Reviews.Content: I think if the service had not been so terrible I might have had a better experience. But from what I saw around the rest of the restaurant this was the exception and not the rule. We waited about 15 minutes before we flagged someone down to take our appetizer order and still had not received a wine menu. When a couple was seated next to us the waiter was there within 5 minutes to tell them the specials and take their drink order. Oh, okay, it's just us getting bad service - awesome. For food I tried both the hot and cold lobster rolls. So, being from Texas, I had never had a lobster roll before. After looking on Yelp, this seemed to be the place to try one. I have to say I was a little disappointed. I am not sure if I am just not a fan of the lobster roll, so I can't fault the restaurant for this. But, after the experience I would say that the price does seem a little high.

Reviews.Author: Karin V.
Reviews.Content: It's a no frills restaurant where the focus is on serving great seafood. The space is very tight so get ready to know your neighbors.  Also, they don't take reservations and are quite popular, so come early if you don't want to wait too long. New England Clam Chowder - not as thick or buttery as most new England clam chowders, but still very hearty and the seafood flavors were much more distinct in this chowder. I could really taste the clams, which were large and tender. The firm chunks of potatoes and celery also added a nice contrast to the texture. Oysters and Sea Urchin - they have one of the largest oyster selections I've ever seen, and I appreciated the helpful descriptions listed on their menu for each oyster (e.g. nutty finish, sweet pea taste, salty, sweet, size, etc). The Wellfleet and Kusshi oysters were my favorite.  The sea urchin was good, but wasn't that creamy. Warm Buttered Lobster Roll - heaping with warm, sweet buttery meat from a 1  1/2 lobster in a toasted roll...straightforward and perfectly executed. It's also served with a generous portion of fries - because the fat from all the butter isn't unhealthy enough, of course.  :-)Lobster Stroganoff with Wild Mushrooms - again, they don't skimp on their seafood here...there was more lobster than pasta in this stroganoff. And because they use crème fraiche instead of sour cream, the sauce was less tangy and enhanced the sweetness of the lobster meat. The egg noodles were delicate, while the flavors were rich and earthy. Admittedly, I thought the dish could have used a little more salt or something else to perk it up. It's a huge portion, so I got kind of bored half-way through it - although my husband loved this stroganoff and happily finished the rest.  Overall, I really liked the unfussy personality and plethora of seafood at Neptune Oyster. I will definitely be coming back to check out their Fish Taco Sundays and Lobster Spaghettini Mondays.

Reviews.Author: Maria A.
Reviews.Content: Back in August 2010, I came here based on the reviews. We came here for lunch, and we were greeted warmly.  The ambiance was really nice, but if you come here, be prepared to sit closely with other people.  You can actually sit at the counter as well.Our server was really nice and answered any questions that we had.We both ordered the warm lobster roll, and OMG!!!  DELICIOUS!!!  I'm drooling right now as I type, it was just THAT fabulous!!  The fries were perfection.If my experience here for lunch was spectacular, why did I knock off a star?  Well, the following day, we went back for dinner, which was our last night in Boston - yes, it was THAT good.  It was REALLY crowded outside.  We were told it was a 2 hour wait, and I gave them our cell phone number, so they could call us.  We went to a cafe while we waited.  Finally after 2 and a half hours, we went back; hey, it was worth the wait for us.  They seated us and there was no crowd outside anymore.  When we sat down and were giving our orders, they told us they ran out of bread and lobster. WHAT?!?!  We were so hungry at that point that we just ordered clams.  Although the clams were so good, we were REALLY disappointed.So, beware if you come here for the lobster rolls, it can happen!!

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: I think my experience at neptune oyster gave me a good preview of what giving birth will be like. Waiting 2.5 hours with extreme hunger pangs was excruciatingly painful, but once I took a bite of that heavenly warm lobster roll, I was filled with such joy that any memory of pain vanished with a quickness.  Don't worry, I am not going to eat my future progeny.  Just saying, solid five stars despite the ridiculous wait!

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Do I really need to talk about the food? The lobster roll. Get it. Hot with butter. That's why you're here, right? It's exactly as delicious as your wildest dreams and deepest, most secret desires promise you. Only more so. I knew the lobster rolls were supposed to be the best around. There's no need to write another review about that. They are the best. No question. What I want to write about is the STELLAR service. I came here for my graduation dinner with my family. I knew about the lobster rolls and figured this $25 monster (monster of DELICIOUS) was the perfect reward for my two years of toil as a grad student. We did not quite realize how small the space was, or that an hour-long wait was typical. But we'd gotten there early, and we did know it was popular, so we left our names on the list and they said they'd call us. I do think that's a really nice service, especially since they don't take reservations. We hung out in a coffee shop for an hour, no problem. We came back when they called us, and three of us promptly ordered the hot lobster roll with our very accommodating server, who said of course we wanted the lobster rolls. My brother ordered the cioppino, a seafood stew of everything *but* lobster (though you can request it for an additional $10). Lobster rolls arrived stuffed and overflowing with fresh chunks of lobster meat, coated in the right amount of butter: decadently, but not overpoweringly buttery. The toasted brioche buns were the perfect bread for the roll. Now here's where the service gets a gold star. The cioppino is served with rice-- but, our server said, the dish in his opinion "screams for" a side of bread as well. So he took it upon himself to include that with the order. Say what? The service was truly above and beyond. Throughout the meal we were attended to and our water glasses were topped off as often as fast as we could drink them. Service, again, was exemplary. And the food was, without an ounce of hyperbole, PERFECT by all accounts.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly K.
Reviews.Content: Neptune is my first stop and sometimes my last when I visit Boston. The restaurant and ambiance are classy without being fussy or stuck up... very fitting for a seafood spot. I realize 'Oyster' is the namesake, but go here for the lobster roll. Yes, it's $25, but it is hands down the best roll I've had all up and down New England. It's 'Connecticut'-style, as they say: lots and lots of large chunks of fresh Maine lobster meat drizzled with hot drawn butter on a fresh and perfectly toasted roll. It's a large lobster roll; you could easily split it and the pile of fresh cut french fries with which it's served with a friend. The oysters are choice as well. They have varieties from various regions along the North Eastern coast, including Prince Edward Island and New Brunswick. My husband enjoys the Neptune burger, complete with a fried oyster atop a perfectly cooked-to-order medium-rare beef patty. Insane. Someday I'd love to try their lobster Caesar salad... but I don't know if a day will ever come that I *don't* order the lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Kathy Z.
Reviews.Content: The best lobster roll and clam chowder I have had!!!!Very small place and there might be a long line but it will be worthy the wait!!

Reviews.Author: Aga S.
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong with Neptune Oyster! I have been to this restaurant several different times and I have yet been disappointed. Every single item on the menu is amazing. Obviously, Neptune is best known for their amazing seafood, but don't be afraid to try their burger or steak - both are excellent! The restaurant is small; there are only few tables and a quite long bar. They don't take reservations so be prepared to wait; luckily the staff can take your name and cell phone number and call you few minutes before your table is ready, so you can go to a bar or another restaurant nearby and enjoy a drink or two.

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: Don't even think of trying to get a bud light here, they only have good beer...My first time in Boston and we ventured into this place on multiple recommendations from friends and yelp! This place is an absolute much visit when in Boston. Here's what you do: just pick a couple of oysters to start with, and just get the Lobster Roll, warm with butter. Don't even look at the rest of the menu (I'm sure its good, but the lobster roll is amazing). In the lobster roll, they gave you so many pieces of lobster! The lobster were favorable and just plain delicious. We came on a Tuesday afternoon, and the restaurant was filled. We sat at the bar and didn't have to wait in line. I can't imagine what the place would look like on the weekends; probably a very long line and wait. If you're from out of town, just come here during the weekdays for lunch, so that you don't have to wait too long. Its close to all the tourist attractions anyway, so this would be a nice stop on the way to Paul Revere's house.

Reviews.Author: fred n.
Reviews.Content: Clam Chowder was not worth $11. Very tasty, thin, but well seasoned and chunky clam pieces. Atmosphere is eclectic and congested/warm. Best to go for Oysters and a cocktail.

Reviews.Author: Hannah F.
Reviews.Content: After going to Neptune Oyster a few times, I've decided it's one of my favorite restaurants in Boston. I agree with other reviews that have noted slow service and high prices. But here's the thing--I don't mind long lunches or dinners (in some circumstances) and I definitely don't mind paying high prices for fabulous food. Granted, I won't go regularly since I'm living on a grad school budget, but for a splurge, it's great. First tip: if you sit at the bar, things tend to move a little faster. You're right in front of them so there's no ignoring an empty dish or glass.Second tip: Even if you're not a huge fan of eating an entire meal full of raw seafood (like I do), Neptune Oyster has wonderful alternatives for you--particularly their daily specials in the corner of the menu. I sampled my boyfriend's fish and chips (he's one of those who doesn't live off raw seafood) and it was honestly the best I've ever had. It was an ACTUAL filet of fish instead of those pathetic pieces they normally fry up for fish and chips. It was perfectly battered and the fries were awesome. I was really, really surprised that they did such a good job with it.I've had a various assortment of the oysters they offer plus the clam chowder, hamachi, and a few other random entrees. I'm allergic to lobster and crab--so I can't attest to that myself. I can only repeat rave reviews from my parents when they last came with me.The oysters are always amazing. Super fresh, absolutely the best quality and always presented well. I order extra kumamodo (sp??) and kusshi. I'm a huge fan of the small, plump oysters that are less briny than the bigger ones. But I'll eat (and appreciate) any oyster. I could literally eat an entire meal of those two oysters alone with a glass of white wine and be the happiest person in the world.The clam chowder isn't everything I hoped it would be. It has great quality ingredients and the clams are wonderful but the soup was a little thin for me. But that might just be personal preference.Whatever fabulous sea bass concoction was offered the second time I was there with my boyfriend....oh my god. Insanely delicious. The fish just melted in your mouth. I believe it also came with a polenta that made my day.Hamachi--always a winner. Beautifully presented and absolutely delicious.Triton platter--supposedly incredible. My parents split it during my most recent visit and I, sadly, could not partake...but they talked about it through the night and into the next day. The lobster salad was a huge winner, as were the mussels, clams and oysters. The shrimp were HUGE. Oh dear lord were they big. And supposedly also quite good. Needless to say, I was insanely jealous. The trick to Neptune Oyster is to not go during extended peak hours. Go for lunch (same menu, smaller crowd) or around 9ish if you can stand a late dinner. Personally, I love long lunches so I love going (when I can, obviously), in the early afternoon and just eating as much as humanly possible. Maybe that's what made the slower table service more acceptable my last visit. It was also only one waitress for the whole restaurant and she tried to be as attentive as possible so I respect her for that. I've also never, ever had a problem with any of the staff at the restaurant. They have always treated me with respect and have been very friendly through the meal.Final tip: Put your name in when you're not hungry, wander around the great little shops in the area, then indulge when they call you. Don't expect to immediately get in. It's a tiny, tiny restaurant and it's always crowded. But it's crowded for a reason.... So not a place to go on a whim unless it's some weird hour of the day because you'll face a long wait and get cranky. Just take a breath, relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Soohyun C.
Reviews.Content: I rarely give 5 stars, and I rarely go back to the same restaurant the very next day. I guess that makes Neptune a rarity.Conclusion: THE BEST LOBSTER ROLLS, hands down!My bf and I were visiting his friends in Boston for the weekend and we went here for dinner the first night. We were a fairly large group (the place is pretty small), so had to wait about 2 hrs so we went to have beers at the Italian place on the corner.They "close" at 10:30pm, but as long as you get on their waiting list, they will keep the kitchen open for you even if a table opens up after their official closing time.The lobsters rolls come with HUGE chunks of lobster - it's like eating actual lobster claws sans the hassle of breaking thru the shell. OMG soooo good! FYI the hot lobster roll is dipped in butter, and the cold is mixed with mayo - I personally like the hot better.Other things we got:* Cioppino: DELISH! Fresh seafood + excellent broth = can't go wrong. * Clam chowder was the watery kind - which is supposedly the authentic version. Was good, but not the creamy type I'm used to...* Oysters: got an assortment, all fresh and tasty.We went to B&G to compare - B&G is more of a date place, whereas Neptune is a bit more relaxed, B&G has really small portions and only has the mayo lobster roll (chunks aren't nearly as big as Neptune's). I would say though that the oysters at B&G were a tad better...

Reviews.Author: Heidi L.
Reviews.Content: Star rating: 5*to die for; 4*will visit quite often; 3*will go if nothing else around; 2*will require extremely strong argument and incentive for me to step foot in it again; 1*why isn't it closed yet?Maybe my expectation was too high for Neptune Oyster (all the glowing reviews on Yelp!), I wasn't very impressed with the food. Of course I still liked them, but .... I don't think I'd want to go back because of the food.We ordered the bluecrab cocktail, and the shrimp cocktail. The bluecrab was actually pretty nice and the hint of mustard was great. My friend and I both thought the portion was bigger than expected. The shrimp cocktail.....hmmm, it was a gigantic shrimp but didn't taste very good, nor the cocktail sauce was any special.We both ordered the lobster roll (hot/butter). Well.......again, it wasn't bad but just nothing special at all. Yes, there was a good chunk of lobster meat, but that was it. At one point, I thought the bread tasted better than the lobster.....We also had the white peach bellini. It was okay.In terms of service, it was fine. Our server was quite attentive but I don't remember her telling us any specials on that night.Anyways, everything was okay and I may go back again with anyone who wants to try it out. As for myself, I won't eat here again if I have options.

Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: Before I start - I have to say - this place has some of the best seafood in Boston. Hands down, best. Why did I give this only 3 stars then? Well, a restaurant's reputation doesn't live by food reputation alone. I also work in a restaurant on the side - so that kinda colors my vision as well.I read some really good things about Neptune Oyster and its food and was pretty excited to eat there. Being from San Francisco, I'm fairly spoiled for food quality when I go out. I really enjoy a good meal and I was excited to try some great seafood. So I walked in and saw it busy - an AWESOME sign of a good place. I saw people were busy, so I figured I'd give it a few. Good things come to those who wait, right? Then a Bostonian comes in and started asking me if I went to the back and talked to the waitress about getting on the list yet. Huh? You mean it's ok to barge into a restaurant and pile on more work to the already busy waitstaff? From what I learned, this is pretty standard as a practice in the area. I was a little horrified and I didn't see this as a service - I saw this as the restaurant not setting boundaries on their customers. Walking in to give a reservation to a busy waitress (most likely in the middle of another task) would be like going into the kitchen to ask where your food order is (and kitchens typically don't like that). Let people do their jobs. Anyway, the waitress came over to take my number, which was fine. It got weird when I asked if I could have a glass of wine while I waited. I mean, I'm a single diner and based on the area code, obviously from out of town and not sure where to go. All I got in response was that I couldn't have a drink and wait (only drinking while dining at the bar, which is fine) - but no suggestions as to where to go. Odd. I know from working where I do, if we had to tell someone to wait somewhere else, we'd give a suggestion at least.So I started walking around the block and then my phone rang with a number I didn't recognize. I figured it must have been the restaurant. My phone rang twice and that was it. I hurried back to wait some more (again, they were busy - I could appreciate that). When the waitress finally got to talk to me, my seat was given away. She claimed she called me a few times (entirely possible even though my phone said once) and put me back on the list. But then I got to thinking - what if I went somewhere for a drink and had to potty. Unless I'm very rude - who answers a phone while going potty? - that's kinda gross. Maybe if the people there left a message? Not sure why they don't.Anyway, moving on. After a few minutes I got a seat - mission accomplished. I then ordered some oysters, mussels (awesome) and a salad (awesome). After close to 30 minutes, there were still no oysters. WTH! Apparently they had a new shucker for the night. Again, it's fine if someone is new, but obviously, this person wasn't trained right or still needed to shadow someone to get more up to speed. I finally got the oysters, 30 minutes after ordering - but apparently there were people waiting longer than me!I guess my experience there was laden with management problems - which really colored my vision of the place being great and wanting to come back (good food alone is not enough). I don't blame any of the waitstaff or the oyster shucker. It's a busy place and people need to be enabled to do their jobs. Again, I also have my view because I work in a restaurant as well.My suggestions to management:--have a self-managed list for people to signup for a table. We do this all over the place in San Francisco - people signup and put a phone number or whatever. It takes the burden off of the staff to manage a list. People can write down a name and wait or walk. They get it.--have a voicemail left when a table is ready. Maybe tell someone you have 5-10 minutes to show or else your table is gone. What if the person is in the bathroom or indisposed somehow? To lose your table over that is just - well - kinda uncool.--don't allow customers to come in and interrupt waitstaff. People can wait - and make that clear. The interruption these new customers provide doesn't give anyone any better service. Except getting themselves on the list - see item 1.--If someone is new - help them to succeed and not throw them into the fire. They waited WAY too long to get the poor new guy help. I mean - it's obvious he's not ready. Maybe he needs more training during the day. Sure he did get help - but after being 30 minutes behind? Really?This place is really great foodwise....I just fear that over time, there will be somewhere new with equally good food and the business here will die off. I hope next time I visit Boston I can swing by with less aggravation and have a more relaxed time. It's a great place, it really is....just these side issues make the entire experience less than stellar.

Reviews.Author: Louis A.
Reviews.Content: (I'll keep this short and sweet seeing as there are so many reviews)I've been to Neptune twice in the past month and both times I was blown away. The first time, I came mainly for the oysters. As recommended, the locally caught were the best. I think Duxbury were our favorites. We also had mussels and they were great. The second time we had oysters and entrées. The special was seared tuna served with hand made guacamole and crab meat. Amazing. We also got a lobster roll (with butter) and it was fantastic. Both dishes could not have been better. Even the fries were delicious. The wait both Saturday's was over two hours, which is a bit annoying but what can you do? Neptune is worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Michael Z.
Reviews.Content: THE best WARM lobster roll you will find in the city, with a nice LARGE price tag to go with it. Expect nothing less from the famous Neptune Oyster, because these guys are for real. Personally, I think this place is great to go to if you have a few Million dollars to spare, because you will find some of the best seafood here in this little nook of a restaurant located in the North End. If you're on a tight budget and still want to maybe sample this place, I HIGHLY recommend the Neptune Burger. It is $14 of heaven topped with fried oysters and their special house spread with a side of curly fries. Not only will this thing knock ur flavor socks off, it will FILL YOU UP until you can't eat anymore because this burger patty is probably somewhere between 1/2-1 lbs of meat.Other things to mention: oysters from Neptune Oyster are also incredible.Also, I heard they had a popcorn flavored oyster once when it was in season.. WHAT? ARE YOU KIDDING ME!? POPCORN FLAV.... yup. Go see for yourself.

Reviews.Author: Josh C.
Reviews.Content: In the words of the immortal Joey Lawrence....Whoa!  Pouring rain during our walk so we took a quick detour to hit up this small restaurant.  We are not really much of raw oyster lovers so opted for some chowda and their hamburger (topped with fried oysters).  Agreed that the Chowder was good but a little more watery than we like it.  Still very solid.  The surprise was the burger.  Fantastic combo with the garlic mayo relish.  We both loved it.  Fries were also excellent.  Sat at the bar so wait was not an issue.  Highly recommend although it does attract a crowd (with good reason).

Reviews.Author: Jen B.
Reviews.Content: Even on a Sunday, this place was packed! Arrived around 4:40 pm to the restaurant (party of 1, as I'm on a business trip). Luckily, the wait was only 10 minutes.For my appetizer, I ordered the raw Maine salmon with labneh (Greek yogurt-like food), plum slices, chives with a circular drizzle of olive oil. It was good - a new twist on smoked salmon with the olive oil. I thought the plums could've been more ripe (they seemed to be too hard compared to the rest of the dish) and a hint of flavor (lemon?) could've enhanced the olive oil.For my main dish, I was torn between the lobster caprese salad and the Georges Bank scallops - though since I don't like tomatoes, I was advised not to order the salad. Scallops it was.The scallops came with duck confit, Brussel sprouts, blue cheese and D'anjou pear sauce. The quality of the scallops was good, but I felt distracted by the duck confit to really be able to enjoy them. The dish was too complex;  why not cut out the confit and just highlight the flavor of the scallops? Needless to say, I ate the entire dish, so it was still pretty good.Paired it with a full bodies Cab/Merlot blend from Napa, I had a good meal but would say this place needs to work on simplifying some of its dishes before I would give them another star.Atmosphere is wonderful - hexagonal tiles and soft music playing hits from the 40s and 50s gives a retro feeling.Overall - it was pretty good; I would go back again but would be more selective on what I order. For those who like oysters and raw shellfish, this place is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Amy P.
Reviews.Content: I moved here from Seattle, a great food city; Boston has been a let down in this department. This is the only restaurant in the city I've truly loved. Not only are the ingredients of stellar quality, but the preparation is interesting and unique. I've found a lot of the food in Boston to be a bit too rich and a lot of the cooking methods seem a bit old fashioned. I don't like my food loaded with butter just to create flavor. And this place gets it right, the chefs here know their craft. Skip the large chain restaurants or restaurant groups. Give this gem a try. Perfect for a special occasion, date, or catching up with a good friend. It's small and they don't take reservations, so try and hit it at off hours. P.S. I think this is the restaurant Ben Affleck took Rebecca Hall to on their date in The Town. The decor looks the same anyway...

Reviews.Author: Audrey C.
Reviews.Content: Went early to put our name down on the list. Even at 3pm, they said there was a 2 hour wait, but fortunately, they said that if we wanted to walk around, they would give us a call when the table was ready. So we ended up at a bar across the street, and the table was ready in about an hour.Meal was great. We ordered 5 oysters each, the hamachi, cioppino, lobster roll and scallops. Overall, great selection of oysters, hamachi was fresh, lobster roll was alright (I'm just not a huge lobster fan), cioppino had a lot of seafood and I liked the rice in it, but I want to focus all of my attention on the scallops which were AMAZING! Who woulda thought that scallops, duck, blue cheese and brussel sprouts would make a good combination? Well, it did. The 3 of us shared everything and by far, this was the best thing that we ordered!I'm afraid to order scallops anywhere else now, since my bar is now set so high.

Reviews.Author: Milly H.
Reviews.Content: This review is strictly for a special service that Neptune Oyster provided.  After drooling over the lobster roll for the last year, I insisted that my brother and his friend visit on a recent trip to Boston.  Being that it was his birthday, I wanted to pick up the check.  Neptune was able to accommodate this request for me without any issues, and my brother was so surprised when instead of the check, they gave him a note that lunch was on me.  It was so special, and I really appreciate them making it happen.

Reviews.Author: Scott D.
Reviews.Content: Anyone who knows Boston knows that that North End, Boston's Italian neighborhood, is notorious for it's narrow streets, lack of parking, and great restaurants. Neptune Oyster is one of those great restaurants.The restaurant is tiny with not much of a waiting area. When my wife and I got there, the place was packed. No room for us inside the door so we stood outside and waited.The restaurant is longer than it is wide with an L-shaped booth-like bench stretching along the entire left side of the space and half of the back wall. Several tables were jammed together in front of the bench with chairs on the other side. With seating for twenty-six at the tables and another ten at the bar, which ran along the right side of the restaurant, this place might be considered large by some North End standards. The very front of the restaurant, just inside the etched glass window fronting the sidewalk, was the raw bar where J and I watched the show. Rows and rows of shellfish, and a woman shucking oysters like she was pouring water into a glass. Smooth, effortless, perfect.After about ten minutes outside and another twenty minutes inside, we sat down at a table. J and I started our night off with two glasses of NV Borgo Magredo Prosecco and a dozen oysters. Four Wellfleet, medium sized, salty, and sweet; four kumomoto, small, sweet, plump, and creamy with hints of cucumber; and four Fanny Bay, medium sized, plump, low salt, sweet, and buttery with a melon finish. Neptune Oyster has a dozen different oysters to choose from as well as little necks, cherry stones, and shrimp cocktail braised in Harpoon beer.Moving on to course two, we shared Neptune's Bottarga Salad. Bottarga is cured fish roe and is delicious. This salad was fantastic with Boston lettuce, red grapes, fennel, caramel onions, white anchovy, grape seed oil and a Parmesan dressing.With dinner we drank a bottle of Carpe Diem Chardonnay from the Firepeak vineyard in Edna Valley, California. J ordered Neptune's Gloucester Cod Loin served with stewed tri peppers, oregano, mustard, freshly grated horseradish and a grapefruit vinaigrette. The plate was garnished with supremes of grapefruit.I ordered the Fillet of Salmon with a saute of crispy duck, pea tendrils, avocado, ginger and soy. Both of our entrees were truly spectacular, but J's cod loin dish may very well be the best dish of the year. The cod was cooked to perfection and the spicy horseradish was balanced so well by the sweet, tart grapefruit, the mustard and the oregano. The cod dish was definitely the star of the meal.Now for the best part of the evening. We return to the car to find a carefully placed PARKING TICKET on the windshield! Sometime between the last time I was in the North End and last Friday night, Hanover Street converted all the on-street parking to Residents Only after 8pm.Oh well. Neptune Oyster is awesome and worth a parking ticket. I'll make sure not to park on Hanover Street the next time I go.

Reviews.Author: Heidi X.
Reviews.Content: Plan ahead and arrive early to put yourself on the waitlist for seats. This restaurant is really tiny, and latecomers experience two kinds of disappointment -- being turned away because the restaurant and its waitlist are maxed out, and having some of the more delectable oysters on the menu run out. Book a babysitter too, cos this place has no infant high chairs, nor any spare room for kids to wriggle or run around.I had a really good experience here, after waiting an hour and a half for my table. What the other reviewers have said about the hot lobster roll and the oysters are right on the mark. I would also add that the Ipswich fried clams I had at Neptune Oyster were better than what I've tried up in Ipswich itself.

Reviews.Author: Lucia A.
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended to us by a a person from the tourist bureau. She said it's the best place for seafood! She was not lying!!Located in the North End of Boston (the Italian district), this place had the freshest and best tasting food. We were told to go there for their Lobster Roll. When we sat down, I noticed the list of raw oysters, so I had to try a few. I have NEVER had raw oysters that were so fresh and so tasty!!! Then I split the Lobster Roll with my mom (we had it hot with butter). It was so delicious, we didn't want the meal to end. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgable about the food.I would never go back to Boston without going to this spot!!!

Reviews.Author: Yvonne Y.
Reviews.Content: Great oyster bar! If you ever want to come try this place, make sure to come 2-3 hours before the actual time you'd like to eat (esp. on the weekends), because that's how long of a wait it will be. If your stomach is on flex time, come on a weekday between lunch and dinner, and the wait will be a lot more manageable - 5-15 mins wait.Although there's a long wait, this place is definitely worth it. The lobster roll is amazing - get the hot one and ditch the cold - the hot buttery lobster roll brings out the fresh lobster flavor a lot better than the cold mayo ones (and that's a general rule of thumb with LR at any given place, trust me). $25 for a sandwich might sound a bit steep, but you get a butt load of lobster meat where you don't need to get cracking 3 lobsters to get to it. Aside from the lobster rolls, Neptune has a great variety of selection at the raw bar. It's like ordering sushi, they give you a little piece of paper with all kinds of raw goodness on it with descriptions for each of them, and you can order them by however many you want - great way to try different kinds and not have to commit to one option by the half-dozen like most other places are. (C'mon, we are all commitment phobic one way or another, it's difficult to commit to SIX of the same kind of oysters!)This place is tiny - bar seating on one side, tables on the other side against the wall. But to keep it as an oyster BAR, all of their seating are raised to a counter-top level (even if you're not siting at the bar). I really appreciate when restaurants put little details like that for their identity, so this makes me like this place even more.To compare with the other oyster bars in town, Union Oyster House is more touristy, for the history, and a bit more run down. Island Creek is more hip and modern, putting raw bar with a contemporary twist, where as Neptune is more of a classy, traditional and sophisticated oyster bar. Definitely give this place a try.

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: If there is one place I consistently recommend to people in Boston, it's Neptune Oysters.I have been here at least 5-7 times and the wait is always ridiculous. I came here with my girlfriend a couple weeks ago and was quoted with a 2.5 hour wait. Yes, that is ridiculous, and yes, it's probably worth it.As with most people, I love the lobster rolls, but not as much as others love it. I always get it hot with the butter on the side. However, don't be tricked into thinking that the lobster roll is all that's good here. I LOVE the North End Cioppino, which is a fantastic stew mix of various seafood and saffron rice. Amazing dish. If you come here with several peeps, I also love the entire whole bronzini, which is cooked perfectly (but of course, with bones) and isn't for the lazy. Whole fish is always best. I recommend coming when you have less people, as it can be a grueling wait. The great thing is that they call you on your cell when they have your table ready, so you can walk around the North End while waiting. Overall, always a great experience, especially when you have great company.

Reviews.Author: Lana N.
Reviews.Content: Despite the wait at Neptune's, this place is a definite must stop shop when in Boston. I don't think I've ever experienced such a level of oozingly outstanding decadence - I may just keel over into cardiac arrest any day now; nothings like butter and cholesterol to do you over...Neptune's is known for two things; their raw bar and their lobster roll... but it was our last day in Boston, so my BF and I went all out... oysters, shrimp, clam chowder, *johnycakes*, and their oh so coveted hot buttered lobster roll.They have a list of 10-15 different items on their raw menu. They were out of the one oyster I was eyeing, but we still managed to order a selection of different raw oysters and clams, as well as some giant sweet shrimp... It was fun knocking them back and getting a taste for northeastern oysters. They were all smaller than I imagined them to be, but.the champagne hinted one was definitely my favorite... When in Boston, get clam chowder... right?? The clam chowder here was stock full of fresh clams... but it was also very runny and less creamy and typical chowder-texture like than I prefer. Id prob not recommend the chowder from Neptune's - head to Quincy Market instead? Per recommendation of the people sitting next to us at the bar and our waitress, we got the **Buttermilk Johnycakes** aka honey butter, smoked trout tartare, and Little Pearl caviar on a cornmeal pancake. If I were to give a dish to describe decadent, it would be this one... it tasted as if a whole stick of butter was put into it, and it was divine! There was a hint of acidity to each bit of sweet and salty, and it had a great sense of textures... If I were given whatever I wanted in my last dying meal, this would definitely be on that list of my dying last bites. It really is THAT good, and I would definitely recommend it!The HOT buttered lobster roll... I'm typically not a huge fan of lobster; I prefer my crab and shrimp and raw seafood... but if lobster we're to be done any way, it should be done the way it is here at Neptune's: piled high and oozing with butter. Its over the top and definitely gonna require a few extra notches on your belt, but worth the go at least once if not more for the die-hard lobster fans.Overall an exceptional meal worth every penny. So come give it a go... then be ready to start saving up those nickles and dimes to come back once you've let those arteries clear.

Reviews.Author: SR M.
Reviews.Content: The best lobster roll in the city hands down. Oysters are fresh and seafood is solid. The worst part about this place is the wait. They dont take reservations and on any given Saturday night the wait can be as long as 3 hours. But they will call you so if you want roam the city that's always an option.

Reviews.Author: Lin Lin S.
Reviews.Content: This place is small. And muggy. And a little unorganized. Who do I give my name to for the wait list? I shoved myself in and stopped the first waitress that I saw, disregarding the fact she was busy doing something else. The nice thing is, they take your name and call you when the table is ready. We wandered over to mike's pastry to warm up our appetites with some cannolis. For labor day weekend, our wait was 1.5hrs. The lobster rolls are huge and served with fries. If you have a plus 1 with you, get one of each: butter and mayo so you can compare. My gripe is they over butter the rolls too much so the bread gets soggy real fast. I ended up eating mine with a fork. There's a lot of lobster meat in this roll. The clam chowder is not chowda. This version was very thin, also like a runny bisque, but still with lots of clams.

Reviews.Author: Lisa L.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Neptune 2 times. I have had the clam chowder, Ipswich fried clams, raw oysters, and lobster roll. All amazing. I must say, however, that the lobster roll is what gets me back every time. Order it hot, you won't regret it. It is a bit expensive, but totally worth it. One of the most delicious meals in town. Also, it is worth the wait for a table (which is sometimes long because of the small space).

Reviews.Author: Javi N.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! Looooong wait though, so call ahead and see what the wait time is.Very small place.Try EVERYTHING!!!!Expensive though.

Reviews.Author: Andre B.
Reviews.Content: Seafood here is awesome! One of the best Lobster rolls I have ever had. I also had a platter of crab legs that were very fresh. Be prepared for a long wait to be seated though, the place isn't that big...

Reviews.Author: Vickey T.
Reviews.Content: Overrated... highhhlyyyyy overrated for their lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Sophia S.
Reviews.Content: Went for lunch on a sunday and the wait was over one hour. I have to admit though, they ran the line very smoothly, there never seemed to be chaos or confusion. And I do think the lobster roll was worth the wait.We got some raw oysters and warm lobster rolls. The warm lobster rolls are soaked in butter, i think it was too much butter but it was absolutely incredible. The lobster roll comes with fresh cut fries too, that were freshly fried and peppery.Our only complaint is that it was really expensive for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: Neptune himself must have blessed this tiny oyster bar. After indulging in the lobster roll (with hot butter sauce) from Neptune, I feel compelled to update the "My Last Meal on Earth" category in my Yelp profile. Sorry Shake Shack, it was fun while it lasted. The amount of lobster they stuff in this sandwich could feed a small village for days. Imagine a volcano erupted on your roll and all that came out was lobster. The oyster bar was phenomenal as well. The freshest ones we had in Boston were right here at Neptune.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: This place was so good it made me want to punch the cook right in the mouth for ruining other lobster rolls for me.  Though a bit pricy, it was worth every cent - I'm pretty sure one roll contains more lobster than I've had in my entire life up to that point.  It came on a perfectly toasted bun, drenched in warm butter, and served with some great, crispy fries.  We also had a smattering of oysters, clams, and crab legs, and a fucking amazing neptunes on piggyack appetizer.  Service was fast and friendly.  They were more than happy to make recommendations which was really cool.  Though crowded and cramped, the food restored my faith in all things good in life.

Reviews.Author: Louise M.
Reviews.Content: What can I say....I'm still salivating over the warm lobster roll that I had in March! I want to go back to Boston so bad just to go to Neptune. It was my first time in Boston, and I didn't know where to go for the best lobster roll. My brother in law happened to know just the place. Not only that he knew, he even introduced my sister and me to the warm no mayo lobster roll. It was to die for - it was SO SO damn good! It was lobster chunks piled high, drenched in clarified butter. It was out of this world. We ordered several different types of oysters too and wowa! However, I wasn't too in love with the clam chowder. I prefer the traditional thick clam chowder. Theirs was a little watery with no apparent specific viscosity. We had to wait almost two hours for a table! But it was worth the wait. We walked around North-End and had time to check out the neighborhood. We walked through the Holocaust Memorial, Haymarket and all the way to Quincy Market. We had to share a table with 3 gentlemen that ordered dozens and dozens of Oysters and the biggest shrimp cocktails I've ever seen. Turned out the shrimps were from Indonesia. I'm from Indonesia -  I haven't seen shrimps that big back home! It was also my birthday and they thought I was 27. I was singing all the way back to Cambridge "27..oh yeah..27..."The waiter was great and knowledgeable on the types of oysters. I ordered a Boston iced tea. He was like - what's that?! I was about to die from humiliation. I told him it was iced tea and cranberry juice. That's what Red Lobster told me anyway. He was like.."Ohh! I learned something new. We can do that!" I was like.."Don't." For $20, the warm lobster roll is a must eat if you're in Boston. It was a God's gift to mankind.

Reviews.Author: Meridith H.
Reviews.Content: Is it exclusive? Yes, but the place is small, so it has to be.Is it expensive? Yes, but the quality speaks to the price.Is it snooty? Not a bit.Estimated wait times were given & were pretty accurate. Instead of a line, they take your phone number and call you when space opens up. The North End location is a great asset here, because people can just go amuse themselves on the Freedom Trail or whatever for a while. I scarfed down a buttery, decadent lobster roll, and didn't have room for the fries. I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Ben C.
Reviews.Content: I love oysters.This place has them.East coast.West coast.I go there and eat them.All!

Reviews.Author: Paran Y.
Reviews.Content: I am a prophet. And I shall prove it. You at 6:30 on a Friday night strolling into NO trying to impress a date: "table for two""the wait is over 3 hours""well....shit"It is only then will a naive thought start to form in your mind that may forever alter the course of your future--"ugh...is it worth it?!" Please, let me be your voice of reason: YES YOU IDIOT. Here, I'll even plan an even more impressive night. Put your name down and then cab on over to Drink, my favorite watering hole.  I'll be early enough where you won't have to wait in that line as well.  Casually sip on some choice cocktails while amazingness awaits.  Trust me it won't feel that long this way. Now the pièce de résistance.  Imagine the day you got your first kiss. Feelings of excitement, mystery, anticipation, and lust all wrapped in one moment. Now imagine that experience lathered in delicious butter.  Wait, what?!  Yes, you have just experienced a NO lobster roll.  My hands are shaking as I write this sentence. Lobster withdrawal is no laughing matter.

Reviews.Author: Enoch C.
Reviews.Content: Previous yelp reviewers were right! Delicious oysters!I got the Lobster Roll as well. It was jam packed full of lobster. Only downside was that some pieces had a weird mushy taste to it... I'm not sure what it was but it seemed to be common among the claw pieces of my sandwich. Despite that set back, I could tell that the food was delicious and still gets 4 stars from me!

Reviews.Author: Jeannie H.
Reviews.Content: I started coming here in 2006 and back then, I could get a table with a very reasonable wait.  Now, the wait times are extraordinary and I blame Food Network for this undesirable change.  This is my 7th trip to Neptune's and I've now covered most items on their menu minus the daily specials.  I think I've finally figured it out why my meals have ranged from great to mediocre.  Their cooked dishes can lack consistency, which may leave you with a serious disappointment.  If you're a tourist and this will be your only visit, I'd recommend sticking with the staples and be adventurous some place else.  This is also not the place to come for chowder - it's full of clams but so runny.  I like my chowder thick and full of ingredients so this is the only thing Legal's does better.  Lobster Roll - This is the best lobster roll we've had thus far in Boston for $25.  It's better than the $27 version at B&G.  However, for $12 James Hook makes a pretty decent lobster roll (premade in a hot dog bun but what do you want for $12?).  Alive and Kicking serves one for $14 but it's really a sandwich not a roll.  L'Espalier serves a Lobster BLT on brioche toast during lunch hours for $25 but not sure we care for the combination of bacon and lobster.  In the Neptune's version, the cold roll has enough mayo to bind the lobster without being overwhelming.  The hot roll is full of unsalted buttery goodness.  The toasted brioche is a little heavy for the delicate lobster but that's a trivial complaint.  Overall, the hot roll wins.Triton or Neptune platter - Oysters, clams, mussels, shrimp, crab, lobster, and octopus galore.  Mussels are by far my least favourite bivalve and need some type of broth without being able to hold their own without the dressings.  I also prefer Cherrystones over Little Necks.  They claim the crab is blue crab but I really don't think so.  Blue crabs tend to be much sweeter, not to mention they are small in size and these crab chunks are huge.  Overall, these platters are a great value.  There is a ton of fresh seafood here but served without much fanfare (just some light mayo here and there) and it's low on energy expenditure (all the meat has already been taken out for you).  I don't mind getting down and dirty with my seafood but I'd rather save the bib and napkins for home.I really enjoy Neptune's though the increasingly touristy atmosphere has detracted it a little for me. I stood in line behind two guys who were complaining that they don't eat seafood and think raw bars are gross (and in all seriousness were having a conversation about whether a lobster was considered a bivalve, while the other idiot answered, "No, shrimp are bivalves").  When I asked why they were here, the response was, "because Food Network told us to come."  Please, go clutter McDonald's instead and leave Neptune's to those of us who actually know how to eat.

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: THE WAIT IS LONG AS BALLSBUT, WELL worth it if you ask meThey take your number at the front and call you when your table is semi-near ready. That's nice and all, but I'm naturally skeptical and felt that if i didnt stay there and stare down the staff, I woulda gotten screwed over. TWO HOURS later (with sore, bulging eyes), we finally got a seat.We got the 2 raw oysters, fried clams, and of course, the famous lobster roll.There's not much more that can be said that hasn't been said  yet. Oysters were fresh, the fried clams were tasty (although I did find a few shell fragments in them), and the lobster roll was magnificent. GET THE LOBSTER ROLL HOT, cause I feel like you can get the cold just about anywhere. ALSO, the fries that came on the side were perfectly cooked and a nice complement to the lobster! IT BETTER BE for the price we paid.. Overall, I'd come here again, but only if my parents are payin!

Reviews.Author: pslice p.
Reviews.Content: Excellent oyster bar and the lobster roll was to die for. Long waits, go early.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: I can sum up Neptune Oyster with this - we went there with about 10 people.  We had the seafood tower and a bunch of other things.  We saved the lobster roll for last - the hot one.  We decided to split 3 for the ten people because we were all full and stuffed already.  When it came out and we all devoured the rolls...we ordered three more...and then three more.  It.is.so.good.  Sober talk oclock.Oh, the other stuff was good too. Next time I go, I won't even waste room on the other foods.  Just 5 oysters and three lobster rolls for me.  I work out religiously but I will be a fat boy for this place.  No joke.  Dead serious.Happy eating, suckers.

Reviews.Author: Andrew D.
Reviews.Content: I don't see why I should write a review about this place seeing that there are almost 950 reviews! I don't care! I want to tell my tale of one of the best meals I've ever had!We were in town for the Patriots game and kinda jet-lagged from our flight in to Boston, we suddenly felt the need...the need to feed.We were stumbling around outside our hotel and found this place. We looked in the window and saw all the fresh oysters and seafood...our mouths watered.  We ordered a bunch of oysters...can't really remember all the names, shrimp cocktail, rock crab claws, lobster rolls and beers!!I think that nothing more needs to be said...one of the best dinners....ever.

Reviews.Author: Erik F.
Reviews.Content: I had to come back like 3 times to finally get a seat for me and my girlfriend.  It was one to two hour wait..but It was worth it.  The oysters are fresh and I had the biggest pawn shrimp I had ever seen.  YUUUMM!!I grab a ALLAGASH WHITE (beer) and started ordering every oyster they had.  I like trying new foods and beer. I guess my girlfriend seen this place at one of those food network channels. I look around and everyone was kinda fancy dressed. I came in with my DODGER jersey cuz the dodgers were in town. Its a great place to go. ENJOY!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: What else can really be said about this place?I love the $25 hot buttered lobster roll more than some of my relatives. Don't get me started on the oysters.

Reviews.Author: YJ L.
Reviews.Content: Seriously?!?!? that is what my fiance and I said to each other as we slurped up our first oyster. This place is so good, it makes you curse, even if you aren't a curser! Totally worth the wait and the hype!We got a dozen assorted oysters, we just asked our waitress what was the best. ZOMG the BEST oysters I have EVER EVER EVER had in my life. On top of the cocktail horseradish sauce, they also give this oniony vinegary sauce to put on the oyster. This combo along with the freshness of the oysters made me curse like a sailor. Downed with some bubbly goodness I was in heaven. We also got 2 lobster rolls, one cold with mayo the other warm with butter. GET THE ONE WITH BUTTER! the mayo was great dont get me wrong, but neptune oyster just does the butter lobster roll SOOO SOO RIGHT!!! Thank you Boston and thank you Neptune Oyster for giving me one of the best meals of my life! I will be back!
