Reviews.Author: Annie H.
Reviews.Content: While not one dish was "out of this world" good, every dish was deliciously consistent and the food was definitely memorable.  We sat at the bar and ordered the recommended fried clams (clams themselves were good, but the homemade sauce/topping was amazing), hot butter lobster roll where I replaced the fries with a wonderful butterleaf lettuce salad (tasty, tons of lobster, though I would rather try the cold roll w/mayo next time), grilled shrimp appetizer (probably my favorite, flavorfully grilled with a wonderful sauce), and of course, oysters (oysters were very fresh, but wished they had the wine vinaigrette)Pretty darn good, and worth the wait if you're visiting town.  Definitely put your name in before heading off to browse Quincey market!

Reviews.Author: Ksenja T.
Reviews.Content: I visited Boston for the first time this past weekend, and on our last day we ventured into Neptune Oyster after exploring the North End area. The wait time was about an hour at 4 pm and we ended up getting two seats by the bar which I actually preferred. This spot most certainly deserves a 5/5.  I am not a seafood expert, but the oysters were simply outstanding.  Divine freshness.  You can order different types depending on what type of finish taste you prefer, but I tried the fruity and citrusy finish ones and they were incredible.  We also got two appetizers: the hamachi crudo and the tuna tartare with the avocado spread.  The prices are a bit high for appetizers ($16) but you are paying for the freshness and quality of the fish.  The little chips on top of the hamachi were a nice touch, and the avocado was the perfect companion to that fresh tuna on a crostini.  I highly recommend trying them.Now, the lobster roll IS all the rave ($25).  There is a reason this place has a 4.5 average even after 1000 reviews and more.   If you come to Neptune Oyster even once in your life,  this is the one dish that one must get.  We got the hot roll with butter, and it was one of the best things I have ever eaten period.  The lobster just melted in your mouth, and the touch of sweetness from the brioche bun just took it to a whole other level.  The french fries were also excellent.  I cannot wait to come back to Neptune Oyster and order myself another lobster roll.  Definitely a good reason to come back to Boston for.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is the best meal I had during my Weekend in Boston!!No lines!!! No wait for a table!! This must be my lucky day!Everything we ordered were so so good!Hot Lobster Rolls ($25) - I think I am converted after the first bite... Buttery, Warm, Fresh, Great Texture... I want my lobster roll HOT!!!! And butter beats mayo anytimeClam Chowder ($11) - great seafood broth based with tons of clams....... and just a light touch of cream... pricey for $11? But worth every penny!!!Various Oyster and Clams ($1.80-$2.80) - I have a serious situation here.. When my friend who said she don't want ANY started eating mine!!! Why? They were just so so so good....Dayboat Scallops Crudo ($13) - The most disappointing item we ordered!! But still one of the better scallops crudo I had... maybe just that the others items were just amazing?!!!!!!!Those seafood still haunted my mind in a good way till now... Neptune definitely going to be one of the reason I know I will be back to Boston again and again!!

Reviews.Author: Tatiana B.
Reviews.Content: The wait to get in this place is ridiculous but I would do it 1000 times because the $25 lobster roll is so worth it. Yes, it's a $25 sandwich but YES, it is worth it.First time we were here it was mid-afternoon and it was full but we only had to wait about 10 min to be seated at the bar (bar is not a first come, first serve). Second time we came for dinner around 7:30pm or so. First off, to actually get in the restaurant in order to get your name on the list is a paaaainnn. Everybody is trying to get in; there is only a little corner by the door where everybody tries to squeeze in. You have to wait a long time for one of the servers to free up and come with the list to get your name down and then the wait. So, this second time we actually waited 2.5 hours. Ouch! But the good thing is that this place is next to little Italy and around a few bars. So, we just sat down at bar and had like 25 drinks (more like 6) and waited for the call. I like my lobster roll hot with butter. None of that cold with mayo nonsense. It comes with fries but who cares about the fries?! Not me (but they're good). We have been here twice and we always split one roll and both times I've regret it because it's so freaking good. I think I eat half of it in 3-4 bites. They don't skimp on the lobster either. That baby is full top to bottom, left to right. We also tried the hamachi ceviche but we didn't like it. Stick to the roll.

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: Small and intimate, which I LOVE. It's not crowded, it's cozy and makes the atmosphere.I read the yelp reviews and saw that people were "dreaming" about the oysters and it's SO TRUE. ohmygod. I would do anything for another...SO tasty.The clam chowder soup was bomb.com with the PERFECT amount of pepper which is a totally weird thing to say but it's true...you'll see.AND of course, the lobster roll was crazy.The waitress was awesome and the wait was about an hour but 100% worth it. They don't take reservations but you can put your name on a list when you get there.GO.

Reviews.Author: Justin L.
Reviews.Content: For my taste of New England seafood, this is where me and my girl went rather than the uber touristy Union Oyster House that was my first thought.  Walking in, the place is cramped but beautiful.  A long bar stretches the whole place, with marble table tops, and nicely patterned tiles on the floor.  We were told it was a 50 minute wait by the hostess, so we went and bought dessert for after.  About 40 minutes later, we got the call that our table was ready.  The couple we were seated next to weren't really friendly, but not that annoying either.  Our server was very effective, although she could've been better in some regards.  For instance, not checking in with us for awhile when I would've liked to order a glass of wine, acting unpleased when we asked for bread and then only dropping off only 2 small slices, etc.  Nothing earth shattering, just little things that are memorable.  At the end of the day none of these other things matter though, as it's all about the food and in this regard Neptune delivered.  This was easily one of the best meals I've had all year.To start we had 3 kinds of oysters: 2 Kumamoto, 2 Beau Soleil, and 2 Island Creek.  I wanted to do sea urchins too, but unfortunately the table before us got them all (bastards).  The Kumamoto weren't as tart as I had remembered and were actually a little small, but the Beau Soleil were buttery and much better than I had remembered.  The clear winner though was the Island Creek, which had an acidic fruitiness to them and which are from nearby in Duxbury, MA.  I came close to ordering more, but we had more than enough food coming.  Next up were some steamed Wellfleet Littlenecks.  I found the clams to be a little bit tougher than I expected, but all the right flavors were there.  The roasted garlic sauce they were in was drinkable, and the chorizo added in was crazy good.  The bread our waitress reluctantly brought was good on its own, and was perfect for soaking up some clam juice.  I had the North End Cioppino with lobster added for my main course, and it was superb.  Think big chunks of lobster, different kinds of fish, whole shrimp, mussels and clams all together in a spicy stew with some great saffron rice.  Heaven, right?  Damn straight.  My girl got the seared Georges Bank scallops, which were rich and velvety with a nice crispness on the outside.  I was confused that this delicate shellfish was paired with duck confit and a very sharp blue cheese (Maytag) on the plate though, as it detracted from the dish significantly; this is a great example of a great chef trying to do too much.  On the other hand, the miniature brussel sprouts it came with were absolutely addictive.  The dish would've been pretty complete with just the scallops, sprouts, and 1-2 other not-so-overwhelming elements.So my first trip to Boston wasn't too bad after all!  Small missteps aside, this meal was pretty epic.  Considering dessert afterwards--a combo of stuff from Mike's and Modern Pastry--epic is the right word.  I am very glad we chose to go here instead of Union Oyster House and chose to wait for a table.  To those complain about price or the space, you knew what you were getting into when you walked in, and to those comparing lobster rolls, you sound like me with pizza.  I don't have the experience to say where Neptune stacks up in that competition, but they do put out inventive, amazing food.  Last but not least: thanks Wendy!  :)

Reviews.Author: Ronnie M.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Neptune Oyster on a recent weekend in Boston.My first bit of advice: get there EARLY.  We drove up to Boston from New Jersey on a Friday and, after driving around looking for a parking spot for close to an hour (and after initially going to the wrong "Salem Street" due to an inept GPS), we ended up getting to the restaurant at about 8:30.  I was so elated to finally reach our destination, as I had been researching the place for close to a month and was eager to sample all of their much-lauded offerings.To my chagrin, we were greeted at the door and told that they weren't taking any more names for the night, as there was currently a 2.5 hour wait.  Crestfallen, we left and had a drink at a lesser known seafood place a few doors down before mustering up enough spunk and forced positivity to go to Pomodoro for what turned out to be a nice Italian meal. But I digress.We returned to Neptune Oyster the next day for lunch and, after waiting a measly 45 minutes, were seated at the bar - FINALLY!!  We ordered about 8 different types of oysters, the buttermilk johnnycakes, the hamachi ceviche, mussels in thai-style curry, and, of course, the famous hot lobster roll.All of the oysters were very fresh and tasty, but I think my favorite dish we ordered was the hamachi, which was bursting with flavor and left me wishing I had ordered more.  The johnnycakes were also ridiculously good, and the mussels very good also.  The hot lobster roll, though very good, was probably my least favorite.There were so many other things on the menu that I would have loved to have tried, time and money permitting; hopefully I'll get back there some day and make that happen.The moral of the story: get there early, but if you get there too late due to an inept GPS, lunch the following day is just as satisfying!

Reviews.Author: Victoria T.
Reviews.Content: First of the food was great. Ordered the hot lobster roll and fried clams both very delicious. The reason why I am giving it one star is because the service was completely unacceptable and very unprofessional. When we first got there they told us the wait would be and hour to and hour half which was fine, we walked around and had no problem waiting. We went back and it had been a two hour wait at this point and they tell us to go get another drink and come back in another hour. Which got me a little annoyed. So finally after a 2:45 hour wait we were called can headed to the Restaurant. Our table wasn't ready and waited another 20 min. At this point it was 9:20pm and all I wanted was a lobster roll. Once we sat down I decided to brush it all off and enjoy the food and drinks. But this is when I completely just wanted to lose it. We sat at the bar and the waitress taking care of us was completely rude and wait it gets better. Before she even took our drink order she decided to order herself one and drink an alcoholic drink in front of us while she's working. And then told us we needed to hurry up and order because kitchen was closing at 9:30. Then her husband or boyfriend don't know who it was comes and sits next to us and he is insulting the other waitresses that worked with the waitress we had. And they were both bad mouthing everyone that worked there. That seemed very unprofessional have some class you're at work. Then they received their food and she kept swing by and would start eating and mind you it's a nice place started burping. I was completely disappointed. I honestly wanted to try to out weight all the negatives with the terrific food but I couldn't. I don't think I'll ever go back because for the price of the food, you expect a nice atmosphere with it. They should hire well behaved and more respectful staff. I have never seen such behavior ever.  She was complete trash and clearly gives the restaurant a bad name.

Reviews.Author: Lauren B.
Reviews.Content: I am salivating thinking of my scallops with crispy pancetta. O-M-G I love it. Good wine and oysters too. Also, the oyster descriptions are very accurate! Next time, I am going to stuff my face with a lobster roll. It will be AMAZING I am sure. Until we meet again.........

Reviews.Author: Mylinh M.
Reviews.Content: How do you start a review about the great love of your life?  Well, Neptune's isn't as great as my husband but it's a close second.  Quite possibly my favorite restaurant not just for the superb food but also the sentimental value.  When I moved to Boston in 2005, Neptune's was my first meal in this city and continued to be where I would come to celebrate special occasions and milestones.I come for 2 reasons, the oysters and the lobster roll.  The selection of oysters is fantastic and I particularly appreciate the descriptions of each oyster.  I have found that the descriptions are right on and I have rarely ever been disappointed in the quality of the oysters or the taste.  The oysters are unique, rarely do I have oysters with a champagne or buttered popcorn finish!  The prices have gone up a bit and the oysters are around $2.60.  It's amazing how quickly one can devour $100 worth of food!The lobster roll is served on a brioche bun with either a mayo sauce or hot butter.  It's very traditional without anything extra to detract from the real lobster taste.  Definitely not frozen in any way.  The chunks of lobster is huge and there is so much lobster goodness crammed in that little bun that I have many bites of just lobster alone.  Absolutely to die for.Other notable dishes I've had are the clam chowder, the steamed clams, and the oyster minestrone.  The first two are standard but so delicious.  I don't usually like my oysters cooked but the minestrone has the most delicious oyster flavor.  The broth is rich and the spices add interest to this tomato based soup.  So good, not to be missed!This restaurant really doesn't need any more reviews, but I love it so much, I just couldn't neglect it.  If you're in Boston, check this place out, I would move back to Boston just for Neptune Oyster alone.

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: I sat at the bar and the bartender was great!  The service was super.I had 4 types of oysters which were outstanding....I love the oyster menu that describes the flavors.  It was spot on.Of course...hot lobster roll with fries....and it did not disappoint one bit.Washed everything down with a few Harpoon Ales and my night was perfect!

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: I love Neptune Oyster--food, wine, ambiance--it has all of it. A wonderful, charming place worth the wait--but if you are strategic you can work around this issue. When I worked in Boston I went with 5 colleagues and we managed to get seated (together!) for lunch at 1/1:30 pm. We chose a weekday that was a little gray and rainy, and cold of course. Be flexible and try to target non-busy times. Or if you're just visiting put your name down and walk around the North End--lovely and so real.. Also a great place to get a drink at the bar. Neptune Oyster has the feel of a small, upscale local diner that's only known to you and your friends. I love the mirrors and the white subway tile. Looking in the front window is enough to make anyone happy--oysters on ice and lemons galore. Their font is enough to draw you in too! Complete perfection!What I had: 2 glasses of Sancerre, 4 oysters (a Wellfleet, an Island Creek, a Katama Bay, and a Beach Point), & the famous (hot) lobster roll with butter and side salad. All delicious and a must on any visit to Boston!

Reviews.Author: Anne K.
Reviews.Content: Amazing place to take a group of four.  My personal favorite meal from here would be the clam chowder and a peach bellini.  Love the raw bar, and friendly staff.I recommend coming here for a late lunch, as it does get crowded.

Reviews.Author: Danny G.
Reviews.Content: Hmm...where should I start to review this wonderful experience. It was the last day of our Boston tour during Spring break. In fact, it was the last moment before our return flight back to LA. It is such a perfect "period" for the trip, albeit the rainy weather. We started with a dozen oysters of 6 different kinds from the raw bar. The island creek stood out to be my favorite. It wasn't as salty as the menu described, but the buttery finish just smooth out the fresh taste even more. The steamed mussel appetizer was probably as delicious and worthy as a seafood dish gets. The broth with peanuts was creamy but not overwhelmingly rich, and it went perfectly with the bread doll. Since we went on a Monday, they served the legendary lobster spaghetini. It definitely deserved a two thumb up. Even my GF who usually is very critical and picky for American seafood loved the cheesy creamy spaghetti and the sweet lobsters. Overall it's a great place to enjoy decent seafood, with a quite homey ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Best. Twenty. Five. Dollars. Ever. Spent.That lobster roll was stupid.  It was unfair.  Why did it have to end?  Why was I left with an empty plate covered with the ghosts of what used to be.  The buttery delicious lobster was something I'll always hold in my memory as a sandwich worth it's weight in gold.  Don't let the price tag discourage you!!  It's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Angelina C.
Reviews.Content: Can $90 buy you a food-induced orgasm for two?Yep.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Dear Chef, this evening (Sunday) we had a conversation in the kitchen, where you were gracious enough to help me fulfill my girlfriend's Birthday wish, a hot buttered lobster roll. Monday is her bday, so she will go to bed and still be full when midnight strikes from the most wonderful Lobster meal. I can't say thank you enough, and I added a pic to this page of her with the roll in the Boston train station on the way back to NYC. Her trip home was complete, she is super happy and suuuuper full. Thank you so much for having me there and helping me make her evening and her trip back to Boston complete.Much love,Mike Lanni

Reviews.Author: Rick T.
Reviews.Content: I was able to get to Neptune for an early dinner and was able to snatch a seat in front of the raw bar immediately. Tons of diners arrived to put their name on their waiting list. Their wait was 45-90 minutes. Wow! I got real lucky!I had some Wellfleet and Thatch Island oysters to start and ordered the famous lobster roll (hot) as an entree. I've always enjoyed eating Wellfleets when I've been on the east coast, but the Thatch Island were excellent as well. Fairly large sized oyster and I loved the buttery finish. I liked that they gave you a sheet to order your oysters and provided detailed descriptions of the oysters' size and taste.The lobster roll finally came out with a mound of fries. You can order the roll hot with butter or cold with mayo. I was a bit hesitant ordering it hot since I was afraid that it may be too oily and the bun would be soaked in all that butter. However, it was PERFECT! Good amount of lobster and the fries were great. It was a bit on the high side in terms of price, but I'm not in Boston often so it was quite worth it.

Reviews.Author: Allison C.
Reviews.Content: Holy buttery goodness.  Neptune's is by far one of my most favorite restaurants in Boston hands down.  What's not to love?  Oysters, Clams, Lobster, seafood galore!  Entrees are delicious, wait staff is friendly - but the only downfall to Neptunes is the size of the restaurant and the wait time.  Great place to check out if you're looking for quality seafood.  I recommend the hot lobster roll (its pretty heavy though), oysters, and clam chowder!Nomz.

Reviews.Author: Tommy C.
Reviews.Content: Incredible lobster roll. Enough has been said about that.Everything else was a little "meh" for the price. Ordered the Triton platter and there is something a little off about their lobster and crab salad. It's great because it's virtually all meat, but I just didn't care for the seasoning and the amount of mayo/aoli whatever it was.It's worth going to see what the hype is about, but it's not life-changing. I definitely do not enjoy the seating arrangements there.

Reviews.Author: Aaron M.
Reviews.Content: Seriously? $25 for a SANDWICH??!!And the answer would be ... YES! It's worth every one of those 2,500 pennies! It's official: The warm lobster roll is part of my Last Meal. If I don't lick the plate clean, any leftover melted butter will make a fine conductant. When they throw the switch, I'll go out in a blaze of succulent crustacean glory. (See "My Last Meal on Earth.")Four trips to Neptune in 2009 yielded four new friends, from all over the globe. I just can't get enough of you, sweet Neptune!(Oh, did I mention? The oysters are off the charts.)

Reviews.Author: Kristyn M.
Reviews.Content: Just when I didn't think Neptune could get any better....I go and try their lobster roll. Buttery. Rich. Succulent. Tender. Fresh. Delicious.AMAZING. And seriously, who would've thought a seafood place specializing in raw oysters and whatnot would have some of the most immaculate french fries ever? Not me. BUT THEY DO. And this was seconded by sister-in-law potato connoisseur extraordinaire. Worth the 1h45m wait to be sure.

Reviews.Author: Paula A.
Reviews.Content: ~ L O V E  this place ~Yes its busy. Yes its small. Go, give 'em your # & they'll call when your table is ready. Take a stroll around historic N End & think about the party that your mouth is about to have.We started with the oysters & jumbo shrimp -- i don't do oysters but i hear they were great & the shrimp was yummy! the cocktail sauce was perfectly spicy. Onto the main event: THE LOBSTER ROLLS. we got one hot (dripping with butter) and one cold (lightly mayo'd). Only problem, i can't decide which i liked best. At the end of the hot one, you have to resort to using a fork & knife b/c the butter does a number on the roll, but that's hardly a complaint. I'm sure i liked my side of fries b/c i ate them all & i'm picky about fries. Topped off our meal w/ a few  bloody marys & blood orange bellinis - both fab. the service was great -- especially impressive b/c it's a small place & constantly mobbed.

Reviews.Author: Lena K.
Reviews.Content: You know, there are little things in this world that are better than huge chunks of lobster drenched in hot melted butter poured over a piece of bread that soaks up all the leftover butter than the lobster couldn't catch. Or a fried clams appetizer with fresh tartar sauce that consists or a portion so generous it can easily pass as an entree.Or an oyster selection so varied in selection it's like you're in an ocean... filled with lots of different oysters...?either way, Neptune Oyster was FABULOUS. yeah, it's kind of expensive and yeah, the space is small so you probably have to wait a bit. but it was worth it. plus, it's right by modern, mike's and maria's so you can wash down your lobster with a delicious cannoli! perfect for any day

Reviews.Author: Saba N.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I didn't review this place! I have been dying to go for so many months and then I finally do... and I forget to review it on yelp! silly me.So. flipping. good. I think it's a touch overpriced for the size - but it's really a delicious lobster roll (as I'm sure everyone is aware).I just think the wait is absurd for what it is. I know they take your number and I know that you can go wander around.. but 3:30 on a Sunday.. 2 hours wait? Are you kidding me? God, sometimes I despise the tourists! (Just kidding, but seriously.. go back to your state). It's definitely the best lobster roll I've had in Boston.. but I would really only go back if the wait wasn't too long. Or if I didn't mind waiting (i.e, check in and go explore the city). It's a horrible spot for an impromptu day or a romantic date. And.. it's super cramped on the inside. I guess it's part of the 'old school charm'.

Reviews.Author: Julie H.
Reviews.Content: Wow!  Freaking heaven on a toasted bun!  I think that when I took the first bite of my hot lobster roll the clouds parted and the sun began shining...yes it was that good!  This place kinda set the tone for my entire weekend in Boston.  I started off with some oysters and then that INCREDIBLE lobster roll.  Honestly, I am a bit afraid to eat a lobster roll from anywhere else now cause this one was the first that I have ever had and I can't imagine it getting any better.  If it does, I am in serious trouble cause that means I gotta drop everything and move to this fantabulous city.  My kids will be none too happy cause there is no way I am taking them with cause then I would have to share the lobster!!!!!!Thanks Neptune...you are so appropriately named as you ARE definitely  the king of the sea(food).

Reviews.Author: Sebastian N.
Reviews.Content: Love. Lobster roll with butter was stellar. Service was fantastic. The Johnny Cake with smoked trout and caviar is out of this world. Raw bar is fantastic. My favorite seafood joint in bean town.

Reviews.Author: Seth M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Neptune about a handful of times and have not had a bad meal.  This place is great.  You'll definitely have to wait, but you can put your name in and give them your phone # and go have a drink across the street, they'll call you when they have a seat for you.  Everything I've eaten here is wonderful, including the oyster crackers they give you munch on while waiting for your meal. Not going to go on and on about what to get because you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  If you want some of the best seafood in Boston.... go to Neptune.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L.
Reviews.Content: After being told we'd have to wait 30-45 minutes at a tourist trap a few blocks away, my boyfriend quickly yelped raw bars in the area, hit upon Neptune, and, based upon the good reviews, we rambled on over. And thank goodness we did!Despite it being 7pm on a Saturday night, we immediately found seats at the bar. The bar is an elegantly appointed amalgam of ebony-washed wood, mirrors, and white subway tiles. In a less thoughtful décor job, these elements could have rendered the bar clinical, but the ambiance as it stands is sophisticated without being overly pretentious. As we didn't sit at the tables, I can't vouch for how crowded they are, but we had more than enough room at the bar.As an oyster novice, I was hesitant about the raw bar. After our first three pairs of oysters, however, I was completely sold on a second course. All of the oysters were extremely fresh and the available selection is considerable. Our waitress was personable, attentive, and recommended a great white wine to pair with our selections. Pricing was fair, but that was probably because we didn't order plats. Would enthusiastically recommend, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Josh M.
Reviews.Content: We didn't go all the way to Boston to go to Neptune, if we had...it would have made sense and been more than worth the trip!  We sat at the bar, were given a card with great oyster options, and a small golf pencil to make our selections.  The attentive bartender helped us make magic with that pencil.  All in, we ordered 2 dozen of the best oysters I have had in my life.  We followed the oysters with a hot lobster roll, which was beyond fantastic.   It was interesting to me that all tables and bar spots were filled with people on dates.  I think people were hoping its true what they say about oysters... This place does its best to prove it and does a damn good job.  Trust me on that.

Reviews.Author: nomo c.
Reviews.Content: Oysters were all fresh and delicious. But we live in Boston and can get the same type of oysters for a dollar at a restaurant with happy Hr specials.  So it was nothing special to me.The hot lobster roll is full and meaty but I've never been a fan of things drenched in buttah so I wouldn't order it again.  Butter lovers will die over this. The Johnny cake with honey butter, smoked trout, and little pearl caviar was sooooo goood.  I could have eaten 5 of these.  Nice sweet and savory flavor.The curry mussels are also a must have appetizer.We went during lunch on a weekday so we only waited 5 min.The bathroom is small but clean, a plus.

Reviews.Author: Tony T.
Reviews.Content: Selection of oysters is incredible, and boy are they tasty! I really like the menu which describes the flavor of each type of oyster.Also, second best lobster rolls I've ever had (best were from Reds Eats in Maine).The cioppino is also excellent.Service was good.Wait time is INSANE though. Like three hours on a weekend and 1.5 hours on a weekday.

Reviews.Author: Brenda B.
Reviews.Content: My bf and I had stumble upon this place by chance on a rainy day. Drenched and hungry, this place looked dry and cozy. Heading inside, it was empty. Apparently, we beat the rush by a good hour before it was flooded with people. Do get here early because it got packed even on a Wednesday night. We seated ourselves at the bar and our waiter was quick to greet us. Staring hungrily at the row of oysters by the window, the seafood fiend next to me could hardly wait. I was excited as well especially since I have never tried raw oysters before. As it turns out, I couldn't have picked a better place to do it.To start, you're given a piece of paper and a yellow pencil to write how many oysters, sea urchin, shrimps, clams, etc. you want. We decided to go all out with the raw bar getting a bit of everything plus the P.E.I mussels appetizer. What did it for the appetizer was the curry broth. Be sure to save a piece of the bread you get in the beginning to pair it with remainder of the broth.I love the jumbo sized shrimps! One bite, you'll get this overwhelming sensation that you're sitting out on a dock by the beach with the Caribbean breeze blowing through your hair. It's my way of saying this is damn refreshingly fresh! The cocktail sauce was delicious even by itself! The spicy mustard slabbed on top makes it all the better. The oysters were A-mazing!  I honestly couldn't tell which was which since everything was served on this gigantic silver platter with ice. Our waiter did tell us, but seriously I was just nodding "okay, yup yup," hoping it'll help speed up his monologue so I can quickly feast. This whole experience rocked my taste bud. Some were salty while others were sweet. That oyster juice was so good that I wish they sold it in bottles at CVS or something. Titled "Wellfleet oysters juice" now flavored with cocktail mustard and garlic. The cherrystone and little neck clams were also deliciously succulent. I think the little neck clams were the most salty ones of the raw stuff I've tried.  Definitely come here for their fresh oysters selections. It's a pricey place but well worth the money. I would suggest it to any guy to bring their dates here. Once you try this place, you'll want to come back.

Reviews.Author: Sacha M.
Reviews.Content: Typically, I avoid the North End like the plague. Well, perhaps not the plague. Maybe I avoid the North End like the flu, as I do head there occasionally. But the point is that the hordes of tourists and the restaurants that get by serving their unknowing patrons lackluster, and often, inauthentic cuisine, prevent me from staying too long. It's no surprise that my favorite place in the North End, Neptune Oyster, is a seafood restaurant with an emphasis on shellfish.I have been meaning to try the lobster rolls at Neptune for, I kid you not, four years or so.  I needed to know if a roll in a sit down restaurant with a $25 price tag really did trump all of those served up at seaside shacks. So, I clearly took my dad here for Father's Day out of loving daughterly devotion and not at all out of the need to satisfy my own selfish shellfish affinity...The tiny spot, with its nautical tiling and window full of fresh oysters, clams, and shrimp, probably only seats forty, three-quarters of them with lobster roll in hand. For one who tries to avoid tourist traps, I may have come to the wrong place. In fact, while waiting to be seated, one family on the street told us they were from Maryland and had tried on two other trips to Boston to get in.But trap Neptune was not. The restaurant satisfies both CT-style lobster lovers and everyone else by offering its rolls hot with butter or cold with mayo. I told my father that there were rules to our outing: We were to each order a lobster roll. One had to be buttered, one had to be mayoed. We were to split these evenly. We were to eat the buttered one first so as to enjoy it while warm. Again, I stress the daughterly devotion. Rules and regulations, though, went out the window, because both of us had strong preferences. My dad only had eyes for the cold lobster roll, but I did steal a bite or two and was impressed. Both rolls featured only whole pieces of claw, knuckle, and tail meat which were substantial and weighty, yet not at all chewy. The brioche bun certainly tipped its hat to the traditional hot dog roll and its light sweetness heightened the extreme sweetness of the lobster. This was not, however, a refined experience. Whole pieces of lobster means a whole lotta mess. The soft bun perfectly encased the cold lobster but quickly split when topped with, no saturated by, the buttered lobster, which sent streams of fat down my arms. Although, "streams of fat" may not sound particularly appetizing, I definitely have to declare the lobster roll with butter the winning sandwich. The sweet butter gave the lobster such depth and richness while allowing what we paid $25 dollars for to shine. I would certainly also order the cold roll again. The coating of mayonnaise was so very light and added a sexy silkiness to the experience. It also gives you the option of forgoing the knife and fork if you simply want to hunker down and eat the lobster roll as it was meant to be eaten.As for the sides, the roll is served with a heaping pile of fries, which I expected to only be a forgettable requisite but which were instead well-seasoned and nicely browned. I opted for some mixed greens, which were woefully overdressed. I've heard great things about other menu offerings and the raw bar, which I would love to try, but as I said, there were rules to this trip.Just as you sometimes feel the need to get the burger from Radius, I guess there's a time and a place for a good $25 lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Monique N.
Reviews.Content: I heart Neptune Oyster!My hubby and I visited this place twice and each time we are amazed that the food is consistent and you cannot beat the authentic atmosphere, character in the decor everywhere you look.  Our first visit was during a quiet afternoon and our second, a hustlin' and bustlin' weekday evening.  On our last visit, we started off with a round of 8 pairs of select raw oysters, the freshness is amazing!  Accompanied with cold glasses of harpoon IPA. YUM!  Ordered the lobster roll (hot) it was ridiculously good!  So good that, I didn't even like lobster before I had the lobster roll, now I find myself fantasizing about the next occasion that I can spring $25 for something so good I feel guilty after every bite.  Although a little less glam in comparison to the lobster roll, the Neptune Burger was a pleasant surprise for a seafood joint.  A hearty serving of burger topped with fried oysters and let/toma/ketch on a soft & fluffy, grilled bun. *Sigh* till next time...

Reviews.Author: Erik M.
Reviews.Content: Went to the Legal Seafood down in South Boston the day before and had about a dozen oysters, and thought they were really good. Now, however, after being to Neptune Oyster I know what a good oyster should taste like!Friendly, casual service. We dined at the bar, but that was very pleasant. Fast service. Like many other we had to wait just over an hour for our table, but it was well worth the wait. Just go to one of the other restaurants on the street and have a drink while your table gets ready!

Reviews.Author: James C.
Reviews.Content: Great seafood! We caved and went with the lobster roll and we were not disappointed. I love the fact that they'll take your number and call you when they have a seat for you. Nice touch. Being able to visit the neighborhood while waiting for a table made the 45 minute wait a pleasure. The oysters are fresh and the selection was more than adequate. If given the chance I'm pretty sure I could have dropped $200 on oysters alone. Two dozen later and I had to curb it a little. As stated the place is small but that is part of it's charm. You never feel rushed and the service is quick and courteous. This will be a stop whenever we come to Boston.

Reviews.Author: melissa T.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome! Amazing food, great fun atmosphere, the lovely ladies that work there are friendly and helpful.. We were looking for one last lobster roll before heading leaving town. This place was it. The crab bisque was so delicious, I could have eaten a few bowls. I had the "naked lobster roll", the boyfriend had the "lobster roll with mayo", both were delicious.  Because this place is so amazing, there was a small wait, however they take your name and number and will call you. We found a coffee shop up the street to hang out at until we could be seated. We did notice that they have a raw bar, and put together some beautiful plates. Good variety of beer and wine. This place is small, but totally worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Keith R.
Reviews.Content: I got the warm lobster roll with butter. There was a lot of meat and it was really good. For $30 I think you can get a better deal though.

Reviews.Author: jonathan s.
Reviews.Content: oysters and a lobster roll. pretty great lunch. big tasty variety of oysters and mignonette was basic but still good. got the lobster roll hot and this on its own was worth the 30 minute wait. highly recommend. fries it came with were above average as well. like a lot of places now, they take your name and phone number and call you when your table is about to be ready. this allowed us to have a beer across the street while we waited. place is tinnnnny. would be rough to sit at the counter.

Reviews.Author: Steve C.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic lobster roll. Must have contained four lobsters worth of meaty, delicious chunks of ocean goodness. Very crowded, but got a spot at the bar in minutes. Hard-working staff is friendly and helpful. Will be back for more.

Reviews.Author: Danni S.
Reviews.Content: Wow. Wow. Wow. I was completely blown away by Neptune Oyster both times I have been there this summer. Its hard to even find what to start with. The restaurant itself seats under 50 people, from I saw. There are only a handful of tables and a bar; I sat at the bar both times and was completely comfortable. I absolutely loved how intimate the place was. That being said, be prepared for an hour or two wait at dinner time (and you're in the North End so go get dessert first with your time!). The service was great, I had the same bartender both time and he had perfect recommendations for both food and drink. I was not a big oyster person before I stepped foot in Neptune; however I can't say the same anymore. They have an incredible variety of raw bar options. I have discovered that I prefer West Coast oysters. I also tried the hot butter lobster roll (yum!) and the seared scallop. Lets just say that I licked the plate clean. I wish I could get the seared scallop every night for dinner. It was simply that delicious. There is something about a new experience that I love, and Neptune provided that with style and some of the best food I've had in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Kim D.
Reviews.Content: I walked around the North End looking for a possible lunch that can fill me up before my flight since my friend was at work at the time.  I yelped around and walked around but then came to Neptune Oyster.  There was a line forming already before it even opened...always a good sign.  It's a tiny place that they try to pack in with all the customers.  Since I was one of the few that got in first thing service was still peppy and good.  I started with a chenin blanc as I waited for my oysters and clams to be shucked.  Fresh raw oysters and clams were great to start off here.  They have great variety.  I then opted to get the lobster speghettini.  Portion was huge.  It made me think I shouldn't have the raw stuff but I figured I had a long flight I'd just skip out on dinner.  The pasta dish was very good with a lot of chunks of sweet tasting lobster and the light tomato sauce paired just right.I did feel like the servers were probably waiting for me to leave to get more folks in around me but I did take my sweet time and it was just me and not a large party so they can't say anything. Overall, I'd come back again when it's not so busy...I don't know about having to wait too long.  It's a great place to eat but there's also a lot other places to check out in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Jim G.
Reviews.Content: Can you say the worst service ever? I feel more appreciated at a McDonalds

Reviews.Author: Abdul M.
Reviews.Content: The oyster selection and the fact that you can order by the piece allowing you to order one of each if you like is great. The freshness and quality of the oysters was unsurpassed. The waif staff is friendly and even though the place is small they make sure you are seated as quick as possible. We have eaten at numerous oyster places in Boston and other places and this would be in the top 5 on our list. You need to go if in Boston and if you like Oysters. The lobster roll was huge and equally good.

Reviews.Author: Willanne W.
Reviews.Content: I confess, this was my first Lobster Roll.  So, not having anything else to compare it to, I'd say it tasted like lobster in drawn butter.  I like that but it wasn't a culinary adventure .. especially not at $25 for the sandwich!  The roll was okay; fresh, toasted and saturated with butter.  The lobster was, well, lobster.  Saturated in butter and was more than I could eat.  It was accompanied by a plate of home cut french fries.  Tasty but quite greasy.  Barely made a dent in those as they were a big pile.Personally, I wouldn't wait in line for it.  I'd rather wait in line for pizza at Pizzeria Regina!

Reviews.Author: Sally S.
Reviews.Content: Best Clam Chowder soup I had in my visit to Boston. Definitely get the lobster roll. I had it warm with butter.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer A.
Reviews.Content: I'm very glad Jill K. chose this place for us to finish our trip off with Lobster Rolls.  Those things are HUGE!  (and delicious)  I've had my fill of lobster for a while...In addition to the crazy lobster rolls...Neptune's offers a good list of oysters that you just check off on a list the ones you want (kind of like those papers you get during all you can eat sushi) and yes, they were yummy.The table next to use was a group of four sharing a couple bottles of wine and various seafood appetizers and dishes - which seemed like a really cool way to go.  The mussels and razor clams looked delicious!In addition the feel of the place was really mellow and cool.  Great for a group, great for a date.  We were lucky we got there early, it's not a big place so there was a line at the door when we left.

Reviews.Author: Jacquee P.
Reviews.Content: It's beautiful in here. Absolutely beautiful. Loads of crunchy ice, bright yellow lemons, marble counter tops, dark wood...We had the black cod ceviche with blood orange and smoked salt and the HOT lobster roll. The lobster meat to bun ratio is very nice. The bun couldn't contain all the lobster meat so I ate it with a knife and fork.

Reviews.Author: Adam W.
Reviews.Content: Impeccably fresh seafood served in a most tiny and charming environment.  The close quarters foster a convivial environment and encourage total strangers to share conversation and food amongst themselves.  The end result is a totally enjoyable dining experience.  By the time all was said and done, I had ordered and/or tried a variety of oysters, clam chowder, fried Ipswich clams, and a lobster roll.  Everything was fantastic, and I seriously doubt that there are any clinkers on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Jeff M.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is quickly becoming one of my favourite restaurants in Boston. The Monday night special Lobster and spaghetti was absolutely wonderful and had more lobster than pasta in it. I just wish they didn't have to sit you next to other parties. Aw well...I'll keep coming back.On a recent visit the skin on the Friday night special Blue Fish was soggy.  This effects the texture and taste off the fish.  Everything else on the plate and that night was still excellent.

Reviews.Author: Jo K.
Reviews.Content: Clam chowder was watery and lacked flavor. Then came the lobster roll, 3 of us got it with mayo, the other friend got his with butter. Hot butter was clearly the winner. For a $25 sandwich, I expected more. It's definitely fresh and loaded with lobster meat, but as for flavor I say it was bland and average tasting. Loved the interior though.

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: The place is TINY!!! You have to be really lucky about when you go to get a table. I don't usually eat raw oysters, but I definitely made an exception here. They had delicious and not fishy oysters. There were so many selections, we didn't know which ones to pick, we had the server pick for us. And her recommendations were a success!For 3 people, we ordered : 1 hot lobster roll- loved this one1 cold lobster roll -it was nice, but I prefer the hot one1 seafood soup - YUMMY. That's all I can sayA note though. Lobster rolls apparently come with fries. I didn't know that because 1/2 of the restaurant ordered lobster rolls and theirs all came with salad. Apparently you have to ask. We didn't so ours came with large servings of fries. However, when we asked about it, the server gave us a free salad on the side since she saw how daunting it was that we had 2 giant piles of fries that we didn't look too happy about. Overall, lobster roll was good. Surprisingly filling. If I were to return, for 3 people, I'd have ordered 10 oysters, 1 hot lobster roll, and the soup. And that'd be all. Two lobster rolls is just overkill.

Reviews.Author: Eric F.
Reviews.Content: Wanting to show my visiting friend some of Boston's best raw seafood offerings, we decided to stop by Neptune for some oysters and clams.  I'd been meaning to finish up sampling all of their oyster varieties, so here we go:Thatch Island, MA (buttery, light briny taste)Bluepoint, CT (smooth)Taylor Bay, MA (overly salty)Pemaquid, ME (zesty)Ninigret, RI (lightly salty)Fanny Bay, BC (melon flavor, cucumber finish)The Fanny Bay oysters took the cake with their standout, layered flavor that transitioned well from beginning to end.  In fact, I'd say it beats out the lauded Kumamotos for my top pick.  I had some white to go with the midday snack and I continue to be thoroughly impressed with their selections by the glass:Puiatti, Chardonnay 'Zuccole', Fruili, 2009 (mild butter notes, full body, dry finish)Gramona, Muscat 'Gessami', Penedes, 2008 (medium body, mild sweetness, honey and lemon notes)Both were fantastic and I would especially recommend the latter considering that I'm not even a fan of Muscatos in general.  Excellent food as always and I WILL get the Triton platter one of these days! XD

Reviews.Author: Irene H.
Reviews.Content: Found this place, thanks to Yelp. I arrived around 9pm on a Sunday night. The line was out the door. When you get there, check in with the hostess. Whenever I dine alone, I encounter friendlier service and this place was no exception. The hostess found me a seat at the bar as soon as something freed up, ahead of the other parties. Sunday is fish tacos day, but by 9pm, they had run out of fish tacos. Sad face. I got an oyster card which lists all of the in-stock oysters, its origin, and description. I opted for 6 East Coast oysters from MA and PEI. I appreciated the descriptions; there wasn't an oyster that I didn't like! I got the lobster roll as my main. You can get it warm with butter or cold with mayo. I went with the warm because I often feel that places obscure the flavor or quantity of lobster with mayo. For $25, I don't think you can get a better lobster roll in NYC (and I know this is Boston, but unfortunately my lobster roll baseline is from NYC). The lightly toasted roll was brimming with big chunks of lobster. The fries on the side were also perfectly salted and in my opinion, the perfect consistency. I went again the following night, around 5:40pm. I really wanted to try the cold lobster roll, but ended up going with the special of the day, the lobster spaghettini ($36). For those of you who are worried about portion size, you can share with another person. Also, unlike most places, there are probably more chunks of lobster in here than spaghetti! (or on the lobster roll).

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Went to Neptune Oyster over the weekend and had a great late lunch with a friend. Just a tip, if you don't want a long wait I recommend coming here for a late lunch. We got here and waited at the door for 5 minutes. Do they have a host/hostess? We ended up sitting at the bar, which was fine.We had:Fried Oysters - They were great, perfectly fried, and the tartar sauce it came with was homemade and very tastyOysters - We had about a half dozen oysters. The Kamata Bay oysters were my favoriteLobster Roll - We got the lobster with Hot Butter, which was what the waitress recommended.Overall Neptune's is a great raw bar restaurant but the place is extremely small. Definitely worth the wait and the price!

Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster, I have nothing but good things to say about the place! Well, maybe except for the wait. I love seafood! It's kinda my thing.The goods: I ordered 3 different types East Coast Oysters and they were amazing. I wish I could tell you what they were, but I insisted on letting the waiter choose them for me. On a side note, if you don't know what's good just ask the waiter/waitress. The Oysters were shucked on the halfshell and placed on a bed of crushed ice served with condiments. Not bad for approx $2.50 a pop.Then there was the HOT or Buttered Lobster Roll. I can't even begin to tell you how awesome this thing is! It's a good amount of lobster chunks in the roll served with fries. The fries are also very good and are often overlooked because the lobster roll just eclipses it. The roll is $25 and is worth every penny. When the lobster roll hits your lips it just melts in your mouth. The lobster topped with warm butter very tender and the roll containing it all together is moist. It's pretty much a perfect combination. To top things off I had a Peroni to finish it off.The ONLY complaint:The wait was a little long. Give or take an hour or so just to get a table. Luckily for me I had a layover for 3 hours and got a seat at the bar right away.Overall:It's a quaint little place that has a knowledgeable waitstaff with passion for what they serve. From talking with some locals and outsiders like myself, I've found that this is probably the best hole in the wall place. People are friendly and the food is amazing. Good place for good seafood, if you can find it. My blackberry GPS didn't pin-point it, just found a general location of it.

Reviews.Author: Josephine L.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm....Oysters.I'll say this for Boston: You turned a former bivalve-hater into a bonafide bivalve-lover. Mussels, scallops, clams, oysters....I love them all! Probably because I can get them so fresh here.Anyway, Neptune Oyster was an adventure in fresh seafood. My friend and I got 14 delicious, slimy, briney oysters to start. I don't remember their names besides Island Creek and Kusshi, but we chose them on the basis of their finishes: butter, cucumber, sweet pea, citrus.Then we split the Hamachi Crudo. Sweet Jebus, it was good! OK, I love yellowtail like my aquatic soulmate (that I want to eat) so this dish was pretty much guaranteed to satisfy. Fresh, thick slices of beautiful yellowtail lightly topped with salad green garnishes and homemade kimchi (yes, kimchi) underneath with a little cucumber/lime/salt sauce to accompany. Delicous!I had the North End Cioppino for my entree and it was amazing. Basically a seafood stew (two of my favorite things in one) served with saffron rice. They did not skimp on the mussels, clams or fish and did not hold back on the spicy tomato broth which was absolutely fantastic. Warm, hearty, fresh--a perfect entree.My friend got the lobster roll and it was very good. Thick, succulent pieces of tender lobster on a hot buttered roll with some excellent crispy french fries--definitely a good pick if you want something lighter.Service was excellent--friendly and very attentive, even with the ever-increasing dinner crowd and ever-decreasing dining space.

Reviews.Author: Angie T.
Reviews.Content: This was our very first food stop in Boston and we are sure glad we did!  If you're a sea-foodie, this is a great stop.  I would definitely recommend their Plateaus.  We got the Triton it was a GREAT variety selection.  I'm a big oyster fan and the oysters had a great finish.  Their homemade cocktail sauce is a great pair. You can't be in Boston without having a Lobster Roll!  And their lobster role is delicious!  We tried it hot and I can't imagine having it any other way.  I would also suggest trying their Buttermilk Johnnycakes.  It's paired with trout tartar and caviar, and it's a different flavor in every bite.  The restaurant was very small so large groups may be hard to get seating.

Reviews.Author: Sandra L.
Reviews.Content: You come here for the food, not the service. Though the waiters were not super friendly, they were not rude either. They just work there...We tried to walk in for dinner on Thursday night at 7pm and the hostess said they stopped taking names for the remainder of the night! Crazy! The establishment doesnt have much dining space though. It's a casual enviornment and totally bustling. Since we couldn't get a table there, we decided to try Neptune for lunch on Friday.We arrived around 11:45am and seated promptly. There was a major rush at 12:30 though...We ordered the Ispwich clams as a starter, then tasted the Island Creek (Duxbury) and Katama Bay (Martha's Vinyard) oysters. The clams came out nicely chilled. The Katama Bay oysters had a nice buttery popcorn finsh while the Island Creek had a fresh, juicy and fruity taste. Both very good.Then we moved on to the lobster roll. You have the choice of hot or cold. The cold roll consists of lobster mixed with mayo on the roll. We chose the hot roll, grilled with butter and filled with warm lobster chunks. It was DELICIOUS!  The plate comes with fries which tasted fine but looked very dark. My boyfriend thinks we got the bottom of the batch. Anyways, don't fill up on the fries.Since we had a little room left, we ordered two more sets of oysters. The Pemaquid had a nice citris finish (which I love) and the Cherrystone clams were very sweet and juicy.  It's definitely a place to try if you love oysters and lobster rolls!

Reviews.Author: Michelle T.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch on a Saturday around noon and only had to wait 20 minutes. The last time we came here for dinner at 8pm, we were asked to wait 2 hours. Portions in general run a little smaller and prices run a little higher than I think is fair value for a place of that size, atmosphere, etc. The hot lobster rolls are incredible...I'm not a big fan of butter, but this buttery bread was perfect. Not too greasy, not too dry and served with a side of a teeny little salad.Cioppino was fresh and delicious. We added lobster, but it wasn't worth it for the extra $10 we added in addition to the regular price. Flavor wise and service here, they hit a high 4-stars, but value and atmosphere, I'd have to say a high 2 or 3 stars.

Reviews.Author: Shannon M.
Reviews.Content: Come here on Monday's...they have lobster spaghetti and it is ridiculously good!!We started with the mussels in red curry sauce with cashews, cilantro, garlic and lime.  I used to hate mussels.  And then I had them with red curry and cilantro.  It changed EVERYTHING.  Now I am obsessed and this is all I want to eat.I ordered the hot lobster roll with butter sauce, which was delicious, but then I had a bite of my boyfriend's lobster spaghetti....and for the first time I had to admit he had the better dish.  The service was great, I loved the decor, and the wait isn't terrible when you can explore the North End.  We had enough time to leave, wait in line for some cannoli's to have for dessert later, and then come back to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Came to Neptune around 6pm on a Monday, which pretty much beats the dinner rush at any restaurant.The raw bar has huge variety, and the 2 types of oysters I partook in tasted very fresh.The lobster roll, expensive, tasty, bathed in warm butter (chilled with mayo is an option, but our waiter recommended this). It's definitely enough for an entree, but my fatty family decided to turn it into an appetizer. The clam chowder was a healthier-version, less cream and more fresh ingredients. Worth a try, but I'd argue it's not the prototypical Boston chowdah. I was less impressed with the entrees, but did find the portion sizes just right.Service was great, decor was very fitting for a trendy, upscale seafood place. I'd strongly consider coming back to Neptune in future Boston trips.

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a buddy and his girlfriend for lunch. They had only been open for 5 minutes before there were already 10 people inside. The place holds about 30-40 so it's obviously pretty popular.For appetizer we got some oysters and the shrimp cocktail. They were fresh, but we're in Boston here, so nothing special. Though the shrimp was delicious, fresh and slightly sweet. We wish we tried some of the fried appetizers. They looked really good.We got the lobster rolls, hot and cold. The hot was pretty good, but could really use just a little seasoning beyond the butter. And the cold was the same, mostly mayo and sold, no celery or anything. Buuuut, the rolls were 8 inch rolls and stuffed with a lobster and a half. It's ridiculously huge.Overall, slightly pricey, but portions and quality to match.

Reviews.Author: Roxana F.
Reviews.Content: YUM.I went here over the summer last year for a second date and boy was it a good one!First off, this place is pretty damn small and you sit VERY close to your neighbors, but we sat at the bar which I liked more than sitting at their tables. Get here early so you can put your name down because it gets packed.We started off with their clam chowder and some oysters. Clam chowder was AMAZING, not too heavy, great balance of ingredients, just plain delicious. Oysters were okay...it was actually the first time I've ever had oysters and I have an intolerance for salt so they weren't the best part of the meal, but my date loved them.We then shared two entrees. Their menu changes regularly and if I'm not mistaken we got arctic char and sea bass. One came in a delicious, summery, seafoody stew, and the other came with beets and goat cheese, which is a favorite combination of mine. If I am ever fortunate enough to go again I want to try the lobster roll everyone on here raves about. I went here 9 or 10 months ago but I will never forget how good the food (and company) was, so if you're visiting Boston or are a Bostoner looking for dinner in the North End, check out this little gem.

Reviews.Author: Jessica I.
Reviews.Content: This is a place that's inspired enough breathless reviews and superlatives that it makes writing a review feel somewhat superfluous. But the warm lobster roll... I just can't stop thinking about it. Maybe it won't haunt me in my dreams if I write a review.Just about everything good you'll read about Neptune Oyster is true, and so are some of the complaints. But this is a solid five-star place because it's that rare famous restaurant with food to back up its reputation. Yes, it's tiny and crowded and the wait can be long. So what? I defy you to find tastier seafood anywhere. Besides, there are dozens of great little bars and restaurants to hang your hat while you wait for the server to call you when your table is ready. Is that really so difficult? I'd wait for hours in a rainy gutter for another warm lobster roll. The raw bar is great, too. I happened to like the cozy, tight space, as it feels like it's not been changed for decades, and the service was warm and efficient. There are many good reasons for the line out the door. You'll see me in it next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Diane Z.
Reviews.Content: I love the lobster rolls! Just tried the cold one, and it is delish! Although, I still like the hot one more.Don't skip the shrimp cocktail! They're huge and meaty!

Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: Stopped here this past weekend.  It was about an hour wait during lunch time but you can use that time to grab a beer at one of the many North End bars in the same vicinity.1. Oysters-  Oysters were phenomenal.  Had an assortment of six and although pricey, as is always the case with oyster, they were worth the dough.  Great variety and awesome flavor.2. Hot Lobster Roll-  This was definitely a very good lobster roll.  That being said, I don't think I would label it as "elite" as many on here have.  I'll have to try the cold one next time.  I wanted to try the hot for something different but after eating it, I can safely say that a cold roll from "Ed's Lobster Roll" in NYC is superior.  3. Beers- Harpoon IPA on tap and it was tasty as usual.All in all a great spot.  Pricey but mostly worth the money spent.

Reviews.Author: Jerrold S.
Reviews.Content: The hot butter lobster roll is the best lobster roll ever.  The mayo version is out of my life forever.  I don't understand why people like to mask the lobster with goopy mayo.  The hot butter is the way to go.  The toasted roll held up well to the lobster and hot butter sauce.  The fries were fresh cut and some of the best fries we've had in a while.  Every fry off the 3 lobster roll plates was eaten. The clam chowder was a little disappointing.  Too watery for me.  Not enough cream and richness to the broth even though there were huge clams in the chowder.The steamed clams with white wine, garlic and parsley was refreshing.  The sauce was tasty.  We could have eaten several orders of these. I was a little disappointed with the raw oyster and clams.  They were good no doubt but not as good as Legal Sea Foods.  It was nothing special but I think that is probably due to my preference for the smaller west coast oysters.  We tried some of the local oysters and this just isn't my favorite type.  Too meaty for me.  The clams were good but didn't have the same meaty salty balance.Go for the hot butter lobster roll.  Don't kid yourself.

Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: Still my favorite place to eat in Boston.  Even in August, fresh and briny local oysters in abundance - the Wellfleets and Katuma Bays were flawless on my recent visit.  The lobster "cocktail" is still amazing and a generous portion, to boot.  Had a wonderful and chunky special mixed crudo - yellowtail, salmon and tuna dressed and presented beautifully.  Finished with the angels on piggyback, which I had never tried before but could not resist after the couple sitting next to me at the bar oohed and ahhhed over theirs.  Obscenely good - crunchy fried oyster, succulent pork belly cooked to the melting point where it more resembled rillettes and pistachio aioli with nicely dressed mixed greens.  Mmmm.  All washed down with a glass of Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc from New Zealand - my favorite white wine.

Reviews.Author: Lisa B.
Reviews.Content: Sooo many reviews, so I'll be quick.Outstanding raw bar.  High quality dinners.  I got the lobster roll (hot) and my party got the scallops and cod.We waited an hour and a half (beginning at 530 on a cold Friday night), and I'm not 100% sure it was worth it.  The food was definitely good, but I wasn't blown away by any of the main entrees. The raw bar, however, easily gets 5 stars.  Next time I'll just order from there.

Reviews.Author: Anne W.
Reviews.Content: It's still pretty good.. but they have cheapened out.  :(  I am sorry.. I just hate it when a restaurant starts out so good and then they cheapen out to make more money.  Don't do that!!Their lobster roll used to be stacked up high with lobster.  Now they have reduced the amount and added more butter.  Sad.  It's not as good even though it's still the only one around.  My friends who don't like butter think this place uses too much.  :(Their Triton platter is not as good as it used to be.  I think they have reduced the amount of seafood.  I would highly recommend asking for no mayo on the crab meat. The lobster is good with the olive oil and lemon.Their whole fish is a new dish that I have discovered.. pretty good.  Worth a try!

Reviews.Author: Mitch W.
Reviews.Content: Lobster Roll!!!!   Yipee, it was hot, fresh, buttery, and full of delicioiusly yummy lobster! I had the one with butter and french fries ($25.00).  YOU MUST TRY THE LOBSTER ROLL!What a great meal for my first Boston visit!!!Besides the lobster roll, we had four oysters ($2.70 each), which were fresh and excellent.One caveat:  Be prepared to wait.  We arrived around 11:15am and were told it was an hour and a half to two hour wait.  (We walked around the historic sites in the area to kill time.  You'll see the red brick line and it takes you to the sites like Paul Revere's house).Two words:  LOBSTER ROLL!I wish there was a place like this in Los Angeles.Xie Xie!

Reviews.Author: Alisa M.
Reviews.Content: Had to wait about 3 hours on a Saturday night before getting a table. It was worth the wait. The place is not that big and it gets VERY crowded. I would suggest making reservations early (they don't take reservations over the phone) because they were turning people away at 8pm because their wait list was so long.We ordered the hot lobster roll ($25) and comes with fries. The lobster roll was amazing ridiculous! The warm bun and sweet succulent lobster. I'd wait here for a table anytime! I'm usually a crab person, but this trip moved lobster right up there with Alaskan king crab! The raw bar was awesome too. They have a pretty large selection of different types of oysters. The oysters are shucked right behind the bar and if you're lucky enough to get a seat at the bar where they're shucking the oysters, it's something worth seeing. Oysters that we tried included: Kumamoto, Kusshi, Katama Bay, Summerside and Bees River. All were good except for the Kusshi. It's supposed to have a cucumber flavor but it had a bitter aftertaste. The ranking for the oysters: Kumamoto, Summerside, Katama Bay, Bees River, and Kusshi. I really like the Kumamoto because it was small and plump and very creamy. Very delicious!Although we went to another place that had $1 oysters the night before, these oysters are fresh and range between $2.50-close to $3 per oyster. We were disappointed that they ran out of sea urchin. Being from Chicago, it would have been nice to try fresh sea urchin since we don't have the luxury of trying it fresh out here. Would have liked to try the North End Cioppino. The people sitting next to us ordered it and it looked and smelled really good.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Jeebus, what a long wait to eat here! OMG! Such good food!So gf and I were told to by many people to come to Neptune when in Boston and of course we did. I knew there would be a wait, which was fine to me as we walked to Quincy Market to continue our touristy shopping.Anyways, three hours later, we were finally able to sit and order food.Oysters: Very fresh, very good. The only reason I didn't like some oysters were because I didn't like the particular oyster and not because they were bad or anything. GF and I loved the kumomoto's. For me, I thought the katama's and bees river's were up there as well. GF really liked the summersides. We both didn't care for kusshi. Then there was the lobster roll: We got it warm as so many others have before and it's so simple. Nice bread (didn't collapse under the meat like it seems like it has for others), plenty of lobster meat, more than plentiful amount of butter. What more can one ask for? Fries? Sure, they came with fries too. Really, really sweet and succulent lobster. My mouth waters thinking about it. Price isn't cheap, but is worth it for what you get. Will definitely be back when back in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Sasha B.
Reviews.Content: my favorite oyster bar. PERIOD.This is one of the places I truly miss in Boston. Great atmosphere, great food, GREAT raw bar.

Reviews.Author: Jon W.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars!Jon-- The wife and I felt like we entering an exclusive club, where only those with the most endurance would win. It was a 1.5 hour wait for this gem, but well worth it! We started with a half-dozen uber-fresh oysters recommended by the waitress from their very descriptive menu. We continued with a mildly spicy and saffron-ny cioppino and the much-vaunted lobster roll. The cioppino was excellent. There was a nice variety of meaty mussels, some large and succulent shrimp, and really fresh clams sitting in a very fragrant and slightly thick broth and a pile of risotto. It was both hearty and light and refreshing at the same time. Awesome!Jenny--There is very little seating here, but because Neptune Oyster came highly recommended, we roamed the neighborhood to kill the time. The lobster roll was the most expensive and best I had on our entire New England tour. We ordered the cold one with mayo. They just piled on the sweet lobster meat. Boy did I love biting into each succulent piece. The bread was nicely toasted too. I also really enjoyed the the cioppino. The mild spiciness really made it stand out from the rest. I had to try to slurp up what little broth the husband left me!Definitely worth the long wait! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: jasmin v.
Reviews.Content: I dream about the Lobster Roll! It might be because nothing compares in Chicago, but on a recent trip to Boston I tried two highly recommended Lobster Rolls and this place wins by a landslide.  MUST get hot and buttery!Be ready to wait a long time and outside but there are plenty of things to do (we walked to Mike's Pastry (YUM!) to buy cannoli's for dessert afterwards)The wait is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Caroline K.
Reviews.Content: We were given a 1+ hour wait, but it's so worth it.Oysters are undoubtedly famous and incredibly fresh as stated repeatedly in the previous reviews, so I won't go too much into detail there.  Their Indonesian-imported shrimps are insanely large, or otherwise described as, "injected with steroids."  But SO GOOD.LOBSTER ROLLS.  Your visit is not complete without one of these.  Large chunks of hot lobster slathered in butter served atop a super soft roll complete with French fries.  It kind of explains why Boston's well known for their seafood extravaganza.

Reviews.Author: Vince N.
Reviews.Content: Wow these were some amazingly awesome oysters. I would have to say the lobster roll was pretty amazing also.We were looking for the best lobster roll in the city...Neptune's popped up.Definitely a place worth going to if you are into shooting some raw oysters.For those who don't like raw oysters, the oysters here are so great you definitely have  to give it a shot. Sometimes you have to pay for what you get, and you will pay a pretty penny.The restaurant is quaint, so I would imagine that it fills up fast.We showed up during an off time so it was empty and a good time for our group to sit and talk.I'd eat here again the next time I was in Boston. I don't think you'd be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Eunice K.
Reviews.Content: SERVICE/AMBIANCE:-Really lucked out when we came here because we got there early and did not have to wait at all. The restaurant is pretty small and it is very casual inside. Love the atmosphere. They have a great beer selection.FOOD:-BLUE CRAB SALAD - Fresh blue crab and avocado. So yummy!-LOBSTER ROLL - 540 people say its delicious, well they are all right! Best thing I ate during my whole trip to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: Hate to be cliche with this one, but it's a 5-Star for the Lobster Roll.  Granted, we also tried the Blue Crab Salad, but it's a clear 5-Star.  I highly recommend calling your name in or at least trying to.  We had a 50 minute wait at 1p but they did take our number and call us while we were enjoying another local bar. The service was wonderful, our waitress was sweet, the Blue Crab Salad was wonderful, light and... the lobster roll was warm, buttery and rich.  Absolutely a dream.  I'm sitting in Charlotte saddened that I couldn't go back for dinner tonight!

Reviews.Author: Bobbie W.
Reviews.Content: Everyone I know who's been to Boston raved about this place so I managed to squeeze it in on a short business trip. It was close to closing time but after telling the hostess we were flying out the next morning, she was really sweet and got us a few seats at the bar. Me and my two coworkers each got a bowl of clam chowder and hot lobster rolls. The clam chowder was a little bland. I think it might be because it was the last batch for the day and they added water? Not really sure but it wasn't as tasty as I thought it was going to be. The good thing is there was lots of clams and veggies.The lobster roll was huge! There was so much lobster it was really overwhelming. I LOVE lobster but there wasn't anything in the sandwich to help balance it out. I got sick of it after awhile. It's basically just lobster and butter on a roll. Nothing else. Thank god I got salad instead of fries. It gave me some variety in textures and cut up that meatiness.Overall, I liked the restaurant. It's really cute inside and the servers were really nice. I'd come back but will definitely get other items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Priyanka M.
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical reviewing this place after over a 1000 reviews, but they are totally worth it. Lets just say I've been dreaming of their lobster rolls ever since I had them. After having read of Neptune oyster in nytimes and then on yelp my fiancee and I made it a point to make it here during our visit from Seattle. Lets just say best decision ever, even with the hr and a half wait time. The waitresses are extremely helpful and the food is beyond incredible. Starting from the raw bar to neptune caesar salad, neptunes on piggyback (great combination of oysters and porkbelly with pistachio aioli) and lobster roll, everything was cooked to perfection. For anybody who loves seafood, dining experience in Boston is incomplete without going to Neptune Oyster house!!!

Reviews.Author: Brittany H.
Reviews.Content: simply the BEST lobster roll in all of New England and New York.  Sorry NYC, your lobster rolls ain't got nothing on Neptunes... how can you say no to large chunks of lobster on a warm, buttery roll?!?!  Even the portion, I must admit was ginormous!  Very generous of you Neptunes...I applaud and approve.  brownie points for everything else...tuna tartare,  carrying kumamoto oysters... (though Glidden Points came in close second)....their chowder is a MAJOR let down.  this is not what i consider even remotely good.  still everything else is too good to pass down..and for that... i still give this place 5 stars for their amazing seafood.  and their delicious blood orange bellinis to wash it all down...the only caveat?  the 1.5-2 hour painstakingly wait. the restaurant itself is a handful of tables and bar seating.  Tight indeed.  TOTALLY worth the wait... TOTALLY worth the hype.... survival of the fittest.  seriously.

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: The raw oysters were amazeballs.  We were able to eat outdoors and someone on the street was playing a harp!  So romantic!  Also the clam chowder in the bread bowl was the most delicious I've ever tasted.  I am ruined for life because no other clam chowder can compare!

Reviews.Author: esther d.
Reviews.Content: Best hot lobster roll I've ever had! There was a 2.5hr wait on a Saturday early afternoon, but they let you put your name & number down and call you when you're table is ready so we walked around North End while we waited, and got food trucks to hold us over~Also got - Oysters : GoodClam chowder : WhateverBut again, best hot lobster roll ever! Definitely worth the trip and the wait!

Reviews.Author: Xin Z.
Reviews.Content: Food is good and fresh. A little bit price, and the space is really small.

Reviews.Author: Zhibo P.
Reviews.Content: I ordered lobster roll and clam chowder today. Both were great! I like this place.

Reviews.Author: Sam T.
Reviews.Content: Best Lobster Rolls ever.  All other sea food at raw bar was fresh.  You can't go wrong with the food here.Place is a bit stuffy.  Wait staff was cool, but the other customers were a bit snooty.

Reviews.Author: Rozita N.
Reviews.Content: It's a good place for visitors if they want to have an authentic boston style lobster. sometimes you need to wait in line for a long time to be seated. If you can go there for lunch before 11:30

Reviews.Author: Chris V.
Reviews.Content: We endured the long wait at the pub across the street.  No sweat.  The oysters were so fresh they begged for mercy.  None was given.

Reviews.Author: Jun W.
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you, this place matches all the hypes that have been generated in my search. Hands down, their lobster roll (with hot butter) was simply the best I have ever had in my life. The oyster tasted very fresh as if they just came from the sea. How did they pull this up? I have no idea. Though the wait was long (1.5 hr on Sunday) and food was more on the pricey side, I had not the slightest complaint. Comparing to the value they bring to the table, I was blown away and simply threw the cost out of the window. My experience with it is on weekend night is that you have to get there early enough (before 6pm) and put yourself on the waiting list. They then get your name and cell number and call you usually in 1.5 to 2.0 hr when the table is ready. I was rejected on Saturday after arriving there at 7:20pm. The rejection was simply and straightforward: we are fully booked for the night, please come back another time. Not giving up, I arrived there at 5:30pm on Sunday and finally got myself a spot after 1.5 hour of waiting.Definitely want to take my wife there next time I go to Boston!!!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa W.
