Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. I would recommend anyone to just order the Lobster Roll. It's good stuff. One of the best lobster rolls I've ever had.We had the clam chowder, which was just ok. The oysters were all yummy. That lobster roll is still on my mind. I can't wait to go back!Love the ambiance and the small restaurant charm. :)

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: One of Boston's best, but be careful if you're on a budget. It's easy to rack up a bill here! Not that you'll care...Order a bottle of wine, a variety of oysters, 2 crab legs, a lobster roll with butter and entree to share. You'll leave full and happy.

Reviews.Author: Angela H.
Reviews.Content: Service is slow, rude and inconsistent. Told us we couldn't order certain entrees off the dinner menu till after 5:30 (2 hrs away) which significantly cut down our options. but the table that sat down right next to us, 5 minutes later was able to order off the dinner menu. what the what?!they have lobster rolls hot and cold. got the hot lobster roll with butter. i would give the lobster roll a solid 4 stars. stuffed with lots of good meat sandwiched with soft fluffy bread. However, I wanted a little more flavor, maybe a little bits of celery to give a little more texture. The restaurant does not put salt or pepper on the tables which is irritating. The food was good enough that I'd give this place another shot.

Reviews.Author: Ida G.
Reviews.Content: We only had a night and day to spend in Boston, so we had no time to waste hunting for the best lobster roll, having never tried one before. For $25, we figured it'd be big enough to split, but we were wrong, and not just because it's on the small side. I mean, wow. I totally didn't expect that. If you think that lobster rolls are overrated, prepare to be proven wrong. We had the choice of either hot or cold, but it was around 28 F outside, so we numbly opted for hot. It came with fries.I had to knock off a star because I had the stupid idea of also ordering clam chowder. It was really runny, and the potato was severely undercooked. We were too rushed to send anything back, but the lobster roll was so good that I honestly didn't care.Seriously though, even if you're strapped for cash, just go in and split a lobster roll. Your taste buds will love you forever.

Reviews.Author: Wendy T.
Reviews.Content: While visiting Boston, I had two goals: eat my heart out with raw oysters and find the best chowda in the city. Neptune Oyster won with both.The oyster selection is fresh and delicious - the menu was great in describing the flavor, saltiness and finish of the oysters. We also had the fried ipswich clams - delicious and came with a unique tartar sauce. Cioppino wasn't a traditional cioppino - too watery, spicy - but the seafood in the cioppino was fresh, plump and delicious! I came back two days later for lunch by myself for some more oysters and also to try the chowda. Best chowda I had in Boston. Creamy, fresh clams, perfect potato and celery bites.. I'm craving this as I write.Go to Neptune!

Reviews.Author: Sooj O.
Reviews.Content: On our way to New Hampshire, a friend and I decided to spend a day roaming around Boston.  I always forget that New England is always about 10 degrees colder than New York.  It being early April, the early spring chill was getting to me after about two hours of walking.  We stepped into Neptune's wood-paneled cozy atmosphere.  A dark and small restaurant, the place is intimate and relaxing (or at least mid-afternoon).  The oysters were delicately briny. And somehow, there is nothing more ladylike than slurping up oyster juice from the beautifully warty on the outside and pearlescent on the inside shells. The baby octopus in brodo were tender and divine.We were fortified to step out once again into the New England snap and explore the North End.

Reviews.Author: Natasha A.
Reviews.Content: Reasons why a typical 1hr + wait and a somewhat high price for the oysters are completely worth it:- They have more variety of oysters than anywhere else I know of in Boston.- You can order a-la-cart from a little piece of paper like you do at a sushi place. There about 10 types of oysters to chose from plus clams, crab claws, lobster and other types of raw salads.- The oysters are very very fresh.- The wine list - amazing wine list. Try a crisp sauvignon blanc with the oysters, such as Cloudy Bay mm.- The entrees - lobster roll and scallops were phenomenal.- While you wait, there are countless of bars and restaurants to have a drink. They will call your phone when they can seat you.

Reviews.Author: Greg M.
Reviews.Content: The Honest Truth:If you want seafood, come here.  Everything is fresh and cooked well.  They have a buttload of oysters to choose from.  Get the Lobster roll! Tons of juicy and tender Lobster on some bread.  The other menu items were good too. Can't go wrong with anything.The Details:This place is really small (as are most places in Boston) so come early! It's got a nice, intimate environment, and the service is attentive and good. We came at 5:30 and there was no wait! Of course, the Lobster Roll is a must order.  They don't skimp on the lobster and its nice and buttery.  We also tried the scallops which were pretty delicious (athough you don't get as many) and some sort of cilantro fish, which was also really good.  The price is a expensive, but definitely a great place for fresh seafood dishes!

Reviews.Author: L M.
Reviews.Content: Previously I've written how I LOVE this place.  But ate lunch there today and there were a couple of bad pieces of lobster in my roll.  You know that ammonia taste seafood gets when it's starting to go bad?  Yeah....not the sweet buttery maine lobster taste, that's for sure.  I picked out those peieces and ate the rest. I should have spoken up but my dining mate seemed fine with hers, and it was so busy there... But it's bothered me for the past few hours so felt the need to review.  The johnnycake we started with was excellent.  For $27/roll, though, there should never been any iffy lobster being cooked at all.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Before coming here, I had heard many good things from other people about Neptune Oyster's famous lobster rolls. I have to say, they were absolutely right. Neptune Oyster's lobster rolls are the best I have ever had. Not only are their lobsters very fresh, the price is also very reasonable.The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is super cozy. Yeah, the wait can be very long and it is quite packed inside, but it is very VERY worth it.A trip to Boston is definitely not complete without a round at Neptune!

Reviews.Author: Mick T.
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice atmosphere, very good food, decent wee selection of beers, but pricey.I like the atmossphere in here and all the white tile (which they had before it got sort popular). But, the place is small and can fill up fast, also don't sit at the bar where it curves, everyone walking in the door will be banging up against you, if it's really cold outside, sit all the way down the back!

Reviews.Author: Aaron B.
Reviews.Content: Had the new lobster pan roast.When I was done I looked like a field surgeon during the Civil War. My hands were covered in butter and lobster.Damn, that was good.

Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the smallest restaurants I've ever been to. Literally a hole in the wall with most of the patrons sitting at the counter. We were told the wait was going to be an hour, but it turned out to be almost two - didn't eat until almost 11pm!Nevertheless, it was worth the wait. I've been craving East Coast raw oysters for a while and Neptune did not disappoint. The Mt. Vineyard oysters stood out the most, with it's "popcorn finish". We also had a bowl of clam chowda. I must say, I was surprised at how non-creamy it was, and the celery was a very nice surprise. Lastly, we had the $25 lobster roll. My god why have I never had a lobster roll before?? Always with hot butter, none of that cold mayo crap.My suggestion: Go early, put your name down, and enjoy a drink at Bacco's before dinner. And always eat your seafood with a nice glass of wine or bubbly.

Reviews.Author: Heidi L.
Reviews.Content: I find my mouth watering as I'm writing this and my tummy just let out a growl. Seafood in the Bay Area isn't half bad but my friend and I made a point of it to set time aside to enjoy lunch here. Do NOT leave this place without ordering the hot lobster roll. It would be a crime to do so! There are few things in the world as delicious as the mayo-free hunks of lobster on a warm buttered roll served at this place *droool*The lobster bisque is also quite delicious, wonderfully creamy and best of all, full of large chunks of lobster. They don't skimp on their seafood here unlike other cheap ass restaurants out there. The oyster menu here is quite impressive, but I'm clueless as to the differences between each kind so our server was nice enough to suggest a few for us. I personally prefer the vinaigrette at Hog Island over their's but we came here for the lobster roll and were left needing mops to wipe up our drool.

Reviews.Author: Jenna P.
Reviews.Content: Oh my, so delicious.  My boyfriend and I came here since we heard about the unreal lobster roll.  It is definitely UNREAL.  We got the hot buttered lobster roll with fries, oysters and a couple LARGE shrimp, oysters, and also the flash grilled yellowtail.  Everything was outstanding and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Steve H.
Reviews.Content: This is our go to place for shell fish in Boston.  The seafood is fresh and tasty.  This place is really small and the table seating is really cramped.  Get to know your neighbor really well (the tables are basically placed together, so, basically dining with people you don't know.  Anyhow, I prefer to sit at the bar counter.  Had a lot of fun talking to the bartenders (waitor and waitress) at the bar.  Not a huge fan of east coast oysters, but absolutely adore cherry stone clams.  We also ordered the kumamoto's, but they were so tiny they should be tossed out instead of serving to us for $2.90 a piece.  Not overly impressed with the lobster roll, but at $25, I guess it's a good value.  I wish the dining room would be more like Union Oyster house.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Stopped into Neptune Oyster last week while in Boston on a business trip. Had the clam-chowder and a lobster roll. Clam-Chowder was OK, very loose and not really all that flavorful. Potatoes were a touch undercooked for my taste, but acceptable. The lobster roll (can be ordered hot or cold, which is a neat twist...) was TOPS. A couple of craft beers on tap, Harpoon Summer was solid. TONS of oysters to choose from, will have to explore when I come back. The joint is tiny, we got there for an early dinner on a Monday evening around 5:30pm and got the second to last table, and the bar was already full. Service was good. Solid little spot.

Reviews.Author: Kelly S.
Reviews.Content: Came here during a weekend trip. I'm a huge fan of lobster rolls and couldn't resist! The wait was over an hour on a late Sat afternoon but lucky for us they called after only about 20minutes to tell us they could seat us. Awesome! The lobster roll - had the warm lobster roll with butter, the lobster was the best I've ever had in a lobster roll hands down SO FRESH. Perfectly warm, tons of buttery goodness. BUT I was not a fan of the actual roll at all, almost stale and not a great flavor. I'm still giving 5 stars because the lobster itself was so good and the sampling of oysters were fantastic with the perfect pairing of sauces.

Reviews.Author: Lisa F.
Reviews.Content: One of those places that's worth the wait - waited literally 1.5 hrs on a tuesday night. You can leave the restaurant, but stay close by the area because they'll call your phone when they have seats/tables available. The oyster selection is very impressive, and you always know which kinds of oysters you are eating because of the way they arrange them on the plate. The lobster rolls ($27) are delicious, although I thought it was too lobster-heavy (yes, they put a lot of lobster inside), and maybe a bit too much butter as well. Haven't tried the other entrees, but they look very tasty too. The staff is also very friendly and quick/run things efficiently. The place has modern decor and is very small - I'd guess the whole place could seat ~25 people. If the wait wasn't so long, I'd come back quite frequently :)

Reviews.Author: Christos C.
Reviews.Content: One of the few non-italian restaurants in the North End and it's fantastic. It's very small and intimate and has a very classic 50s feel from the music to the decor. As the name indicates, this place has a wide selection of oysters. The food is great and it's extremely creative everything from mixing veal with fish. The menu also changes pretty regularly so it's like a new adventure every time. I'm not much of a wino so it helps that the staff can help suggest some great wines. This place is really small and they don't take reservations so unless you want to wait, I'd suggest getting there early or late.

Reviews.Author: SunnyAndLeonard E.
Reviews.Content: The oysters are just unreasonably good. The lobster roll? Guess my expectations were too high.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: This place was an amazing stop after a not-so-amazing 4 hour train ride from New York.  So if someone's in the mood for delicious seafood eats, where do they go?  Boston, of course!The seafood here is amazingly fresh and they have a great variety of oysters.  It's located in a great shopping district too.  Parking can be challenging, but that goes for most places in Boston.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: D S.
Reviews.Content: I had heard that Neptune was great, and I expected great food there. What I did not expect was such a fun and relaxed atmosphere in a place that was at the same time jam packed! A lot of times when you go into the type of place where there is communal seating, and high turnover, there is a rushed feeling... not so at Neptune.I went in with my mom and her friend when they were in town last weekend and we were seated next to a group of gentlemen having a business lunch. Upon arrival our server (Vinny- the best ever) let us know right away that since he was slammed, it was going to be about 10 minutes until he could get to us. Letting us know that ahead of time made it no big deal... We sat down, and he actually got to us in about 5. We had amazing Skip's Island Creek Oysters, and some Kumamotos that were pretty killer too. We tried both the butter and the mayo lobster rolls... both are awesome... The butter one may be a bit more delicious in my opinion, especially during the winter months since it can warm you up, but kudos to the the mayo roll too. It is surprisingly light, as it is far more lightly tossed in mayo than other lobster rolls I have had in the past.We sat and talked with our table mates and Vinny through 2 bottles of wine (great selection), and then Vinny treated us to an appertif (which sadly, I cannot remember the name of) it was dark pink (almost red) and delicious. Sweet, but not too much so, and the perfect end to the perfect meal on a lazy weekend day.I highly recommend spending a long lunch at Neptune to anyone!

Reviews.Author: Joanne G.
Reviews.Content: This was a place recommended by a good friend - who just jumped to "GREAT" friend status.It was awesome.  Hubbie and I were celebrating our 10th anniversary weekend-style - and wanted lobster and clams - we got both!The place is wikked tiny but we were seated at the bar, which was comfortable and if you don't mind being (lovingly) pushed and shoved as people try to get by - the bar is fine and fun.  The waitresses at the bar make it easy to take it easy when it gets crowded.First of all the cherrystones were succulent and beautifully displayed.  Ordered 12 and 2 oysters.  (I Love the fact that you can order 1 of everything if you so wish.)  After the 12 - had to have 6 more.Our main course - whole sea bass with fingerlings and a creamy sauce and pan-broiled lobster with chiorizio and corn.Can I just say YUMMIE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!My fish was light and delightful.  Sweet and moist and very flavorful.The lobster was buttery and beautifully done.I'm hungry AGAIN just thinking about it. a total YES for anyone who loves a fantastic raw bar and awesome entree's

Reviews.Author: Catherine A.
Reviews.Content: Neptune round two. After a horrible first experience a yr ago I decided to give Neptune another go around. More so cause my friends wanted to go. Stayed away from the items I had last time. The Ipswich fried clams are AMAZING. Mashed potato & grilled blue fish special was delicious. Doesn't get four stars cause of the overcrowded situation. our waiter almost knocked me out of my chair three times when he was trying to squeeze past me to serve the table next to us. Definately a fire hazard.7/4 addition: when my credit card statement arrived in the mail a couple of days ago, neptune had overcharged my cc. i will not be going back here any time soon.

Reviews.Author: Red J.
Reviews.Content: If this place was in NY I'd be a FREQUENT and I mean FREQUENT customer.  Aside from the amazing raw bar, they have one of the best burgers I have ever had!  Who would have thought right?  Yea, me too, I was amazed when I tried it.  This place is small and expect to wait no less than 30 minutes when you go, unless you go right when they open.  Also expect to be cozy with the other diners because again, it place is small.  We went for dinner on our trip to boston and I thought we wouldn't have to wait that long since we arrived at 5:00 ish, boy was I wrong.  When I got there, there was a line and we were told that the wait would be approximately 45 minutes.  BUT the hostess was very nice and told us that if we leave our number they can call us when our table when be 10 minutes from being ready so we can get back to the restaurant in time.  When we finally got to sit down and eat, we ordered the Neptune Plateau and some additional oysters, which weren't included in our Plateau.  The descriptions of the oysters on their oysters were dead on!  They described the taste of the oysters to the tee and they were amazing and fresh.  Aside from the oysters, their crab, lobster, and shrimp salad were SUPERB.  Each salad had big clumps of meat in them and I left this place STUFFED.  I had originally intended to just stop here for appetizers but I could not eat another bite afterward.One thing we really wanted that we weren't able to order that night because it had already ran out at 6:00 PM!!! were the cherry stone clams.  I guess this is another good reason to go early because their food items run out quick!Now how did I come by the burger?  As I said earlier, you're very cozy with your neighboring diners.  We sat next to a family having dinner and the woman kept raving to her dad about how great the burger was and that she had to have the burger again (she'd obviously eaten there before).  So when the waitress came to take the order, her dad ordered the burger and when she ordered it the waitress apologized and told her that her dad had ordered the last burger!  I was in disbelief and so was my bf, after we had dinner there, we both couldn't stop thinking about the burger.  So what did we do?  We ditched one of the other restaurants we planned on eating at and went back to Neptune's or lunch right before we headed back to NY.  And guess what?  This burger was just about the BEST BURGER!  It was sooooo juicy and the bun was just perfect.  And I usually eat my burgers with everything catchup, mayo, mustard, tomato, etc.  But I did not add anything additional to my burger.  It already had some kind of mayo on it and it was just perfect.  I would have never guessed that a place known for oysters would have such an amazing burger.

Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll ever....have it warmSmall place and long wait but, worth it in the end!

Reviews.Author: Dave C.
Reviews.Content: This place really delivered.  My first weekend having oysters and these were off the chain.  Super Fresh, Super....moist??  Is that a good thing?  haha  They were damn good, 'nuff said.For dinner I had the Lobster Roll and some of the local IPA brew.  I got the roll cold, you have a choice warm with butter or cold with Mayo.  I figured cold would be a little more manageable so I rocked that out.  This is served with some of the best fries I've had in a while.  This was a huge surprise as they were just tossed on the side of the roll.  Together, everything made this meal something to Yelp about.  Check this place out if you are ever on the North End, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Author: Evangeline L.
Reviews.Content: Best. Lobster roll. Ever.Kick ass fried oysters too. Hell everything there is delicious!! Mmmmmmm.

Reviews.Author: Arlynn A.
Reviews.Content: They do not take reservations! Come in early to put your name down on their list. They will call you 15-20 min before your table is ready. We had the Hot lobster roll & Clam chowder. We loved the Hot lobster roll, the clam chowder was really running, if you like your chowder that way.

Reviews.Author: Elaine T.
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Boston, this is a place you don't want to miss. I was so fortunate to come with 2 other people so I could try their food too! haha.We ordered Neptune's on piggback for our appetizer (the toasted crostini was layered with shredded pork and topped with deep fried breaded oyster sprinkled with fresh zesty greens). My bf got the lobster roll (they give you the option of having it warm or cold- go with the warm choice!). They butter and toast the roll and pile it on with a ton of lobster. This lobster roll was huge! They don't skimp on the size. My friend got the succulent scallop with braised pork shank. It came with 5 large pieces which got kinda rubbery at the end of the meal. As for me, I was lucky enough to have experienced their Sunday special Fish taco. Apparently many of the locals come to Neptunes on Sunday especially for this entree.  It's battered just right with large chunks of fish. The cole slaw served with the tacos was fresh and had a strong taste of lemon. Overall, I would come back and order the lobster roll (warm) and fish tacos.Hint: make reservations and swing by Mike's Pastries since it's around the corner.

Reviews.Author: Jovi C.
Reviews.Content: The hour-plus wait to get in this joint was totally worth it. I have never in my life had a more delicious shellfish meal. It almost makes me want to cry that we live on the other side of the country.I've tried other places in Boston for lobster rolls, but this is by far, the most succulent, fresh, and amazing lobster roll I have ever had. No need to eat those fries -- save room in your belly for the giant chunks of lobster. It was a super hot day, so I opted for the cold lobster roll -- incredible!For an appetizer, the hubs and I shared some fresh oysters. Mind you, we normally don't like fresh oysters, but it seemed the thing to do. We ordered a few with both the mignonette and the regular cocktail sauce and were totally blown away. It was literally like tasting the ocean -- fresh, bright, delectable. This will definitely be my go-to place when I'm in Boston. Tips: - Service is brisk, but that's okay. You're there for the food, not to be pampered- They take credit cards (some places in the North End are tricky with their cash-only- VERY small and no waiting area, so be prepared to wait outside in the intense heat in the summer or brutal cold in the winter- Get there at an off-hour. Don't even try to go during lunch or dinner -- we arrived at 2:30 and still waited an hour, so imagine what it would be like during a lunch or dinner rush- You'll be seated at a table with other people. They want to use up every single seat --- about half of the restaurant are stools at the oyster bar -- i would not recommend this for families with small children- Average tab is about $80 if you have a few oysters, 2 lobster rolls, and 2 beers.

Reviews.Author: Kim V.
Reviews.Content: We tried to come here before but the wait time was over an hour. Determined to try again, we went on a Monday a little after it opened. Good move on our part. We were seated immediately.We have heard about the warm lobster roll, and decided to try it. After some oysters and steamed clams that is. For the oysters, we tried: Glidden Point, Summerside, Hog Island, and the bf's favorite: Kumamoto. If only I had a bottomless stomach and wallet, or I would have tried more. I selected the Glidden Point after overhearing the waitress mention to other customers that people raved about them. They were right, those turned out to be the best on the ice. If we didn't already order the steamed clams (which were also amazing) and the lobster roll, I would have ordered a few more of those.There is so much more to try and I can't wait to come back to Boston, stand in line and get a few more of them oysters!

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: In Boston there are pretty much two types of oysters bars.  The first being the old school choice and one of the most reviewed restaurants on Yelp, that being Neptune.  Then the new school choice being the swank and hip Island Creek.  Of course we had to go to both to see who does it better.  We went to Neptune for lunch, it is in the really cute Little Italy neighbourhood.  It is small, thankfully we came at a good time and didn't have to wait.  We ordered twenty total, which were from 4 different provinces/states. The oysters were shucked and came to the table promptly.  It is really helpful that they provide you with a sheet telling you where, price, and the tasting notes of the oysters.   To go with our order we tried their white peach Bellini. which was perfectly balanced with champagne and peach puree.Overall it became quite difficult to compare it to Island Creek, if you want to go to a place that is traditional then Neptune is for you.  If you want to go to a place that is hip then go to Island Creek.  No matter where you go, the oysters are fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Alyssa K.
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've ever waited for a meal as long as I did for Neptune Oyster. We were given an estimate of 2-2.5 hours. Fortunately, we got the call that our table was ready "just" 1.5 hours later.I was very curious about the lobster roll here, since everyone on here raves about it. I'm a huge fan of the lobster roll at Luke's Lobster in NYC, where the lobster meat is very flavorful with all the butter and seasoning they put on it. $25 for a hot lobster roll and fries here, vs. $17 at Luke's for a roll, chips, and a drink. "This better be worth it," I said to myself.It was. It was worth the $25, worth the 1.5 hour wait for a seat, worth enduring sitting next to two obnoxious biznatches who thought we couldn't hear them and kept commenting on how we were such tourists for taking pics of our food.I want to estimate that Neptune's lobster roll had about twice as much meat as Luke's. The chunks were gigantic and juicy. The big difference was that Neptune's roll was much more "au naturel"; the hot bun was buttered, but the lobster meat itself tasted very pure and fresh. The fries were awesome, too. I can tell I'm going to have dreams of Neptune's lobster roll; one of these mornings, I'm going to wake up with drool all over my pillow. It's certainly one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had... would give Neptune 4.5 stars if I could! DEFINITELY will be back, even if it means waiting up to three hours.

Reviews.Author: Shannon L.
Reviews.Content: I have not had oysters in 10 years after a particularly bad experience. However, my friends insisted I go to Neptune Oyster."The only reason you don't like oysters is because you haven't had any good ones," they say. So off we went to Boston.We arrived at around 3pm and were told that there was a waiting time of about an hour, which seemed fair enough (we walked over to Quincy's Market in the mean time).The place is really small, but it's a nice atmosphere. I thought I was only going to have "one, to try", but boyyyyy, was I wrong. I think I'm in love with oysters now. It's super fresh, and you can see them shucking it by the windows.I didn't have anything else, but I think it's suffice to say that it's enough to go back just for the oysters. They have changed my life forever and opened my eyes to.. oysters.

Reviews.Author: Ladyjane S.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place 4 stars if it weren't for the service. I came here expecting a great meal - and why wouldn't I with a 2 hour wait? - but I was fairly disappointed. The food was great. We had oysters, a hot lobster roll and a whole grilled fish. Everything was fresh and well-cooked; but it wasn't worth the crowded and unfriendly atmosphere of the place on top of the wait. Our server/bartender couldn't have been less interested in us and took his sweeeeet time getting our card back to us so we could get the hell out of there. It just left a bad taste in my mouth and I don't ever plan on returning.

Reviews.Author: Chann C.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have always wanted to check this place out so we went there one day during the weekend. We got there around 5:30-6pm and waited almost two hours. We read reviews on Yelp first and knew there would be some time waiting. We killed time by getting some cannoli's at Mike's Pastry and roamed around cute Little Italy. When we were finally seated, my girlfriend ordered the cold lobster roll and I got the hot one. I also got some raw oysters and clams to start off. The oysters were absolutely delicious! They were so fresh. The lobster rolls were also excellent. However, I think my gf's cold lobster roll was tastier. Overall, great food, good service, tiny place and loud atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Charlie D.
Reviews.Content: God damn, these things do make you horny! Maybe that was the beer. Well, the oysters were delicious nonetheless. I'm coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Sue U.
Reviews.Content: I had the best lobster roll I've ever had; and the rest of their menu is also amazing. Sure it's a bit pricey but really worth it. You have 2 options for the lobster roll: cold with mayo or hot with butter. Of course we've tried them both and I cannot decide which one is better. Both of them are really good. They do substitute fries with salad if you want BTW.They have good selection of raw bar with good beer and wine. The only downfall is the wait since they have very small space; but hey good things come to those who wait a bit, right?

Reviews.Author: Andrew R.
Reviews.Content: Great meal last night. Wait was long but the food was worth itI had the cioppino. A wonderful spicy sauce to accent the fish and seafood. I started with oysters. It was wonderful to be able to select from so many varieties. My wife had the scallops with roasted Brussel sprouts with a pear and blue cheese sauce. The brussel sprouts were roasted great and she ate a bunch and normally won't eat brussel sprouts. Our daughter had the hamburger and fries. Great burger for a raw bar

Reviews.Author: Keen Chanunya C.
Reviews.Content: We ordered Wellfleet (loved!), Beach Point(loved!), Pleasant Bay(loved!), Browne's Point(good), Cherry Stones (so-so), and Shrimp Cocktail (very good).  The Clam Chowder is very delicious.

Reviews.Author: Jes H.
Reviews.Content: Fabulous food.  Fabulous staff.  The perfect place to pop in for a good dose of seafood and wine or beer.Lobster roll is $25, but it's worth it.  On the advice of our server, we opted for hot with butter (as opposed to cold with mayo) and were not disappointed.Crabcake special was unique and yummy.  I loved the accompanying crab salad with avocado and frisee.Fried clams were perfect.  The house-made tartar sauce garnered raves from all four in our group.Clam chowder was lighter than most, and very flavorful.I skipped the oysters, as I'm preggers, but my friends said they were uber-fresh and tasty.

Reviews.Author: Steve R.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a recommendation from a Boston local. The dinning area is very cozy with a couple of tables and a bar area. Only beer and wine is served here. Impressive! I ordered a variety of oysters on a half shell with both the white wine vinegar and cocktail sauce. Oysters were very fresh! Not complaints here. It was on par with some of the oysters I've had in Seattle!  After a few locally brewed beers, I finally decided to get the one of the house specials, a dish with a crouton, topped with braised pork, topped with a deep fried oyster. It was served with a pistachio vinaigrette, and golden raisins. At first I was skeptical about the whole pistachio/raisin/oyster combination was going to play out. But in reality it worked! It worked well!Overall it was a pretty good experience, my only regret was that I was too full to try the lobster rolls. Next time!

Reviews.Author: mahi m.
Reviews.Content: The Neptunes on Piggyback was one of the most fascinating & delectable things I've put in my mouth in a long time. Perfectly fried oysters, light and hot, settled on a sort of shredded carnitas and toast. As that melts in your mouth, the greens and golden raisin confit sneak it with a little sweetness and light. They've got standard seafood bar fare, too, but the rest of the menu is where you'll find innovative tastiness. Walked in on a Thursday night, sent back a glass of wine with no attitude, wasn't pressured to turn the table (sorry, line out front). It's tiny and a little loud, but that's an easy price to pay for dining revelations.

Reviews.Author: Sil S.
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review from our trip to Boston last October... but I still can't forget the oh so yummy lobster spaghettini (Monday night special) I had. I must say it's the best pasta ever I've had. Spaghettini was cooked just perfectly to al dente, plenty of lobster, and the sauce is to die for! Not too heavy or thin, just right! Too bad I can't just teleport to Neptune to have this heavenly dish.BF had the lobster roll. Also very good. Soft roll with lots of lobster in it. Also had a platter (maybe about a dozen) of oysters. Very fresh and tasty. The only down side was the wait to be seated (no reservation taken) and the small space. Tables are real close together.  But the wait was much worth it, as for the small space... guess I can peek at other tables to see what they're having, maybe even strike a conversation about the food, or not. Until next time I'll just have to reminisce...

Reviews.Author: Leizl M.
Reviews.Content: While planning a trip to Boston for a friend's wedding, I scoured Yelp for various seafood places to try, and Neptune Oyster was one of the first on my list since I'm hellbent on trying every lobster roll that people claim is the best of the best in their city. Given all the reviews that mentioned a long wait, I made sure to get there just before 6pm to avoid the dinner rush and was immediately seated in one of two remaining tables.We started with a sampling of oysters from the raw bar, all of which were fresh and delicious. My boyfriend enjoyed the nutty finish of the Summersides so much that he ordered another two for himself. I ordered the blue crab cocktail, which was around $15-18 market price, expecting the usual not-too-little-but-not-generous Manhattan helping of lump crab with cocktail sauce on the side given the price. I was pleasantly surprised when the waiter delivered a heaping bowlful of crab meat, and was even more astounded by the flavor: amazingly fresh crab with a spicy kick of what I believe was horseradish. Just recalling the dish now, I'm salivating and lamenting the fact that I can't have it for lunch today.For the entree, my boyfriend decided to try the vitello tonnato sandwich. The combination of tuna tartare, veal, and spicy mustard was intriguing on paper, and the sandwich itself did not disappoint - a single bite was an explosion of flavor so surprising, very different but incredibly delicious. I had the lobster roll hot with butter, as recommended by many of the reviews here on Yelp, and it was as flavorful and fulfilling as I imagined it would be. If there's one thing Boston does right, it's lobster, as no matter where I went during my trip, the lobster was always juicy, fresh, and well-cooked, and Neptune's lobster roll was no exception. I also appreciated that they weren't stingy with the lobster, as that seems to be a trend with a lot of places that serve lobster rolls.Overall I was very moved by my dinner there, so much so that I'm writing a wordy out-of-town Yelp review, which I rarely do. If I lived in Boston, there's no doubt I'd be a regular here, regardless of the wait. The next time I'm in town, Neptune will be one of my first stops. And maybe my second. And my last.

Reviews.Author: Lola N.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend lives basically next door to this place and until this winter, we had never been. Amazing time!  Best date night ever.We did have a small wait, we sat at the bar, and it was chock full, but it was a Friday night, so what to expect?  The atmosphere was incredible, it is the only place I have ever been that made me feel as if I were a very sexy movie star living in the '50s and not like it was a bar/restaurant trying to make me feel like I was in the '50s.  We started with champagne, that really set the decadent mood, and then followed up with some good beer.  It's cozy and beautiful in there.  We were at the bar, and every time they walked by us with food we fell in love, asked the server what it was, and contemplated having it.  Everything smelled amazing.We continued with the raw bar, and each ate1 of every oyster they had and tried to pick up the notes that their menu swears exist, like "citrusy" and "hints of champagne."  I'm not sure that either of us were able to pick any those up, but we had fun!! I then had a raw tuna appetizer - I remember it was delicious, but not much else.  Perhaps I was too drunk at this point.  BUT what I was not too drunk to remember was my Lobster Newburg, which I will never forget as long as I live.  I have NEVER had a better dinner entree anywhere, in my entire life.  And I've been to some big deal restaurants.  It tasted absolutely heavenly, and had little shitake mushrooms, and a slightly creamy sauce.... I ate this almost 6 months ago and I still can't stop thinking about it.  I don't even remember what my boyfriend ate because mine overshadowed it so completely.  I know they change their menu often, so I can only pray that one day this will be available again.The servers were very busy but also kind.  We felt kind of obvious as the twentysomethings at the bar seated amongst the older, obviously rich other dinner patrons, but we did spend as much as any other couple would, and although we looked totally normal and not like we owned our own yachts, we were treated very nicely by the staff, and no one was condescending.  I'm sure this place is super expensive although I didn't pay.  Here's the rundown: this place is absolutely delicious, full of the kind of ambiance that is REALLY hard to come by nowadays (and that's really why I wouldn't hesitate to pay the prices), and will make you a superstar for taking your girlfriend/wife/date here.  I don't even typically like expensive restaurants, and I'm telling you this is one that's worth it to pay for.  After my boyfriend gallantly took the check and refused to let me help at all, I was mentally starting a list of all the crazy things I wanted to do that night.  This place is that awesome.  Try it.

Reviews.Author: Jane A.
Reviews.Content: Make sure you go early because you may have to wait for over an hour.They have awkward seatings and you may have to share a table with strangers (small restaurant - I dont think it fits more than 30 people max, including the bar area) and their service is pretty slow, but their fabulous oysters make up for it, so I wont complain :)I heard their lobster roll is life changing - I will try this next time I go back.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: I DO love my oysters! Neptune was as good as everyone hyped it up to be. It's small, intimate, good service and tasty. Of course we got the lobster roll (I only had a bite of my hubbys but both him and my sister got it) i had a whole ton of oysters (they let you mix and match any amount you'd like--kinda like a sushi bar) the k bay ones were the best! and my brother got the scallops which were very yummy and even a lil crispy. The drawback ofCOURSE is the 2 hr wait on a Saturday night. But you know what, it's not difficult to kill2 hours in the North end on a Saturday night. We had drinks, got Mike's Pastry, and Neptune was faithful to call our cell phone's right when our table was ready, very efficient! Oh, another minor drawback is that the ppl waiting to put their names down/waiting to be seated really crowd the front door. That can 1) be a fire hazard 2) obnoxious patrons making rude comments to the ppl dining :( All in all though, I can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Author: chase m.
Reviews.Content: The lobster is Fabulous! Juicy and full of flavor! it's definitely a MUST TRY in Boston !! Price: $$-$$$ Service: Although the food was amazing, think staff can lighten up a little. It wasn't exactly the most fun experience, but the food made up for it. Ambiance: casual Groups: it's a tight space but there were groups of 5-7 there. snug. Would I come back? If i was in the area, for sure!

Reviews.Author: Vonnie W.
Reviews.Content: I tried this place because it was the first place that popped up for seafood in Boston on Yelp.If you didn't know to look for this place, you may never find it.  It's smack dab in the middle of an area known for Italian eateries.  We had a party of three and came in, worried that we might not get a seat.  The place is teeny tiny and looks as if it has more bar seats than regular table chairs.  Luckily, we were seated immediately upon arrival (Sunday night at 7pm).  We started off with a few oysters on the half shell.  My bf enjoyed them thoroughly and the few that I had were perfect.  We moved on to have the grilled lobster, hot lobster roll and scallops with pork.  Everything was SOOOO darn delicious.My roll was PACKED with nothing but warm, sweet and tender lobster meat, no fillers!  I couldn't even finish the roll or the french fries.  The grilled lobster came with mussels, clams, roasted potatoes & asparagus (all of which were delicious)!!!  I didn't get to taste the scallops but they looked awesome as well. While the menu items were a little pricey, they were worth every single penny!!  The staff was very friendly and quick and I cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Author: Angie L.
Reviews.Content: This was our last and final stop in our search for the best lobster roll in Boston. We were all in agreement... it was worth the wait,  best lobster ever! We came for Sunday lunch time, around noonish. The place was packed. I mean.. packed! There's absolutely no room to stand inside the restaurant. It's a pretty tiny place and the "waiting area" really can't hold more than a couple people. The nice thing is, you go in, you put in your name, and your phone number and I guess some people just go until they're being called? I can't be sure they actually call you since we waited there. But I assume since they did ask for your number and and most people just kind of disappeared after they gave their names and numbers. We were seated after waiting for 30 minutes, which was not so bad I suppose. Tables are really close together so you can definitely hear what your neighbors are saying. Since we had cold lobster rolls at other places, we thought we'd try the hot lobster rolls. Boy, did we make the right choice. Very generous portion.. The Mr and I shared our order since he wanted to try the Lobster Bisque too. We both regretted not getting our own plates. Cousin who normally never finishes her plate gulped down the big roll herself... and the fries. I can't remember the exact price, but I believe it was around $25/plate. Not cheap, but the portion definitely matches the price. The Mr. really liked the lobster bisque too. I didn't try it, so I can't give my opinion here. After all the places we checked out for lobster rolls, this will now be our number 1 stop next time we're in Boston. I'm drooling just thinking about how tasty it is. Yum.. I would move to Boston just so I could eat here every week.

Reviews.Author: Zach W.
Reviews.Content: Very good oysters with a solid selection. The decor of the place is sweet and the service is pretty good (part of the reason one star off). The other reason only 4 stars is the fact that the space is tighter than dress on a......yeah you get the picture...not a lot of elbow room.Have had various oysters, all very very good and of the highest quality (not cheap, not crazy expensive, about the same per oyster as other high level oyster bars, $2-3). Also had the Lobster roll hot with butter.....awesome but a little overpriced at $25. Also had the fresh Yellow Fin Tuna appetizer on a piece of bruchetta with avocado spread and aiola sauce, it taste like heaven....but it's sooooo small! One piece of bread with fresh Tuna for $17!!! HOLY CANNOLI BATMAN! Overall, definitely worth going to and trying it out. I'll definitely come back for more oysters but will probably pass on the rest of the food next time because of price, not quality. Gets packed too so be sure to get there at a good time or wait a bit. Oh, and they have a decent selection of rare beers on bottle, poor selection on tap, decent wine list as well.

Reviews.Author: Jon P.
Reviews.Content: Ultimately eating dinner at Neptune the Sunday of our 7PM flight back to Chicago was a miracle. It really couldn't have come together any better. We started off the day knowing that we only had limited time in Boston before our flight, so we figured we'd eat an early dinner. We were determined to eat at a great seafood place. That morning, for no good reason, we declared the day to be the "Day of Lobster". It started off with a lobster omelet at the hotel and went from there. Neptune was to top it off.Not knowing anything about Boston and having no leads, we turned to Yelp, which in turn pointed us to Neptune. We did some touristy things to kill some time and then made our way to the restaurant around 3:30. When we got there we were surprised to find a line out the door already. Yikes. We put in our name and she said the wait would be around an hour and 45 minutes. Yikes again. But we were determined. We walked around what seemed to be Boston's Little Italy, had some food from Mike's Pastries (which also had a huge line), played in a children's playground... and realized that it only killed about an hour. We went back to see where we stood, and it didn't look great. We explained our flight situation and she told us to hang around and she'd absolutely have us seated within a half hour. Totally accommodating. Thirty minutes later, we got a call and we were sitting in Neptune. The place is really small, which is the reason why the waits are so outrageous. The entire left side of the place is a bar and the right side is about 7 tables. It seems a bit cramped, but you can deal with it because it's all very clean and pretty. Our waitress, Kristin, also doubled as the hostess. She was very busy, but our service never suffered. First we ordered some oysters because it seemed like it would be a crime not to, and of course we ordered the lobster cocktail to continue with the theme of the day. The lobster was good. I'm not big on oysters, but the two I had were alright. I liked being able to order different varieties and compare them all.For entrées , we were all looking at lobster. Most of us were eying the lobster roll, however, and that seemed like a wasted opportunity since there were plenty of other interesting dishes on the menu. We told our waitress about our Day of Lobster idea and she suggested 3 lobster entrées and an oyster appetizer for all of us to share. We ended up with a lobster salad, the grilled lobster, a lobster roll and the Neptunes on piggyback. She also helped us order a bottle of wine that goes well with lobster.Everything we had was delicious, but the lobster roll was everyone favorite. The flavors are very simple and traditional, but damn is it good. I could eat that roll soaked in butter and lobster juice alone everyday. I don't have grilled lobster all that often, so that was a nice change of pace and the salad was fresh and was a nice element. Overall, everything was great and it all came together nicely. All of us were incredibly happy with how the meal turned out.

Reviews.Author: Maria L.
Reviews.Content: SO DELICIOUS! My boyfriend and I were in Boston for a only few days, so we found this place on Yelp, read the great reviews, and made it a point to try this place before leaving town.OH-MY-GAH! This place was amazing! we started out with the Buttermilk Johnny Cake, ugh! my mouth waters just thinking about it, it was sweet, buttery and savory. Then our lobster rolls came out...WOW, prior to this, I had only had the wimpy lobster rolls in LA. So when I saw the amount of lobster in that roll for only $25 I was amazed and the flavor was incomparable to what i've had in LA. Simply the best. We fortunately didn't have to wait in line. We got there at around 12 and there were two seats open at the counter. The place is kind of tight, but the food makes bumping elbows into strangers completely worth it. Will definitely eat here next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Josh A.
Reviews.Content: Another great great great experience at Neptune. As always, be prepared to wait. Went in for lunch on a nice summer day, wait was 45-1hr for 2 people. At Neptune I actually prefer to sit at the bar.... it makes for a nice experience.Food- 5 StarsAmazing oysters all typesAmazing blue crab salad cocktail w horsey sauce Johnny cake w/ smoked trout off the hookGreat two fish fish taco special- something I have never had (two fried fishes in the same taco) but it was super good.Service- 5 StarsGreat bartender and quick serviceValue- 3.5 StarsIt's expensive but worth itDrinks- 5 StarsAlways great wine suggestions and selections.Atmosphere- 4 StarsSee previous reviews.

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: I ate my first lobster roll here, and it was delicious. A perfectly toasted hoagie drenched in butter and overflowing with lobster!I don't usually like sandwiches, so spending $25 on one seemed like a gamble, but luckily it was well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Eunice R.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll is good but way too hyped; and the seared scallops were salty and cooked a little too long. I did however really enjoy the oyster bar. Maybe it's because I'm from California, but I've never been to one before and it was a really great experience here. The waitress was so friendly and helpful and the huge selection on fresh oysters was awesome. Make sure to get the Kumamoto when you're here. It's absolutely divine. It's on the smaller and sweeter side. :)I brought a friend from California here, and honestly I was quite embarrassed/disgusted/shocked. He ate like 15+ oysters by himself. I guess they're THAT good. Shouldn't you only eat like 7 for health reasons?? haha

Reviews.Author: Rae R.
Reviews.Content: We went on a Friday at 3pm. No line, sat at the bar which was really quite charming. I love the look and feel of this cozy little (VERY LITTLE) place. What more can I add to over 1000 reviews? I'm a transplant to the New England area, so fried clams are a new thing for me.  And yep, the fried clams with a wedge of lemon and side of tartar sauce...delightful!  However, I surprised myself by not totally loving my hot buttered lobster roll. It was delicious, but just too heavy for me. If you're a lobster fan, this is definitely for you.  I'm going to ask for the cold lobster but on a hot bun next time - I hope they can do that!

Reviews.Author: Mark V.
Reviews.Content: I was in the middle of a trip to Boston and on the Freedom Trail. My sister said I had to have a Lobster roll while I was in town and this was THE place to get one. I was a bit deterred by the $25 price tag on a sandwich, but decided it was worth a try since I was visiting. In hindsight, I am so glad I made that decision.Luckily, we had arrived at an opportune time and the wait was a little over 10 minutes. In the meantime, I was treated to watching the workers shuck oysters through the window. The interior of the restaurant is humble in size, but what they lack in square footage is made up for in qualify seafood.We ordered some oysters from the raw bar as starters while we waited for our lobster roll and yellowfin tuna. Unfortunately, razor clams were not being served that day, so we decided on a mix of west and east coast oysters. Flavorsome oysters with a taste like they had just been plucked from the ocean. Very briny with a hint of sweetness when biting in.Then the moment of truth arrived: My lobster roll arrived. I ordered it hot with butter and, to my extreme delight, they chef had drenched my lobster roll with it. It was just like a french dipped sandwich. I dove in and was overcome with flavors. The rich butter and the delicate lobster meat coming together on a roll meant to vessel this combination directly to my taste buds. I can now define my life to before and after having this lobster roll. If there it only one thing you could do while visiting Boston, this had better be it!Overall, it was an impressive experience. Come early or be prepared to wait if you come down during busy times. Also be prepared to pay a pretty penny when the bill comes. However, the experience and the high quality seafood is well worth it. I now look forward to my next visit to Beantown for another taste of this succulent meal.

Reviews.Author: Kat S.
Reviews.Content: The other reviewers have said enough, but I'll say it one more time - HOT. buttered. lobster. roll.  SO worth the wait and the $25 price tag.  Their raw bar is great, too, and I always end up leaving here stuffed and broke. Living right down the street, it's easy for me to go put my name down and keep myself busy for a while, but you definitely need to get here early for dinner.  If you are just in town for a visit and want some authentic seafood, you want to go to Neptune.

Reviews.Author: AD S.
Reviews.Content: Just absolutely fantastic seafood--and this is coming from someone who does not particularly like seafood. A friend and I went on a weekend night in late June, so checking in at about 10 til 8 PM got us seated at about 10 PM. We had about three different types of oysters, and although I did not put much stock into different oysters, we could really tell the difference. My friend got fried clams, which he liked. Then, we each got an order of shrimp, which I thought would be a few shrimp for dipping. I was wrong--we each literally got a shrimp, albeit a very large and succulent one. Finally, the best part for me was the salmon. Simple enough, it was smoked salmon and oil, and it was absolutely fantastic. I would go again just for that. In any case, I was miffed at first that they don't take reservations, but it's pretty obvious why they wouldn't want to. So yes, expect a wait and go have a couple drinks/snack elsewhere before returning. Also, you can easily ring up $150-200 for two people if you are hungry, so be advised.

Reviews.Author: Kristine E.
Reviews.Content: Lucked out that it was a rainy night and I was able to get a seat at the bar.  Lovely oysters followed by a spicy yet light chioppino.  I can't wait to get back and try the chowder and lobster roll!

Reviews.Author: Justin J.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Reid F.
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind crowding into a small space, the food at Neptune is really good, starting with the large selection of reasonably priced oysters, and continuing with the chowder, lobster rolls, and (even) outstanding burgers.  There's a reason they always have a line to get in.

Reviews.Author: Jalayne A.
Reviews.Content: The shrimp cocktail is one of the best I have had - wonderful service! Truly enjoyed this experience.

Reviews.Author: Aaron L.
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to grab the last seat at the bar this night right before they started to turn people away as they were "sold out." There was so many people waiting they simply couldn't take any more people on the wait list. This, along with the great Yelp reviews had me pretty excited about what was to come...As much as I would like to describe the fresh amazing taste and texture of the oysters, the light yet subtly complex cocktail sauce that redefines what cocktail sauce can be, and made to order clam chowder, there just isn't words to do it justice.The Lobster roll with hot butter.. Well I may have shed a tear when I saw it and every bite was out of this world. It was PILED with lobster, and every bit was prepared to absolute perfection. Stop reading... GO .. NOW.

Reviews.Author: G H.
Reviews.Content: Like they really need another 5 star review? Even though the Hot Lobster Roll is fantastic, suggest someone in your group orders the cold, or get one to share. I didn't expect to like it that way, and was so wrong. It is "almost" as good as the hot roll, and a nice change of pace. Worth the wait and price, way worth it. Staff was really friendly even though the place was packed both times we were there.

Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: Fresh and fantastic the day I was there...we sat next to a couple from Tokyo who was also impressed with their fish. I was looking for alternatives to our old standard The Union Oyster House and found a new favorite in Neptune. The oyster selection here is better and the 2" Carrara marble bar and tables are impressive! Beer selection was only OK. We had a Hamachi Kama appetizer that was amazing!Better beer (California IPA anyone?!) would get it up to five stars (for me) real quick

Reviews.Author: Gabe M.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place has excellent oysters and seafood.  I came in for lunch and happened to sit near this guy who was a sort of oyster connoisseur who gave me a little tutorial on the progression of oysters I should eat.  He suggested starting with some west coast oysters (Kumamoto and Island Creek) and then going to a fuller east coast Cape Cod oyster (Wellfleet).  Being an oyster newbie, I gave it a shot and I could definitely see what he was talking about, great stuff.  I then had their famous lobster roll, which was the reason I had originally came after reading about it in so many magazines.  I had it Connecticut style (hot with butter) and it was quite awesome, tons of large lobster chunks falling out of the huge roll.  The only thing I would have liked to do is get a salad instead of the fries it comes with, I don't want to know how many calories that meal had.  :)

Reviews.Author: J. J.
Reviews.Content: Two words:  Fried clams.  Fried Ipswich clams, to be specific, and oh man were they delicious.  A mix of whole belly clams and clam strips, though the majority were juicy whole bellies, coated with a perfectly crispy and flavorful batter.  The clams were served with a house-made tartar sauce that's so tangy and addictive, I wanted to lick the bowl clean.  Pretty much perfection.For an entree I opted for the cold Maine lobster roll with mayo (it's available hot and with butter, too).  It comes with either french fries, or a salad and I chose the salad since I had already had quite a few fried clams.  Fortunately, since it costs $25, the lobster roll did not disappoint.  The huge chunks of lightly dressed lobster meat were tucked into a perfectly toasted roll that tasted like brioche to me - faintly sweet, and a great complement to the lobster.  The side salad was a simple and equally delicious combination of butter lettuce, chopped hazelnuts and a light vinaigrette.My only complaint is that the space is so small and it was so crowded that the servers bumped into our table each and every time they passed by.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a low key neighborhood type of place. It isn't a chain and the quality is consistent. It is a great place eat with friends for a casual meal. Large counter with about fifteen stools and loose tables make up about fifty seats. The oyster selection is quite large and very fresh. All of the fish and seafood is very good and all fresh. As you have read here on yelp the Warm Buttered Lobster is a real stand out. If you like Lobster Rolls; you will not be disappointed. Every person I have taken here has LOVED the Warm Lobster Roll. They also have a very decent wine list and small list of beers. Great for casual dining with a group or just yourself. Parking is terrible as it is in the North End. Salem Street is a small one-way street so you will not likely find a parking spot. Better to park on Hanover or any other main street and walk to Salem Street. I have eaten at Neptune's over thirty times and the Five Star rating is for the consistent fresh seafood and one and only Warm Lobster Roll.

Reviews.Author: K P.
Reviews.Content: Went here for a late lunch, and we weren't disappointed! Oysters were awesome! We did about 15 oysters between 3 of us, and then we ordered the clam chowder (superb) mussels (HUGE portion) and the lobster roll....it was such a great dining experience. I can see this place getting packed for lunch/happy hour/dinner, I think we got lucky getting easy seats and fast service going at 2pm on a Monday. Next time I'm in town I'll be here!Only tiny complaint - bread took ages. But that's not a biggie.

Reviews.Author: Kim C.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 starsThe lobster roll is so excellent.  The bread was slightly crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside and drenched in the lobster flavor butter.  The entire sandwich was warm, goozing with flavor and was generously portioned with lobster.  I've had this sandwich over 6 months ago and I still crave it!  I haven't been able to find a lobster roll that rivals it on the West Coast. Also ordered the Triton platter to share with 3 other people.  All the seafood was delicious and very, very fresh.  If I ever go back to Boston, this is definitely one of the spots I'm hitting up!

Reviews.Author: M S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent selection of oysters from all over! Very impressive :) Clam chowder was good if you like Manhattan style. Warm buttery lobster roll was in fact excellent.I got in for lunch on a rainy Monday so the place was slow.. Staff was clearly bored and did not seem to care about its patrons. So the service was a bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Author: Rosie Z.
Reviews.Content: Enough said about this place. Small space so recommend avoiding peak tourist hours. They have a wide selection of oysters and wine. Lobster roll is good, as expected. However, I wish my roll was toasted and more crispy... lobster meat itself was drenched in butter and yummy. My partner's arctic Char was very tasty as well, the presentation was really good too which I didn't expect.Overall, very good place for a seafood lunch. Personally thought at $25, the lobster roll is not as good as the one I had in Pearl Oyster Bar in new york, but oh well, Boston is no New York, at least for its dining scene.

Reviews.Author: wsl l.
Reviews.Content: After much rave reviews, I finally made it to Neptune. We got here around 7pm and since it was a spur of the moment thing, we had no reservations. As expected, the place was packed so it was not too surprising that when we put our name down for a table for 2- we got aresponse of  "it's going be a 40min wait". OK- no problemo.  - gave the digits for a call back when the table was ready. Hungry took over so we headed over to a side street pizza joint for a snack. The name escapes me right now but it was good... I guess that's just gonna be a different yelp review.  :)We did our business at the pizza joint and 45 min later. Still NO call.  I know- I'm a bit impatient and very much an "are we there yet" gal.  We decide to head over to Neptune to see what the hold up was. When we got there, the hostess advised that we could look at the menu to see what we wanted to order.  Gladly obliging we looked on as our mouths were salivating.  We waited another 15min to be seated.  Is it 8pm already? We got seated at a table and since the place is really tiny, the tables are placed right next to each other.  They pack you in like sardines, elbows to elbows- no personal space.  We were lucky to spot 3 empty stools at the bar instead and were able to move.  Still elbows to elbows, but the thought of the cute guy sitting diagonally right across from me while I wolf down oysters was not going to be pleasant.  I recommend sitting at the bar instead. We got 1 1/2 doz of oysters and 1/2 doz. of cherrystones,  hamachi tartare and the roasted wild sea bass.. all to share. The oysters and cherrystones were very fresh, but I have to say, they were small.  I've had bigger.  The hamachi tartare had nice presentation, but was unfortunately overly tart with citrus flavor.  The people next to us saw what we were picking at and also ordered it.  Too bad they didn't ask us how it was. They took a few bites and had the barista take it away and ordered a salad instead. No joke. The bass entree was very tasty,  except for the pancetta that the fish was sitting ontop of- it was way too hard.I''m not a fan, but if I feel like spluging and waiting around, I would like to come back again and try their lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Debbie N.
Reviews.Content: Pros: Delicious and varied raw oyster bar, FAST serviceCons: small, always crowded, expensiveVerdict: If you're coming for the oysters, there are probably better places in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Lena N.
Reviews.Content: Very small place. The servers looked annoyed that they had so many customers. Service could have been a lot friendlier so minus stars for that. If you love raw oysters, this is the place for you. They're good. They're fresh. And they have almost any kind you could dream of. I had quite a few here and that blew a nice hole in my wallet. Lobster is not really worth it. You can get it elsewhere for cheaper and just as fresh (Try Atlantic Fish). Lobster roll was decent but not to my liking. Overall, Stick to the oysters here. On the pricier end (read: harvest your money tree) but you should remember that being cheap with seafood means a date with the toilet later in the night.

Reviews.Author: Katya K.
Reviews.Content: This place is a real gem in the middle of tourist trap cafes/restaurants in that area. When I entered the room I thought that magic happened and I ended up in a totally different area and city, mostly because I grew tired of seeing 'same shit different premises' thing in that area. My friend and I couldn't be happier with finding it after drawing circles around the area in search of a real-good spot. Oysters were great even though I am not a huge fan of most of them. Neptune burger was a blast - oh my, it was huge and meat was so good! And I still feel the taste of grilled octopus with soft taste of arugula and I regret so much that Boston in 4 hour drive from here. Wine list is more than decent and I loved crispy beers that friendly manager recommended. Why 4 stars and not 5? We had to wait for quite a while to get every dish we ordered though waiting was worth it.

Reviews.Author: marcus o.
Reviews.Content: hey this place is on point with the seafood stuff.Heres my take on it, the oysters are great.  You have a few options which you can pick from a list when you submit your order.  I selected randomly ones off the list that sounded cool.  I also asked the waitress for some recommendations after my selections.  I picked pretty much most of her suggestions.  So thats the process for the ordering of oysters.  Taste?  they taste great.  Smooth and buttery thats all I remember.The other item which I suggest you try.  Lobster roll.  Its absolutely great.  I enjoyed the bread that held the lobster in place.  Man this was good, I'm hungry writing this review as I think about it.  All in all good spot to check out.  I would love to try the clam chowder next time I'm in town.  Well thats the pick I got for you for your oyster and lobster roll hunger.  Oh and a major plus on top off all this is the decor of the place, white tile floor and walls in a diner type setting makes it all worth it.  Lobster rolls for the win!

Reviews.Author: Raymond N.
Reviews.Content: I had dinner at this place couple of weeks ago during a visit. Neptune Oyster is one of the best places to eat in the Boston area. A small place I must say, because I missed it twice walking on that block. Nice decor on the inside. Very limited seatings (about 6 tables and couple of bar stools). Best bet getting there is train or cab. No street parking anywhere. The food is amazing! The lobster roll is filled with a generous amount of meat. The bun is toasted, though slightly too moist (perhaps it was sitting for a little bit and it absorbed the moisture from the lobster meat. I went there on a Monday night, the special was a lobster pasta. Let me tell you, there was more lobster meat than pasta! Lobster was cooked just right. Juicy and not too chewy. Won't find a place like this in NYC where I live. I was impressed by the selection of oysters. The waitress gave us a piece of paper with the list of oysters available for the night. Just check off which one and how many you want. Best part? It gives an accurate description of each oyster. Bravo. Definitely would return again.

Reviews.Author: Annette P.
Reviews.Content: I went during the winter on a wednesday night. There was a line out the door. The hostess was taking everyone's cell number to call them 15min prior to when a table would be available (an approximate 3 hour wait!). Lucky me, I was away on business and eating solo. With less than a 20 minute wait, I was seated at the bar, delicious lobster roll in one hand and a complimenting glass of red wine suggesting by the bar staff in the other. Fantastic! You can't go to Neptune Oyster and not at least try the lobster roll.The only negative = it's very cramped. I hope you're not closterphobic.

Reviews.Author: P. G.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a must-experience if in Boston.  You have to get there early or you'll have the misfortune of standing outside with your mouth-watering.  Seriously... the night that my boyfriend and I went, we only had to wait about 20 minutes, but I've heard that the wait can be a couple of hours.  And they don't take reservations.Neptune Oyster has a very extensive oyster selection, and we started off our meal with a dozen oysters of various varieties.  All were pretty solid, but to be completely honest, some were too salty and too briny for my taste.  The best part of the meal, however, was the lobster roll!  OMG, soooooooo good!  My boyfriend and I both got the "hot" rolls, and the rolls came with HUGE chucks of lobster and butter for days (Paula Deen would love it!).  If I'm being completely honest, the actual bun left a little to be desired - it was just kind of plain.  The fries that accompanied the lobster roll were equally delicious as the lobster.  They were fresh, hot, and perfectly seasoned.   Great service, amazing food... Yummmmmmmy!!

Reviews.Author: Veronica P.
Reviews.Content: Order one thing in the menu - the hot lobster roll.It's my first lobster roll experience EVER so I have nothing to compare to but it was DIVINE. Freshly out of the oven sweet brioche soaked in dripping butter goodness married with fat lobster pieces... *dreams*The cold one wasn't as great but still very good. Chips were nothing special. Clam chowder was delicious. Fat clams, crunchy celery and not overly thick like the others I've tried.Be prepared to wait. .We waited for one hour, wandered around, missed the call (they claimed they made two) and had to wait again. Luckily only for 10 minutes. Service was friendly and attentive. Cosy and buzzing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: sara a.
Reviews.Content: Service left much to be desired, hence the less one star. I mean, it was busy and all, but there is a minimal amount a server should do, like ask if you want a drink especially if it's over 100 degrees outside. Ask if you want fries or salad. You know...Anyway, the food was pretty delicious. I ordered the $25 lobster roll (hot). It was good, but what isn't good drenched in butter? I do agree with the other reviewers that the taste of the hot roll far exceeds any of the mayo cold lobster rolls I've had all around the city. And I loved those mayo cold lobster rolls so that says quite alot. However, the butter drenching means heavy feeling. As I write this, I feel like my insides are coated with a layer of butter.Another cool thing about this place is that you can order the oysters a la carte. They give you a oyster menu (think sushi menu at a Japanese joint), and you can write the number of each kind of oyster you would like. I loved the idea because I felt like the lobster roll would fill me up, but I still wanted to try the oysters since it is called Neptune Oysters. I got two different kinds of oysters, one from Washington and one from Maine, and they both tasted fresh and oysterlicious. All in all, the food here is good but pricey. If I came here on my own dime, I'd just stick to the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Nicole W.
Reviews.Content: Ratting: 3.5Our first meal in Boston had to be seafood and all reviews pointed to Neptune Oyster.We started off with the fried ipswich clams with lemon tarter sauce and the P.E.I. mussels in a red curry broth. Both were great but I preferred the clams and hubby the mussels. He made sure to order a basket of bread to sop up every drop of that broth. Next up the Maine lobster roll served hot and drenched in butter. I think it could use a tad more butter if you can believe it. I'm so bad... If you don't want to feel totally piggy nix the fries like we did and order a salad. It's nice and fresh.

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: Best selection of oysters I've ever seen, freshest oysters I've ever tasted.  Trying out different oysters really adds spunk to your meal, makes it more memorable...whereas going to other places, you basically get one kind b/c there's only one type and eat for the quantity.  The raw bar here is worth the wait itself.  As for the lobster roll...hot damn it was tasty.  An entire Maine lobster of meat topped w/ warm butter accompanied w/ fries.  Yeah it's $25, but I'd get it every time I'm in Boston.  Paid about $45 (tip included) for 4 oysters, half a lobster roll and a beer.  That's about the only downside to this place...forking out steakhouse fare.  It looks cramped inside, but ppl don't really get in your way.  Staff is helpful and efficient, you're usually in and out within 45 min.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: So we dropped in last night expecting a long wait. We arrived at 6:25pm on a Sunday night were asked to leave a phone number and told it would be an hour or so. It actually took 1:20 before they called us and another 20 to be seated, so that was a bit annoying. We did a dozen assorted oysters that were very delicious and fresh. We also both opted for the hot buttered lobster roll and WOW! Best lobster roll I have ever had (although I would have liked less butter).  The fries with the roll were nothing special, but that roll was Amazing!Be ready for close quarters with your neighbors, they definitely pack people into the small almost communal tables. Oh and bring an extra jacket because they won't let you wait inside at all.. Food was 4.5 stars, but seating and service were a bit lacking. However I'd still recommend it and caution people to be ready for a long 2 hour wait. Put your name down then walk around the north end and return.

Reviews.Author: Steven L.
Reviews.Content: Wow, everyone seems to have drunk the Neptune Oyster kool-aid. Now I am not saying the place is bad... in fact, my meal there was actually good, but it wasn't mind-blowing which I would have expected given these reviews.I don't normally like to eat alone at a restaurant but was alone for this occasion and asked for a seat at the bar (around 6 pm). Hostess said there was a 20 minute wait and that she would call me when a seat was available. Didn't have to wait 10 minutes before I got a call back, so that was a good start. I overheard that the wait was about an hour for a party of 4 at that point.Ordered three oysters of varying sizes, origins, and tastes to have some variety. They run about $2-3/oyster and all were nice and fresh. I definitely could've eaten a couple more but wanted to save my appetite. BTW, the triton plateau looked tremendous.Now the clam chowder. I LOVED. Probably my favorite part of the meal. I like my chowder not too heavy and this delivered. Fresh and flavorful with clams you can actually taste. I only wish the bowl were bigger.And then the Maine lobster roll. Nice, large chunks of lobster meat on a buttered roll with a large heap of fries. It was good but a little too buttery for my taste. Compared to a $15 lobster roll I have had from the Red Hook Lobster Pound, I felt that while you definitely get more bang for your buck the quality was just slightly higher. And the fries were sadly burnt. Maybe if they take that off the order it would be $5 cheaper and then you can leave your stomach room for more oysters...Service? Ehh. I know I was alone, but the bartender/waitress couldn't really be bothered. I had to wait for her to finish her "line" of customers after attempting to order and then saw my order for oysters sitting in front of me for a good five minutes before she delivered it to me. Also the people next to me who ordered after me got some of their food before mine. Normally not really nitpitcky, but we ordered the same thing. So I guess I'll have to dock a star for service.Now I would still recommend this place if you're in Boston and looking for a one-stop shop for oysters, clam chowder, and lobster rolls. Hopefully you'll have the same orgasmic experience as everyone else seems to be having!

Reviews.Author: Janet G.
Reviews.Content: I came here again this weekend for lunch. 1.5 hours wait. But it was worth it.The oysters were once again fresh...kumamotos are awesome!I ordered the Vitello Tonnato...I was a little skeptical of the veal/tuna sashimi combo..but boy does it work! I'm not sure how to describe it. The tuna was very fresh and the veal added a nice meaty flavor (probably not the best way of describing it). I am sometimes hesitant of ordering sashimi-type meals when I'm super hungry, but the fish/meat combo satisfied my tummy. I can't wait to eat it again!

Reviews.Author: Katrina A.
Reviews.Content: Coming here was the highlight of my Boston trip. I made sure that my sister and I were in line before they even opened to avoid the long wait times. We got there at 11:15 on a Saturday, and there were already 26 people ahead of us. Luckily we were the last ones in for the first seating. It's a small restaurant and you will be seated quite close to strangers. We were seated at the same table with another group of 4. My sister and I moved our part of the table slightly, but the waitress told us to move it back... Definitely try the oysters. It was my first time trying oysters and I'm glad I did!
