They give you a list of the offerings with descriptions and you pencil in how many you want. Super easy to order. Then get the lobster roll. Best lobster roll ever. Best hot, drenched in butter. It is sooo worth it.

Reviews.Author: Bob M.
Reviews.Content: There is a real jerk there that is combative, unfriendly, and insulting. He wears spectacles and needs an attitude adjustment. Do not go near this place!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Craig W.
Reviews.Content: The food was decent. Although, if you like hearty, rich, and thick clam chowder, this is not the place for you. Be prepared to wait in line as this is a tourist spot for sure. Also, Yelp says they open at 9:30 and they actually open at 11:30. Lastly, I am not a fan of rude people and the twisted sisters that seem to run the place held true to the stereotype that Bostonians have a bad attitude and act like their shite don't stank:)

Reviews.Author: Edison T.
Reviews.Content: It's a little close to 1 AM and I'm sick. Bored and watching TV, I suddenly had a craving for soup, more specifically, clam chowdaaaaah. I attempted to remember when the last time I had it was and that was at the end of October in Boston at Neptune's. So I started to reminisce about experience there...(insert dream ripples and harp music...)I walked into the restaurant, the place was small and crowded. Few gentlemen in suits in front of me and I was worried I wouldn't be able to get seated in time since I had about an hour to eat before I needed to get a cab back to Logan to fly back to California. Hostess approached me and said she had a bar seat available and a big smile formed on my face. I sat down at the bar and looked at the numerous selection of oysters in ice at the oyster bar. Looked over the menu, but really i already had in mind on what I wanted to order based on friends' recommendations.Summerside Oysters, New England style clam chowder, and the lobster roll with hot butter.Oysters came out first, freshly shucked right in front of me. (yelp.com/biz_photos/nept…) I drizzled a little of lemon over all of them and slurped the first oyster in one quick gulp. Suddenly, Lionel Richie's Hello popped into my mind, why? "Hello, is it me you're looking for?" YES! YES IT IS! I've been looking for the perfect oyster and now that I've found you, I wanted to kiss/engulf you a thousand times! Golloped the next one with a dash of the red sauce and the sweetness of the sauce even brought out the sweetness of the oyster even more. A minute later, the whole dozen was gone and I didn't know what to do with myself, twitching already like a crack fiend in need of the next hit.Luckily, the chowder came out before I had to resort to prostituting my rotund body for more oyster money. (yelp.com/biz_photos/nept…) The chowder was amazing. It was light and the freshness of the ingredients just bursted in your mouth. Just a dash of pepper and that was all I needed to compliment the chowder. Clams were plentiful and you just know that these clams were from cold waters.Finished that in about a minute and a half, would've been faster had I just thrown caution and my tongue to the wind to just down the hot chowder. The last order took a while to come out, I kept looking at my watch and started to worry that I might have to bypass cannolis from Maria's and just head back to Logan (#FatKidProblems). But then suddenly...(this next part was all in slow motion).A sweet aroma caught my nose and my heard turned. I saw my server come out of the back kitchen holding a plate on a tray. I squint my beady little eyes and tried to make out what was on this place. I could actually see the buttery smell arising off the place and making a streamline arrow towards my nose. She is taking forever to walk along the L shaped bar counter towards my end. Then she plates it down in front of me and all at once the sweetness of the toasted soft roll, the large fat chunks of perfectly cooked red lobster tail, and the dripping hot butter attacked my nose and a pool of saliva formed in my mouth. (yelp.com/biz_photos/nept…) That picture does not do it one bit of justice nor will any of the meaningless words I have written or about to write. The roll was oh so toasty on the outside, perfect crunch at first, then followed by the soft sweet inside. Then I hit the barrier of rich, aromatic, hot butter and what glorious butter flavor it was. Finally the lobster meat: succulent, juicy, tender, hot, sickly, and ripe, it may my taste buds dance the Lambada, you know? The Forbidden Dance? Yes, the roll was in sync with my taste buds in a perfect harmony. It was beautiful and unfortunately ended too quickly.I looked down at the empty plate, tears building up in my eyes, and wanted to order more. However, my flight time was approaching and so I sent for the check. During the meantime, i devoured the delicious crunchy fries that came with my lobster roll. I thanked the server for delivering Heaven to me on a plate, bid adieu, and went off on my cannoli quest.Now I snap back to reality, oh there goes gravity. I'm in my cold house and yearning for Neptune's warm buttery lobster roll. Why do we have to be on opposite ends of the United States? Oh well, 'til next time our paths cross again. As for tonight, I will find you in my dreams once more oh sweet baby lobster Jesus.

Reviews.Author: Jenni H.
Reviews.Content: I knew I wanted to try a lobster roll during my short week in Boston so I did my research and settled on island creek oyster bar and Neptune oyster. I went to ICOB my first night and didn't think I could have another lobster roll as good until I hit Neptune my last night and was proved wrong. I ordered the hot version of the roll which has lobster with hot butter as opposed to the alternative of cold margarine. When it arrived, there was extremely generous huge chunks of lobster that were buttery and delightful. Definitely more lobster than ICOB's. Also, where as ICOB'S was more "artisan", this was more hit the spot soul food. If you want something more fancy, I would recommend ICOB, but if you want down-to-earth pure and delicious good grub, definitely stick to Neptune. Just based on my personal taste, Neptune had exactly what I was looking for in a lobster roll and I would definitely pick this as my go to for rolls in the future. The one negative is if you are driving, it is literally impossible to find parking. I actually drove to Neptune my first night in Boston but after almost half an hour of circling the neighborhood, I gave up. When I actually ate there, I had to park near the waters, which was a 20 min walk away. The wait time is also ridiculously long even at odd off hours. I went at 2pm and still waited for about half an hour. Also expect to rub elbows with the person sitting on both sides of you because the tables are all communal and the place is extremely small. But for the sake of its lobster roll, I think it was worth the trouble :)

Reviews.Author: Julia B.
Reviews.Content: Awesome lobster roll with butter, and great oyster selection.  The staff was very friendly, despite the constant crowd.  Downside- prepare to wait at least 3 hours during peak times (worth it)

Reviews.Author: Josty G.
Reviews.Content: Great food! Amazing oysters! Killer ambiance! You'll wait for 2hrs but it's worth it. Go kill some time at one of many pubs in the neighborhood or grab a cannoli around the corner at Mikes Pastry. Everything on the menu is superb so order up and don't be shy! I recommend glass of wine, dozen oysters, and seared Yellowfin tuna (don't be fooled it's a large portion) or their spicy mouth watering Cioppino! Next time I'm in town I'll definitely be having a lobster roll. Service was good but don't expect to be in 'n out. You waited for 2hrs so sit back sip your wine and enjoy the classical 50's throw back ambiance. Don't rush a great experience.

Reviews.Author: Sidney L.
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite sure why Neptune Oyster has received such glowing reviews. We went there on a Sunday evening, and we put our names down on the list three hours in advance, hoping to eat around 7:45 PM.- The service and ambience were abysmal. We had to share a table with a party of four, which just felt awkward, especially at such a fancy restaurant (last time I had to share a table at a nice restaurant was at some cheap Chinese place). The table was way too small for what we ordered, and I found myself eating off of a precariously balanced plate in the corner of the table. One wrong move and I would've been covered in lobster and mussels. The server was inattentive, and didn't refill my water. She also did not bring us bread, which all the other tables had. And having only one bathroom in the establishment just made things difficult.- It is definitely true, the oysters and the lobster roll were as good as advertised. It was really neat trying a variety of oysters side by side, and they were well prepared. The lobster roll was perfect, the best I had ever had.- The rest of the food we ordered was merely okay. I found the clam chowder to be watery (I prefer more thick and creamy chowder), and the mussels were nothing to write home about.In the end, with all the food and a glass of wine, I ended up dropping about $70 on decent-to-good meal with an awful ambience. Definitely did not feel like it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Wendy L.
Reviews.Content: I finally made it to Neptune Oyster after living in Boston for so many years. I was always deterred by the long wait during nights and weekends. This place only has 5 tables and about 10 bar seats. They don't take reservations but I believe you can order take-out so if you really want to try their famous Lobster Rolls without waiting perhaps that could be an option. We ordered a cold and a warm Lobster Roll. I prefer the cold one with mayo but the warm one was delicious as well. They give you big chunks of lobster and a ton of fries but $25 is still a lot for a Lobster Roll when lobsters are only a few dollars a pound in the summer. Basically you're paying for the North End experience and their fame. We also got Fried Clams as an appetizers and that was amazing...not too much batter and a lot of clams so you get what you pay for. The restaurant is very small and cozy. The decor is not fancy but it fits into the theme of North End restaurants. I'll definitely be back for the Lobster Rolls!

Reviews.Author: Anna C.
Reviews.Content: Good God Almighty - this place is delicious.1) Neptune's is a tiny, tiny place that seats about 30 so wait or put you name down to be called back.  If you're smarter, you'd call weeks in advance to get a reservation (if they take them).  We put our name down, walked around, snacked on some cannolis and about 3 hours later, received a call back and were glad we came in.2) Order the oysters.  Any of them.  All of them. They are fresh and you kind of have to feel sorry for the shucker because of how many they have to shuck, but still, order them.3) Then order the cioppino.  This is the BEST EVER cioppino I've had in my life.  Good thing they gave us bread to soak up all the soupy goodness.  Not a drop went to waste.4) The lobster roll was delicious, tenderly cooked lobster perfection.  After taking a bite of my husband's cioppino, it was hard to go back to my lobster roll.  Good thing he doesn't mind sharing.We ordered a couple of glasses of wine and that was it.  We were stuffed and very happy to walk back to our hotel, which was quite far....Do not miss place this while in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Larry M.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Lobster Roll, the only place that is better that I know of is Red's in Maine.

Reviews.Author: Erin K.
Reviews.Content: I ended up here on a whim friday night and boy was it memorable. My friend and I were sorta hungry and wandered in around 7pm. The place was fairly full but there happened to be two seats at the bar so we sidled up.The decor of this place is great. Its cozy, timeless, tasteful it feels vintagey and european, carefully detailed but simple and understated.My experience here was nothing but positive. The bartender was incredibly sweet and totally laid-back for friday night dinner scene. She excitedly relayed the recent celebrity clientele Justin Timberlake and Kate Hudson, but was decidedly as polite and friendly to us as I'm sure she was to them.We felt no pressure to order an abundance of food or to drop wads of cash.  We sampled oysters all excellent, that came via a handy and descriptive menu, location, price, flavor profiles for each type. My friend got the veal and tuna tartare sandwich an unlikely combo, it was awesome served on toasted brioche with a grainy mustard, cucumber salad and solid fries. I literally pored and lingered over the menu, everything sounded delicious. There were tons of unusual flavor profiles, food combinations and several cuisine influences. Far from standard seafood house options.I decide on squid diavola which was grilled and then stewed in a spicy delicious tomato sauce with beans and isreali couscous. I would definitely go back here with more of an appetitie so I could really eat my way through the menu. For an unplanned Friday night this was by far the most memorable meal of the summer, not bad for wandering off the T after work.

Reviews.Author: Betsy K.
Reviews.Content: Loved it. My huz used to work with the owner at another Boston restaurant-it is ridiculous it took us five years to finally try it. Food was great, wine list is incredible. A piece of lobster from my roll fell on the ground and I had a moral debate in my head about picking it up and eating it under the "five second rule". Only advice go on a Sunday as it is tiny (and beautiful). I have one regret-everyone had this little oyster crackers with butter at their places, but not us. I suppose I didn't need them...

Reviews.Author: Samantha S.
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stop on a hot evening, I can't believe we got a table as every other time I've tried going its been a long wait.  Not a thing to complain about, but don't go here if you or anyone you're with is a vegetarian...or if you're not willing to get cozy with fellow diners.  A lovely restaurant that felt authentically Boston, and a great spot for people watching and drinking.

Reviews.Author: Vincent Y.
Reviews.Content: My first lobster roll and hopefully not my last. Just perfectly cooked lobster. I've never liked any lobster but the Chinese sauteed variety. Everything else is just too expensive. This was worth it. I am never writing off American seafood again!!!!!I loved their raw bar. The prices are great and our oysters were clean. I didn't particularly like either sauce with the oyster because I eat the oyster for it's pure, how do I put it, sexiness. Their oysters are just sexy and perfect. I see how it's been seen as an aphrodisiac and Neptune does it right.I got the warm lobster roll. Thank you yelpers!!!!! It's a great investment. The staff was very friendly despite my party having huge backpacks-we were basically backpacking through Boston house-searching. The restaurant is small but everyone seems to be having a great time. I love this place and I hope everyone else gives it a try.

Reviews.Author: Thor T.
Reviews.Content: Could not leave Boston without a quick visit to Neptune.  While the eating indulgences of the previous few days precluded a full sampling of Neptune's enticing menu (in particular the Sunday special of Fish Tacos), I still was able to sample three outstanding offerings.  First, a wonderful selection of Northeast oysters (Maine, Nova Scotia, PEI), plump and pristine in their saline splendor (and going perfectly well with the California bubbly offered by the glass).  Neptune's version of New England clam chowder is a classic rendition, with fresh small clams (a couple a bit sandy) and a rich, creamy texture.  My favorite was "Grilled Petite Octopus ' Fra Diavolo' - four polipetti perfectly grilled, on a bed of stoneground polenta in a Calabrese chili brodetto (providing the "devilish" part of the dish).  That dish alone is worth a trip to Neptune!   Service is efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Jen L.
Reviews.Content: If you are batty for bivalves and other shellfish, this is the place for you.I am not. I really don't eat much shellfish at all, so why would I go to a place specializing in Oysters?SHRIMP COCKTAIL.Seriously, this is best i have had in this city. The shrimp are immaculately cleaned, crisp, fresh, and best of all HUGE. I am also a fan of their cocktail sauce which has a lovely kick of potent horseradish (Why must I love all things that burn so?). I love lots of their crudo dishes as well, particularly the Hamachi sashimi with thai chiles and spciy microgreens (NOM). Also a favorite are the tuna ribbons with celery greens.

Reviews.Author: Eric B.
Reviews.Content: So... I originally added this review to the wrong place which just means, you shouldn't either trust a word I say or realize that I was going through a illness that caused my mind to stop working. Having said that here's what I think of Neptune:This place is awesome if you enjoy bivalves and seafood and if you don't then what's wrong with you anyway? Sheesh.I got there early with a friend and it was busy already, always a good sign. We sat at the bar and decided to split one of the raw bar samplers. And lo, it was good! The burger our neighbor ordered looked awesome too (fried oysters top it off). Of course, I have to come back and eat more bivalves and try that famous Lobster Roll I keep reading about.

Reviews.Author: Wendy C.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome.  I think I was putting off reviewing it because of the already guaranteed wait any time remotely close to dinner hour.  Be prepared to wait a long time - but it's worth it.The oysters & other raw bar stuff are super tasty, and they do a good job of helping the noobs by providing little descriptions on the list you order on.  But I love & miss Neptunes at least as much for the Neptune Burger as for the oysters.  Actually, it has fried oysters in it so maybe that's a pointless comparision. ;)  The bread, the burger, the fries - all excellent!Oh and the decor is lovely too.  If I go back to boston, this is the first place I'd spring for.

Reviews.Author: Onur U.
Reviews.Content: Wow!Oysters don't get fresher than this.  A dozen options, all fresh.  Shucked with lots of liquor left in the shell (yes! this is such a must).  Raw clams too.  Never had them before, but I enjoyed them.  We had one of everything, and next time I go back, I'll order that again.  This is as good as oysters get.The other dishes were good too.  Delicately breaded fish for the fish tacos.  The fish was fresh and flaky.  Seared scallops that were so buttery (texture, not greasy).We showed up 15 minutes before they opened on a sunday morning, and we were glad we did.  It was full at 11:30 on the nose.  But it's worth the wait.  If you like oysters even a little, this is destination dining.

Reviews.Author: Karyn S.
Reviews.Content: We went for an early lunch on Saturday right when they opened at 11:30; thank goodness we went at that time, because before long, the line was forming. Don't come here if you want privacy - the tables are right on top of each other and I was sitting next to a three year old, which was a bit annoying. But it's a small place and they're trying to feed as many people as they can. Great subway tile on the walls, has an overall terrific old school feel to it. The hot butter lobster roll was fantastic; probably the best I've ever had. The raw oysters were amazing and the mignonette was exactly how I like it. Very glad we came here, would definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Colt V.
Reviews.Content: Visited on a Saturday, during a vacation to Boston.Split a lobster roll with my girl friend. I have to believe that butter is better mayo in this regard, but then I'm from Texas... It was terribly delicious, lobster was had in June for those seasonally interested. We also ordered a dozen oysters off the raw bar, from various regions, everything up to snuff in presentation and taste.What we ordered was all very straight forward and done with excellent ingredients. Prices more than matched the quality of the food, and felt very reasonable for the area.Of note to visitors, it's very small and will get busy. You're probably going to be sharing a table with other people, so don't get too upset about not having a table of your own. Take the opportunity to converse with strangers!They're considerate enough to take your cellphone number and will call you when your spot is ready, allowing you to wander the North End.

Reviews.Author: Rosa Y.
Reviews.Content: A cute little Oyster Bar where there's always a line, but totally worth the wait. The oysters are fresh and the selection wide. My favorite was actually the squid salad! Refreshing and crunchy that tickled my taste buds. It was right before a ball game around 3 in the afternoon, so it wasn't a full meal. Just enough to keep me content and sing "Sweet Caroline" at the Fenway :)

Reviews.Author: Alyne W.
Reviews.Content: We had two glasses of white wine each and ordered the Lobster Roll and the Tritron pleatau and can i just say AMAZING!!!! My BF took his first bite of the lobster roll and said "sweet buttery bliss with succulant lobster" The tritron plate is enough for two or three. The Oysters, clams, and mussels are superb and the shrimp cocktail is three large prawns that were del-ish. If you are in Boston and you treat yourself to one meal (and you love seafood) this is the place!

Reviews.Author: AJ G.
Reviews.Content: Since B and G was booked he week before my trip to Boston, I thought I would try something new. Wow, I am so glad I did. There was a 45 minute wait on a Friday night, but there was plenty of places to get a drink and wait nearby. We had oysters and a octopus (ceviche like dish) for appetizers. Both I highly recommend. I had the Blue Fish and my Fiancee had the lobster roll. Both dishes were out of this world. Amazing flavors , great service, and great atmosphere. We will be back the next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Ed R.
Reviews.Content: Wow... As if another review could make a difference. Went to this place because of the yelp reviews but then got worried because it was in a touristy area... Badly mistaken, this place is amazing.Started off with a great atmosphere - small and tight quarters. Ordered up a seafood platter to start that had shrimp, lobster meat, crab meat and oysters. Everything on that plate was fresh and tasted amazing aside from one of the oysters (which escapes me at this time.)For our main courses we ordered two main lobster rolls - one with mayo and one with hot butter. The table thought the one with hot butter was better but they were both simply delicious. I would order either one, plenty of lobster on a tasty bun and fries to die for. Yes.. fries. The third person had the striped bass which was fresh and also deserves accolades.  To wash it down had a bottle of wine.   I would return in a heartbeat. We went for a late lunch and waited for a table to open up, took about ten minutes.

Reviews.Author: Steve K.
Reviews.Content: It too bad when poor service offsets great food. A friend and I walked up to Neptune at 9:20pm on a Thursday night. Late enough right? Not quite. There was still a line of about 15 people out the door waiting for a table in a space that seats about as many at the bar as it does in the rest of the place. We came back around an hour later and sat at the bar--at this point the place only being about 1/3 full. I waited about 10 minutes to get a menu, and watched my oysters sit slightly more than an arms length away for several minutes before they were picked up and brought over. Regardless, the platter I had of 8 oysters was absolutely outrageous. The mignonette sauce was a little strong for my taste, and these oysters are so varied in flavor that I didn't want to completely kill my palate. Overall, the Wellfleet oysters were my favorite, though each one offered a slightly different variation on salt, cream, and melon flavor.Once again, getting and paying the check was a frustratingly long experience, but given the food here, I'm not about to destroy the integrity of this rating.

Reviews.Author: Leslie P.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the buttery lobster roll!I went with some co-workers on a random week night when we decided to take our chances and see if we can avoid the typical 2-hour wait.  We were in luck.  We only waited about 45 minutes, and they took our cell phone number so we were able to grab a drink somewhere nearby.The place is tiny.  I have to give the servers some major kudos for running around in such a tight space that is packed full of people.  We had really good service.Now, to the food...I am not an oyster fan, so I opted for crab legs to start.  They were cooked perfectly and very fresh and flavorful.  Then I ordered the buttery lobster roll for my main (skip the crappy mayo version!).  It was AMAZING.  There was not a shortage of butter, that's for sure.  The butter did not take away from the lobster, which was yummy and plentiful.  Come hungry - it's well worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Stacey D.
Reviews.Content: Give me your oysters,your crab, yearning to be happy,don't set your fish free.

Reviews.Author: JP E.
Reviews.Content: No disrespect to Maine and I've been there, but Neptune Oyster has the best lobstah roll I've ever had.  Yea its $25 but its huge and worth every penny.  The roll is huge and stuffed over the top with claw and knuckle lobstah meat.  My wife and I got the cold and hot versions which were both ridiculous but I would have to give the edge to the hot version.  The warm butter spills into the plate and I found myself mopping the butter up with the bread roll.  Money.  Fries were great as well.  well seasoned and fried several times.The oysters were great.  Wide selection and you order by pencil and paper.  My favorite is usually the kumamoto.  Pair a few oysters with a harpoon ipa and lobstah roll and you've got 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: Went to Neptune with a good friend on Friday night.We arrived at 7:30pm, expecting to wait, and put our name on the list for the 1.5 hour wait. Went out for a drink, came back 1.5 hours later and were seated right away.  The oysters never disappoint.The lobster roll was amazingly delicious. (still the best i've found in beantown). God, the fries are even good.Note: the lobster roll is huge. Perfect for sharing :). Didn't have the clam chowder this time around, but I remember from last time that it was really good.If you have a tourist in town, and you want to show them good old New England fare, take them here. Never fails!(just be prepared to wait if you come during dinner rush...)

Reviews.Author: Drea Y.
Reviews.Content: You know the saying, "big things come in small packages."  Well Neptune Oyster is no exception. This restaurant is like a boutique diner.The lobster roll was worth all 2,500 pennies, the oyster selection was vast and our servers knowledge of said oysters was incredibly impressive as she helped us make our selections when we ordered a platter of about 15.Awesome experience, amazing food!

Reviews.Author: R M.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the lobster roll (hot).  It was freakin' bomb.  I also ordered an alcoholic beverage but it wasn't good enough for me to remember.BTW, The couple sitting next to us got the hot lobster roll and cold lobster roll and said both were good.Get the hot lobster roll.Tip:  Put your name in early because this place is small.  The wait is long.  So if you're visiting, consider taking a detour to put in your name then go back to exploring the Freedom Trail until they call to let you  know your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Sasha B.
Reviews.Content: Maybe because this was my first warm with butter lobster roll, but this was the best roll I've ever had! Why aren't they all made this way?? Seriously so good! My friend and I split the yellowfin tuna app, it comes on top of a french bread slice with avocado spread. It was very good! Heaping pile of raw fish, and super fresh tasting avocado! Everyone at Neptune was eating only lobster rolls and oysters, I highly recommend some of the other apps!

Reviews.Author: Jenny Y.
Reviews.Content: I think this will be more a 4.5 stars for me. Yum! We had the clam chowder, little necks and of course the lobster roll.. I visited Boston about 2 months ago and I still think about the lobster roll from time to time. If you like lobster this will make you love it! I've always liked lobsters but I forgot how good it really was until I had their lobster roll! We went for the hot over the cold because mayonaise just seemed like it will over power the lobsters. Anyways, the hot is just simple but as good as it gets! Pure big chunks of fresh lobsters with butter. The bread soaks up the butter just enough that it's not sickening greasy but perfect combination wer when you take a bite it's like the perfect amount of butter to lobster ratio (does that make sense? ^_^ ). Anyways just tons and tons fresh lobster meat. Yum!Little necks were really good too. Fresh FreshClam Chowder - I really liked it but I think I can see wer this will be more dependent on people's preference.. it is less creamy than most clam chowders.. but i think it makes it really good because i can actually taste the clams and how fresh they are.. u dun get sick of eating it over and over because it's not too heavy like most clam chowders..

Reviews.Author: Matthew F.
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for one night in June on business with my boss.  Spent the early evening walking around from bar to bar trying to shake the disappointment of Cheers from my mind and then resorted to Yelp for a dinner suggestion.  Neptune was the first highly rated spot to pop up, so we poked our heads in. The lady at the door told us it would be 90 minutes, which seemed like a lot on a random Thursday evening especially when my entire time in Boston was limited to about 28 hours. I was ready to leave, but my boss decided we should put our name on the list. It was moments like this where I understand completely how he got to be where he is.The food here is amazing. The oyster varieties were all interesting- one tasted of cantaloupe of all things - and incredibly fresh. The real showstopper though is the warm lobster roll. Sure, it would be hard to bathe a lobster in warm butter and not enjoy the taste, but this was incredible. The bread was perfectly crusty. The butter wasn't excessive to the point of making my hands greasy, and the price wasn't altogether unreasonable.  But the real driver behind this 5 star review is that I have woken up on three seperate occassions thinking of this sandwich. As ridiculous as that sounds, it's absolutely the truth.  We sat at the bar, and the server/bartender was so friendly too, and the type to make a point of asking and learning every patron's name. Honestly, I can't even complain about the wait because the experience was so good.

Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: The Lobster role reaches all the high expectations. Make sure to get it buttered and warm!But if you're going for lunch be sure to get here early, its small inside and fills up fast!

Reviews.Author: Napkin Freak C.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I waited outside before opening time.  And boy were we NOT the only ones!  We barely made it in and we were already like 45 minutes early. haha.I am not into lobsters too much but it was amazing to have their lobster roll.  It is sauteed in butter and served hot.  (lobster rolls are usually cold).  This was a huge delight whenever my friends and I come to boston.  Give this a try but expect a long wait.  I am very proud that there are restaurants out there that I can actually say that it was excellent and significantly good.  As for the oysters, they were fresh.  I usually have the East coast ones, generally more fresher in taste and texture.  Yum!Lobster bisque was great but almost $15, wow!  That is pricey. But if you are not too hungry, just only get the lobster roll, comes with a load of fries.. that gets you full enough.  Yay!

Reviews.Author: Jade N.
Reviews.Content: First time in New England so I had to try a lobster roll and since yelp told me that this was the place to do it, i did!The place is small and can get crowded but cozy. There is a solid wine list to pour over (ha ha...) and the lobster roll was as expected - simple and lobstery. Roll, lobster, butter with a side of fries and call it a day.

Reviews.Author: Alistair B.
Reviews.Content: Overrated.  Was told it had the best lobster rolls.Lobster roll was good but not worth waiting an hour for and I've had better in Cape Cod and New York.Raw bar was very good. Some of the staff are pretty unprofessional and don't handle the long line well at all. Beware.

Reviews.Author: Diana F.
Reviews.Content: Neptune's oysters are fresh.  There's quite a variety to choose from, ranging from east to west coast.  I prefer to sit at the bar because you get to watch the shuckers go to town on these little ocean gems.  Their warm lobster roll is TDF (to die for).  Yeah, it's a bit pricey at $25 but honestly, worth it.  I have dreams about this lobster roll!The restaurant is tiny.  And expect a wait.  I usually put my name in, then go grab a drink nearby.  Don't let this deter you... it's worth the $ and wait.

Reviews.Author: Brianna W.
Reviews.Content: I first came here on a date -- that relationship has long ended, but my love of Neptune will never die. The lobster roll is good, but actually, isn't my favorite. I like a little celery mixed in. BUT. I love oysters. Like own a book on eating oysters. Love oysters. These people get oysters. They talk to you about oysters like wine or snotty beer. (Start, finish, texture, etc.) I'd recommend always sitting at the bar so that you can order in small groups and talk to the bartender for more recommendations. The decor is perfect -- all white marble and small tile. The wait is always unreal, so I never come here with more than one other person (and honestly, I've been known to just find the lone seat).

Reviews.Author: C K.
Reviews.Content: The meal would have been great..if it wasn't for the waitress who messed up our order.  We ordered Apps- combo of oysters/clams, piggyback, clam chowder Entree-lobster roll and lobster spaghettini Except for piggyback, all the dishes came out together. SERIOUSLY?  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  She felt bad and didn't charge for the clam chowder, but the experience and flavor combo was ruined.

Reviews.Author: Scott K.
Reviews.Content: Wow, the lobster roll was amazing.  It was definitely the best lobster roll I've ever had!  The taste of butter soaked in to the roll and the meat was just so tender and juicy.  Next time I'm here I will DEFINITELY be visiting neptune oyster for a lobster roll!  The downside for me was the fries.  The fries tasted like they had been fried in old overused oil.  I barely touched my fries.  You must must must get the lobster roll (hot)!!The line was long though, so be ready to wait a little bit to get a seat.

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent spot for oysters and seafood dishesVery nice and attentive staffpresented the oysters well - helped choose wine, and were just very pleasant all aroundit is a little pricey - but you will be happymy oysters were magnificent - tried a bunch of MA oystersthe spaghettini was very good but not exceptional, needed a bit of acid - but that is more my preference perhapsI look forward to visiting again

Reviews.Author: Meilani M.
Reviews.Content: I honestly would've given this place 5 stars but since the place is so small there's always a really long wait. The food here is AWESOME! They have their own house made clam chowder. It isn't as thick as regular clam chowders. It's more soupy but it's still very good. You can see and taste the clams which has to obviously be the main ingredient (instead of potatoes).I don't eat lobster but my friend had order the lobster roll. I tried it any way. It was GOOD, buttery and soft. I didn't even care about the bread. It was all about that lobster. They are not stingy with the lobster either. You get what you pay for.I also ordered their oysters & Grilled Whole Bronzini. All the oysters were fresh and had a hint of sweetness flavor to them. The Bronzini was so tasty. Stripped the entire fish down to the bone. It is very expensive. I think between the 2 of us it was around $120. I would definitely come back again! It is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly M.
Reviews.Content: Mmm...buttery goodness. The hot lobster roll is a definite must.My only gripe is the accompanying French fries. If I knew it would come with some bland ass fries, I would've substituted.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth N.
Reviews.Content: A friend and I have been having a "burger off". It's hard for me to admit defeat, but it happened at Neptune Oyster.The burger is not only massive, but it is topped with fried oysters. The roll is sweet, and as my friend put it "melts or crumbles in your mouth" as you bite into it. The fries were delicious, and my substitute salad was fresh.The only downside is the wait. On a weekend night don't expect to eat unless it's really early or really late-- thankfully I live a few blocks away or I'm not sure what I could've done for two hours.

Reviews.Author: Rhea K.
Reviews.Content: FINALLY made it into this place. I recently took a trip to Boston and so many of my friends were recommending this place to me. I saw the $25 lobster roll on the menu and was like... shmeh. But people kept assuring me it was worth it, so I tried to grab a seat here... 3 times.First night was a Thursday. Following some advice on here, we figured we'd show up to put our name down on the list and settle for a late dinner (we're thinking maybe 9:30 or 10) since we were pretty full anyway. Decided to show up around 8:30 to put our name down and they were SOLD OUT for the night. I've never heard of a restaurant "selling out", but there ya go. It's ok, we have a few more nights so we'll just try again.The next night, Friday night, we show up a little earlier, this time around 7:15. Surely we'll get a table for late dinner. Nope! The hostess said we could maybe get a table around 10:30 or 11, but no guarantees. Wha?! Jesus, this place is popular!Finally, Saturday night, we do it right. Showed up at 5:30 to put our name down, we're told the wait will be around 1.5 hours and they'd give us a call. Perfect. We head back to our place, take a little nap, and get a call about 2 hours later saying our table is ready. We showed up and were seated promptly, and service was great.Now, onto the FOOD (I feel like half the battle was just getting a seat around here). I must say, it was worth all that hassle because the food was amazing. Oysters were amazingly fresh. Also got the johnnycake which was like... how do I explain this.... heaven in your mouth. No kidding. The cake itself was so fluffy and crispy and buttery, and the creaminess and saltiness of the caviar and trout tartare complemented it perfectly. And of course, we had to get the hot lobster roll. SO delicious. Lobster was perfectly cooked, plump and juicy with a little chew to it, on a perfectly buttered bun and crispy fries. It was amazing. I will have dreams about this lobster roll, it was so good. I wanted to order more, but we were pretty full after that. I bet anything here would be amazing though. And the bill wasn't too bad either.I'm only taking off a star because it is so hard to get a seat here. I understand that's just how it is, but if you're from out of town and aren't expecting that (since most restaurants aren't that way), it can be really frustrating (ran into several frustrated and angry out-of-towners hoping to get a seat here). At some point you either have to a) expand or b) change your system, but I guess it'll happen if it makes sense and is what's best for the restaurant. So overall, definitely worth the wait, but the wait issue should eventually be alleviated somehow.

Reviews.Author: Eileen J.
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic! Boston is known for their delicious seafood but I think this place just topped any other experience. Everything was just so delicious. The clam chowder, mussels and hot buttered lobster rolls. Definetely something you have to try when you go. It is pricey, lunch came out to be $95 with tip but totally worth it. And the wait was around 30 minutes on a Thursday at 12PM but you leave them your number and they do call you when the table is ready.Overall, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Author: Amy N.
Reviews.Content: WOW. You must go here and try the lobster roll - it is amazing. I am not even a big seafood fan but I couldn't get enough. I went here early in the evening so I avoided waiting in line. There are not many tables, so get here early!

Reviews.Author: Ryan Y.
Reviews.Content: My sister, who has been living in Boston for the past 4 years recommended this place to us when my family and I came to visit. First, yes, the wait was as bad as people say. We had to wait 1 hour to get seated (as promised by the waitress), and this was on a random Tuesday. It's busy. It's small, and there's not a lot of seating inside. Memorial weekend must've been a nightmare.Bro Tip: you'll probably get seated faster with a party of 4 or less. Taxi cab size. We had a party of 5, and parties of 3 and under got seated before we did. They had to put 2 tables together for us. As visitors we had no problem waiting for "the best" so we strolled around the north end and admired the history, and quaintness of the entire area--as well as the filming locations for The Town. Not hard to waste time when you're entirely new to the area. Picked up some goods from Mike's Pastry a few blocks away.  There was only one waitress handling the floor (not counting the one behind the bar). She was polite and helpful, though clearly over worked, running around refilling water and taking orders. On to the food: We ordered the spicy seafood stew, 2 lobster rolls (hot), 3 different oysters, and 2 New England chowders. Seafood stew: A nice tangy spice along with some great seafood. A piece of whitefish(?), 2 pieces of salmon, and assorted shellfish. Not too bad. Oysters: we only ordered 3 because we came for the lobster and I never had any before. They have all the different types of shellfish listed on a sheet like a sushi bar along with descriptions of their flavor--like fine wine. I ordered one from Thatch Island with a "buttery finish". I couldn't really discern anything specific, but it was cold, refreshing, and surprisingly good. Not fishy at all. Lobster Roll: Comes prepared in 2 ways, cooked in butter, or cold with mayo. We ordered 2 hot ones because mayo would overpower the delicious lobster. It was worth the wait with it's buttery deliciousness on a toasted bun. Only thing negative was that I got some cartilage/shell in my sandwich that I had to pull out of my mouth. Not pleasant nor appetizing. -1 star.All in all, very good though expensive for the casual lunch. Great for that "one time thing".

Reviews.Author: P C.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was the hype that killed it, or the tourists walking in with their guidebooks -but while I'm glad I came, I don't plan on being a repeat customer.  Lobster Roll - you have the option of hot or cold, I tried hot with butter (for those that are health conscious, you can ask for light butter).  Can't comment on cold - but from listening to others around us, hot was way more popular.Tried two other appetizers, both forgettable and overpriced.  The guy next to me at the bar ordered the clam chowder - that looked disappointing.  This place is not kid/stroller friendly.  Its small, tiny, so don't even try it.  On the plus side, service was amiable.

Reviews.Author: K M.
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for Neptune Oyster, we decided to try it out before leaving Boston.   First of all, don't let the fact that there are no crowds waiting outside fool you.  Apparently, there's always a long wait, both for lunch and dinner.   The waitress basically takes your name and number, which leaves you free to roam around the North End until they call to let you know your table is ready.  Thank goodness the North End is filled with interesting shops and historical sites!   We waited about 1.5 hours but the wait didn't seem long because we kept ourselves busy walking around.   In fact, the little boutique right next door is a great place to kill time.  The restaurant is quite small.  In fact, it's much smaller than I imagined.  It's no wonder that it's hard to get a seat at this hot spot!   I'd also recommend to go earlier in the evening.  Apparently, during the week, they close a little early, and if you get in later, they might not be able to seat you.   The hostess was very respectful and gracious in letting customers know the seating situation.  We started out with fresh raw oysters and the Fried Ipswich Clams.   Both were delicious!   I wanted to order the Tuna Ribbons salad but it was no longer available so I had ordered the Neptune Caesar Salad.   It was a good salad but nothing special.   It's only a caesar salad after all.   My husband, on the other hand, ordered the famous Lobster Roll.  This sandwich epitomized decadence with all it's buttery goodness!   This is definitely a standout at this restaurant.What more can I say?  We enjoyed our meal, and the service was pretty good.  We will be back whenever we're in Boston again.

Reviews.Author: S K.
Reviews.Content: I've been here only once, but it might have been the best oyster bar experience I've ever had.  Was it the weather?  Cold winter temperatures make oyster eating alot more enjoyable....Anyway,  almost everything we ordered from the raw bar was perfect - fresh and perfectly shucked.  It's a small cramped space, but sit at the bar and you'll feel cozy.  Cobble streets (?), walking distance from the pier, we're in Boston now.  Well that is how I remember it.  Maybe there were no cobble streets.After the oysters, order the cioppino stew.  Ridiculously flavorful.  From what I remember, the broth is a bit thicker, spicier than the average cioppino.  Delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sarah F.
Reviews.Content: Neptune's Oyster is a must-stop in Boston.  The Lobster Roll is amazing and the Bouillabaisse is delicious.  This place serves up the best lobster roll in the city.  The only trouble is getting a table.  Go on a rainy weeknight, like we did, and you should be fine! :)

Reviews.Author: Fiona C.
Reviews.Content: I was visiting a friend in Boston who had heard great reviews about this place and read that yelpers had given this place really good reviews. We didn't know what the waiting system would be like, but we called ahead and they just told us they didn't take reservations. We found out in a pretty stressful way. The wait for seats is not the problem- there are plenty of places in the area to enjoy a drink or snack before your table is ready. They don't take reservations, but you can go early in the afternoon to put your name down. They call you when space opens up and you come back - you can't sit at the bar to enjoy a drink. Nothing was said about how long they would hold your seats for - so..then what is the difference with taking same-day reservations? Would they hold it for 10 minutes (like some places in NYC do) or until you decide to waltz in? And what is their policy if I missed the call? I missed the call but called them back and no one picked up. They finally picked up when my friend called them back a few times frantically since we have already waited over 3 hrs for this much anticipated meal. May I suggest working on your communication with customers or posting your restaurant policies somewhere? Food was ok. We picked an assortment of oysters, had the lobster roll and curry mussels. The oysters were a hit and miss. The beausoleil is delicious, the others were just meh, but the one with the popcorn taste is disgusting and so were the cherrystone clams. The lobster roll was ok - I've had better but like that this was served in meaty chunks. The curry mussels were surprisingly spiced and not too bad. Tip: go early in the afternoon (~4pm) to put your name down if you want to eat dinner at a decent time.

Reviews.Author: Taylor C.
Reviews.Content: Why didn't anyone ever tell me about Lobster rolls before this?!

Reviews.Author: Mitsuo K.
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend for anyone visiting Boston. Their oysters were amazing as well as their scallops and lobster roll.  Arguably the best ones I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: Rey B.
Reviews.Content: Oysters are so fresh you might want to slap them :-) but eat them instead mmm mmm . Went here with a friend and the selection is so awesome you have to get one of each then get a big order after sampling. So fresh and the Staff is awesome.

Reviews.Author: ariana b.
Reviews.Content: Small, quaint, crowded, good food.Get the lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Denise T.
Reviews.Content: This place has been on my lobster roll bucket list for about 3 years and it did not disappoint!! We arrived on a Sunday morning about 15 minutes before they opened and was part of the first seating group.We started w/ a glass of cava, shared a variety dozen of sweet and refreshing oysters, buttered Johnny cake w/ smoked trout tar tar (get theses!!!) and the hot buttered lobster roll. The Johnny cake was thin and crispy and moist with a drizzle of honey, perfectly balanced with the salty and creamy tar tar. Can't add anything about the lobster roll that has not been said before...loaded with lumpy and buttery lobsta in a warm, soft and lightly toasted split top bun!! The French fries were a great compliment. Those that say the are too "soft" are probably used to crispy McDonald's fries. These are made from real potatoes, inside cooked and outside crispy. Just the right thickness.On the high side for a brunch, but worth every dollar for a vacation splurge - especially with the high food quality. We sat at the bar and our server was sweet, efficient and friendly. Just the right touch.Wished we could eat here again on this trip, but we only have 3 days in town on this trip and must spread the foodie love to visit some other favorites!

Reviews.Author: Debra B.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my sister on a Wednesday night, soon after labor day weekend.  Finding parking was a little painful unless you prefer valet.  Arrived around 8pm, with an hour wait (the place is tiny so i don't blame them). They took our name and number to let us know when our table was ready with ease, and there are plenty of other restaurants, cafes, and bakery/pastery places to go to in the mean time while waiting. We ended up getting dessert at Mike's Pastry and their competitor Modern Pastry around the corner from Neptunes to save it for later. By the time we sat down at the bar in Neptunes, it was about 8:45pm. The bar staff was very friendly, and prompt us right away.  We ordered a few beers and wine. My sister and I ordered a dozen oysters that was so delicious, hearty, and fresh. For appetizers, we had Neptunes piggyback, and Hamachi Ceviche which were both absolutely amazing, and super fresh! For entrees, I had to try the famous maine lobster roll in butter that came with fries, and by far it was the BEST lobster roll I've EVER had.  My sister ordered the lobster clam bake and it was awesome! They gave her PLENTY of fresh seafood and was so filling! We ended up having to pack about half of our entrees towards the end.  Overall- Neptunes menu is quite expensive, but absolutely worth it. I don't know how many times I need to harp on the word 'Fresh' but the food here is very, very fresh! You can just tell when you have ate in many places and order the usual seafood dish. Here- it was phenomenal. When I've been hungry lately, I'm still thinking about how great it was here! I will definitely be back here again!

Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: A staple of gastronomy in Boston.If you're ever in Boston and your looking for the "it" place to eat while here check out this little restaurant called Neptune oyster house.We had the octopus minestrone, the fish & chips and the lobster roll. (lobster roll being the signature dish) it was worth the 15 minute walk from where my Hotel was. Maps are deceiving in terms of distance, if you're anywhere in the financial district take a walk and you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Author: Monique S.
Reviews.Content: Best restaurant in boston. the best lobster roll ever. my bf and i went on a weekend afternoon, waited for 1 hour, totally worth it. the waitress was really friendly, we had oysters, lobster roll and wine, great time!!!! love it

Reviews.Author: the asian jedi ..
Reviews.Content: seriously fabooooolous service. such nice people who work here. LOVE.fried clams= delish(reg battered and served with lemon and tartar sauce)clam chowder= delish(unique style, light not chunky or super creamy, a delicate take on this soup, very tasty)fresh oysters and lobster claw=crazy delish(beau soleil are best in my opinion)lobster roll=crazy delish(huge chunks on lobster sooo good, cannot go wrong with this)great wine selection. i would come back. come early.

Reviews.Author: Omar M.
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you about this place.  My cousin and I were on a roadtrip, we were coming from South Carolina.  We've heard about the lobster rolls in Boston but I didn't know what to expect, we did a quick yelp search and we found this place, Neptune Oyster. When we arrived, there was a decently long line out of the door, we came at a late lunch hour, around 2:30.  The place is very small and cozy, there's a bar all around and a few tables.  The hostess said there would be about a 45 minute wait, so we put our name down and walk around the block, we come back and after about 20 minutes we came back and there was room at the bar so we sat at the bar. We ordered some oyster to begin with, we chose a few different kinds from their menu.  Their really fresh and the sauces they give you are really good.  They give you a good description of the oyster on the menu so you know what your getting.  Then we each ordered a lobster roll, which comes on a toasted roll and just dripping with butter.  They put so much lobster in the roll its spilling out, you can't really keep all of it in the roll.  That first bite was euphoric, the tenderness and flavor of the lobster with the butter, It was one of the greatest things I have ever eaten.  It didn't let me down, it exceeded all my expectations. I tried to savor it but it was just too good.  After finishing it I really thought about ordering another one, even though they are $25, but I decided against it.  I have never had any other lobster rolls in Boston, but I can't imagine them being better than this.  It was the best 25$ I've ever spent.   Next time I'm in Boston I am definitely coming back.

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: In town for a meeting and decided to stop in for lunch. I went on a Monday for lunch. I walked in 7 minutes after they opened and the place was already 3/4 full. I was able to score a seat at the bar and ordered the Clam Chowder and the Lobster Roll warm. I have never been to a place that serves them warm before but I think that I am converted now. This is a must try just male sure to get there early.

Reviews.Author: Justin D.
Reviews.Content: Wow. really, Wow.This place is amazing.I have to say, outside of sushi, I am rarely amazed at what people do with fish.  This place really sets the bar.I went to dinner with a group of friends and there was not a single dish was not amazing.The salmon melts in your mouth, the stergin rocked the house, the marlin (served two ways) was spectacular, the trout amazing, the oysters were fresh and delicious.I save my five star ratings for the places that are "must go to if you're anywhere near there" and this place suits the bill Spectacularly.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay F.
Reviews.Content: I went to college in Boston, and currently live in MN.  I would buy a ticket to fly back for an evening with the sole purpose to eat at Neptune Oysters.  It is that good.  I had been reading reviews and heard from my fellow foodie connoisseurs about how great the place was for years and a couple weeks ago, I finally got to eat there.It was HEAVENLY.  I went with my boyfriend and two close college friends.  My significant other and I split the lobster roll, which we got hot.  Imagine the softest, sweetest, most enjoyable roll cut down the middle and filled with the freshest, most succulent and perfectly cooked chunks of lobster drizzled with creamy melted butter.   It was heaven.  Our table also split the raw seafood platter for 3.  They were the best oysters, little neck clams, mussels and fresh crab salad and fresh lobster salad I have enjoyed in my life.  This is the same platter that I am enjoying in my picture.  The shrimp cocktail that came with the platter was perfectly cooked and chilled so it crunched when you bit into it.  I'm still telling my friends in MN about it.All of this was about $25-30 per person. I walked away stuffed, and oh so satisfied.  Do your taste buds a favor.  Go to Neptune Oysters.

Reviews.Author: Connie C.
Reviews.Content: If you have a ton of time to relax and eat raw oysters forever and ever and not worry about food poisoning or how much your check will be, this is the place.The variety of oysters and the special way that they prepare the seafood in the kitchen menu is pretty exciting to sample. Having had the lobster roll on a previous visit, we decided to have a saturday afternoon snack of way too many oysters and a shrimp gazpacho, and lobster caprese salad, a perfect summer menu.  The place might have been crowded, but there is certainly no hurry amongst the bar staff, and worth seeking out.

Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: We came once on a thursday and once on a saturday both within half an hour of opening and had no problems with getting a table. You do have to share a table with others as they get busy.Clam chowder - Light  and you can taste all the ingredients unlike the clam chowder on the west coast wheres its thickWarm/cold lobster rolls - Both were great but I preferred the warm lobster rollMussels - Tasty but nothing specialOysters (wellfleet plus some other ones I can't remember the name of)  - SInce this is our first time trying oysters raw- it wasn't such a bad experience. Very fresh tasting.Sea urchin - Can't say I really like this one but it was interesting to try.

Reviews.Author: Wayne L.
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip in Boston and a friend took me hear today after work. He grew up here so he knows his seafood  in Boston.The place doesn't take reservations and has a long bar and about 8 tables in the next aisle. It's small and for a Monday evening is packed. There were 3 of us and we tried eight type of oysters. They were all all tasty and super fresh. I also had the plain lobster roll with butter. Just fantastic!!!  If in Boston I recommend a try.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany Q.
Reviews.Content: It was Sunday afternoon and there were 5 of us walking around the North End.  Waiting for the right place to pop out at us until someone mentioned Oysters and we headed right for Neptune.  Everyone relates Neptunes to Oysters and thought what the heck.  Three of the five people with us are from out of town and we hadn't been there yet.  We didn't know how small the place was until we got there.  The waitress approached me took my name and number and said it would be 45 minutes.  There are 5 tables that can be manipulated to seat however many and than seating at the bar for about 15pp.  Within 10 minutes she called that there were 5 seats at the bar.  We sat at the far end of the bar just about in the kitchen.  Being  a person that doesn't eat Oysters I tuned out the waiter as he talked about all the many types they offer and went right for what I could eat.  They have a small selection on there menu but if you eat seafood than you shouldn't have a problem. Although they do have a burger and another sandwich for those that doesn't it seafood at all. And they have a daily special, each day a sandwich or something is on special. They mainly have oysters, shrimp and crab (king, alaskan, stone) on the menu and you can order by the piece and get a few of each thing which is nice. We odered a variety of oysters (which I didnt eat), stone crab legs (2), shrimp cocktail (1 jumbo shrimp), fish tacos (sunday daily special).   Everything (except the oysters I can speak for since I didn't eat them) was awesome. The fish tacos, although were $23 dollars, comes with two tacos that are PLENTIFULLY filled and were awesome.  The fish is light fried but still has TONS of meat and flavor.  The stone crab was tasty and the shrimp was tasty and not fishy.  From what I'm told by everyone else the oysters were awesome!  They don't serve them any other way than RAW.  That was the only disappointment since my boyfriend was hoping to have steamed oysters and they don't serve them that way.

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down my favorite restaurant in all of Boston.  This is a tiny oyster bar, with a very intimate feel.  Their seafood is super fresh, though I come for the raw oysters.  They are just divine.  If you are in Boston and love seafood, go.  Your tastebuds will thank you.But be forewarned: they don't take reservations, and sometimes the wait can get long if you go at peak dining times.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan K.
Reviews.Content: If you don't like these oysters you will never become a fan. Best oysters you'll ever eat.Pros: The oysters (the high salty ones are REALLY salty so be careful), lobster roll, service. TV showing sports.Cons: 90 minute wait and it got more crowded. Get there early to put your name down.

Reviews.Author: Mary H.
Reviews.Content: After reading everyone else's review, I gotta say that I am definitely trying the lobster roll next time I am at Neptune Oyster.  However, the Neptune Burger and Buttermilk Johnnycakes that I did order was very good. In fact, the Buttermilk Johnnycakes was truly divine. My friend and I shared this hot little treat, which consists of a fried corn pancake with honey butter, smoked trout tartare, creme fraiche and little pearl caviar. We split the whole thing, gobbled it up, and had there not been a crowd of people in there with us, I'm sure I would have licked the plate. Yes, it is that good. The Neptune Burger was also good. It is a cheddar cheeseburger with fried oysters, garlic mayo, and relish. I wish that it had more than 3 small fried oysters. I love them suckers. But, alas, it didn't. We split the burger and appetizer, and then headed off to Bova's. A good lunch indeed.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl M.
Reviews.Content: This is a tiny little restaurant with spectacular food in a popular neighborhood that doesn't take reservations. Luckily they have a great policy of taking your phone number and calling you when your table is ready, so you can walk around and kill time while you are waiting. Brillant!  In the minute's time it took us to get inside when they had our spot available I witnessed 2 customers getting all worked up over the table situation. People really seem to be passionate about getting in there, that is always a great sign.The food was spectacular. I was a little bummed to find they only served champagne and wine, I am not a huge fan of either. We did get a nice bottle of wine which was almost half  the bill. That was the only negative. The fish/shellfish was all very fresh and delicious!

Reviews.Author: Abdulrahman B.
Reviews.Content: Finally I went there with my friend on a Sunday night, Columbus day weekend. We waited for more than an hour coz it was full! Usually, restaurants that are full and have long waiting times are good signs to rest assure that you will enjoy the great food you are going to have and this is definitely one of them.You will see all the tempting dishes of fresh seafood flying and landing on tables next to you which makes you too eager to wait for yours. We had the Buttermilk Johnnycake and shrimp cocktail for an appetizer and shared two main dishes which is the hot lobster roll and north end cioppinno. The least I can say is seafood at its best and what makes you wantta go there again and again is their daily specials! Would love to try the Lobster Spaghettini and Fish Tacos in the future. Great place to go when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Author: Jen F.
Reviews.Content: I had been meaning to go to Neptune Oyster for about two years now. Its location--the North End--had been in large part the reason for this delay.Finally, I made it! And it was everything everyone says it is. Holy hot lobster roll!!! Who would have thought that something so simple could be this ridiculously good. I mean, seriously, it's like a first bite of heaven. It's incredible, that's all I can say. Perfectly toasted bun, tons of lobster meat, and hot butter....yeah. Everything else we had was just as good--the tuna crostini is fantastic!!! Also, they have a great wine list. The only issue is that it's a small place, with a long wait, and about half of the seats are at the bar. If you don't mind any of this, then the Neptune Oyster is easily one of the best restaurants in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Riz I.
Reviews.Content: Katama bay had a nice buttery flavor and Peter point oyster was small n juicy The menu is not too varied and easy to choose. I had the grilled Bronzini ( Mediterrean Seabass) and it was good blend of olives and tomatoes topped with a nice sauce. On the flip side it comes with bones so I could see some people having problem eating that. Personally I devoured it Lol Service can definately be improved upon.  Overall a good place esp for oyster and Lobster rolls.

Reviews.Author: Ben R.
Reviews.Content: Great spot for a high quality version of classic boston food.Even though some might call it "lame and stupid and thoughtless" to order a lobster roll at an upscale restaurant, the one here is a great education in how good lobster rolls can be.  Turns out they can be seriously delicious.Awesome oysters, awesome lobster-based caprese salad.  Awesome experience.Only drawbacks are the lack of reservations, which makes this place a bit hard to regular.  Also prices are a bit steep.If you've got some friends from out of town visiting, a little extra cash, and some time to wander the faneuil area after you put in your name, then definitely check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Catherine L.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places I don't know if I should write about because I don't want others to know the secret.  But seeing that the secret is already out.. what the hell :pOne of my favorite places to get raw oysters!  You're presented which a "fill-in" menu when you sit, much like those you get at sushi restaurants.  I love how the fill-in menu has the list of offerings from the raw bar, with good descriptions on what to expect for a taste.  I think I'm in love with the Kumamoto oysters.  They also give you a regular menu, which has plenty of great offerings.  The fried clams is especially good here.  They don't overbatter and just let the freshness and taste of the clams shine.  The clams almost seem delicate.  The octopus salad is good too.  I love grilled octopus.  We also had the lobster roll.  They don't skimp on lobster, that's for sure. But taste-wise, it didn't have as much of a wow factor as the other dishes.  This is a really popular place with locals and tourists.  Be prepared for a wait.  And come early!  We saw people being turned away at 8:30 to even put their name on the list because the wait was already too long.

Reviews.Author: Judy T.
Reviews.Content: WORTH THE WAIT! At first I thought bc we were a party of 8 we were told 1 1/2 hr wait as a joke to get us to leave..no they werent kidding. we went to a nearby park around the corner and enjoyed the fountain with the kids. They'll call you when your table is ready, so go put your name and number in an hr before you really want to eat so youre nice and ready when your table is. The place is small and very casual but their food is to die for. It's some of the best oysters and clams I've ever had and being that its Boston, we HAD to have seafood during our trip. Now, the best for last...the lobster roll was worth every penny. nothing but pure lobster on a nice toasted roll with your choice hot wth butter or cold w.mayo. My suggestion. hot with butter all the way. You won't regret it, trusttt mee!! enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Chelsea V.
Reviews.Content: So delicious we went twice in the week we were here. Loved the variety of oysters to choose from. Had the buttermilk johnny cake the second time around, which was as delicious as the lobster roll. The wait is super long - we just got a beer at a pub just down the street, which meant we were in a wonderful mood by the time we sat down to eat. I recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Rimma A.
Reviews.Content: The BEST lobster roll I've ever had in my life!!We stumbled upon this place after Barking Crab cancelled our reservation, and thank goodness we did!We tried some oysters from the raw menu and were floored by their freshness and taste. These oysters rivaled the ones we had at Wellfleet Oyster Fest, and that's saying a lot! The steamers were spot on, and like I mentioned earlier, the lobster roll is to DIE for. You can't beat huge, heaping chunks of fresh, warm lobster in a buttered roll. Just writing this makes my mouth water again!!The only downside? This place is tiny and there is always a bit of a wait-- so worth it, though.

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: I am always skeptical when there is enormous hype around a restaurant but am happy to say that Neptune Oyster met expectations. Yes, the place is tiny and they don't take reservations but it's worth the wait. The North End is quaint in general and the cozy ambiance is perfect. We started with the Steamed Wellfleet Littlenecks. For entrees we had the Cioppino with lobster and Shrimp & Grits (new to the menu). All of it was excellent and so fresh. No oyster but I'm sure they are delicious as well. Great experience!

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: Very fresh seafood (oysters were very good). The lobster roll was pretty good (soft and sweet). Fries had a nice sweet taste to it as well. The clam chowder was good but had clam shell bits in it. Overall, fairly pricey but a good place to check out while in Boston.Service a little rushed but our waitress did pretty well for having to deal with so many tables at once. It was also pretty cramped, and people had to share tables often (if that bothers you). It's pretty close to the Haymarket stop though :)

Reviews.Author: Jon S.
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add about this fabulous restaurant.  Just don't make the mistake I made the first time I went here and order the cold over the hot lobster roll.  My go to dish is the North End Cioppino.  I like the slight kick to the broth and the freshness and variety of the seafood.  I do wish they gave you some bread to mop up the broth but the rice is a nice substitute.   Just go, try to find a spot, and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Alison W.
Reviews.Content: Went there during the mid-afternoon on a Tuesday, and my friend and I were able to get seats at the bartop immediately. We decided to split 3 items since we wanted to try them all. The clam chowder was just ok. It was pretty bland and could have used some kind of spices or flavoring. The Buttermilk Johnnycakes were fantastic! This was by far the best dish we had! We had the hot lobster roll too, although I wasn't blown away. The lobster meat was in nice juicy delicious chunks, but the roll was so simple that it left me wondering what everyone was raving about.

Reviews.Author: Christie L.
Reviews.Content: We stopped by to get lunch on a Friday around 1:30pm. They told us it would be about 40 min for a seat and took our number. We got a drink across the street and, right on schedule, they called us with seats for the bar. We each ordered a hot lobster roll and some oysters. The lobster roll was amazing, overflowing with huge chunks of buttery lobster. The oyster bar is great for those who aren't sure if they will like oysters - they have a list with great descriptions of each type of oyster so you know what you'll be getting. Definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Haley B.
Reviews.Content: I posted this on Trip Advisor too, sorry if you're seeing it twice...Seriously, the hot lobster roll with butter will change your life.  My husband and I were making yum noises as we ate.  A drop of butter ran down my hand.  The bread was perfect, big chunks of lobster.  It simply is a MUST HAVE.Oysters were great too - I especially like Island Creek.  I really appreciated how they broke down what each kind tasted like, how salty it was, etc.  Fries that came with the lobster roll were yummy too.  We cleaned our plates but honestly, all I can remember is how amazing the lobster roll was.The wait can be long (ours was just under an hour and a half to sit at the bar on a Sunday at around 6:30), BUT they take your name and phone number and call you when your table is ready.  That way, instead of sitting around in a waiting room, you can go explore the North End or do as we did and relax in a nearby hookah/cigar lounge for a bit.I suggested the hot lobster roll to a relative traveling to Boston and they agreed that it was every bit as wonderful as I'd described.  If we ever return to Boston, which I sure hope we do, we will definitely make a stop, or maybe two, here.

Reviews.Author: Ryan C.
Reviews.Content: Decent lobster roll, but the fries were pretty boring. The fact that it was only a few degrees cooler inside but just as humid was disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Jill G.
Reviews.Content: Awesome, fresh seafood in the North End. Average prices, average atmosphere. Pretty good service.

Reviews.Author: Lu C.
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 pound lobster there, as well as 3 kinds of Oyster. They are all very tasty! But because it's a very small restaurant and many people would go there, it's better to go there between 4pm-5pm.

Reviews.Author: Eric F.
Reviews.Content: You go to Neptune's for the food not the service . Don't  expect 5 star service, but expect the quality of the food to be 5 star . This place is small and the wait can take 1 - 2 hours, but well worth it .. Good luck and enjoy

Reviews.Author: Sabrina O.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place has fantastic food! Although its a bit of a splurge. Eg. I came on a Monday night where the special was lobster spaghettini...for $38!I had the Cioppini, which was chock full of seafood, in a wonderfully spicy broth. The staff is harried (it's very busy, all the time) but are friendly and seem to do their best. I had no trouble with my order, but the couple beside me had gotten there just before me and hadn't even received their entree by the time I had ordered, eaten and left. Overall, a great place to splurge.

Reviews.Author: Alisa S.
Reviews.Content: Opens at 11:30am on Saturday. We got there at around 11:20 and there was line already. Luckily we got a seat! From the yelp reviews, I knew what I wanted already: Hot Lobster Roll & Neptune Burger. Their was enough lobster on the roll for the two of us to share. We shared the burger, too. It was really juicy and flavorful.  Boyfriend also had the oysters and tried the Wellfleet, Katama Bay, and Kumamoto. His favorite oyster was the Wellfleet. We liked how there were detailed descriptions of all the different oysters.

Reviews.Author: Nilo K.
Reviews.Content: Wow. Is all I can say. My husband and I just enjoyed a variety of east coast oysters and shared a hot lobster roll sandwhich. The lobster was moist and the roll was light and sweet.   The service and the food was truly fantastic. A definite keeper. I will come back next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Jay P.
Reviews.Content: Just a complete utter fabuloucity of all that is bivalve good.Got there around 6 on a Saturday night.  The place was packed.  Someone came up immediately and took down my number.  We walked around for a bit in the North End, and was called half an hour later when our table was ready.  We weren't too hungry when we got there, but after the first slurp of the freshest oysters in Boston, we were hooked.  Started off with the Triton Plateau, which contained a good assortment of clams, one type of oysters, shrimps, a great crab salad and lobster salad.Vinny, our waiter and oyster master, helped us pick the oysters and wine.  After the Triton an half dozen of oysters, we wanted to order more, but Vinny was a good man, telling us to stick with just one entree - the lobster roll.  Having driven three hours to Maine to get to Red Eat's, we can be picky about lobsters, and didn't think anyone in Boston could come close, until now...Great meal, great food, great service...  Just go.

Reviews.Author: kenley s.
Reviews.Content: ...it's been 4 days and I'm still thinking about the heads on the shrimp in my cioppino that I sucked on. I'm Chinese I've sucked on a LOT of shrimp heads in my life and these were SO intensely flavourful...quite possibly the best I've ever had!...I'm new to New England, so not a clam expert, but I am a foodie/chowhound and I know when something has been fried properly...the Ipswich Clams were PERFECTLY fried...not greasy or heavy at all, I would've been happy just eating a few plates of those for dinner...confident that my stomach would be fine with it.oysters were great of course, and the waitress had good suggestions for our table (some beginner oyster eaters)...the one knock was the sardines on flatbread special...which was a bit meh (flatbread got soggy, was also a little steep for what we got)---but I happen to be the master of sardines on flatbread ('been perfecting it on a semi weekly basis for years...so I'll let it slide :))

Reviews.Author: Whitney P.
Reviews.Content: BY FAR, the best lobster roll around.  Get it hot.  Great little location and ambiance.  Love the marble counter tops, the red leather banquets and white tiling.  As an oyster novice, I love that the oyster menu describes exactly how each tastes.  Great date spot.  A bit tougher for groups.  They don't take reservations.  I've had most luck when I've gone in looking for just 2 spots at the bar vs trying to get a table with a group.  Can get packed, but definitely worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Sasha T.
