Reviews.Content: Went here w/ my bestest for her 27th bday because we both love oysters and both heard that the warm lobster roll was the best.  Walking in, the place was alive and adorable.  We lucked out and got the last available table (next to some lively, drunk ppl from Cali).  Unfortunately the table was right next to the door and it was freezing and I kept having to move my chair for people to get around.  I'm not one to complain though - we did get seated reat away and some people waited a LONG time.  On to the food:We started w/ a few different kinds of Oysters and some prosecco...the oysters were all delicious, and i liked the fact that they provide descriptions.  We then tried the scallop crudo which had an orange, mint, and feta dressing...it was good, not amazing...but the mint really added something.  For dinner we tried the hot lobster roll and the bowl of littlenecks in a garlic, white wine sauce.  The lobster roll was as good as everyone said...buttery, warm, melt in your mouth, large pieces of lobster, good fries.  It was gone very fast.  The littlenecks were large and tasty.  Lots of garlic which is always good.  As others mentioned, service was a bit slow and it was packed...but we weren't in any rush and in fact appreciated taking our time and not feeling like they wanted us out the door for the next couple.  Pricey, yes...but for four glasses of wine (2 prosecco, 2 nero d'avolos), oysters, crudo, amazing lobster roll, and littlenecks, all of which were extremely tasty, I don't think $125 w/ tip is outrageous.

Reviews.Author: Susan E.
Reviews.Content: Another solid lunch at Neptune this past weekend.  We got the fried clams, handcut fries, I had a bowl of the clam chowder (not a traditional clam chowder but I really like it).  This time I got the hot lobster roll.  I just ate the lobster and ignored the roll....man it was good.  Totally worth the $ - you end up with as much lobster as you could pick out of a 1 1/2 lb without the work and it tasted great!We got the last 2 seats at the bar looking out the window which was nice.  All the staff are good except the girl shucking the oysters, etc.  Some people tried to ask her questions when they came in and she totally ignored them.  Oh well.

Reviews.Author: Matt P.
Reviews.Content: I won't spend an age on this - since I'm just adding to the pile - but this place was great. The only thing I'll say against it is that it's quite busy, and kind of loud (even on a Wednesday night).My date and I started out with a plate of oysters and a lovely bottle of white wine our server recommended to us. The raw bar menu came complete with descriptions of the various sorts, which was pretty helpful for us neophytes. I can't really speak to the oysters in detail, but I certainly enjoyed them, as did my date (who knows more about seafood than I, I'll admit).We followed those up with a salad served with white anchovies and fried artichoke hearts. This was delicious. I can only wish there had been more of it. Especially recommended if you've never had fresh anchovies.Then we had a plate of steamed littlenecks, which were delicious. I realized when eating them that other restaurants tend to cover up the taste of the shellfish with heavy sauces, not this place.Finally, I ordered a hot lobster roll with butter. Seconds after my first bite I could feel my whole body flooded with endorphins. It was beyond good - it was an experience in the psychopharmalogical effects of deliciousness.If you can get in, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Author: Esther Y.
Reviews.Content: I avidly use yelp.com to look for restaurants and find awesome places to eat but i have only posted a review once besides this one... i was inclined to post a review of neptune oyster because it was such an excellent experience. we read about the long wait for this restaurant so we went around 2:30 and got seated almost immediately.   after my experience i would definitely wait an hour easily to eat here... what i ordered:OYSTERS - just tried a few kinds of oysters... the descriptions of all the different kinds of oysters were there so it was very helpful for someone like me who doesn't really know the difference of what.CLAM CHOWDER - great!  if you ask for a some bread it goes excellent with the soup.P.E.I. MUSSELS - aMMMMMAAZZing.  amazing sauceNEPTUNE BLUE CRAB SALAD - the crab is mixed with the avocado and i'm not the biggest fan of avocado but it was really a delicious combination.GRILLED MAINE LOBSTER - 2 lbs of plain grilled lobster served with asparagus, mushrooms and some other vegetables.  it sounds simple but the way the vegetables were cooked and served went soooooo well with the lobster.  (!! you should ask what the market price of the lobster is... it was $65.00 just for the lobster which seemed kinda pricey~)had a glass of riesling along with the meal.and i had asked for some CORNBREAD... it was listed as part of another dish but i asked if i could have some and it wasn't a problem at all.  our server was soooo helpful and amazing and gave a glass of red wine at the end of our meal as well as well as the chef coming out and chatting with us for a bit. amazing food, service and atmosphere.  awesome experience. enjoy~

Reviews.Author: Tatum V.
Reviews.Content: Brought my aunt and uncle from Tx here - they were very impressed with the selection of oysters, the size of the shrimp cocktail, and the lobster rolls... OH MY~!Amongst the 4 of us, 3 opted for the warm lobster roll with butter while one opted for the cold lobster roll with mayo.  General consensus - the warm was better, but both were extraordinary!Wonderful wine selection, we paired our oyster medly with a nice crisp White Burgundy - divine!Worth the wait, try for a seat at the bar!

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: While on vaction in Boston, I went with my sister and mom. We wanted some oysters and did not want to go to the Union toursist trap so found Neptune and we got really lucky.If you go here, make sure you love seafood, because that literally is all they have. My sister is a vegan so they specially made her a side salad with no fish while we ate oysters. Anyway, the oysters were great. Being from the midwest, I really dont know how to order oysters but the bar tender was really nice and able to help use. She picked out a good range and allowed us to taste different types. I learned that I definitally like the east coast and higher salt version.Since we did not eat a full meal and the Lobster roll was way to expensive to just try, I cant give a perfect rating. However, I would definitally recommend people going just for a drink and the raw bar!

Reviews.Author: Dave M.
Reviews.Content: So after never having oysters before, I can't really offer any sort of informed review compared to other restaurants, but from what I had was great.  We put our name on the list and went for a walk around the neighborhood, and half an hour later we were seated at the bar next to the door.  Not ideal, but you take what you can get in a place that cramped.We ordered 8 oysters from around the country, and found that the descriptions listed on the menu were very accurate.  I loved the less-salty ones, but I really can't complain considering I ate them all and would have ordered more if we didn't decide to move onto entrees.  Seared tuna salad and a octopus appetizer were what we chose and shared equally.  Very good tuna, and the octopus mixture was delicious.Overall, a good experience and next time I've got an hour to kill in the north end, I'll think about putting my name on that list and getting a few more oysters.

Reviews.Author: Jia F.
Reviews.Content: I went there with the intention to eat the often talked about new england oysters. The oysters were absolutely delicious and staff was very good with their recommendations. The high salt ones from MA were to die for. There really is no need for their sauces when the oysters are so divine. They also have a fresh squeezed lemonade which you can watch being made if you sit at the bar. It helps clear the palette between oysters. The only downside is the wait but if you go with two people and sit at the bar, its not nearly as bad.

Reviews.Author: Heather G.
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing.  Been twice in the past month and cannot wait to go back.  Here's what we had:Oysters- can't be beat.  Comes with handy descriptions so you know exactly what to expect.Lobster roll- good, but would've liked to have a variety of lobster meat, not just the tips of the tail...  should have claw meat for that price.  But the meat was so perfectly cooked...Steamers- great, just like I like 'em.Fried Clams- easily the best I've ever had.  I will probably have to get these every time I go back.Blue Crab Salad- fresh and delicious.  Perfect balance of avocado and ginger.

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Another great dining experience.The warm lobster roll tastes better than the cold one. I think the warm butter enhances the lobster flavor. Also, the blue crab cocktail has a lot of flavor.

Reviews.Author: Ryan H.
Reviews.Content: The place is small. The wait is long. The food is worth it. This place has the best lobster roll I have ever had. I've tried this place twice and the warm lobster roll just gets better and better. Buttery and no work to get the meat out of the shell!!! Perfection!!! Not only do they have a great lobster roll. The oysters are great as well. With a large selection to choose from. You can't go wrong when it comes to Neptune Oyster!Come early and expect a wait

Reviews.Author: Jess H.
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE BEST SEAFOOD MEAL I'VE EVER EATEN.We traveled to Boston for a work trip and serveral people told us to try Neptune. We will be returning everytime we go to Boston. We had several different oysters from the oyster bar and crab claws. For our entrees my husband had the Northend Cioppino with Maine Lobster and I had the hot butter Lobster Roll. Both were perfectly cooked with an abundance of seafood that made our tastebuds sing. We left happy as clams! If you are in Boston EAT HERE! Well, well worth the price!  (And don't bring small kids, it is communal dining and there are no high chairs - our hyper toddler was the only drawback to our meal.)

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best meal I've had in Boston. Oysters were so fresh you'd think they had been in the ocean that morning. Delicious mussels (infinitely better than Legal Sea Foods or Anthem), nice grilled bread to accompany. I had the lobster spaghettini after nearly being talked into the swordfish by a neighboring table, but you can get swordfish any night.It is pricey, but I don't anticipate going often (regrettably). It is cozy, but we were there on a frigid Monday so it wasn't too crowded; I was bumping elbows with said neighbor but they got their bill as we sat down. Service was outstanding -- attentive without being overbearing, dutiful without being patronizing.

Reviews.Author: Kris N.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my favorite restaurant of all time!I see lots of raves about the lobster roll, and I concur.But it is the raw bar, the crudo and the small creative plates that I adore, and I believe make Neptune Oyster truly unique.  The special crudo of the day always blows me away.  Octopus cocktail is fantastic (as well as the more common shrimp, crab, and lobster varieties).  Today I tried the "Neptune on Piggyback" appetizer: fried oysters on braised pork topped with salad.  Fantastic.I often find myself, like today, taking a long, slow, (expensive, it adds up fast!) grazing through the delights of the sea with a string of small courses.I can say that after dozens of visits over the years, I've never had a bad plate or ever left disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Tim Z.
Reviews.Content: There is not much that needs to be said about Neptunes. They have a menu as simple as In and Out Burgers in Southern California.  Main features, are oysters, some other fishes that I forget, and THE LOBSTER ROLL.  I came in for the main attraction.  After hearing about the lobster rolls from my coworkers who have been out to Boston on numerous occasions, and about how this place is usually super packed, I had to find out what the hub bub was all about.We came in here on a Wednesday around 11:30 right when their doors were open, and it filled to half full in 10 minutes.  The lobster rolls were a thing of beauty.  Hot buttery lobster fully deshelled for you on a warm bun with seasoned fries on the side.  It was simplicity at it's finest.  If it was just later on at night, I would have loved to try one of their numerous glasses of wine.

Reviews.Author: Whiskey C.
Reviews.Content: I'm all about service when I dine out.  If it wasn't important to me, I'd be cooking for myself. With that said, I really did quite enjoy the food.  I don't love sitting in the lap of a stranger, as it is pretty cramped in there. But it's worth the experience.  I will go back so I can give it another try and update my rating.

Reviews.Author: Diane M. F.
Reviews.Content: Always off the chart!The night prior to the Nantucket Wine Festival we embarked on a visit to Neptune Oyster....I and an array of wine connoisseurs from several Napa Vineyards.  I assured them that the 1.5 hour wait was well worth it.  And the tour of the North End began.  Then the call came and we were on our way back to Neptune.  The corner table was ready and waiting upon our arrival.  We started with an array of 4 dozen oysters with an impeccable mignonette accompanied by a bottle of white, a bottle of red and a couple bottles of bubbles (champagne) of course.  These wine enthusiasts had no problem finding top notch wines and bubbles on the Neptune menu (Thank God).  On to dinner....  It was to be a Lobster Roll night at our table....hot buttered and the New England traditional, all accompanied by the most perfect fries in the city!  Let's just say not a scrap was left for the dumpster scavengers.

Reviews.Author: Aubrey T.
Reviews.Content: After living across the street from Neptune for a year and giving up on multiple 2+ hour waits, I finally made it to this wonderful restaurant.  (I had also been turned off in the past by an unfriendly who first ignored  and then was quite rude to my friendly midwestern mom while she were trying to get our name on the list.)  This time I was able to put my name on the list at 5:30 on a quiet Thursday, and we were called by 6.I did not try the famous lobster roll, but see any other review if you are interested in this menu item.  I can personally assure you that it is worth trying other items on the menu as well.  My boyfriend and I sat at the end of the bar and enjoyed chatting with the attentive bartender. There was a fun lively atmosphere at the bar, and I would request to sit there again if I only a party of two.  We started with a couple of Cisco brews and oysters - all six varieties we tried were delicious.  I also liked the bowl of oyster crackers that accompanied them.  Instead of the famous lobster roll we split a couple of appetizers: mussels and tuna.  The mussels were delicious, and the peanut curry preparation was quite unique.  Our bartender gave us a couple pieces of warm bread, which they should give everyone (if not, ask for it), to soak up a little more of the broth.The tuna appetizer (different than the one on the website menu) was AMAZING.  It was only one piece of bruschetta, topped with a cilantro/avocado spread and mounded with delicious marble size pieces of tuna.  $17 for such a small portion would have seemed too high if this hadn't been one of the best bites I've ever had.Overall the dozen oysters, 2 apps, and 4 beers was $100 before gratuity.  Pretty steep, especially as we realized on our way out that we definitely could have made room for a famous lobster rolls or the seared scallops.  However, the meal was completely worth the price tag.  Next time, I'd probably split oysters or mussels to start and order full entrees instead of apps.For fantastic seafood, try Neptune on a weeknight when you can get your name on the list early.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if the lobster roll would be worth the price, but it was worth every penny. Before going there, I compared lobster rolls in the neighboring area, but even by description, Neptune Oyster seemed so much better in quality and taste.It was $25 for a lobster roll and fries. Normally I would expect them to skimp on lobster, but they definitely didn't. We were stuffed with a little to spare. The lobster roll was a butter roll stuffed with lobster chunks and butter. It was served with a side of fresh french fries. My only complaint was the service. The server was not friendly and did not seem interested in helping us. For a small restaurant, the staff didn't seem too happy or welcoming. I don't even remember them greeting us as we came in.

Reviews.Author: Julie B.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped here for lunch shortly after they opened for the day. It's what I would recommend doing so you beat the crowd and avoid the wait.We started with the steamed little necks which were some of the best we've ever had. Next, we moved onto the warm butter lobster roll. We each had our own and 2 weeks later I'm still thinking about it. It was one of the best things we've ever eaten. The meat was overflowing from the roll so much that I barely touched the fries it came with. They also had a nice selection of beers. We can't wait to go back the next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Candice P.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a great place if you are going with no more than 4 people. The place itself is very small and usually crowded so big groups should not attempt to go here. The small size is literally the only downside to this restaurant because the food is great and the waitstaff is very friendly. The Yellowfin Tuna Appetizer was my favorite dish. Although it is very small (probably would only work to split between two people at the most), every bite was great. The tuna was perfect and the avocado spread on the baguette was an interesting yet delicious combination. I went during lunch so I only had the clam chowder for my main dish even though it is listed as an appetizer. Normally I like thicker,creamier chowder but the version I had at Neptune was still really good. It was a lot lighter than what you would usually expect to see from chowder and also seemed fresher. It was the perfect amount for lunch. The prices are pretty steep for the portions you get but in my opinion it is completely worth it. The food is fresh and delicious and is perfect for any lunch or dinner meal.

Reviews.Author: Daisy L.
Reviews.Content: Buttery lobster roll heaven. I had a bit of shell in mine, but it's okay. Very tight seating, no privacy, and there's usually a wait. But they'll call you on your phone, so you can walk around the area.

Reviews.Author: Megan H.
Reviews.Content: Being new to the area, we relied on the reviews of Yelp to lead us somewhere for my birthday lunch on Christmas Eve. We headed to Neptune around 3pm and scored two seats at the bar right away. The place is Small! But as small as it is there is a lot of character to it. It was packed the whole time we were there. We ordered the Triton Plateau to share for our appetizer which was silly as it could have been a whole meal. It had oysters, huge shrimp, crab salad, lobster salad and mussels I believe. It was great- Yum! We ordered Clam Chowder and the popular Hot Lobster Roll to finish out our meal. I didn't even taste the chowder because I ate as much of the Lobster Roll as I could. For the price, it was a great size with lots of hot, buttery lobster! The best I have had yet! I love french fries and it came with some but I was too full to even have one. All in all I really enjoyed our lunch here and have plans to come back again when the weather warms up! :)

Reviews.Author: Ben M.
Reviews.Content: Righteous. Go here now.What are you waiting for?

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: Pretty much everything here was really good..Of course the hot lobster roll took the cake.. Was a welcome change walking in from the freezing outdoors! The restaurant is very cramped but in a warm homey way.Service was top notch - server selected very good assortment of oysters.Great for 4 or less!

Reviews.Author: Travis D.
Reviews.Content: Not much new to add, except that I was impressed that they will call your cell when your table is ready. It's nice to go explore the North End and not have to worry about hearing your name called.The lobster roll and the oysters were delicious... I just wasn't enamored with the clam chowder. It definitely tasted like it was made with fresh ingredients and was lighter than your typical chowder... it just needed more clams! Alot more.The beer selection from tap is pretty limited, but they have some nice bottles (Allagash White goes nicely with a plate of oysters!)

Reviews.Author: Nancy W.
Reviews.Content: Oysters were excellent, clam chowder was more "meh". The soup, because it's "made to order", did take a little longer than I would expect to come out, and the style is really thin, rather than a thick, chunk soup.I'm a little hesitant to go back, only because I KNOW that I can get just as good oysters for cheaper (and a better experience with better service) elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Jason G.
Reviews.Content: Finding this place on a recent business trip, thanks to Yelp, was a revelation ... and I say this as a native New Englander! After six varieties of local oysters, I had the "Neptunes on Piggyback" dish, which was a really interesting combo of textures and flavors ... Something I haven't seen noted in other reviews, is that they offer either the cold lobster salad roll ... OR ... the hot version, which has the lobster meat tossed in drawn butter! I finished my meal with the hot, and WOW ... SO ... GOOD! Ask for a side salad instead on the fries, if you want ... the dressing was perfect.The wine list and beer selection was also interesting, and the Ligurian white I tried the other night was a nice compliment to their food.Next time I'm there I plan to try their burger, because it features fried oysters!GO!

Reviews.Author: Alexis C.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite restaurant in Boston. The day I find out I'm leaving Boston, I'm going to eat here exclusively until I move away. I'm that devoted. (I guess the first thing I'll have to do after I move is get my cholesterol checked. Oh well. Some sacrifices are worth it.)I've only had their hot buttered lobster roll and stuff from their raw bar, but that's fine by me and I have no plans to try anything else. The lobster roll is $25, which seems like a lot, but just skip eating out until you save up $25 and then go with a clear conscience (what is that, like three mediocre lunches?) and a hungry stomach.I don't think this place is overrated unless you don't like seafood, in which case you should not come here because you will be sad. I went once at 4 pm, which I figured was a great time to get a minimal line because it's too late for a late lunch and it's too early for dinner. I still had a 2.5 hour wait, which was fully worth it. I also went once before it opened and stood in the line with all the other die hards. Unfortunately, I was one of the first people who couldn't fit into their establishment, so the wait was an hour. Still worth it.The ambience is zilch, and you have to sit very close to other people. The restaurant employees don't really care about service that much (not that they're rude) because they know there's a ton of people waiting to sit in your seat. The second you're done eating, someone shows up to take your plate away, and then you get a stream of polite hints that you should clear out stat. But the food is divine. Don't go if you're on a tight schedule because it just won't work with the wait times.

Reviews.Author: Jessica V.
Reviews.Content: Over the years, my husband and I have been to nearly every reputable restaurant in Boston. From l'Espalier to Ana's Taqueria, we'll go anywhere for good grub. We were frequenting Neptune before it won the awards and made all the tourist guides. This is the best restaurant in the city in terms of food alone. Seafood in the North End, oh yes.Start off by getting your name in early - and prepare to grab a drink at Goody's or another nearby bar while you wait for the staff to call. Yes, it's crowded bordering on frenzied. Take a seat at the bar if it's a choice between that or no Neptune. The staff is always sweating. Running. Crazed. Just plain hardworking. Tip them well. They deserve it. For the love of all things holy don't get the Lobster Roll. Although it's quite good, to order it is like asking Van Gogh to draw you a Mickey Mouse. You'll be missing out on some serious culinary genius.My advice in terms of food: Start off with oysters from the west coast (Kumamoto etc), then get multiple apps, try the specials and ask for off-menu items and recommendations. Then waddle home like the gluttonous mess that you are and fall asleep dreaming of the next time....

Reviews.Author: Jim M.
Reviews.Content: This place is 5 stars all the way. Ordered oysters ala carte - I recommend ordering the oysters that are medium or low salt. The pilsner they had on draft was great. The prices were very fair.

Reviews.Author: Amin S.
Reviews.Content: I had some oysters, the cioppino and the lobster salad and they were all incredible. The portions are also quite large - it looked liked the salad has over half a lobster!

Reviews.Author: Dorothy D.
Reviews.Content: The food is to die for. If I ever came back to Boston I would come here again. I came with my friend and we were able to get full off of a dozen oysters, the buttermilk johnnycake and hot lobster roll. It's a bit pricey but definitely worth the money. The oysters were fresh and delicious. My favorite between the two dishes was the hot lobster roll. It was overflowing with buttery lobster and the roll was soft enough for me to bite through the bread. The slight downfall of this place is the limited seating. However, you can always put in your name and phone number and wait for them to call you while you're out exploring the area.

Reviews.Author: Bryan V.
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for only a short time (10 hrs), but I decided based on the reviews that I needed to try Neptune. As typical, there was a wait - arrived around noon on a Friday and had about 2 hr wait. The cool thing is that they take your number and call when your seat will be available in 10 min, so you can continue to explore around the north end as you wait. The estimated and actual wait time agreed within 15 min. I had oysters and scallops crudo as this is great spot for raw. The variety of oysters was excellent and the server provided insight into the selections. The scallops were excellent with citrus and papaya.

Reviews.Author: Rich J.
Reviews.Content: I can see why this place is so popular. By the way, what's with all the ridiculously small eateries in Boston? Does anyone want to run a  restaurant with more than 4 tables and a bar? I knew this place was insanely popular so I decided to go late lunch/early dinner..4ish in the afternoon on a friday right after we arrived in Boston and checked into our hotel. It worked out well as we snagged the last two seats at the bar. We got the Triton seafood platter ( oysters,clams, mussels, shrimp, lobster meat and crab meat) and two orders of fried clams. I washed all that down with a couple of Allagash White beers. Perfection.

Reviews.Author: Danielle M.
Reviews.Content: This was our first meal once we arrived in Boston, and probably the best! We had to wait an hour to get seated, but definitely worth the wait.The food: Oysters, lobster roll were extremely fresh and delicious. The service: Very friendly and helpful waitress. The cost: Was a little pricey (most good restaurants are in Boston), but worth every penny!

Reviews.Author: Chuck R.
Reviews.Content: Johnny Cake.....ORDER IT!If you like oysters get at least 3 different kinds and compare. The taste difference alone is an unbelievable experience. Nothing like New Orleans oysters. The Day Boat Scallop simply melts in your mouth.  And of course, the Lobster Roll is wonderful. Get there early and bring a credit card.

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: Must Must stop if you are ever in the area! Lobster rolls are a plenty in Boston. Even Legal Seafood serves a legit one but Neptune Oyster takes it to the next level. The Lobster is soooo succulent/fresh/melts in your mouth. I got the cold roll last time.. that was a mistake, not as good as the hot one. Great selection of fresh oysters. I had about 10 of them and they were all amazing. Prices were in range with what you would expect... maybe the roll was a bit more but nothing too major. It's a real small joint so I'd suggest go during down times or be prepared to wait. I came at 7pm and for a table of 2, it took 45 minutes. The area around it fosters interesting walks in the vicinity but it all pends the weather.

Reviews.Author: Ken S.
Reviews.Content: Oysters here were really fresh, I tried a few of their sample selection and wasn't disappointed.  The lobster roll with butter was good but mine had way too much butter that completely soaked the roll, not my thing.  Overall, the food was good but nothing really stood out to me about this place.

Reviews.Author: Zach W.
Reviews.Content: Incredibly fresh seafood and the Neptune Burger is one of my favorite burgers in the city. The restaurant is a bit small but thats common for the North End eateries, and is well worth the wait if there is one. Need to get my friends together for a hell night which consists of a table paying a flat price as the chef keeps bringing entree after entree to the table until someone taps out. If you want seafood and are sick of the classic tourist hangouts of Legal Sea food and Union Oyster house check out Neptune Oyster.

Reviews.Author: v i.
Reviews.Content: Oh my god! This place was the best! I was in Boston recently and read good things about this place on Yelp, so off we went...not disappointed! Although, I have to admit I've never been to an oyster bar before, so they could be all like this.On our first night at Neptune (yes, there was another visit within our weeklong visit) we were told that the waiting time was 1 hour (the place was packed, the line was long, & they don't take reservations), so we decided to eat dinner at an Italian place up the street (also very good but don't remember the name if I do, more details to follow...) and then come back. We ordered the Triton platter, which came with raw oysters, cherrystone & littleneck clams, steamed (& very sweet!) mussels & tigerprawns, lobster salad & another salad (crab?) + a bottle of white. So delicious!!! Perfect after dinner meal :)The next time we came for lunch and amazingly, there was no one there. We were joined by 3 different groups afterwards though. The atmosphere was more laid back, you could see more of the place, all the details, like I noticed this really old (vintage?) black metal fan on the wall by the entrance to the kitchen, the nice tiles, etc. So the ambiance is really nice, both daytime & nighttime. Lunch was also amazing...tried 6 different types of oysters (the highlights were the kumamoto & I forgot the other type - Pleasant Bay?), clam chowder (very light on the cream, you can really taste the essence of the clams, this was so yum), and tried several appetizers, like hamachi ceviche, scallop spicy ceviche, octopus salad, & crab cakes (kind of Italian stye, it had basil, cheese, tomato...) What was also nice is one can order a bottle of champagne at a reasonable price here (cheapest is $39). Anyway, just simply amazing seafood, lovely ambiance, good service, will go back whenever I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Vincent B.
Reviews.Content: I went for the first time to Neptune Oyster to meet up with a few friends to have, what else, the awesome oysters!  And awe wasn't the only thing experienced, as bliss, freshness, and the ocean also decided to show up.  The oysters were by far the freshest I've had in Boston, and the various selection was impressive with such a limited seating arrangement.  I was astounded at the knowledge the waitstaff had for their products, and encourage everyone to try as much of the raw bar as you can muster (or afford).  To balance the sea, I wanted something from Gaia, and decided on the burger.  Yes, it may sound strange, but it was one of the best burger I've had in recent times.  I mean, how can you pass up a burger topped with fried oysters?  As the god Neptune watches over you enjoying the harvest from his seas, look up (there's a mask), and give a toast with a succulent oyster shell.  Salute!

Reviews.Author: Maria Z.
Reviews.Content: I've never had a bad meal here. I've never had anything bad here! Great service, great wine list and, oh yeah - GREAT SHELLFISH! If you are a fan of oysters (or looking to explore), you must, must try Neptune Oyster. Get there on the early side. The restaurant is small and they tend to fill up quickly and don't take reservations. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: I'll admit that I am disappointed that Neptune is currently "Hot on Yelp". This was one of the first places I had ever eaten at in Boston and every time I go, I feel like I'm very lucky to get a table. I've never waited more than 5 minutes to sit and the service has always been great. The waitresses (I've never had a waiter there) have always been knowledgeable and pleasant.Neptune is one of those places I visit when I know I'm going to be in the North End. I never go for a full dinner, just for a dish of 6-12 oysters per person, which are always amazing. The shrimp cocktail is great as well. The downside, which I won't take away any stars for since this is the North End after all, is that this place is tiny and being a big guy, its quite uncomfortable.I've had a few friends go there who've eaten a full dinner there and said everything was excellent.

Reviews.Author: Elaine H.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the BEST Lobster Roll in town (hot butter one) and freshest oysters- my personal favorite in Boston. Never been a fan of oysters but I finally gave in not too long ago and had my first oyster at B&G Oyster bar, but gotta say Neptune's offer even more variety as well as flavor.Neptune Oyster Bar is a must go if you're looking to have the best lobster roll at a classic oyster bar, pairing white wine and fresh seafood always satisfies me immensely. Having been there over 5 times, Neptune has never failed me with their oysters, shrimp cocktails, cod, any of the appetizers, and last but not least the lobster roll!! One thing I really disliked was the Clam Chowder, theirs is more like the Manhattan style rather than thick and creamy New England style so if you're looking for the classic New England style, just go to Boston Chowda inside Quincy Market. I'd recommend going at late lunch hours so there won't be a long wait. In all my dinner experience at Neptune, a 1 hr wait is very typical. All in all, a must-go if you want to have quality seafood or to impress friends!

Reviews.Author: Zev X.
Reviews.Content: A great date place!  Expect to wait for a tableSmall cozy restaurant. We ended up sitting at the bar. The bar staff was really nice.  The oysters are phenomenal.  There are so many different types to choose  from.The hot lobster rolls with butter were awesome and completely unique!It was expensive but well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Stephen Y.
Reviews.Content: Pretty darn good crab claws here.While the oysters were a little weak (not sure if they're in season in late April), this was a superb culinary experience and defines Boston in the same way that Au Pied de Cochon defines Montreal. I had a tuna special (Saturdays) that was seared to perfection. My partner's sea bass had just a hint of tumeric. All-in-all, great execution and great service too, but be prepared to wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: Ravi M.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I headed to Neptune Oyster as it was a Best of Boston choice backed up by very positive Yelp reviews.It was a great choice and a simply outstanding experience! Thankfully we got seating at the bar without having to wait for too long. The waitress was very friendly, took the time to listen to us, and then made some very helpful suggestions. We had a platter of oysters from about 6 different locations from the East and West Coast each with it's own distinctive flavour (and after taste) and texture - washed down with White Wine. Delectable! We were feeling a little adventurous and wanted to taste different things. Next was Baby Octopus cooked Moroccan style with cous cous and a nice blend of spices, and finally Fried Clams. We were too full to try anything more! Neptune has that lovely ambience that is informal, inviting and friendly.    There is a good, varied selection on the menu, which was a pleasant surprise. The food is fresh and tastes great!Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Nikki M.
Reviews.Content: After all the great reviews on Yelp I decided to give this place a try since I was coming over to visit my brother & was craving for some good oysters. Even though they told us it would be 1.5hr wait we decided to walk around and come back to it. We ended up waiting 2 hours... fine... The clam chowder was $11 which is a little more then i usually see on the menus but thought, hey it might be really good clam chowder & I am a big fan of this soup so decided to try it out. #1 The soup was basically watered down, although the clams were nice but chowder was not thick at all#2 Too much celery which made the whole thing taste like it after a few spoonsWe also ordered 2 dozen oysters & a dozen littleneck clams. I honestly will have to say the oysters were not as good as I expected it would be. Possibly because it was too cold so there wasn't the "oyster taste" to it. Clams were excellent. If I were to come around again.. maybe I would try the lobster roll. The lady next to me ordered it & smelled yummy.

Reviews.Author: Kat A.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of my most favorite restaurants in Boston. The food is amazing. I had the atlantic char, which was  flavorful and cooked to perfection. It's a tiny place and very crowded but I love the décor and atmosphere.I was torn between 4 and 5 stars. Settled on 4 only because it's not easy to get a table (they take no reservations), and the prices are a bit on the high side.

Reviews.Author: Megan P.
Reviews.Content: Best Lobster Roll. Ever. I'm from Cape Ann originally, and I know my lobster rolls and seafood in general. The hot lobster roll is made with big pieces of lobster (from the shell, not a can) warmed in butter and served in a big toasted buttery roll-because when it comes to lobster, you can not have enough butter! The prices are a little high, but it's worth it for the quality seafood you get here!It is a very small place, which adds to it's charm. I wouldn't recommend for large group over 4 people though.

Reviews.Author: Steve J.
Reviews.Content: I like Boston, Neptune Oyster! And I'm from S. California!If you tried any oysters in the past year or so with oysters for lunch as its main course, you'll eat one of the best here. Whats incredible is that everything on the menu is good!

Reviews.Author: Kata S.
Reviews.Content: Neptune I wish you existed in Phoenix.  It was a pleasure to visit you during the Boston Marathon.Neptune is in North End, average priced for the area, and on a Monday evening at 5:30 we were able to snag up a table within 45 minutes.  The high notes:  Oysters very fresh, you order them a la carte style so you can pick and choose your flesh.  Lobster roll they did a great job on, it was warm with butter and the fries that accompanied kicked butt.  The bank scallop dish was one of the best ways I've eaten scallops in a long time.  Neptune is creative with their dishes, the service attentive.  This was a more expensive meal for us, but I believe the prices to the average for the area that we were in.

Reviews.Author: Sarah D.
Reviews.Content: The tiniest little restaurant with the most amazing seafood i've had yet in Boston. If you've read reviews, you already know to get the hot lobster roll. Im a transplant from Delaware and didn't understand what all the fuss was about with new england and lobster rolls...so. much. mayo. Neptune changed that forever. Another menu item I enjoyed was the lobster caprese salad. Try it. We came at 4:00 pm on a Saturday and still had to wait... get the idea? Another thing to note is no liquor, just wine and beer. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Ckoka C.
Reviews.Content: Lovely place, small but nice.the food was great, I liked the oyster's variety, and the lobster sandwich too.

Reviews.Author: Erika F.
Reviews.Content: I think the only reason my boyfriend comes to visit me in boston so much is to come eat the lobster rolls here.  Love the lobster rolls, period.  Other things: Be prepared to wait.  Usually there is someone taking names that will give you a call so you can leave.  The most recent time I went there were only two waitresses so we just had to wait for a seat to open up, which was fine since we weren't in a rush.  Did not like the clam chowder, I've only had it once so, but would not order it again.  It was watery, and the clams were a little grainy.  I've had a fried clam appetizer? or fried oyster? i think it had raisins and pistachios.  It was really tasty a little sweet but still savory.  Very delicious.  Almost makes me want to try the rest of their menu and stop ordering lobster rolls.. You can get a salad instead of fries w the lobster rolls... the fries are awesome, but the salad they serve with it is pretty good too.  I think its butter lettuce with a sort of vinaigrette dressing with chopped almonds.  Just be warned, I think if you order the salad instead of the fries they may put less butter on your lobster roll...Most recently came here after the july 4th weekend-- our mistake.  They were out of some of the fish.. which was when i should have realized that going to a seafood restaurant after a holiday weekend is never a good idea.  The lobster roll was still good, but not as fresh tasting, chewier and i think i hit some shell.  Don't make our mistake..

Reviews.Author: Amanda Z.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable HOT Lobster roll - I died!!! I find myself dreaming about these guys.Also had their fried clams and few Oyster selections, equally amazing - but does not compare to the HOT Lobster roll.I make sure to take all of my out-of-town guests here... but be prepared to wait for a table, try to go mid-afternoon after and before the main meal rushes.

Reviews.Author: Tammy K.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll can't be beat.  Hot or cold?  That IS the question.  I love the buttery goodness of the hot lobster roll, how the butter seeps into the bun and everything melts in your mouth.  But, I also like the creamy mayo of the cold lobster roll.  I think hot wins in my mind - the cold needs a little texture difference, maybe some celery?The clam chowder is good - great clam flavor, fresh clams.  We also had the scallop crudo, which was extremely fresh and tender and everything I love about raw scallops!  Love the decor of this place - reminds me of Parisian bistros.  Lots of dark wood, tiles, mirrors and a great bar.  The Prosecco is a nice complement to a big plate of oysters or really, any dish here!

Reviews.Author: Nick Z.
Reviews.Content: [drooling] LoooooooooooooOOOOOooooove Neptune Oyster. Their oysters and fish are FRESH. The absolute best. My guess is that they tell all the local suppliers to see them first and they pay for that kind of service/selection everyday. And they pass that cost to you, to be sure, but if you want the best it'll cost ya.The oysters are crazy tasty. And, like so many have said here, the lobster roll is UNREAL. Super tasty and I think their fried clam bellies are arguably the best on the whole damn planet. They have a Neptune platter of oysters that, if you like oysters, is perhaps the best thing you'll ever do for yourself in a restaurant. Seriously. Get it. Don't think about the price. DO IT.You needn't dress to the nines, but this is definitely a special night out.Note: waits are HUGE. A good note is to have a super delayed lunch or a very early dinner (3-5 PM).

Reviews.Author: Jack L.
Reviews.Content: If I could rate this place 6 stars I would. The best. lobster. roll. ever.If you have an extra $50 to spend, go for the hot lobster roll, a couple of oysters and the clam chowder.Also be sure to get there at 5 PM or else you'll suffer an hour-long wait.

Reviews.Author: Jamie M.
Reviews.Content: First Oysters! I was always very hesitant to eat oysters and had my first experience at Neptune.  Since then I can't get enough oysters. Try the stone crab and definitely get at least one shrimp (they're the size of a lobster tail)!!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: Awesome food.  The Hot Buttered Lobster Roll is to die for!  The place is very small and the wait can be very long, but well worth it.  My advice is to go early, put your name in, and go get drinks elsewhere while you wait - they will call your cell.  They do not take reservations, smaller parties are better, I believe 6 people is their max for a group.  My husband does not really care for seafood.  He tried the fish tacos and loved them!  This is  MUST for any trip to Boston!  Remember to get the HOT BUTTERED LOBSTER ROLL!

Reviews.Author: Fred F.
Reviews.Content: !!!!!  WARNING  !!!!!If you do not get to the restaurant by 7:00 pm, you may not get seated - that's how busy this place is.  I am not joking, I watched them turn away more than a dozen dining parties because they were booked for the night.  They do not take reservations, either.Now that that's out of the way, let's talk food.I was in Boston this week for a convention and decided I wanted lobster.  Friends from home suggested I go to "Legal Seafood", but after asking some locals their opinion, the consensus was that Neptune Oyster was the place to go.So I checked Yelp and the reviews said I had to try the lobster roll.  Now that I had a plan, it was tune to set out and get my dinner.  Fortunately my hotel is only a 15 minute walk through a very nice section of town to the "Little Italy" area where Neptune is located.I arrived at 7:10 and put my name on the list.  I was told that there would be "at least an hour wait, maybe longer".  They took my name and cell number and said they would call me when my seat was available.  The restaurant is small, maybe 10 tables and the bar seats maybe another 15 people.  This explains why the wait is so long.While I waited, I walked around Little Italy.  What a nice, charming area!  I haven't been around a nice community like this in a long time.  Lots of other restaurants, bars, and shops to check out - I wish I was going to be here longer...Anyway, I was called at 8:15 and was told my seat was ready.  I sat down at the counter in the 1st seat by the door.  I had a great view of the oyster bar and the street, so dinner and a show!The waitress was quick to bring me some water and a menu, but I already knew what I was going to have....clam chowdah and a lobstah roll!  I placed my order and waited anxiously.  I didn't have to wait long and my chowdah arrived.  This was some very good clam chowder with BIG chunks of clam and potatos, and some very small diced celery bits.  This chowder was thin (think mikly, not the thick creamy stuff that comes out of a can).  The waitress even asked me if I wanted fresh ground pepper in it (yes, please!).As I was finishing my soup, the lobster roll arrived.  No before we get to the lobster roll, I need to talk about the fries that came with the dish.  Normally I'm very 'meh' on fries - they're always soggy, or greasy, or blah.  THESE WERE THE BEST FRIES I'VE HAD IN AGES!!!  Hot, crispy (but not greasy), and they had a nice TASTE to them - not that typical 'meh' taste that requires a ton of salt and/or ketchup.Now for the lobster roll, and we'll start with the 'roll' part.  Again, rolls to me are usually kinda stale, tasteless, and usually the worst part of a sandwich.  This roll is baked fresh at a local baker about 4 blocks away (I think that's where she said it was).  It was incredibly fresh, SOFT, buttery, and delicious!  It was about 7-8" long, and STUFFED with lobster.I opted for the hot lobster and butter combo (versus the cold lobster with mayo).  The lobster is Maine lobster, and there are HUGE chunks of tail meat and claw meat in there.  This brings us a good point - this is a messy eat.  If you're wearing a suit or dress shirt - roll up the sleeves or you'll get lobster meat and butter all over them.All I can say is this was fastastic!  The lobster was fresh, the bread was fresh, and the fries were crispy!  If I ever make it back this way, I will probably try the Crab Coctail instead of the chowder, but I'm definately having the lobster roll again!Now go forth and have the best lobster roll you'll ever eat - you'll thank me later.Oh, and don't forget to go early!

Reviews.Author: Miguel R.
Reviews.Content: I passed this place twice trying to find it, and my my, what a terrible decision it was to try to be seated around 1PM on a Saturday. The wait was about a full hour, but a nice afternoon stroll through North End makes the wait bearable.Credit where credit is absolutely due: the service is quick and attentive and the oysters are exceptional. In spite of the uncomfortably tight, yet charming marble and tile space. In spite of being able to hear the insufferable socialites gossiping about you and complaining about the quality of their oysters relative to yours literally 8 inches to your left. In spite of the stools that fatigue your elbows and the wobbling marble-top tables that taunt you in turn. In spite.It's a little known fact that oysters are actually an extremely high profit margin food item, but even then, I did not find the a la carte oyster menu to be too pricey. The rest of the menu is a different story, but the reason I stand by my 5-stars is that if you love oysters, you should really do yourself a favor and give this little nook a visit. Just build in a nice buffer so you're not ravenous by the time you're seated.

Reviews.Author: Rachel H.
Reviews.Content: I had heard and read lots of reviews of Neptune Oyster so maybe the place was overhyped for me, but it did not live up to my expectations. I went with a friend on a Monday night, arrived around 6 p.m., and was told there would be an hour wait. Not a problem as we expected this, and I appreciated that they called when seats were ready so we could walk around the North End.We sat at the bar, and I ordered the clam chowder and a hot lobster roll. The clam chowder was delicious and unique - lots of very fresh, yummy clams. I love clam chowder and you just don't see that many fresh clams in a bowl too often. Unfortunately, when I neared the bottom of the bowl, I found a piece of a shell - about an inch and half wide and sharp! This could have been really dangerous if I swallowed it. I hoped this was just a fluke and went in for another spoonful and found even more tiny pieces of clam shells. I told the waiter and appreciated that they took the chowder off the bill.When the lobster roll arrived, I was excited but it was soooo rich that I found it to be difficult to eat. Don't get me wrong - the roll was packed with lobster which was great but with all the butter loaded on there, it was hard to eat too much without feeling stuffed - and a little sick - to my stomach. Granted, I do normally order cold lobster rolls so maybe that's more what I'm used to but after hearing the rave reviews of the warm ones, I wanted to give them a try. As some other reviewers mentioned, the fries were excellent. Very crispy and delicious.Overall, Neptune Oyster was good - despite the shell incident - but not worth the wait on this particular night. Still, I'm tempted to try their cold lobster roll sometime to see how it compares to others in the area.

Reviews.Author: Jay W.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten some of the finest Sandwiches this country has to offer. (Salumi, Ikes, Katzs, Al's #1, Paseo). This is my favorite, there is no better for me than the hot Lobster Roll. Is there a wait? Probably. Ambiance? A little snobbish. Expensive? You betcha! Is it worth it? Aw yeah, it's wicked good!

Reviews.Author: Gary S.
Reviews.Content: What a great place!  Been here multiple times and never disappoints, except the wait!  Fresh food and great service!  Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Author: Tim S.
Reviews.Content: I had the hot lobster roll and it was sublime. Best ever had in my life, and I have had hundreds of lobster Rolls. The meat was tender, the roll was buttery and toasty. $28 is expensive for an ordinary lobster roll, but a bargain here. The fries were cooked to order and excellent. Decor is cool, as if I was in the Marais district of Paris. Get there before 11:30 or you won't get a seat at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Sebastian H.
Reviews.Content: We stopped in at Neptune Oyster on our way back from Maine after hearing/reading so many great things. What a great place. They were packed on a Monday afternoon, so you know they are doing something right. We waited about 10-15 minutes and were sat right by the raw bar (which i always like). I sparked up a convo with the house shucker and she told me their is almost never any down time and they are constantly busy. Another good sign. We started with some stuff from the raw bar (oysters, clams, and shrimp.) Everything was delicious, and very very fresh. We ordered 2 lobster rolls (1 cold-mayo, 1 warm-butter). Both were full of huge chunks of juicy, sweet lobster. We both agreed that we liked the buttered one best. However, this by no means discredits the mayo one. If (when) we come back, i'm almost sure we will order both and have the same eating/sharing arrangements. This was my favorite lobster roll i had during my tour de lobster, also the most expensive ($27). But it was DA SHIEET!! go to boston, go to Neptune, and..... ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Author: Vina A.
Reviews.Content: The wait can be crazy. The waitlist was closed at 7pm two days in a row, but we finally made it in on the third try.  The oysters were fresh. The clam chowder was great! It wasn't extremely thick, but that's what I prefer.  The lobster roll (we had the hot lobster roll with butter) was incredible. The lobster pieces were delicious and went great with the sauce. The fries were good albeit a little too salty.  No dessert menu.

Reviews.Author: Carrie T.
Reviews.Content: Great seafood! Very fresh and great quality. On the pricier end but worth the experience. Beware, there will be a long wait since the restaurant is quite small

Reviews.Author: Just M.
Reviews.Content: Memorable, repeatable and a great dining experience: The oysters... so fresh, skillfully described and then presented - so good I moved my fellow diner from "ewwww" to "WTF" to "OMG"! Johnny Cakes ... sigh.  The staff was so much more than accommodating and friendly. One commented that, it was exhausting saying "No take out" but it ensured that the in house diners were served the very best with the very best attention.The place is a hole in the wall and packed with a constant crowd at the door yet the skillful servers make you feel welcome, not rushed. It is a quintessential Boston experience - not unlike the oyster bars of London and Europe...Highly recommended if you enjoy excellent sea food, a succinct and brilliant selection of wines and a memorable experience.

Reviews.Author: Charlie T.
Reviews.Content: Hot lobster roll was awesome. Best in Boston.  Clam chowder a bit watery...not much content. Service a bit slow but that is because everything is made to order.

Reviews.Author: Laurel H.
Reviews.Content: Worth every dollar. Simple seafood done fabulously.

Reviews.Author: Sasha B.
Reviews.Content: This is really the only reason to go the North End other than a canoli. Best oyster bar in town.  Yes it's expensive and impossible to get in to.  But there is a reason for that. Rest of the menu is also fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Moe B.
Reviews.Content: The oysters were delicious! They had many to choose from, as well. The local beer paired perfectly with them. It's a bit pricey, but that's to be expected. It can be difficult to get a seat (you will probably have to wait if it is lunch or dinner time), but it's well worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Shaun R.
Reviews.Content: The authentic experience of eating fresh oysters at this swanky Boston North End spot can't be beat. However I can't recommend the lobster roll, it might have been just an off day, but my lobster was over-cooked and didn't pair well with the accompanying ndercooked and soggy fries. I will be back to sip/slurp wine/oysters but will leave the full meal for another one of the many great neighborhood restaurants.

Reviews.Author: Melody R.
Reviews.Content: WHY ARE ALL THE RESTAURANTS IN BOSTON SO FREAKING SMALL. I really don't understand it! There are lots of great reviews for this place, so of course we had to try it...the wait was 3 hours, we arrived at 1 but got seated at 4. So we came for lunch and ended up eating dinner. The place was pretty packed consistently for the duration of our meal. We ordered the routine things - lobster roll, cioppino, and special fish of the day (which I sadly do not remember what exactly it was). After ordering, we look over to the party next to us and see that they are devouring two dishes of mussels - it was evident that they thoroughly enjoyed it since they were sopping up the rest of the sauce with bread. It looked amazing so we got an order. HOLY COW were those mussels tasty!!!! Sadly, these came first because the rest of the meal was quite lackluster. The cioppino came out luke warm and tasted...standard. The lobster roll was good but drowned in butter, so much so that it tasted more like a butter roll - which is great but it gets old after a couple bites. The fish special was good but no better than what you could get at any other seafood restaurants. Unfortunately, Neptune was all hype for me (except the curry mussels, they must put crack in it).

Reviews.Author: Janet J.
Reviews.Content: Great oyster and lobster roll. But you have to wait up to 3hrs at dinner time. It's worth waiting though.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: Delish but expens

Reviews.Author: Chris Y.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll was amazing.  Slightly buttery, but not too overwhelming.  The clam chowder was a little too watery for my taste and there wasn't enough clam flavor.

Reviews.Author: Kim I.
Reviews.Content: I was never really a fan of oysters but Neptune converted me to love them! I've never had such amazing fresh oysters until I came here...I was shocked. The hot lobster roll was also mouth-watering. The only thing I don't like about Neptune is the popularity and the wait in line :( You really have to go during a random hour to get seated quickly.

Reviews.Author: B R.
Reviews.Content: Best in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Hao-Han L.
Reviews.Content: It is a very special experience for me to taste oysters as taste wine in winery, but I waited for over two hours. It almost drove me crazy!

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience here.  They do not take reservations so go put your name, then hit a local pub because there is typically a very long wait.  They do take your cell phone number and will call you when you are able to be seated which is great.  The whole restaurant is about the size of a garage so I hope you like to be seated in close proximity to others.  This gives it the North End feel though that I enjoy.  Now to the food, oysters were outstanding- we essentially sampled all of them and there is a long list.  We all had lobster rolls (cooked) you can also get them cold if that's what you prefer.  They are the best, in my opinion, in Boston.  Overall great restaurant with a great North End feel...

Reviews.Author: Rick J.
Reviews.Content: You should experience Neptune Oyster when in Boston. The Lobster Roll is unbelievable... huge, delectable chunks of lobster, drenched in butter on a soft toasted roll... what's not to like? Be sure to get it hot. That was the highlight of my lunch. I also enjoyed the crab claws, but wish I had tried the shrimp cocktail. I'm not one for raw oysters, but everyone around me was definitely enjoying theirs. I thought the service was excellent. Yes, there was a bit of Boston attitude, but it was part of the ambiance, and I was well taken care of. I showed up at 11:10 AM on a Friday, and the line had started. I was just after a group of six, and got in immediately when they opened at 11:30. By the time they opened, there were more than enough people to fill the entire restaurant, which is small, but larger than other places I tried in the North End. Definitely try this place for great seafood!

Reviews.Author: Maria M.
Reviews.Content: Go for the oysters. Nothing else. Long wait for anyone at any time. Which is fine because, their oysters are definitely worth it. Here's the thing: everything else is just ok. The lobster roll looks great.. it's fresh.. but it's nothing special really. We ordered the butter lobster roll by the way. It's good lobster meat, on a roll soaked with butter. Not bad.. just not the best (and not worth waiting an hour for). We also tried the clam chowder. I'm used to my clam chowders being a little thicker and more filling. And their clam chowder is a little more watered down with smaller pieces of potatoes. However, they do give you a lot of clams which is good right? =)But the oysters are definitely the best I've tasted. So go for that. Do this: go in, put your name down, go get an appetizer or something elsewhere, come back and eat your oysters (about $2.50 and up each) to your heart's or wallet's desire, then go and eat another meal elsewhere, and dessert elsewhere.The place is small, so of course there would be a long wait.. but since it's so crowded, our server did forget to bring us a couple of our orders. Also, the service really wasn't that great... it took about an hour and 5 minutes for our orders of lobster rolls and clam chowder to come out. oh well.... Better luck next time,Bottom line: oyster? yes!!!!; everything else was just ok.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: Wow!! This place was amazing... I was in Boston area for business for a few days and had a few meals here and there but nothing really blew my mind or was worth noting. On my last day in MA I was in the area and decided to stop by! This place is nice and small... but the wait is insane! From what I heard from the servers, this place stops taking names for dinner on weekdays typically around 8:30 (they close at 9:30 on weekdays), and on weekends they told me its not unusual for them to stop taking names around 7-7:30 (they close at 10:30 on weekends!)!!!Who does that?! lol... so this already shows how amazing this place is.Luckily I came by myself and snatched a bar seat!From what I heard, MA is best known for the lobster (or lobster roll) and clam chowder. By that time, I had already had a lobster roll from another well rated restaurant known for their lobster roll (and I don't really like lobster all that much!)... so by the time I got to this place, I really wasn't feeling another lobster roll. However, upon the recommendation from everyone in the restaruant, I deicded to give it one more go....So starting off with the main entree, I got the lobster roll... and boy am I glad I got that!!! It definitely knocked my socks off and made me rethink liking lobster (as I'm more of a shrimp guy)! The lobster was hot and succulent. The meat tasted like they just picked out a lobster out of the sea, cooked it in a tub of butter, and got all the meat out... all in one go!! I don't think I've had lobster this good before and I was flabbergasted at how good it was! If I had more money and if they let me, I would've tried to take one to go (too bad they don't do to-go orders though because of how busy they are). The lobster was very buttery, hot as it came out to me, and cooked to perfection. You could taste a bit of the sea left in it as well!I'm not sure if they make their own rolls but would not be surprised if they do! Because their roll held up pretty nicely as well and was the perfect partner in crime for all those huge chunks of lobster!Also got their clam chowerder and had to try some of their oysters as well. Their clam chowder was a bit different from the west coast clam chowder it seemed... The chowder tasted a bit more... "ocean-like"? if that makes sense... probably doesn't but it was really good. I was impressed. Their oysters were probably a little less excited just because I've had some amazing oysters already. I got the island creek (from Duxbury, MA), and the Beausoleil (from Shippagan, NB) from the recommondation of my server. The island creek was better but was not super impressed in that arena (not to say it wasn't good like I said, but I've had amazing oysters already on west coast already). Once you sit down, service is great and food comes out reletively fast (if you aren't in a huge group or anything). So all in all, a fantastic last dinner at Boston MA. I am very glad I took the effort to drive down-town to get this meal. I can't imagine anyone getting a better lobster (or lobster roll) better than this place. The price and wait are def worth it. Therefore this place gets 5 stars in my book! So if you're in the area, make a good effort to go to this place... it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: The staff needs to be more organized. I came here on a Saturday and there was a 90 minute wait for 2 people-- that's OK, BUT what is not ok is having people wait for 25 minutes in the doorway before taking their name and number to contact them when a table is ready. The staff is highly disorganized and the staff seems very frazzled when busy. Mgmt should address this. Oyster selection was great though...

Reviews.Author: Kyle B.
Reviews.Content: Just tried Neptune oyster for the first time.....A+. Had a variety of great oysters, then P.E.I. Mussels that were in the most amazing sauce. Make sure you ask for bread to soak it all up. Finished with a hot buttered lobster roll that was perfect. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Author: Stephen R.
Reviews.Content: Heard the lobster rolls are great here.  Unfortunately when we went there the wait was 2 hours.  We didn't end up staying around, but the interior was very nice and at the bar they super fresh fish on ice.  Can't wait to go back and try.

Reviews.Author: Zita B.
Reviews.Content: Great Restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Shawn G.
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews, Neptune really is great.It's clear the food is stand out; what makes the place special is its cramped antiqued interior from a century ago: white tiled walls, tin ceiling, dinner service at the marble-topped bar giving it an iconic air.It's a little piece of Tribeca in a hidden corner of Boston. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Author: Little Miss M.
Reviews.Content: If you are into seafood, this is the place for you. If you are not into seafood, this place will horrify you since it is small and you are practically on top of empty oyster shells, shrimp/lobster tails, and other seafood remnants the whole time.But as a seafood lover it was perfect...it was like I found my people. The chalkboard lists the many varieties of oysters of the day (I am wary of places that do not update this list since freshness is key to a good oyster), the menu lists other great seafood options, and the wine list is perfect. Seek out this place when you just want a nice glass of white and an assortment of oysters. Yum!

Reviews.Author: J.A H.
Reviews.Content: Had dinner here around 6pm on Friday, group of 4, only 15 min waitArctic Char w/ green grapes, goat cheese and beets: TO DIE FOR. Seriously, this dish was outrageous. Couldn't have been better.Seared Scallops: Delicious. Served with halved bing cherries and some kind of cured pork. Great savory/sweet balance. Hot Lobster roll/butter: First of all, the roll itself was outstanding. It's sweet in that perfectly bready way, and doused in hot butter. There is a generous portion of melt-in-your-mouth lobster chunks in between, and the fries are SO FRESH and crispy. yum.Blue Crab Cocktail: Oh. My. God. No really I actually could have eaten a bucket of this. Sweet, succulent crab bits tossed in this incredible light mustard/mayo/lemony dressing. Will DEFINITELY be returning here.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M.
Reviews.Content: Though I consistently refer to Neptune Oyster as: "You know not 'Poseidon' Oyster... but the other Water God Oyster place" to which my husband gently nods his head and says, "yes dear, NEPTUNE Oyster" (he is such a patient man), I really think the food is excellent. The demerits in rating just come from the atmosphere. We had an hour and a half wait, during which time we went and ate some gellato down the street and walked most of the North End. Once we were in the restaurant, the crowd was not one that I would usually seek out and we were cramped together so you had to feel chummy though I was mostly grouchy and really hungry.But that was all made up for by the fact that our bartender was knowledgeable and a generous pourer (perhaps to make up for the ridiculous time we waited to eat there) and the food was divine. Some of the best scallops I have ever had the pleasure of eating.I look forward to going back and diving in to the raw bar head first... Perhaps we will just get there at 4pm...

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: I am a sucker for a good raw bar, and let me just say this place had a good one. They had 9 different types of oysters on the half shell to which I happily of course went to my old salt friend the wellfleet, which was incredibly fresh and extremely meaty, they also had rock crab claws, which got me as giddy as a school girl. If you go I suggest those little pincers of paradise.The main course I had was their lobster roll, they served it 2 ways warm sauted in butter, and the traditional way cold in mayonnaise. I got the warm and could feel my dad making love to it with his eyes when it arrived at the table, not that I could blame him it's better than any lobster roll you can get trust me on this one... just go get the damn lobster roll.Our waiter was awesome, really nice guy really helpful. Though when you go there expect a wait because it's always packed, and they don't take reservations, it is also a smaller restaurant... but hell for as good as this place in I would have let someone sit on my lap for the duration of the meal.

Reviews.Author: Beth H.
Reviews.Content: The place is small but it has the  BEST lobster roll around Boston.  For an oyster place, their burger is also fantastic.  The selection of oysters are FANTASTIC and you can't go wrong with any choice.  You can taste the difference in each region and water.  I will always recommend this place to anybody who visits, just moved here or would just like some GREAT food.

Reviews.Author: Jackie G.
Reviews.Content: Yum Lobster Rolls! We went on the recommendation of my co-worker and it was awesome. We both tried the hot lobster roll with butter. AMAZING! I felt a little overwhelmed by the fries, but was in love with the lobster. I can be hit or miss with extreme amounts of butter and it was actually just the right amount. It had a slight peppery tinge to it. YUM!We also tried a few oysters which were equally wonderful. We sat at the bar which was a fun area to people watch.I'd recommend going early. We went around 4:30/5pm on a Saturday and had about a 30 min wait. They take your number and call you which is actually great- you can head to another north end spot and grab a drink/app.Just save room for the lobster.

Reviews.Author: Ryan R.
Reviews.Content: An entire lobster's worth of meat is served with each lobster roll. No filler, all lobster. The waiter is extremely helpful, he will not hesitate to recommend places to go, wine pairings, the order the food should come, etc.If you have a sibling, and do not bring them here, he/she will hate you for the rest of your life. The food is that good.

Reviews.Author: Adam B.
Reviews.Content: We may have had to wait 1.5-2 hours, and that would usually have made me mad, but holy moley was this place good.Never had an oyster before and will probably save my money in the future by not getting one again. I was told to just swallow it and not chew on it so it felt like I was just wasting my money. The thing everyone needs to get is the lobster roll. I can't give it justice trying to explain it on here. Just know that it's lobster, butter, really good bread and probably one of the best things you've ever had, no joke.The clam chowder was awesome for the fact that it was more a soup than a heavy chowder that you see everywhere. It tasted great and was a welcomed change to every chowder I've had in this town.The shrimp were really good too. The table next to us got the tacos, which not only looked awesome, but the people raved about them. I don't see the huge draw to oysters and if you're like me, DO NOT cross this place off your list. It's got a lot more than oysters to offer.Waiter was great too. The only downsides are the wait and if you don't like being a little cramped.

Reviews.Author: nguyet l.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!! I love this place the food it great. The oyster are clean and fresh and high quality. They also have them from difference regions. I love the mussel appetizer.  nice rich not creamy, hint of garlic, seafood heaven. they have them in different taste and after taste. I recommend getting one of all of the oysters they serve on that day because the options changes depending on the season and what is caught that day.and which ever floats your boat get more of it ^.^for the entree the lobster roll. I tried the cold with mayo lobster roll, it wasn't my favorite. but that is my opinion. BUT I LOVED THE HOT BUTTER LOBSTER ROLL ^^ They also have a very good variety of beer wine and champagne here. it changes with the season as it should with any good bar.the missing star is for the amount of time it took to get a seat. it varies depending on the day and time. once I had to wait 4 hours to get in. I do wish they would expand. but totally worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Cat L.
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant, small and cozy.  The wait is long, but worth it!  Luckily, you can just give them your cell number and they'll call you when your table is ready.Lobster roll was fantastic, but I LOVED the raw oysters.  They have so many varieties and everything is super fresh.Service was great, never had an issue.  I'm going back!

Reviews.Author: Laura W.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place.  My biggest complaint is that they won't take reservations, you can't call to put your name on the list, and it's tiny!  I have to drive an hour just to go here and have been turned away at 6:00 because the wait's over 4 hours . . . such a disappointment that I no longer go there.  While it's some of the best food I've had, that inconvenience and poor service lost my business.Definitely the best lobster roll I have ever had-hot with butter is the way to go. Great wine and beer selection too.

Reviews.Author: Patrick M.
Reviews.Content: Living next store to this place was dangerous to both my budget and my waistline.Went here regularly and never had anything less than a great meal.The lobster roll is easily the best I have had outside of a few straight-off-the-boat Maine lobsters. Their fries are delicious. The oysters are fresh and they have a regular rotation. The staff is friendly and very helpful.It does have a somewhat small menu, though I never found this a problem. The only other negative, or rather warning, is that it is a very small space and one should either avoid during busy times or try to reserve a table (which I am not even sure you can do short of going in and putting your name on a list).

Reviews.Author: Danny C.
Reviews.Content: I heard about this restaurant from a friend and how good the lobster roll here was. My group decided to try this place out for dinner. We were going to make reservations but then I saw on yelp that they don't take reservations. We ended up waiting about an hour for a table. Like many of the highly rated restaurants in Boston, this place was small but busy. Since this was close to our last meal in Boston, I decided to try the Clam Chowder, since we were in New England after all. It was pretty interesting. They had potatoes in it and it was creamy with an adequate amount of clams in it. I felt that the soup needed some more taste to it though. Instead of getting the soup, my friend ordered an enormous dish of mussels for an appetizer. I tried one and it was very good. I wish I had gotten that instead.For the main dish, I wanted to try the lobster since I heard they are plentiful and cheap in New England. However, the market price for it was like $50 so I went for the lobster roll instead. The lobster roll was covered in butter and looked tasty. I enjoyed it and it was very filling. However, I don't believe it's as good as my friend and the reviews here described it. I thought there was too much butter and it seemed to have overwhelmed the lobster taste. It also didn't look as good as some of the pictures I've seen of it. If I ever come back to Boston, I think I would try the scallops and oysters here.

Reviews.Author: Lydia s.
Reviews.Content: Before I discuss the food, I would like to address the individuals who complain about waiting too long and the size of the restaurant. Nothing worth having in life comes easily, unless you are a spoiled brat who is used to getting everything you want instantly. Small, local eateries are difficult to maintain in busy, expensive cities like Boston, and for this establishment to uphold a standard of quality for so long without compromising their culinary integrity is notable. So go early, plan ahead, and find something to occupy yourselves with, KNOWING that you will have to wait. Don't be one of those people who stands awkwardly gawking at others while they dine. That said, the food is excellent. The Lobster Roll is of course, as many have said before me, amazing. But rarely have I found a Northern Spot that accurately prepares a southern dish like Shrimp&Grits, and rivals Southern cooking! (I lived in the South for 15 years and my Man is from SC). Delicious, just the right amount of spice, and a whole lot of shrimp! Seriously. It's rare when eating a shrimp dish that when you get down to the last bites, you have shrimp left. Even with me sneaking them off his plate, he had a large last shrimpy bite!We tried 11 different types of oysters, and found the written descriptions to be accurate and enticing. We found we enjoyed them best with just a tiny squeeze of lemon, as they are ridiculously fresh, but to each his own. The mignonette is nice and the cocktail sauce had plenty of spice. However, despite the awesome food, the BEST part of our experience was the service. Although, as it was our first time at Neptune's, getting our name in with the very busy hostess (poor thing, what a tough job) at first was a bit confusing, we ended up with seats at the bar which was awesome, as our bartendress Julie turned out to really make our dinner more of an enjoyable meal.
