She has a great sense of humour, honest recommendations, and, as it was my birthday, sent out a few extra oysters on the house.. totally unexpected kindness but much appreciated and really sweet! I have worked in the service industry since I was 14, and this was an overall exceptional experience. If you want to be coddled, go find an overpriced place with white tablecloths where they crumb your table in between courses. If you want great food, an authentic, feel-good-busy atmosphere, and stellar service, and some of the freshest damn seafood I've ever had, come to Neptunes. (and ask for Julie..)

Reviews.Author: Krista G.
Reviews.Content: This is a great example of Yelp in practice.  We found this place while in Boston by searching Yelp.  After reading the amazing reviews we had to try it.  Glad we did!  Since there are already over 1000 reviews, and no one could possibly read them all...I will be succinct.  I only want to add that this place had the best NE clam chowder I have ever had!

Reviews.Author: Marcelo C.
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:10 AM, there was already a line outside. That's the best time to arrive! Best Seafood in New England by far! Amazing atmosphere! Just order anything on the menu! It doesn't really matter! It will be the best seafood you ever going to have!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie K.
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I wandered in at 5:00 PM on a Saturday in April.  We had no idea that a 2 hour wait was standard!  We lucked out and only waited 40 minutes.  We shared oysters, all very clean/no sand, 2 hot lobster rolls, and a white peach bellini for me and an allgash white for him.  We had great service, compared to what other Yelpers have said.  We sat at the bar and didn't feel uncomfortable at all.  Waitress/bartender was attentive and nice, even when bf spilled cocktail sauce all over the counter.Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: I'm not big on giving out 5 stars. However this place deserves all 5 stars easily.I had the hot buttered lobster roll and a few beers while in Boston doing a little sightseeing. It was well worth the adventure of touring Boston and waiting until a little later in the day for lunch. When I got in there it was after 2pm and it was still packed. Keep in mind, there is very little seating in there and I was by myself so I snagged a seat at the counter.The lobster roll was amazing and the fries were a nice accompaniment. It was a ton of food and I left stuffed.The bartender was very knowledgeable on the couple of questions I had and she seemed to work the counter very well.Next time I come in it will definitely be for the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Carmen C.
Reviews.Content: The lobster sandwich was huge and delicious! I think there is better though... The lobster meat wasn't as tender as I would have liked it to be.

Reviews.Author: David E.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small joint tucked away in a small street. The wait is going to be long (30-60min) but well worth it, every dish tried so far is wonderful, seafood is very fresh , and so are oysters.

Reviews.Author: Melinda N.
Reviews.Content: OK, perhaps we ate the "wrong" things (i.e. we didn't have fresh oysters), but this place just didn't live up to the hype. i had the monkfish with rabbit which was very fresh but the entree itself lacked flavor and was a bit dry- it was all very "one-note." the pork and fried oyster appetizer was good but not great. the frites in my husband's entree were soggy. I must say that B & G Oysters (in the South End) is so much better, and the ambiance is practically identical, as are the prices. My advice? Go to B & G,

Reviews.Author: Susan T.
Reviews.Content: Went to the Neptune Oyster with a friend for dinner. He says its one of his favorite restaurants and now I know why.  The service was great, atmosphere cozy, fabulous wine and the Seared George's Banks Scallops are not to be missed.   Going back soon!

Reviews.Author: Meghan B.
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep my review simple as well. Living in the North End I know this place always has a wait. Put your name in and they will call your cell when your table is ready. Get a drink across the street, relax, as it's worth it when you get to sit down! You can't really go wrong with the oyster selection and the server is extremely knowledgeable. The hot lobster roll was fantastic! I'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Melissa B.
Reviews.Content: Worth the price and worth the wait! A once in a lifetime, world's best hot lobster roll!  Worth $27 for a lobster roll with yummy fries! So glad we went there!

Reviews.Author: Jane L.
Reviews.Content: I'm having ambivalent feelings about what to rate Neptune Oyster. It's my favorite restaurant in Massachusetts but there could be improvements. Food: Mostly awesome. Hot buttery lobster roll is foodgasm and genius, but the clam chowder is thin and not well flavored. Selection of beers and wines are also complete and great additions to the food.Service: always goodLocation: horrible. It's so tiny and they don't take rez so that if you don't get there at 3:30 pm, you'll just run into waits of 2 hours. This is what I take 1 star off for. The hassle of it all isn't worth it except on special occasions.Ambiance: super. So there you have it, in an oyster shell.  A great, too popular gem.

Reviews.Author: Allison T.
Reviews.Content: Is a lobster roll really worth $25?  Absolutely!  I ordered the cold Maine lobster roll with extra melted butter on the side for dipping and it was AMAZING!  The succulent lobster claws were HUGE and cooked perfectly.  A "must eat" when you're in Boston for sure!

Reviews.Author: Craig Z.
Reviews.Content: One of the best meals I have had in Boston.  Loved the Johny Cake and the ciopino was very good too.  Service was OK, and the place is nice enough, but in the final calculus, I am not sure I would wait an hour again.

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Boston for Thanksgiving week and as you can imagine every resturant was busy but this tiny little oyster bar handles the long waits in a very innovative way!!! They take your cell phone # and give you a call when your place is up, giving you the opportunity to go shopping or whatever during the wait. Now about the food...I had the Cioppino, as it is on the menu it would be fantastic but the waitress suggested I add lobster meat... WHOA!!!!!! What a flavor explosion!!! I started with a sampler of the different oysters on the menu which was a great opener, washed it all down with one of the local amber brews don't remember the brand because the meal made the beer an after thought... That's a good thing...pricey for a lunch (approx.100.00 my wife had the clam chowder and a tea) but it was a late lunch that served as dinner too.Espresso and cannoli at cafe Vittoria made for pretty epic day!!

Reviews.Author: Mic X.
Reviews.Content: ok, there are already over a 1,000 + reviews for this joint, so why bother adding another superfluous review onto the pile?because people need to be made aware of the following:*  this is not a restaurant. it's a marble closet with a smattering of tables and chairs. do not go here if you are claustrophobic, otherwise - you will beak out in hives (or quite possibly a full on panic attack). * if you get here before 5:30 pm on a weekday - the chances of being stuck in a line are dramatically reduced.* the shrimp that come in the North End Cioppino have the shell, legs, and head intact. you could go the pansy route by cutting and peeling all of those parts off of the shrimp, or you could muster up a modicum of courage and chow down on that shrimp whole! (just don't think about the shrimp's eyeballs being ground by your molars while eating ~ it'll go down easier that way). * the North End Cioppino is truly delectable. wait. that wasn't really a yelp worthy description of that seafood stew. i'll try again. OMG. the North End Cioppino was pure AMAZEBALLS!!!! it was delectgasmic!!! * the fried clams are fried clams, and are just like any fried clams that you can order at any restaurant that serves fried clams in the country (in those parts of the country where fried clams are served).* the server will bring you a little sheet of paper with a list of numerous types of oysters that they are serving at their raw bar on that given day. it's kind of like ordering sushi a la carte, but the descriptions of the oysters on the little sheet of paper will aid you in your decision making process.  you will soon discover if you are a briny, salty, sweet, bitter, musky, or a combination thereof, oyster eater. i did not see a puke or phlegm descriptions on the little piece of paper. * the lobster roll is one beautiful, buttery slab of caloric bliss (of should i say - blitz?). the creation weighed me down for the remainder of my day, but when i unloaded that 25 lb bar out of my system later that night - it smelled like pure gold!* the lobster roll should smell and taste like gold. the damn thing costs 25 bucks. i guess Whitey Bulger is still taking pay off money from this place, because everything on the menu is pretty damn expensive. * lastly, if your friend, date, or whatever does not like seafood - they do have hamburgers and ribeye on the menu. if they are vegan ~ i hope they like beets, 'cause that's about their only option.

Reviews.Author: Leighann F.
Reviews.Content: Last Saturday, I had hot buttered lobster roll for breakfast. It's even better as the first meal of the deal. Just be willing to wait until noon to have your first meal and you're all set.

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: Review Dedication: Boston's Finest CM Leighann "Like Rimes, if that helps you" F!  Without her [indirect] suggestion, one would've missed out on the best Lobster Roll in all of Beantown!Link to Leighann's Profile (like we need it):  yelp.com/user_details?us…Every city has a "best".  Whether it is a sports team, steakhouse, neighborhood, cocktail lounge, or gelateria, one stands above the rest.  Seeking the most delicious and flavorful Lobster Roll, I was directed to Neptune Oyster by Lady Leighann.  Luckily, Leighann's suggestion did not only deliver, it exceeded any and all expectationsThe Decor...  Two words, "Dark" & "Marble"!  Upon first entry, patrons will discover the uptempo vibe of this establishment to be both homey and relaxing.  The lively, upbeat atmosphere of the restaurant suggests a low key, good food establishment that's meant for patrons looking to converse at unabridged decibels.  Although the restaurant itself is petite in nature and somewhat cramped, the ultimate feel of the establishment is that you're here for the food and the conversation.  Don't expect high end white table cloth service at Neptune Oyster, here, it's all about the food.The Food...East Coast Oysters:  Buttery to the touch, clean to the taste!  The natural sweetness of the East Coast Oysters protruded during consumption.  Although hearty and slightly bitter notes were detected, the overall impression of the Oysters was derived from its complexity and sweetness.  A slight application of lemon juice provided the welcoming acidity, which helped to insinuate the Oyster's delicate texture and bold flavor.Cherrystone Clams: Scrumptious & Meaty are two terms that immediately come to mind.  At first taste, patrons will find that the delectable musky flavors from the Cherrystones are complemented well by the superbly clean finish.  Topped with cocktail sauce, the cherrystones provide a slightly bold bitter flavor that's enhanced by the mild tart / tanginess of the condiment.  Perhaps the most acclaimed remark that can be rendered to the Cherrystones is the textural contrast derived during consumption.  Boasting a buttery smooth outer texture, which alleviates to a meaty center, the Cherrystone clams provide an accompaniment of varied consistency.Cold Lobster Roll w/ Boston Lettuce Salad:  The visual appeal can be summed up with the 5,000 character constraints of this review.  Of course, I'll leave the visual aspect to the picture taken of this roll.  As for the taste, at initial consumption, patrons will find that the excessive (and somewhat insurmountable) portions of Lobster meat applied in the compilation to be both welcoming and humbling.  Each individual bite revealed a progressive quantity of scrumptious lobster meat.  As for the flavor, the perfect balance of mayo to crab meat provided both a slight tartness which helped with amplifying the natural sweetness of the lobster.  Furthermore, the perfectly cooked texture of the lobster meat helped with escalating the crustacean's natural delightful flavor.  Lastly, the substitution of French Fries with the Boston Lettuce Salad provided the welcoming flavor contrast of acidity, earthiness, and slight nuttiness to the application.  Overall, the Lobster Roll was superbly executed with no technical or presentation flaws present.Hot Lobster Roll w/ French Fries: Similar in presentation to the Cold Lobster Roll, two significant differences are noted...  The first being the roll was hot.  The second...  Mayo was substituted with warm unsalted butter.  Initial observations of the roll revealed that the heated application helped to elevate the natural sweet scrumptiousness of the Lobster.  The application of the unsalted butter in lieu of mayo helped with the magnification of the lobster's juicy consistency.  Further consumption of the warm lobster roll will provide both a mild detection of saltiness and peppery kick, which helps with enriching the delicate properties of the lobster.  The side of French Fries accompanying this application provided a welcoming crunchy textural contrast and mild starch profile to this dish.35 minutes later and the best meal ever consumed in Boston was complete.  Despite the wait time being 45 minutes to an hour, having a chance to sample Boston's Best Lobster roll was indeed worth the wait.Needless to say, this is the first restaurant I am hitting up when returning to Beantown!Notes on Neptune Oyster:- Wait times can vary from 30 to 90 minutes- Seating is cramped, suggest leaving large baggage behind- Although the lobster rolls were pricey ($25 each), it's best to get two and share both the Hot & Cold.- Get anything other than the Lobster Rolls and you're doing yourself a disservice

Reviews.Author: Rick T.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the  warm Lobster Roll with butter today and what a delight.!  The atmosphere was pleasant with courteous staff. The place is a bit tight however there was no wait since i went early afternoon.  I will definitely be back for more.

Reviews.Author: Xander C.
Reviews.Content: the oysters here were fantastic! very fresh and delicious. i'm currently living in california, and i prefer atlantic oysters to pacific oysters (particularly dislike kushii and kumamotos). the lobster roll (hot with butter) was also fantastic! probably the best i've had, although i have not tried many establishments in New England. tried the fried oysters on top of pulled pork (forgot what it was called) - the oysters were phenomenal, the pork was average, and the greens were overly sweet... with a pile of raisins in the middle. overall a good dish only because of the fried oysters raising the overall bar of the dish.

Reviews.Author: Susanne H.
Reviews.Content: Kind of modest setting, not crazy about the service. I wasn't that impressed with the clams, to be honest i've had much better around town. On the other hand, the lobster roll with butter on a brioche bun was incredible. Hence, I've to suggest this place.

Reviews.Author: Alexis K.
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the clam chowder, but possibly its just not my style - too soupy (watered down)... But the hot lobster roll was good! Service was good! Oyster selection was (naturally) fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Ashley M.
Reviews.Content: I'm not an oyster-fan so I can't do justice to this tiny little North End hole with the amazing fish. I took my father (a HUGE oyster affecionado) there for Father's Day last year and he went crazy. He swears Duxbury oysters are the best in the world and that he's never had bigger, better ones than at Neptune. As for me I had a creative ceasar and a fish dish that practically made me cry, it was that good.   However, tiny and crowded are the operative words (as with more North End) haunts, so be prepared.  Oh I almost forgot - amazing wine list as well! You need good wine to accompany your fish, no?

Reviews.Author: Leah R.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for a late afternoon early supper. Started off with a few oysters as well as a glass of Portuguese Vinho Verde, which was followed by the greatest lobster roll I have ever eaten. (and I've tasted a few from distinctive places in New England). The grilled brioche roll was chock full of sweet, buttery lobster . . . so fresh and so test. I am destined to be back!

Reviews.Author: Annie M.
Reviews.Content: yummmaaayy hot lobster roll. YUMMAAYYy!!!

Reviews.Author: Matt L.
Reviews.Content: If you look up seafood restaurants in Boston, you may come up with over 100 choices in downtown alone. However, not all are what they are cracked up to be. Bring in this place, so small you may miss it walking by in the crowded North End. One thing you won't miss is the line sometimes outside the door to get in. The place may look small, and there isn't much to it and it is always crowded, but it is probably some of the best seafood I have tasted not only in Boston but all of New England. The menu contains an array of raw bar choices and delicious appetizers and creative entrees. Plus it houses a spectacular wine and beer list. You may have trouble getting a seat, but sitting at the bar is just as good. We ordered this Neptune Plateau Platter, which offered samples of lobster, crab, oysters, littlenecks, clams and shrimp. Everything tasted perfect and top it off with an order of fried clams which was out of this world! The staff moves quick here and is helpful and attentive. Plus for what you get, the prices are not bad. It is a close quarters vibrant place but that adds to the charm and they do not take reservations so I recommend getting there early. Highly recommended and a place I will return to in the future! Simply put ....awesome!

Reviews.Author: Timothy E.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. One of the best meals I have ever had. Plan ahead to get there early as you will wait, but they take your name and call you when they are ready, giving you time to explore the surrounding area. The chowder is fantastic and the Seared Georges Bank Scallops were divine. Staff is friendly and the small space is surprisingly welcoming. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine B.
Reviews.Content: I love throwing these slimely little nuggets down my gullet.  I also like opening up the hatch and bombing back a few cold drinks.  Classy joint and I usually don't fit in but its worth looking like a bum and having a good dinner.

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty good, a little bit short of my expectations.  The oysters were very good, I liked how they had a little sheet with the explanations of each kind from each region and what to expect in the flavors.  I am a big oyster fan and was very pleased with every one that I tried.  The first disappointment was the amount of time it took for each dish to come out.  I felt like the service was a little slow, the waitresses and bartenders were all extremely nice and good at what they do, but the food preparation was slower than I would have expected.  The next disappointment was the scallops, I don't know what possessed the chef to think that dousing the plate with honey would be a good idea, because it simply is not.  The dish was far too sweet and lacking a bit of citrus or sourness.  I also had the lobster roll which was absolutely amazing.  The amount of lobster they include is awesome AND WORTH THE PRICE!  I will definitely come back here for the oysters and lobster, but maybe try and come earlier in the day to avoid a crowd. The prices here are very reasonable, I don't get where people get off in saying it's too expensive, I mean have any of you who are complaining ever purchased and prepared a lobster from a grocery store?  They are expensive, difficult to deal with, and it is time consuming.  For $24 you get about 1-2 lobsters worth of meat perfectly prepared, anybody who thinks that is too expensive needs to stick to the McDonald's $1 menu because that seems to barely be within your budget.

Reviews.Author: Claudia H.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great atmosphere.. a bit pricy but not too bad for Boston. I came here around 7h30 and we had to wait 30 minutes to seat, so getting a seat during prime time is a bit hard. Get there early! Or you can go around the block and get a drink somewhere while you wait. The hostess got my number and called me when the table was ready.

Reviews.Author: John N.
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews about this place and see all the great reviews about how fresh there seafood is plus they had razor clams raw on their menu so I was very excited to go here. We decided just to eat everything raw like clams, kumo oyster, and another one but can't remember the name. The waiter told us that they ran out of the razor clams so i was very disappointed but I was here anyway so we order the stuff. I was quite surprise and it was actually fresh and delicious. We had a couple of beer's and one of our friend(brooke) drop a plate so that was very embarassing, can't take her anywhere haha

Reviews.Author: Ron B.
Reviews.Content: The "host" at the front door was a total prick. Totally unnecessary. Tip: If you don't like people and customer service, try finding a job in computer programming. The food is okay but don't spend more than 30 min waiting for it. Just not worth it.

Reviews.Author: Michael U.
Reviews.Content: Owned and operated by Jeff Nance and featuring a mere 44 seats including the raw bar my first impression on entering Neptune was probably the first impression everyone has - sardines - as in "packed in there like sardines;" to say the least this place is a tight squeeze.  With that consideration noted, my second thought on walking past each diner en route to our table was "that looks good - that too - oh, and what is that;" in other words, the product they are putting on the table looks outstanding even from afar and the restaurant smells nothing like an "oyster shack" but rather like the upscale bistro that it is - a bistro of bivalves if you will.With the paper menu already perused during our long wait it would be a short time before our server, a pleasant young man with an astounding knowledge of the myriad types of raw oysters and other seafood combinations on the menu, would arrive at our table with glasses of ice water.  Not an enormous fan of raw oysters myself but pleasantly seated with a direct view into the kitchen I listened as the province, flavor profile, and texture of each oyster was described and within moments one of my co-diners had selected a half dozen that would arrive shucked on ice and by then the rest of our order was decided and we were left with perhaps a twenty minute wait during which beverages never reached less than 1/3 empty.Noting already that service was extraordinary throughout our meal, I will note that the small kitchen's pacing was unfortunately less so - an issue for myself particularly as I ordered a warm appetizer and warm main course with both delivered simultaneously leading to a conundrum as to which would suffer from the air conditioner blowing directly over our heads.  While our server noted that this "shouldn't have happened" even as he delivered the food and tried to make up for it by granting our request for a sample of the a la minute clam chowder it unfortunately did happen and the thin milky lacking both salinity and texture really did not make up for a lukewarm $25 main course.For my co-diners the first ordered the Vitello Tonnato sandwich with roasted veal, tuna tartare, cucumber salad, and spicy wasabi mustard and the second a plate of seared Georges Bank Scallops with Braised Pork Shank, Sienna Farms Root Vegetables, Brussels Sprouts, and Chanterelles.  Graciously allowed to taste a couple bites of each I'll note that despite my feelings about veal/beef in general, the Vitello was actually much more like a creamy and subtle tuna tartare sandwich than veal - as a matter of fact, if anything the veal mostly served to make the standard tuna seem more textural and fatty; toro-esque if you will and while I personally feel a heftier bread would have helped, it was still quite good.  Moving on to the scallops - they were almost so good that they made me regret my order as the caramelized scallops married perfectly with the slightly sweet pork while the root vegetable and chanterelle combination did likewise with the caramelized Brussels.For my selections, save for the timing issue alluded to above, the flavors at Neptune Oyster remained spot on for both appetizer and main course - the first, the house special Neptunes on Piggyback.  Described as "Crispy Oysters, Berkshire Pig, Golden Raisin Confiture, Pistachio Aioli" and served beneath greens and atop toast these lovely plump oysters arrived perfectly crisp on the exterior and briny and sweet within.  Paired with the tasty shredded pork beneath, sweet raisins, and a splash of acid from the aioli I personally could have done with more oyster and less bread considering the price, but all things being equal this was a surf n' turf combination done quite right.For my main course I simply couldn't resist the hype. Described simply as "Maine Lobster Roll with toasted roll, hot with butter, fries" and checking in at $25 all I can say is that the parts I was able to eat hot were everything you'd expect from hot buttered lobster - no more and no less.  Ample in portion and with the bread nearly saturated with butter while still holding its form I only wish more places in Boston served their lobster rolls in the manner as opposed to cold with Mayonnaise.  Was it worth $25?  Probably not, especially as I was not wowed by the fries - but it was quite tasty and prepared perfectly with a great meat to bun ratio and plenty of butter.With the check divided and paid our exit from Neptune would be almost precisely one hour after we entered the door and even then the wait time for those leaving their name at the door remained "an hour to an hour and a half" and all things being equal I'd say the experience and food was worth the wait at least once-but looking back in retrospect on my trip if I were a local I'd probably not return anytime soon unless I lived in the neighborhood given the quality, size, convenience, and reservations system of their new competition near Fenway - Island Creek Oyster Bar.

Reviews.Author: Analisa S.
Reviews.Content: The hostess is a snooty woman who gives herself a little too much importance. Go down the street to Rabia. Same oysters less attitude.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie G.
Reviews.Content: YES YES YES!!!After a long, sun soaked, cold watered, overly drunk, baby hat stealing day at Singing Beach at Manchester-by-the-Sea, a crew of us emerged from the commuter rail, on to a four person pedaled bike and ended up in North End. Surrounded by gaggles of tourists in the hot sun, we ended up at Neptune thanks to Angel's gentle guidance. The restaurant is small but not that cramped-there was a cool simple long bar that I would totally sit at with one other person. Our table was clean, almost kitchen like and we got to sit next to the open door since it is under-air conditioned. With families in their suburban dressed best, we plopped down with sand in our breasts and I am sure reeking of alcohal and ocean and giant bags of wet towels and everyone was cool with it. We each got to pick oysters from a long list like when you order sushi, and the prices can start to rack up. But I had never really had oysters before (only started eating seafood about a year ago) but I was in a very special place. Served on a large plate of ice and two kinds of sauce, I also ordered a very simple large shrimp cocktail for myself. I loved one so much, the Nova Scotia one I think, I ordered one more for myself and they served on a tiny little plate of ice and wedge of lemon-god I just love small miniture things! I also shared the PEI Mussels with Angel and they were damned tasy-recommend getting hot bread to sop up the buttery sauce (although I still love Central Kitchens Mussels the best). We ordered some kind of peach nectar and champagne drinks, and the eel and yellowtail salad one woman had was amazing (like sushi...in a salad!) and another one had a real delicate salmon salad that hit the spot.The waitresses were totally chill and competentant. I thought about coming here again just the night after. My god. I cannot wait to come again!

Reviews.Author: Tamra A.
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, amazing seafood. Sit at the bar. It's pricey food but worth every penny. I could move to Boston just to be closer to places like this.

Reviews.Author: Jenny S.
Reviews.Content: my friend in boston said that the ONE PLACE i absolutely had to try before i left was neptune oyster for their LOBSTER roll..honestly this place is WAY too small. and they need to expand or get a new location!! we came at 730 on a sunday night and they wouldnt seat us because there was already a 1.5 hour wait in front of us!!.. so we asked if we could order to go AND THEY DECLINED!!!.. that was the worst part.. SO we came back the next day RIGHT WHEN they opened at 11:30.. this time we were seated! my friend and I shared a cold mayo lobster roll and a hot butter lobster roll so that we could try both.. it seems like MOST people like the butter hot version but i personally think that is just lobster on bread. and not really a sandwich..i MUCH PREFER the cold mayo version! .. just try both and make your own decision! .. by the way THEY DON'T SKIMP ON LOBSTER.. lobster is OOZING out of the bun and falling off the side in HUGE chunks!.. also comes w/ nice side of crispy fries!the lobster roll was definitely a MUST TRY for a boston trip!my other friend also got the crab salad which wasn't bad but i'd go for the lobster rolls!!

Reviews.Author: Marty S.
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing!   Was told they were too busy for takeout.    No lines, but was told I could wait for a table and then have the order packed to go!   The table wait was 45 to 60 minutes.  I can't comment on the food, but the service/reception was just bad business!

Reviews.Author: Amanda S.
Reviews.Content: what an extremely memorable and amazing experience. i will never forget it, and this place will always have a special place in my heart. i can't wait to go back one day.to start, my dining companion and i decided it was smart to have oysters. we had::- watch hill, from westerly, ri. they were medium-sized with a medium salt content and a sweet, buttery finish. - kumamoto, from willapa bay, wa. they were small, sweet, plump, and creamy with hints of honeydew melon. - kusshi, from deep bay british columbia. they were small with a low salt content and a sweet cucumber finish.all were delectable, and amazingly palatable at 11ish in the morning. i did not regret it.after our oysters, we each had a bowl of the clam chowder. WOW. this clam chowder has ruined all other clam chowders for me. it was so light and more brothy (because, as i learned, that's how it *should* be), filled with decadence. they didn't skimp on the clams, either. i could eat it during any season.finally, we finished with maine lobster rolls. WOW.::pause for dramatic effect::..WOW. these were the end-all, be-all for me in terms of lobster rolls. at $25, they aren't cheap, but boy do you get what you pay for. everything from the roll to the luscious, generous chunks of lobster are simply divine. the fries were way too salty for me, but i didn't care because that wasn't what i was there for. also, we ordered them both ways (hot with butter and cold with mayo), and you really can't go wrong.it is an extremely tiny space, so get there early or be prepared to wait. luckily, there are tons of ways to stay entertained in the north end. make sure that when you *do* eventually get seated, you savor every bite. it'll be over before you know it.

Reviews.Author: Jia Z.
Reviews.Content: Very very good food, both from the kitchen and the raw bar. I have been here about 5 or 6 times in the past year for both lunch and dinner. There is usually a wait for dinner, but not for lunch on weekdays. If you plan to go for dinner, and it is already pretty late(9pm), call first because they may not have any more free seatings that night. Oysters are great, the shrimp cocktails, crab claws are also good. The raw bar's prices are completely reasonable, comparable to seafood restaurant chains, but the quality is much better. There are specials for each day. On Mondays the special lobster spaghetini is really good, it is pricey at $38, but worth it. The hot lobster roll is the best! The seafood stew very good as well. The only thing I have had that was not completely amazing was a fish sashimi appetizer plate. Okay wine selection by the glass, few but good beers.

Reviews.Author: Doris K.
Reviews.Content: I was sadly disappointed. We went here because I have some people that were out of town visiting and because it was my birthday. We tried many of the raw oysters and I wasn't that impressed. The best ones were the ones from Nova Scotia, and the most expensive of course. The cherrystone calms weren't at all sweet, more salty. The waitress kind of messed up our order so we ended up with three fish dishes. I can't remember what they are anymore because it was a while ago but one of them tasted very fishy while the other two were pretty good. Their calm chowder is a lot watery then expected and I feel that they put too much "crunchy stuff" and not enough calms. I'm disappointed that they ran out of vanilla lobster and because the waitress messed up we didn't get to try the lobster roll. I also felt that most of the things were too pricey.

Reviews.Author: Tyler C.
Reviews.Content: tastiness: :-)wallet: $@#!%!wait staff: :-)

Reviews.Author: Raymond W.
Reviews.Content: The wait is ridiculous. I was determined to eat at Neptune for years, but never put the effort until now. I took some out of town friends here at 3:30 on a Saturday and the wait was 1.5 hours. We placed our name and number and took a long walk around the North End, stopped by a few stores, recited The Midnight Ride of Paul Revere, walked through the chaos of Haymarket, Quincy Market and all the way back. Luckily the seating time was pretty accurate and we were seated in the back corner. The server was very friendly and helpful with suggestions especially with my friend who had an unfortunate crustacean allergy. We started with some raw oysters, steamed cherrystone clams, and got a complimentary spreadable salami spread with toasted bread. For entrees one friend got a crudo and clam chowder, while another friend and I got the hot lobster roll. All I can say is WOW. the amount of lobster meat was generous and the hot butter mess was so decadent and rich. It was my first time trying a hot lobster roll and I don't even know if a regular could ever compare. It's definitely a delicious Boston hot spot, but be ready to plan your day around it and be ready with a back up plan if the wait is just too unbearable.

Reviews.Author: Steve N.
Reviews.Content: had a huge plate of oysters, about six varieties, all very very good. had both lobster rolls (hot and cold) and the cioppino, which was also excellent. prompt friendly service.the bathroom is right at the end of the bar and there's only one so if ya gotta drop a deuce, hold it for later.

Reviews.Author: Ann A.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Friday night and there was a two hour wait.  Luckily, they'll take your phone number and call you when your table is ready so you don't have to just stand around the whole time.  The Neptune burger was worth the 2 hour wait. A cheeseburger topped with fried oysters.  Nom nom nom!!  Not a fan of the fries -- thought they were soggy.  I was disappointed with the lobster roll.  Hot = butter, cold = mayo.  I found it to be mediocre compared to other lobster rolls I had in the city. (go to James Hook for an EXCELLENT lobster roll)

Reviews.Author: Katrina V.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Lobster roll was hands down the best I've ever had. For $25, the roll was over stuffed with lobster meat! Delicious.

Reviews.Author: Randy D.
Reviews.Content: went here for lunch before the dodgers-sox game.  best time to go is between 11 and noon.  after that, you can expect a long wait cuz the place is small, seating no more than 30 at a time.  we had the foie gras and hot lobster roll with fries.the foie gras came fried, on top of some moist cornbread, and was encircled by a peach sauce reduction.  tasty.  the lobster roll was as good as ever.  hot lobster covered with melted butter on top of a grilled brioche roll.  so yummy.  a pint of fresh-tasting guinness (felt like I was in ireland) to wash it down, and i was good to go.  dreaming of my next visit....

Reviews.Author: Laura P.
Reviews.Content: The secret's out that Neptune Oyster is one of the best "new" restaurants in the North End.  Their raw oysters are incredibly fresh, though I have a weakness for the tempura-like fried oysters (or clams, or . . .).  They change their menu frequently so I do try to indulge in items other than the fried oysters.  They used to have this crudo- raw and smoke salmon with bits of fried risotto or carnarolli rice, some greens, and olive oil.  It was pure genius!  Worth every penny!

Reviews.Author: Tracee D.
Reviews.Content: the best burger i ever had in my life.the lobster roll was amazing too. oysters & burgers with a peroni, what really else do you need?I love red boothy banquettes & subway tile so. yes.

Reviews.Author: Kelsey R.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places in the North End! With an over-saturation of Italian food I love the seafood option here. Great atmosphere, nice but not super fancy and stuffy. The raw bar is amazing and the food is great. I had dinner here for my birthday this year and something took a while (we didn't even notice) and they sent out an entire plate of clams while we waited. The wine selection is fantastic and the service is always very nice. A little pricey but definitely worth it for fresh seafood. It's always busy so go early and you can put your phone number in and head down the street for a cocktail, they'll call you when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Corona W.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a cozy little spot in the North End with a great selection of shellfish. The oysters are fresh and so delicious - which is probably why the place is always jam-packed. I usually go for the oysters, but I've also had the lobster roll (amazing!!!), the North End Cioppino, and the fish tacos they have as a special. The North End Cioppino which was quite good, but more of a comfort dish. I ordered it in the summer and wished I had stuck with the oysters instead. It would have been perfect in the dreary depths of winter.....

Reviews.Author: Kerrie K.
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful restaurant in the North End. The food was lovely, fresh and unbelievably scrumptious. We waited for about an hour, nevertheless it was extremely worth it. While we were waiting for the call we walked around the North End and enjoyed exploring while having a glass of wine at a nearby bar. I had a decontstructed Tuna Nicoise, that was so tasty. The restaurant was noisy and enjoyable and filled with noise. We are going to definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Summer L.
Reviews.Content: Delicious oysters and such a great selection. I fell in love immediately. I do agree that the restaurant is small, but that won't take away from my rating as there isn't much they can do about that now.

Reviews.Author: Sara S.
Reviews.Content: Heaping portion of lobster without the mess, sticky hands, or tacky bibs. Just get the hot buttered lobster roll for $25. One of the best decisions, ever.

Reviews.Author: Iyona H.
Reviews.Content: Lobster Roll is a MUST. It comes warm with butter on it.  Went two days in a row. Also ordered the Johnny Cake both days. My husband ordered the burger on the second day. It was very yummy I had a bite. Only reason he ordered the burger because he had already gone there prior to me arriving & had his first lobster roll with his co workers.. He loved it so,he had to bring me once I arrived.Please be prepared for a long wait. The day we went there it was later in the evening & the wait was 1hour & 45 mins. We put our name on the list, left our cell phone number & they will call you when a table is ready for you. We went the next day around 12:30 & the wait was about an hour. It is soooo worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Eric R.
Reviews.Content: oh my yes.yes yes yes.holy yes.Look. I'm not going to beat this one to death. It's spectacular. You need to try this place once, possibly a few hundred times.

Reviews.Author: Dta E.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Tom H.
Reviews.Content: God (or nature) makes the oysters, and Neptune brings them to you fresh. But don't forget the rest of the food-- i've been there twice and both of my entrees were outstanding, as were those of my friends. The service was exactly the way i like it, friendly, helpful, and unobtrusive. Hell, there isn't anything I don't like about this place. Probably my favorite place to eat in the city.

Reviews.Author: Victoria G.
Reviews.Content: The food here was amazing! You have to try the clam chowder and lobster roll. The lobster roll is huge and sooo good. The only con about this place is that is very small. Luckily me and my friend were able to get a table as soon as we walked in. But the wait times are very long and they don't accept reservations.

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: despite having been up in boston for the good portion of a year, i am only now beginning to explore the seafood (esp. lobster) offerings this town has. went to neptune on a monday evening hoping to grab a table. unfortunately, this place is super small! there are maybe 5-6 tables in the place plus a bar for seating. we ended up at the bar nevertheless. a long marble countertop which was pretty close to the tables...so the one thing to watch out for if you choose the bar is the wait staff brushing you throughout the night.the menu is simple. interestingly they have weekly specials and on monday night that would be the lobster spaghetti. we ordered a round of fresh oysters from the lady behind the bar...you select them off a listing (similar to some sushi bars) - each having its own taste description (fruity, etc.). the waitress was very knowledge-able and helped us choose 3 types to sample. all the oysters were extremely fresh.next, onto entrees - we ordered the daily special and a lobster roll.  the lobster spaghetti was not too flavorful, the marinara sauce wasn't seasoned enough...we ended up just picking at the lobster bits. the big hit? the 'warm' lobster roll (which you could also get cold) - soooooooo goooood!!! i would venture to say it's up there as one of my faves (at $24, it's a bit steep).

Reviews.Author: Faith M.
Reviews.Content: Awesome lobster roll! You must go here and order this, you won't be disappointed.  There is a wait for seating but that's okay, go around the corner to Maria's and have a cannoli first :)

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: Oysters and lobster roll with a glass of pinto grigio. Need I say more? Go at an off time to avoid waiting in line.

Reviews.Author: Barbara A.
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 7 and I know what you are thinking - are we insane, and even though it was packed we got seated in about 15 minutes (special circumstances that I won't rub in).As I said in my previous review, I am not a raw bar nut but everyone else I hang with is and since it was my hubby's 50th, it was all about him not me so this review is more about the none raw bar stuff. Suffice to say, all who love raw bar (wellfleet, little necks, island creek, etc.) were unbelievably impressed.We had the fried clams which were divine, but the stand out was the tartar sauce (that's right, I said tartar sauce) - it was so good you could eat it on its own.  The johnny cake app with caviar and tuna was sublime - who knew a pancake could be this yummy.  We also had the scallops with a corn and suckling pig concoction - there were 4 huge scallops cooked just right and it was sitting on this corn melange that was delish.  The lobstah rolls were really, seriously good but so were the french fries that went with it (I know fries, who knew).  We also got a crab dish, but I am allergic to crab so can not fully review, but my friends said it was good.As far as drinks, they have the standard beer and wine but also Bellinis - I had the White Peach and the Blood Orange.  The white peach was more my speed because it was a shade sweeter than the blood orange which was tart-er.  I wish I was not too embarassed to get the blueberry just to compare to the others. Oh, well.I really like this place but they really don't need my business and it shows (even though our waiter was very nice - but seriously he had that too cool for school attitude)

Reviews.Author: Brady B.
Reviews.Content: I finally got to try Neptune! Now I see what all the fuss is about. My friend and I sat at the bar and proceeded to have an orgasmic meal!The Bartender was excellent (my friend thought he should have smiled a bit, but I think he just has a low key personality). Now for the food....we started off with a dozen oysters. Six different varieties varying from local to West Coast oysters....so good!We then shared two lobster rolls. One hot with drawn butter and the other one cold with light mayo and a nice, peppery flavor. Both were huge and and the lobster tasted oh so fresh. The fries were fantastic too!By now you're thinking 'but Brady, why only 4 stars?' Well....when we arrived on a busy Friday night around 7:30 we were told about 90 minutes. We pretty much expected that during peak dining hours on a beautiful Friday night in the summer and seeing as Neptune is wildly popular. The hostess took my friend's phone number and told him that she would call when our spot was ready. We went back about 90 minutes later and she told us that she tried to call us. Hmm...oddly no call was received on his phone, hey, the cellular world is far from perfect right? So we waited about 10 more minutes...not a problem. However during that 10 minutes another friend of mine shows up behind us and told me that he had been told close to 2 hours and that the hostess would call him, etc etc. He then told me how the hostess informed him that she tried to call him as well but yet no such call received. Basically, when you are told at this place that you will receive a call from the hostess when your table or bar spot is ready don't count on it. Minus one star for that.

Reviews.Author: Zander B.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in this afternoon for lunch and had the clam chowder and lobster roll. Wow. The chowder was unique, not as heavy as I expected with red potatoes and full clams.. But man was it good. I pretended to be full for a second a few times so as to not look like a glutton. And the lobster roll.. Man it was great. Got it hot and it was delicious. Be aware we got the last open table for lunch and everyone after us had a 30-40 min wait. Great service and polite staff too.

Reviews.Author: Kayle S.
Reviews.Content: Tiny, overcrowded, too posh, and too expensive.  The oysters were excellent.  I tried several kinds, and the wait staff was knowledgeable about their variety and flavors.  There is also a good variety of other seafood.  If you can afford it, it's definitely worth going for the oyster aficionado's special occasion.

Reviews.Author: DeeDee E.
Reviews.Content: One of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at in my life. I've had the clam chowder (BEST I've ever had!) the oysters...well, you may as well go grabbing them out of the ocean yourself, the (hot) lobster roll (died and went to heaven...) and the jumbo sea scallops...absolutely out of this world. I love this place. Every single little thing about it. The tile, the marble, the lighting, the bar (my favorite place to sit!) the beer, the music! All of it is just perfectly right. I agree with "Tom H." re: the service...right there but not hovering. I'm not sure how the other reviewer didn't notice the oyster pricing (it is on the "chalkboard" AND on the "scorecard") but I'll bet the waitress was wondering, too!  I think perhaps it is a good, safe thing I don't live in Boston...I could O.D. on Neptune Oyster! If I could give it more than 5 stars, I would.

Reviews.Author: Lee G.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster in the North End District in Boston has a lobster roll that is literally exploding with lobster meat.  They have two options for rolls at $25.00, a hot one with butter and a cold one with mayo.  The toasted roll is sweet and compliments the explosion of lobstery goodness very well.  The mayo is slathered on but not overdone, and the pieces of meat aren't just lobster shavings but big and chunky globs from the tail and claw.  An appetizer of oysters is a must since it's half the restaurant's namesake.  The Wellfleets and the Island Creeks are the best since they have the shortest trip from the ocean to your plate.  sandwichguynyc.blogspot.…

Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: Totally fantastic. The tiled floor, mirrored walls, long bar, marble-topped tables is the place for place, or cod, or lobster, or oysters ...  Great French fries, or chips as I'd call them.  Excellent wine list and fun service. What more do you want. I'll certain go back and recommend to others to do the same.

Reviews.Author: Lisa J.
Reviews.Content: Best place to learn about Oysters and taste the largest variety on earth!! Ask their knowledgeable staff and you will get great advice on food and wine.

Reviews.Author: sheev p.
Reviews.Content: Very nice restaurant, bit costly but its worth to go there if you are going with guests. Most of the time it is crowded so sometimes you won't get proper service. They decorate the oyster plate very nicely and they also have good selection of oysters. I tried oyster first time in this restaurant After few days, I visited this place again but I didn't got proper service so I started to visit Union Oyster Bar which is cheaper than this place and having a good service.

Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: Often praised and spoken about, the burger at Neptune Oyster in the North End was my next destination is search of the best burger in Boston. To no surprise, the menu is dominated by fresh seafood, leave it to this nitwit to order one of two dishes on the menu that featured beef, it felt like I was ordering off the kids' menu. It's my fault for thinking this burger would be excellent, how could a burger be any good at a seafood restaurant? It's different, I'll give you that, maybe that's why it's so beloved, when do you ever see a burger with fried oysters? I feel that too often people like or dislike their meals before they even eat. Brioche, ground beef, garlic mayo, oysters and relish may sound appealing, but does it actually work well together? In my opinion, it does not, too much burger and way too much bun overwhelm everything else in this burger, despite being pretty well seasoned.Let's start with the beef, as any good burger blogger should do. It's above average in quality, probably nothing more than Chuck but I could be mistaken, and seasoned nicely. But it's over-cooked most of the way, medium about 75% of the burger, then oddly a perfect medium-rare for my last few bites. Either way it's more or less dry and not juicy like a burger should be. I was excited for fried oysters, but whatever attempt that was made at breading these guys was a failure, with only a couple of scattered bread crumbs managing to cling to the oysters, not like a fully breaded offering I was expecting. And there were only three sad little oysters, really not serving much of a purpose other than the addition of the fresh smell of the ocean, which I don't think I need with my burger, but that's just me. The relish offers a nice tang, but it can't stand up to the size of this burger, which is much too big both in the meat category and in the bread category. My old nemesis brioche comes up again, and fails again, and we've seen this too many times before; it's too much bread and it almost never works on a burger, no matter how pretty it looks.The French Fries are perfect, however, arriving crispy, fried to perfection, and salty in that glorious way that only a French Fry can be. I do believe that the burger could be improved upon by being a bit smaller, I'm not saying every burger has to be thin and griddled just to feed my preference, there's a place in my burger heart for a thick and juicy burger unequivocally, but too often larger burgers initiate more problems. It's not always easy to cook the proper temperature throughout, ingredients get lost along the way (garlic mayo was supposed to be on the burger, could have fooled me) and it can never be harmonious because you end up alternating between a bite of bread, a bite of meat, and the occasional taste of a condiment, but rarely do the ingredients come together at the same time.

Reviews.Author: Irene L.
Reviews.Content: I think this is over rated, compare the price and the food, the one in long beach called john's raw bar (as I remember) which I reviewed is a lot better than this one, and need to wait for an hour for a table. I don't see any freshness or special here!

Reviews.Author: Eleanor V.
Reviews.Content: I am just now waking up from what can only be described as the most miserable 36 hours of my life. And who to blame for this terrible spell? Neptune Oyster Bar. If you call yourself an oyster bar then you should know a thing or two about that briny little shellfish. My friends and I ordered about 20 oysters of local origin to down on Friday night, followed by some lobster rolls. We enjoyed ourselves heartily with the oysters (but, wait!) and even though the lobster roll was expensive and not that special (overcooked, poor quality butter) we left with smiles on our faces (even after waiting 1.5 hours for seats at the bar). Fast forward one hour and I am puking my ever-loving guts out at home and crying for mercy, a process that would repeat itself through the whole night and following day. This was coupled with a nasty fever and other, unmentionable, gross things. The culprit had to have been a bad oyster that in my hungry haste after the long wait I failed to detect.Now, it might seem unfair to write a one star review over one bad oyster. But, again, this is supposed to be an oyster bar. THEY SHOULD KNOW! We didn't go there and spend almost $200 so that one of us might get the lucky oyster that makes you never want to eat seafood again. In a lesser, not renowned establishment, maybe...but C'MON! And the lobster role wasn't great. It just wasn't. And I said it to my friends before I horked it up.So, there it is. I would say eat here at your own risk. If their staff can't tell the difference between a live oyster and a dead one (hah! I couldn't either when I ate it, but I'm not paid to!) then they need to hire new shuckers.

Reviews.Author: in B.
Reviews.Content: Love the lobster roll - fabulous.  Why only 3 stars? Went with two friends, two of us had diet cokes one had soda water.  The bartender asked if we wanted a refill - we said yes.  When the bill came we were charged for SIX sodas.  Apparently they charge for refills.  You would have thought the bartender would have mentioned something.  Asked the bartender about this - he insisted it was "policy" and said something about the "high cost of carbonated beverages".  My friend made the insightful observation that at the pizza joint next door you can get unlimited soda refills with your $3 slice of pizza.  $25 for each lobster roll - and then $15 for the sodas... really??

Reviews.Author: Morgan C.
Reviews.Content: My son ate here recently and was victimized by an unethical server who adjusted the tip.  By the time we discovered the problem it was too late to dispute.  Server name on the receipt was Grouper.Just a warning to check your receipt carefully here.

Reviews.Author: charlene c.
Reviews.Content: It's a pity that the service here is so bad that I would never return, because the seafood is fresh and I live just across the street. The first time I had to deal with the condescending hostess who was very impatient and rude. I decided to return to give it another try. On my second visit, the condescending hostess is still working there and I also had to deal with an equally rude waiter, who add a 20% tip to the bill by himself!!! My receipt states that this Server is "Unagi" I really wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. If you do go anyways, beware and check your bill because the servers here are not only unprofessional but will add a 20% tip on their own for their unacceptable service.

Reviews.Author: Edwin L.
Reviews.Content: a yelp quicky - if you plan to come here... expect to wait forever! otherwise their food is amazing!i recommend the lobster roll...

Reviews.Author: Ryan K.
Reviews.Content: There is a reason that this place is always at the top of all these review sites. Everything about this place is top notch. The food, the staff, the cleanliness the freshness of all the ingredients, you get it. The ONLY knock you could possibly give this place is that it is small and can be extremely hard to get a table. If you are going for dinner, go put your name in early! Don't EVER walk up and think you will just get a table... because you won't!

Reviews.Author: Damon I.
Reviews.Content: A friend was visiting from Los Angeles and we were commiserating over LA's lack of true Italian cuisine and seafood sans fusion flare and avocado.  After reading Annie P's review, off we were to the North End and Neptune Oyster to satisfy our unsated predilections.Neptune Oyster is small and they told us the wait for two would be 45 minutes.  We left a cell number and wandered about until the call came as is customary for a dinner wait in the North End.  The crowd was a little older and more well dressed than us and we were sat at a communal table - *uncomfortable*.  However, all were there to take respite from the cold with raw aphrodisiacs so love was in the air.  We ordered a lovely bottle of riesling and several Oysters to start.  We took the chef's recommendation on the oysters which happened to be pemaquid oysters from Maine with a strong shallot sauce - fresh and savory, mmmm.  For dinner we split the special of the night which was a combination of flash seared marlin and tuna tartar.  The marlin was covered with an avocado (what?!?) wasabi relish and the tuna was topped with a liberal dollop of caviar.  The fish was delish and had such a naturally soft, buttery texture.If you've got someone from out of town who demands Boston Seafood, don't take them to some raucous crab shack, take 'em to this North End niche for a memorable Boston seafood experience.

Reviews.Author: Joe H.
Reviews.Content: This place is stupid good.  Walk in, sit down, no menu needed just order the lobster roll and leave extremely happy.

Reviews.Author: Michael T.
Reviews.Content: I personally don't need aphrodisiacs as I'm ALWAYS in the mood (aka horny), but everyone needs a raw bar fix every few weeks and this is the place to go.  It makes Legal Seafood's darn right illegal for what they serve (I still love you Uncle George!); they have some of the best selections of clams, scallops, and of course oysters around.  The space is cramped, but people are happily slurping away, elbow to elbow.  It makes for a great second or third date place because you really have to sit close to each other and with all the careless, accidental touching of knees and elbows and all the slurping noises and romantic vibes, well...who knows what it could lead to...  Neptune's is definitely a place any self-proclaimed foodie cannot miss.  Two words, three syllables:  Wellfleet Clams!  Booyah...

Reviews.Author: Sophia S.
Reviews.Content: Really loved this place.  Based on the reviews, boyfriend and I got here right before 5pm, I know, super early, but we were seated right away at the bar.  Thankfully we decided to stay because once 5pm hit, the wait started at an hour and then around 6pm as we were finishing up our early dinner, the wait was up to 2 hours.  Ok back to the food.  I'm a huge raw bar fan, so of course I started with 3 clams and 3 oysters. They were fresh, clams were briney and chewy just the way I like it and the oysters were buttery and smooth. I ordered the cioppini stew - spicy with prawns, clams, mussels, salmon, saffron rice. Served with toasted, buttered bread (not your average white bread, I think sourdough), anyway, the stew was perfect. Boston was a cold 30 degrees when we went so this hot, spicy stew hit the spot right away.  My BF got the lobster roll, hot w/ butter (not cold w/ mayo) and it was a good sized with large chunks of lobster. Delicious. The fries that came with it were perfectly salty but soggy.  Overall, this is a great place to visit when in Boston. We stopped by Mike's Pastry (very famous, lines out the door) on the next block to top off our meal.Will be back on my next trip to Boston

Reviews.Author: Megan C.
Reviews.Content: Wanted to love this place... Fiance and I were in Boston for the weekend and prior to going we really researched where we should go to eat.  Being that we both reeeeeeallyyyy love a good lobster roll we checked Yelp and came up with this place.  We knew there was going to be a wait so we scoped bars out ahead of time to chill at.  It is a very good thing we did as there are literally like 8 tables in the whole place and a long bar that isn't used for bar patrons but rather as dinner seating.  We got there at 8:15 and were told it was a 2 hour wait, no biggie and gave our cell phone # to be called when ready.  As we were leaving and mentioning the wait a threesome was walking in, overheard us and said "wow, a 2 hour wait?" (I mention this for later reference...).  So we head across the street to a pub for some drinks, get a call at 10:30 our "table" was ready and head back.  We let the hostess/waitress know who we are and proceed to stand there for 20 minutes, unable to get a drink but watch a few people get up from the bar and the hostess seat the threesome from earlier in the evening that we had spoke to coming in AFTER we had placed our names.  OK that's odd, you called us 20 minutes ago and are now seating a party we know came in after, and are now completely ignoring us.  A simple, "hey guys I know you are waiting it will just be a few more minutes, or can I get you a drink while you stand there in the middle of the restaurant?" Nope, nada.  I actually tried to make eye contact several times and it was clear she was ignoring us. So finally at around 11:15 we are seated at out "table", and by table I mean the bar (which I actually do not mind but the service/rudeness from this server doubling as hostess put me off).  We ended up being really glad we were sat at the bar because our server here was super friendly and really on top of things.  It is cool too because the bar serves also as the raw bar at one end and we were seated there and could see all the amazing-ness being shucked and served. We started with some oysters (wellfleet, kumamoto, and blue points) as well as a couple of the biggest shrimp cocktails I have ever seen; all amazingly fresh and tasty.  Then we each had a lobster roll; I went with the hot roll as was highly recommended and my fiance the cold.  They were decent but definitely not the "knock your socks off" we were expecting and needed some seasoning, I actually liked his better and being the sweetie he is we switched, we thought they would be better though with a different roll, these were too bulky and tasted too charred.  All in all the food was good and most of the service was ok, but I really didn't see the hype.  For Boston I expected better, Luke's and Pearl in NYC blow this out of the water.  To those who read this all the way through, sorry for such a long review :-)

Reviews.Author: Alan S.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is one of my favorite restaurants in Boston. I just wish no one else knew about it. It has the feel of a small neighborhood type restaurant. Unfortunately, everyone in the world knows about it. I've been to Neptune several times over the years. I used to be able to walk in with a relatively short wait. Yesterday, I went there at 12:30pm and the wait was 2 hours. I've had several items on the menu over the years but the menu changes periodically. These days, I really only get the warm lobster roll. A generous portion of lobster cooked in butter and then drizzled with more butter. It really is all that it is cracked up to be. The best lobster roll in the city by a long shot. Worth every penny. If you can stand the wait, a must try if you are in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Seth P.
Reviews.Content: Top North End spot that dishes out great Clam Chowder, Lobster Roll and Oysters from all over US.

Reviews.Author: Cyndy K.
Reviews.Content: Long wait, pricey, great oyster selection, good Italian wine, but the lobster roll was not the best I've had.

Reviews.Author: Bassem S.
Reviews.Content: Great place to sample oysters and delicious hot lobster roll, but can you say overpriced? $25 + a 2-hour wait for a lobster roll is worth it once for the experience, but don't punish yourself and keep going back for more. If you must, get in line at least 30 mins before the restaurant opens and get in with the first wave of seating. The service is pretty efficient - but make sure you're ready to order when the server comes over or you'll have missed your chance for a while! Stay away from the vitello tonnato - strange combo of textures.Tip: Split the hot lobster roll with a friend so you can sample other treats like the (many) oysters, fried ipswich clams, and shrimp and blue crab cocktails.

Reviews.Author: Ilya E.
Reviews.Content: My cousin brought me to this place on Salem St. in the North End and I refuse to go to any other seafood place now. The service is great. Oysters are fresh and the selection is nice. The best part about this place is the lobster roll. Get it warm with butter. Its heavenly. I can't order lobster rolls from anywhere else because Neptune has spoiled me. Truly the best lobster roll in New England.

Reviews.Author: Becca F.
Reviews.Content: I want to go back to Boston just to eat here again. As a frequent visitor of Shaw's in Chicago, I fear I will never be satisfied by another oyster bar after this visit to Neptune. Showed up at 11:45am on a Sunday and was immediately seated. Staff was attentive and we loved watching them prep the shellfish behind the bar. Had a dozen oysters, fish tacos and lobster roll. No frills but all perfect. I usually enjoy my raw oysters with mignonette, but these had such flavor alone, I ate them naked. I could tell the difference between the oysters Neptuen serves and the ones that have to make the trip to Chitown - and the additional hours of travel seem to make a difference.

Reviews.Author: Leroy K.
Reviews.Content: What can I say, another succulent lobster roll with the perfect amount of butter. I havent had a dish yet that wasnt stellar! Can't come to Boston without stopping in.

Reviews.Author: Jesse L.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Neptune Oyster at least 5 times and this place has never disappointed. I have tried practically all the other restaurants in Boston that serve lobster rolls and Neptune Oyster puts them all to shame. You have the option of a cold lobster roll with mayo or a warm lobster roll filled with butter and you are crazy if you don't get it warm. The amout of lobster meat they put in the roll is huge and sometimes even struggle to finish because their is so much lobster meat in the roll. I have never ordered the burger, but my friends all say it is amazing as it is made with fried oysters. Easily the best seafood restaurant in all of Boston.

Reviews.Author: Lyssa D.
Reviews.Content: This place is something wonderful.  We went at an odd hour of the afternoon and it wasn't too busy.  The Lobster roll was brilliant and a must have, with BUTTER.  My cutie had Neptune's on Piggy Back, he said it was a do over.  Next trip, we'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Pilan C.
Reviews.Content: This review is solely for the lobster rolls.  We had heard so much about them, but when we got there we realized that they had a cold one and a hot one, so we got one of each!  The cold one was a very well-executed "traditional" lobster roll. The lobster chunks were huge, the mayo was light, and there was no celery or other filler like that.  Delicious. The hot one was also totally DELICIOUS, but the idea of it kinda was mind blowing. -- warm lobster + butter sauce!!  I never knew you could put that in a sandwich. I'm just a bit sad that I never discovered this place when I was living in Boston, and only discovered it now, 5 years later. The skin-on fries were also very tasty, but clearly played second (or third, or fourth) fiddle to the lobster roll. A bit expensive ($25 each) but well worth it, especially if it's a special occasion. I can't wait to go back to Boston again.

Reviews.Author: Molly K.
Reviews.Content: First stop was for lobstah rolls at Neptune Oyster (food first, obviously). Neptune Oyster opens at 1130am, and if you're interested in grabbing lunch, you should be there as close to opening time as possible, as they do not accept reservations and the wait can be up to 2 hours (especially for dinner). We popped our name on the list, were given our 45 minute wait time, and went on a mini-stroll through the North End for some coffee while we waited. After 45 minutes, we received our call and returned to be promptly seated at the cozy bar. Most important word: cozy. The space is small, with only about 15 chairs seated at the bar and a few tables pressed against the wall. The tin ceilings with the ceiling fans reminded you it was a warm breezy summer days as you peruse the surprisingly lengthy menu. We decided to split 1 hot lobster roll and 1 cold lobster roll (so we could try both, of course) while T went for the fried clams. the kitchen contains the whole kitchen...2 people....small space, providing a surprisingly lengthy and delicious menu. In my opinion the hot lobster roll blew the cold lobster roll out of the water, but feel free to go and make your own decision!Pictures and more on -- ----

Reviews.Author: Kelly H.
Reviews.Content: damn it boston... why all the 5 stars?? okay, of course i had to come here as this is one of the highest yelp rated places to try... and i also read they have a killer lobster roll...here's my take on the place: $2.5/oyster?! c'mon... seriously? i can it somewhere else for a better price!  $25 lobster rol... okay, i must say, their lobster roll is much better than yankees... there's flavor and the meat is in chunks! so i'll give them that... the lobster roll is decently good... but in my perspective, if anyone cares... it's on the brim of making my One and Done list.... =T

Reviews.Author: Melanie M.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! An amazing raw bar and one of the best lobster rolls i've ever had. My friends and I got the hot and cold lobster rolls just to compare, definetely will only order the hot buttered lobster roll next time I go. The oysters and so fresh and taste just like the sea. Service was great too. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Jack N.
Reviews.Content: Let's just say I ate the .5 star. The lobster roll is absolutely delicious, as everyone here pointed out. But having been to Legal Lobster the night before, this place is rather small for brunch. I love the fact that they have 12 different types of oysters to choose from including kumamotos. I think I had the wellfleet but it was a bit salty instead of fruity, like their check off menu suggested. So wish I took a pic of the list of the oysters. All the dishes were excellent. The only wish is that maybe the lobster roll is cheaper ($24). It is excellent, with probably as much meat as a whole lobster, but when I have a friend that said he can get lobster roll for $8 (in Maine), it makes me wonder, is it really worth it? Damn, I have to go to Maine to find out.

Reviews.Author: Eric D.
Reviews.Content: I would seriously move from So Cal to Boston just so I could eat at this place once or twice a week, it's that GOOD!!!!!!!  I was in beantown for 4 days and ate here twice! What can I say that hasn't been said...Food and servioce are FANTASTIC!! Don't complain about wait you wussies! Get there early before they open or around 2-3 during the week, ofcourse the weekends are going to be crazy! Put your name and number in and they will call you! Lobster roll hot w/ butter was the best! Fried clams were so damn fresh and light and the real deal! Johnny cake with trout tartare was one of my favs!! Can't wait to go back to Boston just to stuff my face at Neptune! I love you guys.....:)

Reviews.Author: Shane B.
Reviews.Content: It lived up to the reviews!

Reviews.Author: Tasty Bee Review S.
Reviews.Content: Great clam chowder and mussels. Noisy but enjoyable. Great wait staff.

Reviews.Author: Gary B.
Reviews.Content: Visiting from Baltimore area, this place was recommended for the lobster roll. I've never had one, so when I got there I asked the waitress which is better the mayo or the butter lobster roll she said the butter. So for $ 25 you get a 6 inch lobster roll saturated in butter. Oh yeah with a side of fries. I could not finish it. It had plenty of meat but to much butter, and the roll was just soggy from the butter bath. I wouldn't recommend it, also avoid the clam chowder, it was so watery and no flavor at all. I think I'll stick with my Maryland crabcakes and cream of crab soup. Sorry Boston this place was a gross.

Reviews.Author: Susan S.
Reviews.Content: Ditto all the other rave reviews!  The lobster roll was amazing, we enjoyed great wine, and attentive service!  Looking forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Author: Danielle F.
Reviews.Content: People have written such high praise for this place and I will not be deviating from the trend.  Have been on several occasions, however after a great meal last night, I was inspired to write a review.  Yes, it is pricey, however they have a great raw bar selection coupled with a great wine list (with good by the glass options as well) and phenomenal food.  Don't be fooled by a limited menu, this place is a guaranteed good meal.  Had the cioppino last night which was loaded the garlic and saffron - so it had quite a zip to it.  The meal had a wonderfully flavorful broth and the garlic was sliced paper-thin.  If you want a good red, check out the Nero D'Avola.  Our server was well-versed in the wine list and was able to make good suggestions to my friend who was undecided.

Reviews.Author: Thuy L.
Reviews.Content: W.O.W!!! Hot Lobster rolls ARE the WAY to go. I love Lobster, lobster rolls, lobster mac n'cheese, but I've never had HOT lobster rolls (aka buttered hot dog roll with buttered lobster). But be warned, this place was PACKED!!! We had friends from out of town visit and they had never had lobster rolls before so we thought we'd check out Neptune's. They don't take reservations so we got there around 6:30 and put our name in for a table. The hostess said it would probably be 2 hours, so we left our phone number so we didn't have to wait in line for 2 hours which was nice. However when they did call, they apologized for calling 20 minutes too early, and even when we did get there---they had "sold out" of tables and were no longer accepting names for tables. People had to take the chance to sit at the bar. We were waiting on a table that had had their check and was just sitting there for approx 45 minutes.  I don't know how they sat there for that long. It was extremely warm in the restaurant due to the lack of air flow probably due to the number of people crammed in there.  Plus it's so crowded that you would think that once they are finished with their meal, they would be mindful of the other people, sign their check, and leave.  But that's not Neptune's fault that they are so desired.  Was it worth the wait? Hell F*ing Absolutely!!!!

Reviews.Author: Lauren L.
Reviews.Content: Such a cool place.  Everyone said this was a must-try when visiting Boston, and I can see why.  We put our name in around 2PM and were told it would be a 2.5 hour wait.  The place is pretty tiny, but completely worth the wait.  It's really cool inside with white marble tables and a daily raw bar menu complete with wine-like descriptions of different oysters to try.  The biggest mistake was not getting more oysters - they were the best I've every had.  The lobster roll is one of the most popular items, and it was definitely tasty.  There's a huge helping of lobster inside a buttery roll and served with fries.  I didn't need to eat until breakfast the next day.  Everything was enjoyable and delicious, and it was definitely a highlight of the trip!

Reviews.Author: Jen Y.
Reviews.Content: The Lobster Roll. Great Lobster. Great Roll. Butter. Juicy. Tender. Perfect.Expect a wait.Also, oysters, fries, the steamed littlenecks, the bouillabaisse special.I haven't tried the yellowfin tuna appetizer yet, but it looks amazing.

Reviews.Author: Tucker C.
Reviews.Content: Monday night special.  Lobster spaghettini is amazing, just amazing.

Reviews.Author: Laura J.
Reviews.Content: Great seafood spot in the North End with a ton of charm and rustic pazazz. Love the interior decoration. Has a slight brasserie feel with the large mirrors on the walls, marble bar and table tops, and brass fixtures. The atmosphere is busy but there is still an intimate feel and its not so loud you cant hear whomever you are talking to. I went with the same person both times I've visited Neptune Oyster and both times, we both LOVED everything we had. Whats funny is that on our first trip back in December, we loved what we had so much that we ordered the exact same meal on our second trip together this past week. We started with a selection of oysters including some wellfleets and kumamotos. The mignonette served on the side add's such a refreshing bite that really compliments the sweet and briny nature of the oyster. For our entree's, I ordered the tuna ribbons salad, similar to a nicoise. This salad is so incredibly fresh and delicious I cant even begin to explain. If you like fresh raw tuna, this salad is where its at. The aioli style dressing included on the dish adds such a depth to all the ingredients, tying the eggs, greens, haricot vert, , capers and tuna together perfectly. He ordered the vitello tonnato, a sandwich of epic proportion. Holy sandwich. The bread is a texas toast style, toasted perfectly and stuffed with the most luscious tuna tartare and layered with roasted veal. Its then topped with a crunchy cucumber salad and mustard sauce to boot. The play on the classic italian dish, traditionally served as a veal cutlet topped with a tuna sauce, is phenominal to say the least. If my friend wasn't going to order the sandwich this time, you better believe that I would have gladly done so.
