The contrast in flavors and textures is enough to make my mouth water but the execution of this sandwich is flawless. I highly recommend trying it. The fries served on the side are killer as well.Other notables to try, which I have been told are simply fab, include the hot lobster roll and the grilled bronzini. Absolutely one of my favorites in the Boston area.

Reviews.Author: Yibing Q.
Reviews.Content: lobster roll was really good! clam chowder was close to the divine!!!!! oysters were so incredibly fresh as well!this place is immensely small - and so avoid coming in big groups. you would be sitting next to strangers.our wait was around 40 minutes on a Thursday evening. however, they take down the mobile numbers of people on the wait-list ... and they would give you a call when your table is ready. (ie, you won't have to waste your youth away waiting outside of the restaurant ... go check out the nice shops nearby or grab a cuppa further down the street!)this is a BOSTON-MUST-DO!!!

Reviews.Author: Abby B.
Reviews.Content: in my search for the ultimate lobster roll in boston, all of my sources insisted, nay, demanded that i try this place. i was not disappointed. i had it warm. it came tossed with butter (perhaps a tad too much) on brioche, with fries. it was everything i hoped it would be and more. my companions had the clam chowder and a roasted celery salad, both of which received an enthusiastic thumbs up. i feel the tiniest bit of guilt because one of my dinnermates is a vegetarian, and all she could eat was some lettuce and my fries. but honestly only a smidge -- i would push my grandmother down the stairs for another lobster roll.parking is a bitch, but the restaurant is located close to the haymarket station on the green line. it was crazy busy when i went (saturday night, regatta weekend), and the wait was an hour and a half. i'd do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Author: Norwin E.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll I've had so far! Huge chunks of lobster all buttered up. Nicely toasted bread roll to come with it. Also comes with a side of fries which I found were too salty for my taste, but it's ok since it was all about the lobster roll. Also  had a couple of the kumamoto oysters and they were really light and refreshing. They were not salty at all. Come out here if you want to splurge, have a special occasion, or have visitors. The restaurant is very small and intimate. You WILL be sharing space with someone else at your table or at the bar. Gets pretty packed no matter the day of the week. It seems to lighten up around 9pm. Put your name down and walk around somewhere until they give you a call. Despite the prices, this is one of the best that Boston has to offer

Reviews.Author: H S.
Reviews.Content: As I get older (read: as I go to more bars and restaurants and write more reviews on Yelp), I get stingier with my stars. I hang on to those stars like 7-year-old Holly hung on to her First Communion money. I like how at the beginning of Yelping, everyone got five stars. You served me food? Five stars. You served me a beer from tap? Five stars. But now old and jaded, the number of five-star ratings have gone way down. Now it's like a holiday when it happens.And yeah, Neptune Oyster calls for a holiday. Probably the best oysters I've ever had, and a wonderfully clean and classy bar. It's a small place, but we went after dinner and didn't have to wait. Our bartender was sweet and the wine was good. Like I said, oysters were amazing, and I adore the raw bar menu. We split the special (blue fish over lamb) which was also phenomenal. Perfect little place in the North End... by no means a hidden secret or a divey/inexpensive restaurant, but so worth a visit. I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne W.
Reviews.Content: We came here last weekend for a celebratory dinner and arrived at around 6:30. We were seated promptly but with a bit of attitude from the waitress (there's not really a host here). An annoying thing about this restaurant is how cramped it is; even though you can get your own table for 2, it's pushed against another table for 2, so basically your party of 2 will be a party of 4, except you just won't know the other two people there. We didn't particularly like the mother and daughter sitting next to us with their snooty air and got especially ticked when they ate about 3 freaking clams from their entire appetizer and left the rest to be tossed. So wasteful... We had those clams in the wine and garlic broth as a starter, and wow were those good. Nice, garlicky, with a bit of sand in the clams but not too much to notice it terribly. I loved the broth; wish we had more bread (we got only got 2 tiny pieces of bread, AFTER asking our waitress, and then we asked for another helping) to sop up that clammy goodness. We also had the oysters, of course.. I can't remember all of them, but I do remember that we had the kumamoto and the pemasquid. This was my first time having raw oysters, and while they were very fresh and tasted interesting (sorry, this lack of detail is due to my lack of oyster experience), I'm not sure I'd want to get them again. We then shared the cioppino and the lobster roll. The cioppino had too much heat in it; yes, on the menu it says it's spicy, but I really don't think the average person can take that much heat. I can tolerate slightly more than the average person and so can my boyfriend, but we both agreed that if they had to make it spicy to give options to diners if they wanted it mild, medium, or very spicy. Kind of ridiculous. But the lobster roll was DELICIOUS -- we had it hot with butter in a roll (how else can you have a lobster roll?), and there was a very generous amount of lobster. All the seafood we had that night was fresh. The service, though, is something I was really upset about. From the moment we walked in we could tell the waitress had an attitude problem. She gave us a dirty look while we were getting seated, and in addition to that, she explained the sides and specials to the table next to us but didn't let us know that we had those options as well. And then, she also didn't give us the full wine list, but she DID do that for everyone else around us. I didn't even realize it until I noticed that all the other tables around us had one more menu than we had, and this was after we already ordered our drinks. We wondered if this may have happened since we were the only non-Whites in this restaurant... well, we could never really prove it. Our main courses also took a very long time to come; we probably spent over an hour waiting for them to come, which is really unacceptable. This isn't some large restaurant where several hundred people are being served. We asked the waitress if our dishes were coming, and she had this agitated look on her face and insisted they were coming. They didn't come for another 20 minutes after she said that. While the food was great and the seafood fresh, I'm still hesitant about coming here again because of the poor service and the long wait for the main courses. That waitress really needs to get her panties out of a bunch.

Reviews.Author: Byron C.
Reviews.Content: Most famous restaurant in Boston? Even my vegetarian friends have heard of this place so I had to try it out. Clam chowder: Huge disappointment, especially from a clam chowder lover like myself. Watery, bland and I hurt my teeth biting into something that looked like a piece of broken clam shell. 1/5Neptunes on piggyback: Wasn't expecting much out of this as I had no idea what the heck this was, and even after reading the menu I still don't. All I know is it tasted pretty good. 4/5Crab claw: A lot smaller than I thought a $5 crab claw would be. 2/5Lobster Roll: The most famous of neptune oyster's dishes. On the plus side despite costing $25 you're definitely getting your money's worth. The roll isn't very long but they pack it to the brim with so much lobster some of it is guaranteed to fall on your plate. The taste was just okay though. The lobster is definitely quality but they slobber it with way too much butter and the bread becomes greasy and soggy if you don't finish it all right away. 3/5Triton Plateau: A platter consisting of jumbo shrimp, raw oysters, clams, mussels, crab mix and lobster mix. It doesn't look like a lot of food at first, especially for $58, but believe me the crab and lobster will fill you up in a hurry. Raw seafood is pretty much the same everywhere as long as it's fresh but the crab and lobster did not disappoint. 3.5/5

Reviews.Author: Madame T.
Reviews.Content: This place was on my list for ages and I finally got there while in Boston recently.   There was no one greeting at the door, I did not see any waitstaff, so I sat on an empty barstool.  WRONG!  Go back to the door and wait for the hostess.  The hostess came out, I gave my cell # and was told the wait would be a 1/2 hour.  I did not want to wander too far in a new 'hood, so when the 1/2 hour was up I popped  in to check the status.  WRONG!  The hostess spoke to me in a reprimanding tone, pointed to the sidewalk and told me to wait outside.  Yeah, right!  I got a perfectly good slice of pizza in Beacon Hill for 3 bucks instead.

Reviews.Author: Bill E.
Reviews.Content: I had a great lobster roll! I was starving and had just gotten off the train from NYC and this took care of it. I had a choice between hot or cold, I chose cold (traditional, right?) It was a cool room, looked older than it really was. It was about half full, service was good, friendly and sincere as I sat at the counter solo and read the paper. I'll return.

Reviews.Author: Theodore B.
Reviews.Content: omga boston must in the heart of lil italycramp seatinglobster roll is a must and the neptune burger is gluttony personified=)Oh and just watched the town with ben afleck... so nice of a setting - who would mistaken that neptune pic in the background of the movie

Reviews.Author: Melody H.
Reviews.Content: yeah, yeah. the food is good. they have a good oyster selection and they are FRESH. the hot lobster roll tasted good but the meat was kind of overcooked and definitely not worth that much money.am i leaving something out? oh yeah, waiting FOUR HOURS for a damn meal. that's ridiculous. first of all, we were quoted 2-3 hour wait, for TWO people, when we arrived before 6:30. alright, fine. i get it, it's the weekend.  i really wanted to try this place so we sucked it up and went shopping. we called 2 hours later to check in, and the girl merely said that she had quoted us UP to three hours wait, and that it would indeed be at least another 45 minutes. okay, yes, you did say 2-3 hours. we returned the said 3 hours later, only to find a few parties ahead of us still waiting. we were past the point of no return, we weren't going to cave in despite our hunger. another 30 minutes rolled by. a few more parties get seated. another 30 minutes. finally, she calls our name and we don't even get a table but seats at the bar. it is now 10:30. the apathetic bartender is slow to give us water, and to take our order, and appears to prefer chatting with his fellow co-workers rather than attend to us. we put our order in, and the oysters arrive fairly promptly. however, the hot food takes another 30 minutes to arrive. so by the time we really get to eat, it's almost 11:30. are you kidding me?? i'm pretty sure he forgot to order our lobster roll and cioppino. i know this because we watched the surrounding customers (who were clearly seated AFTER us) get their food before us. In fact, the guy next to me had devoured his lobster roll and was ordering another platter of oysters by the time our food got to us. But that's not what made me most upset. What I was peeved about was the fact that when I asked our bartender where our food was, he simply said, "it's coming" and turns around to avoid us. no apology, no nothing. also, they really need to expand this place.i think i'm done ranting. if i hadn't had to wait at all, i probably would have given this place a 3-3.5 based on the food. the oysters, yes, but the other stuff, i can get better elsewhere. you can get better customer service elsewhere too.

Reviews.Author: Mansi M.
Reviews.Content: Been in Boston for a while now and i FINALLY made it to Neptune Oysters. We got really lucky went at an odd hour - 3:00 PM on a Thursday and we still had to wait for about 15 minutes. It is not that bad as they take down your name and phone number and call you when your table is ready.We ordered  some amazing oysters from ME and MA and all were really yummy!We got the lobster roll, Clam Chowder - with the oyster crackers and the Clams.The Clams were my absolute fav - they had a nice gravy and spice to it. Probably the best i have hadLobster rolls- Were great the warm bun and the amazing flavor of butter and lobsters is a must tryClam Chowder- was different than i have tried else where but was good as i could actually taste the clams and potatoes vs. creamIf you are a seafood lover - u must go

Reviews.Author: Mariam C.
Reviews.Content: BEST SEAFOOD IN TOWN! LOVE everything about this place. Service is good, can't blame them for the small space and the high demand. Due to it's popularity, there is the occasional line out the door but it's worth the wait.  Fresh oysters, great lobster roll never a dull seafood dish.  Love every dish on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: We got lucky and there was no wait.  Woohoooo.  The waiter told me that on Saturdays the wait can be 3 hours long.  Dang!  If you can, go on the weekday!  Spent 25 bucks for a hot, buttery lobster roll and it was goooooooood!  I had to force myself to eat slow bc I could have eaten the whole thing in 60 seconds flat.  (Not because it was small but because of all it's tasty, buttery goodness.)  Note:  If you have kids...it's a small space and they don't have high chairs.  Wish they had at least one high chair but I guess they don't have many families coming to eat here.  Anyway, if you're in Boston and searching on Yelp for the BEST Lobster Roll, just stop...stop reading all the 400 and something reviews Neptune Oyster has.  *EDIT:  Oh my bad, they have 737 reviews.  DAMN! *  Save yourself some time and just goooooooo.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Thomas F.
Reviews.Content: The oysters and clams were tops. They were fresh, plump and skillfully shucked. I had the lobser roll hot. Then I had the lobser roll cold. It was fantastic both ways. A prefect breakfast any day.

Reviews.Author: Sandy W.
Reviews.Content: Everything at this place was yummy!  We went for a late lunch and the waiter was super friendly...we had some mimosas, oysters, a lobster roll and the yellowtail crudo was to die for.  The waiter gave us a delicious dessert wine after our meal...on the house.  I can't wait to go back next time i'm in boston.

Reviews.Author: Nicola P.
Reviews.Content: This place still gets only one star. Went to "try" for the Neptune burger a few weeks ago and got the last two seats at the bar. JACKPOT! Things are looking up here people!! Then I see him, the horrible horrible bartender. Great, we have a 50/50 chance of success. Order up one dozen oyster and waited and waited for him to take our meal order. Finally, I waved him over and said "Maybe we should order now?" Ok great," We will have 2 Neptune burgers." Then out of his mouth, i see his lips moving, but in slow motion and i know we have a problem here... he says "Sorry, we are out of the burger" Mind you, it is 6pm on a Monday night.. how on earth are you out of the burger??? Maybe you should have said something when we sat down "hey we 86-ed the burger, just in case you wanted it..." Now, that burger is truly an amazing burger, but i am so fed up with the service at the bar and the fact that they constantly "run out" (i personally think they purposely dont have it because it is the least expensive item on the menu) that i really cant do this anymore. Dining out shouldnt be based on chance and the hopes that you carry something that is always on your menu. So, even though you were the place where i fell in love with my now boyfriend Neptune Oyster, you and i are done.

Reviews.Author: Chi J.
Reviews.Content: Truly disappointing, overpriced, cramped, unfriendly.  The clam chowder was decent, my lobster salad had a piece of lobster on it the size of my pinky at most, the lobster roll was really good.  Most importantly the service was rude, our waiter told us we could move the table a bit because it was to far from the bench for me, than the other waitress came over and moved the table back out rudely saying 'don't move the table'.  I just could not believe it, than over a 100 bucks for two people... never again...

Reviews.Author: M D.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars.  Maybe more but will have to go back.  Tips: Plan on a wait  (at least an hour) and best to go in small group...cannot accommodate large parties.   Great selection of oysters and though place is small has a great cozy feel, ate at bar.  Oysters were FRESH and wait staff had great knowledge, really enjoyed them.  Also had a lobster roll, hot--did not disappoint, seasoning makes it great along with the toasted bread.  As with all reviews--agree one of the best if not best I've had!  A little pricey but overall worth the trip and meal--may slightly edge out Island Creek in terms of oysters.

Reviews.Author: Pat M.
Reviews.Content: Lunch today was my first time here and I was pleasantly surprised.  Neptune is a very small place, only 10 tables or so and a bar where you can also eat.  The menu is short and simple, but the food is outstanding and done very well.  They have a wide variety of oysters from all over to meet just about anyones taste.  The lobster rolls were to die for, the bread was soaked in butter and they are not skimpy on the lobster meat!  I also recommend the veal and tuna tartar sandwich, it was not what I was expecting, but man was it excellent!I will definitely post more when I go back for diner in the future, this was a great find!

Reviews.Author: Foodlover C.
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for 2 days and saw that this place had such high reviews on Yelp so decided to try it. It was the most over-rated restaurant I have been to, I almost think it is a shame that this place is regarded a Boston institution. The food was slow and the service was unattentive. The lobster roll was very average and definitely not worth the price point of $25. Luke's lobster roll here in New York for $16 which tastes so much better. Don't even bother with this place, its not worth the wait, the hole you will have in your pocket or the disappointment from unrealistic expectations.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this place.  Life is too short, money too precious and other choices too ample.  We planned to meet there for a brothers' reunion.  My first brother got there first, had a rude reception trying to get a seat for him and for me.  When I arrived, I was met my a dragon lady who was so rude and nasty.  No seafood can be so good.  Who taught that woman how to greet a paying guest?  We were three and couldn't get a table or a seat at the bar - because our full party wasn't there.  My brother and I agreed to leave.  I will never ever ever go back.  Why?  I should actually thank the woman.  We went to a neighboring seafood place down the street and had a joyous, delicious and warmhearted time.  To the Neptune Oyster, I say later.....much later...like never....

Reviews.Author: Molly J.
Reviews.Content: I have never heard anybody who doesn't like Neptune Oyster. Thanks to the friend who brought me here. They serve lobster roll in warm with butter and cold with mayo(?). Most people like to have the warm version because its one of Neptune's signature dish. I also heard compliments on their crab burger. I will make sure I try it next time I go! The only disadvantage is the restaurant is too small to serve so many fans.

Reviews.Author: Manolo E.
Reviews.Content: Amazing oysters.  I typically do not eat/like oysters but these were excellent as were the lobster rolls.

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: The best food and restaurant that we experienced in Boston!!!! Waitstaff is friendly and helpful. The Lobster Roll is a must!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Sarah D.
Reviews.Content: This place just does things right. I love it. I have only been here twice, both times for an early dinner on a saturday afternoon.First off, as it is the first thing that strikes you walking in, the place is tiny. If you have never been there, and you are reading this review and thinking about how tiny it might be, i will guarantee you that it is tinier than that. There are only a few tables and they are very close together. There is also a bar that sits maybe 15 people? Anyway, despite the cramped space, it still has a look to it. White and black tile and a nice bar. There is something very nice about it. Get there early. Because of the small space, it doesn't take much to fill the place up. Prepare to wait no matter what time you get there; you might get a table or a bar seat right away if it's off peak hours, but even then there's no guarantee because if one or 2 larger groups get there first you could be out of luck for a while. I recently waited about 20 minutes for bar seats at 4pm on a saturday. By 5pm, people were being told an hour.The food is just excellent. The oysters are the draw, they carry about a dozen options at a time with a pretty wide variety of flavor profiles plus cherrystones and littlenecks; everything i've had from the raw bar has been excellent. I've tried a bunch of the entrees there including the cioppino, a seared red snapper, a tuna entree, scallops and some steamed littleneck clams. The steamers were fine, they were like pretty much any decent steamers i've had, but that is the only thing i've tried there that wasn't exceptional. The snapper was the most perfectly cooked piece of fish i have ever had. The scallops were huge and flavorful and perfectly seared, served with (among other things) some of the nicest bleu cheese i've ever tasted. I have never tried their famed lobster rolls (they do look great but when i go there i'm not in a sandwich mood.)I have ordered white wine both times and been happy with what i was given but i'm not a wine person so i can't really review the wine beyond that it was refreshing and complemented my food well. The beer list is small but has some nice local brews on it. My sister swears by their belinis, offered in a bunch of flavors and made with fresh fruit juice.Service is friendly and knowledgeable. I have only eaten at the bar so i can't comment onthe table service, but the bartenders are great. They don't rush you out despite the small number seats; food can take a while getting out but in the meantime you can eat some oysters, have a drink and feel pampered.Prices are medium/high. Nothing is incredibly expensive on its own, entrees seem to be in the $20-$40 range, but it is easy to spend a lot of money there because once you start eating those oysters it is very tough to stop yourself from ordering more. 2 entrees, 10 oysters and 2 glasses of wine came to around $95 plus tip.

Reviews.Author: Katrina W.
Reviews.Content: Big Ups to my fellow Yelpers with all the reviews to Neptune. Hubbie an I wanted the scoop on best hot Lobsta Roll in Boston and this place was beyond expectations. Appreciated the pre salt & pepper on the fries. Local Oysters were out of this world as well. This place doesn't do reservations so get there a bit early. It's also a cozy joint so if you have a large party I suggest being there all on time and prepare for a bit of a wait. Believe me though The wait is worth the mouthwatering journey that awaits you.

Reviews.Author: Zhenyu L.
Reviews.Content: One of the best sea food restaurants in Boston. I've been to many in Boston, but this one is the only one that I would definitely give a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Author: Sally T.
Reviews.Content: We tried to eat here last Sunday night.  Their website listed that they close at 11pm.  We walked from our hotel and took the T there.  Got there at 9:30pm and they tell us they closed the kitchen because it was a slow night!!  We had planned to come here and all day we were totally looking forward to some decent lobster rolls and oysters on our last night in Boston.  So it ended our trip on a very sour note and left us scrounging for a last minute restaurant at 10pm.  Not gonna penalize them with a bad rating since we didn't get to eat here.  But be sure to call the place before heading there.

Reviews.Author: Arik C.
Reviews.Content: You know when you read a wine description with ntoes of "fruity", "smooth", " full-bodied"?  Well that's what Neptune and Oysters does here but with osyters.  Never thought I would try a oyster with a watermelon finish but it actually had that flavor.  Great place if you want a WIDE variety of oysters,, fresh seafood and a reasonable wine list.  The oysters go for $2 a pop so watch the tab as it can be fun to keep trying the different varieties.  Not a lot of seating, no reservations are taken and the AC is not enough during the brutal days of summer!

Reviews.Author: Yubert F.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner and to try a duxbury oyster after reading the reviews on here.  I also ordered Monk fish and my friend had the Marlin.  Gotta say, they did Monk right!  It had the texture of lobster, yay!!  I tried a slice of Marlin and it was delicious!  I'll definitely be back.  Warning though, parking around here sucks!

Reviews.Author: deb y.
Reviews.Content: i was going to knock off a star because they dont take reservations and it's all "first come first served" but i guess i understand why they have that policy given the great reviews of this place and their small space (which is why this place is so special in the first place)...after living in boston for 4 months, i thought it was time to try my first lobster roll ever.  and as a lobster roll virgin, i'm glad my first time was with Neptune Oyster.  The hot butter and the maybe 2lbs of lobster that were in my lobster roll made me forget all about the cold wind outside and the dreariness of new england winter evenings. and any restaurant that makes me think "hm...i could be happy in boston" deserves all 5 yelp stars.thank you, Neptune Oyster, for making me believe.

Reviews.Author: Joe L.
Reviews.Content: o... m... g...i had been meaning to go to this place when i lived in the neighborhood, so this visit was about 5 years in the waiting.went for a late saturday night dinner with a friend. a bit of a wait, but the hostess got my cell number and said she'd call when a table was ready (we killed some time with a few beers at the never crowded corner cafe a few blocks away). had a table within a half-hour and decided to sit up at the counter. the interior is relatively small, but it's a lively and classy atmosphere and very cool to see all the oyster shucking and the efficiency of the staff when you're sitting up that close.oysters: without a doubt the freshest and cleanest oysters i've ever had in my life - served with the traditional cocktail sauce and lemon. they give you a convenient checklist to mark how many and what kind you'd like. i think i had all east coast, if remember correctly. just unbelievable oysters and i'm pretty much going to compare all oysters at any other place to neptune's from here on out.new england clam chowder: best new england clam chowder i've ever had. it's the thin kind (which is actually more traditional, unbeknownst to me). perfect ratio of clams and potatoes, great consistency, and the most flavorful chowder ever.fried clams: they were excellent. good portion size with a nice, crunchy breading covering fresh whole-belly clams. not the best ever, but i'd get them again. (a bit of random advice: if you want the best fried clams you'll ever have, you have to go to this small vendor in the north end during st anthony's feast. alas, the exact location escapes me...).it was just a great dining experience. lively ambiance, good service, and amazing food.

Reviews.Author: Greg B.
Reviews.Content: Great for a traveler, sit at the bar and choose from a great selection of oysters, friendly service and great lobster rolls. Pretty good wine list.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: Oh so good!  We went in at ~5 and they still had seats available, but we weren't hungry yet. We were told to come back a little later and put our names down, so that's what we did. They'll call you when a table is ready for you! It was one of those freak storms when we went, and we were maybe a 5-10minute walk from the restaurant. It was POURING outside, but the hostess called and told us a table was ready. We braved the rain for it. Totally worth it. The hostesses and waitresses are so friendly and welcoming. A tried 6 different oysters. We also ordered the buttermilk johnnycake, and I had the monkfish. Monkfish - huge portions and delicious! It was too much though. The first bite was AMAZING! But after a while, I was just forcing it down my throat bc it was too good to waste, which ironically made me enjoy it less and less. The buttermilk johnnycake tasted like comfort food to me-- it reminded me of something from my childhood but I just couldn't place my finger on it. I still cant think of it! This seems like a tourist spot, but it's SO GOOD! you must try it!My only complaint is that we were seated near the entrance, and people were constantly coming in and standing at the door. I felt a little claustrophobic, and it was too crowded.

Reviews.Author: Layla P.
Reviews.Content: Service was not great - we never even heard the specials for the night. We put our name on the list and they told us they would call our phone when the table was ready since there was no waiting room. So we went to a bar nearby and never got a call....The food was tasty but not as good as we expected - one of the appetizers tasted a little fishy...I thought good fish wasn't supposed to taste fishy? They had just run out of the veal and tuna sandwich (Thursday night at 7:30) which we were really looking forward to, so that was disappointing. The lobster rolls (hot and cold, definitely prefer hot) were good but just not sure if it's worth the $$.

Reviews.Author: Lisa P.
Reviews.Content: Came here yesterday around lunch time and seeked refuge from the snow in this quaint little restaurant. The restaurant was very busy and surprisingly small. There were probably only seats for 20 or so people. There was only one waiter so things were a bit slow and rushed. My friends and I ordered half a dozen raw oysters, clam chowder, and the lobster roll. The oysters were VERY fresh tasting which was a plus. I wish they had Tabasco sauce and sriracha though. The lobster roll was pretty good.. lots of lobster. I just wished it was grilled more so that it was crispy, mine was a bit soggy. The calm chowder was a bit disappointing since I'm used to the thick soup, not worth the $11. Overall, this place is worth a try but I don't think I'll be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Kazu O.
Reviews.Content: 3 words: best lobster roll.... EVERnot made cold with mayo... its hot and buttery... sooo good...their oysters are OK... good wine selection...expect to wait 45 minutes...

Reviews.Author: Jeannie J.
Reviews.Content: I came here on Sunday night just shy of 7:30pm and was turned away for the remaining tables of the evening (apparently the kitchen closes at 9:30 on Sundays).  The person in line in front of me got the very last table, grrr!  However, the hostess offered to take my phone number and call me if there happened to be room towards the end of the night.  We decided to roll the dice and wait for the call.  It helped that we were absolutely stuffed all day from our El Paisa brunch, so thankfully we weren't starving and miserable.  Around 9pm we got the call and walked over.  The service was standard and the food came out promptly.  The lobster roll was a whopping $25 but every bite was absolutely worth it.  We also ordered some oysters which tasted exactly like the menu described, no surprises there.  The clam chowder was a disappointing- very soupy and skimpy on the fillings.  But maybe that's just the style? All in all worth the hype I suppose.  Just show up before 7pm to make sure you get one of the last tables of the night, and expect about a 2 hour wait.  From 7:30 on, you'll have to get lucky like we did.  I guess they took mercy on a some folks after us because only 2 more parties got tables the rest of the evening.  They should expand, being a victim of one's success doesn't work out well for the rest of us hungry folk!

Reviews.Author: Eric A.
Reviews.Content: Super over-rated.  The hot one sucks.  Watery clam chowder.  And the waitress thinks it's supposed to be watery.  I guess you have to LOVE lobster.  Like LOVE it to like lobster rolls.  To be fair, I've never had a lobster roll before, but I've also never had lobster that I didn't like until I came here.  The hot butter one is too bland.

Reviews.Author: Janet Y.
Reviews.Content: Oh man, it's been a long time since I've been in a good food coma. My favorite oysters from this evening are the Beausoleil, Kumamoto, and Kusshi. I also ordered the blue crab cocktail, escargot fricasse, and the Gloucester monkfish. The blue crab cocktail is quite plentiful and I think the $19.50 for this side is worth the price. The escargot fricasse was absolutely delicious! While I could've done without the pieces of chicken, the sauce was so tasty that I wanted to lick the plate. I also tried my friend's buttermilk Johnnycake, which was also great especially the smoked trout component. If you've ever been to Barney Greengrass in New York and enjoyed its selection of smoked fishes, you would be happy with this dish. My entree, the Gloucester monkfish, is probably one dish I wouldn't order again. I've never had monkfish before so I decided to be adventurous. To me, the skin of the monkfish was chewy and the meat was dry on the inside. Maybe this wasn't meant to be? However, the mushrooms and the corn purée did help to elevate the dish, but not enough to save it. Regardless, I will be back before the crowds show up with an empty stomach and a fat wallet!PS- I wanted to order take-out, but they don't do it on Fridays and the weekends because it's such a busy place.

Reviews.Author: K U.
Reviews.Content: the hot lobster roll was good. the service was not amazing though. way too small and crowded/

Reviews.Author: Brandon J.
Reviews.Content: I came in for the first time last night and felt like this was my new home. The raw bar was the best I've had in the city.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie L.
Reviews.Content: i was pretty disappointed when we went our first night at 9pm, and they told us they weren't accepting any more reservations. apparently the last group had already been waiting over an hour, so we decided we'd skip out..and later decided to come back the next day for lunch. when we got there and could actually see into the place, we understood why the wait was so dang long. neptune is SUPER tiny. there are maybe 20 seats at tables and a bar for around 10.  yes, it is THAT tiny. but i guess, as proven, yes, it is that good. though it is pricey.. it is amazingof course reading all the reviews about the lobster rolls, that was a consideration...however, i'm not a huge fan of mayo and a bunch of friends were ordering the hot lobster roll with butter.  i decided to venture another way and order their sunday specialty of fish tacos. i wondered what kind of fish tacos these were going to be, though i definitely had high expectations being at the place we were (and $23 at that). i also decided to start with a crab cocktail.the crab cocktail came out first. super fresh, ultra satisfying, around $12. everyone had a forkful and we love the light dressing w some sort of horseradish taste.  other appetizers around the table included the clam chowder, which most of us loved.  now, if you're looking for that thick, chunky clam chowder, like shirley was, you may not be content...but if you want a smooth, creamy but not heavy, super clammy clam chowder, this is it. they come along with home-made oyster crackers that are a little large and hard to bite into, but in the soup, it works.onto the main courses..i'll go around the table and finish with mine.  mags ordered the neptune burger..one word, MASSIVE. she even took the fried oysters out to eat on their own since she could barely fit the burger in her mouth.  lobster rolls, awesome, as everyone has described.  oysters, no need for explanation. and finally, my fish tacos. OMG, the most amazing fish tacos. the toasty tortilla with that perfectly fried fish and sauce... plus the slaw accompanying it. when i first took a bite, i was like OMG and passed it around insisting everyone try. if you are there on a sunday, please PLEASE order the fish tacos.  these are fish tacos like no other.  I got two ginormous fish tacos!  so filling, the 2nd one i ended up eating half of the fish without tortilla. lunchtime pick to avoid the line..keep in mind, no high chairs, etc..so if you wanna come w baby, think about what you might be able to do to rectify that issue.

Reviews.Author: Tawn N.
Reviews.Content: I arrived from San Diego and went oyster tasting with places within walking distance of the Park Plaza hotel.  We had a phenomenal experience at the Union Oyster House and was excited at what Boston had in store however, Neptune Oyster was disappointing after the super fresh and delicious oyster at the other place.  The decor was charming the ambience was warm but lacking in substance.  Give really good food over ambience anytime.  Onward to Legal Seafood.

Reviews.Author: Van A.
Reviews.Content: Chose this place because of yelp reviews and wanting seafood. Walked in and sat down right away. Ordered 6 oysters and they were all from MA. Delicious! Also ordered two shrimp cocktail( a la carte menu) huge and very good with cocktail sauce. Ordered the lobster roll, clam chowder, and fried clams. Lobster roll was plentiful and roll was downright goodness. Chowder was sooooo good and fresh. Fried clams were also fresh and omg awesome! Gave five stars because my experience was perfect and memorable. Would definitely recommend going early because this place is really small...

Reviews.Author: My N.
Reviews.Content: Had oysters, fried tuna balls, and the cold loster roll.  Was yummy!  Paired with the Santorini white wine = perfect.  Friendly service as well!

Reviews.Author: Kristin X.
Reviews.Content: This place is really popular and difficult to get a seat. Ordered the hot lobster roll, it had huge chunks of lobster and lots of butter. It's what I expected. The sandwich could have been better if they offered different sauce options, for instance cilantro sauce or mild curry sauce. I don't know, just some food for thought. I'll try their fresh oysters next time.

Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews for Neptune really makes me wish I liked oysters. Unfortunately, I don't and even with Neptune's amazing reviews, I had no desire to try them. On the plus side, this allowed me to try a menu item that seems to be a bit more obscure: the Vitello Tannato. This was a really tasty sandwich that came stuffed with tuna tartare, veal, cucumber, and spicy mustard. I felt the veal was a bit out of place and it didn't really add anything to the sandwich (it didn't really subtract anything either, it was just kinda there). However, the tuna tartare  stole the show and was amazing. Overall, it was a very unique and tasty sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Kat D.
Reviews.Content: Fish and seafood in the North End. What's not to love? It was hard to decide what to order because everything sounded so delicious. Whole fish, Gloucester cod, cioppino, shrimp and grits, cuttlefish and "Neptunes on Piggyback" were all amazing. The space is small and cramped, but that was fine with us. Just put your name on the wait list (no reservations here), then squeeze into a table or belly up to the bar when it's your turn to be treated to some expertly-prepared culinary delights. I wished they served bread to soak up the sauce from the fish stew and the other dishes as well. In hindsight it probably would have pushed me over the edge on the fullness scale. Bread or no bread, I ate every morsel and I'd do it again!

Reviews.Author: Bryan B.
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I can't verify how great this place is. I went there for a lobster roll, I heard it is the place to go for them, but it was absolutely packed.  I was waaay to hungry to wait, so I ventured to an adjacent business and ordered one.  It was fantastic.  I only wish I could remember the name.  It wasnt busy, but it was like 2 doors down.  If anyone knows let me know.

Reviews.Author: Kristen S.
Reviews.Content: In a word: awesome. I love having a *selection* of oysters. The place gets crowded quickly, and frequently on Friday or Saturday nights there will be a cluster of people trying to get in from the cold without anywhere to go in the tiny room (which can create a rather unpleasant arctic draft when the door is kept ajar). The bf and I like getting there just a little bit earlier than the crowd (around 6ish) and we've never had a problem landing two adjacent seats at the bar. The wait staff is great too, super accommodating. Although we go for the oysters and clams, we occasionally split an entree. I know it sounds a little counter-intuitive, but try their burger. It was juicy and delicious.

Reviews.Author: nm n.
Reviews.Content: I just can't figure out what the big deal with this restaurant is.  The only thing I can think of is that it's in a tourist trap location (The North End) where everyone expects the food to be good so they say it's good.I went here for lunch and ordered the tuna tartare sandwich with veal and a side of fries.  I had to ask for some lemone to squeeze on the tartare cause it was dry.  Then asked for mustard to put on the sandwich cause it was flavorless.The service was also not good. The waitress's mind was obviously somewhere else (I really shouldn't even have left a tip because of the bad service).I ended up paying $40 bucks for lunch, which included a glass of wine (too high in my opinion for mediocre food)This is a typical north end restaurant: Average food, high prices, for out of town tourists.The best restaurants in Boston are not in the North End, but unless you actually live in Boston,  you'll never know that & if you live in New York City, no restaurant in Boston will ever come close. It's just not there yet.

Reviews.Author: Peter Y.
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place. Went there twice in 3 days. As stated in other reviews, the place is very small and the wait can be long. They will take your phone number and call when your table is ready. You can walk around Little Italy and see other things while you wait.As for the food, Oysters are a must. Nice variety that you chose on a sheet that describe the location where it is harvested and the taste profile - similar to a sushi sheet. One advise, they do not list Uni on the sheet or on their menu board. You should peek at the window display area where the oysters are prepped and look for the sea urchin. Must have this - really tasty. All of this is not cheap. $2 .50 and up per oyster and other item - crab claws, shrimp, etc.Another must is the Neptune Caesar. Great salad with marinated anchovies and grated cheese. Lobster roll (butter) was good and must also be ordered.Staff is great and place is nice. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is the price.

Reviews.Author: Keiko K.
Reviews.Content: Our dinner at Neptune began with a standing wait to grab a spot at a shared table.  In any other place, this annoyance would not be so easily remedied by grabbing a glass of wine at the bar, but the sparkling number that we decided on was so delicious that it both made us more patient and whetted our appetites.I couldn't figure out the appeal of the oyster crackers that were placed on our table before the food came out, so I just ordered another glass of wine.  This turned out to be a good decision, as I ended up reaching the perfect state of "enlightenment" with which to fully enjoy the variety of flavors in the oysters.  I highly recommend that you look over the drink menu; it really adds to the meal.  The food itself is so divine that a little bit can go a long way, which is a good thing because it sure is pricey.  We ordered a plate of oysters and the caviar toast with pancetta and salmon mousse special.  Yes, the combination of slimy oysters, salty eggs and whipped fish sounds a bit too...um, aquatic...but it really was one of the most delicious meals I have had in a long time.The atmosphere is crowded but comfortable.  I seem to remember black and white tiles and marble, which somehow still managed to be cozy.

Reviews.Author: Andy J.
Reviews.Content: If this review was based on food alone it would be a 5. However service was super slow. It took a half hour to get my 6 oysters. My water glass was constantly empty, and the food prices seem a bit high. Also a clone of the douchebag from the bar scene in good will hunting was sitting next to me. The food was awesome though. Oysters super fresh and the hot lobster roll was fantastic. The lobster was sweet and the roll they use is perfect. While the seafood was outstanding the highlight may have been the fries. They were absolutly perfect. While the food was awesome my experience there was not, hence the 3 star rating.

Reviews.Author: Jake A.
Reviews.Content: After a long and torturous tour of the "top" lobster rolls in Boston, me girlfriend and I need no further convincing. Neptune has used the age-old business rule of KISS (keep it simple stupid) and applied it to the perfect and buttery roll. A whole lobster cooked to perfection and dripping with hot butter, crammed between a fresh and fluffy brioche bun. Look no further lobster fans. Enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Max B.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best food I've ever had.Various oysters - 8/10Yellowfin Tuna with avocado spread, Iggy's baguette, citrus aioli, and ginger - 10/10 - very interesting flavor with many layers. Possibly the best dish I've ever had.Fish tacos - 7/10

Reviews.Author: Vin S.
Reviews.Content: OK. If you like shellfish. This is THE place for you. Like a lot of North End eateries, Neptune is small, a bit cramped and has no waiting area or lounge to speak of. We were there on a Saturday nite and made the prudent choice to arrive just before 6pm. Our wait time was 30 minutes, and the hostess contacted us by cell phone once a table was ready. I'm not a big oyster guy but the selection of oyster types seemed plentiful. Lots of other raw bar choices as well:  from clams to jumbo shrimp to crab to sea urchin. (Sea urchin?!  No thanks.)  I fully expected to be wowed by the seafood, and I was not disappointed. My applewood bacon scallops were delicious, and my gal's lobster roll was as sumptuous as the prior reviews indicate.  A really nice suprise was the assortment of local craft beers on hand. The Allagash White paired excellently with my meal.

Reviews.Author: Joanna C.
Reviews.Content: Small, crowded, a LONG wait, nearly no parking available, tourist location, and yet - what brings me back? Ah, yes - that's right, it's the FOOD.Maine Lobster roll - a standard and established item at Neptune Oyster. I prefer the hot over the cold. Something about that hot buttered, toasted bun cushioned with succulent lobster chunks...mmm, and the potato skins fries are perfectly crispy, tender, and salted. Even better with the Fisherman's Brew.A variety of fresh raw oysters with knowledgeable, friendly waitstaff. A helpful order card with informational taste points highlighted. Served with cocktail sauce and mignonette. Some may find this odd but I personally love dipping my fries into the sauces as well.Tip: do not come hungry because you will usually need to wait a good amount of time; by the time you're up - you'll be starving. I also noticed that It doesn't help to stare at the patrons eating as you're waiting outside (I'm so SO rude). Sit up at the bar if you can. The best time to come - on a weekday during the afternoon; it's quieter, calmer, and you can have an enjoyable lunch. Definitely one of my Boston favorites.

Reviews.Author: Zhanwen C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food although pricey. Fresh oysters for sure, and artsy and delicious food. The scallion dish I ordered was fantastic - I have never liked brussels sprouts in my life, but Neptune amazed me. Make no mistake here: like most fancy restaurants, Neptune doesn't give generous portions, but it's not stingy either. Make sure to wait for 2-3 hours if you have a 5+ group. It's popular!

Reviews.Author: Etrain S.
Reviews.Content: Two words: lobster roll. Three more words: hot with butter. Utter these when the waiter comes by and asks for your order, and you will never be the same. I frankly don't like traditional Boston lobster rolls that much - cold lobster with all that mayonnaise and other junk? Why would you ruin one of the most delicious creatures the ocean has to offer? Neptune does it right. Serve the lobster hot, slather it with butter, and on top of a rich toasty roll. I've ordered other stuff here too, but only when they've been out of lobster rolls (not a common occurence - I go here a lot!)Additionally, if you're an oyster lover, then this is your place. About a dozen different oysters to choose from, they arrive fresh daily and are shucked right in the storefront, for all passers-by to see. They bring by a menu that's descriptive with a full flavor profile of each oyster and let you pick and choose. I usually get 4-6 different ones to try before my meal.

Reviews.Author: Klaus B.
Reviews.Content: A tiny restaurant with a very nice atmosphere, good service, very creative and excellent tasting dishes, perfectly fresh seafood and a good wine list. Definitely the best place of our Boston/MV food tour.Atmosphere:It's a tiny place with a long bar that almost spans the complete room. There are maybe 30 seats available, which you cannot reserve. so take some time to wait (the waiter will take your number and you can go and have a drink at one of the many bars in walking distance until you get a table). Oysters are presented at the front window, the decor overall is comfortable and fits the seafood menu.Food:The PEI mussels were soft, no sand, great mussel taste with a surprisingly well tasting sauce. Not your average garlic white wine sauce, it is spiced up to taste a notch sweeter and very extraordinary - but still supporting the taste of the mussels rather than distracting from it. We had about 30 oysters and tried all oysters they sold that day. All were excellent in quality (which was certainly supported by the right time of the year for oysters), we specifically liked the Summerside ones.The Neptunes on Piggyback were fantastic, as well. I always try things in restaurants that I would never put together in one dish myself. Most of the time I find out there is a good reason why I wouldn't and occasionally I have a chance to extend my horizon. The fried oysters and the pig already worked incredibly well together and came on a very tasty bread. The raisins were a fabulous addition to that taste, I simply loved it. I considered ordering it again as a main dish...But then decided for North End Cioppino, which was a delicious fish stew with saffron rice. Very tasty and the prawns topping the dish were as fresh and moist as they get. Yummy. Some of the fish was a bit dry, but that's to be expected as they provide the flavor for the stew.We also had pan roasted fish from the daily menu, which came roasted to perfection, extremely moist and very lecker. And least but not last at all Lobster Stroganoff. Wow, that sounds crazy and it tasted very, very well. Not too much cream so that the Lobster taste was strong in the dish. Surprisingly (again!) the Lobster was supported by the mushrooms, rather than put to the background. Just great.Drinks:The wine selection was really good. We picked a very nice French Sancerre, but I don't remember which one it was. It did go very nice will all our dishes.Service:Though no reservations are accepted, you get a call when your table is ready (after you showed up with the complete group). Staff was very friendly and fast and did not rush us at all, though we started dining at 9:30 and the kitchen was supposed to close at 10.I will go back here whenever I am in Boston and have a chance to do so. I would recommend anything we had, but personally enjoyed the Neptunes on Piggyback, the Lobster Stroganoff and the oysters the most.

Reviews.Author: Jess B.
Reviews.Content: This place is legit....it's probably one of - if not the BEST - seafood restaurants in Boston. The oysters are fresh and cold and fabulous - the selection is overwhelming. They pile a massive amount of fresh and tasty meat on the lobster roll - go for the warm buttered. The environment is casual and inviting....be prepared to wait, especially if you go on a weekend....but it's WELL WORTH IT!!!

Reviews.Author: Samantha L.
Reviews.Content: We got there on the earlier side -- 6pm -- and only had to wait for about 15 minutes for a table.  We also walked to the location so we didn't have to deal with hideous North End parking.  Therefore, the two likely complaints i'd have,  parking/ hassle to get there and a long wait, are irrelevant.  The place is jam packed, but you pretty much forget you've got two stranger at your four top squished up against you because the lobster roll was really just that good.  The service, though more help is definitely needed, was as good as it could be with one waiter seating folks and doing his job.  All and all, it is the best lobster roll I've had in Boston proper so far.  I'd still choose Brown's in New Hampshire or Lobsta Land first, but this is a close third.

Reviews.Author: Stomping S.
Reviews.Content: Didn't do oysters, but found this place to be incredible for food and ambiance. Quaint (tiny) seating area; sat at the bar. Ordered: seasonal Harpoon on draft, clam chowder, lobster roll w/ clarified butter. Bartender was friendly and helpful, with plenty of local knowledge. Clam Chowder was good, Lobster Roll was excellent. Have to say, though, that halfway through the sandwich I felt nauseatingly heavy... if you're used to a balanced meal, may want to go lighter on the appetizer/soup. Didn't touch the fries on the entree because I was way too full. Excellent experience.

Reviews.Author: Bondi J.
Reviews.Content: Wish there could be an outpost of Neptune Oyster in New York so I wouldn't have to take a flight to Boston every time I crave their clam chowder and out-of-this-world oysters!  Would eat here every day if I lived in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Pee D.
Reviews.Content: Service was OK.  Food was OK.  Spicy ciopinno was bland.  Extremely overrated!!  At the very least, local seafood should be reasonably priced. I can still smell it on my fingers.

Reviews.Author: Justin S.
Reviews.Content: Tiny, cramped, the hostess screwed up the waitlist and it took something ridiculous like 2 hours to get seated, but totally worth it.  The raw bar is obviously the main attraction, with an extensive oyster menu and helpful tasting notes, though really, they're all spectacular.  The hot butter lobster roll is excellent and enormous (has anyone actually had the mayo version here?), and the fried belly clams are maybe not quite Clam Box level, but you don't have to drive to Ipswich to get them.  Definitely one of the best meals I've had in Boston.  It's a seafood city, and Neptune has some of the best; don't miss it if you're visiting.

Reviews.Author: George T.
Reviews.Content: For sure one of the best places for oysters in Boston.Went there last night (Sunday) around 7:30 was told the wait will be 1 - 1.5 hrs, got a call in about an hour.On weekends if you get there 7pm - 9pm a 1.5 - 2 hour wait is almost guaranteed so plan ahead, during the week probably at least an hour. Your best bet for the short wait is a rainy day or if there is a Pats game that night (per our waiter). Comments like these "I did not eat here but i dont think the food is worth waiting over 3 hours for... Reservations???" by connie b. make no sense, obviously it is worth waiting since other people who have been there at least once are willing to wait that long.Again, plan ahead and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: Seriously. Who waits 2-3 hours, aimlessly walking around the North End, starving to the point of delirium, just to eat a hot lobster roll? Me. And I've been doing it over and over for 3 years now.Tip: to make your wait go by in a snap, have some drinks at the quirky Corner Cafe on Prince St.

Reviews.Author: Ronnie D.
Reviews.Content: 1.5 hour wait on a Friday night was well worth it. Sat at the bar, oysters and crab were great, bartenders were awesome, and the entrees were unreal. One of the best all-around meals I've had in a while.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: What the shuck? Was I at the same oyster bar you guys are talking about?  After reading these reviews, I'd be scared to go near the place.  Makes it sound like yuppy hell.  Out of town Yelpers -- here is the deal on this place.  Out of this world fresh oysters.  I know.  We have an oyster bed in our backyard and we eat 'em serious fresh every chance we get.  This place is one of the first restaurants I've ever been to that comes close to "just out of the water" fresh.  People wearing jeans slurping 'em down by the dozen.  Ice cold beer on a hot summer night and an awesome place to people watch.  Alot of fun and I will definitely go back

Reviews.Author: Oski B.
Reviews.Content: There is no greater honor for a lobster to be caught and be made into a Neptune Oyster hot lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Carm B.
Reviews.Content: Ok!  Can you say FANTASTIC!!!  The seafood here is so fresh I'm assuming it was swimming before it got on my plate!  Very small restaurant, gets very crowded fast!  Get there as soon as it opens to get on the waiting list.  They take your name and number and will call you when a table opens up as there is nowhere to wait in the restaurant.  Use the time to do a little sight seeing.  Hot Lobster Roll, off the charts!!!  Oysters are ridiculous!  We ordered the Triton Plateau for the 2 of us.  OMG!  Wait till you see this thing!  Oysters, Clams, Crab, Shrimp, Lobster, Mussels.  It was amazing.  Service is fast and good!  I would most definitely recommend "attempting" to go to Neptune!  Fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Alma C.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best seafood I have ever had, and I'm basically a mermaid. One memorable visit, Neptune had about 20 different types of fresh oysters on the menu, one of which (Katama Bay from Martha's Vineyard) was described as "Medium large, high salt, popcorn finish." My first reaction was, "Huh?!" and then when I tried them, the next reaction was, "Orville Redenbacher!" No joke. If you are from out of town, this place is a must-visit. It's tiny and first come first serve, so get here early to make sure you don't miss out.

Reviews.Author: Stephen L.
Reviews.Content: So the lobster was indeed good. Got the lobster roll with warm butter, and it's a lot of food. But the place is TINY, the wait is 3+ hours, they don't take reservation, and there is no take out!

Reviews.Author: Courtney R.
Reviews.Content: Hyped up place. Ordered a lobster roll with no butter. As I've found is customary at nice Boston restaurants (apparently), it came drenched in butter. If you have to drench your seafood in butter, I doubt its quality - sorry. Cocktail shrimp were huge and amazing, though, and it almost redeemed itself. Cute restaurant, wasn't crowded on a Tuesday at lunch, but I won't be back. I'll take my hole in the wall lobster rolls over this any day.

Reviews.Author: Barney B.
Reviews.Content: only a place this good can use tuna tartare as a damn condiment for a veal sandwich.holy mother of god, this place is just intensely amazing and unprententious.for a city so steeped in fishing history, I always find it difficult to recommend a seafood restaurant in the city without forcing a schlep to Inman Square (Legal's doesn't cut it, sorry).  Now I have an awesome option for the BOS side of the river.

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: What can I say about Neptune Oyster that hasn't already been said. Get the warm lobster roll and die in peace

Reviews.Author: Kara R.
Reviews.Content: There's a ton of reviews, so I'll keep this simple.Tiny place!  We got a place at the bar to avoid any possibility of sharing a table with someone. The bar was nice to sit at so we could ask questions and our water glasses were right in plain view.We had Thatch Island and Pemaquid oysters.  We both preferred the Thatch Island.  We also tried the Cherrystone clams (also raw).  Not our cup of tea, but that's no fault of the restaurant and it was fun to try something new.The PEI Mussels in curry broth were pretty tasty and nicely cooked.  On tiny complaint is that there was no bread to dunk in the sauce so it all went to waste for the most part.And finally... The hot buttered lobster roll.  I'm no lobster expert but I could tell it was nicely cooked.  It was just amazing. My husband and I split one- all together it was a good sized meal for 5 pm, but I'm sure I could have managed a whole one myself.  I'd like to go back for lunch to try the cold roll but we're leaving Boston tomorrow morning. :(Service was pretty decent. And tiniest bathroom ever.Very happy and satisfied tonight.

Reviews.Author: Elisa E.
Reviews.Content: Amazing as always! My husband and I brought our two boys with us on this vacation and they loved it as much as we do. Great service, great wine, and amazing food...what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: I know it's really hard to get into Neptune, the wait can be forever.  I was lucky as I was a single traveler and was able to slip in and grab the single seat still left at the bar.I love this place, it's old and authentic.  It's small, a bar with seats and a few tables against the wall.  It's busy and noisy with a fun vibe.The wines, champagne and beer choices are large and the bar is full of large containers with ice keeping bottles of wine chilled.The women who work here are all young and friendly.  They sure work hard as they are moving nonstop to keep this busy place moving along.It all looked so good, that I had it all.  I had a bowl of clam chowder, six Wellfleet oysters and lobster spaghettini.  My meal was delicious.  The oysters were local and fresh.  The clam chowder may easily have been the best clam chowder that I ever ate.  It was full of clams and rich and creamy.  The lobster spaghettini although not large in portion had a lot of lobster and meat and was really wonderful.I really enjoyed my meal here.  The food is something that I will remember for a long time.  It was a perfect Boston lunch.  I had two nice glasses of wine and I enjoyed the atmosphere and the busy vibe that this place gives off.  I thought the wait staff was cool and very friendly and helpful.My only complaint and the reason that I give this place four stars and NOT five is that I think it's over priced.  My six oysters, clam chowder and small portion of lobster spaghettini plus two white wines was $100.00.  I was a little shocked at the bill.  My meal was delicious and from a food stand point I would surely return here.  I loved the look and feel of this place as well, but $100.00 for what I had can only be described as overpriced!

Reviews.Author: Rachael R.
Reviews.Content: So sorry to all the people who may have been creeped by a little face peering in the window while they tried to eat their oysters in peace. But whenever I pass by (usually on the way to the fabulous Acquire next store) I am the little orphan looking in on the family Thanksgiving dinner by warm candlelight. Even though I only go twice a year (whenever guests come to town) I think it's one of the classiest spots available. If you have the chance, go early (like 5pm early) so you won't have to crowd in the doorway.

Reviews.Author: Karen K.
Reviews.Content: Seems as if their popularity has gone to their head!  The food is consistenly great, unfortunately though the wait staff has become consistently bad.  I will get my lobster roll elsewhere from now on, thank you very much.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer V.
Reviews.Content: First impression, the place is small. It needs to be a little bigger. They sat us at the bar and that would have been okay if the stools had backs, but they don't and my friend and I both did not like that. They also had tables, but it was tight in there and there was a line out the door so we waited and that was the first available. We were curious. It was really good. We had some calamari that was sauteed in some kind of tomato type juice/sauce it was not thick enough to be sauce, but not watery enough to be juice if that makes sense. I had never had calamari done this way. I've only had fried calamari with an array of sauces but this one topped them all.  There were olives cut up and some kind of green in the sauce as well. It was very tasty.For my main course I had the Georges Bank Scallops with Duck Confit and Pear Anjou and brussel sprouts. It was awesome. I suck at cooking scallops at home. Some things I leave to the professionals. Scallops is one of them. Excellent job! My friend had the lobster roll with butter. I have to be honest. I love lobsters and specifically lobster rolls but the only time I've ever seen them with butter instead of mayonnaise, was at the Big E in Springfield, MA and it was so gross and like dried out, but I should have relalized that I was at Neptune Oyster and it wasn't going to get much fresher and better than that. I checked out my friend's, she offered a bite, but I've been losing weight, so I was trying to stay away from all that butter. Plus every time I have had a brioche roll, its been dry and not the way I am used to having a lobster roll like at Kelly's Roast Beef where they butter and toast the roll. But this one looked really good. She said it was. The prices were right in line with what I envisioned being they are high end, in the north end and near the ocean so everything is so fresh. The service was good. the waitress/bartender was very attentive, but we did wait quite a while in between the appetizer and main course. We ended up saying something. They handled it well. At first seemed annoyed but quickly got over it. It is way too cramped in there. I'll go there again, but I hope they expand some day. You need room to move when you're eating. God forbid you are a little bigger. The woman next to be asked us to push down because there was a big guy when we came in, so we did. A pleasant evening all the way around. I enjoyed my meal thoroughly. If I could change one thing, it would be the size of the place. Everything else was stellar.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters I've ever had.  Best sandwich I've ever had (hot butter lobster roll).  If I had no other reason, I would come back to Boston just to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Timmay S.
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I decided to hop around the North End eating the day away, and oysters were on our list so we decided to give it a shot. It was a busy Saturday so naturally we had to wait about an hour or so to get a seat. Once we sat down we opted for some wine, a few different types of oysters and the mussels. We went with the Sangiovese, which was quite yummy and seemed like a good choice being in the North End and all. Then it was magic time, the oysters came out with a cocktail sauce and a nice mignonette. The oysters were so fresh and had a nice straight from the ocean flavor to them. The only thing that could have made those little raw critters seem more fresh if I was sitting on the beach. Then came the mussels, which were cooked in a red curry broth with cilantro, garlic and cashews. I don't know about you but I feel that mussels and curry is a great duo, such a great combo. They even brought out some bread for us at the end so we could sop up all that delicious broth at the end.The food was great, so fresh and delicious. The wait staff was great, playful and fun. The only thing is that it can be quite a wait because it is small and there are close quarters. Would definitely go back for more oysters. Oh ya and the other cool thing about eating here is we got to sit next to Tyra Banks. I guess if it's good enough for her it's good enough for us.

Reviews.Author: Jason K.
Reviews.Content: First stop in Boston always. Clam chowder made to order that is to die for, the cold plate filled with goodies are amazing, friendly service, this is the best place.

Reviews.Author: JOSH L.
Reviews.Content: As this looks like it will be Yelper review #744, I'm gon' keep this short and sweet. I've been to Neptune 8 times over the past five years and it has never been anything short of perfect. The vibe is casual and your realtor would deem the the bar/dining area 'cosy', but its all part of the undeniable charm.Best lobster roll in Boston, bar none. French fries are also uniquely amazing. Wine pairings are spot-on. And the ambience - all solid white marble bar, clams on ice in the window, unassumingly romantic North End alley location - is New England chic done right.This place is TINY and POPULAR, so get there at 5 to minimize your wait...and remember the wait will be worth it. If you want to experience what its like to be a hip Bostonian who knows and respects the classics (ie: lobster anything) but wants it all in a fabulous post-millenial package, you'll do no better than Neptune. Pick o' the menu: Lobster RollSkip o' the menu: N/A - all is phenomenalIf This Restaurant Was a Madonna Album, It Would Be: Ray of Light

Reviews.Author: Travis W.
Reviews.Content: I joined yelp just so I could talk about my experience at Neptune Oyster.I visited Neptune Oyster for my first (and second) time during my first trip to Boston over Thanksgiving break.  We came to Boston looking for amazingly fresh seafood and lots of local beer and were beyond impressed with Neptune Oyster.  We started the dinner off with the Triton Plateau, their raw bar sampler for 2.  All of the oysters were extremely fresh and their lump crab that came with it was out of this world.  The high point of my night was when the lobster roll came out, however.  Maybe I'm (seafood) sheltered coming from Chicago, but I have never heard of a warm lobster roll.  Imagine a crispy homemade roll, packed full with fresh lobster and then doused in warm butter.  Unbelievable.  I don't know if I was tainted by such a great overall experience, but even the fries were perfect.My friend also had the chowder and said it was one of the best he's ever had.  Nice local beer selection and a fairly reasonable wine list to boot!   We had dinner there Friday and lunch on Monday before taking a flight out.  I will also be back the next time I go to Boston.  It wasn't cheap, but I've never felt better spending a lot of (my own) money!

Reviews.Author: V V.
Reviews.Content: I was there in the spring and forgot to write a review. This place must be a hidden jewel, although I'm not sure how much of a secret. The line can build up outside as this place is good  food wise and tiny seating wise. It literally seems to only fit 10-12 people and I may be exaggerating by 2 people how many it can hold. The wine and beer selection was good and the food was even better. Stop in when you get a chance. It's a great place to get food before a celts/bruin game or Garden event.

Reviews.Author: Cindy L.
Reviews.Content: We went there and tried their lobster rolls....YUM YUM YUM.  Their oysters are fresh and juicy.  I was not a big fan of raw oysters before but after trying them at Neptune Oyster, my life is changed forever.  They have converted me into a raw oyster lover. I can't wait to go back (we are from California) and eat there!!

Reviews.Author: Adrian M.
Reviews.Content: After a 12 mile bike tour through Boston, it was time to perk up with some good seafood, and Neptune delivered with extreme prejudice.Straight to the Raw Bar!I shared about 2 dozen oysters, sampling most of the MA fare since I wasn't too familiar with their flavor.  The oysters were extremely fresh, and well cleaned.  I followed suit with the famed Lobster Roll - INSANE.  the bread was fresh and filled with a buttery mound of tender lobster meat that could hardly fit in the roll.  Crispy shoestring fries ride shotgun on this plate, and good luck finishing them after the roll. The staff were all personable and maintained a good sense of humor, despite the huge Saturday crowd that descended upon them.The place gets packed, and on the weekend, you may get sacked with an hour or longer wait if traveling in a group.  As a couple, we were seated in 30-40mins.  I'd recommend planning something around the wait, checking in and leaving your phone number well before your stomach talks to you.

Reviews.Author: Ngoc L.
Reviews.Content: We were the 2nd group in line when we got there at 11am. I heard it was small but didn't realized how small it was so come early if you can. Please note we were there in March so it's not tourist season. Sadly, our effort that morning right at  timedidn't grant us the pleasure of trying their lobster roll. The host did stressed that they were waiting for their shipment and it is on its way.  NO guarantee by what time but I think their vendor had some problem that morning. We didn't want to wait around and grabbed two seats at the bar. My star ratings are for the oysters alone! OMG, I don't think I've tasted such fresh and delish flavors on these babies. I would skip on the clam chowder. Although the clams were fresh and flavor wise was good, it's just not worth it in my opinion. Get more oysters instead! We weren't going a day without eating a lobster roll so we asked our server where would they go as an alternate spot. I'll have to write a review for that establishment but it was a great choice.

Reviews.Author: Blake V.
Reviews.Content: In Roman lore, Neptune is a god (named after the Greek deity Poseidon.) In Boston, there is a god of seafood restaurants named Neptune Oyster. From their much heralded lobster rolls to their fantastic chowder to the city's best selection of oysters, a seafood lover cannot go wrong. Sturgeon, monkfish, and sublime ciopinno. I've been here for business lunches and dinners with mi amore. It's a great setting for either occasion.

Reviews.Author: L W.
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Neptune Oyster since they first opened, when you could walk in for dinner and be seated immediately. As with majority of people, the warm lobster roll had been my favorite dish only because it is not easy to find warm lobster rolls. All other dishes there have been good with the exception of the Clam Chowder which is lackluster. Even with the popularity of the place, I still enjoyed the lobster roll until yesterday. A little background: last week I was in CT and ended up at a restaurant that yes, had warm lobster rolls. I really enjoyed it but wished they used the same bread as Neptune Oyster. Since I had that in mind, I decided to stop by Neptune yesterday around lunch and shockingly, was able to be seated almost immediately (since I was solo, I guess). Of course, I got the lobster roll and was rather surprised to see that there had been some changes since my last visit there mid-August. The meal portion was considerably smaller, even the fries. I did not complain though since the prior portions were considerably large and this one was somewhat manageable but, it is about perception. The bread not as sweet as it used to be, there was barely any butter on mine, and the lobster was overcooked. Now, if that was my first time there I probably would have raved about the lobster roll but sadly, for me it demonstrated a negative turn and all I can think of is that other warm lobster roll in CT.  As I looked around, it was easier to count the people that did NOT have the lobster roll which I think explains the significant drop in standards. Needless to say, I do not know when and if I will be back but if I do return I certainly will not be getting the famous lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Mathew N.
Reviews.Content: This place is quite a bit overrated.  The clam chowder was watery and fishy tasting.  The lobster roll, served hot with butter or cold with mayonnaise (I tasted both), was good but not really worth the high prices.  French fries were overcooked and not tasty at all.  Maybe I'm missing something but this place was a disappointment.  On the plus side, we didn't have to wait at all to get  a table for four at about 5:30/6:00 on a weeknight.

Reviews.Author: Y.K. D.
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU YELPERS!!  It was my first trip to Boston and I came here with my family because of all the wonderful reviews! It was everything that I had hoped for and more!! We came here on a Wednesday, had a very early dinner (around 5pm) but I was so glad that we did because by 5:30pm this place was packed!! (This place was very small inside)  we ordered a dozen of MA oysters and clams - super fresh and tasty! We also ordered a bowl of clam chowder and mussels with red curry broth - both were very delicious and the quantities were quite generous! Then the entrees:  lobster roll and seafood cioppino - one of the best we had!! (My fam and I are quite picky with our seafood, as we grew up in Hong Kong and then moved near San Francisco - both places where you can find plenty of great fresh seafood)  there were tons of chucky fresh lobster meat (cooked with just enough amount of butter, without overcooking the lobster) in the roll, and the cioppino was just perfectly cooked with, again, generous amount of super fresh seafood!If you love seafood, you will have to try this place! ..just remember to come here early even in the middle of the week!

Reviews.Author: brad c.
Reviews.Content: No need to beat a dead horse. Best restaurant I went to on my last trip to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Jenessa C.
Reviews.Content: Definitely get there early, or else you will wait. We arrived right when they opened & were able to get a spot, but within 10 minutes of opening, the place was packed. Our party ate the Vitello Tonnato which was fantastic, the Hot Lobster Roll which was packed full of lobster, & the Clam Chowder, not a thick & hearty chowder, but still excellent. Asked for Oyster recommendations - and the Massachusetts from Duxbury & Martha's Vineyard were the best. Paired the oysters with champagne & it all made for a wonderful lunch!

Reviews.Author: Jenna H.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in the North End! Best Oysters I have ever had, very fresh. Waitstaff is always knowledgable and friendly. My favorite dish is the lobster roll -while a bit pricy, it is the best and I always get it. They also have great fries - thin cut, home cut. Also has a nice wine selection.

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is my third update to this review.  Why?  By far the BEST fried clams I have ever had in my life.  And I've had Woodman's...

Reviews.Author: Taylor W.
