Reviews.Content: OH WOW!...Neptune's lobster roll is the best I've ever had...huge, juicy chunks of fresh lobster- it will not disappoint!  The restaurant is small, but we came here around 5:30 and didn't have any trouble getting a table.  They get your food to you really quickly, and it is SO FRESH!

Reviews.Author: Shirley Y.
Reviews.Content: i love neptune oyster!  the missing star is because of the wait and the cramped quarters.no doubt, this cozy little place gets crowded.  it is incredibly popular, a tried-and-true staple of the north end for quality well-done seafood.  not only is the place small, people tend to sit and linger over a glass of wine and food.  and the food is good and the wine list extensive.  when you finally get a seat, whether it would be at a marble-topped table or at the bar, they give you a list of oysters in season for you to mark off as part of your order, served on the half shell, similar to a sushi joint.  they also have specials of the day.  one of the days, it's sardines.  i have not tried that, but i do highly recommend their lobster spaghettini, available mondays.  their lobster roll isn't really a roll, but more like chunks of buttered lobster on a beautiful perfectly toasted hoagie/sub/hero bun. also, their neptunes on piggyback are perfectly battered and fried.  fried oysters can tend to be overdone, resulting in a rubber-like puck, but neptune's are light, fluffy and melt-in-your-mouth delicious.sitting at a table, be prepared to bump elbows with strangers at the neighboring table.  the place is the epitome of quaint bistro decor.  i'm on a huge bistro/brasserie kick, so it fits my bill, with the black and white mosaic tile flooring, and the mirrors adorning the walls displaying the bellinis of the day or the crudites offered.  on chilly days, a heavy velvet curtain is placed across the door to prevent drafts.  and drafts will occur, with all the patrons coming in and out, some unsuccessful with waiting for seats.

Reviews.Author: Jen T.
Reviews.Content: I think this was by far the most outstanding meal I had on the East Coast. And this trip also included NYC & Philadelphia.So I came here on strong recommendations from Marcus L. and Frommer's about finding the freshest seafood in Boston in a quaint setting. And they were right.For a table of 2, they quoted us about a 30-45 minute wait, took down our number, but we got a call back within 10 minutes saying a table was ready. Yay!When they say the place is small, it's small. You pretty much have to share elbow space with the table next to you, but everyone's enjoying their food and having a good time, so no one really cares.We ordered oysters & clams a la carte (the way it truly should be). I don't remember the exact names, but we went with ones that are locally from Massachusetts and that were recommended by our waiter. What's also nice is they give you a sheet with the available fresh seafood, the prices, and the description of each (the size/flavor). Very useful, and some of the bestttt oysters I've had. And I realllyyy love fresh oysters.For entrees, my mom went with the hot lobster roll and I had the scallops. I don't even like lobster (I know, I'm weird), but the lobster roll was soo good. Is it weird that I thought the roll was even better? It's super fresh from a local bakery. Yum.The scallops were actually a very big portion. Very tasty, well-cooked, and actually ended up being more than I could eat. Delicious though!I think the cherry on top of the delicious food was the service. I saw only 2 or 3 waiters, yet despite the busyness of the place, the service was impeccable. They were calm, very knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. Some of the best service I've experienced in a long, long time. Neptune's may be a little pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for here. If you want a guaranteed good meal in Boston, come here!

Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: Been there once and have been yearning to go back. Their clam chowder is probably the best I've yet to have. Pair it with their lobster roll....I finally found something I can appreciate in new england

Reviews.Author: Thompson L.
Reviews.Content: Best Lobster Roll in MA.  The hot with butter was better than the cold.  The lobster was cooked to perfection and on a genuine new england roll.  It's pricey but worth the indulgence.. and while you're at it.. do yourself a favor and order yourself a dozen oysters.

Reviews.Author: Ken W.
Reviews.Content: This is an often well reviewed restaurant. Here is why I had a mixed experience: firstly, there were way too few wait staff. There was one overworked waitress for the half of the restaurant that was not seated at the bar. I ordered 4 Jonah crab claws at $5.25 each and she couldn't find time to get me a proper fork for digging out the flesh before I finished them. The fried clams were absolutely delicious, fresh and sweet, which is why it still gets 3 starts. They have a cioppino as well, not really the West Coast kind but the seafood is really fresh, two jumbo prawns, very sweet, even if the soup was not to my taste. The oyster over pork appetizer is not very good.  Everyone recommends the lobster roll, but the friend i was eating with had one before and he didn't like it so I didn't have it.

Reviews.Author: Jamie B.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I dined here on a Tuesday night.  We arrived about 7:00, and waited only 15 minutes!  They do not take reservations, so this was a pleasant surprise!  We sat at the bar and started with a dozen oysters.  We had a huge variety and all were extremely fresh and shucked right...no sand, no shell. Perfection.  We then had fried clams to share, which were HUGE and delicious.  They weren't as sweet as I had hoped, but I think these clams are how fried clams are supposed to taste.  (Since I am from Nebraska and now Illinois, I know all of the fried clams I have had over my lifetime have been frozen garbage.)  For dinner, I had to have the lobster roll because I have read such rave reviews.  It was wonderful- I ordered it as they suggest, hot with butter.  This was heavenly and huge!  The chunks of lobster meat and the nicely toasted bun were together one of the best things I have ever eaten.  My husband ordered the scallops, which were served with duck confit and beets, with a side of fresh greens.  They were perfectly cooked, not overdone, and succulently sweet.  Both of our meals were fantastic.The atmosphere is wonderful- very classic, yet modern and sophisticated.  I wouldn't recommend coming here with a large group unfortunately, because you may wait around 2 to 3 hours for a table.  The service is fantastic... I wish Neptune Oyster would open a location in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Ari B.
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything other than the Lobster Rolls here are unbelievably out of this world great!!! If you want to enjoy a great seafood meal, than look no further! For those that enjoy oysters and fish, this place is for you as well! I was not amazed by the clam chowder though. But like I said, a trip to Boston without a visit to Neptune Oyster is criminal!!

Reviews.Author: Ashwin T.
Reviews.Content: worth the wait. Was visiting boston for the weekend, and decided to come here for the lobster roll after reading good reviews, and a couple of personal recommendations. Went at an off meal time (4PM), and was still given a 90 minute wait time. ended up pregaming with oysters and clam chowder at union oyster house and came back just in time for the lobster roll (and another set of oysters). Went with the hot buttered version, which was indulgent and delicious. Served with a healthy portion of fries (although we left most of these untouched to save our appetite for the seafood).

Reviews.Author: Kristen M.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared! It's times like this I am so proud to be a Yelper.  So many surprised faces at the door confused and shocked by the wait quoted.  Thanks to fellow Yelpers, we had it all planned out. Got there at 4:30 pm, and put our name in. Only quoted a 1 hour wait.  She took our mobile number and promised to call. We strolled thtough Little Italy and enjoyed ourselves. Got a call after only 45 mins, and we went back and got seats at the bar, which was nice. We ordered some fresh and yummy oysters and the best hot lobster roll with butter I've ever had.  End of story. Thank you Yelp!

Reviews.Author: Charles C.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll EVER. Ton of lobster meat, amazing fries. Wait is long but you can leave your # and walk around the area. If you're in a group, get the neptune platter from the raw bar. The shrimp and crab claws are banging. Oh and don't bother with the cold roll, hot all the way!

Reviews.Author: Anna L.
Reviews.Content: love love love the oysters here!i loved the selection of oysters along with the little descriptions of where they are from, their size and flavor. we ordered 6 different oysters, all very fresh and delicious, clam chowder, and of course the maine lobster roll that everyone talks about. i have nothing more to say about the oysters. they were fresh and plump. period. The clam chowder was surprisingly light for a cream based soup. There were plenty of clams and not alot of fillers like potatoes and veggies. Also, it wasnt thick and starchy like the ones ive had before. it had a nice clammy, lightly creamy, delicious flavor. We ordered the lobster roll hot and buttered. They were huge chunks of lobster on a hot buttered roll with a side of fries. each lobster piece was succulent, chewy, and flavorful.the lobster roll did get a bit heavy towards the end and we were getting pretty full, but no doubt, it was DEEEEElicious!

Reviews.Author: Gabi F.
Reviews.Content: Loved their hot lobster rolls in butter. One of the best I ever had. Service was ok, food took a while to come out and waitress forgot to put in for our appetizer. The place is very small and they don't take reservations so it's probably better to come for an early dinner. Definitely will come back for another lobster roll next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Anya C.
Reviews.Content: I think Neptune Oyster is as good as it gets. I love this place! The service is always friendly and even though the seating is cozy, everyone is always super friendly and i've had many pleasant conversations with the people eating next to me.  I always forget to order the buttermilk johhnycake until i see someone else order it and wonder what that delicious dish might be...next time i'm going to try it. The clam chowder, cioppino and lobster rolls are my go-to favorites (along with a dozen oysters).

Reviews.Author: Paul K.
Reviews.Content: I've had some great lobster rolls including from Pearl Oyster Bar and Luke's in NYC.  The one they serve here is awesome and might be the best - opted for the warm butter (versus the cold mayo version), and it was amazing....huge, pieces of lobster (8-9 oz of meat), on a light/flaky roll.  Also tried the clam chowder, despite knowing it would be watery, which it was - definitely prefer the thicker version.  The PEI mussels were fine but their curry flavor was hardly noticeable.  I'll echo how tiny the place is and I can imagine going here during peak hours will require long waits - we went for a weekday lunch around noon and were seated right away.

Reviews.Author: Emma T.
Reviews.Content: This is hands down one of the best paces in the city for seafood. It's such a quaint little place, service is always great, and the food is spectacular...always. Have never had a bad meal here. I absolutely love this place in the fall for lunch. On a crisp, fall, sunny day you walk over sit at the bar,  have some oysters, wine, lobster roll...people watch...it's the best. I would definitely recommend sitting at the bar as well. And though they don't take reservations, if you have to wait just go over to Goody's grab a beer and your seat will be ready before you know it! My only tiff with this place is their tartar sauce. I give them props for making it homemade, but I personally prefer the good ole mass produced tartar.

Reviews.Author: Anne J.
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, knowledgeable staff, fantastic oysters, and the blue crab salad was to die for. Wow! Only gripe is that it's cramped and loud, but I didn't care since the food was so good. Bill for two dozen oysters, the salad (we shared), and two glasses of wine was just over $100 - definitely not cheap, but the oysters really were fabulous.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline B.
Reviews.Content: In Boston for some fall foliage and sight seeing.  Wanted to have a fancy night out in a big city.  (We are surrounded by Applebees and Olive Gardens in my home town.)Best dining experience of my life.  I recommend sitting at the bar... feels more quaint and you get more attention from the bartender.  Had a wonderful bartender/waitress.  She picked an awesome bottle of wine for us based on what I told her I liked... was very attentive but not annoying.  We ordered the crab claw, 5 different kinds of oysters, 2 jumbo shrimp, clam chowder, steamed clams and 2 lobster rolls.  The lobster rolls really ARE ridiculously wonderful.  Even the fries they serve with them just compliment the roll properly.  Not sure how to explain it.  At first you're like eh... fries, I wont waste belly space on them.  But then you are like yummm! These are the best fries ever!!  Clam chowder was just ok.  Wasnt bad, but nothing to write home about.  Steamed clams were huge and the sauce they were in was interesting.  I'm sure I knocked a year or two off my life from all the butter but we don't splurge like this often... I'm glad we chose here to do so.

Reviews.Author: Cindy S.
Reviews.Content: This place is FAB-U-LOUS! Yumm! Had to wait a bit, but it was well worth it. My husband and I shared the fried clams (delicious!!), a bowl of chowder, and a hot lobster roll with butter and fries. One of my favorites!

Reviews.Author: Marni J.
Reviews.Content: Small busy place that seats about 25-30 people including the bar.  The service is certainly not rude, but no smiles either.  However The OYSTERS were fantastic, and very faily priced, not only the selection was great and fresh, it almost seems as though the Oyster Technician personally selected them!!  The appetizers were good but nothing to write home about.  This is a great little place for oysters and it's tucked inside of northend.  Parking is non-existent.

Reviews.Author: Jill k.
Reviews.Content: now, apparently, there is a epicurean delight in new england called the lobster (lobstah?) roll.  before researching this trip, i had never heard of it... but once i did, i had to have one!thanks to ligaya t., i learned of neptune oyster, and on our last day in the area, we made our way there.this place was old school cool.  and cozy.  but perfect for the drizzly evening.  we amazingly scored a table without too much trouble, and promptly ordered ourselves lobster rolls.um, wow.  WOW!  we had seen some pictures of lobster rolls previously, but these rolls were gargantuan, with gargantuan chunks of hot and buttered lobster just spilling out...and as for the taste?  as spectacular as i could've dreamed!  i really can't wait to have one again!note: the oysters and fries were delicious too!

Reviews.Author: DeeJay H.
Reviews.Content: Maybe the conditions were just optimal....I had to go with the 4.   We found parking out front which is like some sort of miracle in the North End.   Walked into the normally packed restaurant and got seated right away at a gorgeous table.   Had a fantastic bottle of white with the a dozen of the freshest oysters- followed by one of the most interesting appetizers.  Crostini with uni, strawberries and bacon.   It exploded with flavor and was like nothing I have ever tasted.   I want to go back now and have it again.   Knowledgeable, friendly staff- All and all a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Started with half dozen raw clams as an appetizer.  They were fresh, sweet, and a little salty just as they should be.  Had the Bronzini for an entree.  You work a little for your meal since there are bones throughout, but it is well worth it.  The sauce the Bronzini is served in is perfect for dipping bread into.  My sister had the warm lobster roll which was also delicious.  This place is small so there usually will be a wait.  It was hot as hell in there last Sunday during dinner or I would have given 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Sam S.
Reviews.Content: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Boston. It is a little on the pricy side, but I've never eaten something here that I didn't like. They don't skimp on portions, try the blue crab salad its AWESOME.

Reviews.Author: Greg P.
Reviews.Content: This is a must while in Boston.  Very small location in the North End section of town - so its great if your visiting as you will come close by on the Freedom Trail walk (great attitude adjustment stop for wine,  hint hint).  One note - they do not take reservations so you will have to plan your visit in the off hours - like a late lunch.  Another note, is that you can give them your cell phone number and they will call when your table is ready - which is pretty cool since there is so much to see right around the North End.I have been here quite a bit and never had a bad experience.  We prefer to sit at the bar since they have only a few tables and they are very close together.Very good wine list and the food is outstanding!  I love the steamed wellfleet littleneck clam app as well as their NE clam chowder - usually get one or the other as a starter every time I visit!  The oysters are really good as well - they are fresh from around the world so the selection varies.  You can order a dozen or you can make your own dozen from the various oysters they have that day - its a great way to sample various oysters from different area's.    But you have to safe room for the OYSTER ROLL!!!!!!! It is the best i have ever had!  I usually get the hot buttered oyster roll - it is sooo fresh and tender...wow!!!!!!The service has always been top notch and they are always very patient as they walk through the various fresh oysters and clams they have that day.

Reviews.Author: EP G.
Reviews.Content: Awesome lobster roll - get the warm version with butter. Oysters were fantastic - fresh, ice cold and tasty, each kind we ordered was just as described.  Tuna tartare  sandwich with (cooked) veal (yes - both together in one sandwich!) was interesting, tasty and a bit spicy. Yum! Worth the wait - leave your phone number with the hostess and go grab a drink down the street, or walk around the cute North End until you get the call back. You won't be disappointed. Our waitress was pleasant and knowledgeable. Nice selection of wines and beers. Small place (seats about 40?) with a fun, classy, easy-going vibe.

Reviews.Author: Colin D.
Reviews.Content: Came here on Saturday after seeing the reviews on Yelp and I wasn't disappointed. I had some Oysters to start with which were good but then I had the warm Lobster roll with butter. Oh my it was delicious, the combination of butter and lobster is just perfect. Was a little crowded but hey I don't mind it's great to see a place like this succeed. The only downside is that I probably won't eat another lobster roll since I can't see anyone else matching this one

Reviews.Author: Sara M.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place for fresh oysters. As others have said, the lobster roll is also AMAZING. If you come for anything else, expect a limited (but yummy!) menu and a cramped (but kinda cozy!) location. I love coming and eating at the bar... my husband and I had a lovely New Year's Eve dinner at the bar one year. Very sweet and memorable. It is a little pricey but not unreasonable for a special occasion. The employees are always pleasant and I have never felt rushed here, despite its popularity and small size.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia Y.
Reviews.Content: $25 for hot lobster roll -- worth every single dollar. the place is really small. as small as giacomo's. be prepared to wait, or if you're lucky like me, i was able to get a seat right away.their clam chowder had so much clam, I didn't know what to do with, and it was much lighter than one may consider a chowder. none the less it was really good.try their local beer ... boston ipa was it? it was very nice with the lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Mike Z.
Reviews.Content: waited aout 30 mins for the two of us to get seated. Ordered 3 different types of oysters (byond excellent - so fresh), some clam chowder(I've had better but still tasty - needs to be a bit thicker and potatoes cooked more) and the lobster roll (hot with butter - F'in awesome). I think 9 out of 10 people there ordered the lobster roll so we knew it had to be good and it didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Author: John E.
Reviews.Content: Agree with everyone else, great lobster roll. 45 min wait at 430pm Saturday. I heard them say it was 2 hours at 515pm. The Neptune is a raw sampler, $58 with lots of variety

Reviews.Author: James Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll, lobster roll, lobster roll. The only bad thing is this is the only place you'll ever be able to eat one because no other roll competes. Get there early, they don't take reservations but they will take your name and number and call you when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Beth M.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here the other night - I realized after we committed to meeting there that it was a Thursday and we'd likely wait a long time. I typically tell people, if you want to try this place - go mon-wed. Once thu hits, the line gets long, real long. We waited over 2 hours. They took our number down so we could roam around while we waited. At first it was fine because we grabbed a drink across the street - but once the hunger pains hit and I didn't want to waste my appetite on anything else, we started to get a little 'over tha wait.' We were finally seated close to 9:00pm - they actually had to turn a bunch of other folks away that they just couldn't seat before closing. Strangely, we sat there for over 5 minutes with no one taking our order. I got grumpy - hey, if you're going to have customers waiting 2hours, expect that they're going to look for very good service. When the waitress finally came by - my icey attitude melted away because she was very nice. We ordered a bunch of oysters for an appetizer and 2 hot lobster rolls for dinner. I had trouble deciding on a glass of wine and asked for a suggestion by the waitress. Well, I guess I should have realized that I may have set myself up, but little did I know she suggested the $15 glass of red. I had no idea it'd be $15...there were no other red wines by the glass on the menu for that much. It was delicious - so her suggestion wasn't bad - but I got sticker shock when the bill came. 2 glasses costing a cool $30 - add on 2 $25 lobster rolls, oysters, and my husbands beers - it was a legit bill. I was glad to be buzzed signing that tab. At the end of the day, I still think its the best lobster roll and the only hot, buttered version I know of in the city. Very generous with the lobster meat as well. But beware of the wait and the small quarters!

Reviews.Author: Noelle A.
Reviews.Content: Yes. Everything people are saying. Yes. I went on a recent trip with my boyfriend and we are poor college students. Even so, we knew we had to treat ourselves and decided Neptune was the place to do it. Not disappointed in the slightest. We stopped at the restaurant at 7:45 pm on a Friday night. We were told it would be about 45 minutes which was fine by us as it let us to park our car and check into our hotel. 45 minutes on the dot, we got the call that they were ready for us. The place is small (like knocking elbows with the person next to me small), which might be my only complaint, but good food is good food. We decided to be adventurous and order some oysters because...when in Rome, right? They were delicious! They include a pretty detailed description of every oyster they offer and they also include the place they came from which was a nice touch. Obviously, we both ordered the hot buttered lobster roll, him with fries, me with the salad. Yes. Just yes. There are really no words to describe how good this lobster roll was.The butter soaked up so nicely into the bread - which was soft but not at all soggy. There are literally chunks. of. lobster OVERFLOWING out of the sandwich. I think perfect is the only way to describe this sandwich. Get it. Seriously. The fries, like people said, were not out of this world amazing, but i mean. OVERFLOWING with lobster. One can hardly complain. The salad, on the other hand, had this really fantastic pecan citrus vinaigrette that was a really unexpected treat. All in all, the resounding verdict I have is : yes. If you don't know where to eat, I cannot recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Author: Mina I.
Reviews.Content: Oysters on the half shell plus fried oysters equals oyster heaven!  Believe it or not this place has converted me to an oyster lover.  The staff is really friendly and helpful even though the place is really small and a tiny bit tricksy to maneuver.  I am constantly daydreaming about this place..  yum

Reviews.Author: robert o.
Reviews.Content: A great small hidden gem!!! I have been going to Neptunes since they opened. I have an affinity for a dozen or so of their littlenecks clams, then I move on to a lobster roll. I prefer the hot lobster roll that the cold version. Both are extremely fresh and filled. Their fries are amazing!!

Reviews.Author: Kate M.
Reviews.Content: I agree! Very quaint little gem in the North End. Great place for a date. Pricier than most, however worth it. The quality of food is excellent! Staff is friendly and menu is unique. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Erin B.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is worthy of the rave reviews and worth the expensive prices.  This tiny oyster bar is situated on Salem Street in the North End, smack dab in Italian Restaurant territory.  It has a cozy get-to-know-your-neighbor feel.  If you are going with a friend or on a date I recommend sitting at the bar, it's almost more private than a table.  Neptune has a GREAT wine selection and their bartenders are very knowledgeable about food and drink.  I got hooked on their oysters last summer and it was burning a hole in my wallet until I learned to shuck my own (see Mercato Del Mare review).  Oysters, little necks, lobster salad, IT'S ALL GOOD!  Check this place out for a unique seafood experience but be prepared to wait as they don't take reservations.

Reviews.Author: Andrea C.
Reviews.Content: If it was acceptable to weigh a million pounds and die of a heart attack, I would do it here with their amazing lobster rolls. I am drooling just thinking about it. I have never had a sandwich so sinfully delicious or seafoood so sinfully delicious. I would have to say their lobster roll almost beats out my mother's famous lobster thermidor.Oh....how I could just eat that for days.My husband and I wondered into this restaurant over Memorial Day weekend and luckily were able to be seated within 5 minutes.We had their oysters to order which were good, and their made to order clam chowder. However, the lobster roll which is a small whooping $25 worth every penny, was by far the star item for us. We chose to have the hot lobster roll on a warm baguette drenched in a seasoned butter. I mean sinfully drenched. The sandwich was perfect, the bread was light, fluffy, and not too dense. The lobster was tender, not over cooked, and cut into nice bite size chunks. Needless to say, we had to roll ourselves out of the restaurant after all the wine and food. I am so happy this place is not walking distance to us.

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: Went here to beat the heat, unfortunately they don't have AC (and for some reason the Sox game wasn't on as I had expected). Regardless, a nice glass of Vihno Verde cooled me right off, along with a half dozen oysters. I had the hot lobster roll here this past winter, and it's by far my fav in the city. I ventured out and tried the scallops, which were rich and caramelized on top. Beets, hazelnuts, goat cheese, watercress, and figs really set the scallops off. Plus the diver scallops were huge! It was a great lunch, I definitely want to come back and try the North End Cioppino.

Reviews.Author: ack c.
Reviews.Content: man oh man, just thinking about this place makes me want to grab my coat, my baby, and run to the north end. blasted snow!  i think this place is one of the best seafood joints in boston. it's small, cute, great fresh food, and great staff... totally earns the 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Kazuo O.
Reviews.Content: Came here to eat lunch before the Red Sox game.  I ordered the hot lobster roll.  The roll had nice chunks of buttery lobster goodness.  Fries were okay.  Compared to B&G Oysters I like this place better.  The lobster roll was $25.

Reviews.Author: A T.
Reviews.Content: Prepare for a crowd, which is always a sign of good food. Pull up a seat at the white marble bar and order some champagne or white wine, then let the staff wow you with the selection of oysters and clams. Everything was super fresh and de-lish!

Reviews.Author: ML ..
Reviews.Content: It's funny, I came here way back in 2006 on a one day trip to Boston...loved the town, wish I could have spent more time there.  Anyway, I went with a friend who at the time was working the line at a raw seafood restaurant in San Francisco, so we ordered lots of oysters and in general sampled a lot of their crudo offerings.  It was such a good meal and so memorable.  In fact I was thinking about it the other day...then my gf and I decided to go watch The Town tonight and there was one scene set in a restaurant that looked exactly like how I remembered Neptune's to be, so naturally I had to Google it to confirm and whattya know, it WAS Neptune's.  So I decided to give'em a Yelp.  I sure do miss this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Jenny M.
Reviews.Content: Great little place, Fantastic Lobster Roll and Cocktail Shrimp.  Also they rocked out a delicious burger for my non seafood eating hubby.  I would get something else next time.  Nice service.  Not sure its worth a two hour wait, but definitely a class act!

Reviews.Author: Ricky R.
Reviews.Content: Go here and eat beautiful, fresh, clean oysters. They give you a slip of paper w the flavor profile of each oyster, you write down how many of each kind you like. Love it!I get the Johnnycake, I feel it is one of the most wonderful things in the world. I wanna spread the smoked trout, caviar and creme fraiche all over the cake, roll it up and eat it, but I dont, I use a fork. The cake is crispy, a little sweet and a little savory and the perfect accompaniment to the fish. It is in my eyes, absolutely perfectly constructed, thought out, and executed. It humbles me with its simplicity, texture and flavor. These people in the kitchen care about me as a customer so much that they create dishes like these. It makes me feel loved to be in there. For another starter, I've also had the neptunes on piggyback, they're fried oysters on roasted pork on crostini with pistachio aioli. I have to try this dish again, to be honest I had it right after I had the Johnnycake for the first time and I was still weak in the knees from the johnnycake, its hard to follow that johnnycake.I've also had their burger, it is a beautiful thing. Why waste stomach space on a burger at a seafood place? Because it has fried oysters on it, and if they care about their meat as much as their seafood, its a lock that the burger would be divine, also the lovely Sarah (hope I spelled it right) recommended it. It was, in fact, divine, perfectly cooked (although a little under seasoned for my taste) with cheddar, fried oysters, garlic mayo and a pickle relish. A Beautiful Burger! Beautiful is how i would describe everything I've had here, not so much in presentation, but in flavor. Clean, fresh, beautiful food.Oh yeah and they pull a proper (imperial) pint of Guinness here, lovely. Sadly they do not have Fernet Branca, but it is in the North End, so Fernet is around the corner.

Reviews.Author: Shannon K.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is, hands down, the most fabulous restaurant I've been to in my entire life.First, the food: absolutely orgasmic. It's actually quite a bit cheaper than I would expect, given the quality. I had the buttermilk johnnycake as an appetizer -- something I'd never even heard of before. It's a honey butter crêpe topped with smoked trout tartar and caviar. Now, I'm an American/Italian food kinda gal -- cheeseburgers, calamari, potato skins, et cetera -- but this completely blew my mind. I ate more slowly than I ever have in my life, just so that it would last longer! For dinner, I had the Maine lobster roll, served hot. This being March and, thus, not lobster season, I didn't expect to be impressed... but it was by far the most delicious, juicy, succulent lobster I've ever had. And they didn't drench it in butter, either: it was lightly brushed -- the perfect amount. Absolutely amazing! Months later, I still think about this dinner and wish I didn't live 3,100 miles away so I could visit it more than once a year!The service was attentive and friendly. Our drinks were never empty, and the food came out speedily and with care. The chef himself attended our table on no fewer than three occasions to make sure we were happy and to offer any assistance he could -- even such mundane tasks as filling our drinks.Those who are looking for a quiet, spacious, private place for a relaxed dinner or an intimate date will need to look somewhere else. It was noisy (though not prohibitively so -- I never once had trouble hearing my companion) and incredibly crowded, even when sitting down. We shared our table with two other couples (there are only spots for perhaps 30 people in the entire restaurant). That said, the air of happiness, the smell of delicious food, the hustle and bustle of a busy, successful restaurant, the chatter of obviously pleased customers, and the warmth of both the staff and the interior itself contributed to making the experience an exceedingly comfortable and enjoyable one.The bad: the wait is long -- hours, and even so it's still far longer than they quote -- and annoying in that there's no standing room. I was incredibly frustrated by the time our table became available; we'd been shoved, pushed, and snapped at by other equally frustrated customers for far too long a time. But once I sat down and had a taste of the amazing food, I was incredibly glad that I'd stuck it out... and you will be, too!

Reviews.Author: Brian J.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll ever. So much that I had to give some to my wife cause I couldn't finish it. Oysters were good and fresh and the staff know everything about them. No matter what, you're going to have to wait, so give the hostess your cell number and go for a walk around the North End (and maybe hit Modern Pastry for dessert).

Reviews.Author: Tasha D.
Reviews.Content: We stopped by here on a Saturday in June because the nyt told us to (travel.nytimes.com/2010/…).  At about 1:30, we were told there was a wait of 45 minutes, so we wandered around and back and they called my cell when our table was ready.  Ordered a glass of rose and a hot lobster roll.  Both were excellent, but the lobster roll was out-of-this-world good.  It was I-will-fly-to-Boston-just-for-this good.  My friend took pictures of it and we daydream while staring at them good.  I think the roll had about 3 lobsters worth of meat or something in them.  We could have split one and still not had room for dessert.  Ridiculous.

Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll in Boston. Massive portion of hot fresh lobster dripping with butter on a toasted roll with fries. Try going during weekdays or during off hours to avoid long waits. Also, delicious and unique clam chowder! Pricey, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Author: Art W.
Reviews.Content: Came at 5:20 pm and was told 2 hour wait.  Fine - no problem.  Ate a pastry, had a cappuccino, and a few drinks.  Now came back and told another 45 minutes.  Fine - waited in the park and people watched.  Came back and ended up waiting 3 hours and 20 minutes total for a seat.  It felt like a miracle - like winning the frickin lottery.  Now we were seated and ready to order.  Had a couple of nice glasses of white wine.  Now the main courses....The branzino and the lobster roll were great and well priced for what they are.  You can read in detail about the lobster roll in other reviews.  My mom got the roasted 2 lb lobster at market price.  At an amazing $55 this dish sucked.  Actually, at any price point it was terrible.  How do you destroy a perfectly good 2 lb lobster?  You put it in the oven till it looses all juiceness and until it's tough and rubbery - too tough for the knife you are trying to cut it with.  Really disappointing since we were expecting an expertly cooked piece of lobster.  It's not hard.  Service was meh.  The waitresses are obviously over extended.  Forgot my glass of wine until I repeatedly asked about it.  They're kind of snappy when you ask how long more you have to wait for obvious reasons (how many times a day do they get asked this each day?).  Anyways, not likely to repeat and do not recommend with the plentiful other restaurants in the North End.  If you do go, send a single person at 3:30 or 4:00 pm and then go and hang out somewhere else for the 2+ hours you wait for a table.Lobster roll raises it to 3 stars.  Otherwise it would have gotten 2 stars in my book.  Still not worth the wait.  The day before, we had the lobster roll at The Lobster Pot in Provincetown which was just as good and took them literally 2 minutes to make.

Reviews.Author: Charlotte S.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. Came here for a mid-day birthday 'snack'. Totally turned into a full meal. I mean, how could you not?! Had a dozen assorted oysters (mainly West Coast varieties). The ceviche was out of this world, and the mussels were perfect. Sat right at the bar, had great service, and even caught the beginnings of our beloved Eagles play some football on tv. (The lost- whomp whomp). Regardless, 100% would tell anyone the HAVE to check this place out!!!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen J.
Reviews.Content: OMG - a place to die for!! This restaurant is quite small and was very busy even at 3 in the afternoon.  This was my first visit after reading the raving reviews and my love for lobster.  The 20 minute wait and relatively slower than expected service was well worth it!My guest and I tried the raw oysters and ordered the warm lobster roll (signature item on the menu).  We enjoyed our choice of fresh raw oysters so much that we had to order more.  The lobster roll was finger licking good - the lobster was cooked just right and wasn't filled with just claw meat.  It had good sized chunks of lobster tail with the perfect amount of butter - I was literally in lobster heaven!!  Despite feeling stuffed, we were compelled to order another lobster roll to share!!!Maybe we can keep this gem hidden from all the tourists so the wait wouldn't be so long but it seems highly unlikely.  I will be a regular at this place and hope it never changes.

Reviews.Author: Brittany B.
Reviews.Content: THE best lobster roll I have ever had. Hot and lathered with butter on a toasted roll with seasoned french fries... I'm drooling just thinking about it. Every person on the wait staff always seems like they are two seconds away from having a mental breakdown/beating someone up, but I guess it's because tensions are high when you don't take reservations and the line for a two person table can be 2+ hours long. If you can go during off-peak hours, it's an amazing experience. If not, be prepared to put in the time to wait for a table. The good news is they take phone numbers so you can walk around the north end, grab a drink, relax while you wait.

Reviews.Author: B. T.
Reviews.Content: The restaurant doesn't take reservations and it is small so likely you'll wait.  If you have a problem with that, find somewhere else in The North End... there's no shortage of options.  If you have some time to kill, find a place to hang for an hour or two and wait it out for an amazing meal at Neptune Oyster... that's what we did.  After going to a pub for a few beers and watching some of The Sox game while waiting for our table (two hour wait on a busy Thursday in August), we were promptly seated.  Raw bar was a good as I remember on my last visits with a great selection and shucked properly with no shell fragments ending up in my mouth! For mains we had The North End Cioppino with Lobster added (worth the extra cost!) and The Scallops.  Both were off the chart amazing.  This may be my favourite restaurant on earth... definitely top 3!

Reviews.Author: Rainbowz R.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Janice L.
Reviews.Content: Seafood 5 stars, but packed seating affects overall experience. We lucked into 2 fairly uncomfortable stools right away at the bar at 6 pm on a Thurs as larger parties queued up. Friendly wait staff, good wine suggestions. Outstanding steamed mussel app. w pernod cream sauce, but had to ask for bread to sop it up, received 2 nicely grilled slices. Sumptuous hot lobster on good roll albeit w soft home-made fries but friend liked them. Cioppino w lobster added was excellent w good variety and very filling after the mussel app--lobster, 3 each mussels and clams, salmon, small piece white fish, 1 jumbo shrimp, all atop a spicy, slightly creamy light tomato-ey broth over rice--perfectly cooked and completely satisfying. $110 w tip for one app, 2 entrees, and 2 glasses wine. Not cheap, but quality and quantity earned the price. If not crowded in along the bar atop hard barstools, it would have been a perfect meal. Would dine here 2-3 times a week if had the means to do so. A true gem in the North End and for the city.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer D.
Reviews.Content: They have very good oysters for a hefty price (though that's typical in Boston).  The grilled oysters were good, but the ham on it was too salty.  The steamed clams are good.This place is very small and tight, and expect a long wait for seating.

Reviews.Author: April I.
Reviews.Content: Give me oysters or give me death!!! Oh how I love Neptune Oysters. Let me count the ways: 1) The menu is perfect and focuses on fresh seafood with an emphasis on tasty oysters. I've had east coast oysters like Malpeques and Blue Points to the west coast varieties like Kumamoto and Fanny Bay. It's all good. 2) Hot lobster roll with butter on a toasted roll. Hot diggity damn do I love this and I'm from Maine! I grew up a lobster roll traditionalist -- lobster, a bit of mayo, and a toasted hot dog bun is what I had considered to be the bomb, but the hot lobster roll at Neptune Oyster is awesome. And for those times when I am feeling a bit traditional they do offer a cold lobster roll with mayo (not as good in my opinion though). 3) Olive oil shallot mignonette for your oysters --hey you are in the North End after all so this mignonette really represents your location. I thought it was weird the first time I tried it, but now I kind of like it. It adds a nice flavor with my oysters. 4) Try their daily specials -- lobster spaghettini, fritto misto, risotto...c'mon this ain't some leftover crap you'd get at most restaurants. Their specials are GOOD and again fresh. They often sell out!! 5) Wine list -- by the glass, by the half bottle, or by the bottle. From fairly inexpensive to much to much for my budget they have a great selection and the staff don't bat an eye if you order the $29 bottle of white or the $100 of red. 6) The staff are really quite unpretentious here which is a rarity. They are friendly and move quickly and are unassuming and make suggestions are the right time. I could keep going, but here is what I recommend you do:Walk to the T. Get on said T and head to Government Center or Haymarket (your choice). Walk from T to the North End, Salem Street to be exact. Go into Neptune Oyster. Order a dozen (to start) of east and west coast oysters. Order a glass of wine or even a bellini. Order a hot lobster roll. Sit back, slurp, drink, repeat!!  Order more oysters.  Have another drink.  Leave very happy!!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen A.
Reviews.Content: This place is a lot smaller than I imagined it would be. It is cramped, yet intimate, and I think it added to the whole experience of eating fabulously good seafood. My boyfriend and I ordered 3 varieties of oysters (which I can't remember the names of), simply based on their medium salt content. Delicious! I was hesitant to order the lobster roll because it was so expensive, but I went for it and got a hot lobster roll. Then! I realized why it was expensive. Because it's so good! Fresh lobster meat drenched in butter with toasted bread..yum. My boyfriend ordered the North End cioppino, and that was amazing as well. Not only was it plentiful in various seafood, but the broth was very addicting. Some of the best food I have had in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Matt S.
Reviews.Content: Simply great seafood here. The room is packed a little tight - we sat at the bar. We ordered a dozen oysters from all over the map - each one the pinnacle of freshness and all delicious. Followed up with two lobster rolls, one hot and one cold. Which was better? My wife and I are still debating. The hot tastes like a freshly shelled lobster with drawn butter, the cold is chilled with a very subtle and crisp mayonnaise. I cannot recommend this restaurant more highly.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: My coworker and I got a ton of different oysters and some raw clams as well.  We also split the lobster roll, naked style.  This is one of the rare places that offers their lobster roll without the mayonnaise dressing.  The generous chunks of lobster were drizzled with warm butter and served up on a warm, fluffy roll, next to a huge order of fries.  Delicious!  It's a bit pricey here, but it's worth the money.  It's a small restaurant, but we just sat at the counter and we were fine.

Reviews.Author: Yb W.
Reviews.Content: My first lobster roll ever! Fresh, warm, buttery roll teeming with large chunks of juicy, poached lobster. Option of hot with butter or cold with mayonnaise. Comes with lots'o'fries if lobster and butter aren't filling enough. Pricey at $25, but they don't skimp on the lobster. Also had the special of the day, a striper with blue crab salad and creamy mashed potatoes ($30). Everything was delish. The singular disappointment was the clam chowder, which was undersalted and watery. But overall, very pleased with the entrées. Restaurant is small and service is SLOW--tasty lobster only for those who are willing to wait.

Reviews.Author: Steve G.
Reviews.Content: Great, little spot.  Does not take reservations and it is small, so be prepared to wait.  Lobster roll is incredible and the crab meat salad is one of the best values around.

Reviews.Author: Faye Z.
Reviews.Content: Thi is the best oyster place! Their fresh made clam chowder is very different and refreshing. If you are a seafood fan, you will be crazy about this place! It's packed at lunch time, so try to avoid the peak hour.

Reviews.Author: Joanne R.
Reviews.Content: After I started a thread a while back searching for the "perfect lobster roll" and almost unanimously was directed to Neptune Lobster.  Well, at long last, I met a friend for lunch and ventured to the "other part of the world" (i.e. the North End) to Neptune and I found THE PERFECT LOBSTER ROLL!!  They offer two variations, regular (w/mayo) and the other served hot w/drawn butter.  At our server's recommendation, I opted for the latter and it was a meal of deliciousness!!!  While somewhat pricey ($25), it was worth every morsel.  While this was my first time to Neptune...I will definitely be back to sample its other offerings or maybe to get another heavenly LR.

Reviews.Author: Meagan L.
Reviews.Content: Best freaking meal of my life. I went to Boston hoping to eat as much seafood as possible and boy did I ever. Great oysters and the lobster stroganaff was probably the best meal I've ever had in my life. Very knowledgeable wait staff and great wine too. I only wish I lived in Boston so I could eat here more often!

Reviews.Author: Steve W.
Reviews.Content: Ate here on a Yelp recommendation.  Came to Boston for a work trip and wanted seafood.Had the Neptune on piggyback appetizer and it was very good!  Lobster roll for lunch.  As reviewed earlier, it was excellent!  Food was pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Author: Leslie N.
Reviews.Content: So, we actually didn't even get in. we got there and the were no longer taking people in. and of course reservations are a no. we begged them to get us a hot lobster roll togo. they agreed. it was AMAZING.  next time though.. i'd like to actually get in and sit and eat, id really like to get at the oysters

Reviews.Author: Ri H.
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews say, this place is seriously the best place for oysters! We got an assortment from the raw bar and a main dish. The waitstaff are patient, informative, and helpful. They helped us navigate through the wine list and pick something appropriate with our oyster and clam assortment. The wait is long (and we went on a Tuesday night), but they take your phone number down, so while you are waiting, go to Modern Pastry or Mike's an enjoy a coffee and consider it an extended dinner.The casual atmosphere is nice and unpretentious, but the only thing that could be a downside is if you end up sharing a table with some loud people with annoying conversation.

Reviews.Author: Christopher L.
Reviews.Content: Serious about oysters and clams. So good. The crab claws were iced and therefore cold and gross. The steamed clams are awesome! We dipped bread into the broth.

Reviews.Author: Jillian S.
Reviews.Content: Long wait was worth it. Cozy space without feeling claustrophobic, great service, quitessential New England food. At our table, a few dozen local oysters were consumed as well as the oysters in piggyback - fried oysters atop pulled pork on baguette with chutneyed golden raisins and greens. Oh my gosh, so good. The lobster rolls and lobster spaghettini were also fabulous. Put your name in with the hostess and get a drink at a local bar with outside seating. They'll call your cell when a table becomes available.

Reviews.Author: Hungry M.
Reviews.Content: If you're in Boston and have time to go to only one place for dinner, this should be the place. Other then the wait (it's tiny), there is nothing I don't love about this place. Super cool atmosphere, excellent service and awesome food. Here's a tip: put your name down and go next door to Ernesto's pizza and have a slice as an appetizer. Fantastic pizza, and according to all the accolades on the wall, best pizza in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Josh A.
Reviews.Content: Food is good but not sure the excessive wait is worth the food....we had to wait over 2 hours to be seated.  The place is extremely small so i wouldnt recommend going on a weekend unless you have 2 hours to kill.

Reviews.Author: Roger W.
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to visit Neptune Oyster after it was featured on the Food Network.  Hot lobster roll is not as common as the cold version.  It was my first experience with the hot lobster roll.  Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the hype.  No major flaw, but I thought it was a bit on the chewy side.  Clam chowder was decent with good amount clams, but the overall quantity was small.  I recommend the Neptunes on Piggyback.  The crispy oysters, golden grape, and Bershire pig really came together nicely with good flavor and texture combination.

Reviews.Author: Pat M.
Reviews.Content: Great SEAFOOD !! Great Service !!!

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S.
Reviews.Content: Just spent a couple days in Boston, which I highly recommend!  I felt the necessity to get some Chowda while there, but did not want to go to the Union Chowder House, sure its good but seemed like a tourist trap.  So I asked the bartender if he were to get a bowl were would he do and he recommended Neptune's.  It was excellent.  Not as thick as I thought it would be, but was perfect.  Plenty of clams and very rich.  Later found out that they had been rated the best lobster roll, maybe next time I'll get that.  Place is very small, as are most of the restaurants in the area.  I was told that you can't go wrong in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Ashley D.
Reviews.Content: i don't even know how i could have given this place 4 stars before. this is hands down my favorite spot in boston. finally tried the hot lobster roll with butter and it was definitely one of the best things i have ever eaten. on top of that i highly, highly recommend the lobster cocktail. it was delicious and all of the flavor components were on point. it's a bit pricey but then you realize it's freaking lobster. and not only that but it's prepared perfectly and the portion size is pretty generous. there was a bit of a wait to get a table but it wasn't a problem for us at all. the hostess/waitress took down our name and phone number so we walked around the area for a while and she called us when our table was almost ready. good service, great food. love love love everything about neptune

Reviews.Author: Amy P.
Reviews.Content: The only reason this was not 5 stars was due to the sheer stress of eating here. The place is so teeny tiny that 3 people standing to put their name in blocks the whole front! Otherwise DELISH. Lobster roll was ammmmaaaaaazzzzzing. Fries were fries, not great, but okay. I noticed pretty much nobody touched the fries, so having other options might be nice. Coleslaw, side of soup, etc. Very fresh seafood. Clam chowder gets 2 stars for being really watery and thin. A must try though!

Reviews.Author: Jessie E.
Reviews.Content: Truly amazing. Oysters are ultra fresh, devils on horseback is crispy deliciousness. I dont waste my time on lobster rolls but it seems to be the place to get it. Of course I do wish they took reservations because it's a nightmare to get it but the wait is worth it. Great wine list!

Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: Great oyster bar and lobster roll chowder was awesome as we're the scallops

Reviews.Author: C T.
Reviews.Content: I visited Boston for the first time over a year ago and I still think about this place. It was so amazing!! From the oysters, to the clam chowder, to the lobster roll! I still dream about it haha. The food is amazing. The best thing to do is go early though. We got there at 7pm, they took down our phone number and we didn't get a table until 9pm. They stop taking people after a certain time as well just because the place is so small. Just plan ahead because it is so worth it!

Reviews.Author: Essie Y.
Reviews.Content: Hands down, BEST LOBSTER ROLL!The wait is usually at least an hour for 2 people, so be prepared to wait. The place is quite small, and fits probably about 20 maximum. The atmosphere is very cozy and service is usually pretty friendly. In any case, the hot butter lobster roll is worth coming back for again and again!

Reviews.Author: Chuck D.
Reviews.Content: I really don't think I can put into words the meal I had at Neptune Oyster Friday Night...People can rave about a place all they want but it usually doesn't live up to expectations...as much hype as I heard about this place I was completely blown away by the Fried Clams, Oysters and Lobster roll I ordered. First lets start off with the Fried Clams...Ive been everywhere for fried clams and they're prob my favorite thing to eat...Woodmans, Farnhams, Clam Box, Clam Shack, Kellys...you name it Ive been there. The Clam Shack in Kennebunk,ME was the mecca of fried clams for me until I had them at Neptune. They were done perfectly...nice slightly salty taste and a perfect batter. The Oysters made Legal Seafoods raw oyster bar seem like a joke...so fresh you could taste the sea water. Finally the lobster roll...a Real Lobster roll...chunks of lobster meat tossed with butter and the most amazing french fries makes me wish I never moved to LA if I knew how good this spot was. Special Thanks to Tiffany our waitress who gave 3 glasses of champagne on the house for my birthday. I give this place THE BEST OF THE BEST AWARD....100/100 I certainly DUKE IT!!!I do want to note...the lines are insane here...Heres my advice...GET THERE EARLY...Anytime after 5:30 you are looking at a 2-3 Hour wait due to limited seating... They do allow you to put your name down and they will call your cell phone when your table is ready...beats standing in line on the street. Whatever the wait is....TRUST ME...ITS WORTH IT!!!!

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: The food is good. The fried clams are delicate and not overly breaded. The clams must be fresh because you can still taste some brine and they have a fresh consistency. Oysters are good and decently priced. Clam chowder was actually a little too thin, not a lot of clams, lot of potatoes and could have been richer which was surprising - the day before we'd gone to salty dog in Faneuil Hall (against my wishes but my local friend suggested it) where i thought the chowder was ehhh... it wound up being better than Neptune's. The lobster roll was delicious. We got the buttery one rather than the cold style. Expected a tad bit more lobster given the price tag but neither my girlfriend nor I left unsatisfied, although we did order a lot. The place is expensive and you need to wait in line. We got there for lunch at 1045 and made the first seating at 1130 which was smart because after, they were telling people two hours.Great, friendly, knowledgeable staff, which is crucial when facing a wide selection of oysters and other shellfish where flavor nuances can make or break. Probably would go back again. Mostly to try a few of the more exotic dishes (the piggybacks looked delicious). Little pricey overall but worth the stop and perhaps also, the hype.

Reviews.Author: Mike H.
Reviews.Content: Worth whatever wait you have. Had the raw oysters of course, as well as the hot buttered lobster roll. Each visit impresses me as much as the previous. Can't wait for our next Boston visit.

Reviews.Author: Teresa M.
Reviews.Content: 2 words: FISH TACO. Just thinking of it right now is making my mouth water. It's literally a plate of flavor and amazingness! The food at Neptune Oyster is phenomenal to say the least. The seafood is as fresh as can be. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Author: John J.
Reviews.Content: It doesn't worth waiting...so small place is the only reason why its busy...Ive been to rabia's next door friendly fast and much more dishes...

Reviews.Author: Ashley F.
Reviews.Content: A fresh atmosphere is delivered up here with your oysters.  The best thing about Neptune is that the menu gives you a break-down of the the taste of each oyster that you can explore new tastes, or return to familiar ones.  And if you're an oyster virgin, the servers are very open about discussing different options and what you might enjoy.  The staff are more than helpful:  they fetched a loaf of bread for me so quickly when my blood sugar dropped while I was there.  Also, try their selections of fish if you cannot fill up on oysters, their chief does wonderful things with salmon.

Reviews.Author: Mary M.
Reviews.Content: We went here today for lunch at around 4pm.  We didn't have to wait but the place was pretty full already with only 4 seats left.  We took 2 and a couple behind us took the remaining seats.  Being our first time here, we ordered the lobster roll (mayo and butter) and shared them so we can compare.  My bf and I liked both of them.  The lobster was fresh and it came in generous portions (big huge pieces).  I preferred the butter one slightly more because it was warm but my bf thought there was too much butter.  We also ordered mussels, and the waiter asked if we wanted bread with it.  I am so glad he asked because the sauce was so good for bread dipping. ...heck, I would've drank it alone :-P  Overall, good place to check out.  Can't wait to try other dishes next time. Oh...the fries with the lobster rolls weren't that good.  I didn't really touch them.

Reviews.Author: Lala L.
Reviews.Content: can't go wrong with anything on the menu. they really do it right. easy to mess up seafood....but this place doesn't know how to mess up seafood.i don't mind that this place is tiny...this way...none of those obnoxious crowds.

Reviews.Author: Bill M.
Reviews.Content: Waited over an hour for a table for four on a Tuesday night at 8:00. We waited since the ratings were all good. I had the clam chowder. The best I have had. The clams tasted like they were just shucked. The broth was just perfect, not to thick or overly creamy. I also sampled a clam and oyster from the over dozen to choose from. I ordered the snapper with artichoke with truffles. Excellent, but I would prefer the skin removed. The table spent over $200 before tip, which include only 3 beers. A little pr icy but worth it.

Reviews.Author: L Y.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the perfect lobster roll, this is the place to go!  I thought that this place served better lobster roll than Maine, though it is much more expensive at $25.  Of course, we had to try the oysters too, which were amazing.  What people don't know about it the branzini Cinque Terre style--we came to this place specifically to try it because we have been to Cinque Terre and missed branzini.  It's not quite as good as it is in Cinque Terre, but it is still pretty darn good!  They serve it whole (like they do in Italy), plentiful, and flavored with a similar pesto sauce.  The flesh of the fish was creamy, moist, and perfectly cooked.  Simply delicious. It's a small place, crowded, slow service, not child-friendly, but totally worth it for the food!  We came for a late lunch around 1:30 (party of 4 + baby) so we were able to get in.  Definitely a must-try place in Boston if you're looking for seafood!

Reviews.Author: A M.
Reviews.Content: Man, these Yelpers sure know what they 're talking about!I started out with 2 oysters, boy were they the freshest that I ever had!  Next up was clam chowder.  It's very thin, not thick at all.  Very tasty, I still like the one I got in SF from a place called Hog Island.  I had the hot lobster roll for dinner and it was decadent!  It can be a little rich with the butter sauce, I would get it on the side if they allow it next time.  I still gobbled it all up!2 thumbs up!  Everything was very fresh and very very good.  I will be back!  =)

Reviews.Author: Alena K.
Reviews.Content: Love Neptune Oyster. Definately the best place to go in Boston if your an oyster junkie like me :)

Reviews.Author: Martim G.
Reviews.Content: So I landed in Boston and had an afternoon to kill.  What to eat?  Seafood of course.  So I whooped out the old iPhone and Yelped my way over to Neptune Oyster.Oh goodness... this is a good place.  The line was fantastic (as in out the door).  The place is tiny and the number of people who wanted to eat there easily outnumbered the number of seats available.  So we put our name on the list and went for a walk.  Finally it was time to eat.  We were seated in the corner of a table and shortly after they filled the rest of a table with another party of people.  They seemed nice enough but kept talking about scars, bleeding, breaking bones and vomiting.  Not the best conversation to listen to as you ingest a generous serving of lobster roll and fries, but oh well.  Oh yeah, the lobster roll.  SO good.  So buttery and tender and fresh.  Mmmm...  I got some oysters as well just to say that I tried them and man, I was blown away into outer space.  I've never been a big fan of Oysters but these things were as fresh as could be.  I only ordered three because it wasn't the main course but I'll definitely get more next time I'm in Boston.I did get a questionable piece of lobster in my lobster roll and the waiter could have saved me from dehydration a couple of times so I'll give this place a 4.  I'd give it a 4.5 if I could but paying $25 for a lobster roll (though a magnificent lobster roll it was) also helped me in rounding that number on down to a solid 4.So, overall, if you want some awesome seafood while you're in Boston don't miss this place.  The wait may be long and the conversation that your neighbors are having might gross you out but in the end your taste buds will thank you.

Reviews.Author: Barry D.
Reviews.Content: Visited Boston and the North End in May. Loved this place. My wife said these were the BEST oysters she had ever eaten. I had the clam chowder, which was also very good. Went there for appetizers before an Italian dinner. Great place and it is busy!

Reviews.Author: W Q.
Reviews.Content: get the lobster roll - oh my god.  you'll never have it better anywhere else.there's lots of good stuff here, but you just can't go wrong with the lobster roll.  it's served warm, perfect.  nothing else comes close to how good the lobster roll is here.i crave it every day.  one of the most memorable experience in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Carlton L.
Reviews.Content: How could anyone be in Boston and not have lobsters? Neptune's lobster roll was phenomenal. Even with a hefty $25 a piece, the chucks of buttered lobster overflew the slightly toasted bun. The generous portion crab and bibb lettuce salad was equally delicious. We also tried its clam chowder where I found one of the largest clams ever put in a chowder. Although the space was small and we practically could pick out extra lobster pieces from next tables. Definitely worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Michelle A.
Reviews.Content: A MUST in Boston. It's the full experience.   Order the clam chowder just to see the teeny rolls they serve as oyster crackers. Raw clams are another east coast original, and are fresh and delish here.

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: We were here for vacation. was told this was the place to come get a great lobster roll. They were so right. This place is clean and the service was great. we sat at the bar near the oyster shucker. All the suggestions were solid. the food is done simply with and artistic flair. We were also asking for places to go while in Boston. everyone was way cool and they knew the menu real good. Small place but worth any sort of wait.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie M.
Reviews.Content: Soooo good. The lobster roll was buttery goodness. The raw bar was fresh. Shrimps were huge. Everything was clean and deliscious. Service was friendly. Would definetly go back again.

Reviews.Author: Grey H.
Reviews.Content: Cute little boutique-y restaurant. Very busy and cramped but adorable ambience and fresh raw platter was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Andy L.
Reviews.Content: Woohoo! As good as it gets! Indeed. My sister and I each ordered the lobster roll. I got the traditional cold lobster roll and it was as good as any that I've had and I've had at least a dozen variants in Maine, DC and SF. But the warm lobster roll with drawn butter that my sister was knee-knockingly good. The service was good and the atmosphere was nice and is comparable to Bar Crudo or Anchor in SF.

Reviews.Author: Colby B.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. If I lived closer, I'd be there far too often. The oysters are so fresh and cold - delicious. My boyfriend and I had the neptune on piggyback appetizer (fried oysters, braised berkshire pork, salad with golden rasins etc) it was delicious and very well thought out. Glad I looked on here to see so many recommendations for that. When we were eating it we could really tell that whomever created that dish had such a focus on the dish as a whole, instead of some places that do things simply to be different. The staff was friendly and attentive. I also really love how it is a tiny place and can only hold so many people. It makes the experience much more personal. I'll definitely be returning!

Reviews.Author: Kate C.
Reviews.Content: We walked the "Freedom Trail" as a thinly veiled excuse to go to Neptune Oyster. It really should be called the Neptune Oyster trail. Yes, we had to wait about an half hour. (Notably, there is no "lunch hour" or "dinner hour" here". They are cranking all day and night). In any event, we got two seats at the bar! (Very exciting). The waitress was great, allowing us to taste several wines because frankly I had never heard of 90% of them. A lot were from Eastern Europe. Even the wines were phenomenal. We got 12, no wait, 18 oysters, and then we split a lobster roll. It did, and this is incredible, meet expectations. A risk or course is that with all this hype you end up being disappointed. Not the case here.

Reviews.Author: M M.
Reviews.Content: I'm not even going to bother with a thorough review JUST GO THERE and experience it! With 4 1/2 stars out of 850+ reviews, they are as good as it gets. Worth the 1 1/2 hour wait!

Reviews.Author: Clark C.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best oysters I've ever had. The lobster roll is outstanding as well.

Reviews.Author: Christine Y.
Reviews.Content: Oh delicious delicious delicious! As a visitor to Boston, I googled "top Boston restaurants" and N.O. came up. Not having had great lobster rolls, I had to have one here and it was heeeeavenly. Better than the ones at Fanueil Hall, Atlantic Fish Co, or Legals. Buttery and enormous amounts of lobster. Perfection.

Reviews.Author: Guillermo K.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll here is the best thing about Boston. No doubt.

Reviews.Author: Barbara N.
Reviews.Content: The cold lobster roll was overflowing with tender, fresh chunks of lobster meat.  Not too much mayo, which I was happy about.  The side of fries could've tasted better.  My friends were really happy with the huge selection of oysters to choose from, and the ones they actually ordered were to their liking.

Reviews.Author: Chi-Chi S.
Reviews.Content: this place is def overrated. the food is impressive, and portion is friendly, but the server is like "we have a really busy place and u guys better hurry"! we were told there might be a 45min wait but it turned out to be only 15min. i like the idea that customers signed up w/ their phone numbers and got called when there was available space. the hot lobster roll is very very flattering. yum! might go back for the lobster burger and the pan boiled lobster.

Reviews.Author: Damon S.
Reviews.Content: Came in for lunch and easily got a seat at the bar.  I guess I was lucky as I didn't have to wait at all as apparently so many other reviewers have.  It was a hot day and place either has no or inadequate AC so it was a little uncomfortable (probably why the place was not busy).  But the service at the bar was excellent.  Oysters were fresh and very good, tried multiple types.  More than adequate wine selection with some excellent wines by the glass available.  Had the swordfish which I believe was off the daily special board and also tried the scallops. both were excellent. The place is not cheap but the food is indeed excellent.  Definitely one of the better North End seafood houses.  Would definitely return but probably not on a hot summer day.

Reviews.Author: ninpou k.
Reviews.Content: A bit crowded and cramped for space, but was busy and the food was good.Had some assorted oysters and the Maine Lobster Roll.  Very tasty, no work!

Reviews.Author: Bebe Z.
Reviews.Content: Their hot lobster roll is the best in Boston, we waited 2 hours and it is surly worth of waiting!

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: Home run on everything -- food, drink, atmosphere. For oyster lovers, a meal at Neptune is a religious experience.

Reviews.Author: Ty W.
Reviews.Content: Well...we finally made it after making multiple attempts this year to unsuccessfully get in. Let's start with the food. I started with a half dozen oysters. Easily the best oysters I have ever had. I love the amount of liquid that they are able to keep in the oyster when they serve it to you, it really adds to the taste. We also shared the clam chowder. The chowder was good, definitely on the peppery side (which isn't a bad thing) and not necessarily as thick as I like it but the taste was very good and I thought the clams were good as well. For our entrees we got the hot lobster roll and the cioppino. The lobster roll was ridiculous. I am definitely sold on connecticut style. My only complaint is that the roll didn't necessarily seem up to the task of holding on to that much buttery lobster. Other than that though, amazing. My cioppino was very good as well and contained quite a bit of seafood. It looks kinda small at first, but in the end it turns out to definitely be enough food. The service was fine for such a fast paced place. I can't say that it was stellar by any means, but it was more than acceptable for a place of this size with epic wait times. Overall, the food was 5 stars and the service was good enough to not drag it down...so that is 5 yelp stars in my book.

Reviews.Author: Megan C.
Reviews.Content: This is THE PLACE to get a warm, buttery LOBSTER ROLL. It is heaven on earth.The restaurant is very small and does not take reservations. Go early to put your name in and expect to wait about an hour and a half on a Friday or Saturday. However, I take that time and go to a wine bar to pregame my lobster roll.Even the fries are to die for. Staff is very knowledgable and friendly. Great wine selection. Also the only place I have found Aglianico on the wine list. Thumbs up to Neptune Oyster

Reviews.Author: Stacey T.
Reviews.Content: First off...anticipate a 1-2 hour wait.  This place is very popular, very tiny, and they do not take reservations.If you can stand the wait, you will be rewarded.  The warm lobster roll is amazing (the best I've ever had--and I've eaten my fair share of lobster rolls).  The service was also great.  Most definitely one of my faovrite restuarants in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Hyunsoo M.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best seafood you will find in the city can be found here. Small and cozy, not like Legal Seafoods. The staff is friendly, courteous, and they all know what they're talking about when it comes to food and wine. The owner is always there, and always friendly. The menu is definitely original. Each entree has a little something different that you can't get anywhere else. A little pricey, but well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Ginger C.
Reviews.Content: Adding to the Neptune love, nothing to add to the already informative reviews.

Reviews.Author: Todd G.
Reviews.Content: Our dinner here last night was excellent.  I had the swordfish and it was cooked perfectly.  My girlfriend had the Tuesday special, fish and chips and it looked and tasted great.The scallops looked great too.

Reviews.Author: Al A.
Reviews.Content: Awesome food.  Bad service.  Long line ups.  Expensive but worth it.  Stupid mirror used as a "today's special" announcement board.

Reviews.Author: Jeff R.
Reviews.Content: The absolute best Lobster Roll on the planet. When in Boston, I wanted to try an authentic lobster roll, and thanks fellow Yelper's you were right, Neptunes has it!  It is a bit on the pricey side, $25 (plus a glass of wine at $11), but you get like an entire lobster in a huge bun.  I ended up only eating half the bun.  This is a super small place, but if one or two are going, you should be able to get a spot at the bar.  Next time, I'm going to spend more time here on an empty stomach and try out the chowder, and fresh oysters.

Reviews.Author: Jess M.
Reviews.Content: So, I've been to Neptune twice in the past month... and that means 5 stars on its own. I don't like to double up, but this place is sooooo good that I couldn't stop myself.Went here first to celebrate a friend's new job and so, of course, we started with some prosecco while we perused the menu up at the bar. After some careful deliberation we got a bangin' bottle of wine, at a reasonable price, and the Triton Plateau to start. I say to start, because we were set on getting that famous hot lobster roll, but when the $48 cold bar platter arrived, it was pretty clear there'd be no lobster roll. 6 oysters, crab legs, cherry stones, little necks, mussels, and two giant bowls containing a lobster and a crab "cocktail." Everything was amazing, but I was a huge fan of the crab cocktail. Basically some fresh bluepoint crab tossed lightly in a dressing of herbs and a little mustard... it was amazing. And I was surprised at the lobster cocktail being so fresh and amazing. I'm used to pre-shucked lobster being kind of pasty or rubbery, and this was neither. Too full to continue on, the amazing bartenders brought over some after dinner wine to say, "hey, thanks. You guys are awesome." And we said, "yum," and tipped them like crazy.Second time around we dove in with a bottle of white that the bartender helped us select, and after three tastes we found one that we liked. The bartender was totally helpful and nice, and not at all annoyed at the girls who didn't like a couple of the wines. We started with the GIANT shrimp cocktail (this shrimp is borderline lobster, they are so big). Amazing and horseradish-y, they were the perfect started for the hot lobster roll. Finally. And it lived up to expectations. A roll piled with warm lobster, tossed in butter, and paired with some awesome house-cut french fries. The roll was soaked in butter, in a delicious way. Basically, when I dream, it is about this lobster roll.I hate giving so many high ratings, but this is the best seafood restaurant I may have ever been to. And as someone from Maine that's saying a lot. The staff is friendly and there is ALWAYS a line out the door. That alone should tell you how awesome this place is. So go and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Matt W.
Reviews.Content: My friend was leaving town, and requested Boston seafood as her last meal. We planned to go to Legal, then decided at the last minute to check this place out instead since the reviews were so amazing.Yelpers, you have yet to lead me astray. Literally everything we had was the.best.ever. I had the lobster roll (hot), my fiancee had the special sea urchin carbonara, and our buddy got the fish and chips. We shared it all, and good GRIEF was it heavenly.We also shared oysters...my fiancee and I had never had one before, so it was quite the experience. The incredibly nice guy working the counter offered to take our picture, and gave us round 3 of oysters fo' free after we raved about how much we loved everything.Also, we got there early (around 5 on a Tuesday, we jetted out right after class) and there was no wait. FTW.All in all...it's impossible to over-inflate expectations for this place. Expensive? Yes. Can you die peacefully once you've gone? I think you know.

Reviews.Author: Erik K.
Reviews.Content: Truly great, vitello tonnato is superb.

Reviews.Author: Anna L.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters and warm lobster roll. Place is a bit small, perfect for dining alone or for couples. Tight squeeze.

Reviews.Author: Trent C.
Reviews.Content: I had the lobster here and my gf had the lobster roll.  Would definitely recommend getting the roll, but if you want to get your hands dirty then the lobster is also a good feed.

Reviews.Author: Maya H.
