Reviews.Content: Really, really, really good.  I would give it 4.5.  Docking half a star for the fact that it's pretty much ALWAYS full of people, so you're lucky if you get a seat or have a 15 min wait, and that the waiters/hosts are not very friendly.  I think it's because they're busy all the time, they just don't have time to smile.  But the bartenders are really nice!Oysters are THE BEST in Boston.  Better than Island Creek, better than B&G.  I am judging based on shucking quality (no shells, no dirt), temperature of the oysters, pricing, selection/variety (they had one from NZ, which is really cool), and overall quality/taste of the oysters.  Hands down the best.Lobster roll is also the best in Boston - I'm only talking about the hot one.  Never had their cold version, but after I get that I'll rate again.  But ever since I had their hot lobster roll, I want to dump hot clarified butter on EVERY lobster roll I get.  I'm hooked.  Share it with someone; it's so filling.Fries were so-so (a little too darkly cooked for me) which is a big drawback in a classic seafood place, and fried clams were very good but not mind blowing.

Reviews.Author: Ann M.
Reviews.Content: Life changing: The lobster roll!

Reviews.Author: Rick M.
Reviews.Content: We are here in Boston and were ready for a long wait but were lucky that we got seated within 20 mins and if we had waited 45 mins it would've been worth the wait. the lobster roll was all that the crab cocktail was all that and the local oysters incredible

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place and even better service - Sarah makes great service effortless. She's the bomb.

Reviews.Author: Marcus H.
Reviews.Content: Fabulous oysters--need I say more?  All of the oysters from Rhode Island were excellent.  I'm coming back here when I return to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Derek T.
Reviews.Content: 2 hour wait on a Friday night for a table of 2.  Are you serious?  700+ reviews means that this is something I have to try before I move away from Boston.  The lobster roll, as mentioned by many people, is to die for.  Literally.  The next time around, I'd ask for the mayonaise on the side as towards the end of it, it got a little too much.  However, it was breathtaking.  The oysters were as advertised and had a nice variety from the East Coast including Halifax, Canada, and from Boston.  Yum.

Reviews.Author: Erika W.
Reviews.Content: Had the Triton Plateau for my husbands birthday dinner. It was delicious! Oysters, cherrystones, littlenecks, muscles, gigantic shrimp cocktail, crab cocktail and lobster cocktail. We were so full we did't end up ordering anything else. Definitely have to go back soon and try as many other items as I can! The lobster cocktail was lightly seasoned and might have been my favorite item on the plateau... But, then again everything else was really just as good! Loved it! Ps: we also had great service.

Reviews.Author: Thomas L.
Reviews.Content: 6 oysters, few drinks, some oyster crackers, and satisfaction all around.The oysters came with your standard lemons and horseradish/cocktail sauce combo, as well as another awesome addition of what tasted like a chilled vinaigrette with diced onions. Tasty!Tight sitting all around, especially at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the most memorable - and delicious - meals I've had. We came for the lobster roll and it was a rainy afternoon so luckily there was no wait when we arrived right at lunchtime on a weekday.I love the decor in here, definitely fits with the whole oyster thing and reminds of white-glove service, yet still has a fairly casual feel. They have seating at a long bar as well, so it's perfect for people coming in by themselves.I can't say I've eaten a lot of lobster rolls being from the West Coast, but this has to be one of the best! I hate mayo and I loved that you could choose the buttered option instead. It was divine and with the skinny crispy fries and a glass of champagne, it was definitely my kind of meal. Worth every penny and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Tina M.
Reviews.Content: I waited over a year to finally try this place, and boy was it worth the wait. The first time i went to Boston, my friend and I couldn't get on name on the list, it was only about 7-8 pm. We were very disappointed since we were only there for the night. I definitely had to come back JUST to try this place. So recently, I came back, mainly to finish up eating at all the places I didn't get to on my first trip. The wait is long, about 1-2 hours on weekends for dinner to get seated, but the good thing is they take down your name and number and call you when a table is ready so you have plenty of time to walk around north end. It's a fairly small place, right in between fine dinning and local's go to. The service is great, attentive waiters and helpful suggestions. They'll keep an eye on when you're done and are on top of getting your next order in, and trust me, you will order multiple rounds. I was only looking forward to the oysters, but it probably wouldn't filling, so I asked for suggestions on appetizers. We chose yellowfin tuna tartare.. it was heavenly, melt in your mouth texture with out of this world dressing mixed into it, on top on toasted rye. It was the best tuna I've had, I devoured every last bit of it. Shrimp cocktail were next, and you can't mess those up, but they always have their way of topping everything! THE BIGGEST SHRIMP I'VE EVER SEEN. So juicy and sweet, I didn't even need the cocktail sauce, it was perfect alone. Then of course, we were given a list of west and east coast selection of the oysters, I wanted all of them. And that's exactly what I got. We made our round and tried every single selection available for the season (during november). Freshest oysters I've ever eaten, hands down. You'll taste the distinct flavor of each one from the area that they're from. Some more ocean-y than others, but I'm sure there's one to fit any person's palate. From nutty, to fruity, to champagne-like flavors; you'll find it all in these succulent oysters. My boyfriend and I had many favorites, so of course we ordered a second round. Ones that stuck out to me most were Kumatos, from WA (these little ones hold a lot flavor, don't be deceived), Summerside, Wellfleet, Island Creek from MA, and Beach Blonde from RI. I was satisfied, and I fell in love with oysters all over again.

Reviews.Author: Blue K.
Reviews.Content: I will never eat a lobster roll anywhere else.  Get it with a side salad instead of fries!

Reviews.Author: Oz L.
Reviews.Content: Neptune gets a 4 star from us for the food and unfortunately a 3 stars for the FOH service.  We were there over the week end. On Friday at 6PM. The oysters are fresh but the line and the wait kinda killed our appetite!

Reviews.Author: Eazmg C.
Reviews.Content: NO lived up to its hype, which i feel like isn't always the easiest to do.  Everything was delicious, as far as getting in expect a long wait, give your name early and give yourself an hour or two to come back.

Reviews.Author: Frank M.
Reviews.Content: Wellfleet, island creek, wianno oysters..... Littlenecks, fried ipswitch clams and hot lobster rolls that I still dream about. Food and service was perfect.

Reviews.Author: Nadine F.
Reviews.Content: Since this restaurant is the most-reviewed and most highly-reviewed Boston establishment on Yelp, it made the perfect place for a special occasion dinner.We knew there would be a long wait, but we were pleasantly surprised when asked for our phone number and told the hostess would call us to come back for our table. Mind you, it was a 2 1/2 hr wait, but we've waited over an hour outside of other places we love, so getting a chance to enjoy the city in the meantime was great. Come on a nice night, put your name in, and go grab a drink and an appetizer somewhere else to hold you over. Don't come to put your name in too late or you might get turned away--there was a group who came at 9:30 when we got back and they were told no more names were being taken because the wait was too long and they close at 12.We got back just over two hours later to check on our wait time, and the hostess actually had spots open at the bar and we were able to sit right away. She and our waiter were both very nice, I noticed some other reviewers thought that the staff had a 'tude but we didn't have that experience. Got started with raw oysters, which neither of us had ever tried, and with the help of the bartender decided on a couple East coast, a couple West coast, and some littleneck clams. The East coasters were super salty but good (I believe they were the Kumamoto),  but we both actually liked the West coast ones more. I forget which ones they were but in their description I remember they said "with a melon flavor" or something like that. Still salty but not as briny as the East and the sweetness was a perfect complement. Clams were little but good as well. Finally, we both got the hot lobster rolls. Amazing. Buttery, toasted bun just bursting with huge chunks of delicious lobster. Most places will run you $18-25 dollars for a lobster roll, and they're $25 here, but absolutely worth it and definitely have more lobster than any other place I've been. Also worth mentioning, despite their business, we didn't feel rushed at all by our waiter and were able to take our time, which we appreciated.Overall, worth the wait and the price. We'll be back!

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for the weekend. I enjoy good Lobster rolls. I saw that Neptune Oyster appeared on many "Best Lobster Rolls" and best places to eat. Based on the 1000+ reviews on Yelp, I had high expectationsFirst thing to know is the wait:I arrived at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon. This place is packed and there is a 2+ hour wait for parties 2 or more. As I was traveling solo, I was able to get a seat at the bar within 15 minutes. The restaurant itself has limited seating and the waitstaff does a great job of trying to manage it. They will take your name and number and will call you as your table is getting close. If you aren't a patient person, I would recommend you skip this place.They have both a warm and cold lobster roll. The server I had seemed to push for the warm lobster roll which is done with butter. The food came out in about 10 minutes. The bun had simple grill marks, the lobster itself was nicely cooked. For $25, the portion size was small. It was served with fries which were nice.

Reviews.Author: Mark K.
Reviews.Content: The best lobster roll in Boston - and amazing fresh oysters and shellfish with an extensive selection

Reviews.Author: Mama Z.
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal.  I am a native Bostonian and this is one of the best resto's this country has to offer!   I love that they call you if there is a wait.  One absolutely has to know good food and drink to fully appreciate this place.  It would be wasted on someone who thought Kelly's on the beach was just as good ;-)

Reviews.Author: Chia L.
Reviews.Content: I must say one of the best place to get a lobster roll!

Reviews.Author: A C.
Reviews.Content: Wow, so good, worth wait, got there early, put our name and number down and went out and about sight see'ing. Great lobster roll but you've read that before. small space, good wine.

Reviews.Author: Jenny G.
Reviews.Content: Rude rude rude! Bad service! We asked for more bread because of the mussels and clam chowder are a little bit too salty and the guy ignored our request and said don't drink too much. Bad attitude! Will never go back again no matter how good the food is.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan T.
Reviews.Content: Great food and great service. I couldn't ask for more

Reviews.Author: Yangyang Z.
Reviews.Content: This place is not as good as what it sounds like on yelp. I was really disappointed. I was almost ignored by the server, although I was sitting right on the bar (you also have to wait SUPER LONG to just sit on the bar...or anywhere in that restaurant). Oyster was good, but hey. this is Boston... your oyster is SUPPOSED to be good. I love lobster, but their lobster roll was only okay. I seriously will not come back. Hate their service.

Reviews.Author: Surfdawg M.
Reviews.Content: Da Best Lobsta roll I've had. A bit pricey, but as good as it gets! Absolutely da finest....great fresh oyster assortment too!

Reviews.Author: matt b.
Reviews.Content: Visiting from out of town and it came recommended.  Had the lobster roll and it was awesome!!

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait but very noisy and small. Great food.

Reviews.Author: Susan P.
Reviews.Content: Everything we ate here was SO good!!!  We came in on a Wednesday at around 4:30pm, so there was no wait or overcrowded tables.  It was really relaxed and our food came right away.  Our waitress was so nice and was quick with getting our orders and refilling our water.  We had the johnnycakes with trout and sturgeon caviar and the special Kombu and citrus cured salmon with ginger soy to start.  Then we tried the Hot lobster roll, because of all the yelp reviewers loving it.  The hot lobster roll was so buttery and they did not skimp on the lobster (huge chunks piled super high).    I would have to agree with the other reviewers, the fries that came with the roll were soggy and oddly dark brown, but we finished them.  We also had to get oysters, because it is an oyster bar after all.  The Well Fleet and Bee's River were very buttery and full of flavor and I can't wait to go back to order them again.  I will definitely have to make a trip here every time I come to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Margarita Y.
Reviews.Content: Waited two and a half hours to get our party of four seated. We got the two best oysters recommended by our waitress: the wellfleet and the island creek (first two items on the list) along with the cherrystone clams. The island creek was hands down our favorite.Individually we each got: the Neptune burger, the shrimp and grit, the north end cioppino, and the lobster roll (with butter, SO GOOD).I extremely recommend this place. Before we got in we overheard three different persons saying how good their meal was out loud so we definitely went in with high expectations. Fortunately Neptune Oyster did not disappoint. Just be prepared to wait because the place only serve around 10 tables.

Reviews.Author: Jim L.
Reviews.Content: Awesome raw bar in the North End!  Loved the oysters, the chowder, and the lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Joshua F.
Reviews.Content: Waited five hours. I was initially grumpy about the wait but after taking a bite out of their lobster roll, I was happy again :]Well...I was happy until the bill came haha.

Reviews.Author: Yuki L.
Reviews.Content: Came here because of the good reviews. It was not what I expected. We ordered 12 oysters, 4 clams, clam chowder soup and a lobster roll. The lobster roll was a total disappointment. It was not as juicy and fresh as we expected and especially for the price we paid for. Recommend to go to the restaurants around seaport district for better lobster. The oysters are not so fresh, but I recommend the Kunamoto oyster out of them. It's the only one I like among the one I ordered. The clam chowder was ok. Recommend to go to San Francisco for better clam chowder. However, I love their service and the atmosphere of the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer D.
Reviews.Content: The food is excellent, it has a great atmosphere and the service is fast and friendly.  They really do serve the best lobster roll.  This place is worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: B R.
Reviews.Content: Incredible first experience for us and our friend visiting from out of town.  With no plans, we decided last minute to venture over to the North End for a late lunch.  We were immediately impressed with the overall look and atmosphere of Neptune Oyster.  We ordered fried clams as an appetizer and a bottle of red to go with our meal.  The clams were perfectly fried and juicy, served with an unique aioli relish.  I ordered a warm, buttery lobster roll for my entree.  My fiance and friend split a plump, monster of a burger topped with fried oysters.  Both were served with fries and extremely satisfying.Other then our wine being just okay, our entire experience at Neptune Oyster was a great way to introduce our friend to Boston.  The dessert wine our server surprised us with was also a nice and thoughtful treat. An excellent place to visit on a chilly winter afternoon for an all around enjoyable experience.Now amongst my favorites!

Reviews.Author: Alex R.
Reviews.Content: I'm a lobster fanatic, and Neptune Oyster serves the best lobster roll I have had in my life.  Forget the great oyster bar, the delicious and creative Neptuneburger, or the cozy yet fun atmosphere.  Based on its lobster roll alone, Neptune Oyster merits five stars.  I would eat here weekly if they if I lived in the vicinity.  I just wish they took reservations!  The wait can be frustrating at prime dining hours.

Reviews.Author: Dale C.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster, I love you. Seriously, I can't say enough good things about this place. The oysters are the best I've ever had - perfectly shucked, fresh, delicious, awesome. My friend and I attempt to eat our body weight in oysters each time we visit. The vitello tonato and lobster roll are terrific alternatives as well. Combine that with an adventurous, off-the-beaten-path wine list, and the adorable young woman behind the bar and this place is one of my two favorite restaurants in Boston! Oh, get there early or be prepared to wait!

Reviews.Author: Karl Sterling H.
Reviews.Content: Oh man.  What can i say about this place with sounding like a blabbering idiot?Well I am from the San Fransisco bay area, and as such my girlfriend and I have been on a crusade to learn as much about good seafood and where to find it as we can.  So when I found out she needed to go to Boston I hopped along intent to find one meal that would make me come back for more.After perusing Yelp I decided Neptune Oyster sounded like the place for me.  I love seafood, especially shellfish, and a lobster always sounds like a good idea for me.  I also really wanted to try the oysters, I've never had any raw and I have a habit of spoiling myself rather early on when it comes to habits and hobbies.My girlfriend and I started with the fried ipswitch clams.  I've had a decent amount of fried clams, and these babies were eye opening.  The taste was extraordinary, it didn't seem like they were fried at times, the batter was so light, but just crispy enough, and the clams tasted phenomenal.Then we moved on to some raw oysters and clams.  I don't know too much about this area, but I am now hooked and scouring the bay area for oyster bars...thank you neptune.My girlfriend got the tuna carpachio for lunch, and was delighted with her plate.  She is not a very big salad fan but loves tuna.  She was surprised by the "fresh selection" of vegetables and absolutely loved the tuna (she told me to make sure I mention how good her salad was when I write this).I had the infamous lobster roll and well, it lived up to its name.  I can't say to much about it that hasn't been said, but not only was it hard to leave the restaurant, I didn't want to get up, absolutely delicious, especially considering some of the slim pickings on the west coast.All in all, an appetizer, a smattering of clams and oysters, with two lunches, 85$ including tip, mission accomplished.  I am coming back next summer.

Reviews.Author: Paul G.
Reviews.Content: Had to find out what all the hype was about. At 4pm on a Saturday we had to wait 30 minutes for a place at the bar. The wait was worth it. Fresh oysters and yellowfin tuna and swordfish were had along with martini's and a great Tasmanian pinot noir. Service at the bar was attentive and exceptional. The seafood beats any other fish house in Boston hands down for freshness. Although the place is small and crowded, there was a great foodie vibe about the place - everyone here was grooving on the food. There are no reservations to be had here and if you come at a busy time, you will likely have to deal with the ad hoc system of getting a table since there is no host person handling the door. Be patient, it's worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Kate P.
Reviews.Content: Holy moly - went to Neptune for a feast with a friend last night and we had such a great experience!  We sat at the bar and started with a glass of prosecco and chatted with the bartender a bit about the wine list.  He gave us some recommendations, let us taste one of the wines and was a lot of fun to interact with.  We planned on trying the hot lobster roll, after hearing such good things about it, but were so full after splitting the Triton Plateau.  The plateau was killer, soo good.  Three different kinds of oysters, mussels, crab salad, lobster salad, lobster claws... mmmm... hungry again.  The small space was beautifully decorated, the pricing for the raw bar was clearly stated and the oysters had great descriptions.  Must go back asap for the lobster roll!!!

Reviews.Author: Scott R.
Reviews.Content: The best Lobster Roll ever! excellent service. An amazing oyster bar.

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those little places that you just have to try. Their Lobster Roll is to die for! From the warm, buttered, toasty, Lobster-filled roll to the  delicious seasoned fries. It is a must! I usually order the hot buttered lobster roll w/ a side of tartar sauce. It is AMAZING!

Reviews.Author: A B L.
Reviews.Content: YUM! I can't believe this was my first visit to this place!!! Not much I can add that others haven't already stated. The warm lobster roll is unreal. And definitely get a few rounds of the fresh, raw oysters and a couple craft beers. Definitely not a cheap date, but not a whole paycheck either. Worth it in my opinion. We'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Bryan K.
Reviews.Content: the good reviews speak for themselves.  This place is fantastic.  I suggest the Summerside oysters.  They were so much our favorite we had to order a few more.  Also, I saw the hostess take someones phone # so she could call them when their tabel was ready for their large group and allow them to stroll around the North End while they waited.  Nice touch.  Excellent raw bar and delicious french fries!

Reviews.Author: Howard B.
Reviews.Content: Tiny, tiny, tiny...but all the fresh seafood you could ask for.  Good portions, well prepared for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Author: cassandra L.
Reviews.Content: Finally we went to Neptune Oyster today!This place really lives up to all the hypes!We ordered a few welfleet,  Katama bay, Kumamoto oysters and Jonah crabs. It is so...fresh! We also like the description on the raw bar menu which helps us in determining which oyster to order. It describes the name of the oyster, origin, size, price and taste description of each oyster.  We ordered the hot buttered lobster roll and Vitello tonnato (tuna tartar,roasted veal,cucumber salad and spicy mustard. Both of the sandwiches are so.....good! The portion is also huge! I can hardly finish half of the lobster roll! The lobster is so..succulent and the tuna tartar and the veal combination in the Vitello tonnato was incredible!Our server was friendly and the atmosphere is cosy!Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: I had lunch here with a colleague.  We both sat at the bar and ordered the Vitello Tonnato sandwich, which was tuna tartare, roasted veal, cucumber salad, and spicy mustard...probably one of the top five sandwiches I have ever eaten in my life.  It was pricey, but well worth it.  When I feel as though I need to splurge on a lunch again, this will be my choice.

Reviews.Author: Warren K.
Reviews.Content: Monk fish made with real monk!! Recommended by our lovely and talented ( ..name omitted as apparently she already has already enough stardom in her life.. ) you can't miss..

Reviews.Author: Jed H.
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely worth the wait! They don't take reservations, so plan ahead. Go put your name in early and find one of the abundant north end nooks to have a drink while you wait, It will be worth it I promise. Sit at the bar, the service is better, and the helpful staff is always within hailing distance if you have a question about their extensive raw bar selections. So I did my research before taking this adventure, and man am I glad I did! GET THE LOBSTER ROLL with butter, best ever! Hand-cut fries are delicious, but wow, the lobster... I can't even really put it into words. Just awesome. The Cioppino was very good as well, a vast assortment of seafood was served in a great rich seafood broth with saffron rice. Between my dining partner and I we finished every bit of the 7 oysters on the half shell, lobster roll, cioppino, and bottle of wine. We didn't need dessert, but we asked anyway... Now, being in the industry I LOVE that they don't serve dessert. They just don't! They simply do what they do, they do it really, really well, and that's it. I applaud them! However, if your buttered lobster roll wasn't a sweet enough ending, walk up Salem and take a right at Bacco. Go down to the next main street and take another right. Grab some cannoli at Mike's Pastry.

Reviews.Author: M. L.
Reviews.Content: Found this place through yelp and got the hot lobster roll as recommended. This was so delicious. The only draw back is that the place is tiny and they don't do reservations but it's worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few restaurants where Yelp has been completely off base.  We went on a Monday, hoping to avoid the absolute crazyness described by some of the weekend reviews. Monday wait was still about 45 minutes. Not a big deal, the Modern Bakery is right around the corner for cannoli goodness.  45 minutes later, a harried waitress seated us at the worst seat in the restaurant -- at the tail end of the bar, next to the bathroom and the chlorine-spewing dishwasher. That's fine, we can deal.  Then we waited for the bartender, who was apparently the manager on staff to wait on us. 20 minutes later, after several attemped mild-mannered flagdowns, we finally had our drink and raw-bar order taken. In that time, the chatty couple next to us were finally served (after 40 minutes, they said). Then half-way through their dinner, their much-awaited appetizer arrived. When they complained, saying not only was the dish far too late, but that they tried to flag down the bartender twice to cancel the order... the bartender argued with them for several minutes that they should still take it.  40 minutes later, we received our oysters -- easily the highlight of the evening. They were exactly as described on the order card -- tasting like the distilled essence of the ocean. When the bartender dropped them off, we joked with him that it looked like the kitchen must have been short staffed, expecting a slower Monday. He gruffly said 'No, this is a normal Monday, and we have the same staff as normal.'  25 minutes later came the clam chowder. It wasn't terrible -- was even pretty good, if under salted, potatoes under-cooked and almost crunchy. At least it was real New England style, with a creamy, but non-flour-pasty thick broth.   10 minutes later (and an hour and a half after we sat down), I finally received my much-awaited lobster roll. Toasted roll... butter... hot lobster.  ...What a let-down.  The lobster was OK. Far less sweet than a northern Maine crustacean, and a bit on the tough side. There was plenty of it, and it was drenched in butter over a toasted bun. But... The bun was a non-descript semi-sweet roll. And the butter was unsalted, and the lobster meat cooked without salt or ocean water. So the whole of it was more of an oily-slobbery pile of rubbery lobster... However, when I was finally able to flag down the bartender after another 5 minutes for salt, I was able to eat the rest of the roll with at least a modicum of flavour.  On the other hand, the fries were far over-salted, and a quarter of them over-cooked unto charred.  All in all, not a great experience. The fruits of the ocean call, but we'll be eating them someplace else.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy S.
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best oysters I have ever had they also had a wide selection!!! The service was great but we did have to wait for a seat for an hour due to the small size of the place absolutely worth it. Also had the fish tacos and they were great also.

Reviews.Author: Matt D.
Reviews.Content: The $23 lobster roll was delicious and so were the oysters. I was visiting Boston and a coworker recommended this restaurant and i was very impressed. I ordered the steamed lobster roll with butter. Maaaan. the best lobster roll ever. The restaurant sits in an alley way in the north end section of boston. On the oyster menu list is the description of the taste of the oysters and is right on the money.  Small restaurant. So the wait could be from 1 to 2 hours. the only good thing is that they will get your number and call you when they are ready for you. So you could walk around the north end.

Reviews.Author: Christy L.
Reviews.Content: The choice of oysters is amazing. Lobster roll is the must. We also like the clams are huge and delicious. It is cooked perfect. Don't try the crab. It is very long wait.

Reviews.Author: Doug F.
Reviews.Content: Finest quality. Top notch. Worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Becky Z.
Reviews.Content: Two words:  LOBSTER ROLL!  I would seriously give this place 10 stars for that alone if I could.  Since visiting Boston I've had an insane want to go back to get another roll from Neptune's, and I'm not even kidding.  They stuff it with super tender meat and douse it with melted butter.  Sorry, I can't handle the mayo kind.  (its an abomination to put mayo on lobster!!)  Simple, excellent and one of my favorite meals EVER.  Oh yeah, and hubs enjoyed the oysters too!

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: the lobster roll is amazing. it comes on a the hot buttery toasted roll. thankfully we split it between 2 people - it is so stuffed with lobster chunks, there's no way i could have finished it alone. $25.the chowder is thin. if you don't like watery (in consistency, not taste) chowder, dont order it.

Reviews.Author: hannah d.
Reviews.Content: Despite the waiting time, the food was great! We ordered the hot lobster roll and it's the best I've had. The sea bass also impressed us with it's taste and presentation. The only disappointing one was the clam chowder. It was so watery and tasteless.

Reviews.Author: Gfiddy F.
Reviews.Content: Totally excellent, well worth the 40 minute wait - most places are not worth that kind of time, of course.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were visiting Boston and she found this place online. We decided that we would give it a shot despite the high prices. Well we were both glad we did. We both got the lobster roll and it was AMAZING. The atmosphere was nice and the service was good too. The restaurant is a little small and was a little loud. We could only get seats at the bar. What great food packed into such a small package. And it was entertaining watching the fresh sea food bar. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Caroline D.
Reviews.Content: This place is no joke.  HOT lobster rolls with butter.  Enough said.  You need to go.  When I have visitors in town, we plan our day around getting to Neptune exactly at 11:30 to secure a table (yes, I plan my days around meals).  Have also tried the burger, which is surprisingly delicious since seafood is what Neptune is known for.  The burger is juicy and seasoned very well.  Their fries, which are my favorite food ever, are delicious.  Warning:  You may never be able to go back to cold, mayo-based lobster rolls . . .

Reviews.Author: Wai F.
Reviews.Content: So we made the classic mistake of not getting the lobster roll. We wanted something different, so we went that route.We got a seat at the bar right in front of the oyster prep area, which was perfect as we were able to watch the oysters shucked masterfully in front of us. Super fresh and super tasty.After that we moved to the main courses: clam chowder and a burger. The clam chowder was a bit of a disappointment after all the other chowders we had on this trip. It wasn't as thick as we like it to be and it tasted "rushed". Not to say it was bad, but we were expecting more. The burger was shockingly good as it was topped with fried oysters and a garlic mayo. I was a little self conscious about ordering a burger in a seafood joint, but don't be. Just order it and be happy that you did.Oh, the place was crowded as all hell, but it was worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Ro P.
Reviews.Content: Warmed bread, lobster roll is the best in New England. Great atmosphere. Expect a wait to get a seat.

Reviews.Author: Piyali S.
Reviews.Content: I had my first ever oysters here and they were yummy!  They were prepared (cracked open) right in front of us at the "oyster bar" and served with Worcestershire sauce- yum!  This place is pretty touristy and while I usually find that pretty annoying I didn't mind it here!   Great joint to have your first oysters!

Reviews.Author: kathy l.
Reviews.Content: I gave them another try, and loved it this time.  Lobster and butter in a hot roll-it doesn't get any better.  Hint..go early on a rainy cold night-it's so much better when you don't have to wait!!!

Reviews.Author: Marie G.
Reviews.Content: We stopped in at Neptune Oyster during our visit to Boston last weekend, after much internet scouring for the best lobster roll.  We were NOT disappointed.  First, I love Neptune's policy of taking your name and cell number so that you are free to wander the neighborhood while awaiting your table.  It was much better than standing around watching the other patrons enjoy their meals, and is probably necessary as Neptune is a tiny dining spot.We ordered Neptunes on Piggyback, which are fried oysters on top of a crostini with shredded pork, greens, and golden raisins.  Delish.   We also got an order of the PEI Mussels, which are served in a red curry sauce with chopped cashews, cilantro, and lime juice.  This was probably my favorite part of the meal.  SO delicious.  The sauce was so good that we asked for some bread to soak up the remaining sauce, and I even had a brief moment of considering putting the bowl to my face and just drinking the rest of it.  Lastly, we shared a hot buttered lobster roll.  It was everything we expected and more.  Just large, juicy chunks of lobster covered in delicious butter atop a soft, buttery brioche roll.  Fries on the side were delish, too, but when paired with lobster, who cares about anything else.  They also had several craft brews on tap and in bottles.  Overall, a great experience, great atmosphere, and amazing food.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: I went at 3pm on a Monday afternoon and had to wait 30minuts. (for a table of 3).  The food was ok.  The raw bar/ oysters were probably the best part of the meal.We also ordered the cioppino and the hot buttered lobster roll.  The lobster roll had a lot of meat on it but I've had tastier.   Maybe because it's not lobster season but the lobster was a little bland. (others i've recently tasted also were the same)The cioppino was good and it would've been great had I not tasted the cioppino at Atlantic Fish.  The broth was not as rich and flavorful as Atlantic Fish's and while it was good, the one at Atlantic Fish was amazing.I'm glad I got to go here on a recent Boston trip but it was just alright.

Reviews.Author: Yu Ting Y.
Reviews.Content: we had the oysters and shrimp at the raw bar. i previously had an aversion to oysters of any sort, but i was told that neptune was different. verdict? I AM NOW A NEPTUNE CONVERT.other must-tries: scallops, lobster rolli was so incredibly happy after the meal, i love you boston, and i love you neptune!

Reviews.Author: J T.
Reviews.Content: Hands on the best lobster roll I've ever had. Just true quality Maine lobster goodness, washed down with a good local beer.

Reviews.Author: Carrie R.
Reviews.Content: I won't go into details...all the praises have been mentioned in previous reviews!  Very much enjoyed my meal, oysters and an amazing lobster roll (warm w butter).  Definitely worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Mary T.
Reviews.Content: I didn't enjoy the lobster roll at all... not one bit. The lobster, and subsequently the roll, were soaked in butter which made my stomach turn. I also ordered the fried clams which I really enjoyed. The clams were fried to perfection and not greasy. The tarter sauce that came with the clams was too sour and mild tasting, but I was fine with eating the clams without a dipping sauce. I should have just stopped at the fried clams! I came for the lobster roll and was extremely bummed that I didn't enjoy it one bit. The bright side is that I didn't have to wait for a table; we came around 3 pm on a weekday.

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll I've ever had.  Pretty long wait, but totally worth it.  The place is tiny but the vibe is nice and the staff was welcoming.

Reviews.Author: Jim A.
Reviews.Content: The funniest thing of the reviews of this terrific place are to read the far, far outnumbered bad reviews. I am an unabashed fan. The service is great, the wine list is top notch (other than all the CA Pinots) and the food is excellent. Here are a few survival tips so that you can have the best possible experience.1) If you don't queue up around 11-11:15 odds are you going to be waiting and on busy days that can be 2-3 hours. Telling you how long the wait is not a science. They have no idea if people are going to hunker down, order tons of food, etc. If they don't get it exactly right they're not being assholes. They will take your cell phone number and call you. Don't act like an ass and get in their face. Got to witness a group of 6-8 completely go off the rails about not being sat immediately. They have like 45-50 seats, that's it. Relax about it or get there early.2) If you're going to complain about the cost of the $25 lobster roll, don't order it. It is huge and the buttered version is really quite amazing. That being said, it is not the only lobster roll in the world. They have a plethora of other things to choose from.3) The Johnny Cake and Smoked Trout is not talked about much here. It is insanely good. It sounds weird but it might be the best thing on the menu.4) The great thing about the place is the atmosphere. Relax and take it in. If you are just treating this like some tourist thing to do in Boston and go in and pound down a lobster roll and then head back off to the Freedom Trail you will likely not get it and feel like you didn't get your money's worth. Have a glass of Muscadet and order a selection of oysters (their taste descriptors are incredibly accurate) and ease into the whole thing. 5) If you got auto-gratted you probably deserved it for some reason. They get stiffed on tips there a lot and not because they aren't good servers. Go to Miami. You'll get auto-gratted on your take out latte at lots of places. If they hit you with an auto-grat you were either a big group or a person who clearly was planning on the no tip route.In short I love this place. I would go there constantly if I lived in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Nicole T.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited this bar when we were visiting Boston two years ago. We got the Lobster roll, Chowder and I got some raw oysters and clams. For libations, the bf had a beer and I had some red wine. All of the food and wine were incredible. It was probably the best meal I've had in a long time. The waiter even gave me the recipe for the Chowder. I lost it :( but I am glad to say in one week, I'll be going back there for another meal. We are visiting Boston for only one night but that is the one place we want to go back to! I wish they would move to Baltimore so I can eat there all the time.

Reviews.Author: C C.
Reviews.Content: Just visited Neptune for our 9 year wedding anniversary. The lobster salad and blue crab meat were competent while the hamachi ceviche and the grilled whole fish was very good. However, the oysters were a huge disappointment compared to Island Creek, East Coast Grill and Miel. Some oysters tasted fair, but Neptune's Wellfleet Oysters were the worst I have ever had in Boston or NY -- smallish, limp, and some pieces are barely recognizable, as if parts of it was gone or shredded up. 12 hrs after the meal, my wife started getting REALLY SICK!! Second day after the dinner -- still vomiting and etc. Maybe we should have observed the rule of not eating oysters in months without "r" -- as in July! Advice: if you get oysters that look limp, send it back!!

Reviews.Author: Sara B.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely may be the best meal I've ever eaten, and i live in nyc. Don't wait any longer. We had the Mussels and the curry sauce is to die for, the hot lobster roll melted in my mouth.. But by far the johnnycakes were the best thing I've ever eaten. Must try! Do not miss. Service was great too!

Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: Excellent restaurant, the food here is the best i have had in a long time. The service is also very good, enjoyed a fantastic meal and never felt rushed so they could sit others. will be back here time and time again

Reviews.Author: Nick S.
Reviews.Content: A must-stop in Boston.  This was our first stop in Boston-due to all of the overwhelmingly positive reviews.  Neptune did not disappoint.  We stopped at several other oyster bars over the course of our trip, and actually had several different lobster rolls.  The Neptune lobster roll was by far the best, and something everyone should at least try when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Author: scott p.
Reviews.Content: It was an amazing meal.. I agree with all of the positive reviews and then some.  The lobster roll and clam chowder were incredible.. extremely simple, but absolutely delicious.  The oysters were also great, but the chowder and lobster roll were "last meal" good.The wait staff were extremely pleasant for how small and busy the restaurant was.. Sharing tables isn't my favorite thing to do, but well worth it.

Reviews.Author: P Michael B.
Reviews.Content: Fun location on the edge of North End. A bit of a challenge to get to. Wide assortment of Oysters. Really liked the experience.

Reviews.Author: michelle w.
Reviews.Content: Came here with friends who were visiting from out of town. We heard it was a top rated restaurant in the country. It was quite amazing! It was a very memorable experience- and I want to go back very soon! I loved it! The oysters were Fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Corey S.
Reviews.Content: maybe more like 3.5, but i'll give it the extra half for freshness...i took my girlfriend here last week for her birthday, and we loved it.  it's already one of her favorite places, but now one of mine as well.the food is AMAZINGLY fresh.  the oysters we had were fantastic, as was the harpoon braised shrimp cocktail!  we got the lobster roll and veal/tuna sandwiches for entree's along with a bottle of white wine.it is expensive, and it is small.  the staff does know their stuff, but once it's full it's harder for them to get around, and due to the layout, they can't have more than 2-3 people serving.  there's only a handful of tables though, but still...  it took a while to get that wine.  and if you get there once it's filled up, be prepared to either wait an hour or go somewhere else, unless you luck out and find a spot at the raw bar (first come, first serve, no names on a list - only for tables).  pretty good sized portions though, and all-in-all, a nice place.

Reviews.Author: Mrs. G.
Reviews.Content: The oyster burger seems like a strange combination right? Well it is an awesome combination. I loved it! The portions were large for this burger and smaller for some of the other entrees. I do think they could go a little heavier on that end but the food is yummy! It is a small restaurant so leave some time for yourself to wait in line. Well worth the wait! Bigger is not always better! Love it.

Reviews.Author: Jon K.
Reviews.Content: I had dinner at Neptune on Friday, 10/30. There were four people in our party, we showed up around 7:30 to put our name in and they said the wait was about an hour, so we left a cell phone number and went to another place to have a drink. Almost exactly an hour later they called and our table was ready. The oyster selection is great, and I think their descriptions of the various oysters were helpful and accurate. The rest of the food was good, not great. I had the hot buttered lobster roll. The meat was perfectly cooked, and nice big chunks. At $25 I thought it was on the high end of reasonable. My complaint was that they actually used too much butter, and the roll was so buttery it was almost inedible. The wife got a Caesar salad for $17, which I thought was way overpriced. All in all, I liked Neptune Oyster but I think B&G in the South End is hands down the better oyster spot.

Reviews.Author: Bell C.
Reviews.Content: Foodwise:Good selection of oysters (you need to fill up a form like sushi bar).Appetizer:  Blue crab salad is one of the best salad I ever had.  Lobster roll ($25) was very good, but it's greasy for me, so the portion is slightly big for one person. We tried another fish dish (banzino I think) ... it was okay, not worth $30 for that.Overall, will go back again.4 star b'cos the price is pretty steep.

Reviews.Author: Cari T.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best seafood I have ever eaten.  The neighborhood is so cute, I thought I was on a movie set.  Prior to being seated, we waited at a bar in the area due to the restaurant's small size and long wait, but please do not let either of those things deter you from dining here.

Reviews.Author: Jenny H.
Reviews.Content: The oysters here are obviously very very good. As for the various sandwiches, I think the only one really worth trying is the warm lobster sandwich, that said, you should definitely consider splitting the lobster roll since they're not stingy with the lobster nor with the drawn butter that comes with it. The sandwiches also come with fries. So I'd recommend splitting a warm lobster roll and getting half a dozen oysters or more!  The cold lobster sandwich is just the normal mayo type and not really all that exciting. You can also switch out your fries for a salad... which might make you feel better about all that cholesterol... and esp since the fries are really salty and not that tasty anyway. (It's just more filling)

Reviews.Author: Valerie D.
Reviews.Content: Food was ridiculously delicious! Fantastic steamed clam appetizer - I didnt want too let them take the broth away (needed more bread to dip!)! We each had a lobster roll, one with mayo and one with butter. Both came on a brioche bun and both lobster rolls were awesome! Service was superb. Went for a late lunch during the week around 3pm. Our server was warm and attentive!Will definitely go back whenever I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Pamela A.
Reviews.Content: Neptune was a delight! i can definetly say it was one of my top highlights in my Boston trip! salmon, oysters and lobster were our party's choices and EVERYONE absolutely enjoyed to the fullest!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: This was my first oyster experience and it was great. It took 20+ minutes to get a seat, but our first order was filled within 10 minutes. Our second order of oysters took quite awhile though and it was especially annoying since they were sitting right in front of us, just waiting for the waitress to move them from the oyster station to in front of us so we could consume them.Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Author: Nick D.
Reviews.Content: I had the hot lobster roll like everyone else and yes, it tasted great.  The butter was the icing on the cake. They provide lots of lobster in the bun as expected for the $25 asking price.  The fries that came with it were just average though, and service was so-so.  I went at 2:30pm on a Sunday afternoon and expected wait time was 30 to 40 minutes.  They put you on the list and will call your cell phone when a table is open.

Reviews.Author: Aisha C.
Reviews.Content: Very good food. Rude service ( from the owner to the servers). If the rudeness won't detract from your meal, then no need to avoid this place.

Reviews.Author: Jon D.
Reviews.Content: Great place! We had oysters, appetizers and drinks and loved it all. Fantastic atmosphere and location.

Reviews.Author: S T.
Reviews.Content: Seriously good food. We had oysters, clams, and the warm butter lobster roll.  We were in heaven. Wash it down with their pale ale.. speechless. Definitely worth the wait.. even double the wait. Wow.

Reviews.Author: Emily R.
Reviews.Content: Yummmy!!!My friend and I arrived for dinner when the restaurant was packed so we gave our # to the hostess so that we could walk around until a table became available. Of course I forgot that my phone was on silent so we were a bit late arriving back to the restaurant. The only reason they get 4 stars instead of 5 is because they were not that friendly when we arrived close to the time the kitchen would be closing. I have worked at restaurants before so I understand how frustrating it can be but you're not supposed to show it!! I quickly got over that when the food arrived. We ordered a ton of oysters and the scallop dish. All of it was DELICIOUS!!! I would go back every night if I could!

Reviews.Author: K. E.
Reviews.Content: If you like oysters, you will want to live here! It's a small place so you either have to get there early or plan on waiting a while, but it's worth it!!

Reviews.Author: Sara N.
Reviews.Content: Food was great. Service was great. I went for a work dinner, and the atmosphere is a little too intimate for that, but I'd certainly go back with friends or family.

Reviews.Author: Juliette D.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll was absolutely to die for! Even the fries that came on the side were delicious. It was definitely worth the almost two hour wait.

Reviews.Author: Harold S.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster has the best lobster roll ever.  I know this has been stated in many of the reviews, but I will never be tired of it.  It comes on a warm, grilled roll.  The roll is topped with a generous portion of warm, buttery lobster meat.  Their wide selection of raw oysters is great as well.  I highly recommend the kumamoto oysters if you like a soft, plump, sweet buttery taste.  Come here early though, as you will most likely have at least a 1 hour wait.  I recommend coming here before 5pm on weekdays, or on the weekends, come and put your name on the waiting list, then stroll around North End and Haymarket.  Trust me, it is worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Kerry A.
Reviews.Content: Yep, the lobster roll, hot, with butter is everything it was supposed to be.  I am not the biggest fan of lobster but after eating it here.....I become one.   It's a good thing I went by myself because the wait on a Saturday at 6:00pm was 2 hours for parties of 2 or more.  I sat at the bar within 15 minutes of arriving which was a nice opportunity to talk it up with other out-of-towners.  This place is a must when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Author: Kyle R.
Reviews.Content: went here for lunch a few weeks ago. place is always jam packed. that goes to show ya...people like what they are doing.I had the neptune burger, nice big burger with fried clams on top, it was amazing. wish i had more time to enjoy their massive raw bar. Very fresh seafoodthe service was outstanding given how busy and tight the space is. gotta respect the squeezing between benches and tables to drop the food

Reviews.Author: Nilou L.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING seafood!! It took a while for our oyster order to come out, but they were worth it! Our waitress had great recommendations and was very pleasant.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy R.
Reviews.Content: Lets get this out the way first, you WILL be waiting a long time to get in. They take your name and cell number and they call you 15min before your table is ready. That being said the food here is amazing! Do yourself a favor and get the lobster rolls. Considering how much lobster you get, its a good value. Also the Johnny cakes are highly recommended. Overall a fantastic experience. If it wasn't for the long wait (about 3hrs) I would give them five stars. Still the fact that I waited that long and still gave them 4 stars means the food is really just that good.

Reviews.Author: Christopher V.
Reviews.Content: Fourth time that I have been here, and fourth time that I have been fully satisfied. I don't even care about the wait depending on what time I go, I know before hand that no matter what it is totally worth it (as long as I have a pack of smokes with me I'll be good). First things first...a bottle of wine; white of course. Aragosta di Sardegna bottle with plenty of kumamoto oysters for starters. Second bottle came around, and sure enough, entrees came through. Oh my God. The scallops hit every single one of my taste buds, and before I could taste my uncles Cioppino, there was nothing left. After we paid, I had the honor of shaking the owners hand; props.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: I think this is most likely the best spot in Boston for oysters.  They give you a paper checklist and pencil to select which type you want to order.  Seems a little crazy but I kept mine so that when I go back I can reference what I like (they do change the type of oyster they carry however).  Every time I go I see people with that incredible looking lobster roll...I'll post an update after my next trip there to rate it.

Reviews.Author: Gretchen S.
Reviews.Content: This place does not take reservations, but you stop by, give your name and cell phone number, and they let you know when to come back.  We walked around the North End, had a drink at a bar in another restaurant, and returned for our table when it was ready.  We were crammed into the back of the restaurant.....this place is small, with not much room to move around.  That being said, the food was spectacular, and the waiter incredibly knowledgable and helpful, as well as friendly!  As far as I can tell, everything on the menu is outstanding.  Will go back again whenever I can!!

Reviews.Author: Albert K.
Reviews.Content: Amazing.

Reviews.Author: Steve A.
Reviews.Content: There really isn't much I need to say about Neptune Oyster.  Best Seafood in the entire city of Boston.  The Lobster Rolls are the greatest thing ever!!!  Always a wait to get in there but I promise you that you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Jenn J.
Reviews.Content: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Its just THAT incredible!My co-worker has been raving about this place for months and I finally had an opportunity to go on Sunday night. I checked out the menu ahead of time and noticed the Sunday special was fish tacos and I knew I had to try them.My guest and I arrived around 6 p.m., was told there was a 30 minute wait, so we headed over to Goody Glover's on the corner for a beer to kill time. Within about 20 minutes we got a phone call that our table was ready so we went back to the restuarant and grabbed a seat at the bar.After reading many reviews on Yelp and tips on Foursquare we knew we had to try the hot lobster roll, and I really wanted the fish tacos. We started with a dozen delicious oysters and a glass of wine and literally I cannot rave enough about how delicious our meal was. Having been born and raised in New England (seafood capital of the US - duh) and spent time in Southern CA, Costa Rica, and other tropical places, I had yet to find decent fish tacos anywhere in New England ... until Neptune Oyster. The best fish tacos. Period.The lobster roll was one of the largest and tastiest lobster rolls I've ever had (and that says a lot considering I grew up on the coast of Maine in a lobstering village). The butter is mixed with pepper and some other tasty ingredients that make this to die for (yes, literally). Not to mention the fact there is probably a solid 1.5 - 2 lbs of succulant lobster meat in the oversized roll.If you are a big fan of seafood (oysters especially), don't mind spending $125 - $150 on dinner (including a few glasses of wine),  then you HAVE to go to Neptune Oyster - its more than worth the wait! Its a place you will go back to time and time again.Service is prompt and polite. The place is very small and I wouldn't recommend it for a group larger than 4 people. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Dan E.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Wednesday night about 6pm.  2 of us got seated about an hour later at the raw bar counter and i thought that was pretty good considering what everyone was telling us about the wait.  We started off with the triton platter, which put me into shellfish Heaven.  I usually follow the rule that says you should not eat oysters in the months that do not have an "R" in it, but the bartender recommended some Oysters from Maine (can't recall the name of them for the life of me) for our platter - most amazing oysters ever!  and the rest of the platter just kept getting better. The biggest shrimp i have ever seen, mussels, crab salad, lobster salad, and clams.  The only down note for me was the cherrystone clams, which were a little tough and too briny.  The clam chowder was next, with a smooth creamy broth and tender clams, again Neptune did Boston proud on this staple dish.  Onto the Lobster Roll.  Since this was my first lobster roll, i was kind of expecting something similar to a seafood salad from Maryland, where its mixed with mayo and some sort of seafood seasoning, celery and maybe onion.  Well, it really is lobster with just mayo or butter.  It was good, but i think you Bostonians could learn something here from us Marylanders, add some seasoning/spice to the mayo or even the hot butter (a nice garlic/spice infused drawn butter for the hot one)-just a suggestion.   All i can say is that I'm glad i didn't have to have a cholesterol check after visiting here, because I'm sure my levels skyrocketed to over 300 from just pure gluttony from the best raw bar i have ever visited.

Reviews.Author: Danny B.
Reviews.Content: Simply one of the best seafood restaurants that I've ever been to. A definite must try in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Thomas S.
Reviews.Content: I am not a seafood guy at all, but the the lobster roll here was excellent. You may want to plan way ahead though, as it seems they are always overrun.

Reviews.Author: Anthony M.
Reviews.Content: Love Neptune Oyster! Get the famous lobster roll. Rated the best in the US by Food Network and I agree. I've had the ones from several lobster restaurants in Portland,Maine and Neptune's is the best. If you go to Boston, you need to try this place.

Reviews.Author: Angela H.
Reviews.Content: Good food, but not amazing. The service is slow because the staff is overworked and there's always a line. The shrimp was delicious, the hot lobster roll was good (very buttery), and the clam chowder was good but not amazing. FYI, my hubby was very unhappy with the quality of the oysters. We used to live in SF so we have high standards for food.

Reviews.Author: Jessica D.
Reviews.Content: A drop in the ocean of fantastic reviews... every single one deserved.  So I will keep this short.The BEST Lobster roll bar none.   One of the best things I've ever eaten.Caesar salad with fresh anchovies?   Best Caesar I've ever had.Oysters?  In the past I've eaten them because I felt like I should like them... but they've always been a bit too briny (at other establishments in SF).... here, I ordered some to try, and then ordered more.  Apparently I love oysters when they taste delicious!GO TO NEPTUNE.

Reviews.Author: carprin n.
Reviews.Content: Don't go on the weekends - but if you do, go early. It gets crazy busy, and they don't take reservations, the wait can get up to 2 hours. We went here on a Friday and couldn't wait, but went before that on a Wednesday and were seated in 20 minutes! The oysters were super fresh and delicious, but other entrees impressed as well. Their scallop dish was amazing - the scallops seared perfectly, while still soft inside. My friend ordered a tuna tartar sandwich, which was humongous, and also very tasty. Had my first New England clam chowder here, and it was on the light side (I prefer that to the heavy, rich taste) but still flavorful. The hamachi sashimi dish could be better, but overall, it was a great experience. Definitely will go back!

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: If you ever come to Boston, you have to try this place.This place has the best lobster roll I have ever eaten in my entire life.  The sandwich is huge, stuffed chock full of chunks of lobster meat, and slathered in hot butter.  I love how the hot butter drips down my wrists...mmmm....butter....Make sure you come off hours.  The lines can get really long.I wish more places in Southern California served hot lobster rolls.  i'm not a big fan of the cold lobster rolls slathered in mayo.

Reviews.Author: E K.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for our one year anniversary.  After reading other reviews we knew we would have to wait, so we put our name on the list and went across the street to get a few drinks.  The restaurant is very small, and we ended up sitting at the bar to eat, which was fine.  It wasn't as fancy of an atmosphere as we thought it would be.  Definitely a place to wear jeans.  We started with some oysters, which I was apprehensive about since I had never had them before.  I definitely liked the West coast oysters better-- a little more buttery and creamy.  The East coast ones just tasted like salt to me.  Best Lobster roll I have had so far in Boston.  Get it hot!!

Reviews.Author: Lee B.
Reviews.Content: In a word, try the warm lobster roll.  Yummy.  Loaded with butter.  It will take care of that craving.  We also had the fried clams as an appetizer.  Can't  miss with these.  Lightly breaded and fried.  Some of the best I ever had.  Believe the hype and try this place if you are in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Stephen Y.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is, by far, one of my favorite places in the world.  I travel frequently, and am always looking for new places to eat.  However, when I am in Boston, I MUST go to Neptune Oyster for a Lobster Roll.  The best Lobster Rolls I have ever had (and I have eaten many).  I prefer mine "hot with butter," however, I also enjoy the "cold with mayo," as well.  The only downside is the size of the restaurant. It is very small and most seating is at the bar.  The raw bar is outstanding and carries many varieties, as well as perfect explanations of each variety.  A bit pricey, but it is understood as you get about a 1 1/2 poind lobster on each Lobster Roll.  Sweet Potato Fries are great as well, and they have some great wines!  One of my must have's when in Boston as well as my favorite places of all time. I have sent many others here and have never had a negative review after!

Reviews.Author: Jeff L.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. It's a toss up between this place and B&G Oysters for the best in town. Place is always packed and always has new and interesting specials. Seating is limited so I usually seat at the bar. Staff is awesome and super friendly. Back to the Oysters, super fresh. Taste like they just caught that day. Can't recommend this place enough. Quite pricey for me, so it's a special occasion type place.

Reviews.Author: Mia S.
Reviews.Content: I love my seafood. I mean really, really love it. Lobster, clams, all of it. And I've had a lot of it. But this may have been some of the best seafood I've had at a restaurant. Get the buttermilk johnnycake. It's a savory pancake, with trout tartar, a dollop of caviar, smothered in honey butter. And it was seriously one of the best things I've ever eaten. We also got some shucked cherry stones and a couple lobster rolls, warm with butter. I don't think you can make reservations, but we showed up, gave them my cell, and grabbed drinks at a bar up the road. We waited about 45 minutes, but no complaints here. This is the only restaurant in the North End I've ever truly wanted to go back to.

Reviews.Author: Danyal K.
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Neptune Oyster. Whenever friends or family come in from out of town, Neptune is the first place I'll take them for a taste of New England seafood at its best.After my last visit, though, I won't be bringing them back. The food is still top-notch, in terms of quality, freshness and flavor. However, the same cannot be said of the service.The staff was entirely inattentive and rude. I wish that I had a better experience, but no meal (not even Neptune's famed lobster roll) is worth putting up with exceptionally bad service.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: Our favorite restaurant in all of boston and we try to visit once a month.  hot lobster roll (~$25) is amazing.  tons of meat and perfect bun.  fries that come with the roll are great as well.  Oyster selection is top notch with full explanation of each type right on the menu.  Try to sit at the bar if you can - great experience with the knowledgable and friendly bar staff.  Oysters are shucked right in the front window of the restaurant, so also a cool place to walk by and them them at work.No reservations, so plan to wait between 1-2 hours, but you can leave your phone number when you arrive for them to call you when a space is available.  So we often leave our name/number and grab a drink at one of the many bars in north end.One downside is that the venue is small, so it is tough to bring a larger group with you, but it is perfect for 2 people - even 4 works pretty well at one of the available tables (but there aren't many available tables).

Reviews.Author: grace g.
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this place get so popular on yelp. Thousands of reviews and four and a half star! The place was super tiny. They will take down your number once you came in and call you when there was a table so you don't need to wait outside. I don't recommend this place for large party. A party of six people can be wait as long as two hours unless you arrive there early.I'm not a fan of oyster so I ordered the lobster roll. It was just a buttered roll stuffed with lobster, nothing tasted extraordinary good. The lobster even wasn't cooked perfectly. The staff was friendly though.

Reviews.Author: Tena P.
Reviews.Content: This is a top choice for seafood in Boston.  The Oyster menu is very extensive, complete with a flavor description for each.  The Lobster Roll is a must-have, even if you order it as an extra entree to share.  While they don't take reservations, just get on the waiting list and find a Pub or Italian restaurant on the North End for a drink/ appetizer while you wait.  This place is WELL WORTH the wait!

Reviews.Author: Kate H.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to wait, but...it's worth it.  We had an assortment of oysters, chowder, and lobster rolls.  I'm not an oyster person, but everyone else really enjoyed them.  The chowder was great and the lobster roll (warm) was amazing. You can get the lobster roll cold too...and I heard it was good (it looked good).  I recommend it warm though.  It is really heavy so if you don't eat alot...it's all you need.

Reviews.Author: Paritosh A.
Reviews.Content: This place is super crowded and small. Be ready to wait for at least 1.5-2 hours if you get here after it has opened for more than 30min. I have to say their warm lobster roll is delicious but nothing spectacular because it is slathered in tonsss of butter and 25 bucks. The lobster is not as fresh as the lobster in Maine. However, it is pretty tasty but anything in that much butter would be a hit. The oyser selection is good and they are also fresh.

Reviews.Author: Mike G.
Reviews.Content: found the fish taco of my dreams. hunks of crisp, well-seasoned arctic char and skate, dressed in aioli with spicy salse, piquant slaw and carrots. a whopping 2 servings of these yum beauties in the Sunday special. compared, famed lobster roll comes second. a distant third to fat, briny cape cod oysters and clams. so worth the long trek from the south end. i be back.

Reviews.Author: Suzie L.
Reviews.Content: Our expectations of this place was really high. We tried to eat here for dinner and was turned away since the wait list was longer than the hours open (we came at 7:10, the kitchen closed at 9:30). To have that long of a wait list, they must be good, right?Hmmm, either that or really inefficient. My friends and I came back for lunch a couple weeks later to mixed reviews but came to the conclusion that the hype is bigger than the delivery.Service is slow and inefficient. It was an hour wait for seating (despite the waiter saying 30 min). Once we did get our seats, it was another 15 min before we got menus. Another 15 min before being able to place our orders, a 45 min wait for our appetizers and food. We asked for bread early on so we could stave off hunger but it was delivered after we received our food, making it obsolete. As for the food, the Johnny Cake appetizer was very good, as were the fried clams. The tartar sauce for the clams, however, tasted like straight pickle juice. The long awaited lobster roll was very disappointing. Our waiter recommended the hot lobster roll, so that's what we went with. The bread roll would have been forgettable if not for the fact that it was only toasted on the outside, making the roll complete mush from the drenching of straight melted butter. Although I prefer lobster dipped/coated/ whatever in butter. There was so much butter that it brought down the lobster.  It tasted like a $12.99 lobster roll, not the $25 price.Despite the freshness of the seafood, the wait, cost, and lack of attentive service make this restaurant not worth visiting. The hype and the price are what drive this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Ron W.
Reviews.Content: Neptune oyster is Not truthful about wait time.  Expect to wait outside in the cold for an additional hour past what you expected!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa P.
Reviews.Content: During a visit with family, we stopped in at Neptune. By "stopped in", I mean that this wasn't by chance, this was a well-planned, well-timed, fully-present-in-the-moment seafood devouring afternoon. We ordered the seafood tower, the lobster roll, more oysters, sparkling wine, more wine, more seafood and indulged in some of the best, freshest raw and cooked seafood I have ever had. If it weren't for the wait, we would go back every time we visit Boston. You lucky, lucky locals.

Reviews.Author: Kalli D.
Reviews.Content: This place was great! The only setback was how long it takes to get in-- but what do you expect when the food is so tasty? I loved their selection of seafood and how the descriptions of the oysters was spot-on. I also had some lobster tail and some shrimp cocktail, and that was delicious as well.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: Great food but be prepare to wait. Service is great and would recommend eating here when in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: Staff is overwhelmed. I arrived before my friend, and I was NOT ALLOWED to sit and order a cocktail and raw oysters at the bar while I waited.  I was really dismissed at the door and wondered if I should choose another restaurant. I sauntered down the street where my  friend arrived.  Then we went back. Then and were told to go across the street and have a drink and wait for their call.  At least 45 min. wait.   We did that only to get a call 15 minutes later.  Left our drinks and arrived back to find..OUR TABLE WAS NOT READY. We were told where to stand.  We are both women of slight stature and it was difficult. People are packed in tighter than a sardines in a can.  They tell you where to place your purse.  Wow. I thought..this food BETTER be great.  The raw we ordered (oysters/clams) was fresh and we enjoyed it, however, their signature vinegar dip was just okay and the cocktail sauce served with it was very ordinary.  We both ordered lobster rolls.  It arrived in a fresh roll with butter.  Some of the meat had very little flavor-without butter dress.  Was overall good, but NOT WORTH the $26. Their menu was FAR too limited and not that exciting. The only other shell seafood entree was clam with marinara sauce-I asked if they could prepare a white as I really wanted clams, but - like the service the answer was NO. After dinner, before we left, I went to visit the ladies, I was told again, where to stand.  The restroom is unisex and it was a complete MESS. Yuck. Overall we had a decent meal,  but there really are FAR BETTER seafood restaurants in the Boston area.  For the price (too high) atmosphere (sweaty and way too jammed in) not returning.

Reviews.Author: Frank M.
Reviews.Content: Wow!We we kicking around boston and had a craving for a raw bar.  Neptune did not disapoint.   Great selection of oysters from the Northeast and Pacific Northwest.  Very fresh, nice and moist.The entries were great,  I had seared bluefish, my guests had salmon, trout and were making constant yummy sounds.   Cute and intimate room with good ambience and a good wine list.  Tables are cramped, so you will get to know your fellow diners.

Reviews.Author: Scott R.
Reviews.Content: I don't hand out 5 stars very often (think O Ya), but this place was phenomenal.  My friend and I had the Triton Plateau (which had oysters, raw clams, mussels, shrimp, crab salad, and lobster salad), some additional oysters, and a plate of fried clams.  Everything we ate tasted fresh off the boat, the presentation was beautiful, and the fried clams came with the most wonderful tartar sauce.  I would not have expected tartar sauce to be a highlight of any dinner, but this was freshly made, not too heavy or thick, and tasted great. Admittedly, there was quite a wait even on a Wednesday night, but it was so worth it.  If you're at all a fan of raw seafood, this is the place for you.  I'm looking forward to going back to try some of their cooked dishes, although I'm not sure I can resist the temptation of all that beautiful shellfish.

Reviews.Author: Francisco J.
Reviews.Content: Amazing Place!! Best oyster ever!! not only quality but variety! Great service! Small place so be ready to wait!!

Reviews.Author: She-Ra P.
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister-in-law, and I all agreed. We had one of the best meals of our lives here. So happy. Will come back every time I'm in Boston. Makes me spontaneously praise the Sea God. SUPERB!

Reviews.Author: CLB B.
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I'm not an oyster fan but the Lobster rolls were to die for.  In fact, in our short 4 day stay in Boston, we frequented this place twice and believe it or not ordered the rolls twice.  We also had the lobster caprese salad and all the flavors were divine.  As good as the lobster rolls, but the rolls and the butter flavor were delicious.  Took it down one star only because of the lack of good and consistent service, but don't let that prevent you from going in here.  It is small but quaint.  Would go back if ever in Boston again...best advice I have is to go on an off traditional eating hour and you might get right in.

Reviews.Author: Fortress A.
Reviews.Content: We arrived 4:50pm on a Friday afternoon and it was packed, we were told to wait 15 minutes so we went for a stroll around the corner, before we even reached the corner we were called back.  This, is great service!The food is just simply 5 stars.  We liked everything about the oysters, the clam chowder, and of course the lobster roll.So, I came here a little worried about those comments on the food here being bland~~~I for one loves flavorful food, this here is not bland. Everything tasted fresh and just simply delicious...

Reviews.Author: Marty B.
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem.  My new favorite seafood place.  The seafood dishes are outstanding and so fresh.  Their arctic char dish with beets, goat cheese and a creme fraiche was one of the best things I have ever eaten, really, not kidding.  I almost ordered a second serving it was that good.  The Cioppino was also excellent and the broth was something I just wanted to drink. The steamers were excellent and the raw bar had virtually everything you would want.The seating is VERY limited and this place is tiny. There are no reservations but I would wait as long as it took to get back in because the food was worth it.  I can't wait to try the other dishes now.  If you are looking for an intimate quiet table, you wont find it here as you basically share a table with others because it is so small.  But you will be so lost in the taste of the food, you won't even notice anyone around you.This has jumped to number 1 on my recommended restaurant list when friends come to town.  I hope more visit soon.

Reviews.Author: Lauren Z.
Reviews.Content: Lobster roll was the best I've ever had.  Atmosphere was great: it felt hip, sophisticated and down-to-earth (not an easy combination to pull off).  It's our go-to spot for seafood in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Mark W.
Reviews.Content: Lobster RollChowder, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Author: Lily T.
Reviews.Content: Last time I came here was the summer of 2009, but I have to give it a review, because it was fantastic!We came in for a quick lunch of lobster rolls.  Neptune Oyster is pretty popular for this, and they were DELICIOUS!!!  The lobster melted in your mouth.  MMMMM!!!Although, at $25 apiece (maybe they're more now), they are quite pricey.  I'd give them 4.5 stars because of the price, but they were just so damn good!

Reviews.Author: Lauren B.
Reviews.Content: This place can turn raw bar skeptics into eager band wagoners (I myself used to be one of those skeptics).  Their selection of oysters is vast, extremely fresh and delicious.  The descriptions (med, med-salt, buttery with a cucumber finish, etc.) are helpful and surprisingly accurate, and the wine list and ambiance (reminds me of a tiny Parisian city bistro with the subway tiles and red leather booths - minus the snootiness) add to the experience.  Their lobster roll is phenomenal as are any and all other items on the menu.  I don't think I've ever been here when the the place wasn't packed, but they'll take your phone number so you can wander around the North End while you wait, or grab a seat at the bar if you can.  A great place to show off to your out-of-town friends!

Reviews.Author: Robert C.
Reviews.Content: Get the hot lobster roll and hope to get some stuck in your teeth to savor it again later. It's that good!

Reviews.Author: Julian N.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is definitely in my top 5 Boston spots. Three years ago I was there for dinner. I had Duet of Marlin, two preparations, one hot, one cold, on the same plate.It was one of the best meals I have ever had in Boston, and I still talk about that plate fondly. I eat, it's my thing, I love food. I eat alot, if I'm still talking about it three years later that says something. Actually now that I've written this review, I think I need to go there for dinner tomorrow. Thanks Neptune Oysters! Boston needs more like you!

Reviews.Author: Shar K.
Reviews.Content: Cute little place... good food.

Reviews.Author: Debbie L.
