Reviews.Content: My first Yelp review, and for a fantastic restaurant no less!I first heard about this place and its hot lobster roll back in September.  Five monthes later, I can now say that I have finally tried it.  The hot lobster roll: tender lobster tossed in butter, served on a soft bun with a side of fries.  It was so simple and definitely hit the spot.  They serve a traditional cold lobster roll too, but when you have the option of hot and buttered, why would you even consider the cold??!!  Despite being nothing but lobster and butter, it was neither rich nor heavy, although I was still glad I had someone to split it with.  We also tried some raw oysters (served with cocktail and/or a vinegarette-like sauce) and a crudo appetizer.  Both were delicious as well.It is a small restaurant and does fill up fast, but we planned ahead and arrived at opening time.  Service was average.

Reviews.Author: Katherine D.
Reviews.Content: Great food, rude wait staff!  My husband and I went after a review we saw on yelp saying they had the best lobster roll.  I got the neptune burger and he, the lobster roll, both delicious.  We also got the clam chowder but it wasnt worth it, too watery.  Once we got in the place was PACKED very small and no room, so best to go as a couple and sit at the bar facing the street window.  The waitress mimicked me when asking how I wanted my burger done and i asked "what do you recommend", being that the menu lists the oysters can be raw or fried on the burger.  She proceeded to say "a burger..its a burger..a burger" so many times that even my husband stopped and said "ok we get it".  The girl handling the tables rolled her eyes everytime a new group came in to be seated.  Quite the snotty staff, which bothered us..making us question if we would go back or not.

Reviews.Author: Jorge G.
Reviews.Content: Amazing, outstanding, bravo!!! What else can I say about this place.  The food is out of this world.  I was skeptical of all the lobster roll reviews but man was I wrong, hands down the best lobster roll on earth.  The oysters are luscious, fresh, incredible; the scallop dish I had perfectly cooked on point at all levels.  The ambiance is great, not so the wait but it is all so worth it.  We sat at the bar, the bartender was attentive and courteous and not pushy at all, a more than welcome change in a town filled with douche bartenders, the oyster shucker lady was so nice, I mean this place lives up to all the hype and more.  Great wine selection, nice half bottle of a Loire Sancerre that goes oh so well with those oysters and the seafood.  Too bad we are staying in Boston for only a few more weeks but I will make sure to come back to this little piece of heaven as much as I can.

Reviews.Author: Danielle P.
Reviews.Content: My first lobster roll EVER and I gotta say I have officially found my "food soul mate"!!!We were visiting Boston just because and thanks to our fellow yelpers we found THE place to get a lobster roll! I opted for the warm lobster with butter and the boyfriend had the cold version. He may not admit to it but I know he was jealous! His was good but mine melted with smooth, buttery, richness in my mouth. The fries were good too and the bf's first experience with their oysters was very positive but I'm telling ya it's all about the lobster roll!We heard there would be a wait since everyone knows how great this place is but we waited 5 minutes and got 2 open spots at the bar. Service was sufficient and the restaurant is a nice little spot in the North End area but again it's all about the lobster roll! We are going back to Boston this summer and I am definitely, definitely, definitely going to Neptune's!

Reviews.Author: Di C.
Reviews.Content: The food here is great but the service is terrible, especially given the prices.  We ordered two appetizers and entrees for dinner.  Our first app and entrees came out together and our second app didn't come out until we were DONE eating dinner.  We explained to the waiter that we no longer wanted it (because, obviously, we were ready to move on to dessert).  Instead of graciously taking it back or, even more appropriately, comping it, he started to ARGUE with us, telling us that the appetizer takes time to prepare (which he did NOT tell us when we ordered it) and that it was sweet-ish so we could eat it now, after our meal.  I'm sorry, but if you're going to charge close to $40 for entrees, how about training your staff a bit on some basic service etiquette?

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: By far our favorite "Go To" restaurant in town. Hungry Mother is close, and so is Rinos's, but Neptune still wins.  Best fried clams and Lobster Roll I have ever had.  A few tips - they do not take reservations, but they will take your cell number and cell you when your table is ready.  Also Monday is Lobster Spaghetini - don't miss it.

Reviews.Author: Shani L.
Reviews.Content: Ah.Maz.Ing. I don't even like oysters and I L-O-V-E this place. Why? Because of the indescribably, deliriously delicious lobster roll. Hot. With butter. In an apparently house-made (?) roll....heaven. I have been all over the great states of New England and was shocked to find that the best lobster resides in the North End. I was astounded, stunned, speechless.  After some soul searching, I've come to grips with this fact and accept the greatness for what - and where - it is. Expensive? Yes. Worth every penny? Unequivocally, yes, yes, YES!! This is what crustacean dreams are made of. Another huge plus - although the wait is usually insanely long, they take your cell # and call you when your seats are ready. I love the not-being-tethered-to-a-quarter-block-stretch-of-­wasteland for an hour and half bit, and you can stroll around the N.End in the meantime to work up your appetite and scout out the many tempting possibilities for dessert at the same time. Genius.

Reviews.Author: Matthew W.
Reviews.Content: The best ever...i just went there on Sunday with my wife for Labour day holiday. I really dont mind at all to wait for 1.5 hours to be seated..after we put our phone number to be in the waiting list. Because actually, whenever there is an available seat, they will call you asap...literally, i just waited about 45 minutes...We've Hot Lobster roll- super duper yummy. The texture of the lobster meat is more than perfect, the bread is soft and fresh, the mayo butter sauce.......hmmmmm.....such a perfect combination. Writting this review makes me drooling all over again.We also had Oysters ( i dont remember the names). It's holy moly sooo fresh, soooo juicy, soooo refreshing..and they mixed the dipping sauce with white wine, which is a match from heaven with the Oysters. Then, we had crab claws...hmmm...hmmm.....no word to describe.The last is Lobster tail. The buttery lobster tail was cooked with sweet green peas n corns...it's a wow closure for us...With such a quality of food,  the price is actually is reasonable enough.We definetely will come back to Neptune Oyster whenever we crave for super yummy lobster and oysters.....like it...love it...already crazy about this place....Long Live Neptune Oysters....you guys are the best......

Reviews.Author: Amber P.
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for dinner Labor Day weekend (Saturday night).  Expected a wait and was hoping to eat ~ 7 pm, so headed down to the North End around 5:30 pm to put our names in.  Got called a lot earlier than the 1.5 hours they had told us to expect due to some cancellations.  Atomosphere was great- we choose to sit at the bar.  My husband and I split ~ 10 oysters and it was our first experience with a raw bar and so I can't really compare the oysters, but we thought they were great.   Also split the Hot Lobster Roll and the Scallops.  I loved the Lobster roll and though the scallops were good- but not as good as the Lobster roll.  Definately wanted to come back for another roll- it was that good!

Reviews.Author: Eric G.
Reviews.Content: Best lobster roll in the city.   The cold seafood starter is phenomenal.Only gripe is the long waits, but it's definitely worth it and they'll call your cell if you want to go explore while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Steven W.
Reviews.Content: I was on vacation and barely missed out getting here... glad I took the effort!  Well worth it! lobster lobster lobster.. butter, bread... and a delicious guiness!  Now that's a treat!

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: The warm lobster roll here is one of the best things i've ever eaten PERIOD.  Check out my profile pic.

Reviews.Author: Charlotte W.
Reviews.Content: I went to Neptune Oyster on New Years Eve while visiting Boston from NY.  I had found the restaurant on multiple 'Best of 2011' Lists and was really excited to give it a try. Overall, it was an awesome meal and one (if not the) best of our whole trip.  Particular highlights include:-While the restaurant is tiny they will take your number and give you a call when a table is ready.  That's a huge plus in my book b/c you can hit up a bar, grab a drink, or wander the neighborhood rather than hover over someone else's dinner.-The servers are friendly and knowledgeable-The food is fresh, prepared in unusual and interesting ways, and ultimately delicious! The Johnnycake appetizer was amazing (I literally dream about it) and the Scallop entire with brussel sprouts, blue cheese and pork was a combination that I had never seen before and really loved.  The oysters were also super fresh and even came with a description (salty, sweet, etc.) which helped with selection.  My bf had the hot butter lobster roll, he said it was a little more decadent than he had anticipated but was very good.

Reviews.Author: Yunxiao J.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll The lobster roll !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: Time stopped when I took a bite of the warm lobster roll, no shit. Everyone froze, my heart stopped, the heavens opened up and birds started singing! I have indulged in many lobster rolls all through new England and Neptune serves up one of the best. Love it!!

Reviews.Author: Kris S.
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW.  This place is phenomenal.  I went with my husband on his birthday -- the oysters were fantastic and the lobster roll (hot with butta!) was insane.  I read that some people have had issues with the service here, but we had a terrific waiter who helped us navigate the menu.  Also, this was on a Thursday night, and believe it or not, we only had to wait about 30 minutes -- the hostess called us (we were across the street at Vino's) and said they had a lot of cancellations.  Go go go!

Reviews.Author: Boy W.
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I have eaten here.  My biggest gripe is that the host does not know how to accurately give a time frame.  If you tell me an hour, and then after the hour wait you tell me it will be another forty five minutes, there is a problem.  That said, the oyster selection is wonderful.  The P.E.I. Mussels are amazing. The entrees we had were just ok. The lobster pasta dish was bland and the north end seafood stew was bland as well.  I have had much better from this place.  I will go back, but if my hour wait turns into two hours again without an apology, then Neptune is dead to me.

Reviews.Author: Elaine S.
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11:30 for lunch right at the open and was seated promptly.  Neptunes on Piggyback appetizer was interesting and delicious (fried oysters on pulled pork)  but the real treat was the Shrimp and Grits.  I have traveled all over the South, had Shrimp and Grits at some of the finest of the Low country restaurants, and I must say the Neptune's version is among the best if not the best anywhere.  Served only as a special on Thursday it is worth waiting for that day of the week to experience this culinary perfection with just the right amount of spiciness.  Be prepared, however, for what I consider to be a very steep price.  Despite the cost I plan a return visit very, very soon!

Reviews.Author: Absolutely A.
Reviews.Content: the hostess told us the wait was 45 minutes, which is long, but we waited. the good thing is they take down phone numbers. she called after 40 minutes. we sat at the bar, very small and crowded in there. had 3 different pairs of oysters, 1 pair of clams, and they were all so good. shared their tuesday special, sardine puttanesca pasta and it was so good! i've never had sardines that tasted like that. and the olives that were in the pasta were really good. usually olives are very salty and overpowering, but these were soft, slight salt, and very yummy and juicy. the warm lobster roll was also very good. lobster meat was sweet and plump, the butter was a little much at first but then i started to like it more with every bite. we paid over 80 dollars, tip included, but felt like it was worth the price.

Reviews.Author: Héloïse M.
Reviews.Content: Need to go back here, soon!

Reviews.Author: Laurie W.
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 4:30 on a Saturday and put our names in for a 2.5 hour wait.  Meanwhile, because our stomachs were growling after skipping lunch, we stepped next door to Rabbia's for some clam chowder and ended up ordering dinner there.  HOWEVER, the next day, we arrived at the door of Neptune 40 minutes before they open and started the line which began to form within a few minutes.  It was worth the wait; we had the clam chowder, the Neptunes on Piggyback, the lobster roll, and the Georges Bank Scallops with crisped Brussels sprouts & gorgonzola.  The clam chowder was disappointing (the best we had while in town for 4 days was at Rabia's next door).  However, everything else we had at Neptune was FABULOUS.  It is a tiny space, so they take your name and cell phone number and call you when your table is ready; it's nice not to have to stay on site while you wait--though you should probably stay nearby.  Another plus to their system of taking your number and sending you on your way while you wait is that you do not feel the burning eyes of waiting patrons when it is finally your turn to dine.  We didn't feel rushed at all.  I highly recommend doing so and then stepping next door to Rabia's for some clam chowder and gnocchi while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa C.
Reviews.Content: the lobster roll is indeed every bit as good as yelpers profess it to be (although, I must admit I asked for an extra side of butter - Im a very decadent girl!) and the oysters are unbelievably fresh - dare I say the best I've had in the city. my only regret is that I wish I skipped the fries - they were good, but I left uncomfortably full in my efforts to eat everything on my plate. what a great complaint to have! at this point, all of this is common knowledge, but to make this review useful, I have one thing to note: I did have one failed attempt at dinner here and learned my lesson - if you are going specifically for the lobster rolls, as most people typically do, theres two things you should do:1. ASK if they are sold out of lobster. on our first attempt to eat here, we went in at 7 pm, with an hour wait, by the time we were called for our table only to be told that they were out of lobster. we were going SPECIFICALLY for a lobster roll, so this was like OMG DEVESTATING news. I left heartbroken, but live and learn.... if you are waiting for a table and give your phone number, they can call you if they run out in the meantime to give you a heads up in case you would like to make other plans.2. go as EARLY AS POSSIBLE. don't show up at 8 pm and expect them to still have lobster. this place gets BUSY and things do get sold out, despite what the hostess may tell you - when we made our second attempt at dinner here, we were told "that never happens!" well guess what, it happened to us! we knew better to play it safe next time and go directly from work for an early dinner.do this and you will have no problem.

Reviews.Author: Bob W.
Reviews.Content: This place has good selection of oysters but the staff, especially the women behind the bar are horrible. "Don't move the chairs we need to squeeze as many tourists in as possible". If I were the owner I would do a remake on staff attitude.

Reviews.Author: Jenny N.
Reviews.Content: Super cute oyster bar.  Kind of a European feel.  Unfortunately, I didn't think the food was all that great--especially considering the priciness.  The one standout was the crab louis salad--a heap of luscious crab, lightly dressed with almond vinaigrette on tender Boston lettuce.  Disappointing clam chowder (watery and missing the rich clam flavor), although the homemade (?) oyster crackers were a nice touch.  Shrimp cocktail was delicious but absurdly expensive ($3+ for ONE shrimp!),and the lobster roll was wayyy overdressed with mayo.  Most vexing of all, I think the oysters weren't as fresh as some others that I've tasted at Turner Fisheries and Bouchee.   But then again, I will admit that we visited on a Sunday, so they probably didn't have the freshest supply.  I would return just because it's so darn cute, but keep it simple with a glass of prosecco and a couple oysters on the half shell at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle R.
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended by Ligaya and I made sure to bookmark it.  When a fellow Yelper makes a suggestion, I will check it out when I have the chance.  I don't get out to Boston very often, but as luck would have it, I had a meeting to attend at our company's Framingham office, which is only a hop-skip-jump away from Boston.   The place is small and quaint like all the other eateries in the North End.  There was a wait, but not as long as Giacomo's.  My friend and I had the oysters.  I loved that they had a list describing the type of taste of the oyster.  I didn't know that oysters had distinctive flavors...some can be saltier, briney, or buttery.  They were all excellent and made up for the dehydrated oysters at Union Oyster House.  I had the Lobster Roll with the meat hot and my friend had the sturgeon.  Both were excellent and the lobster roll was extremely tasty.  The bread appeared to be fresh, was very soft and buttery and the lobster was moist and soft and full of flavor.  This is one of the best sandwiches I ever had and that is saying a lot because to me sandwiches aren't anything really special.  Next time I am in the Boston area, I would come back and I will take a peek at the restaurants that Ligaya has reviewed and try them out too :)

Reviews.Author: Jimmy J.
Reviews.Content: High quality service and raw seafood.  Chowder underwhelming especially for $11 bowl.  Stick to urchin, oysters, clams and you'll be happy.

Reviews.Author: Paul H.
Reviews.Content: Seafood is so fresh!  I loved the oysters and the cherrystone clams.  The clams were also awesome!

Reviews.Author: Regina C.
Reviews.Content: so i noticed on their board that a shrimp cocktail was $3.75. "sounds great," i thought. so i ordered a shrimp cocktail and a lobster roll. the bartender asked "how many?" and confusion followed. he said i could have as many or as little as i wanted. five, three, one, whatever. so i thought to myself "what the hell is a shrimp cocktail if it's just one. or even two. seems kinda pointless. i'll take three." of course after ordering i realized that three shrimp meant $11 for THREE shrimp. what had i gotten myself into? but jesus lord all mighty when that shrimp came out i could do nothing but gasp and say loudly "are you serious? those are HUGE" to nobody but myself, which got the people at the bar to the right and to the left of me staring at me and the shrimp. they were like dinosaur shrimp. seriously. each one was bigger than  two of my fingers put together. the diameter of each one at it's thickest point was bigger than a quarter. and it was fresh as hell and served with a cocktail sauce and fresh horseradish over a bed of ice. great lobster roll, although it could have been slightly seasoned and the bun could have been more buttery. but a great lobster roll indeed. and i freaking loved the fries.

Reviews.Author: Monica S.
Reviews.Content: amazing.

Reviews.Author: Sarah H.
Reviews.Content: I'm from San Francisco, this was recommended to me and I trekked out there while visiting my son to check it out.  It's very small, the place is the "hole in the wall" type of eatery that one hears about (but I'm going to say it had Old World Charm, because I think that's the intent).  It was down an alley (a marked street that was very narrow?...alley like but  not an actual alley OK?)  and I'm not sure exactly where I was, but it was not a high end of town, in other words, not Beacon Hill.  That being said, we ordered the Lobster roll, and then a bunch of other stuff, like the Lump crab cocktail, and other seafood.  The server was this little guy I think was of Italian ancestry, but I didn't ask, he just seemed to be to me.  He was very patient, and was right there getting us whatever we wanted and was really a gentleman.  I felt it was worth the visit, I just wouldn't rave about it because it was so small and in iffy sort of neighborhood (to me, not necessarily bad though).  Probably perfectly safe, but you might not want to take a first date there, unless you are very confident.  WE did not get sick and I think the food was really good and that's coming from someone who eats out at a lot of seafood places....now however, I will do a review on Legal Seafood, a chain in Boston...

Reviews.Author: Brady L.
Reviews.Content: Okay I hope this sits the stage..... Three fights attendants hear about this place and are told it just cannot be missed during our time in Boston.We got there a tad early and they had not "rolled" up the door yet. Around 11:40 (suppose to open at 11:30) a young girl rushed out and rudely yelled everyone out of her way and "move I have a crowbar"! And the scary part she did that's how they open they windows. That should have scared us a bit but after seeing all the reviews and hearing about this place we decided we had to indulge. We all ordered the clam chowder and lobster rolls. The clam chowder was COLD and one of us send it back. The other was luke warm and just horrible. The lobster roll was delicious but was just not worth the HORRIBLE service we had to endure. For the price we never got a refill on any of our iced tea but just the woman with the crowbar with a horrible attitude. I have never been treated so horrible in a restaurant. I would skip this place next time for sure. I can see it being a super start joint but with that service it bet it slips! Service is so important...... at least me nice.

Reviews.Author: Kevin P.
Reviews.Content: Simply an amazing place. I was just visitng from Chicago, and had lunch there. Hands down best seafood place i have ever been too

Reviews.Author: Callan C.
Reviews.Content: Despite living near to Neptune I had yet to go there recently due to the atrocious wait times.  I kept hearing its praises being sung and finally broke down and went there for dinner on a Sun evening.  1 1/2 hour wait.  Once we got in the food came pretty quickly.  We started with some oysters that were excellent and fresh.  I decided to get some fish tacos that were the special that evening.  There were two types of fish, fried, along with a fruit salsa and vinegar coleslaw interpretation.  The flavors were explosive and enjoyable.  The only downside was there was almost too much flavor going on with my dish.  My fellow diners also enjoyed their meals - they were fans of the lobster roll, the burger was rated well too - but a little over salted.  This is probably a 4.5 star, but the service is a little cold (given the crowds and small space that is understandable), the wait does warrant serious consideration of going to another spot and some of the flavor pairings might need to be worked on.

Reviews.Author: Sadie C.
Reviews.Content: This is a place people rave about that I just don't get.  My friend's husband is a chef in NYC, so when they came to town I thought we'd try this place because people raved about it.  Out of four meals, only one was better than average.  Everything was good, but nothing special.  B&G Oyster in the South End is WAY better.

Reviews.Author: Tracy P.
Reviews.Content: We went to Neptune with a group fully expecting to wait for a table. We put our name on the list and was told that it would be an hour and one-half before we could be seated. About an hour later I received a call from Neptune telling me that the kitchen was closing and we would not be geting a table at all. I won't be back to Neptune. Instead I'll go to Island Creek or any of the other great oyster places around town.

Reviews.Author: Carole H.
Reviews.Content: 1.5 hour wait (but they call you so go walk around the north end, go see the seals at the AQ)... and the rest of the reviews pretty much cover the main points- lobster roll is crazy with and insane amount of meat on the sandwich, wine selection good if a little overpriced (though they do let you try samples before you order a glass, I like that), nice selection of oysters. Only downside (besides the wait): the room is tiny and you will be getting bumped by people throughout your meal, but just ignore that and enjoy the delicious food.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: oyster burger OMFG

Reviews.Author: Kevin H.
Reviews.Content: I've been here about 5 times in the past 3-4 years.  I had dinner there tonight and it was so-so.  I think its lost its shine a little bit.

Reviews.Author: Nerd G.
Reviews.Content: unreal nice spot, delicous. great service.

Reviews.Author: Monica S.
Reviews.Content: The first time I ate here was in March with my parents and it was fantastic. We did an oyster sampling and then I had the ceasar salad with polenta croutons. My mom had the short -ribs and my dad the Neptune burger. My dad had started dinner of in a bad mood but the server in mere moments managed to completely change that. Absolutely fantastic meal.  I wish I hadn't returned and spoiled that memory.I took my husband on Saturday night and it was one of the worst dining experiences I have had in a long time.  We arrived at 7p and had no problem waiting for 1 hr to eat. However, the resteraunt is tiny and they allowed 3 people to sit at the bar and drink while they waited for their table when other people could have been eating. We were finally seated at the end of the bar in basically the service station as well as being next to the bathroom.  My entire visit was spent answering " is someone in there" and having drinks and oyster plates placed next to me.   I completely struck out on the menu.  They were out of the wine I ordered, the item du jour, cavier was out and the ceasar salad is no longer on the menu.  I got the cod and while the fish was nice, the puree was gross. My husband had the steak which was decent, nothing to rave about.  The oysters were excellent but the mussel appetizer was disappointing. The bartender failed to tell us any of the specials and they are written on funky boards around the restaurant which if not pointed out, you will miss.  The entree special, mahi mahi was crossed out to indicate they we out of it and we didn't see the yellow tail hamachi appetizer board until we had ordered but it sounded interesting and we would have tried it.   I truly wish I had never gone back because based on my first visit I was telling everyone to go here.  The only higlight of the second visit was that being in the service station we got to listen to the waitstaff gripe and make plans for later- we went to where they were going after work, the Beehive and it was FANTASTIC for music and drinks; food is inedible but that is a different review.

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: The food is fantastic. If only the service was. I've caught so much attitude at this place I won't go back. Last time I gave it a try two servers were busy chatting behind the bar. The place was about two/thirds full. After waiting five minutes or so, I walked over to ask if there was a table. I got cold stares and then was told they would be with me in a minute. They resumed their girlfriend chat. I left. Love the food, but it's not so good that I need to put up with being treated like I'm some hobo trying to check into The Ritz.

Reviews.Author: Roger W.
Reviews.Content: I waited for 45 minutes to be seated, but it was worth waiting.. The food (all of them) was delicious.. The fresh oyster was really really fresh, also the cioppino was so delicious

Reviews.Author: Glenda C.
Reviews.Content: So after reading great reviews about this place I definitely had to check it out while I was in Boston. Ok, first thing you must know. Get to this place early.....like 2 hours early than the time you really want to eat because the wait is going to be about that long. Went on a Friday night and the wait was 2 hours. I was so hungry I couldn't wait the two hours and decided to come back the next day during lunchtime at opening time.  I was excited to be in! It was so worth it to come back to try this place. I ordered the hot lobster roll and it was incredibly delicious. there are not many places that have "hot" lobster rolls and by that I mean the temperature, most places serve them cold and having them like this was simply amazing, so buttery and delicious. The restaurant is very small, maybe fits about 15-20 people, wish they would expand so the wait wouldn't be so long. Neptune Oyster, I luv u!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan J.
Reviews.Content: previously not an oyster fan. neptune converted me.

Reviews.Author: C P.
Reviews.Content: My updated review: It feels like perhaps ownership has changed, or at least management. Service was mediocre at best even after I found  a long hair on my food as the waiter served it to me and numerous other mishaps. It really was embarrassing for them. This waiter was clearly miserable, overwhelmed, and I figured this might be a uniquely rough day. But when the check came over with the 18.5% tip included, I realised he was experienced enough with his own lack of service skills to know that after the service (and the hair) we received, he shouldn't expect more than 15%, so he made sure he got his 18.5%. And no, we weren't a party of 6 or more. Sneaky.  And call me old fashioned, but if you want 18.5% or more after that kind of service, throw in a free appetizer, maybe a beer, and apologize, don't be a creep. And the lobster roll was great, but not as great as I remember, seemed less buttery or maybe a little dry.My original review: 3 words: hot lobster roll.Neptune is absolutely one of my favorite places. Cute, comfortable, clean, traditional and innovative. I love it.

Reviews.Author: Bethany H.
Reviews.Content: Tourist trap!!! This place is a joke from the service to the food. I'm not going to give all the details because i dont want to relive this horrible experience ever again but please don't ever stick your finger in a customers mashed potatoes after they tell you its freezing cold (along with the rest of the food) and then just leave it on the table. Ever.

Reviews.Author: Leslie K.
Reviews.Content: I almost wanted to rate this place with fewer stars so I would possibly have to wait less next time I go, but I just can't do that to such a great spot. I dream about the hot lobster roll all year long.

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: I can't get away from the hot lobster roll. The oysters are the best anywhere. Don't expect to much for service.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Y.
Reviews.Content: as a lone diner, I don't think i could have had a more enjoyable experience. i was seated comfortably at the bar as soon as i arrived. warning, a table for 2 was over an hour wait. the bar had hooks for my bag (plus), the diners to my left and right weren't nudging me or elbowing me (plus), and the waiters were extremely pleasant and sweet (plus, plus). i ordered two delicious oysters, one from duxberry and one from pea cove. both well balanced and fresh. by recommendation of Sophie Z and Mike S i ordered the hot lobster roll with butter. it had glorious large chunks of lobster meat with a toasted hot dog bun. the warm butter wasn't over powering and the lobster wasn't chewy. my only recommendation is to substitute the fries for a salad for a less heavy meal. the bar tender recommended the chenin blanc to pair which was decently priced and taste.  cheers!

Reviews.Author: sugi o.
Reviews.Content: thank you yelpers for this amazing find! wanted to find a good seafood joint to hit up on my recent trip to boston and had to try this place based on all the great reviews. went in on a friday night for dinner and was surprised at how small the place was. i know, i know if you read the reviews, people mention that it's small and you're rubbing elbows with your neighbors but i didnt know what to really expect. so yes, it's small.. very small. but, it gives it this cute cafe'esque type of feel to it that i really enjoyed. the ambiance is friendly, chatty, people talking, drinking vino and enjoying their meals. we had to wait 30-40 minutes but we gave them our name and number and wandered around the north end and grabbed a cup of joe.upon being seated, you are presented with a raw bar menu that lists the oysters (or other raw item), its origin, price, and description. it was awesome because you can see the different oysters that are available and know what to expect in terms of taste and size. it was very helpful for us since we are not as familiar with east coast oysters as we are with the west coast ones. we ordered a dozen oysters (6 diff kinds) and also 2 stone crab claws. all were fresh and delicious. then we had to have the lobster roll after reading so much about them and oh my... these things are so yummy!! i dont typically like lobster rolls because im used to the cold lobster with a ton of mayo on a huge piece of cold bread. but, i got a hot lobster roll at neptune oyster and it is the standard that lobster rolls should be held to. there were chunks of huge lobster meat on a warm toasted bun with melted warm butter. SO AMAZING. the $25 price tag is well worth the huge amounts of lobster you get... along with a huge side of warm, crisp seasoned fries. topped with a bottle of prosecco and great service from our bartender, and our dinner was complete.hehehe... and we had such a great meal that night that i cancelled our lunch the next day before we flew home and went back to neptune oyster to indulge in one last lobster roll.

Reviews.Author: Sam N.
Reviews.Content: As a first-time visitor to Boston with only one full day to see the sights and experience famous Beantown attractions and establishments, I had to do lots of research prior to hitting the road. My boyfriend's only goal: see the Sox play at the one and only Fenway Park. My only goal: find the best lobster roll in the state. After reading reviews and newspaper articles all pointing to this restaurant, I can say that Neptune Oyster fulfilled that goal.We went for lunch on Saturday afternoon. After taking the train, walking through Boston Commons park, and exploring Faneuil Hall, we set out to find this little restaurant hidden in the "Italian" part of the city. We were quite surprised by how easy it actually is to find, and even more surprised when we entered the door to put in our name. It was a lot smaller than we had anticipated; only around 8 two-person tables and a bar that seats around 13. It was a half hour wait, so we explored the bay and waited until they called us. After 45 minutes, we were sitting down. There were only 2 servers, and one of them was the hostess as well, so don't expect fast service when you go here, especially on the weekends. But the loster roll is definitely worth it. Both of us ordered it hot and it didn't disappoint. The warm, buttered bun is just overflowing with HUGE chunks of hot, buttered lobster meat. Absolutely delicious. I can't say how the oysters were or how their "famous" clam chowder is, but the couple next to us ordered both, and commented on how wonderful the oysters were and how bland the chowder was. I guess everyone is different. It wasn't the cheapest lunch we've ever had, but it was worth it in both the waiting and money aspects. Both of us left full and happy and I can say with full confidence that this truly is the BEST place to get a lobster roll. Yum.

Reviews.Author: Derrick C.
Reviews.Content: Lived in Boston for over a year and had multiple trips back there since but I have never been able to get past that long line @ Neptune Oyster.  Until last weekend when my Mom had the wise idea of going for lunch and lining up early.  We showed up at 11 and were 2nd in line and by the time it opened half an hour later, there were about 20-25 hungry customers behind us.  Right off the bat, we ordered two lobster rolls - one hot, one cold that came w/ fries on the side.  Both hands down the best lobster roll I've ever had with plump, succulent, fresh lobster but I had the hardest time choosing which one I liked more.  Hot soaking w/ butter vs. cold tossed with mayo - I ultimately went w/ the cold.  We also got the Neptunes on Piggyback (crispy oysters, Berkshire Pig, raisin confit, pistachio aioli) which was damn good.  Never would've though a fried oyster would go so well w/ pork but there are probably very few things in life that don't go w/ Berkshire.  Everything worked super well together.  Disappointingly though, the clam chowder was bland and needed pepper to have some flavor.  Don't get me wrong, it was good especially w/ the potatoes cooked harder than most and just having a fresh quality to it, but bland is bland.  Also got some raw oysters which were good but honestly don't even remember which we got.  And last, the Dayboat Scallops were the weakest dish we had.  All in all, worth getting there early to get a taste of Boston's finest seafood joint.

Reviews.Author: Colleen H.
Reviews.Content: Compared to most places in Boston, this place deserves five stars hand down. The lobster roll alone is worth writing about. Smothered in hot melted butter on a toasted bun...I'm drooling just thinking about it. The oyster selection is wonderful, as is the wine. As  you have probably read already, they pack this place to the wall. You absolutely sit elbow to elbow. And sorry, if I'm shooting back oysters and plowing into a messy lobster roll...I definitely don't want someone accidentally knocking it out of my hands!! The worst was last time we came here, the two of us had a shared table situation with a party of 3 -- which was fine. They were really nice and were perfect people to share a table with. HOWEVER, after they left, they seated a party of five there assuming they could take our places after we left. We were about to order dessert and the guy next to me was literally sitting ON me. And I scooted over, and he just kept moving closer!! He was totally trying to make me uncomfortable so we would leave. Well, it worked, because we left without eating dessert--which is really too bad since we were celebrating my boyfriends new job. :( If you're looking for more intimacy with oysters, maybe try B&G. But if you're ready to drop bows, definitely try it out here.

Reviews.Author: Sandy F.
Reviews.Content: amazing oysters selection, at least 10 or so.  there's also other raw bar goodies like crab claws, clams, shrimp, lobsters, octopus ceviche, crab cocktails and sea urchin.  i was surprised to see that they have razor clams at the raw bar.  i rarely see fresh razor clams in boston so i'm very excited to know they serve them here.the place is tiny.  not for a romantic date, but more for wine and oysters, some good hearty laughs, chats and elbow bumping.  you walk in and its a long corrider with one side bar and one side tables.  the tables are pretty close together.  but like i said, if you are here, you're not here to adore the decor or gaze into anybody's eyes.  you are here to enjoy great seafood and great company.  place is pricey but its a delicious way to educate yourself of your mollusks.  the raw bar cards you order from gives you all the deets of the origin, size and flavor of the oysters.  extra props for their (house-made?) oyster crackers.  decent wine list.  most of the entree choices are seafood based.  the cioppino is always my favorite, if i still have room for entree after the raw bar stuff.  the blue crab cocktail is ginormous.  freshly picked blue crab, lightly dressed in a small dish.  definitely enough for 2 or 3 ppl.  the octopus cocktail is really an octopus ceviche.  its good but not great. the octopus can be more tender.  crab claws are meaty and sweet as are the shrimp, but the oysters should remain the main focus. east beach blonde was especially yummy.  i believe its from the cape or martha's vineyard.  all in all, oyster lovers, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Jessie H.
Reviews.Content: My family and friends love this place!!! Too bad I'm vegetarian and not pescatarian! If you are vegetarian I hope your friends and family don't bring you here, it is slim pickin's.

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: I gave this a 2 because although I know the food has to be out of this world we couldn't even get in!! There are no reservations allowed and we got there at around 8/8:30pm and there was a rediculously long wait, I believe it was 3-4 hrs or something like that. I'm definitely going next visit up but the wait was extremely dissappointing.

Reviews.Author: Eleanor C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!  Totally worth the wait!  Eating at Neptune is sort of an adventure.  When you go, plan to find something interesting to do while you wait.  My boyfriend and I put our names in at 6pm and were told it would be about 2 hours.  That was about what i expected so we headed out to explore the North End.  We got a decent slice of pizza down the street to hold us over and then walked slowly around the neighborhood exploring.  Eventually we headed into the only place that wasn't jam packed and grabbed a couple drinks at a bar.  Right on time, Neptune called my cell phone and said they were ready.  We ran across the street, grabbed our seats at the bar and ordered 2 dozen oysters and the hot lobster roll.  The place was packed in tight and we ended up having a wonderful talk with the couple sitting next to us.  The food was perfect and the company was great!  The food even made up for the fact that the guy behind the bar serving us seemed to be one of the most unhappy people i have ever come across.  I am sure that he did not smile once the whole time we were there.  It definitely makes for a strange experience when your waiter looks so miserable.Anyway, I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Kiki S.
Reviews.Content: Having had the most amazing hot lobster rolls on the Cape and in Maine and NH many times, I yelped Boston for the best one in the city. Yelpers, I have to disagree with the direction you steered us.Twenty-three dollars for a medium-sized lobster roll with some fries is a bit steep for what we got. The bread was not the traditional bread, it was more like a poorboy. Tough bread, and not toasted. There was an adequate amount of lobster for the bread, but certainly more like $15 worth, not $23. And not much butter on it. We had to ask for more melted butter to 'help' our lobster, which was room temp, not warm. The butter warmed it up, and then we could eat it.Glasses of wine are $15? Please. Ridic.My man had ice water, but I was chilly (rained all day), so I asked for hot tea. Nope. Plain hot water? Nope. Don't they have a mug and a microwave? Apparently not.So, maybe the oysters are the reason to experience Neptune, but we were not impressed with our lobster roll at all. It's nice they have cold or hot ones, but wish that practice extended to drinks, too.(BTW, Arnold's in Eastham makes a good one.)

Reviews.Author: Flora C.
Reviews.Content: I love oysters.  I order them every chance I get.  (which is a lot in NY, NJ, Philly, and AZ)  The kumamoto oysters (my favorite and I ordered 6....my table ordered more than 20) were a shame.  First of all, they were the size of a dime.  Never have I seen them that small.  Secondly, the mignonette sauce is just embarrassingly bland.  After a long wait, I expected to get some great oysters!  Other than that, the food was fine.  Everything was pretty yummy, but not outstanding.  Sea scallops were good, but I've had better.  The tuna tare tare sandwich was loved by some.  Lobster special was good.  Yellow tail had good flavor.  The standout for me was the bronzini fish.  That was delicious and the only thing worth having here.  I'm being completely honest when I say that I wish the oysters here lived up to its name.

Reviews.Author: Bob H.
Reviews.Content: Went to Neptune on a Thursday night. No tables were available so we sat at the bar. My wife gave the Oysters 3 stars, not as good as B&G in the south end. My clam chowder was just OK. Nice crowd. Bartenders were OK, but nothing special. We won't go back, but I could see how others may like it.

Reviews.Author: Jackie D.
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS PLACE! Ate here multiple times during my visit to Boston. Has the best oysters, hands down, and the lobster roll is fab (you can get it cold or hot). Blows Union Oyster House out of the water. However, place is a little small so be prepare to wait or try to go in Jan during the slower season but def worth it.

Reviews.Author: Timothy B.
Reviews.Content: How is this restaurant not coming up número UNO in the North End?  Ate here tonight oysters are the freshest best condition I have ever seen.  Island creeks fighting it out with the Wellfleets for best in class.  Bar harbor belons sitting waaay in the back of the bus.  Scallops perfectly cooked inaginatively served with Brussels sprouts (minis) and Maytag blue cheese with a tiny tiny bit of honey.  Thoughtful playful serious food.  Despite this dish being amazing - I had serious entree envy looking at the seared tuna "salad" to my left.  And the burger with fried oysters.......wanted it soooo bad.  Next time. Nice  BTG (By the glass) wine selection

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: We are big oyster fans and since we were in Boston, we had to find a good oyster restaurant. The only thing that dampened our trip was this constant drizzle, not only that it was the cold and windy condition that made it worse. We took a 20 min walk towards the North End from the hotel - Bad idea! We got lost along the way and was soaked. We were told to look out for the ugly woman above this building - that's where we will find Salem St. When we arrived at the restaurant, we were ready have some oysters! The restaurant was packed with people we ended up sitting at the bar. We ordered the clam chowder for $11 frankly I thought it wasn't the greatest but there were plump pieces of clams all over, the only thing I didnt like was the celery I thought it gave it a strange taste. They had probably the best list of oysters I've seen so far with 12 different types and I liked how they described each one with size, salt level and the finish. We ordered a pair of WellFleet, Katama Bay, East Beach Blonde, Tatamgouche, Summerside and Ninigret. All were delicious but three of the most memorable in terms of taste were the WellFleet - sweet butter finish, Summerside of cos from Malpeque PEI with a nutty finish and Ninigret - a sweet pea finish. The oysters were $2.40-2.90 a pop but it was well worth it. We were not feeling full for obvious reason but we had an early dinner planned so we wanted something light - the waiter recommended the fried oysters with white sardines salad - it was interesting with a sweet finish. I thought it was a bit overpriced in general given it's just a bar type place but the food was good. The beer was also excellent - I had the Celtic Red Ale - very smooth and malty.

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: came with with some friends for wine and conversation (no food), but was extremely impressed with the atmosphere of this place. also, my friend designed their logo.

Reviews.Author: Jason Y.
Reviews.Content: best lobster roll i have ever had in my life. order it hot w/butter vs. cold w/mayo. it was served on the most heavily buttered roll i have ever encountered. i think each one of these that i eat will shorten my life by at least 1 year, but it is definitely worth it. we also ordered 6 different types of oysters, including the wellfleet, kumamoto and wianno varietals.

Reviews.Author: Frederico S.
Reviews.Content: Great place but really $$$.

Reviews.Author: Catherine M.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of my favorite restaurants in Boston.  It is really small, so it can get crowded during the busy times.  I usually go for lunch when there are less people.  Everything that I have had here is really good.  The oysters are always fresh.  For the newbies, they have descriptions of each type of oyster so you can know what you are getting.  The fried clams and lobster rolls are also really good.  The wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  Oh yeah, and they have a pretty good selection of wine.  Definitely a must try if you are at the North End.

Reviews.Author: Vin L.
Reviews.Content: Once again, you did it. Satisfied my every want and provided my every need. I needed oysters and wanted great wine. Sure we had to wait; obviously this is a sign of well desired place. Put our name in, went to Fiore for a stoli-doli. Finished my cocktail as I got the phone call. Walked over to be seated right next to the bathroom at the bar. I'm not mad - the worst seat in this place is the better then any other "restaurante" in the north end that serves cheap merlot. This staff is great, but busy, which is understandable. The bartender takes a drink order, my picky girlfriend doesn't see any wine she likes - he offers something off menu. It's delicious. Put the oyster order in. So fresh, so good and well priced for what you're getting. Go elsewhere, oysters are the same price and stale. You want a burger? Go across the street to Goody's. This is the place for seafood. Lobster Roll? What are you - from Kansas? Hell, they sell lobster rolls as McDonald's. Read the entire menu, before you order. There are dishes on there that will change your life. The tuna fish sandwich, the bronzini, or the monkfish are a good place to start if you like good food. Ask about the specials. I am in love with this place. The cozy atmosphere is hard to find these days. If you like the cheesecake factory and you think raw oysters are icky, please don't waste your time. The limited seating is highly coveted.

Reviews.Author: Terry M.
Reviews.Content: fresh oysters and clams. decent chowder. but extremely small and crowded. good pre-game spot for celtic's games, if they ever have another team worth watching

Reviews.Author: Taryn C.
Reviews.Content: Yeah...I don't get it. ^shrug^ After reading multiple consistently high reviews/ratings on Yelp about this place, I absolutely positively HAD to have my first ever New England lobsta' roll experience here. My husband, not a big lobster or "raw" fan, was happy to find things he could eat like chowda. Now, maybe I'm missing something in translation, perhaps I'm spoiled because my idea of good shellfish is down in the Chesapeake area, maybe it's because I have a snootiness towards Boston (NYC represents), but I thought this place would change my mind.  Nope.  The lobster roll -- hot with butter -- left a lot to be desired.  The french fries were good, then again so are McDonald's.  My husband claimed that he's had better chowder on the West Coast.  Now, that's a problem.  We are in New England, there is ZERO excuse to not have good chowder (and the fact that I had better chowder in the stands at Fenway Park is absolutely criminal).  Now I will say on the plus side, there is a charm at this place, the crowdedness adds to it for sure, the wait staff is super cool, and I suppose that if you're into the raw bar and stuff, this place might be good.  But my first experience is not one that I absolutely need to go back.  In fact, I'll never be back.

Reviews.Author: Leang E.
Reviews.Content: We must have gotten here at a great time, because we were easily able to get a table but opted for a couple of seats at the bar.  Yeah, it helps that we got here at 1:30pm on a Monday afternoon.  We were able to stare at the seafood items near the window.  Our bartender was very helpful with recommendations, but I had already heard how amazing the lobster rolls were at this place.  We started with a couple of oysters that were decent, but it was the buttermilk johnnycake that took the cake for me at this spot.  The cornmeal consistency cake was topped with trout, creme fraiche, and caviar.  The saltiness of the fish and the sweetness of the johnnycake made for a perfect combination.  I didn't think it could get any better, but the lobster roll was phenomenal.  I was disappointed that I was sharing all this food, because I wanted more - it was so good!  The prices are pretty competitive, but this roll is $25 in itself.  Great spot for beers and drinking and hanging out.  Too bad they don't have outdoor seating or a patio.

Reviews.Author: Phil M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to many places to eat in Boston but never this place. Thanks to Yelp reviews I figure I cant go wrong. We arrived and were seated right away. We were given a long piece of paper with a ton of raw oysters to choose from. I got a few Kumomotos, and some other kinds that were from the North East although I do do not recall the names but they were tasty and cold and did not disappoint. Also order a buttered Johnny Cake with Smoked Trout. This was a strange dish but it was great and loved it. It was a nice appetizer to what was ordered afterwards. I noticed Lobster Rolls being brought out from the kitchen one after one so I figured I had to get that. The Lobster Rolls with hot melted butter on a New England style bun was just perfect and the French Fries with seasoning was great too. The service was great like always in Boston. You do sit close to to other people but its Boston so it's all good. The people were great and this place just felt like home with great seafood. I am very glad we found this place.

Reviews.Author: Lala I.
Reviews.Content: i'd say this is the ONLY good and non touristy spot in north end. food is super fresh and fantastic!! the only bad thing about it is the wait. always always a super long wait, but they do take your phone number down and will call you when table is ready. get yellow fin tunaaaaaaaa !!!!!

Reviews.Author: Vincent D.
Reviews.Content: Delicious:  clam chowder, lobster roll, and lobster cocktail.

Reviews.Author: jenilee p.
Reviews.Content: small, very specialized restaurant in the heart of what can only be called one of boston's coziest, traditional neighborhoods. the north end has no lack of eateries throughout the ins and outs of hanover and salem streets. however, this restaurant serves up the freshest shellfish i've ever had the pleasure of eating, and i suggest that when you come here, you take a gander at the variety of oysters and shellfish on their mirror board, and order away. sitting at the bar is a good choice too. at a most recent visit, we skipped the entrees and just went nutty on the items on the board. this included pleasant bay oysters from MA, flying point oysters from ME, summerside oysters from PEI, kumamotos from WA, fanny bays from BC, the mussels appetizer (absolutely delicious - caramelized eggplant, sweet peppers, basil pesto swimming in a wonderful briny, buttery broth), and finally, an order of sea urchin (or uni if you're used to seeing this on the menu at sushi joints). just a few tips on ordering: if you're unfamiliar with the different pros and cons of each of the oysters they have to offer, fret not! the lovely server will hand you a cliff notes version of the tastes of each of these oysters. also, i know people are often squeamish about uni/sea urchin. who can blame them as you often get less than fresh, orange, murky mystery snot when ordering at the average sushi restaurant. but neptune oyster serves up sea urchin the way it was meant to be tasted and the way in which it received its reputation as a true seafood delicacy. they will clean and present your order of sea urchin just as they would one of their oysters. live and cleaned in front of you. and you will taste a firm, yet melty, buttery treat. i urge you to try it here, even if you've dismissed it in your past.service was wonderful. the restaurant crowd was filled and boisterous as early as 5:10 pm, so plan on coming early (i don't think they take reservations so otherwise you may have a wait.) and please... order the geary's porter. they have it on tap and it goes incredibly well with the oysters. happy slurping.

Reviews.Author: Matt C.
Reviews.Content: This place reminds me a lot of some of the great restaurants in NYC... can't beat the tight atmosphere and great food.  We started off by sampling six different types of oysters from Mass, Maine and B.C. and the clam chowder.  All were very fresh and the meal could have been made at that point.  But then it was the Monday night special, which came highly recommended by the staff - Lobster Spaghetti. Wow!  it was hard to identify the spices but suffice to say it was a perfected blend of flavor, sauce and no lack of rich lobster meet, of which I am typically less than favorable towards.  Coupled with a very dry Italian white wine, the dish made the night.  Not far behind, however, was the scallops entree that one of our party had, which was truly a melt-in-your-mouth sensation.  Unfortunately no room for desert, but the generous and patient wait staff didn't mind us staying around to chat and finish some drinks.

Reviews.Author: L S.
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect to be wowed by the burger here, but it was phenomenal! It's a gigantic hamburger topped with cheddar cheese, fried oysters, garlic mayo, and relish served on a brioche bun with a pile of fries. The raw bar and the wine list are also lovely, I just really can't get over the burger though.

Reviews.Author: Lilee N.
Reviews.Content: Shrimp cocktail and hot lobster rolls- amazing!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly L.
Reviews.Content: Came here based on the New York Times' "36 Hours in Boston." Got there just in time (around 12:50) before the huge rush and wait came on a Saturday afternoon. The restaurant is on the small side with a bar that stretches from the door across the room and cramped tables. We were actually sitting at the bar on the last 2 stools right by the door. People kept coming in and kind of pushed me in my seat a few times because I was invisible (NOT). I ordered the clam chowder to start with and my boyfriend and I both had the hot lobster roll. The chowder was delicious, not as heavy as others and had just enough potato in it and a good amount of celery and clams, which I loved. The lobster rolls were amazingggg. As soon as I took the first bite, I forgot about my annoyance with the people waiting. Delicious buttery goodness in every bite. At the time, we actually weren't really hungry but we finished off our rolls. The fries that came with it were great also. Crispy and salty enough. And the waitress we had was super attentive and friendly despite the place being packed. Yes, the place is more expensive than most other casual dining places but it was so worth the fresh tasting goodness. I would definitely come back here again!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: flew into boston at around 6pm on a monday night. first stop: neptune oyster!!! i knew i had to come here on a weekday because my sister who went to boston a few weeks before me told me the wait was 1.5 hrs on weekends. sadly, she wasn't able to go...but i'm sure glad i did! even though we got there around 9pm, we still had to wait a little bit. ~15 mins for a party of 3. shows how small this place is.i've always felt a little iffy about oysters because i've eaten cooked/fried oysters before andddd i really didn't like it. because of that, i've deemed it my least favorite seafood. it wasn't until a few months ago i tried a raw oyster at the ferry building in SF for the first time. to my surprise...i actually enjoyed it! but i had only one and that's usually not enough to know whether i REALLY liked it or not. well, all i can say is that my experience at neptune oyster confirms my love for raw oysters! i love how you can order by quantity. it's about $2.50 per oyster, depending on which type you get. they have a list of different types of oysters you can choose from and they try their best to describe it (high/med/low salt, briny/fruity/buttery finish, etc), but it's hard to imagine the taste until you actually eat it. i just asked our waiter what he recommended and got that. he was extremely friendly and helpful with helping us make our decisions. good service always makes the experience that much better :)along with oysters, i also got the hot lobster roll which is to DIE for. it was oozing with butter and had amazing fries to go with it. you'll probably get a heart attack after eating it but....you only live once! hahaha it's pricey - $25, but when you're a visitor, the price tag doesn't ever seem to matter.i had a second round of raw oysters too, but this time i decided to try a raw clam (for the first time) and a crab claw (which is cooked). the crab claw was good, nothing too special, but the raw clam was...not so good cause it had a bitter taste at the end that i wasn't expecting. i'm not sure if that's how all raw clams are, but if so...definitely avoiding them but at least now i know!

Reviews.Author: lindsey s.
Reviews.Content: Extremely fabulous! Cozy, hospitable and romantic.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay C.
Reviews.Content: This Southern girl loves a good oyster on the half and this place did not disappoint!  The staff was extremely helpful and the atmosphere is classic 1940s.  I was in love with everything!  From the great decor, the great service, local beers, yummy yummy oysters and the ridiculously awesome lobster roll, I'm seriously considering relocating to Boston.  Ah-mazing.

Reviews.Author: CL R.
Reviews.Content: **moan of satisfaction** Connecticut style, hot-buttered lobster rolls is where it's at. Neptune's version is the largest, most generously filled roll I've had. And it's delicious-- with a mound of crispy, golden fries. We also had the mussels and the crab salad. The salad was fantastic-- a generous heap of blue crab mixed with avocado. I think the prices here are reasonable considering the quality of the food. The place is teeny-tiny-- but they do their best to accommodate you, calling you on your cell phone after you put your name in for a spot. You can walk around North End and enjoy yourself while you wait. Totally worth the wait, by the way.

Reviews.Author: Aluminum Chefs, C and T.
Reviews.Content: There is truly no better place to get your seafood on in Boston - if you can get in, that is.  The north end is such a bummer sometimes, full of tourists, and overpriced, mediocre food.  But tucked away in a blink-and-youll-miss it spot is Neptune - you'll know you're there by the huge line out front of a seemingly innocuous restaurant.  The interior, however, is wonderfully and tastefully decorated (a nice break from the rest of the north end).  The raw bar area is huge and when it's fully stocked on a Friday night, it's something to behold.  The food speaks highly of the chef and the quality of the product he uses.  I could just sit and crush bivalves all night here, tons of different options and a nice mignonette.   I haven't had the lobster roll, but the Vitello Tonnato sandwich is possibly the greatest thing to ever happen.  I would highly suggest it.  I don't think they do dessert, but the north end is pretty good for that, anyhow.

Reviews.Author: Josh B.
Reviews.Content: Hard to imagine what I can say about this place that wasn't already said.  Heard about Neptune from the Bartender at the Bell in Hand tavern.  It was everything we had hoped for; excellent fresh oysters, great lobster roll.  It gets crowded, so expect to put your name on the list and then wander around North End until it's your turn.

Reviews.Author: Christina R.
Reviews.Content: I need to echo the crowd and say this is one of the best meals I have ever had, top notch. Order the lobster roll hot.

Reviews.Author: Aaron X.
Reviews.Content: Great lobster roll ,I will definitely try it again!!!

Reviews.Author: Melissa Y.
Reviews.Content: I heart Neptune Oyster!  I came on a Sunday for an oyster lunch.  There was a bit of a wait, but the waiter took my name and number and I walked around the neighborhood.  The wait was only about 10-15 mins.  We ended up ordering 3 times.  The first dozen was just not enough.  We didn't try everything on the menu, but we should've.  Tell the waiter what you like and they'll recommend the oysters for you and help you pair it with wine.  I've been to B&G and I feel Neptune is so much better because of the selection and service.  Also, parking is a lot easier in this area than in the South End.

Reviews.Author: Scott L.
Reviews.Content: Best selection of oysters I've ever tasted.  Lobster roll was the best I've ever had.  Will be back here every time I'm in Boston.  It's a pretty small place, so prepare to wait.

Reviews.Author: Dan Y.
Reviews.Content: This was my lucky day! Found parking in front of the restaurant on a rainy day and was seated at the bar right away!  Having been here b4 i can say the bar is the preferred seating unless you like the communal dinning experience.  The place is small and always packed so if you are seated at a table you will be so close to your neighbors lobster-roll you can taste it.  Hard to explain that you are not staring at his wife but rather the lobster-roll she is shoving in her face.  Oysters were good and fresh plus the descriptions on the card help.  Variety is a bit limited and prices are a little higher than Island Creek.  The scallop entrée was very good.  Seared but still rare and served with sides that worked to accentuate the freshness of the scallops rather than overwhelm.  The lobster-roll on the other hand was underwhelming this time.  I had it hot as I usually do but this time the lobster was way overcooked and did not taste fresh at all.  Just chewy chunks of lobster covered in drawn butter.  In this round James hook wins hands down, with Island Creek a close second.

Reviews.Author: Kristen W.
Reviews.Content: my god this place is good.  everything from the lobster roll to the clam chowders... best food place ever!  one advice is to come here early to put your name down and ask them to call you when your table is ready to avoid 1-2hr+ of wait.  regardless, it's totally worth it!

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: wow this place is great! got here at 430 on a friday, no wait but the place was full. we got the lobster roll, fried clams, and clam chowder. the clam chowder was good but a little too thin and i would call it a chowder not clam chowder because there were like only 4 tiny pieces of clam in it. will never order it again but otherwise food was awesome! come early!

Reviews.Author: Peter K.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Cramped (small restaurant), long line, and a bit pricey... But the lobster roll is to die for.

Reviews.Author: Jim A.
Reviews.Content: Went straight from the airport to here because I needed a fired clams and lobster roll fix. The place didn't disappoint. Good food and service

Reviews.Author: Ling C.
Reviews.Content: Love everything except for the wait! Try to go during off-peak dining hours to minimize wait. Lobster roll is a must and the clam chowder may be best in Beantown!

Reviews.Author: Sam C.
Reviews.Content: Finally went in with a plan to eat off the rest of the menu and it was great. I took my dad who had never heard of it. He's not an easy critic but left raving about our experience and already planning on taking my mother some time soon. I had the crab cake caprese special and he had a gloucester cod special. We both got a variety of oysters and a few not-so-traditional beers. All of the above were awesome.

Reviews.Author: Kim E.
Reviews.Content: Thank you yelpers for this recommendation!  I was in Boston for the weekend (from NY) and only had 1 dinner while in town and chose Neptune to get my lobster roll fix.  I ordered the yellowtail hamachi appetizer and hot lobster roll (I also tried my husband's clam chowder).  My brother in law hated the chowder, but he's a college student from California, so has little frame of reference.  I liked the b/c it was lighter than most chowders I've had and quite flavorful.  I really enjoyed the yellowtail, but the star of the night was the lobster roll.  Buttery, large chunks of fresh lobster, perfectly toasted roll...it was fantastic!  Loved the cozy ambiance, too.

Reviews.Author: Dave L.
Reviews.Content: This place was great! I went here after a friend recommended it. I have lived in the North End for a couple years now and had no idea how great this place is! All the seafood is as fresh as it gets and also a great wine list...not to mention we each drank a bottle of wine each haha. I ended up with the Alaskan Black Cod and some other thing I cant even pronounce...regardless this place is awesome! Only thing I didnt really like was how close you are to the people sitting next to you, barely any separation but other than that its a nice relax atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: Hands down, my favorite restaurant in Boston. Living in the North End for two years spoiled me...more than 108 places to dine, and the best Italian cuisine in the nation. I've been to Neptune at least two dozen times. Incredible seafood and amazing oysters. If you enjoy oysters, don't bother with ANY other place in beantown. This place is tiny, and they don't take reservations, so your best bet is to go early and give the hostess your phone number if there's a wait. Then stroll around the neighborhood until a table opens up. Seats at the bar are also clutch. Also, Neptune has the best variety of beverages in town if you enjoy unique and local micro-brews (mostly bottles) and perfectly paired wines and spirits. Try one of their signature belini's (champagne and muddled fruit) if you like something sweet! Yes, the lobster roll here is ridiculously good, but so is everything else! Always check out the specials menu. For dessert, finish up with a glass of Brachetto (a red dessert wine, low alcohol, very sweet) and then head out to Mike's Pastry (longest line), Modern Pastry, or Caffe Paradiso (more room to sit down) on Hanover Street for a slice of ricotta pie/cannolli/espresso. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: R W.
Reviews.Content: simply put...It is very difficult to enjoy a raw bar anywhere else after eating here. worth the long waits. A Boston must. A good representative of the Boston's reputation for seafood dining.

Reviews.Author: Courtney G.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll drizzled with melted butter is to die for.  This along with white wine and a few of the delicious oysters is a perfect dinner.  Plan to visit with a friend or VERY small group though b/c the place is tiny and the wait will be long (45 minutes).  It's well worth it though.

Reviews.Author: Adam G.
Reviews.Content: I was here sometime in May. Ok, there is a reason I gave this place only three stars.  The food is excellent the seafood is fresh and ranks up there with the best I have tasted definitely 5-Stars for the food.  The only reason I gave this place three stars is because of the raw bartender/hostess.  She was soooo rude.  She gave me attitude the second my girlfriend and I walked in the door.  The place was packed and we had to put our name in for an hour wait at around 4 PM on a Saturday which was fine.  We were only there for beers and a couple raw oysters.  Our name was called and my girlfriend and I sat at the bar.  The second we sat this blond waitress hostess whatever she was started berating us saying don't you know there are people waiting you cant sit at the bar blah blah blah all this before I could explain that we were told to have a seat at the bar by someone else that worked there.  So fine i brushed off her ignorance.  I ordered six oysters and two beers which came to almost 50 bux with tip and the waitress gave us the stink eye when we said we were not ordering anything else.  I mean come on we were just there for apps at the bar not like we were sitting at a table.  Anyway go there for the food beware of the snobby service.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: This review is to focus on the lobster roll.  I ordered the lobster roll hot with butter.  You can choose to have it cold with mayo also.  When it came out, I knew I was going to love it.  The lobster was in large chunks and piled into a toasted brioche roll.  I took one bite and the buttery goodness took my taste buds to heaven.  It was by far the best lobster roll I had.  I also had the clam chowder. The clam chowder here is not thick and instead of potatos they use leeks(?) I think.  There large chunks of clams in it though and the flavor was good, but to me it was not traditional new England clam chowder.  I also ordered the octopus appetizers which is sliced thin and tossed in citronelle, pepper flakes and cilantro.  It was good but I think is go for raw clams next time.  All in all the food is excellent.  It is definitely crowded and they are first come first served.  Wait time for a table of 2 was over an hour.  The good thing is they will take you cell number and call you when they're ready so you don't have to stand and wait around.  I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Janice W.
Reviews.Content: Love. Perfection. The food and service was worth the wait. And it was a loooong wait. We arrived at 8pm on a Sunday and expected the 'dinner rush' to be winding down. Well, the place is small and popular. So I think it is ALWAYS busy. The girl who took our name was a server. There is no 'hostess' stand. no room. But she came over promptly. TOok our name and phone number and said it would be at least a 2 hour wait and she couldn't be sure that we'd even get seated because 2.5 hours would put us right around when the kitchen closed. We decided to go for it. We went around the corner for some wine at a cafe. In the end it maybe wasn't quite a 2 hour wait - but it was close. But we got in. And it was so worth it. The oysters were perfection. And the lobster roll - the meat was cooked so perfectly. And you can have it with mayo or buttered - I chose buttered. It was a huge amount of lobster - and for $25 it should be. But it was so so worth it.

Reviews.Author: Nathan G.
Reviews.Content: best seafood I've had in a loooong time.  I had the scallops and more oysters from the raw bar than I could count.  worth the wait and money.

Reviews.Author: S L.
Reviews.Content: The lobster rolls are the best!

Reviews.Author: Sfo B.
Reviews.Content: the place is not very large and can be crowded. but the raw bar is amazing, and you have to try the oysters and clams to see how good they are!

Reviews.Author: Emily D.
Reviews.Content: Found this place while on a business trip and ate dinner at the bar with a co-worker. Great little place. no elbow room, but that's ok with me. If you are into oysters, this is definitely your place. Many varieties to choose from as well as apps, salads, entrees, etc. I had the cioppino and it was wonderful. Fork up the few extra bucks and get the lobster added to it. It was delicious and just enough spice to make my forehead moist on a cold winter night. The guy behind the bar (don't know his name, pepper hair, gorgeous blue eyes, you'll know him), was very helpful in suggesting what to drink and eat. I will definitely come back here when in the area again. Very well done.

Reviews.Author: jack c.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing. I didn't know what a lobster roll could be until I had it here. Definitely worth the 1 1/2 hour wait. Love the fact that you put your name down and they will call you when the table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Marcus Z.
Reviews.Content: As soon I was done with my lobster roll....I was ready for another. Really. It's that damn good. Warm and buttery awesomeness.

Reviews.Author: Leon N.
Reviews.Content: I was told on my one day to Boston, this is the place to go for lobster roll.  This was a accurate statement.  The hot lobster roll is amazing here.  Place is very small, so come early, but this place will not disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Madeleine Q.
Reviews.Content: if you want freshly caught, mouth watering seafood selections, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Emily B.
Reviews.Content: I was in in Boston over the 4th of July weekend visiting a friend who lives in the North End.  We were both craving oysters, and she has eaten at Neptune before, so we decided to try B&G oysters.  But alas, it was closed on a Saturday night for the holiday weekend (WTF???)  So we hopped back into a cab and arrived at Neptune at about 8:30PM.  The place was packed, but because we were only a party of two they were able to squeeze us in after only waiting about ten minutes.  I loved the atmosphere, it is pretty old school with tiled walls and a tin ceiling.  It was incredibly loud and cramped inside, but I really didn't mind.  We ordered a bottle of Prosecco, and the Tritan plateau, which the waitress said was perfect for two people.  It consisted of 6 oysters, 3 little necks, 3 cherry stones, 6 mussels, 3 jumbo shrimp, and crab cocktail and lobster cocktail.  IT WAS SO GOOD.  I don't think I have ever have had seafood that was so fresh.  We inhaled the whole thing, and then ordered 1/2 dozen kumamoto oysters.  It was one of the best meals I have had in a long time.  Some might complain that it was a bit pricey, but in my opinion it is worth the price.  I would definitely eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Matt W.
Reviews.Content: got there late afternoon inbetween sightseeing so service was great and quick. Grew up here long ago.  Clam chowder was different, wife loved it, just ok in my book. Oysters were excellent. Entrees were just ok. Sea Bass I loved, my wife got a fish steak (tuna?) with a seasoning and topping that just didn't work.  Good food, but I expected more for the price and recommendations.

Reviews.Author: Jungmin L.
Reviews.Content: The lobster roll is a must. Succulent lobster meat piled atop a soft bun, with the fries...yumyumyumyumyum.

Reviews.Author: Robert M.
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stopped as we arrived in Boston... what a start to our trip.  We were both ready for some liquor and seafood to kick off the vacation.  We started with a glass of processco and the scallop crudo and both were delicious.  We also tried about 4 different oysters from their broad list and enjoyed them as well.  At this point we were very satisfied and I don't mean to rush through my review of the first few items but I have to get to the star of the lunch, the Lobster Roll.  This thing is absolutely incredible, we had it warm with a harpoon roll which was soft and buttery on the outside with a slightly toasted interior which was stuffed with warm buttery Lobster overflowing.  I would take a trip back just for this.
