Delicious!  Our server was also amazing, giving us numerous places to visit while in Boston and not just your regular spots, off the beaten path places such as a jazz club and a hookah lounge, she was great.

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: So when you come to Boston, everyone says that you need to have a Lobster Roll, this is a dish that Boston is known for.  So on the last day of my trip, I yelped Lobster Rolls in Boston and quickly found Neptune.  Courtesy of a previous yelp review, I had read "you can get the Lobster Roll hot with butter or cold with mayo."  Instantly I was sold.  Lobster Roll! WITH BUTTER! AWESOME!So for lunch, my girlfriend and I rushed over to North End and had to try the Lobster Roll.  When we got there, we got seats at the bar, which wasn't exactly what we preferred, but since we were hungry and cold, we didn't think too much of it.  So we ordered a bowl of clam chowder to share and two Lobster Rolls (hot of course).  The clam chowder isn't exactly like your typical clam chowder.  It had more of a classical taste, where you can definitely taste the clams in the soup, and it wasn't a thick soup, pretty liquidy.  This was just okay, it didn't exactly satisfy my need for clam chowder, but this wasn't the reason we chose Neptune.The Lobster Rolls came out, not exactly what I had imagined when I had ordered "Lobster Roll - Hot with Butter."  It came out, with a roll, overflowing with magical lobster.  As I see this, I think, WOW! AWESOME! LOOK AT ALL THAT LOBSTER! then to my next thought... HEY! WHERE'S THE BUTTER!  Ah, but foolish me, the butter was already poured on top of the lobster into the roll, which gave the roll a very soft buttery taste.  I quickly began to eat my lobster roll, only stopping to scarf up the pieces of lobster that had overflown the roll and fallen to my plate.  All the while, scraping the plate for the fallen "juices" (which was really just the butter and lobster juice) with my roll to soak up every single bit.  This was truly an awesome sandwich.  On top of this, I ordered mine with fries, my girlfriend ordered hers with a salad.  I don't know about her salad, but the fries were pretty darn good as well.All in all, best food I had in Boston hands down.

Reviews.Author: Kristin F.
Reviews.Content: Hot lobster roll is amazing!  I mean what is not to love, lobster+butter+roll=yum.  We also tried the fish tacos, and seafood stew.  Everything was delicious and worth the 45min wait.  Put your name in, get a drink at the bar down the street and they will call you when your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Julia K.
Reviews.Content: great oysters and great wine selection.clam chowder is watery, it was just okay.lobster roll was good, a huge portion.wait was over an hour for a table, and around 45 min to seat at the bar on a tuesday night.

Reviews.Author: Mark W.
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite restaurant in Boston. I was told about this place a few years ago but could never be bothered to go,after tonight I regret not going a long time ago. The wait,even though long is totally worth it. I attended on a Thursday night and had to wait an hour and a half to be seated. The place is cozy, you're  going to be squeezing into your seat or squeezing in at the bar. Even though the servers are busy they are very attentive and very friendly, I would not have been upset if they were a little grumpy. The food is awesome,we started with fried clams which were perfect and the homemade tater sauce was delicious. The oyster were fresh even though it was 9pm, best that I have had in Boston and that includes Island Creek Oyster Bar . The Lobster roll was everything that you have read about on Yelp or heard from your friends. The Lobster overflowed out of the bun and was so fresh and tasty, the fries that accompanied it were difficult to ignore.I was actually eating off of my girlfriends plate even though I still had food on my plate, I guess I didn't want the meal to end. I predict that I will be waiting in line at least a few more times before the summer is over and I don't mind a bit. I don't ever say this about any restaurant but you NEED to go and experience the awesomeness that is Neptune Oyster, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Author: Mark Z.
Reviews.Content: My girl loves oysters!  I am not a fan but as a guy you got to do what you got to do.  But damn the lobster roll was pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Denise L.
Reviews.Content: By far some of the best seafood I've had in a restaurant in a long time. This place does not disappoint! We had a half dozen oysters that were perfect, fresh and delicious. Highly recommend the local selection from Mass. We also had the amazing clam chowder and the lobster rolls, one hot with butter and one cold with Neptune's special mayo dressing. The clam chowder is not super thick like you might expect of New England, however it has great flavor and the clams they use are huge and tasty - not just little bits and pieces like I've had with other clam chowders. The lobster was a huge portion for each roll, my boyfriend actually ran out of bread before running out of lobster. I thoroughly enjoyed the cold lobster roll, with the mayo dressing light enough to compliment the flavor of the lobster. My friend doesn't eat seafood, but she had the burger which was also delicious and perfectly cooked. Neptune's offers amazing food, atmosphere and service in a great location in the North End. I will definitely be back here my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Author: Wesley C.
Reviews.Content: a step beyond b&g and island creek.  no question the best oyster joint in the boston area.  why is it so good? it just is.

Reviews.Author: John O.
Reviews.Content: besides the long wait (grabbed a beer across the street) everything was great! i had monkfish for the first time, and it was delicious. the vibe was great too, reminded me of a small, happenin spot in NYC.. which i happen to love!

Reviews.Author: aleem a.
Reviews.Content: worth the money that you spend here . good place to get  bite .. pricey !  a good place for a vacation treat . service was ok but i think it was due to limited seating and small place. call ahead for reservations .. on a saturday lunch the wait was over an hour and half . we were lucky guess some times the wait is more than three hrs according to our waiter . I say let the good times and lobster roll

Reviews.Author: Sara G.
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekday lunch and greatly enjoyed their lobster roll, much more so than B&G. However, I wish their menu was larger, I would have liked to have more options (which B&G excels at). But overall a happy and tasty experience.

Reviews.Author: C D.
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I love this place as a guilty pleasure.  Usually spend over $40 on wine and another $100-120 on oysters and their hot lobster roll.  I love the idea of this place but they can be a bit slow on occasion not to mention the lines.  Their oysters in my opinion are some of the freshest I have had.  They carry both seafood from the East and West coasts which makes this place a haven for the seafood enthusiast.  We have only had their lobster and oysters so I cannot comment on their other fair but I imagine from other posts it is quite good. But we really frequent this place for their "connecticut" style hot lobster roll in butter. Sorry fellas, I hate mayo and it shouldn't be used on such a precious meat like lobster.  I give a 4 for awesomeness and flavor but they lose points in long waits (which they have no control over) and their price, just a bit too expensive.  But we are loyal to this joint.  Give it a try if you are in the North End.

Reviews.Author: Miss D.
Reviews.Content: Neptune Oyster is a great spot.  It's a wonderful place to go with a date.  It's small, cozy, and I love the seating.  The staff was very friendly and the oysters were delicious!  One of the best dinners I've had since I moved here. Neptune and Island Creek are the two places to go for oysters in Boston!

Reviews.Author: Shari D.
Reviews.Content: Amazing oysters and mussels. Cute place.  But it went down the drain after the three of us sat at the bar for three hours and worked up a $300 tab and were asked to leave. What? First we were told it was because people were waiting for dinner. (no one was at the door) Then he said we were just cut off, he didn't ask us to leave. While we did have several glasses of wine/beer, but were by no means a liability. The story kept changing. I was so disappointed. Although service was good until that point, I suppose the feel they are so popular that they don't have to treat people well. Plenty of choices out there for great seafood-I suggest giving someone your business who appreciates it.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: While on our honeymoon in Boston we used Yelp for places to eat (as we use Yelp rather often) which led us to Neptune Oyster.  Yes, the place is rather small and the wait was about an hour but it was the best wait of our trip!!!! The intimate (rather than small) restaurant was cute, cozy and allowed for conversation among the people in your party or the people seated next to you. We were BEYOND fortunate to have an amazing waitress (from Wisconsin) and table neighbors from Iowa and the neighboring area.  Our dining experience was just that..an experience..not just food.  The mussels and the hot lobster roll are a must!! Best compliment we can give this place is we we referred some friends there on their trip and they loved it too!  Neptune Oyster..you guys are delicious with all capital letters!  Another great part was they took my phone number (west coast area code) and text us to let us know our table was ready-that is even better than the beepers because it allowed us to walk around the neighborhood a bit.

Reviews.Author: Katie T.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Yes, the wait was long, but there are plenty of places around to grab a drink while you're waiting. Everything we ordered was SO good, really fresh raw bar and hands down the best lobster roll (warm with butter) I've ever had.  Unlike some of the restaurants in town, the price of the food is justified and completely worth it. The service is great too. They nailed it.

Reviews.Author: Tamiko K.
Reviews.Content: Hi, I just read the burger article & thought there should be a shout out for the Neptune burger - it's a giant patty of goodness topped off w/ fried oysters.

Reviews.Author: Katie N.
Reviews.Content: I liked oysters...and Neptune made me love them. A wide assortment of all your raw bar essentials in a classic Italian-style eatery. I wouldn't go there for a first date, as you will no doubt have very close neighbors.

Reviews.Author: Matthew P.
Reviews.Content: I visited this restaurant 1 year ago and it always stood out as one of my favorite restaurants in Boston. We decided to go again and see if this place lived up to my memory of it and oh yes it did. This place has the best seafood in Boston, the oysters are amazing, the staff is friendly and helpful. There is usually a long wait but no matter what this place is well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: The oysters (great selection!) and lobster roll are so good it is easy to overlook other menu items.  Tried the Neptune Blue Crab salad today.  Beautiful presentation -- crab meat and avocado in a mold, fresh Boston bibb and sweet onions to the side, terriffic Ginger dressing underneath.  Excellent taste and very refreshing on a warm late May Sunday.  Definetly venture out to other menu items!

Reviews.Author: Corwin P.
Reviews.Content: This place rocks, if you can get in. One of the few non-italian restaurants in the north end and one of even fewer that is actually good. This place is rivaled only by B&G in the SE in this reviewers opinion. A great place for the oyster lover as they offer a sushi like oyster menu with many local options, and the freshest and best from both coasts of the US (and sometimes Canada too). The oysters are expensive but if you're willing to splurge they are amongst the best prepared in the city of Boston. Menu items that are favorites are the Warm Lobster Roll (incredible) with poached butter and my personal favorite is the Burger... For an oyster place this burger seems to come out of nowhere but it gives ever burger in this fair city a run for its money. The meat is well flavored and cooked to perfection, the fried oysters and tartar sauce toppings are unique but the flavors meld as if they've been together forever. Try and go at a non peak time and have a great night, only negatives i can think of are that its a small restaurant, they only have one oyster shucker which has caused delays in some of my visits and this place is $$$$. Otherwise eat your heart out.

Reviews.Author: Laura P.
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Neptune Oyster for his birthday, since he is an oyster/seafood lover, and it was one of the best meals we've ever had! First of all you have to know if you go there on a normal date night, prepare to wait at least an hour. They don't take reservations, but it's actually fun; we went there, put in our name and then went to drink wine around the corner till they called us. Once seated, we got a great selection of oysters and ordered the Bronzini to split as an entree. It was his birthday, so I asked them to put a few birthday candles on a plate of oysters as a dessert; it was perfect. Honestly, hands down, one of the best seafood restaurants in Boston!

Reviews.Author: shell h.
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is the best place to eat in Boston. The servers are very friendly and the selection of oysters are very good. The scallop dish i get here is insane, they are huge and sooo delicious. If i was rich i would fly back to Boston just to eat at this place. Also my boyfriend gets the burger with the fried oyster on top and says it is very good.

Reviews.Author: Erin Y.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for my birthday - unfortunately the one hour wait they told us turned into a 3 hour wait, which ultimately led us elsewhere.  However, we went back during a week day, still waited 30 minutes, but had an absolutely amazing meal.  The selection of oysters on the raw bar were fantastic and the descriptions were helpful with making your choice.  As everyone reviews below, the lobster roll was divine.  It melted in your mouth and was rich and delicious.  It was nearly impossible to even get through half the fries after the richness of the lobster roll.  Neptune's would have gotten a full 5 stars but the hostess staff isn't the friendliest and the wait time is pretty crazy.  Is it worth it?  Probably.

Reviews.Author: RYAN P.
Reviews.Content: top three fav restaurants, hands down...

Reviews.Author: Doika P.
Reviews.Content: Great lobster. The lobster roll is a good as you have heard. The johnny cake is great too! The wait is also as long as you have heard unfortunately. If you are looking for great seafood (albeit at premium prices) you owe yourself a visit here. Great place for special occasions or when guests are in town. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: tanya m.
Reviews.Content: as if this place needs any more stars...  the hot lobster roll and johnny cakes w/ trout pate (mousse?) are to die for and the service is wonderful.

Reviews.Author: mary d.
Reviews.Content: Very good food and creative menu.  Unfortunately I left hungry, portions were small, no bread was served. Service was lacking. My appetizer never arrived, meals weren't served together, water not refilled.  It is pricey, so expectations are higher

Reviews.Author: E B.
Reviews.Content: The hot lobster roll is buttery, sublime deliciousness. Sure, the bread disintegrates halfway through, and it was almost impossible for me to eat it in a ladylike manner, but who the heck cares? We went for lunch at around 1 p.m. on a weekday and there was no wait to be seated. We also enjoyed the grilled cuttlefish appetizer. My date wanted one of their famous burgers, but sadly, they were out.

Reviews.Author: Meems L.
Reviews.Content: We came here last Saturday, which was a gorgeous day, and there was a two-hour wait, despite us arriving at 5:15pm to put in our names. (In fact, around 6:30pm, they were all booked up for the rest of night and turning people away...) In my entire life, I have never waited two hours for a restaurant and I am a hardcore foodie.  We went for my mother's birthday and the poor starving woman, was pretty grouchy, tired, hungry, and a tad snappish by 7pm. Ninety minutes later, after being filled with a dozen oysters and clams, a johnny cake (so warm, sweet, salty, and delicious), fried oysters, a tuna sandwich, and two lobster rolls...all smiles and cheerfulness again.  Was it worth our $170+ bill? YES. Was it worth a two hour wait? YES.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Their lobster rolls are great!

Reviews.Author: G H.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this place!  The seafood is so fresh and the lobster roll is to die for!  We love coming here---but hate the crowds and wait.  So we def. do not come as much as we would like!

Reviews.Author: Austin M.
Reviews.Content: Went to Neptunes for a lobster roll and some oysters. The hot lobster roll was delicious! The oysters were also great!

Reviews.Author: Bettina S.
Reviews.Content: The best lobster I have ever had!  I was told to come here by a colleague and I'm so glad we did.  We got there 5 minutes before they opened for lunch and even though the doors were shut, there was a 30+ person line up already.  We lucked out and got the second last set of seats at the bar as soon as they opened.  We had the Maine Lobster roll (hot with butter) and fries.  it was delicious.  I'm still thinking about it!  You must try this!

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: We had originally hoped to make this restaurant as a family meal spot as we were in Boston prior to boarding a cruise ship. Since we had a party of 12 it was out of the question. A group of us (6 people) were checking out a highly rated bakery down the street from Neptune. We happened to walk down the street and noticed a growing line of people waiting for a place to open. Seeing that it was Neptune Oyster and the doors opened in 12 minutes we thought it would be a good idea to stand in line along with everyone else.The best decision we made!We ended up being the last ones in line to get seated. All the reviews that I had read were spot on.Three of us got lobster rolls. Two mayoed and one buttered. The buttered lobster roll was insanely great. The mayoed were wonderful. A mountain of different oyster and clams followed. Awesome.I ordered the tuna sandwich. Terrific. Fresh and tastey.Do not pass this restaurant up.

Reviews.Author: Mike J.
Reviews.Content: great location, atmosphere! oysters were fantastic! they give u the choice of whether you want a cold or hot lobster roll, get the hot! (soaked in butter) french fries: very good, friendly staff but place is small and waitress forgot to put our appetizers in for order but got over that bc food was so good. a little expensive especially if u like to drink.

Reviews.Author: leslie f.
Reviews.Content: I love raw oysters and this place has quite the variety. We dined here for lunch while on a long weekend to Boston. We sat at the bar which was lots of fun. This place is teeny-tiny so expect to wait depending on time of day. We actually stopped in for lunch around 1pm and were seated at the bar right away- we were ready to wait which made it even better. I started off with a variety of raw oysters. I am from down south where a raw oyster is a raw oyster (we don't have types to choose from) so our server  explained to me in great detail how all were different. I settled on a variety of local MA oysters and they were so tasty. My husband and I each ordered the  hot lobster roll. Oh my god- it was like heaven dipped in butter and served on a bread made of deliciousness. I wish more restaurants offered there lobster rolls this way. If you get the roll you have to do it hot, its just so different than the others we had rest of the weekend. This place was terrific - just wish it wasn't so far from Chicago.

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: I read good reviews so I decided to bring relatives here. The fried clams were outstanding. The raw oysters were OK.  The menu has selections of oysters from just about every town on the cape, maine and new brunswick, a bit much. I inquired about cape, (bay)  scallops because they should be in season.  They said yes, they have some "welfleet" cape scallops, so I ordered some. They didn't look or taste like to cape's to me. But in any case they were smothered in herbs, something you just don't  do to real capes.  All in all an above average experience.

Reviews.Author: Kham X.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best seafood that I have eaten in Boston.  On the list of places to eat when in Boston again.

Reviews.Author: cyd l.
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews in local magazines, my husband and I finally made it to Neptune, and were so happy we did.  Agreeing with the other reviews, the place is small, but it is the North End, so what do you expect?  Make the most of it by putting your name/number in with the hostess and walking around to Hanover St for a glass of wine while you wait.  I do feel, also, there is more privacy and room for two at the bar than the small tables where you will get to know everything about your neighbor! The waitress at the bar was more than experienced and happy to make some incredible recommendations.  I had the appetizer, neptunes on piggyback. I would have never ordered this concoction of a crostini with pulled pork, fried oysters, raisins and pistacios, but was not disappointed. Flavor abounded. My husband ordered a salad with tomatoes, artichokes, greens and blue cheese and it was also really good.  I had the lobster roll and he had the cod special, and both were fabulous.  If you want great seafood served in an inventive way, this is your place.  The international wine menu is expansive as well!

Reviews.Author: Courtney C.
Reviews.Content: This place was worth it. I showed up right when they open and didn't have a problem getting a table. The lobster roll served warm with butter is the way to go. They are getting 4 instead of 5 stars because the seating is strange. My party of 2 was seated at a 6 top and then half way through the meal they sat a family of 4 with 2 small children at our table, and it sort of ruined our meal. Should have sat at the bar! Next time.

Reviews.Author: Allison D.
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad we made it here -- I'd heard so much about it and it totally delivered.  The restaurant, food and service are crisp, bright and on-point.  We went later on a Thursday (about 9:30) and did not have to wait for a table (might the NBA final have had something to do with that?).  It was a delight to sample four different types of oysters and compare notes with the characteristics described on the menu.  We tucked into those amazing hot lobster rolls on a fluffy buttered buns,  piled high with sweet lobster meat.  The fries were hot and salty, and it all washed down perfectly with a sparkling rose.  A flawless meal.  God of the sea -- Neptune rules!

Reviews.Author: kai m.
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Boston for the weekend. Went to Neptune base on Yelp recommendation.First, the place is very small. It seats about 40-45 people, total including the bar seats. We waited about 35 mins and got a seat at the bar.Ordered a few diff types of oysters based on the menu description and all of them were excellent!For the entree, ordered the cold lobster roll and a seafood stew. The lobster roll was filled with large, tail lobster pieces mixed with a light mayo dressing. The flavor was basic, to the point, pure lobster heaven. The bum was nicely baked and brushed with butter. The seafood stew was outstanding. Fresh mussels, fish, and other seafood cooked in a very light fish broth with rice. Again, simple flavoring, fresh ingredient perfectly executed.Now the reason for 4 stars rather than 5. First, this past weekend in Boston was steamy with temp reaching to the low 90's. The restaurant had no AC and it was very hot, humid, and uncomfortable. With the addition of alcoholic consumptions I am surprised no customer fainted or passed out from heat stroke. Also, being there are lots of raw food on the menu, I do not know how long the food can stay fresh once they are served. Everyone in the restaurant all have red, flushed faces. Second, the service was indifferent. The servers were not attentive; maybe they are sick of the heat also.

Reviews.Author: Hanna E.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING. I've been coming here since the doors opened and it's always an incredible meal.  I've moved to NYC but still make a special trip to "The Tune" each time I'm back in Boston.

Reviews.Author: Ashley P.
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston to try the lobster roll...... it was great.  My daughter and I made a trip to Boston from NY just  to try their lobster roll.  We really enjoyed the lobster roll and I also recommend trying their fried clams.  It was crispy at the same time it was moist and tender. We've really enjoyed their food.  It was fresh and delicious.  I will make another trip to try other things on their menu.  It was worth 4 hour drive to eat at Neptune Oyster.

Reviews.Author: E M.
Reviews.Content: Neptune is awesome. Period. I promised myself never to visit Boston again without visiting. I also harangue all Boston-bound pals until they promise to stop in. None has ever been dismayed. The food is so good, from the broad gamut of oysters to the hot lobster roll to even the chowda. Couple that with a thoughtful wine list (yes, prosecca is the jam with oysters), and Neptune can do no wrong in my book. It's pricey, for sure, and the dining room is a bit tight, but trust me: sit at the bar and warn your wallet. It'll be plenty worth it.

Reviews.Author: RJ J.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my best go-to lunch spots. Great selection of raw bar items, as well as a fantastic burger, salads and lobster rolls. The raw bar is very speedy and efficient, with great east coast and west coast representation. The service is brisk and accommodating. The wine list is fantastic. A great mix of eclectic picks. The staff handles the at-times daunting wait times with ease. This place is great at what they do...

Reviews.Author: Khoa P.
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is, best lobster roll in my life.

Reviews.Author: J G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, nice place, decent service. I'd give it five stars if the prices were about 25% lower.

Reviews.Author: Patrick S.
Reviews.Content: Best seafood in the city

Reviews.Author: J P.
Reviews.Content: Excellent! In terms of food and service, it was perfect. We had oysters (welfleet, Island Creek, PEI), cherrystone and sea urchin. They were perfect, fresh/clean, flesh separated from the shells, really no condiments needed. We had the grilled cuttlefish, they were so tender yet the tentacles had a nice bite to them. Since this was our first visit we had to taste this lobster roll, boy it was amazing! Fully loaded with big chunky lobster meat, buttery brioche roll and served with double fried french fries. If you like lobster roll, you have to try this. Cioppino was very good, spicey and very tasty broth. We used the bread to suck up all the broth! Yes the restaurant is very small and tables were tight together and there's only bathroom, but who cares?? The food makes it all worth it! I wish we can afford to eat there every week!

Reviews.Author: Ryan F.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Neptune oyster multiple times now and always have an amazing meal. Now I know all the other reviews mention the lobster roll but you are crazy if you do not get it. You can get it warm or cold, but let's be real everyone gets it warm and it's to die for. The raw bar here is so fresh, as is all the seafood. The burger with fried oysters is rather yummy. This place is a definite 5 star. I will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Author: Robin P.
Reviews.Content: One of the worst experiences of my life!  We paid nearly $200, and the food was bland, and the service was just terrible.  I cannot understand how people actually deal with this place.  Take the advice that I got from the table next to us 'go to Legal's and enjoy your food for half the price!'

Reviews.Author: Maureen H.
Reviews.Content: This popular seafood restaurant located in the North end section of Boston is a place we frequent often. Oysters are fresh, plentiful and delicious! Staff is friendly and accommodating and graciously make garlic with wine sauce mussels for me DELICIOUS!  The lobster roll is really as overstuffed as you have heard. One of our all time favorite restaurants in Boston. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Author: Greg M.
Reviews.Content: On Sunday I flew into Boston from Los Angeles. The person sitting next to me asked if I liked seafood and suggested that I try Neptune Oyster. I am so grateful he did!! I looked at the reviews here on Yelp and it convinced me that even though I was tired and had the instinct to stay in my hotel and order room service, I should check this place out. I got there around 5:30 Sunday night and only had to wait about 10 minutes for a seat at the bar. The place was pretty packed and it just got more so during the time I was there. All the reviews raved about the lobster roll so I had to order it. It was spectacular, filled with lots of lobster meat and lots of butter. The bread with it was perfect as were the fries that came with it. I also tried some of the oysters and the shrimp cocktail. All were delicious.My coworker arrived late that evening and the following day I told her about Neptune Oyster and she got so jealous that we had to go that night. So I went two nights in a row!! We started with oysters and shrimp cocktail. Then for mains she had the scallops and I had the Cioppino. Both were amazing!The space is charming. A small gem with good service and amazing food. Can't wait to return to Boston to eat there again!!

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!! Went last night and sat at the bar, Gina and Paul were great!! The oysters were so fresh and tasty and everything else we ordered we just as good. I suggest going and sitting at the bar!!!

Reviews.Author: Tressa G.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is one of the best in the North End. The food is outstanding and the service could not be nicer. The oysters are delicious and the lobster roll is unbelievable. The BEST lobster roll I've ever eaten! I could have shared it, but it was too good to stop eating. The prices are high but it's a fun place to splurge for a special occasion.

Reviews.Author: Elena K.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to sit on your neighbors lap.  This restaurant is tiny, but it was nice to converse with other tourists and get some insights.  I would never bring a date here, romance is definitely not on the menu.   I had the lobster roll, it was good, but what really earned this place 4 stars is the freshness of the seafood.  The oysters, clams were delicious, they tasted like they were just pulled out of the bay.  DELICIOUS!  So go ahead order that lobster roll, but start off with a big plate of oysters.. I suggest First Light!

Reviews.Author: Gloria L.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to come to Neptune Oyster for the longest time, but the rumors of extremely long waits have deterred me until now (visit from the family). The popularity is true; we arrived at 5pm on a Thursday evening and the place was already packed. We got lucky and got the last table for four when we arrived. The raw bar selection is extensive, and we found them to have fresh oysters and clams - SO delicious! We got the clam chowder, which wasn't my favorite, as I like my chowders to be on the creamier side, and this was a little on the more soup-y. The clams inside the soup were really good, though. We got the the seared tuna (not the best seared tuna I've had, but pretty good) and the cioppino (solid), but the highlight of our meal was probably the lobster roll. Yum!! And the fries are SO GOOD! The service was also really good, but just for reference - they don't seat you until your entire party is there (makes sense because the restaurant is small). All in all, a great experience, and would go again!

Reviews.Author: neph n.
Reviews.Content: I was here on a Saturday night, showed up around 5 with no wait!  What!?  It took about 10 minutes for an employee to acknowledge me and found out there was a 2-hour wait.  That's what I expected from the reviews.  I put down my number and walked around the water and laid in the grass and read a book and eventually my dinner companion arrived to finish the wait.  Our wait ended up being over 3 1/2 hours and by 7pm they weren't taking any more names on their list.  I wanted to get "the best" lobster roll because this is something I eat once every few years on a visit to Boston from out of state.  I ordered the lobster roll warm and it was delicious.  The butter was potent but didn't overtake the taste of lobster, the lobster was chewy, which required a minute to chew and enjoy each bite.  Unlike most reviewers here, I thought the fries were good too, nothing special, but definitely not bad.  I'm not sure I'd ever wait 3 1/2 hours or pay $26 (plus drink and tip!) but for a one time experience it was fine.  I do wonder if the food tastes so good because you pump up the idea of how good the food will be as a reward for your lengthy wait and by then you're so hungry anyway, that anything would be good? But a few days later, you look back and question, was it really that good?

Reviews.Author: Aaron L.
Reviews.Content: If i based my review purely on the oysters and lobster roll, I would give it 5 stars... BUT the hostess was very unprofessional and somewhat of a fool. Lets start with the pros. The hot butter lobster roll was dripping with deliciousness. Though its simply butter and chopped chunks of lobster on a roll for $25, the thought of this delight still makes my mouth water. I'm very picky about the freshness of oysters and this place met every requirement. The list of different types of oysters was almost overwhelming, but I got to try quite a few with complete satisfaction. The waitress was actually very nice and friendly, BUT the hostess was disorganized and rude. Waiting about half an hour, she gave away our spot twice did not apologize even after we confronted her. Her response was "well there's nothing I can do about it now, so you'll just have to wait for the next one"  and after our table was finally ready, she did not walk us to our table, just simply said "its ready and walked away." I understand that it was quite hectic with the amount of turnover, but check the attitude B!

Reviews.Author: Karla N.
Reviews.Content: amazing!!!!! need i say more?

Reviews.Author: C L.
Reviews.Content: A favorite neighborhood spot of ours, Neptune Oyster rarely disappoints.  The oysters are fresh and delicious but expect to be shoulder to shoulder with other diners.  It's not a spot for a quiet, romantic dinner but rather a fun night out spent sitting at the wine bar and enjoying the seafood.  Last night, a rainy Tuesday evening, we sauntered in around 7pm and were fortunate to find a nearly deserted bar.  The bartender quickly took our drink orders - favorites from the beer & wine list that we've discovered on other visits -  a glass of the Pigato white wine for me (a delicious Italian light, dry white) and a Whale's Tale Pale Ale for my husband.  A few oysters followed.  Our tried and true favorite is the Island Creek which we mixed with 2 less familiar names.  Neptune serves what is fresh and in season so there is always a new mollusk  to sample.  After drooling over it on other visits, my husband had the Neptuneburger and was it delicious.  Served on a brioche bun and topped with a fried oyster and garlic aoli, it's filling and I was lucky to have a quarter of it land on my plate!  I had the Crab Louis Salad (over butter lettuce with a nutty vinaigrette) and it was also good.  It must have had over a pound of crab on it.  On other visits, I've ordered the cioppino which is also a good choice and the lobster roll is full of big chunks of meat.  Neptune has certainly been "discovered" since we first dined there but my fingers are crossed that they never expand and stay true to their oyster/wine bar charm!

Reviews.Author: Mayur M.
Reviews.Content: hot lobster roll + oysters. perfect.

Reviews.Author: Meagan O.
Reviews.Content: by now everyone agrees that the food here is great, and i agree with the rest of the 10,000+ glowing reviews regarding the fare.  we had scallops, which were seared to perfection;  daily special cod, which was a thick, juicy fillet over a masterful bed of spinach topped with a carrot puree and mini carrot frites; and cherry stone clams from wellfleet that contained massive meaty innards.  the decor is 1930s swank; subway tiles+granite+heavy finishings.  you are made to feel like you might see a ship captain, his flapper mistress, and a slicked hair rum-runner drinking rye and sharing a crab leg.  For such a tight (and its TIGHT) room, the service was pleasant and efficient; they knew what they were doing, and did not detract nor add to the experience, which is how it should be.  HERE is my problem:  the price is terribly inflated.  You are paying $30-$40 per entree and $9 for an ok glass of wine.  The quality of the experience just does not support that price point.  With that said, if you're from out of town, and want to indulge for an evening, you wont be disappointed, and you'll feel like you've found a hidden gem off the tourist circuit.  However, my fellow city dwellers will agree, there is FAR better value to be found all across the city, for comparable ambience and quality.  I wont be back, because I can get the same quality elsewhere for nearly half the price.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: love this place. great bar w upper fresh Oysters.

Reviews.Author: Ellen R.
Reviews.Content: Neptune is an essential part of my visits to Boston.  It doesn't take reservations and it's hard to seat parties of more than 4 people.  It is serious seafood and great cooking.  It has a great fan base, so many of the customers are regulars.  This time, my husband and I were seated at the bar.  Next to me was a lawyer who always eats at Neptune when she is in town and the fellow to her left was also a regular  when in Boston.  The two men at the end of the bar were locals and regulars who proclaimed Neptune the best restaurant in Boston.  We had to have oysters on the half shell and chose 3 kinds; Wellfleet, Island Creek, and Kumamotos. A perfect sampler with our glass of prosecco.  We also had the specials-  pasta with a lobster and tomato sauce that was spiced perfectly and had a generous amount of tender lobster and a striped bass with squash and greens that was cooked perfectly.  We preferred the lobster only because we liked the spice of the dish.  The bartender recommended a Parisol Rose that complemented the meals.  Our bar mates also had a corncake with trout, lobster rolls and more specials.  Everyone was content.  The only drawback is that conversation is difficult.  I simply had to eat.  You could save the conversation for later and have coffee and pastries at  Modern Pastry Shop or Mike's.  A perfect evening in Boston

Reviews.Author: Arlene P.
Reviews.Content: Lunched at Neptune today to compare with lunch at B&G last week.  We arrived at around 3:00 on a Saturday afternoon, and were told a table would be available in an hour and a half.  They called our cellphone after half an hour, which was OK, and just before we were about to order an iced coffee at Modern Bakery in Hanover St.  A good thing.  The Neptune is tiny, but inviting, and the service first rate.  Now for the food and drink.  We began with prosecco and oysters; at B&G we had cremant de Bourgogne with our oysters.  The B&G wine was vastly superior--more brut-ish, less sweet.  They cost the same.  As for the oysters, both places were excellent, though on balance I preferred those at B&G, and the mignonette and cocktail sauces were better.  Moving on, we preferred the lobster salad and skate wing at B&G to the crab salad and warm lobster roll at Neptune.  The lobster roll while very good and meaty would have benefited from a piece of lemon.  The french fries were past their prime, thin and very dark, with ketchup as a condiment.  As for the ambiance, B&G won hands down--we sat on their terrrace on a glorious day, shaded by a large awning, not in a tiny bar-like interior cooled by fans (there is no a/c).  Also, you can park near B&G, and the meters don't require feeding on Saturday after 2:00.  That said, we would return to both, possibly choosing in accordance with the weather.  I would give Neptune 3 and a half stars, B&G 4 and a half.

Reviews.Author: Darcy P.
Reviews.Content: After much searching for the best place for oysters in Boston, I read the Yelp reviews (and Boston mag article) and thought that Neptune's must be it.  And guess what?  Nope.  Had to wait well over an hour, which was to be expected and not why I'm giving this place such a low review.  Upon sitting at the bar, asked about the oysters of the day.  The server pointed to the wall, gave a list and walked away.  I had a question and she seemed irritated to answer it and, while the hour+ wait may make it seem like she was slammed, she was not.  She was chatting with a co-worker and talking about how she was hungover.  Ordered a fair amount of oysters and, when one type was out, rather than tell me, she substituted her favorite.  what?!  at 2.65 an oyster, do you think you would maybe consult with me to tell me the kind I wanted was sold out?  When I said that I wasn't sure I wanted her suggested kind, she said, "I'm not really sure what other one you would like so..."  Trying to be a good sport and always open to food, I stupidly went along.  Guess what?  didn't like them nearly as much as the others.  Stayed and ordered more and, again, no suggestions, no info on the oysters and just plain awful attitude.  Sure, the oysters are good, but they are at a lot of other places at well.  For the price, B & G blows this place away.  Hands down.  I won't be returning and I would suggest that if you haven't been and are up in the air, check out somewhere else first.

Reviews.Author: George S.
Reviews.Content: We came in for a very late lunch and missed the dinner crowd which began to form out the door just as we were enjoying the final bites of our meal. We started with oysters and ceviche from the raw bar which were nice. Oysters were fresh with a good selection. The lobster roll was delicious but OMG the scallops. Why do people not yelp more about the scallops. I had 3 lobster rolls while on this trip. I had one at Quincy market, yankee fish market, and at neptune. All 3 places did a nice job though Neptune was best, but truly we should be discussing the scallops more than the lobster roll. The scallops were cooked to perfection and the accompanying flavors were unique and tasty. Anyhow, the service here was wonderful. My water glass was always full and i felt welcome to continue to order and sip my drink even though I had been there a while and there was a line forming out the door. I had dinner at another Boston "line out the door" restaurant that week and scarfed down food because I could feel the waiter's sense of urgency to turn over my table. That did not happen at Neptune. Truly a 5 star experience (maybe a 4 star price? which makes it a value).

Reviews.Author: Ken V.
Reviews.Content: i love this place!  i've been here a few times with my lady and we both love it.  i've only ever been on the weekend and the line is always long for dinner, but they take your phone number and call you when they're ready to seat you.  we're not picky about sitting at the raw bar vs. sitting at a table so the wait has never been too long.  we usually make our way down to goody glovers for a drink, and by the time we're done w/ a drink our seats are ready.  i enjoy sitting at the raw bar (if you're going as a pair) as it's fun to watch the action and watch the people outside gawk at the food... also, it gives you the opportunity to laugh at them for still having to wait while you enjoy your lobster roll and oysters.  i've had both the cold and warm lobster roll and find the warm to be superior by far.  not that the cold roll is bad, the warm one is just SO good.  well coated with drawn butter and lumped on a roll that's dense enough to handle the load (and trust me, theres a lot of lobster on these) yet light enough so it you still taste all of the delicious lobster.  the oysters are fresh and delicious and the selection is excellent.  the staff is friendly and always ready with a recommendation (whether it be food or wine).  the one minor drawback about this place is that they don't have a host/hostess.  it's usually one of the waitresses doing double duty so you may have to wait to grab their attention when you get there.  not a big deal, but sometimes it can take a bit of patience, but trust me it's worth it.
